The food is 10 stars and also the service. All of the staff were super nice and friendly. The meat is high quality and reasonably priced. The only bad thing about it is we live in LA so we couldn't come here very often. Keep up with the good work guys. We'll be back soon :)

FOOD IS ALWAYS great. I usually surprise whoever I'm in vegas with, with gangnam as a nice meal off the strip Nice getaway and always on point!

5sVeEDj0PouBZP_Jfir9Gw.text: Returned to eat here after the last time we were in town. We ordered the Gangnam setup for 6 people, well because we had 6 people. Mistake!! We had waaaay too much food, but really it was awesome and still a reasonable price per person. Tried the Apple Sodju and that went down real easy, everyone was pleasantly surprised at how smooth it was.  This is quickly becoming a favorite of ours for Korean BBQ.

KglRBoawWxTfXCMG9AacBg.text: Okay buy too much fat on the short ribs. You need to trim the fat. Thanks for the free desert!

yO1QlOWkggy8nBTcsdfYjg.text: Ok once again when we go to celebrate we come to Gangnam Asian BBQ what are we celebrating today oh how about buying our new house paying all the bills for the new house paying for all the options and upgrades to the new house and seeing that they broke ground this week on building our new house as always to celebrate we are here and the food is superb as always tender steak delicious appetizers and great service always make for a spectacular meal

eabkcB7lUO6_GP0YixbA-Q.text: This rating is based purely on customer service. Came here with several family members (party of 8). Once they served up the meat for us to cook I never heard from or saw our server again. They didn't even come once to clean the grill of all the marinade, didn't come fill drinks, didn't ask if we were okay....and then they charged 18% gratuity?! Added gratuity for large parities, I totally understand and will pay it, but added gratuity when we weren't serviced does not make sense. Asked for it to be removed and they did it but no apologizes, and no sense of customer service whatsoever. Prob won't be back. Didn't feel welcome since walking through the door.

Zgrsbi5WJj53guuKUHFLqQ.text: They have really good selections with reasonable price! I would recommend trying their green tea ice cream!

Vxt2t4LQ8prKrozRcJ9rXQ.text: Great food, great price point, and always great service. The prix fixe menu is perfect if you want a little bit of everything. Always love coming here!!

_Q1e_t39ajsp8rWYQUShiw.text: We waited for one hour 10 minutes on Christmas Day and the experience was total worthwhile. I must say this is one of the best Korean BBQ I had.

NLPY9FomArrnHz0nnVcM4Q.text: The sizes of the servings were excellent! Meat was very well marinated and the grills are changed frequently to avoid the burnt BBQ accumulation. Price is very fair, however the service is relatively poor.

mxvgDuNkP2_-2lcfgCRs-g.text: Came here with my whole family of 5. The restaurant is very hard to spot from the outside since their lighting aren't as bright as the nearby stores. Overall, this place is great. Food portion size was a little small and thus minus the one star. Great service. The macaroon ice cream were amazing! They were full of flavors and didn't taste too sweet.  We were each able to redeem our free macaroons ice cream via yelp and brought 2 extra to go because they were so good.

DaH-ECPIJfYoEFrkhfOEfQ.text: Came to Las Vegas and found good reviews for Gangnam . We came and tried it ourselves. I must admit that I really am picky about Korean bbq since K-Town has great places, but this spot did not disappoint. The quality of the meat was excellent and the attentiveness of the staff made this place an excellent to come for Korean bbq. Next time we're in Vegas we will come back to Gangnam.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoying Korean bbq

9uxeSIjHtp-LZvwkJc9R7w.text: Gangnam was a great experience. It was my first time eating Korean BBQ and I was not disappointed. I will definitely make a return trip when I'm in Vegas again. Even the dessert was delicious. We had the macaroon ice cream sandwiches.

q_B6jomP0ARpN_nmyfKGUQ.text: I've been to Honey pig and other Korean BBQ places all over the states and this is by far my favorite. First time here, took my mom and her husband who had never been to one and they loved it. The food was amazing, the staff diverse and attentive, just great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KvUl5lqYaMEegxkNQ1-FCg.text: Service was great but disappointed on the quantity of food given on the Gangnam option for 4 people. The price we paid for the amount of food given to us just didn't add up. We had 5 people but only 3 of us split the Gangnam option of 4. We got 5 plates, 2 salads, some soups, rice, mushrooms(not good), and a couple oysters. The seating was done incorrectly because they had a group of 2 before us  sit at a  table for a big party while having our group of 5 sit in a 4 person table. They just added a chair and had me sit by the lighter. I'd recommend you go somewhere else if you are hungry

JRCHn7Gj4KDdrtJ2y2-eDg.text: I've been to several BBQ places in the Los Angeles area, but this is by far the BEST!! Everything was delicious. Meat was well marinated and great quality. Wontons were amazing. Service impeccable. Entire staff was wonderful and welcoming. Will definitely be coming back again.

Xv0VnDx6b2pTaN99yf13Tw.text: Who doesn't eat buffet while in Vegas? We don't! Hahaha Maybe it's the luxury of living so close to Vegas so it's not a must to stuff our faces in every time we're in town. We're from LA btw. So we obviously knows what's up with the authentic Korean BBQ!   We decided to dine here based on all the Yelp reviews. This is NOT the traditional AYCE Korean BBQ restaurant. You can order individual orders of meat (about $9.95 per plate) or you can do the prefixed meal plans from $56+ per 2 people. We got the Gangnam style $65.95 (most popular) prefixed meal for 2. The meat quality was not bad, but the marinated bulgogi was a little too sweet. The raw oysters didn't tasted as fresh as expected. Which is why I took away 1 star. Customer service was great! They have many servers nearby so getting their attention was not a issue at all.   Overall, we'll be returning in the future. The Meat Lover is the next prefixed meal for 2 we'll be trying.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The meats Gangnam Style prefixed meal has to offer.

qtOlxsNLqsVJTliTKgBRIw.text: Nice place to eat. Stuff are friendly, place is clean and food is good. Had a great dinner with friends. I recommend this to someone who likes bbq and like to chill with friends.

e-UCfFlhLzD63qUzwrY0Mg.text: Everything here was so goooood, Our server Joseph was so awesome and gave the best service. Definitely recommend and happy hour deals are crazy cheap 10/10

5MmzpS5-C6jgY1jzf6e0KQ.text: Not sure what all the hype is about.  I defended this place without ever going here because of its Yelp rating stating, "3100 people can't be wrong." We went here, and I found out that 3100 people can be wrong.  The staff was friendly, but maybe they were friendly because they don't have to do the traditional things a Korean BBQ would do.  We ordered a set menu for four and literally all they did was put everything on the table for us. They didn't offer to cook it for us like most places do.  Hell, the stove wasn't even turned on for us!  So if its not the service that got this place a 4.5 star rating, then what is? Well it surely wasn't the quantity of the meat.  I've never seen four men be so polite around a BBQ.  Its because we knew how scarce everything was.  We couldn't even pig out because there wasn't enough for all of us.  The one good thing about this place however, is the free ice cream macaroon they give you at the end if you check in to.................YELP!  Maybe that's why the rating is so good? Free ice cream? The macaroon was pretty good though!

OcKVmXmhOoXX8rKdjUD2JA.text: This was my first time trying Gangnam Asian BBQ in Las Vegas. I have had Korean BBQ or Japanese BBQ in different restaurants and cities. I have to say this is the best Asian BBQ I have had. The Staff members were tentative and sincere. They made sure your needs are addressed quickly and efficiently.   You have to get the Kobe Beef Carpaccio. The Gangnam combo was more than enough for two. If you have three people or even four; the Gangnam combo for two will suffice. Additional the macaroon ice cream is to die for.   This is definitely a destination every time I revisit Las Vegas

yaKB2rDrKMvK9I09ap3-3Q.text: Wow wow wow!! So good! Got the meat lovers with 3 other people. Worth every penny! Definitely coming again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UyA0HofXNJoeWZAGF5SuyQ.text: This place is my girlfriend's and I favorite Korean BBQ spot in town right now. Everytht we have is always delicious! . The way the meat is prepared is on point. I really like the large tables even for a party of two. The staff is incredibly helpful and always checking in on us.  Only downside is that the price can be a little high.

T7UAfcHMvubPVQVOfpVqnA.text: Very reasonably priced. Great food and service. We came here with a group of 5 and ordered the meat lovers special for 4 people. It was enough for everyone in the group, and then some! The pork Bulgogi was a huge hit with everyone and the miso soup was very tasty! You get a ton of little side dishes as well that they bring out to the table as soon as you sit down. We took advantage of the happy hour specials, 50% off of hot sake and beers. We got 2 Apple sake's,  2 hot sake's,and beers. Our glasses never went empty. I highly recommend the apple sake. Also, If you check in on Yelp you get a free macaroon ice cream sandwich, a delightful way to finish off our great meal! Oh-& for all of that our bill was only around $35 per person! We will definitely come back here the next time we're in town.

Very attentive, constantly checking to see if our grill grate needed to be replaced, answered any and all questions. I can't wait to go back!

xUDiOHBjH9ScgffyMgjRUQ.text: We wandered here just as Happy Hour was starting. We ordered a mild version of the "spicy ramen" and it was still too spicy for my kids. Had the mul nengymun (cold noodle soup) and it was delicious. My husband ordered a beer and we ordered 3 different meats. It was so delicious and such a great deal! The service is not American standards but it still was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean bbq

0yFuprnv4qYRnYhRmLZZGQ.text: Came here with 6 other hungry buddy's. Wow, great food and service is all I can say and great pricing, off the hectic strip but that's fine for us. Came here on a Wednesday night, had to wait only 10-15 minutes but that's cool!  Seated with a bunch of appetizers in front of us from tasty salads, potato salad,'pickled cucumbers, sprouts Kim chee. Yum! We are meat eaters bring us Kalbi, bolgolgi, beef belly (yummy), pork, the works.  Meats are marinaded in deliciousness then BBQ's in a grill - yum!  They keep bringing until you say no mas! So come hungry- great service they make sure you have enough sides and meats for the grill!  Will definitely come here again.

CAXRRdP77H35GNs_YYKGHQ.text: This is a total mainstay restaurant for any time of day. Hungry at lunch? They have a super high value lunch menu where you get soup, banchan, edamame, rice, meat, and more for a very reasonable price. Hungry late night? The happy hour specials are ridiculous. Even when there is no special I end up not really spending much more than during the specials, and I always have enough food to take home to have another meal later. Basically this is one of my favorite KBBQ restaurants in the whole world.  Another great thing is that they have a small bar/counter seating so if you don't want to cook your own meat you can squeeze in to the bar without a wait or table hassle.

1mj-5ycf0j09G5hodHpOfQ.text: After a long day at the pool, day club, and shopping, we were hungry. Gangnam Asian BBQ has amazing Yelp reviews and it seemed like a safe choice for dinner. We arrived ~5pm, still in time to enjoy the Happy Hour specials.  We got: -2 orders of Beef Toro $4x2 -Pork Belly: $4 -Cream Cheese Wonton: $3 -Sweet Corn: $2 -Chicken Karaage: $4 -Jalapeno Poppers: $4 -Prime Kalbi: $8.95 -Strawberry Macaron Ice cream sandwich: Free with Yelp Check in  The entire feast for two was only ~$40 and it was very good.  If I were to go again, I would skip the Chicken Karaage and the Cream Cheese Wonton and it would still be plenty of food for us. The set-up is more Korean than Japanese but the sauces were more yakiniku style. If you're looking for authenticity, this is not the place. However, if you're looking for good food at a great price point, head on over.

9vBM20_Pu8L8Yrf3kpYUJg.text: We have gone twice. The food is high quality and the service is excellent. Somewhat surprising given the location and the reasonable cost of the meal.  As a vegetarian, I'm happy that they provide several options, including two types of bi bim bop, a noodle dish (maybe the acorn one? I didn't try it), and kitchen-prepared korean bbq dishes (mushrooms, soshito pepper, and others). Given that all the grills are cleaned and replaced before and during the meal, you can also order a small selection of vegetable and tofu options to grill, which is above and beyond.

v_Gw3EcuZEZyAnda55iPAg.text: I always leave happy when I eat here. Staff is friendly. Food is good. Prices are great. No complaints! Definitely worth checking out!

4InWe1kYv2w4cEUvqaezig.text: Eh...  I'm from OC where Korean/Japanese BBQ is abundant.  I decided to come in for a late dinner on a Thursday night with one other person.  I had tried to called earlier that day to make reservations but they didn't take any.  There was no wait when we arrived thankfully.  Once seated, we decided to go with the Gangnam Dinner ($60) out of the six options.  It included a house salad, fried dumplings, oysters, seaweed salad, miso, bibimbap, kalbi, bulgogi, choice cut, pork belly, toro, and veggies.  We also ordered extra toro and beef belly.  The best meat surprisingly was the pork belly, although it was the only one not flavored.  I also enjoyed the bulgogi.  The other cuts were average.  The bibimbap was really nothing special.  The sides were all pretty good.  The 4 oysters were gross and didn't taste that fresh.  The veggies they provided was mushrooms and bell peppers.  We also got free macaron ice creams for checking in.    We left stuffed.  You get a lot for what you pay for.  The menu and look of the place reminds me a hell lot of Gyu Kaku.  It's very very similar.  As for service, the guy waiting on us wasn't really friendly.  It was our first time and he didn't really go over the menu with us.  We also didn't get our waters refilled and kept having to ask.  For such high reviews I am really quite disappointed.  Not sure if we will ever be back.

Plus free ice cream for check-in and best service!!!    The server was very helpful and advided us when we ordered too much meat. Very generous portions of side dishes and they were fabulous!

ETiS3Gn4j_3uNOGqYIhHwQ.text: My favorite Korean BBQ place, and possibly my favorite place in Vegas to eat. Staff is always nice and friendly, food is amazing, no complaints.

CZMAayfII2dtdbU24WWsdA.text: For a Latin guy this place was not the best. I'm not a big fan of cooking my own food at a restaurant but I'm not saying the concept is bad. I ordered the creamy corn and that was actually really good. Then I got the Korean chicken with some shrimp and fried rice. The staff was friendly and the time I was there I think I was then only non Asian person. If you love Asian food and the food being cooked in front of you than that's the place for you.

dCnxDO-04BbA3N2Et7L08A.text: Excellent food, great service and plenty of variety. My husband and I visited here on our last trip to Vegas. We were looking forward to bring his Uncle and Aunt who are visiting from Poland. They loved the place and food as well. We will be back on our next visit.

Y-jMVc7YDlnJLzSutzbamA.text: My company and I was in town for a convention and decided to eat Kbbq and chose this restaurant. Well this restaurant was an absolute shame. The quality of meats and the service from our server was horrendous. I just don't understand what all the fellow yelpers are praising. Coming from all the great Kbbq LA has to provide this place was such a disappointment.  On top of the horrible service they charged us an automatic 18% surcharge. We Complained to the manager and nothing was done. Never again am i eating korean food in Las Vegas.

QXT4lyuAXXp5OseRAKTnuw.text: Good Ambience delicious food and good service. Definitely in the top two of barbecue places I've eaten at.

gBlnPJnbIUlQ2zvSHz-j_Q.text: Great food and great service! If you're from Hawaii it's like a Gyu-Kaku and Korean restaurant in one. Cheap prices and food is very very good!!! Had spicy seafood soondubu (soft tofu stew). Also ordered the fried vegetable gyoza. Overall, a great affordable and delicious meal! I wish they had this at home!

5hUHKKwwzHdyrA-n-3zWMg.text: I really wish that Yelp would have the option to rate restaurants with half star. This place is definitely better than average, however, not super great to be four stars.  The atmosphere is hip and modern. They play current hits, have big screens and the decor is very nice. In regards to the food, everything was good. The combos are the best way to go. The portion sizes are good for two people and you get to sample several types of meats. The side dishes are not like your typical Korean BBQ which made me a bit disappointed. They serve the combos with rice, miso soup and a plain salad! I really missed my side dishes!!!! Grrr  The service is good and the price is reasonable. If you cannot get to china town, this is a good Korean BBQ for the area!

Zy-NuyAy9WTn2qO4evrwyw.text: Had all the fresh grillables I could ask for.  I will probably go for individual items on my next visit as the 'all you can eat' is, as you expect, a lot of a narrow portion of the full menu.  Service was kinda rushed, but I was by myself and taking up a four top is not always in their best business model.

V8Q90b-MMLPWvV-twR0yyA.text: This place is great and its not too far from the strip only about a 10 minute ride or so which is not too bad for good quality food. It does get busy during lunch times so keep that in mind and maybe get there early. You can also sit at the bar and order which is nice. And I love that they have the traditional Korean BBQ grill.   As for the food its all pretty traditional I go there often and I especially like their fried calamari and the beef toro. For dessert I really like the cheesecake its perfect. Overall great place with great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best calamari
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso soup is miso good
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Toro very good

-Na2xUVaZXkAzCE90zyOgg.text: I've dined here with friends for dinner a couple times and we all enjoyed our dining experience. Both times, It wasn't too packed so it was a nice, casual atmosphere. The interior was clean and on the hip side perfect for groups. The service is also friendly and attentive.  The menu has a nice variety options and we ordered a bunch to try. From appetizers, drinks and freshly prepared meats and veggies. Everything was tasty and were of good quality, nothing disappointed our taste buds.   I highly recommend Gangnam if you're in need to try a new spot off-strip.   *note: If you give a good yelp review on the spot, you'll get a free dessert. It's not something I'm crazy about giving an instant review for, but if you really like dessert, it's there.

kAP36gHTsfOMSEnn2h03Yw.text: We gave this place a try because it was close to the Hard Rock Hotel where we were staying. Everything was reasonable and good without any complaints. The icecream mochi is a must try.

dj2sdZshIS2XLpls0wZPEA.text: Reasonably priced for a non-AYCE dinner. You do still get good portion. Below are the items we've ordered/gotten:  Mango Saketini and Peach Saketini - alcoholic drinks, they taste like what their names are: mango and peach. LOL.  Appetizers:  Steamed Dumplings Fried Dumplings Miso Soup Seaweed Salad with shredded radish  Post appetizer/pre main course: Fried calamari w/spicy sauce Fresh oysters  Main course: Prime Kalbi Beef Toro Kobe Style Beef  Desert: Green tea cheesecake Fried Banana with Ice Cream  Service was good. Checked up on us one in a while to make sure everything was okay.   This establishment is near the strip and UNLV. So if you're around the area, a must stop!  Would come back here and try out their HH.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried banana with ice cream.
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake.
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters

UlZlMgPZyztAmrtdxCznUg.text: A bit expensive, but will come back. The meat is fresh, and theres is a lot of choices

461mOLRHKuvFTWxSaI3h5A.text: We always love to have the Korean foods wherever we go so, we went to this place while we were at Vegas but it was almost at midnight so, they were closing soon unfortunately. We just ordered the BBQ and went picked it up. It was still very good foods and the server there was very nice, polite and patience to us even though they are closing for the night. Just wish we had more time to experience at the restaurant but next time for sure. The BBQ was good flavor, easy to eat, right amount of rice and meat. Especially the dessert was A+ .

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bibimbab (Rice salad with good amount of vege and meat)
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert ( I called it Macaron Ice-cream sandwich)
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Bulgogi  (never goes wrong)

hBh3mo41C-3dUD2sOjptPA.text: Okay yelpers here's my review. We ordered the following:  1. Harami miso 2. Korean prime Kalbi  3. Prime Kalbi 4. Kobe Ssam (Uni dish) 5. Uni Bibimbap 6. Spicy soft tofu soup 7. Side of white rice   Total bill came out to $78.52 for 2 of us before tax  so $90ish after 15% tip.   I would say the food was 3/4 Korean and 1/4 Japanese style bbq. Korean sides are free and unlimited and if u "volunteer" writing a yelp review u get a free dessert  not the reason I am writing one but hey free is free...  Overall value & price I would say 4.5 out of 5 but with the good customer service it bumps to a 5! Would come back here next time I'm in town! :)  2 days later:  I love the uni bibimbap so much I had to come back here again & get it to go for the road home lol. I had some left over from the 1st time here and  it was still delicious cold. The service person on the phone was pleasant  and helpful. He recommended the bulgolgi bibimbop for the hubby! Will keep u posted on how the food tastes in the car  So here we are in Vegas again May 2016 :)  We're about to drive back home but had to stop for my favorite uni bibimbap!! This dish is served in a stone hot pot so the rice has a nice toasty taste with good amount of uni.   The quality of meat is pretty good for AYCE place but we usually order a la carte so we don't overeat before we get on the road lol.   We refer all our families and friends who are in town visiting to eat here! ;)  Til next time...

BXY1nG0HRfjk1TjN2LGlUQ.text: Food was quite good, about as good as you're likely to get in Vegas (we're still behind L.A. by a long shot)  Prices were fair for the quality served.  Would return if in the area.

HdQoUpacFBKwJHyUnlG4hw.text: I wish I could come here everyday! The best  Korean place ever! Definitely worth waiting for an hour today !

9MEduXZY1jsrL8x8TDHxHw.text: The food and atmosphere here are absolutely top notch. Its a fun place to eat while tasting delicious. And the servers were extremely nice and keep the dri ks full!

DdbdgVi_MQ0rF-wMzhb8EA.text: They have the best happy hour deals! Every time I come here the check is no more than $20 for 2 people and we leave stuffed and extremely satisfied. My favorite are the spicy pork and bulgogi. SO flavorful and delicious. Service here is on point too :)

2QYZTCnmtkLWCfJbWaHwfg.text: I was invited to dinner with friends, one of whom acted as our chef (as he's clearly been to places like this before). We had many different meats, from Kobe beef to spicy beef, chicken, shrimp and vegetables. We also had different beers as well as a Korean drink (sorry, can't remember the name). A few of the group had oysters, which they really enjoyed. All in all it was a very fun dinner. We had two grills going!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c_VcGmuKTAzPSGgJ_ElNeg.text: So i've been here before in the past (almost 5 years ago) and ordered some pork belly to go and it was delicious.   I'm a student at UNLV and grew up with a Korean mother so Korean food is my comfort food.   I came here the other week with a friend and had their Yukaejang, the flavors and everything was delicious, i'm just used to a little more ingredients in the soup rather than just a little bit of meat and broth.   Besides that no complaints from me :)

S2Lcy4a7OiIExP5TNc7LSA.text: Favorite Korean bbq place ever!!!! They have great Quality food, their staff is super friendly and the place is extremely clean! I've never eaten something here that wasn't good, I love the fact that they have meal deals that come with a variety of different foods, everything is always paired so well and so delicious. I love that they're open late and even though they're a bit off the strip they have enough space and the wait times are never ridiculous!! I absolutely love this place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Such a great dining experience, my son really enjoyed cooking his own food!

Z6SuiZqy4Ug1O-sm2GAkgg.text: This place was awesome as previous customers recommended. We ordered happy hour pork belly, bulgogi, beef toro plus vegetables. We ordered too much food, but it was so good. We left with so much food for the next day. It was well worth the lyft ride here.  In addition, we had the free condiments Kimchi and other pickled vegetables.

ulTPDbeUQaEqQxdoHcgaog.text: Great service and great food! Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll definitely be back!  Their tuna kim bap was one of my favorite dishes.  They deep fry the seaweed wrapped with rice and place the tuna tartare on top.  I wish I lived closer so I can get this dish often!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sooo delicious... we devoured everything!

R7B_9RHlBEWtiUlUCm_oPg.text: Best Angus beef Korean BBQ!! Amazing server. Had a long wait but it was worth it in the end.

_S156Rv-9UNHDDPvA9Sr9A.text: Evidently, I have had bad Korean bbq in the past, and didn't know it was bad.  I just knew I didn't like it.  The seasonings were not delectable.    This place is great. We went mostly because it had Japanese offerings that appeared to be hibachi and not just sushi, like many others in the area have.  The meat offerings are VERY thin sliced for quick cooking, by yourself, on the grill on your table.  Kinda fun.  The birgogi was a favorite.  Six selections of condiments, including kimchi, were very good.  The bang bang shrimp was excellent.   Off the beaten path.  A la carte is the best value in Vegas.

QLOdljautME17u3SlvMQBw.text: The service is amazing. The servers are genuinely nice. Food is quick to come out. Flavors are wonderful. And the mini side dishes (Banchan...that come out automatically) are yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iijjYrpl0umWQRebsdK0mw.text: Awesome service staff really hustle. Meat was super fresh and quality. Nice change for the strip. Price was fair...

n6Nsc7i1Q6KUtgh3Fs7FiA.text: This was the best Korean BBQ restaurant in Las Vegas. Meat were tender and the chicken with lemon sauce was delicious. We wanted to try something new so we ordered a cold noodle and it was surprisingly good. Love this place. Highly recommend.  Service was great also.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Selection of the meats we ordered. So good!

35tyei7suFp1m0Hxqapzyw.text: Love this place. Had just checked in so you can check my small blurb there (the have free macaron ice cream sandwich if you check in on Yelp).   I love the prices and that it isn't an AYCE joint which is friendly to people like myself that can't eat large portions at once and are perpetual grazers.    Service staff is super friendly, helpful, and on point.   Shout out to Alex for taking care of us tonight!

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gOgdmvfblcpjnzvE1f_-TA.text: Food: 5/5 Service: 4/5 Cleanliness: 4/5 Decor & Style: 3/5  This place is a lot smaller than Hobak however it's very good. Spicy pork belly and beef ribs were excellent. They even had 32 oz Sapporo beer for $8 I believe!  They open late (1am) so great place to eat if you've landed late. It's also only a short Uber ride from the Airport so your best bet to get good food before you venture out onto the long night (or sleep) whichever you prefer.

OPTbwMnHGkr4wmd8VL6VJg.text: Highly recommend!  The place looks clean, well-kept, and modern with nice decor.  Plentiful easy parking.  Spacious inside.  Excellent customer service.  Fantastic food (good portions and reasonably priced).  First time here.  We ordered the marinaded Prime Kalbi, the Kobe Beef, the Toro Beef, Scallops, Spicy Ramen, Spicy Soft Tofu Soup, and Spicy Tuna rolls appetizer.  Everything was delicious, including the side dishes.  We left feeling full and happy we chose this restaurant.  We will be back for sure.

oDzRskBW0kX9b5N6dbpOuQ.text: Great food! Everything tasted good. High quality meat. Fresh ingredients, and well marinated.   Lot of personal space: the tables are big for even 2-people parties; there are plenty of room between tables.  Very roomy.   The waiters were energetic, efficient, and polite.   One of the best dining experiences in Las Vegas. 5 stars.

1d30aMfAJGtAgr5dTGvc3g.text: Really good KBBQ! When we first got there we were a little disappointed to find that they did not have AYCE. As soon as we got our food though, we saw that it didn't really matter because the portions were perfect. Just enough food to satisfy our appetites without making us feel gross and bloated afterwards. Staff was nice and constantly making rounds to refill water and do grill changes. Price wasn't bad for what we got. Would definitely go back if I was in Vegas again.

SVtiWMw6i46JFcXPJsgryw.text: Went here during EVO weekend and damn this place is amazing. Good amount of meat for 4, plenty of sides and the peach soju is delicious. Meats are good as well

lgpZuhNtIIvf0GbXo6FY8w.text: Awesome place!  A must go when you are in Las Vegs!  Love this place awesome meat cuts!

LPRhSt6S3cXBPwlE-GiczA.text: Great new place for lunch, and to bring out of town guest, I will definitely be back!!!

_C-XL8oNBdApf3B1JzKz3A.text: This place was soo good. It was cute I went last night with my little family and we absolutely loved it will be returning again we were actually celebrating that we are pregnant again so I know what I'm going to be craving lol the staff was super nice and super attentive

3ROyJPtHnZbgJ2wB_xGHBg.text: I highly recommend this place! Best Korean barbecue restaurant I've been to.  Nicely decorated and clean restaurant.  Good service and definitely coming back for sure!

XW-ctlK7LNFBhiHwSSLsEw.text: The Harami Miso and Korean Prime is delicious! A must try. Green tea macaroon was fantastic as well. Food was great, but service was extremely slow. The wait was an hour and the check took 20 minutes to come.

SrND3IKwMdu-uXBq8ceMjQ.text: This was an excellent meal! Besides the wait.. The food and service is totally worth it, everyone is so happy and friendly. Definitely see myself coming back here again!

3DsgqcowOUCR9ELoM2Ucmg.text: Came here one time with my friends that is in town from NY. Was not very impressed with the food here. There are a few other places in town that is def better. The restaurant is a lil run down and the tables and chairs seem a lil sticky

9zZ30L4mJdpkBtjES_xxHw.text: Very authentic Korean food.  The staff was friendly and although they were extremely busy our experience was very good.  Great food

Wf7Dy0YOJUMcXsxhf2HK9g.text: Still the best kbbq in town! Great customer service and great food, what more can you ask for? If you are in Vegas, this is the only kbbq place you should try. Big portions, taste great, and the atmosphere is awesome! Music is awesome, and the caterers are very attentive, I always feel great at this place.

3gHaR9NdQM-GYOBfvAiHEQ.text: Awesome. Must try. Definitely worth a try. Korean BBQ!!! Must I say more. If you live for korean food and not go here you're missing out big timeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!

nqEQkLzT06feIWDLdgjw5g.text: Group of six, we got the kangnam combination and it was plentyyyy of food. The bibimbab was delish, the miso soup was really tasty, the meats were well marinated. The oysters were okay. The service is fantastic and attentive.

V_oVaii1YGzZwislILiXKg.text: If youre in the mood for korean bbq then this is the place for you. Even on a sunday night i didnt have to wait long. I tried mpatly marinated meat and was npt disappointed.

qZlXRwlzF15WdXmJLDvhcg.text: This korean restaurant was AHMazing. Best kk bbq in vegas! If your looking for delicious meat and good vibes here is the place.

Bb-lubxhmU0jud-5sCLo5Q.text: Delicious! Did the Gangman for 2. With Bimbibap and marinated meats. All the meats were tender, delicious.

dVu1N6xiQ_M0u6NE2x7w_w.text: Ordered the Las Vegas combo. Such a variety. Enough to feed 3-4 people. Staff was fine and the atmosphere was great. Worth checking it out.

GnZeTfqHOsE_9DViDmdMLw.text: Excellent Korean and Japanese menu! Really enjoyed my dinner here! I had the spicy tofu soup in a hot pot and it was delicious! Love the side dishes that came with it! Yummy! Will come here again!

mi8oQA_O7oXWaYugzAezCA.text: Good meat quality, reasonable prices. Plates are small, two people will spend over $50 easily. Side dishes can use more variety and better flavor.

CYyMSTDgDm5XYGqwP5ELpQ.text: This Korean BBQ was delicious and each piece was marinated to perfection! Not only was the bbq meat awesome but also bet on other dishes to be superb! Bibimbap was also better than most that I have ever eaten from other places like in New York! Service was also quick and efficient so no need to wait to be served.

MnLltPUKeknXo_Idav6XOQ.text: great place. not AYCE, but it'll fill you up for about the same price. friendly staff, and they have a big screen that plays music videos. the food was great and I got a free macaron ice cream for checking in on my first visit.

wHhlJUzl1RVfQngJOpV-3w.text: Cool design of the restaurant inside ,however,  the food was mediocre. Happy hour was worth the price of the food, but other than that not the best option to eat authentic Korean food .

7fAF7oAZvPbwKjbYQvQ09Q.text: Definitely my new favorite go to for Korean style BBQ.  The prefixed menu options are reasonably priced and the amount of food that comes with it is endless. Every single thing we are was delicious!

b9NRF2R-X1oP_jbbXmebzg.text: Fresh ingredients. Friendly service. Always a fun dining experience. The bulgogi, spicy chicken with lemon and spicy pork are all on the Happy hour menu and their sweet chili dumplings are delicious.

L4VijrW2RIBDBFm6oOhs0A.text: The brisket was excellent. We usually go to all you can eat Korean BBQ .... but with 4 oz portions, we only really ordered 2-3 portions per person. Paid less than we usually pay for all you can eat. Service was great!

SxIZKOUl06lENHRz7f8Fhg.text: First time trying Asian BBQ. And will not be my last! Great service and the food was off the chain. Crazy I'm from LA and just never did the Korean BBQ. Well I have been missing out! When I come to Vegas this is my go to spot.

-g78da76OvwU7jqaLVErYQ.text: I wasn't so impressed with this spot. First of all, it's very crowded here. We came here for lunch and had to wait about 30 minutes. Secondly, the ventilation system isn't so great here and you can feel the humidity and grease in the air. Thirdly, service was slow.   I feel like since they gained popularity and are close to the strip, they nickel and dime you. You need to order a minimum of 2 bbq dishes for complimentary ban chan. Ssam (lettuce) is an extra $2. The ban chan portions are small and there's not much variety. The meat quality was so-so.   I do like how they offer a variety of menu items and even have HH which a lot of people seem to come here for. However, I feel like I can find better kbbq spots in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tofu soup

SyA94nji2eJBhXPUPp8OYg.text: Gave me F quality short rib meat. The koreans got A quality. If your not korean you'll get all the fatty meat. This is bs.

wqWc3925ICLDQiLdVmsdPQ.text: This was our first time dining at an Asian BBQ and it was absolutely wonderful. We ate here the last night we stayed in Vegas and it was wonderful!

G7cXXPTVpt2rCMhCOB8mrg.text: My first non-AYCE BBQ I've been to...and I regret going...in a good way! This place ruined kbbq for me forever because NOTHING can ever be as good! I don't even want to go to AYCE bbq's anymore because it's just not the same!! T___T  Everyone who knows me knows that I have a very...unrefined palette. Everything is "good' to me. Something has to be extremely bad or extremely amazing for me to tell its "amazing". Basically, I cannot tell quality food (I have that whole...appreciate whatever food you have mentality). But this place blew me away! I've never tasted bbq meat sooo tender and perfectly seasoned before.   I've tried one other bbq place since Gangnam (Manpuku in Los Angeles, Japanese bbq) and I just can't. Gangnam will always be a favorite for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. forever ruined bbq for me. amazing and I can never look at AYCE bbq the same way again

xWqpQjfFu6wBXQJ-1xnm7g.text: Serving size was huge!! We got the meat lovers and ordered some appetizers. Our downfall was we ordered too much and didn't end up eating much of the pork belly. Great atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect dinner

MpCek1ySQuJz0K-9OzkATA.text: Awesome place! 3000 reviews can't go wrong. Great location close to strip next to Hard Rock Hotel. Love their Gangnam dinner and happy hour. Super fast service when we came on a Tuesday night at 5:45pm. Delish! Also enjoyed the free macaroon for checking in

zTs5j16eLCpzCJKqvQO3nw.text: Loved this place! The food is great. The service was friendly and efficient. They worked as a team which really enhanced the experience. I highly recommend this place. They have options for every one...meat-lovers and vegetarians.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They have a good selection of ice cream macaroons. Try Vanilla...it doesn&#39;t disappoint
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla and Mango macaroon icecream sandwich. Both were surprisingly awesome. I typically don&#39;t like macaroons.
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great price for a pitcher of ice cold beer

lVCnquRKxavwPHivYSl4NQ.text: These guys got it locked down! Best Korean BBQ there is. Service is just phenomenal. Everyone was just friendly and welcoming. Service was very fast. It may have taken a while to get our table, but I expected it with how popular this place was, and with service and food like this, guest will have a great time and take the extra time to really soak in the quality of the place. We took the choice of the "meat lovers" for 2. We initially wanted for 4, because my wife and I had our kids there with us, but the waitress insisted that the portions were huge, and that 2 would be best for us and our wallets. She was absolutely right. Overall just a great experience! Will make this a "must go to" spot every visit to vegas.

XplIrBC7KKmuMP03_vZimA.text: I like this place. It's lowkey and usually pretty quiet when I go. Their bacon wrapped salmon is great. I could eat only that for the entire meal. Their chicken kirage is delicate and flavorful. Their waitstaff is meh. Don't expect friendly welcoming people up front.

E0Uc5SPnsek8wfYn1l9taw.text: For Las Vegas the city of endless Buffets.. which is great. I was craving KBBQ. Thanks to Yelp I stumbled across this place and it was so so good that I forgot I was in Vegas. This place is off the strip behind the Hard Rock Hotel.  We did not have to make reservations and the wait time was the usual 15-20 min. The booths are fat friendly and the whole ambiance was friendly, hip, and music was on point. It's like a disco with KBBQ.  We  ordered the Gangnam Style ( For Four People) Combo and it was perfect. Which came with Fresh Oysters, Fried Calamari, Shishito peppers, Bibimbap and Miso Soup for the starters and then the BBQ dishes were: Korean Prime Kalbi, Flat Iron Garlic Steak,  Buttery Filet Mignon and delicious Bulgolgi all paired with a Mushroom Medley. There was so much deliciousness that it filled my KBBQ craving.  They also serve Hite Beer and Soju the perfect pair for all the meat you will be consuming.   All in all I would definitely come back to this place again. The price is right and does not break the bank. With drinks it would be $45.00 per person. I just do not know what this place is not in Eater for Vegas.

z8mGNGt0yE5LjJ2OLEYP5g.text: The happy hour prices for the food we got was delicious. Service at most Korean BBQ spots are over the top and couldn't ask for better service. Pork belly was our favorite dish. Top it off with a free Macaron and I was sold on the five star review. Well definitely be coming back to this place in the future.

UDM8GL6TSKk5gKQw0-ZKvg.text: We came to this restaurant for dinner while on vacation. The location of the restaurant is tucked away near the strip. First of all, the ambience was phenomenal. There are about 20 tables with a Korean BBQ grill placed squarely in the middle of each. You are presented with a full menu of options for meat seafood and vegetables and I provided free appetizers like kimchi and hot pickles. We chose the premium package for 2. It came to about $89 total. We said three people on that package and had more food than we could all eat! Not only was a suit awesome. But the portions for very very generous. if you have not tried Korean BBQ, I strongly recommend you give this restaurant a try. If you have had Korean barbecue before, this will probably be the best who have ever Eaton.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free appetizers

HlM8iWicSpwz_uIyn0w7iA.text: Ok, so where do you go for Korean food in Vegas?  Go Gangnam style!  Lots of food for the money and tastes delicious.  We went back a few times while we stayed in Las Vegas.

eo7TLByLQh7up8LWLXeNKg.text: We came by today for a brunch before we went out for my friends bachelorette and the food was amazing!!  Not only that, service was so great and our server Andrew made sure that our side plates were always full. Thank you for making our out of town experience awesome!!

pmMyeUyISLNJ_NIG7cqvTg.text: I love the fast service, quality of the meats and unlimited quality side dishes too !! I usually do ala carte as it's way worth it than the family options due to having a lot of fillers and unnecessary appetizer type side dishes. If you have a big group perhaps the family dishes would be good just make sure you like the appetizers it includes.

2GQhk5KnjdoVRBYTP8p9lw.text: Amazing food! Great service! My new favorite Korean BBQ place. Portions are large! Dried squid side was amazing! Highly recommend!

6rT5qykenz_MIkVTn_F6qg.text: My friend and I came here for dinner after seeing all the recommendations on Yelp. We definitely wanted something more local and not touristy. And, we love Asian/Korean BBQ restaurants.  We were seated right away, and the service was quick and friendly. We ordered the tuna poke as an appetizer and had the garlic flank steak and bibimbap for our BBQ. They also brought the usual assortment of small dishes with the BBQ, like kimchi, some picked vegetables and a handful of other things that I have no idea what they were -- but, they were tasty! The poke was fantastic. And it was a rather large appetizer, too. Both beef cuts were tender and flavorful, although I did find the portion sizes a  tad small, especially considering grilling shrinks pieces down a bit. Also, I didn't love having to cook the dishes ourselves. I'm more used to the Korean BBQ places that actually cook the protein for you. Regardless, though, it was a super fun experience and I think we did a pretty good job grilling! For two people, it was just enough food. And, we had a Yelp coupon for a free mochi ice cream. We also had a couple of drinks, ordering both a sake and a couple of mixed drinks. Had we known how large the sake bottle was, we probably would have stuck with just that!  The price for both food and drink were on point. You definitely get your money's worth.  I definitely recommend Gangnam.

hyZR4dBfsGwroUrUM77tBA.text: I went to LV Convention center for WQA show 2 weeks ago and left after 1pm because the show was small and didn't want to eat a burger there. On my way to the airport, I found this little Korean BBQ restaurant on Paradise rd. Via Yelp.  I ordered Bulgogi and Prime Kalbi Beef bbq and the meats are very tender and flavorful. I also ordered a Kalbi soup for lunch and it was good too. The prices were reasonable and the bill came out less than $30. I would definitely come back the next time I travel to Vegas again.

4G-_6jDyJ1JB8kko3rWroQ.text: Food was okay, service was okay. I asked for happy hour menu 15mins before it starts and ordered items on happy hour 10 mins before happy hour. They didn't told me to wait until it's happy hour so I was charged regular prices. I mean it's my fault but server could told me to wait as she saw I'm reading the happy hour menu not the regular one.

Wjv7QBAbagVV6t5pM65DqQ.text: My friends brought me here as I'm visiting from out of town for work. Staff are great and will give you a run down on the dishes and what tastes best with what. It's even kid friendly! There is so much to choose from but you won't be disappointed. We had the meat lovers for 4 and still had food left over after 3 adults and 3 kids dug in. Be prepared to shower as soon as you get home because I will smell like you rolled in a bar-b-que pit all night.

C-TppIHudjThMA6EdmazmQ.text: Great service! I keep on coming back here when im in las vegas. We always get the gangnam set.

YtqA2_5z_lBBtCFtw1LPog.text: Second-time visit. Came during Happy hrs. Good price and awesome food! I love their bulgogi bibimbap.Our server is very friendly too.

S2LF64RLzCjs_Mwau8YuZg.text: Visited Gangnam on a random night in Vegas to get my KBBQ fix on. This location is just off the strip or about a $12 cab ride off the strip.   I went during their night happy hour and they actually had some pretty good deals. We weren't too crazy hungry so we ordered a few a la carte meats. The portion of the meat was pretty small but the quality made it worth it! They also had some pretty decent side dishes as well!

dL39GZriZ8aSYtkfRWLNMQ.text: Pretty standard Korean bbq with Japanese influences... The wait staff is pretty nice. The liquor is cheap and so is happy hour.... Compared to LA OR NYC KBBQ... It's on the pricier side but the atmosphere and decor is ok.

cCfnrs3x0fjlMzi88cjS7Q.text: Very nice bbq. Everything is super. Kobe beef was indeed very good and worth the price! Servers are great too.

pKgyBOjdEDsZBkReSCPsHA.text: Great food! Great Service! No wait on a Sunday afternoon! Everything was busy wonderful! (:

ClBeEQaqfVPtuIG68yr7ZQ.text: Its a value and great deal.  That being said, a foursome (2 couples) with eats and drinks is going to be about $120.  $40 bucks a person, if you want to be like super stuffed.  Otherwise, you can probably get away with $30 a person (tip not included with that price).  Great food, great service, great AYCE Korean BBQ in Vegas.   Been here 2x and still loving it.

OZCTxlvKemB-UI2UvzIh3g.text: Best meal I've had in a long time... the amount of food they give you is a lot you will not finish it.. will be back next time I am in Vegas I will be back

2Jz8xldpkVyNU26nEgGCaw.text: The environment is very nice and modern. Our waiter was attentive to us. The Korean prime kalbi was delicious as well as the flat iron garlic beef. The spicy edamame was very satisfying.  The restaurant is kept very clean.   We are happy customers.

QmMLMasiV4czPHZGL8cjVQ.text: Felt like Korean BBQ tonight for belated valentines dinner instead of steak. Saw all the reviews on Yelp and the stars this place got so decided to try it out. We order the Las Vegas for 2 and they do let you substitute, you just have to pay the difference! So that's a plus. Overall it's good but I think I still prefer the all you can eat Korean BBQ places.

UqJDKfSYrwvsfLWvBzWguQ.text: Great food, great service! We ordered the gangnan combo, satisfied about the quality and taste. Highly recommend to your guys. It is a must try in Vegas!

YxUSIOPLlg-QNgj-f-sJpw.text: Best Korean Bbq beef in Vegas. I had the poke, spicy tuna, and cheese corn and let me say this it was great. I'm not a fan of Korean Bbq but this place made reconsider that. I will be back and I would recommend this place to everyone.

GBqsTxc6QR-w4biXKAORnA.text: Food was really good, and the service was great. Really enjoyed every slice of meat that was cooked. The music being played out put me in a good mood too.

1I1kDKnREPj4TMAT-Fi3IQ.text: Always good food! We got the premium. The meat is awesome! Even our kids love it here. The macaroon ice cream is delish as well! We always come back here

xhx9zCIga4hclXHN0ZbLXA.text: We always stay at the hard rock on our trips to Vegas & have passed this place several times but there was always a long wait & time was of the essence.  So tonight (Monday) we decided to finally check it out!  (With 4.5 stars and 4K plus reviews we knew it would be legit!). We were able to get right in, and order our food in a timely manner.  We got the premium dinner for two and let me just say it's PHENOMENAL!  The variety and quality is killer.  From one beef lover to another their carpaccio is the best I've ever had & I own an industrial meat slicer! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

oJj2nMCQN2ZRl-cOp5j_7w.text: This place blew my mind! Every item was excellent and the portions are huge. Definitely a good choice for dinner!

Tm901AEiQn5SwBEMD5xbPA.text: Extremely fast and friendly service! Would definitey recommend the korean kalbi and duckbreast. Wouldngo again

kMDljFnIrdLrGqBvvKbtdw.text: Pretty good! The spicy tuna kimbap is a must try! The waiter was also really friendly as well. Overall I had a great time here!

R5AlsMBWcTwySXGS5RKjlg.text: So good! Off the beaten bath, but we are grateful to have found this hidden gem! So much food, come hungry!

1EpqhvlgoHGueDykQDV7zA.text: Outstanding !!!!  Best Korean restaurant in Vegas!!  We'll be back soon!!Outstanding !!!!  Best Korean restaurant in Vegas!!  We'll be back soon!!  Again. We went back.  Couldn't believe it. The service they provide is unbelievable!  Constantly walking around, observing and asking if you want more side dishes. For Real! They are not messing around.   I live in Korea and here. Trust me this is the Real Deal!!  My mother in law makes awesome bean paste stew and she would be upset that I said this was best.   But OMG. I couldn't get enough.  Thanks for reminding that I miss Korea

SL_8f3QurjSsPQgfP2gHcw.text: This place is awesome and food is fresh and sooo delicious.  Though the place is a little small, but environment is comfy and relaxing!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This place is awesome, environment is relaxing and most importantly the food is sooo delicious!!!

vGpaDLOLqdwVvAzHxlkBqg.text: Best korean bbq in town!!! 6 stars if possible. Large portions, reasonable price, friendly people. Highly recommended!!!!!

3W9y7kHYAdfXPgE3lsl25g.text: We were looking for a korean restaurant for my MIL's bday.  We didn't want to overpay for crappy food at Ginseng.  So I yelped around and found this gem.  I had no idea what to expect and trusted yelp (like I do most of the time).  I called and made a reservation for 13 on a Saturday night.  The dinner turned out great and I would definitely return. For Vegas standards, this is a good KBBQ place. Restaurant/Ambiance:  Its located right off the strip (convenient) but towards the back of the lot.  Kinda hard to see.  Restaurant is not a hole-in-the-wall type of place.  Kind of dark with all tables having a BBQ grill top.  We were fortunate enough to be given the private room in the back.  I think it can comfortably seat 15 or so with 2 grills.  It worked out well since we had a couple of small kids.  My only knock was that the table height was kinda high for the chairs.  They had tons of pillows to supplement, but made it just a tad awkward.  The place was initially empty around 5:30pm, but quickly filled up and there was a wait by the time we left around 7pm.   Service:  Service was ok.  Not up to LA standards but decent.  I thought we would get a dedicated server for our group, but through the evening, the servers would rotate to help us out.  Grills were switched out when asked.  Here they do not cater to you and cook your meat for you (like most of the LA BBQ places).  Food came out quite rapidly.  They didn't clear out our plates, but we had a table on the side that we just set all of the empty dishes.  The banchan was never refilled (we never asked).  Water was refilled when requested.  They had a really nice birthday comp (4-5 ice cream macaroons with candle).  All in all, service was decent. Food:  In a large group, you have to go with the preset menu.  We opted for the Gangnam BBQ package for 6 (next to highest package).  This came with a lot of appetizers and side dishes and 5 cuts of meat.  The appetizers included: oysters (good size ones and pretty fresh in quality), shishito peppers (really good per one of the guests), fried calamari (crunchy and meaty.  Nice spicy mayo dipping sauce too), miso soup, salad, and bulgogi bibimpap.  I really liked the bulgogi pap.  Basically meat and rice.  The cuts of meat included: bulgogi, kalbi, unmarinated steak, marinated/unmarinated prime steak.  I wished they would have included chadol as one of the selections.  YOu couldn't really substitute anything.  The meat quality was pretty good.  Good amount.  They also included 3 different dipping sauces.  Value:  If it wasn't for the combo package, I think it could have gotten a tad pricey.  You have to pay for the banchan.  I requested sahm and sahm jang, and they charged me for that.  We did the 6 person combo with 10 adults.  But we ordered a lot of other things on top (udon, 2 different soups, and more rice).  All in all, a great korean BBQ restaurant in Las Vegas.  I would def make reservations ahead of time.

b4nPWUYxMugUHQCba3-alA.text: First time here and everything we ordered tasted good. Service was excellent too. Only 4 stars because I need to come back and order other stuff to check lol  Kalbi prime beef Kobe beef Kim chi fried rice Spicy tuna Seaweed salad Fried dumplings Fried calamari  Don't forget to rate them guys! They give free dessert!

6mbYA07Qc_Xkxm8RjdTY-A.text: I'm visiting my family at the moment, and I thought this would be a great place for my siblings and I to meet since they have tables big enough to seat 10 people. There are so many good reviews on this place that I expected it to blow me away.   At first glance, the place is very nice, clean, and neat. The table we were seated at was huge with 2 large stove tops. There were so many sides laid out around the stove tops, but I only liked the fish cake, kimchee, and macaroni salad. The rest were pretty bland.   We ordered 2 Meat Lovers and 2 Las Vegas to share amongst all of us. I honestly thought there would be more of the specialty meats, but there was just enough for all of us to have a little of everything. The meats were not very flavorful so I didn't actually get the names of them except for the Bulgogi which was excellent.   The servers were okay. Not very attentive. The ambiance of the place was great. Very nice to talk and catchup with my brothers and sisters. Overall, the place itself was awesome, but the food and service were mediocre. Unfortunately, I will not be going back.

SaGwdpZNbljKZv-gVTvIQQ.text: From the Korean Snob again. Food quality was good. My male Korean server needs to be fired or re-trained. Never checked on us, didn't ask me if I wanted rice (dude, what Korean male doesn't eat rice?), no refills, and kept forgetting items we ordered (I can go on and on, but you get my point). Another individual who thinks minimum wage should be $15 per hour, but can't figure out why his tip is too low.   This place is nothing special, when compared to other traditional Korean bbqs. However, I would give this place 3 1/2 Stars if Yelp would let me.   I wish the ventilation was better here.

ziNMYvKizMWdz2JfOf_u2g.text: Really nice restaurant. Outstanding food for a really good price. Good size portions. Great presentation, and great service! Will definitely add to our list of spots to hit while in Vegas.

dnjThPojQzgYyK38ekPptw.text: Not ayce, but probably best KBBQ I've been to.

fMFWnpR7pPggjAPIpBFdqA.text: Great spot to get small bites since everything is a la carte. It adds up though. Ambiance is nice and reminds me of Gyu Kaku. The menu style is also similar to Gyu Kaku.   Meats rated from 1-5 Premium tongue: 5 Filet mignon: 5 Prime kalbi: 5 Marinated kalbi: 3.5, it's quite fatty  Harami miso: 5 Pork belly: 5, oily but so good  Bulgogi bibimbap: 4.5, I like the rice crispy so you have to let it sit for a long while  Ttebokki: 4, it's spicy !  Fried dumplings: 5, I didn't get to try it but the boyfriend said it had good substance inside   I would recommend this spot for people who like Gyu Kaku and a la carte items... Otherwise stick to ayce because they charge for literally everything.

GBpqif3gHsRqe0FO-OTRjw.text: Bugolgi here is well marinated. Expect a great meal only limited by your skills at the grill. Rice is extra though. Since its tapas style you can easily mix and match even if you have a small party. As long as you get at least two dishes you get all the tiny dishes with your meal. Wonderful with a bottle of asahi.

jx0DFoe63l0fEuaXDfkZTQ.text: The Las Vegas combo dinner menu was great.  They allowed to switch shrimp iyem to Kalbi, so we tasted the kalbi which is supposed to be on more expensive Kangnam dinner combo.  The presentation of food was very unique compare to other Korean BBQ house, but i could see they were well thought of. Thr service was great and waitress always come by whenever i needed something.

ZdzeEsufUYGEJK7HkZwKeg.text: This is the must eat for my family every time we come to Vegas. Bulgogi is our favorite! Love the side dishes. Service is decent. The only thing is we have to ask for lunch menu when we come in weekday lunch. That's the season I gave only 4 star.

fMQHTqabXsORq-Z3UmO3Pg.text: Great food and service. Got the $99 for four menu; portions might be a little small for big appetites.

DrnLLBWTfBnvpWxPDb8ogg.text: I came here for lunch today the food was very good the staff was very nice place is really clean and the price for lunch is very affordable

g2n6ORTnteXPIUqtNtn7Bw.text: Second time eating here and second time ordering the Original Bimbibap. The first time it was great. Second time it wasn't served in the bowl (weird) there was no crunchy rice (no joy) and in fact the rice seemed very wet and tasted watery (I didn't know that was possible). They would have only been given two stars off of this plate but I am factoring my first meal there so I'm averaging it at three. Also I have a food allergy so the waitress was suppose to check if I could eat the side dishes they provide but she "forgot" to come back and tell me if I could eat them or not  which though may be an honest mistake sucks for this customer supporting the two star experience of the night.

z5jeFggo2yvwJSbn956Lzg.text: Food:3.5 stars little salty for authentic Korean BBQ. But decent overall. Very similar to Gyu-Kaku BBQ taste and menu. Set menus are great for people who are fairly new to Korean BBQ.  Interior: 4.5 stars. Fairly clean for Korean BBQ. Price: 5 stars very good. Service: 4.5 stars.   3-6 pm Happy hour seems like a great deal.

RR9n2fbAoD3cuUZwVP96_g.text: Gangnam combo for 4 people plus 1 pitcher of beer =$156. Kinda pricey but good quality meats and plenty of side dishes. Overall, very good and will come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

URZUxGYf1VZam1mPitGZmg.text: This place gets better and better. Happy hour gets lit haha. Definitely come check this place out. I honestly think the Kobe beef is a must, after all it is number one.

Wf3z0ZJr-EoPRCsqjyhlcQ.text: Man, I've been thinking about this place since I left. Too bad it is thousands of miles away. I came here for my anniversary on a trip to Las Vegas. After being hit in the head eating on the Las Vegas Strip, we caught a Lyft to this place, guided by the Yelp reviews. We came early, so there was no wait. I could not believe the prices here. You can get so much for your money, compared to the Korean BBQ places we have in NC. But that's not the best part. The wonderfully marinated, juicy and tender meat is the star of the show. Mmm, mmm, mmm. The rice was cooked perfectly. I was finally in asian food Heaven. I will definitely return if I'm in Vegas!

5c9f-K0rbD03HgocPwlQKA.text: This is our favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. Every time we visit The city, we choose this restaurant as our first dinner place. I like their delicious food and friendly service. The prices are lower than most Korean restaurants we visited.

6hd6WioFM1o4uz6LhGjyMw.text: Very good meat quality and side dishes. Also, they gave us a lot of food for good prices. The Kobe ssam is very interesting and a must-try.

FgjVYvGCDMxWoCnu45joog.text: Overall 3.5 stars  Decor: 5/5 -The booths make the dining experience more private and intimate -Plenty of seating for parties of almost any size  Service: 4.5/5 -Friendly service though sometimes hard to find someone bc they were so busy  Food: 2/5 -We considered the meal for 2 @ $45 but didn't like the pre-selection of appetizers and protein -We ended up ordering: Chicken karaage, Fried calamari, Korean prime rib, Filet mignon, Beef toro, Bulgogi, Kimchi chigae -I didn't really have any favorites to be honest. They all tastes alright. I would not recommend the chicken karaage as the slices of chicken were so thin the ratio of batter to chicken was disappointing -All our dishes came to around $50 which wasn't too bad for korean bbq -Check in for the free macaron ice cream sandwich

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free macaron ice cream w check in
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari and chicken karaage. Would not recommend.
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef toro, filet mignon, korean prime

8wcvz_xeW81kW1k5bhOqxQ.text: Got there early for lunch - ordered the popular Gangnam meal for 2 - diff types of protein.  PROS: variety of salads and apps served first, multiple cuts of meat + shishito peppers, crab wontons were delish. favorite salad was the tofu and the pasta salad.   CONS: not enough servers for lunch on a Sunday, certain requests had to be made twice, low on water refills, staff spread way too thin, bibimbap was not good at all, did not have that crispy layer and there was no fried egg. The NY strip was flavorless.

lvBOh19T0JtKM3OvNhwjBQ.text: Amazing food amazing flavor highly recommend. The quality is extremely good. My favorite is the beef bulgogi bibimbap

ffSkXSycwmQNrUBSo5RScg.text: Best meal I had in Vegas this time around.  Not surprised it was listed first.  I don't expect good Korean in Vegas coming from Toronto.  The Banchan was really good and plentiful.  Barely finished the food.  So much variety and all of it above par.    Meats were of great quality and well marinated.  Oysters were tasty.  Roasted peppers a great addition.  In a city where everything is overpriced for the tourist, this is a deal.

b_bgo0gcT-ha1JC1Zjrcqw.text: Came here for Happy Hour on Tuesday and I loved it! Although you might have to wait, the food was delicious and the service was fabulous. The sides were very fresh and well flavored. Sides only are available for those who order two BBQ items per person but it was so worth it. The meat was tasty and fresh. We particularly liked the Bulgolgi and the brisket was not fat and very yummy. The sauces they give can compliment the meat as well! However for the Spicy Pork, it wasn't needed. The Spicy Pork was marinated with a lot of sauce and wasn't too spicy.  Perfect! Also, draft beers were Half Off!!! I ordered a Sapporo beer for $2.50! That was a treat! Almost forgot to mention that you can get a free ice cream macaroon when you check in on Yelp. It was perfectly sweet for our salted pallet. You only get one but it's nicely sized. When I come back to Vegas, I will definitely be returning to this hidden gem. I would even go during regular priced hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Check in on Yelp for a free ice cream macaroon!

OKZETp98GhRFjAaUezH2WA.text: This place is somehow in my bookmarks list. Someone recommended it to me in case I go to Vegas. We were supposed to go to a buffet at the strip (Caesar's), but the line was too long. Luckily we found this place!   This isn't too far from the strip. It's located in a plaza and there's plenty of parking. We came around 10:40 pm and got seated in less than 10 minutes. We also got our food pretty quick after ordering. It took them 5-10 mins to get the main dishes and a total of  less than 30 mins for everything else. My only complaint is that the booth that we got (located on the right side) was very awkward to sit on for me. I'm a short Asian person. Anyone who's probably 6' and muscular/big build would sit comfortably in this booth. The seat is too far from the table. Other than this, everything is perfect.   We ordered the Gangnam Combo and substituted the Green Salad and Koshitsu Pepper Yuzu for the Broccoli Cheese Fondue and Squash Tempura. The Broccoli is okay, not really mouthwatering. My favorites are the beef toro, Korean prime kalbi, 4 out of 8 of the banchans, Mushroom Medley, and the Oysters!!! The Oysters are definitely one of the best ones I've had.   For dessert, we got the Mango Macaron Ice Cream and Tempura with Green Tea Ice Cream. Both free woot!  Overall, this competes with the Korean BBQ places in LA, but cheaper. Awesome!

1kU4RHNal1X95NmHJi7fzA.text: Love love love this place. I got the premium package (6people) for my family (10) order a few more beef tongue and couldn't finish it all. The portion is huge, even tho they wrote for 6 but if you're not one of those who's in food competition then you would have plenty for 6. From what I recall the package include 4 types of beef, shrimp, scallops, poke, prosciutto, salad and tons of banChan. I love how they gave my niece a chocolate lava cake for her bday as a gift then I checked in a got a free mango macaron icecream which both tasted super delicious. Food and serving wise are both wonderful. Will definitely come back if I visit Vegas next time.

7B5T1DQJAckGUqHwS23ETQ.text: If I could give this place more than 5 stars,  I would!!!   I'm so grateful for Yelp and all of your reviews! Without it, we would never have known of this gem hidden in a little shopping center. We decided to go with one if the dinners for 2 (The Las Vegas) and honestly, we were blown away with the amount of food that was served. Numerous little side dishes typical of Korean dining, but....cream cheese wontons, miso soup, edamame, salad, rice or bibimbap, steamed broccoli with cheese fondue AND 4 plates of meat......for $46.00 ???????????? ARE YOU KIDDING ME? There are so many combinations or a la carte items to choose from and all very reasonable. Plus....if you "check in" on Yelp, you get an ice cream macaroon for free...omg! From the amount if food, to the mouth watering flavors, and fabulous service...this place MUST be on your 'go to' list for dinner. You will not be disappointed!!! We did go on a weekday around 5 pm and it was quiet. Not sure how crowded a weekend would be so might want to prepare & call ahead.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ghNSRvjMZPSsB03VZN6oFQ.text: Absolutely loved it here! We got the Gangnam combo for 2 people, and it was way more food than we could finish. It's like the amount of food you would feed 2 hungry men. The meats were tender and juicy, and the leftovers that we finished later that night tasted just as good, if not better.   The service was excellent. Our food came within a blink of an eye. And the dishes just kept coming and coming. They definitely waste no time on keeping things running, since this place gets super busy.

91L9PU-eXwljlhqC41_p_w.text: I came here with two friends and we were starving. We saw that they had Kobe beef from the window menu and was excited to order that. We went for the Premium Cut package (which included the Kobe beef) but we also tagged on another extra order.   The Premium Cut package features a lot of great dishes such as fresh shucked oysters, beef carpaccio in ponzu sauce, oven baked asparagus, and my personal favorite was the grilled shrimp fried rice in the clay pot (forgot the Korean name). The rice was so good that we ordered another one to share.   The Kobe beef was pricey but well worth it - it practically melted in your mouth when cooked to a medium rare.   The three dipping sauces they give you are nice (one was chili based, another had sesame oil and one was ponzu?) and complemented all the beef cuts really well. Overall it was an amazing BBQ from start to finish. Service was friendly and I will come here again when I'm in town.  PS: The reason why they have so many reviews is because you get a free dessert when you show them your Yelp review - however, I found the dessert to be below average (they are ice cream macarons and looked better than they taste) but that doesn't change how I feel about the awesome BBQ. Skip the dessert :)

b9wQZDydVBxkbOJjuxqWOw.text: I took my baby here for his birthday. We both thoroughly enjoyed it. The meat was very fresh and was more than enough per order. My only complaint is that my side of the grill didn't work well, so I had to use his side to cook my food, which took longer than it needed to. Other than that, the service was good. We love Asian BBQ so I'm happy we came to enjoy lunch here.

Xerty93CdrSIc6xTNZoUWA.text: Great food, great service! Would deff come back if we were local. Our server was quick and helpful.

Bhg33MFPRLMW3awaEm-wcg.text: Very long wait. Food is ok. I don't know what is with all the hype. Maybe because of the wire grill. Price is up there. Service is Nice. Place decor is really cool. Order their #1 combo. The meat was a bit chewy. The mushroom wasn't good. The oyster was good. Don't think I'll be coming back

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p2aZXHBWxD75SkL5M_V41g.text: Great food and experience. Don't wear nice clothes though, you will smell like food when you leave.

86Y-pA0WIcweHeqq6Eqr5g.text: I had high expectations due to yelp reviews, but wasn't impressed, as I've had better in Duluth, GA. We came in during a slow Friday afternoon and ordered individual items of assorted marinated meats of pork belly and galbi, and the bacon wrapped enoki (a new found love for enoki mushrooms). In my opinion, the meat portions were too small for the price you pay. I believe they were ranging $8-10 per plate with about 4-6 pieces of meats. The flavors were pretty decent, but the meat quality just wasn't there. The meat did not taste fresh, but rather like it's been a good few days (3-5) since it was fresh. The bacon wrapped enoki was delicious but was very hard to cook without everything falling apart because you have to rotate it to cook the bacon. We did end up getting rice, which is charged for (~$2 per bowl), unlike other kbbq places that provide them at no charge when requested. The banchan was meh, as I thought the options didn't complement the meal well. For desserts, my SO and I checked in on yelp for a free macaroon ice cream. We had green tea and mango. Both were decent, but we liked the mango better. In general, the macaroon seemed stale, but it was free so we can't complain.   Overall, I'd tell you to lower your expectations and you might just really really enjoy your meal!

5iq3mvqmrU2q2qaom3vOXg.text: A hidden gem off the strip.  Had to wait a bit for a party of 10 but well worth it since we got the private room in the back.  The group menus have all you need for a great meal.  Meats are prime cuts and well seasoned.  Sides were plentiful.  Good alcohol selection.  Macaroons are a MUST.  The green tea and mango macaroons are a perfect ending to a great dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
