Lp6x80rJrmBQr4hvXUE3zA.text: I think that this diner is more for couples, and even though I speak/read/write Korean, as an American, I see it as quite cozy. The Mundo was good, and only three pieces is not a lot, it was good. The beer however is priced way too high. I might go back with a friend, but must wait for a paycheck.

bSgk7H09xuf4xd3NHI3Ukg.text: Five stars for the seasoning of the meat! Also, the service and the environment are just great as the food!

x3nq1nle1ba5IcmGPxNw7g.text: This place had a really nice atmosphere and was packed with people even at 9pm. We ordered the gangnam set for 2 and it was a lot of food ! Delicious and really quick service :)

Y4_1-uToO-brWv95XFNVGQ.text: This is my first time eating Korean BBQ and I must say that I am incredibly impressed.  The food is well-priced, neither too expensive nor too cheap and the food is absolutely fantastic. I went here with a large pack: my family and friends, and despite the big party, the waiters and waitresses were attentive, helpful, and kind.  The meat is savory and delicious and tastes perfectly fine even without the seasoning that they give you.  One slight con is that they do not give out rice and that you will have it pay for it separately, but it is a slight disadvantage when compared to the quality of food you will get.  I can definitely say that I am more than satisfied and will come back whenever I visit Vegas again!

rqUv4Zn985IU_a9yJ5IiuA.text: Food was great, and there was a ton of it. Went with a picky eater and three foodies, everyone left happy! Great meats, beef carpaccio was a huge hit - will totally go again.

UjbUmPMWHirZZ_iaiZ2lFg.text: Second time dining and once again blew my mind! Love the bulgogi and garlic edamame! Price is spectacular during happy hour and great customer service! Good vibes all around, love this place

_uHGVWTxq9sAfD2oWgtFRA.text: Right at the E Harman entrance of UNLV at the corner of a strip mall is this hidden gem.  Nice interior and chic decor.  Ordered the Las Vegas (of course) and added beef brisket and bacon wrapped salmon.  If everything is fresh and With u cooking ur own food, how can u go wrong?  Nice variety of ingredients and apps.

Fn7kKJ5PkLpslHHPGoU-6Q.text: Glad to have some good korean/asian bbq near the strip. Quality of meats are good (had the korean kalbi and pork belly).   Quality of Banchan was good as well.

6TZXqYn75Jy-rJ8YYjUkHA.text: Reminds me of one restaurant back home in Cupertino. It is similiar and very tasty. I definitely recommend. (-:

FuWT0DTbIoApXTkVwkgm-Q.text: Food was great , fast service. I live in the Bay Area but next time I'm going here to eat. I recommend eating here. But one server forgot my spoon but it's okay. Food was great so I'm happy.

lrCocWwUp5HLrAzoSCbkyA.text: I love. Gang am. Just had the las vegas table bbq. Excellent quality and flavor.  The servers are very friendly. And I love the bibimap

pkExlHTPPtpAMGRo-O1p9g.text: I love the atmosphere here. The place looks clean too. I like the food, but I definitely had better meat.

tFVp8zLgU4moGi5l7YBRzg.text: Tired of spending excessive amounts of money eating in Las Vegas? Well you have found a goldmine in this place. We came for the happy hour and we definitely left happy and full. The food is delicious, reasonably priced, and varied. We definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Las Vegas and need a break from the strip.

WyRtUaixZO1O0WkhVJXcVw.text: I really like the atmosphere of this restaurant. The waiter was super friendly and grilled the meat to perfection. Unlike other korean BBQ restaurants where you suffocate from the excessive smoke, the ventilation in this restaurant is top-notch.

XQwMv3dJp0mGiwpqJ_agAQ.text: The food here is really good for its price, and the atmosphere is pleasant. Went with a group of 5 and had plenty of food to share with everyone. Everyone has their own pair of tongs, so cooking and serving comes by fast. Y'all know how long it takes to pass around food with KBBQ... But this went by very smoothly. Really recommend getting the combo deals if you go!

0aQLrwTtGKYPKsaL5ga0hQ.text: Best Korean BBQ in Vegas hands down! Had the  best seller Gangnam family platter.   It says it's good for 2 people but good enough for a family of four

jBvNLtu4XrTYl6q1hGAB-w.text: Very good food! Great service! Good meat quality! Recommend the sea weed salad. Enjoyed the pork belly very much. Can't go wrong with this place!

CEzZI0NR6K5uBpKJRbadZA.text: Service was quick and very friendly. Accommodated our group when we had too many people for their back room. Food was delicious!

Xj7aJLqF9zyLX-R-gjjDVQ.text: Really tasty and fun.  Cook yourself,  very reasonably priced and a bunch of authentic Korean side dishes.

SpiLScitZkuaahyQ56XBWQ.text: The food was decent.  Can't beat the price!!! Will go back when in town for sure

JIWfmS2WDEaHJTjGaHLNiw.text: For my second time here, I am significantly more full than the first time I came here.  The food was delicious and the meat was well prepared to be grilled.  I also ordered the ramen, and the noodles were made to perfection.  I only wish that there were more vegetarian options available.

YYxIVhCFMJwsfsx58UMJsw.text: Ordered Harami Miso, Korean Prime Kalbi, Bulgogi, and Spicy Chicken with lemon sauce. The Kalbi was my favorite.   Service is a tad slow and frustrating because there are only 4 tables being waited on.   Restaurant's ambiance is lovely.

mFjJ4g_yxqLPlWWWk9n9wA.text: I liked the suggestions. I chose the best seller. It was really good. Staffs were kind. When we wanted something, they quickly came and served us

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SWDywcfuER4L090GdX1lIA.text: I can't say anything bad about this place. Went here two days in a row for their lunch special it was so good. Their Bulgogi is marinated perfectly. The staff is so friendly, make you feel welcome and that they appreciate your business. The number of great reviews on here is completely justified

HHtYoctYsBqDUcVgMjscOg.text: So...i have been here several times over the past few years. I come twice a year during my trade shows.  I love Korean food, and I consider myself a self proclaimed Korean food snob. This place is good, really good. Yes, the food is delicious and the prices are beyond fair. But what makes this place so good is the service. Always quick, very attentive, very courteous and very helpful.  Bravo to the owner who understands that customer service is key the success of any business. Also, I am not Korean and I am usually one of a few Caucasians in the restaurant when I am here. It is usually filled with young Asians...which tells me it is authentic food and reasonably priced, assuming the younger generation doesn't yet have oodles of money to spend on dining out. You won't go wrong here...promise.

2BLLfWeYz0Utpc6rLGbkiA.text: Been coming to gangnam for a few months now. Have had a great experience every time so I thought id leave a review. The meats are amazing and the vegetables are tasty too. It doesn't take a lot of money to get filled up so don't worry that's its not a all you can eat restaurant. My favorite is mixing the white rice with the egg custard and putting a little kimchi on top before I add my meat on yop. Also don't forget to check in so you get your free ice cream. The best flavor is vanilla. Trust me

Sd8cw0onJ7jtLdRtmZo5bA.text: Pros:    Easy parking    Good service    Usually no wait    Soju beer and wine    Good meats    Nice smaller portion plates and lesser prices    Nice ventilation  Cons:    None

zOBPpnMZiGfEPVFAeyfRgA.text: I love a good Korean BBQ, you really never know when you will find good quality food, This wasn't bad but it wasn't great, it was average. The prices were not ridiculous like many other all you can eat Korean BBQ are. The sides were good, the meats were tender but a little in the flavorless side. Clean establishment and good enough  service! We order the meat lover special! It had 5 kind of meats, salad, miso soup, rice and the spicy steam dumpling. In the other side we did enjoy dessert, good ice cream macaroon.

d6aWGjLGDY_FN4CJX64Mmg.text: This is my first time here with my family and it has been nothing but an amazing experience! The servers here are so sweet and courteous! They have such great deals here, we ate the MEAT LOVERS meal which was around $99 for four people and it was a great deal! There were four of us and we couldn't even finish the plates of meat that were provided! We also ordered the Bulgogi Bibimbap and it was delicious! I can't wait to visit again when I'm back in Vegas! ^_____^

197IehDEbW24U3njIBeomA.text: Wow, lots of great food and fun!  Came here after reading other reviews and checking out other restaurants near by our hotel.  We couldn't have chosen better!

5Bub19fe-IoiV3vNWiYcFQ.text: We went to this place for a dinner at Thanksgiving time. The environment is nice and the food is very tasty, the waiters and waitresses are super friendly. My kids loves the ice-cream cookies. I would definitely visit it next time when I go to LV.

KGlHO4peitCbZh2S9zs2Uw.text: Food was very delicious!!! Won't be disappointed...100% satisfied!!! Best Korean Bqq ever!!

aO-I6EC81Wq9IGGaFge4yA.text: One of the best Korean BBQ places I have ever been. The meat is delightfully delicious and chewy. When I entered the restaurant, the smell of BBQ was amazing. Side dishes are really well and tastefully prepared and staffs are very kind. I highly recommend this place if you are visiting Las Vegas. I also strongly recommend to go for Kangnam set menu - delicious dinner at affordable price!

iy8tpVewjePdy6YP7k8RGA.text: Stopped by here for our last meal before leaving Vegas, awesome Korean Bbq with a large variety of meats.

PGx5vMaXF7T6WfCKIu2BlA.text: We went there for dinner and we loved it!  The decor inside is simple yet very modern and chic. The server greeted us very professionally with several recommendations.  Overall the food tasted very good.  The meat was such a prime cut. It was very tender and juicy which is incomparable with AYCE restaurant. Besides the meat I liked Salmon Carpaccio and Bibimbap.  We will definitely return if we have another chance to visit Las Vegas. I wish this kind of restaurant in my town(upstate NY).

hSeM06K4XxPFrm39HhN-Dw.text: Came with 8 people and we had the meatlovers combo to share. it was fabulous. the service was great as well. we asked for some extra sauces (ask for sesame oil and salt if you feel the meat doesn't have much flavor, it really adds a nice touch) and lettuce wraps and they were delivered no problem and no extra charge. this is a must go restaurant in Las Vegas.

R29q6xtefJ0p5YGtWmn9hQ.text: Very excellent value!  We ordered the gangnam set for two people and the three of us could not finish. But better yet the six marinated meats inclusion filet mignonette and prime were especially excellent. Comes with bibimbap topped with bulgogie.   Only little thing was some of the marinade and bibimbap were a little in the sweet side.   Also excellent service:)

NYh_CIRIXrwmjRGcBpUsAg.text: Good food for great price. Atmosphere is very modern and not loud as one would expect for a bbq at the table.. would eat here again.

oGkd1naIjHZ4C5gU5GUQ8g.text: When we came the line is not long at all. There is only one group of ppl in front of us. We wait 30min. Maybe because they have too little tables.. And then finally we got table. When we follow the waiter walking to the table. He didn't let us sit down. We saw there are ppl chatting and standing right next to the table. But our waiter didn't say excuse me or anything. So I guess is that his boss?? And then the waiter just asked us to wait. And then he left. We were like standing middle of the restaurant don't know what the hack is going on... After a while, nobody is going to do anything for us. We asked the chatting ppl by ourselves if so we can sit. And then the order was fine. When the food come, the waitress needs to mix the food. And food jump out of the bowl right on my purse. I saw she saw it, but she did not say a word.. I am not sure how service here should be. I'm not quiet happy with it.  For the food, it is just so so. I guess because I had too many good food in LA. Here doesn't taste like Asian food for me at all. But if ppl love American Asian food. Then here is the right place. Probably not coming back here.

QZUYe0BQtIYaFmdoTt9W5Q.text: Now I know why so many people have come here. Although if I have to give a fair review I would say that with this many reviews, they could upgrade their cable service to HD. Other than that, servers had a great attitude and food was on point!

BAwmz8tu2KSJ_tUkv5lMoQ.text: First legit Korean BBQ I've been to and it was great! Great staff. Great food. Great atmosphere. We ordered the meat lover for 6. There are 7 of us and we were all very full.

lihZtn5QQO7pdyMAUElyyQ.text: First off I don't like how they make you write a review in exchange for free dessert. This will prob. explain the 4000+ reviews! I feel like its totally unethical, and defeats the purpose of yelp. Anyway, me and a bunch of my friends got the Meat Lovers option and it was really good--my favorite I believe was the Beef Toro and some of the marinated meats. Filet Mignon was a little tough prob. because of how its grilled. Lettuce salad wasn't that great, but I did enjoy the seaweed salad. And the dessert which was a ice cream macroon (mango flavored) was delicious--reminded me of the one's at Trader Joes which I do like. Main bad thing was the location--you have to drive to this location so it's not convenient unless you have a car. Overall, if your craving kkbbq in Vegas-check this place out.

2q_8Fb2ZON-685LcB9kIuQ.text: When the wife wanted to come here for dinner, I was a little hesitant. After all, we're from LA right?   Well needless to say, she was right about Gangnam. The meat selection was perfect and not having to overeat because it was an AYCE was a plus.

13XeLDiD6jbD620Dvyp4eA.text: Definitely worth your time going off strip. We came for a late dinner and their happy hour menu was off the charts. We were able to get pork belly, bulgogi and beef toro for $4 each (amazing!) Drinks were also 50% off which was fantastic. From the happy hour menu, we also ordered all the veggies (broccoli, corn, mushroom medley were all $2, seaweed salad was $3) in an attempt to be healthy. Off the happy hour menu, we ordered beef tongue, skirt steak and kalbi. We also ordered peppers, ramen and bibim ngan myung. Lots of side dishes, really good bang for your buck!

Would order every time: Unmarinaded Kalbi-so tender and fatty, almost melts in your mouth Beef Tongue-served with a lemon dipping sauce that really completes the dish  King Oyster Mushroom-I love mushrooms, so this was a must for me  Would order again: Marinated Kalbi-seasoned very well, beef is tender (I like the unmarinaded better just because you can the taste of their high quality beef isn't masked by the marinade) Pork Belly-fairly standard K BBQ pork belly  Would skip: Filet mignon: meat quality was just not that great Macaroni banchan: this one we didn't order, just came with a bunch of other side dishes, but it was a really nasty macaroni salad that tasted like it was slathered in butter

Xoin_Iiq7tpqsmwFtUQZ-Q.text: Okay guys, discard my last review. Since that REVIEW WAS FAKE just for some free dessert and so is everyone else review that is to here. I had to delete it because it was so unTrue about this place.  This place sucks balls. I'm not comparing it to LA at all. They charge for sesame oil and salt and salad? $4.75 for a steamed egg? You got to be kidding me. Plus they're portions are so small and expensive, I couldn't even get full! Oh and rice was $2 for a small bowl...  So literally each place of meat only has 6 small pieces for $9. So we pretty much ordered everything in the meat section and some bacon wrapped scallops snd salmon. Those were honestly okay.   We decided to try something new by getting cheese fondue with broccoli. BIG MISTAKE. It was literally Kraft single cheese with oil? pg3gi4v-zP1A602VnIuLnw.text: Great taste and good value! My parents visited Korea before and said the food there, especially the cold noodle is authentic and delicious. We waited for 40 minutes for dinner and went again for a late lunch the very next day (that's how much my parents love this place)!  Service is good; they also have a good variety of food and drinks. The only downside is that it doesn't have any two tops, which I believe causes some extra wait time... Changing the table mix (if possible) might help both the customers and the restaurant.

MHRJ9s5h1d4pkkEXEkv08A.text: The reviews are True- best place! Great service, fast, and fantastic quality food.  We did the #1 best seller and the meat was so good. We will come back when we visit again. I will for sure recommend this place to others.  The sides were good- all kinds of flavors for everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat!

LhyRLYrDc9uzSIGS5cytEw.text: Perfect place for kbbq (and happy hour) after work near UNLV! Been here twice and the service and food is great. Recommended it to my coworkers. Definitely must try!

WPMku3arhRKrpIzDT6aoPQ.text: This Korean barbecue spot is a good place to satisfy carniverous cravings, if you can find parking. On weekends their lot can get pretty busy but, the hunt for a parking spot is worth it once you start grilling. My favorite item is the spicy pork. Leave it on the grill to get it extra crispy. Those charred edges give it a wonderfully crunchy texture to go with a moderately spicy profile. The prime kalbi was my second favorite. I loved the sweetness of the marinade that paired nicely with the natural savoriness of the marbled meat. Other items tried included tender chunks of filet, four decent sized garlic shrimp, and assorted vegetables (corn, mushrooms, peppers, onions, zucchini, and more). Portions run a little small, so it's best to order two or three items per person.  With a clean, intimate, dark interior it's great for casual date nights or just hanging out with friends or family. Tables are spaced rather far apart giving all plenty of privacy.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp garlic ($6.95)
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. banchan

cg5XAjdvHdlnUSJU-VBrhQ.text: Whenever I'm in a big enough city, I start craving Korean food.  The GF had heard from some other folks that we should go to Sura, which we had gone to a few weeks earlier.  Sura was fine, but not good/great.  I had flown into Vegas, and per a mutual agreement, had not made any special Valentine's Day plans.  We ended up here for dinner, and there were probably 3 or 4 open tables.  We were quickly seated in the modern looking space.  The menu was interesting - they had the standard combo items, where you get a mix of meat and sides, but apparently when we were there it was happy hour, and they had items that were priced in the $3 to $8 so that you'd order a serving of beef toro, spicy pork, sides, etc  - almost felt like a tapas place, though obviously meat heavy.  Quality of the meat seemed a little better than Sura.  We were a little surprised that the kalbi/short-ribs had the bones removed, but that was fine.  All the meat and sides we had were good, and the gas grill worked fine.  I was also glad to see that they had spicy cucumber as a side, which is one of my favorite forms of kimchi.  The small plate style of ordering probably kept us from over-eating as much as an AYCE joint, but I was feeling nearly as full.  The one miss we had was that we had ordered white rice, but it didn't come out till we were almost done (which had included a second round of ordering).  I had asked about it earlier to one of the staff, and they nodded, and wandered away like they were on it, but didn't bring out any rice.  My guess is that they had gotten slammed at some point, and ran out of rice, so they had to make more, but that's only a guess.  No one said anything, and when they did bring out the rice near the end of the meal.  Overall, our damage with tip was an even $50, which was considerably less than the $72 we had spent at Sura, and I left feeling more satisfied with my meal.

7wGNiPmQjUyll1eAalZ70w.text: This place was soooooooooo delicious. Service was a bit lacking towards end of our meal so only reason why they don't get 5 stars. It gets busy so go early or expect a wait. Totally worth it. I can't stop talking about this place,  I would absolutely go again and would recommend it to anyone.

etviybuZx8nomeJtPM6Jxw.text: It was late and all of the good restaurants in our casino was closed.  We looked on Yelp and GangNam came highly rated and was open late.  There wasn't any wait and we were seated immediately.  The server as nice and friendly.  We order the GangNam #1 for 2.  The small sides were good.  I enjoyed the pickled cucumbers and the daikon.  We had 5 meats.  All of them were good.  The Bulgogi was a little too salty, but still decent.  The only downside was that they didn't change our grill.  Overall though, considering the cost, the quality of meat, and the amount of food you get, this is a solid recommendation if you are looking for korean bbq in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sides
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat and corn on the grill

-xAccnkVFrC8q9wPhU2iAg.text: I am so happy this gem is not on the strip, could you imagine how over priced it would be? Came here on a Saturday night for a 7PM dinner, and the place was dead. But that was okay because my party had an entire back room to ourselves.  The service was stellar, and i'm sure most readers understand the premise of the place. You get a lot of pre-marinated meats/veggies/etc brought out to you and you cook it yourself on the mini-grill. It's so easy a 7 year old could do it (or my older brother who hardly gets credit for cracking an egg).  I recommend you get one of the pre-designed samplers. We opted for The paradise A  and we got more than enough food for two.  The Harami Miso, prime kalbi, and calimari were all yummy.  I would recommend this to anyone who is staying in Las Vegas. It is located right across the street from the Hard Rock Casino, but worth the cab ride if you are staying on the strip and to lazy to walk.

mCE92UZ-MIaFY1BSVAPIDw.text: Amazing Food and even more amazing staff!!!! They've got a Great happy hour as well!!! Highly recommended!!! Best Korean I've ever had!

nvQFbPKiH-rrnN-epYyPkg.text: This is really good: very good good and service. Price is reasonable. The pitcher of beer is very large and very full. Anyway, strongly recommend to one who likes meat and drink. We catches happy hour deal, so the drink becomes very attractive in terms of price.

UHgF-v0Pwww163INv9kLGA.text: Friendly staffs, nice interior, good atmosphere but not the best bang for a buck. Decent place though.   P.S. Steamed Kalbi is waaaaaaay tooooo salty and sweet.. Ask them if they could make it any less sodium and sweetness.

bISXpQKez6yYc2Mwe6G78A.text: Great food, nice service. Best Korean bbq at Vegas. There is waiting line so you have to get there early

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Full
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So full

CiILKrW8Zz9FuvuFkp0WyQ.text: tl;dr--Recommended, though maybe without the full throated cheering from some of our fellow Yelpers.  We stopped by while working out way down the Strip due to the high praise from fellow Yelpers. On Christmas Eve, they weren't offering their usual (less expensive lunch menu) but hats off to the hardworking crew for working over the holidays. It's a mile or so east of Planet Hollywood so plan to drive or Lyft over unless you need the exercise.  The restaurant was basically full at 2:30 in the afternoon, which we took as a good omen. The banchan (free appetizers) came out even before we ordered and included a macaroni salad alongside the more typical kim chi, pickled spiced cucumbers, bean sprout salad, pickled radish and fish cake. The bean sprouts could have used a touch more seasoning but were otherwise fine.  The meats were well seasoned, so much so that we didn't much miss the traditional dipping sauces. We ordered a bibimbop that came in the traditional stone bowl but was not hot enough rice to crisp the rice. The bulgogi that came with the bibimbop was excellent but the only other sides were hints of red peppers and onions: order only as a side to accompany your BBQ and not as a meal.  The grill and exhaust hood were carefully maintained: gleaming metal shiny clean. Bathrooms were clean as well.  Service is typical for Asian restaurants: workmanlike but not particularly friendly. A bit slow but chalk that up to the steady stream of diners.  The kids gave it a 4 so we will round up from 3 or 3.5.  Disclosure: we were offered a free dessert for this review. Ice cream macaroons were delicious!

6ZZ_xuv9WB7zzzJ_0At0rw.text: A really cool, modern, comfortable BBQ Place!  I would give this place a 5 star, if their banchan selection was more extensive.  However, for the location, the food and the service, I will definitely be coming to this place, again and again...  A.  Location - Harmon, Swenson, Paradise.  There is a small strip mall there that has plenty of food choices and this location is perfect for so many.  Right across from Hard Rock....  B.  The Service - extremely efficient and pleasant. I came here for lunch and while it was not terribly busy, the server was just right in being very efficient, always there when you wanted her, very nice and top notch.  C.  The Menu - Loved the menu.  The cuts here are smaller in size and also more reasonable in portion and pricing. You can order a huge variety of different meats, seafood and veggies all ranging in prices form 3.00 to 12.00 per plate.  I loved the mix and match. IF I brought my glasses and had more time, I would have done this.  Instead, I turned over the menu to the combo page and pre-ordered one of the combos to make it easier for me.  D.  The Food-   a.  Miso Soup - OK, so we are in a Korean restaurant and they serve Miso soup. I find that odd, and at same time I really cannot complain since it was tasty.  However, when I am eating BBQ, I like the real basic soup that is plain and simple.  b.  The meats -   Chicken Tender Cheese Fondue -   OK, I am not a huge non traditional foodie, but man, this was really cool and tasty.  Bulgogi - Wow was that really fast and the sauce was PERFECT.  Filet Mignon - So tender and juicy...  Shrimp Garlic - Would have preferred Shrimp PRAWN, but these tiny morsels were okay.  Harami Miso - Man was this steak just right. Never had it before and I really enjoyed it.  Assorted Veggies - Cool. Normal stuff. but those corn on the cob were awesome.  c.The appetizers - Again, miso soup, rice, salad and some kind of cream cheese wonton thing.  Different, okay. I prefer banchan.  E.  Come back factor - This is one cool place, the food is good, the portions are manageable so you can try different things for sure.  For business lunch, hanging out, this is a really nice restaurant and I do plan to come back.  If I am focused only on the bbq, I may try Tofu Hut or other places DJK, but I really enjoyed this Gangnam BBQ.  GK says, check it out.

Vui9SIR2ZECZ2tse9s96pg.text: I love the quality of meat, you know its not for the all you can eat korean bbq grill meat quality. I just wish they had combos.

j-3MTT-oOm0E904CNTpY5A.text: I love Kobe beef and I rate theirs an 8/10 scale.  The Kobe Ssam was exceptional as well as the Uni Bibimbap!  Highly recommended...

For 4people,  1toddler and a baby? And cooked our own food?...when it was really really bad service! We couldn't find anybody to help us. Never ever coming back here again or will recommend this place!

9-FFO67NS2ajUY5hPjzODg.text: Very close to the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, so it's good for students that are craving for Korean barbecue. But the price is kind of expensive for the amount of meat given. The servers don't really check up on your table so you have to go chasing for the servers to get what you want. Also, when I ordered the fried calamari, you can't really taste or feel the calamari inside. It's more of batter than the squid itself. Lastly, I'm more on the shorter side, so the chairs were kind of too far so I kept having to move forward to reach the table. Since the service we received was not good, we did not leave a tip so while we were waiting for our uber, one of the servers, came outside and asked if service was bad, and we responded by saying "it was alright" and he was like "I was just asking because you guys didn't leave a tip". How rude of him to chase us for a tip when service was bad. NEVER COMING HERE AGAIN.

MMqW0j7LDrVj8ZABBEx9Vw.text: We were looking for Korean BBQ when we found this place. We almost walked out because we didn't understand the menu. We are so glad we didn't. I lived in Honolulu for many years and have had lots of good Korean food but I've got to tell you this food was a step above. If your in or around Vegas stop by, talk to Patrick the owner/chef and tell him you want good Korean food. You won't be disappointed

BE_acKTTb3bILd56lG0ztA.text: We ordered the Gangnam Style for 6 people. Plenty of food (fed 8 people) and we also order extra appetizers on the side. Everything we had was pretty good. The spicy tuna kimbap is highly recommended. Chicken wings were tiny (size of my fingers) but overall I would recommend this place.

mcAX6fJw0Ca5x47h1e-5xw.text: I had been wanting to have Korean BBQ for quite some time as I love watching Korean movies and shows on Netflix. I had often seen the characters eating this and I had not had it in probably 10 years...so after looking at the positive reviews I thought it best to give it a go. They set you up with a package of you desire, some have premium meats (juicer more expensive cuts I.e filet mignon) and others have a mix of regular cuts and maybe one premium meat. We chose the latter. Boy was it delicious. The meats were well seasoned and the grill was hot and cooked the meats quickly. The ponchon (the sides...forgive me if I spelled it wrong) were all excellent. I loved the dried squid in particular and the seaweed salad.  I ate my full but felt healthy afterwards and for Checking In they gave us a free macaroon ice cream sandwich...and they were delicious! When I go back to Vegas I am heading straight there.

AXVXTjO2ig5pFS9ojx-vbg.text: This location is really convenient if you're done with class and want to settle for some good food and cheap beers. This is also located near the Kiss mini putt putt if you're trying to take someone on a cheap date.   I definitely receive my money's worth here, especially for it being a non AYCE Korean BBQ restaurant. The service is fast and friendly. The food is consistently delicious and you really can't beat the happy hour deals. I actually spent less money here for two people than if we were to go to any other AYCE. The pork belly and bulgolgi are really tender and even with a slight char from the grill, they never got overcooked.

v70Om9tc3QviIS1pZExsHg.text: I am all about the Gangnam style at this delicious restaurant.  Why spend your money on some terrible buffet in Vegas that you will probably be regretting the next day?  Do yourself a favor....venture off the strip and have yourself a feast of grilled meats, fresh veggies and refreshing adult beverages.  Refuel and power up for your evening. You are gonna need the strength.  We timed our visit for the happy hour specials and spent a nice afternoon sampling so many tasty dishes.  It was not crowded at all at 3pm on a Saturday.  Plenty of parking in the lot outside.  Check in on Yelp for a free macaroon ice cream sandwich for dessert!!

Soju  Food was delicious and service was great and attentive and food came out in a timely manner..considering the price the portions were good...Would definitely come back next time we're in Vegas! -6RssbizEMAmcJ1PBZzGew.text: Great food! Great prices! Great service! One of the beat Korean BBQ places that I've been to.

BPp2j1FE0QaYu_QvoPBRvw.text: Perfect stop on the way to a red eye flight. Clean, good food.  Orginal korean BBQ with grills on the table.  Good selection.

LfnRKUrD3riCkE6Z-FaVOQ.text: I happen to be in vegas for a very large convention, and part of the enjoyment in my job is traveling city to city and trying the different restaurants available near my hotel.  After a very long day of setting up a new show I was starving!  I head back to my hotel at the Las Vegas Westgate, and first things first, I really needed to get out of my work clothes shower and just chill for a minute.  My co worker and myself ar both sitting in our hotel room, catching the end of the sunday night football game, smoking marijuana, and discussing what we want to eat.  We decide we are both craving asian (both food and women) and come accross Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining as a close and affordable option not too far from our hotel.  My co- worker and I are still just smoking weed and now were wrapped up in the NFL game (the giants were playing the niners and I have Carlos Hyde on my fantasy team and he got a late TD to make my lead pretty solid heading into MNF) and now its getting late.  We check the hours and are both pleased to see that Gangnam is open untill 1 am, and to top it off they have a late night happy hour starting at 10 pm.  "This is perfect!" Chris, My co-worker, says.  He continues, "We have time to smoke more pot, sit down and just be high for 5 minutes then realize we have to get going."  I thought to myself, "yes this is perfect by the time we get there the munchies should be fully kicking in, and I will have a nice hearty appetite for my meal."  Chris and I show up, looking fresh in our Hawaiian shirts ready to eat.  Our waitress sits us down and immediately recognizes our sweet shirts and asks us if we are from Hawaii.  We tell her "no" although chris is a quarter Hawaiian but we explain to her we are from California and are just visiting for the week.  She then explains to us that she is hawaiian and she just returned from visitng just a couple days prior. Anyways, conversation ensued, our waitress (she was like a solid 7) points out to us some of here favorite things on the menu.  I procede to order appetizers of their Calimari and the spicy tuna Kimbap.  Remember we are now incredibly stoned and I think this would of tasted great sober.  This tuna kimbap appetizer was absolutely fantastic, I highly reccomend!  So now we move on to the entrees.  I order the bacon wrapped scollaps, the Korean Chicken Fondue, and the Prime Kalbi.  My co-worker had also order the the Korean chicken and the kalbi, but his for his third dish he ordered the Harami Miso. Now I loved all tree things I ordered.  I enjoyed the mix i made myself with one beef dish, 1 chicken dish, and 1 seafood dish.  The chicken cheese fondue stood out as my favorite, while chris pointed to the Harami Miso as his favorite.  My only somewhat negative comment would be that the Prime Kalbi cuts I recieved seem to be a little to fatty for my liking making the meat really chewy. We washed our meals down with a pitcher of kirin.  Now after we finished with our meat cuts, it was time to move on to dessert.  I got the cofee flavored Ice cream sandwhich thing, and it was very tasty and was a nice cold snack to end the meal on.    After dinner chris and I went back to our room to smoke more marijuana and stream Archer on netflix.  TL;DR: Got way too high off gravity bong rips in my hotel. Headed to gangnam and ate a lot of korean bbq. Got a free dessert for writing a review on yelp.

ddVPD_aIcJprQ_NZ3tTwfA.text: Wow. Absolutely amazing. We travel often and have never had such a perfect meal of authentic Korean BBQ. The flavors were all bold and fantastic, service was exceptional. I can wait to come back next time I'm in Vegas.

DMdNOWyUEHW-h-VGT1Vluw.text: Food is great! Wait can be a little long if you have a big party (5+) because the building is small so it's best to call ahead. Learned the hard way :/ but overall good experience and ambiance.

Pecpr_2vTn0_efiwkq1M_g.text: The waiters are very nice.  Happy hour is awesome. We do enjoy dining here. We have a party of 8 ppl.

hj0RK9ayhmSnJfM3L7z0qQ.text: Wow, this place has many exciting offerings.  We tried several things on this trip and some were standouts.  The Dynamite shrimp and Spicy tuna kimbap were our favorite appetizers. Spicy garlic edamame was also good. Our favorite proteins were Harami Miso and Korean Prime Kalbi. Calamari garlic was just ok, not very garlicky.  Broccoli was good, but the cheese fondue was hopelessly separated(tasty though).  To finish it off the Banana tempura was fantastic, choose the green tea ice cream with it. Probably our favorite dessert of our vacation , and it was free for writing this review at the table. The meal came with several welcome extra tastes like Kim chee, sprouted beans etc. We would love to return.

QVBlFlAIiPZij5YAI9euiA.text: Japanese style BBQ but I enjoyed they serve free Kimchee that taste was great.

The plate portions are a generous quarter-pound, and the variety is great; but best of all was the quality of the meats.  We tried seven or eight different cuts, and they all ranged from good to excellent.  The service was prompt and courteous.  So overall we really liked this place snd will definitely be back.  Oh, and they had macaron ice cream!

Quality of the meat was excellent, food tasted great good options and nice setting. I would of have loved more authentic side dishes brought out but that's about the only thing that kept me from giving it a 5 star;)

fUc87GA8iNizja9XhQ6gyg.text: Was greeted right away upon entering. Seated within 5 minutes on a friday night. Ordered from the happy hour menu. Prices were decent and bill came to 50$ for two people which is reasonable given the amount of food we ordered. Food also came very quickly and was able to get refill on the side dishes. Overall great experience and food. Would def come back again!

Yuxzy2Mo3PUfvqxrWZIPcA.text: Cons: Been here yesterday and today and both times it was 1.5-2 hour wait. Yesterday we ended up leaving and eating else where since we were starving and we were 33 on the wait list :(  Agree with another poster that the meat can be more fresh. Oysters not all fresh either. Pros: excellent service and food was good. Overall will come back again probably during happy hour when the wait isn't crazy long :)

59hazGuFK4Fe-toy8yj_GQ.text: Everything was excellent. I got the Filet Minion, Garlic Shrimp, Fried Calamari, and everything was cooked perfectly, and tasted clean. There were 7 small traditional sides included and I liked a few, I don't like spicy things but they had a variety of options for me.

r8naMDdwYmPcVlQop7kKHQ.text: This is a great place to step away from the LV strip.  Our party of 3 was able to beat the dinner rush, we arrived about 5:45pm.  The service was spot on and our glasses were never empty and any request was addressed right away.  The food quality and taste was great.  I personally thought the quantity was not bad at all too.  Some may believe that this place is overpriced, but I have been to many Korean restaurants, and this is not the case.  I would come back again.

KxUNarTekcsgU2DGwdhcPA.text: This is the first place my husband and I tried upon arriving at Las Vegas and it was . We ordered the Gangnam combo for 2 and it was definitely more than enough food: side dishes, oysters, corn, salad, two miso soups, bibimbop and 5 types of meat. Everything was very good! We checked in on Yelp and got some free macaron ice cream sandwich. We got the green tea one and that was yummy too (but nothing spectacular). We would definitely recommend this place!

2c70diSm-mjjPHeIGPnDZQ.text: Meat was really good and tender. Definitely worth your money. Macaron ice cream that came with check in had a range of flavours and tasted good.

HILqvRk47R5x62Lwe20Bcw.text: Ate here during happy hour. It was so so so good! Their specials are amazing too. We were staying across the street at hard rock, which was really convenient to just walk over. The meats were all delicious, loved the cream cheese wontons, and the dessert was perfect ending. Will be coming back when we're in Vegas next!

-Nsb1kCIHneCEOWKZ3Ds_Q.text: I really like this place for their prime cuts. Everything was just so good from the food to the service. Its worth going a little off the strip for food this good. It's not all you can eat but the portions given is plenty. We ordered the prime selection for a group of 6 guys and barely finished everything. Gangnam Asian BBQ is a must.

vWH9Ybz2ecCBmriO7xw9zQ.text: This place was recommended by our first Uber driver in Las Vegas. We stopped her to eat after getting tattoos in the area. We are so glad the driver recommended this eatery as we would not have stopped here on our own. We had the premium meal for two and the meat choices were amazing. This was our first Korean BBQ experience and the wait staff walked us through the whole process. They cooked our meat for us and told us when to pull it off the grill. The sides were out immediately and they were amazing. The entire meal was great and the experience as fantastic. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great meal and great experience.

Yn3brUiTE36vUv9dqg2N7g.text: Pro: food is great and price is great Con: terrible service, took them forever to ask what i wanted to drink and appetizer , then i waited about 20-30mins till they asked if i wanted food. They didnt ask if i want another drink after i finished my first and then i asked for another drink and they also gave me my check andsaid i had to pay cause they were closing or something to get ready for dinner, and i never got my next drink, so i left.  I wouldve gave 2 star if the food hadnt been at least very good

Jk84xpxu20Ei50mPnL7KRw.text: Shisito peppers were so good! I had the be bum bap, which was dol sot. Sooo good. Great service, super clean. Yummy!!!

3StovT5n97fQrC0JhXP64g.text: I like to come here whenever I am in town, it is conveniently located near the Red Roof Inn if you drive in from the back on Swenson.   Very yummy as always. The prices are reasonable as well. I had the bugolgi, beef toro, and harami miso.  On my previous visits I let them cook it for me. This time I cooked it myself.  UPDATED: updated after I ate my free yummy banana tempura. I got it free for posting a review.  Service was really slow.

_TECeermX0UXMEz4LIpLcw.text: Wow! This place really lives up to all its great reviews. Fun concept of grilling all your own goodies. We got the meat lovers. Everything tasted great. HUGE portions! The two of us definitely could not finish it all. Also feel free so swap out and meats or appetizers. They are so flexible and all the staff was very friendly. Also, if you write a review you get a free dessert ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really good lava cake!

wbgzX5AGY9MLYLhnyWKJ8w.text: First time here. Good service. Love the pork belly and the scallop bacon wrap.  Will come again next time visit to L.V

DGYjeVyEPfFauZliz5IQtg.text: Stop reading, grab your wallet and keys and start driving. This place is a GEM. It seems pricey at first but the amount of food you get (not monster proportions but a variety of food) and the dining experience is unforgettable. The place was packed when we walked in Saturday night, but we didn't wait long. 10 minutes max. Our waitress' answered so many questions with a smile on their faces  (real ones). They explained dishes to us when we blanked stared them at options we had no clue we had. Multiple people checked on us to make sure we were chugging along okay, but not in an annoying way. Like kind table clearing ninjas on a mission. It wasn't overwhelming at all. The food all came out very quickly and it was SOOOOO.GOOD. I was nervous about cooking our own meat but it was sliced in such manageable pieces once we got started it was like we were pros. We had the Gangnam for two and we ate everything... Except the fish cakes. They had good flavor but I'm allergic. I would love to go again with friends. I know it would be so much fun, and more kind on the wallet. Seriously if you're still reading, go. Just try it. You'll thumbs up me later.

TgzKaQNlOoQj9Bsh3k1FkQ.text: Place is visible right on the shopping center. We had a party of 7 people and waited roughly about an hour.  The service was decent and the food was great.  I gave this place four stars due to the accommodations. It was super hot inside and it felt like there was no AC inside the building. Our server didn't check on us often and we had to ask for water unfortunately.   I'll recommend the Korean prime and miso. It's so tender and delicious!!  Would I recommend this place? Only if you have time to kill.

rzrPZsiH0zkbmUlbIzei4Q.text: After all those good reviews, decided to try it out. Ordered premium combo, hope to have enjoy good quality of meats and services.  Free Korean tradition appetizers are just ok, poke salads are very salty,  Beef capaccio is sliced so thin and soaking in pot of salt and sauce, totally lost meaning of Korean authentic so fresh to eat them raw capaccio.  I would give one star to bibimbap.  Service is just ok, they want come by table to check and cook for you.  Everything is too salty and quality is close to 25 dollars AYCE but with much less quantity. I would not recommend to anyone else. I would strongly recommend Kobe beef combo from other KBB place called "Gong".

40ByApWFsYrdlvie-eZ80Q.text: Fresh and feast are the precise words to describe them. I came with my boyfriend and his sister when we arrived at Las Vegas and was starving after a 7-hours driving and stuck in traffic jam. It took us about 20 minutes wait but I think we got lucky. Because right after we had a table, the restaurant filled quickly with people inside and outside. For 3 Asian people, we ordered the Gangnam set for 2 people, plus a side order of Prime Kalbi, egg pot, and salad.  - The portion is huge that we should have only ordered the set without any extra. - The meat is fresh and well-seasoned - The egg pot is not so good because it is so dense and plain.  - The surprise is we have to pay extra for the salad! Please excuse me if you're annoyed at this comment. I've been to several Korean BBQ places which don't charge extra for veggie.  - The atmosphere and the service are family-friendly.  - Honestly, I thought of a 4.5 stars because of the egg pot and extra charge. But boom, if you checked in on Yelp, you get a free Macaroon Ice-cream :) That's my weakness point as an ice-cream addict.  Overall, we had a good experience and might come back again for the other dishes ^.^

38TnLjB2Rt1dT2BlvY3YMA.text: Nice atmosphere, great service, short wait time. As far as Asian BBQ places go, this place is decent, fresh tasty meats, yummy free sides. Can't say anything stuck out about this place in comparison to other Asian BBQ places, price-wise it is comparable as well. Good selection to choose from, good for big groups (I know because we were sitting next a really loud one lol).

lMp-jygc007YK2j7Vp2QjQ.text: My family came in just wanting some Korean food and BBQ, expecting it to be like any other Korean BBQ spot we've been to. But we're incredibly happy with this place! The service, the food, the quality, and the quantity all surpassed our expectations.   It's in a plaza and parking can be a bit tight and narrow but not too bad. The place itself feels pretty open and roomy with a dark and a bit of a modern but also traditional ambience.   Coming in, they greeted us right away and got us seated after a decent wait. We also came in during happy hour so there were some nice discounts! There were a good amount of side dishes, and the refills were super generous! My dad had the kimchi tofu soup (requested to be as spicy as possible), my brother had the bibimbap, and my mom, other brother, and I had Korean BBQ (beef brisket and pork belly). Everything was delicious!! Nothing too overpowering or too bland. Everything was just right to our liking. It's hard to get my entire family to enjoy the same place together because we have different tastes, but this place satisfied us all.   The service also added to our great experience here. The servers are all very attentive, friendly, funny, and super helpful. We will definitely be coming back and highly recommend anyone to give this place a try if you're craving Korean food/BBQ.

RxWpyyWUvmd1pEW85ulOwQ.text: Another hidden gem thanks to my co worker for bringing me here! When you walk in you are immediately greeted by a warm smile by all the friendly staff, that is a sign to a good experience from the start. The place is limited to some seating and I can tell it can get very busy with long wait times but it's totally worth it. I sat at the bar and ordered their Spicy Garlic Edamame, another dish that came prepared with thin slices of raw meat In a delicious sauce and 2 bottles of Soju. Everything tasted wonderful and the service was nothing short of amazing. The setting is low lit to create a romantic and calming mood and it just tied in beautifully with my whole first time experience there. Overall, it's a must visit if you want to try an Asian BBQ place, I know next time I will get a table and start cooking to get the full experience but for now, this place is worth every penny and every second of your time. Can't wait to come back!

QogTf59Q5ec46WyucjEInQ.text: Great decor and environment. This place is probably the best deal in vegas. You get free macarons if you spend more than 15 dollars a person which can suprisingly hard to do if you're not extremely hungry. Get the beef tongue it was unexpected good.

xrbeTJWJrPpjqxurzO15WA.text: A four-star average with nearly 4K reviews brought me to Gangnam- you can't deny, that's impressive. The massive menu has preset meals and a la carte options to get your meat on, along with various apps and sides.    We shared the Las Vegas package for two (wonton, edamame, salad, soup, and bibimbap with Korean chicken, spicy chicken, beef toro, shrimp garlic, and broccoli cheese fondue, $45), and added on the flat iron garlic- meal came with the usual banchan and was more than enough for two of us. I didn't have room for dessert and took an entire meal worth of food home. Favorites were the toro, shrimp, and filet, but the bulgogi bibimbap was really great too. Their sides are surprisingly well done, this is not a spot that focuses on the meats and forgets the rest.   Staff were attentive and frequently checked on us. Location looks tiny from the outside but inside was spacious and tables are huge. I appreciate that they changed out our grill without needing to ask. Good spot for group meals!  TIP: check in on Yelp for a free macaron ice cream cookie sandwich for dessert!

dsgcvIGAgV-1FWFYmPLgAw.text: I've been wanting to try this place for awhile after finding them on Yelp, but was sadly disappointed with the whole experience.  The food was pretty good, hence the 3 stars and rounding up, but the service was non-existent.  I probably should have read more reviews prior to going here.  A smile and "you're welcome" goes a long way, and even dropping off the bill and not saying anything is esp rude.  If I had known service was a huge opportunity, I probably never would have taken friends from out of town here.   A mistake that's easily fixed.    There are tons of better K BBQ here in Vegas with way better service that will get our business going forward.  Management/owners- retrain your current staff or make some tough decisions.  But lack of basic and good service will harm your business long term.

vnfi9dLtvrlL6kKv30mr8Q.text: This place is a hidden gem in Vegas tucked in a corner of a strip mall. It's nice to find authentic Korean BBQ in Sin City. Qf6w0Xy4Yo27GqetgkDuAA.text: Third time in here, we're still waiting for 40 minutes already. They even dont have staffs to clean up the tables or serve. I can't deny that they have good food, but now too tired to wait. Others are waiting to be checked out, it's like the staffs just care for the party, not us. If I were the manager or the owner and I dont have enough staffs to operate the restaurant, sorry I'd take a day off..

nfJnHUp5bHJye1pZi2n7Wg.text: Lets start with the NOT SO GREAT.  Our server was terrible.  We came around 1pm for a late lunch, and the restaurant was full, so he asked us to have a seat in the waiting area.  It was a short wait, and about 2 minutes go by.  We hear someone yelling from across the restaurant to us, telling us to please be seated.  It was the original person that told us to have a seat in the waiting area......and he motioned his arm, with his palm up, towards the open table that had just been cleaned and set for 2.  I thought this was really rude that he couldn't even walk over (about 7 steps) and actually bring us over to our table.  We order, and my eyes are always bigger than my stomach, and he starts to tell me I have quite a bit of food, and that I can always order more if needed.  Nice of him to do that, since I don't know how big the portions are.  Our side dishes come out, then the uncooked meat comes out.  We start grilling, but he doesn't bring us anything else -- no rice, no salad, no appetizers.  Finally someone else brings the salad and our order of Jap Chae but no rice.  I'm a a Chinese dude that needs my rice, so to sit there with cooked meat that is getting cold is starting to add to my frustration with their lack of service (or common sense).  We get our rice, and then we have to remind them that they still have not brought our iced water.  So someone runs back there and gets our water and and appetizer and puts it down on the table.  We finally have everything we are supposed to get, and can now eat, but now, I'm really annoyed at how terrible the service has been.  In addition, the table next to me had to constantly ask the wait staff for stuff, as if they were brand new waiters or something.   I mean simple stuff like refill waters, bring extra napkins if the existing ones are completely dirty, etc.  Its not rocket science.  But about 5-6 times during lunch the next table had to ask for this simple stuff.    Food:  Everything we ordered was really good.  In fact if service was half decent I would have even said the food was fantastic, but its really hard to enjoy a meal if you are pissed off at how shitty the service was.  One mistake is ok.....2 is forgivable, but it was like they were PURPOSELY trying to do a shitty job.    We ordered the lunch special which came with white rice and either 1 or  2 Proteins -- we chose the Spicy Pork and Bulgogi.  Both were good. I did the Jap Chae and 2 "a la carte" proteins -- Kobe Style and Korean Prime Kalbi (marinated).  Kobe was SUPER tender and just a great piece of meat.  Prime Kalbi was also a hit.  Sides were great, especially the pickled cucumbers and fish cake.     After we finished our lunch, we realized that NO ONE had even checked up on us once during the entire meal.  Yes, they came to drop off new plates and take away empty ones, but not once did anyone say "How is everything going?" or "Do you need anything else?"  In fact, the only thing that was ever said to me was "Are you all done grilling?  If yes, I can turn off the grill."  I actually wanted to say "Everything was great, thanks for asking" just to be a smart ass, but I decided against it.  And then the next question was "Are you ready for your tab?"  I mean the waiter seriously didn't even offer us dessert, or anything else for that matter.  It brought me right back to being annoyed again, and I even debated not tipping them anything, but being a former restaurant worker, I always leave money because I know that a big portion of their pay comes from tips.  But geez man, it felt like you were intentionally working really hard to be this shitty, and it sure didnt feel like you deserved a tip, but you got one anyway.  In the end , the food is great, but just come with the expectation that your service will be somewhere between TERRIBLE and NON-EXISTENT and you will enjoy yourselves.  5 stars for the food and 2 stars for the service, so that's a total of 7.  Divide by 2 and you get 3.5.  I rounded up to 4.  You have been warned.....

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side dishes....all were pretty good, but our favorite was the cucumber and fish cake

5kav5GQZNpW8IEQIr6k_zA.text: This is our first meal in Vegas and it does not disappoint. We ordered the Gangnam set for two people with a side of fried chicken, dubokki and Kobe saam. Everything was delicious. There's was a lot of food. The bulgogi was delicious because it was in a stone pot so the rice was pretty crunchy and crispy. I liked everything except for the dubokki, it was a little too sweet. Service was good and portion was generous. Price was pretty decent. We got the macaron ice cream through Yelp check in and it was just ok, nothing special. Overall, it was a very good meal and would come back

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ganam set for two with some fried chicken, dubokki and macaron ice cream

w-v1h40aMsZVSl_y-mcRAQ.text: Was a lovely surprise when they seated us 15 minutes after we arrived (on Christmas at 6pm!) with a party of 8 people. We ordered a bunch of plates at first and ordered more once we were done. The banchan tasted really good and the meats were good quality! We ordered two corn cheeses and they were to die forrr!! Didn't order rice cuz it was extra and didn't really end up needing it anyways. We kinda wished there was free salad to balance all the meats. Great service and great food. Would go back!

E-avE18HIoHUI8ZHetSNmw.text: This place is delicious! Our first night and very first trip to Vegas, I decided for the group that we would have Korean BBQ . This restaurant popped up and had almost 3,000 reviews?! You have got to be kidding me.. that is a lot of reviews, so of course.. we HAD to try it and let me tell you, it was not a disappointment.   We got there around 7:10pm and there was a little wait.. maybe 20 or so minutes. Not too bad because they were filled.   We ordered the Gangnam special but added spicy garlic fatty meat, japche, and bulgogi fried rice. We ordered calamari and fried dumplings for appetizers too. The food is absolutely delicious, but my only itty bitty complaint is the calamari was kind of bland... but everything else was soooo good!! All of the meats were flavorful and extremely tender. Everything was just on point and the service was great too. On yelp, there was also an option to get a free macaron ice cream with checking in and we were able to get 3 of them. We tried mango, coffee, and green tea. The coffee is the best in my opinion... real coffee flavors, so good!  You will not be disappointed! I want to come here again when I come back in August

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gangnam order with extras. Calamari, fried dumplings, japche, bulgogi fried rice, and added spicy garlic fatty meats.

whirDkcKR857i3Lvc1hGRA.text: The food and service was good. Called to make a reservation, but was told that they don't take reservations.  Less than one hour into eating, they asked if we needed boxes to pack our food.  They told us that there is a party that had a "reservation" that will be coming in 15 minutes.  Was rushed and didn't get to enjoy our food.

_uN9kx6uC24u1UqO04fS1g.text: Good place to eat and had fun with friends and family. Cooking the food at the table as you wanted was one of the best experiences from eating here. Service wasn't that great that why the 3 star review. Waiter didn't ask for who was the food order and when asking for any drink refill they took to long. To pay the bill took more 20 min. Beside the service food was great very good seasoning and flavors on every bite.

3AXM-Udz9mc8yC9-WwdtvA.text: I love Korean bbq and decided to give this place a try based on reviews and the fact that it wasn't far from my hotel.  We had the Gangnam and we replaced the oysters with steamed egg. The steam egg was dry. The extras all come out with no explanation of what was what same with the sauce. When the meat came out there was again no explanation of what meat was what. Our server stopped by once just as we were finishing to drop off our bill and turned the burner on high rather than off... luckily another server noticed within a minute or two.  Will not be going back! If you're looking for a good Korean BBQ place go to Hobak, it's worth the drive

ssvgR7MI7gA7HMCxAUrgSQ.text: Food was delicious and Service was excellent!  We ordered the Vegas for 4 people and it was enough for 6 of us . . We also ordered sides . . The broccoli is really good and the bi Bim bap is really tasty!  The Vegas comes with meat, 2 kinds of chicken shrimp edamame and cram cheese rolls . . It was all very tasty!!!

JMcIWOM2XCXkwgN3qORU8Q.text: We went here last night and it was fantastic!  They play very cool music videos on a large screen and my kids loved it.  On an opposite screen, they played Euro Soccer, it's as if they knew my husband was coming, lol!! Now, the food..... we ordered kalbi, korean chicken, and filet mignon as our main meat selections. They were all seasoned perfectly and tender. Our additional items were seafood pancake, veggie potstickers, and japchae.  Seafood pancake was a bit thicker and fluffier than we liked.  We are used to thin and crispy.  Veggie potstickers are more like dim sum dumplings.  Japchae noodles were a tad undercooked. Banchans(free side dishes) were kim chee, Squid, cucumbers, fish cakes,bean sprouts,Mac salad were all delish!! I would definitely go back.  Staff was friendly and very helpful.

6YuW62pZsFRoT4J1DN1FzQ.text: Best Korean BBQ we have ever eaten!!! All of the best seller and suggested beef are tasty! Service is perfect Definitely worth it! 160 for 7 people with 8 dishes of meat and 4-5 appertizers. Super cheap compared to all of the Bbq in the bay ea  100% must try

moj3cKb911uqIpAwlA6yJQ.text: 4 of us decided to eat off the strip during our weekend in LV. We're super happy we ate here! The portions were generous and the price is very, very reasonable. Instead of ordering a set meal, we picked-and-chose about 11 dishes to share: 1 seafood salad - 5 stars (it has papaya it in); 3 marinated premium beef - 5 stars; 1 spicy chicken with lemon dipping sauce - 3 stars; 2 pork belly - 4 stars; 1 steamed corn - 5 stars; 1 bacon wrapped asparagus - 4 stars; 2 unmarinated premium beef - 4 stars; 2 big bowls of white rice. 1 large bottle of hi-te (beer) and 1 bottle of sake. Our order came with side dishes at no additional cost (kim chi, pickled cucumber, fish cake, etc...). One thing we didn't order that I wish we did, was the glass noodles (japchae).   You grill all the meat/veggies yourself. Be sure to ask them to change the grill tray (they didn't offer for us). The Yelp check-in deal gave us a free macaron ice cream sandwich (from Brick) - I chose the green tea flavor and it was delicious! The macaron was light, not too sweet, with nice texture (soft/lightly chewy, but not hard). My verdict: go here for a delicious & filling meal off the strip (but it's not too far)!

FzWR-dHPo3b7IDyUAT48Zw.text: Best Korean BBQ, meat was super tender and full of flavor. The salad was so fresh I felt they had a farm out back. Highly recommended.

ofYDVF-tKbeSrmEwieX4Bw.text: 3.5 Stars  Came for the late night happy hour, table for two.  Banchan - fish cake, mac salad, cabbage kimchi, dried squid, bean sprouts, pickled radish/onion, and cucumbers. They were ok, I just wish some were a little spicier.  We had two orders of beef toro and pork belly, one order of bulgogi and spicy pork, and two orders of white rice.   While the meats weren't the highest quality, they were still pretty good and an awesome value for the happy hour prices. Our bill was $29.10; we left feeling pleasantly full and not AYCE overly stuffed.   You get a free macaron ice cream sandwich if you post a review while at the restaurant, which I think explains the copious 5 star ratings.

TtGI6EEwsrYyFUPHocbIKA.text: Came here to eat since we saw all the good reviews. It's a Sunday night at 5:30 so there was a 5-10 minutes wait.   My husband and I got the Gangnam set. The meat all tasted the same except the galbi. Overall, the meat was all a bit tough to eat. Definitely did not have the other experience people had. The meats all came out really oily and fatty. It might be that they just didn't have a good batch of meat or it might be that I've been spoiled by kbbq and jbbq in socal.   The service was okay.   The portion with the set was pretty big. Even though we got the set for 2, it could have easily fed 3 or 4 people.   The free macaron ice cream was the only highlight to my dinner.

Hc7YBaqF2Qs9CvXF3u5Pvw.text: Fantastic Korean dishes indistinguishable from the meals I ate in South Korea.  Very friendly wait staff, reasonble prices and nice decor.  It's definitely worth getting off the strip!

wzPA0Oea3zXael1AjzxsVQ.text: I've been to a few Korean BBQ place. This place has to be the top one or two. The food is amazing. The meat is tender and juicy. The side dishes are delicious. You can ask for refills if you run out. They have excellent deals on drinks during happy hours ( I think it's half of tap beers and house sake). Service is on the slow side, but it's ok. We were busy eating anyways. If you go with a large group, order from the group menu. We had 9 people and we ordered dinner for 6. it was more than enough. The fluffy egg bowl was very good too (i don't remember what it was called). It's located right across the street from Hard Rock Hotel. Check it out. You won't be disappointed.

U1Py7CASuQxuvw42pN_efA.text: What can I say about this place that hasn't already been said? It was amazing and even the Korean BBQ virgins with us were very happy with their meals.  We got there right before 6:30pm and were seated fairly quickly. It's inside a shopping center that is a little difficult to see from the road. They had K pop playing on one of the walls from the projector which is always fun to watch. Service was good and very attentive.  The only thing that sucks is some of the items that usually come as part of the BBQ is charged a la carte here - like the sea salt and sesame oil dip. They charge $1 a pop for it. Not expensive but a little annoying. The drinks here were all really good and SO REFRESHING. I swear, they've made the best lychee martinis I've ever had and I wish I had their recipe. It was that good!  Down to the food - nearly all of it was nothing short of amazing. We ordered the Meat Lover's BBQ for 4 which was $99. Not a bad price for all you get. The meats were all flavorful and marinaded well. The pork belly was the only thing that could have been better - it was not as thick as some of the other places I've been. I also ordered the seafood soft tofu soup which was good but not the greatest. I still enjoyed it.   I'm in Vegas about once a year and when I come back, I'm definitely going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The meat lover&#39;s for 4. It was only $99!!! Everything tasted great however the pork belly was just ok - 6.24.15
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood tofu soup. It was good but I&#39;ve had better at some other Korean BBQ spots. Still tasty though! 6.24.15
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best lychee martini I&#39;ve had this entire trip!! 6.24.15

rmvTZ4cpmvibSj1plmfgBQ.text: Their food is really good and not very expensive. I gave 4 stars because the vegetarian options are a little slim. Would love it if they add those as well.

rOmJnC4IeUmi6H3y2RlVhg.text: First time we have ever eaten Korean bbq.   There were 4 of us so we order3d the Gangnam plate for 4.  OMG the food was a lot and very good.  The service was good and friendly.   After they realized we didn't know what we were doing they came over and helped.  It was a unique dining experience cooking the meat at the table  .  Experimenting with different sauces and trying new foods. Highly recommend for the adventurous.

eqv6IsaQTTsvVRzAJJ769w.text: We're from the Bay Area and we've had some GREAT kbbq, but me and mom have to give this place applause. The service is just as good as the food as well.  Recommendation: Beef Carpacio for appetizer and Short Rib

kOXvB2uuWnu2ppa0ntTd2A.text: I was craving for some good Korean food while up in Vegas.  Thankfully through Yelp I was able to find Gangnam Asian BBQ which wasn't too far from our hotel by cab ride.  The place is located in a mall looking area next to a 24 hr nail salon.  I remember this because I was amazed that they had such thing as a 24 hr nail salon.  We came around 11 at night, a pretty late dinner for us.  But we're in Vegas so thankfully there are lots of late night places to eat.  The good thing about arriving here late is that we made it to the late night happy hour.  I definitely recommend ordering from the happy hour menu!  We literally almost ordered everything from it plus a tofu soup that wasn't on their happy hour menu.  I thought it wasn't going to be enough food but boy was I wrong.  It was too much food! Although my bf can eat a lot, we still had leftovers.  All the meats were good!  Also recommend the cheese wontons. We got 2 orders of those cause my bf liked it so much.  The tofu soup had big chunks of tofu sticking out from the soup and was filled with lots of kimchee and meat inside.  They also give a variety of ban chan.  All so yummy!  I was pleasantly surprised by this place and was even happier with the price.  I would compare this place to being like Gyu-kaku but better!  Service was good, fast and food was great.  No complaints here!

OKv3QQfnfcE9E2_z4vaTwQ.text: After a long road trip through Utah on MDW, we needed some REAL food. After seeing the reviews on this place we knew we had to give it a try.   We came here on a Sunday night on Memorial Day weekend around 8pm and waited exactly 45mins. That's not bad at all for a holiday weekend.. Not to mention their cool projector that plays music videos to pass time.   Now onto the food, we went with the Gangnam combo, and little FYI, if you want to substitute something, as long as it's equal or lesser price.. YOU CAN!! We substituted our bulgogi for beef toro & yuzu for cream cheese wontons.   Now onto the FOOD! I've been to many Kbbq and AYCE kbbq, I have to say,this place is pretty up there on my kbbq list! The meat quality here is very good, tender and tasty. I also like that it's NOT AYCE, the portions were more than enough and I was able to really enjoy the meats instead of stuff my face cause it's AYCE lol.   As for service, everyone here moves fast! If I didn't live in CA, I'd definitely be back!   *tip: write a review and get a free dessert! Win win for everyone!

LCbbP0sG-bb8WHq-Smj2DQ.text: We had a party of four and order two "las Vegas" meals. I think we could have gotten away with ordering one for the four of us because it was a lot of food and much of it went uneaten. But it was very good. Kimchi was the only thing that was bleh.

kS95POAAsW0rv3FcYb21Jw.text: Great place off the strip! Literally only 5 minute drive from PH. We came here before our flight leaving Vegas based on yelp reviews. It was such a good decision to come here as we were just in time for happy hour! Happy hour on a Sunday (bomb!!!) after a long night out = pure happiness!!!!! The servers were friendly, food was delicious. Everything is small plates only, similar to Gyu Kaku.  We tried pretty much everything from the HH menu, the spicy pork & beef toro & pork belly were our favorites for the meats. Steamed dumplings, seaweed salad were also good too. This place is definitely worth the try if you don't want AYCE bbq. Can't wait to come back again if I'm in the area!

dpDcVinB9nFK_2zSpEidAg.text: Best Korean BBQ I have ever been to. Not all you can eat, so if you can loosen up your wallet, this is THE spot to go. 6 out of 5 stars, quality of food is to die for. Service is above and beyond. Sometimes it's a long wait, but the food makes it all worth it.

bO24t7TFbZ7drOS8ew4P7A.text: Very good place to get Korean barbecue if you enjoyed going to happy hours. Open late and they are very happy to help you if you haven't gone to Korean barbecue are not very good at doing the cooking aspect of it. They also have different entrees available such as noodles and other stuff like that but they also have group options if you want to get a lot of different stuff for people all at the same time, especially if you have a larger party and don't want everyone to order 20 of the same thing. Definitely our new favorite place to go for Korean barbecue in Vegas when we visit

3LGGDO_JB8yo06WvYZs6iA.text: It's a little on the pricier side but if you get their combos they are very filling for an average eater but if you eat a lot I'd recommend go to a cheaper All you can eat kbbq. They have good quality meat here though which was definitely a plus.

6TaG3R9aSWZomkeNO8wN8Q.text: Simply amazing. The Gangnam meal for six easily fed seven. Worth the trip off the strip.

2CB2YMGiE2bNHwdNVhwpHA.text: This place was awesome! Very nice and clean, I like music and videos playing on the wall. The employees were super friendly and welcoming! The food was delicious, my husband and I ordered the Meat Lover dish for 2. It was a good amount of food. Will definitely be returning

fJ84GoHhBWHRFjKPClEokw.text: Patrick went above and beyond for me. I had a small reception after a ceremony at the Hard Rock Hotel. Our party of 20 walked over as it is across the street.   I started communicating with Patrick several months before the ceremony. He was very attentive and helpful even when I started to forget about the food as the wedding got closer.   Patrick and I facebooked and texted as the date came closer. He confirmed with me the day before and the day of. When we walked over, they were ready for us, all set up and immediately began bringing food out. Everything was delicious and we were all very full walking back to the hotel. It was an overall amazing experience.

yqjxd3iAUIQolMXr35zbtw.text: Although this place isn't a AYCE KBBQ, but they do have some great selections.  I was in town with a group of friends and we ordered a few appetizers and the Gangnam. There was no wait on a Saturday afternoon, which was a plus.  We'll be back the next time we're in Vegas!

AAJUjbybN41HJJE1LF2gfA.text: I left my heart in Seoul and this was a trip down memory lane.   Awesome kimchi. Fantastic quality meat. Banchan off the hook!   I highly recommend this place, the service is excellent. A Legit Korean waiter entertained my fondness for korea. It's a great place to bring a client or your family.  The music isn't too loud and conversations can be had.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu!
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YkvgRraPH_2MvsF2Sj2bAg.text: First, we did not realize this was all you can eat korean bbq. I don't believe I saw that advertised on their website? I might of miss it. There are three options. Option A- Lunch special, from Monday - Friday. And option B- seafood options and option C- higher dollar option, which have the Galbi. For the last option C, you get to choose from all of other option A-C. Plus it come with appetizers, two soups and rice. Fairly priced for all of the options you can choose from. Service was great and fast. Our waiter helped us cook our BBQ. They do play some top 20 music videos on TV. I did appreciate that they play all of Beyonce. I would go back when I visit Vegas.

KqLjkjfGm5RbD1CEOEtS0Q.text: The atmosphere itself was cozy. It has a great ambiance for its location. When we came in we were told that there were other groups, 3 groups before us but they were so quick on seating us.   We decided to order from menu that's marked "Must try".. the spicy tuna kimbap and calamari garlic. The kimbap was really good, it was melting in my mouth. The calamari was just a blah. Nothing special - I cannot taste the garlic.   We also had the prime kalbi which was very tasty and the dumpling soup.   Please avoid ordering the ramen. The quality and texture tastes like instant maruchan.   Overall the service was good even they forgot my soju but delivered attention after that.

VK-Ie_InwRRoagngeT0I_A.text: Though the food is good . The experience was the worst we ever got . Our server name Yob was so rude to us . First he never introduce himself to us . He looks like he felt irritated when we were  asking him a question about their menu. And when I'm adding more order to our Vegas order he yelled "WHAT ?because he could not hear me . Where is your etiquette? Are you  training your server to give proper etiquette to your customers. And because it's my daughter's birthday we decided to take picture our group . It was so nice of the hostess to offer to take our picture but then Yob came with our order and started rolling his eyes . And started slamming the food on our table . Yob never checked on us if we still have drinks or bussed our table coz it's getting over crowded with empty dishes . Then when we left it was a different person who gave us our bill . And we saw him eating in the bar area . And also to mention your water taste bad . And you were out of plastic bag for our left over . I will not come back here again . I will still love GYukaku , hobak and hwaro . Worst dining experience. . We are nice people to be treated bad .

GF9Ll42aR44RmfvJVuuKww.text: This was my first time at a Korean bbq restaurant. So I'm new to what portions to expect and this was my only complaint. It was about 8.95 for 1/4 lb of meat to cook for yourself. We got three orders of meat, an appetizer of wontons, and some veggie fried rice. Taste wise everything was excellent. I just left a little hungry. Now the service was more than excellent and I can't think of more attentive and friendly service at any other restaurant I've been to. Great atmosphere. I will definitely go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Sbze50iRQjTCzZZ8WdZtQA.text: Came in after reading all the great reviews here. I expected the space to be bigger but it didn't matter that much to me. I came in with my party of 4 and were seated quickly. We ordered the Gangnam for 2 and ordered 2 side orders. We were going to order 5 side orders but our waiter, Ryan, recommended that we should be good with what we had originally with 2 side orders. I really appreciate that the waiters don't push you to order more because it would be wasteful if we couldn't finish everything. The waiters and waitress were all very accommodating and super nice. It's definitely a place that you can take your date to. The meats were super delicious and nice quality. The check in ice cream macaron was a great wrap for the end of our meal!
