r1enKPfgvf39iYUoDKhrLA.text: It's probably been 20 years since I've dined at a Korean BBQ (that you grill yourself).  This place is a hole in the wall that you'd only find if looking for it.  They have happy-hour deals, where you can shave a dollar off numerous dishes, and half-price alcoholic beverages.  My wife and I ordered two appetizers (cream cheese triangles, mushroom medley), and four mains (pork, bulgogi, 2 beef), and a side of rice.  This was more than enough food!  The only item we didn't care for was the pork belly, everything else was very good.  Oh, they also give you 5-7 mini-starters (kimchi, cucumbers, fishcakes, etc.), which were very nice (we would have ordered slightly less had we known!).

xTWoHN0EOSIsS4wXrNID3w.text: We came here on Friday after Thanksgiving and place was crazy packed! Wait time was over 1 hour. Reason why I deducted 1 star.   After we were seated, appetizers and food came out pretty quick and service was good. The spicy tuna kimbap was really yummy, with crunchy rice rolls underneath the spicy tuna.   The meat was very fresh and well seasoned too, just need to make sure you watch the meat so it doesn't burn.  Only downside with Korean bbq is you always end up smelling like the bbq lol. But the food here was great! Probably try to come earlier to avoid the long wait though.

GMyFKH93NUFss4TM18lHXQ.text: Good food and efficient service for the price you will pay.  Worth the money.  You will need to wait a bit- 20-30 min.  We went at 8:30pm and had to wait 20 min.  It was worth the wait.  Kalbi Prime Beef and Kobe Style Beef was fabulous.  Pork belly was good.  Portion sizes are large for the chicken salad and bibimbap.  Definitely to share.  Parking is easy in the lot.   A great place to get your fix on Asian food.  Nice atmosphere.

1P8d_aKFUjvVonpHIJKEWQ.text: THis was my first time having Korean BBQ. I don't like the flavor of garlic and Koreans love garlic. I ended up enjoying the place.

2-N5YEgHG5J_kkjJe__QIg.text: Good service nice staff pronto service, friendly environment very good for family occasions

jzPAVO7oDm5C3mshMCl3Jw.text: Wow!  Absolutely delicious!  All joking aside when people talk about cooking you're own food, but it's more like finding the exact combinations from bite to bite as your pallet changes.  I would equate it to changing colors in a painting to suit the needs of the scenery.    Don't hesitate, look at the number of reviews, go in yourself, and give them 5 stats yourself.

T1k0JK0irW1tsPtuW_DIhg.text: Delicious food. Cool atmosphere. Good service. Only negative is they sat us (party of 7 including a 9 year old) in a booth meant for 4. Tight squeeze, hard to cook your meat.

UEuuzD4kVhEzPOt33VjlCA.text: Found this place on yelp one of best meals i have had in vegas. Friendly staff excellent service. Food was amazing.

qoPlpwOtumNefMUYSZ7Beg.text: Great KBBQ restaurant in Vegas. A little fat to walk to if you're on the strip, but super close with a car. The wait was a little longer than we were told, but the food was delicious and so reasonably priced. Bulgogi was great, but I found the flat iron garlic a bit chewy. The best thing was their Kalbi soup! I love this soup and thought that this place did it incredibly well- flavorful, tender meat, good noodles, and huge portion. Also ordered the prawns and brisket, these were good. Friendly staff and waiter.

lOtXySyAVNpq46nqYJhLPQ.text: Let me first start out with the fact that I love Korean BBQ and this is no exception. My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this little off the strip hidden gem when we went to try and go off the strip to get an ear piercing. We didn't get the piercing, but we ended up eating a fantastic dinner.  We got there just in time for happy hour so we definitely had to take advantage of this sweet deal. We ordered the Chicken Karaage, Steamed Chili Dumplings, and then the Spicy Pork, Beef Toro, Pork Belly and Bulgogi for the BBQ aspect of it. Since it was so cheap, we ended up ordering about 3 or 4 of each of the meat items.  They also had beers on happy hour too, so we took advantage of those as well. We got a pitcher of beer and a bottled soju. I mean, we were at a Korean restaurant so we had to go with the soju.  The service here is wonderful and the food was awesome. Whenever I am back in Vegas I will be coming here!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean feast!

G9I7iHJ7RY7LczwJhkIM-g.text: I had a top notch dining experience at Gangnam. The food was good and the service was excellent. We ordered the Meat Lover for two people. The amount of food was just right. We also received free ice cream Macarons for checking in on Yelp! I would definitely come back the next time I am in Las Vegas.

MIcEAq8zBe3TWUEteNT5jA.text: Love the naengmyun here. I go here every time I go to Vegss because it's so fricken hot and all I want is something icy cold. The meat quality is good too

L4X7d4b7nya_9JDl4F52zA.text: Ive tried a few korean bbq places but this place is amazing. Friendly service, quick service, delicious food. The sides alone are delightful, pickled chiles, pickled cucumbers and i was tempted to order the dried squid to go. Everything we had was so satisfying. Gangnam style !

AUvjTGT6TquKZ3j79JmBtA.text: This place was dope. Especially after the lame situation we had before with korean bbq II. We got to cook our own food and the amount was more than enough for us to eat. Definitely combing back here cause that spicy chicken was marinated absolutely AMAZING!

t8aIWKrtq1jYW_MF-mANng.text: Would definitely return. Service was great. Joseph was helpful and pleasant, giving terrific recommendations. Favorites were: seafood pancake ( light and flavorful), mushroom medley, chicken sukiyaki, bulgogi. The sides and sauces were great. Don't forget to do a yelp check in for a free dessert. We went on a Friday night at 7- easy parking and seated immediately. Thumbs up!

SYWw2zhRnyp4lYEIyFdTow.text: Ate here my first day in Vegas! Got the Meat Lover combo with my family of 4. The seaweed salad was really refreshing and delicious and the sauces were very flavorful! Something different to me was the sides because in SoCal I am used to having more potato salads but here they have fish cakes and more different types of sides! Overall great experience here, bit on the more pricey side since we got the combo for $100 because usually AYCE would be $25/person as well. Maybe next time would only get the combo for 2 people instead of 4 because we couldn't finish but was able to get some to-go! Also great customer service and would return again!   Tip: Check in to yelp for a free macaroon ice cream!

gBWZM2LVESjx25Ss6u9LBQ.text: Excellent food and service beside being super busy this was the best Korean style bbq I have ever been service was outstanding this is now a one of my favorite dining spots we picked the premium meat selection was bit pricey but we enjoyed it will try different selection next time to compare

J3YfMu86tI6Fu_nXPMs3ew.text: Good Korean BBQ in Las Vegas?! Visiting from Vancouver, I really didn't have high expectations for Korean BBQ... but this place blew my mind! The high quality of meat (both galbi and non marinated) were amazing, buttery and melt in the mouth as well as flavourful. In addition, the selection of banchan were good as well.  The prices here very reasonable, the quality of meat is good, and FREE macaron ice cream sandwich with check in! For some reason our check in wasnt working, but our server still honored us the free dessert! The macaron ice cream sandwich was great too, I got the passion fruit shells with matcha.

2YUq4KyrJxXq1enulPTO9g.text: This place is worth the visit and especially at lunch time! There is a great lunch combo for about 10-13 dollars depending how many items you get and it comes with meat to grill, rice, choice of an appetizer, and all the korean side dishes.  We decided to order two orders of the kalbi (marinated) and it was worth it! I could just order 2-3 orders of kalbi and eat that all day.  We took an uber from the strip and it was about $7 which isn't bad for some decent korean food.

AnP1poRithOuxuFWKKsjTg.text: 2 adult and 3 kids! At first we want to try Gangnam set for 2 but we didn't want to eat seafood. We ended up ordered 4 different beef from must try Juicy cut.  1-Korean Prime matraditional Korean BBQ sauce was for my fav. Good flavor and good value 2-Kobe style beef so tender, juicy and fatty!  The server change our grill 3 times that was nice  !  We also tried kimchi bibimbap was okay rice is to soggy!  -1  star for the long wait!

cyHshXzvH68gSZp8EEpqDw.text: Come here on Tuesday night. No wait time . Good service, good food , we have a good time here. We will be back when we have a chance to come back Las Vegas .

6V3bedfy8_2n1vqvzsWCjg.text: A must go to restaurant when I'm in Las Vegas. Very friendly staff and delicious food! Took my daughter and boyfriend here for the first time and they loved it too.

SrYYI_EfyCrDeiggxZvwrQ.text: If only South Florida had amazing Korean BBQ places like this one!! Gangnam Asian BBQ is located a bit off the strip but it's definitely worth visiting. This low-key restaurant has a great menu of assorted meats and also, there's plenty of Happy Hour deals on drinks as well as food. All the prices are very reasonable. It is clean, neat and well ventilated inside so you don't leave smelling like smoky BBQ. The service is good, they are attentive and can answer any questions you have.They have a tv on playing the latest Kpop hits as well as other genres of music.   If this is your first time doing Korean BBQ, keep in mind, you have to cook the meat yourself. If the grill is getting too charred and sticky, you can ask them to change out the hot plate. Aside from meat dishes, there are plenty of vegetable platters you can order. I recommend trying a stew too. For food, I ordered beef toro, kalbi, bulgogi, pork belly and kabocha squash. The marinated kalbi was my favorite but the beef toro was the most unique. Nice fatty thin slices with delicious marbling. I loved their dipping sauces too. Nice generous portions of the side dishes as well. Check in on Yelp to receive a free dessert - maracon ice cream! Very sweet and a large portion too! If only I lived closer....

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H4EEqwW1cO6YOnxLtJ7lAA.text: No idea which one of my idiotic friends decided on KBBQ when we're all hungover but it was a great idea!  The meat here is premium quality and the uni rice bowls were amazing. I really don't remember much since I let my friends do all the ordering as I sat back, got an early start to my day buzz, and let them do all the cooking. I just remembered it was delicious and so worth the $70+ we spent per person. We did drink a lot of beers and soju though...

-L4h3iFHme9ykn4djLsDVg.text: Love this place good food definitely come back here again love the kimchi soup barbecue so delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g34na3XMLaVsFCpg-1NVOw.text: A great Korean BBQ place in Las Vegas. You get a pretty good size grill and decent banchan (side dishes) although I wish there were more types. Good selection of meats, everything we had was good. The meat lovers combo is the way to go, all the good stuff. Each of the meat portions aren't that big themselves, but the full combo is good size. So if you are ordering individually, make sure to get a few. If you check in on yelp you get a little ice cream thing. We didn't have a long wait, but it was a week night.

VV_TIe3kqgWIbxZO0ieAUA.text: I wish I could find this place earlier. Compared to a lot overpriced restaurants on Strip. The food here is delicious with reasonable price.l though it is not all you can eat. The beef is tender the cut of beef tongue is a little thick but still good. The only real complaint is the veggie. I order the mushroom and asparagus but they are all ready to eat and they are cooked directly over fire. I would like to cook them by myself. Still it is a very nice place to visit. If you are not seeking for high-end dining experience on Strip yet still want some place better than Panda Express with reasonable price, this is the place you should visit.

KhCk87QIvgQfp250j_mM0w.text: First time here & this place is bomb! Service was good & they are all friendly. Good with groups & their music was enjoyable. Their food was bomb. Had their yakiniku menu & there was so many options to choose from. Appetizers were yummy, we had their calimari, chicken karaage, and cheese wontons. Portion size was decent for the price. For entrees, we had the spicy pork, beef toro, pork belly, & their korean prime kalbi. Those were bomb too. If you're ever in the neighborhood & you're hungry, then check this place out.

KUt4grroV3FiGSqkdl6E7A.text: This is my first experience with bbq at GangNam Asian bbq.  Foods are good, but portion is kind of small.  However, this is a good one in Las Vegas area.

FKjjW7d03rPwsln9Z7vcCg.text: Awesom Korean BBQ for a great price! We initially went because it was within walking distance to HRH but went back again during our stay because we couldn't get enough.

A-ViaIzTwpfVHPIltfkPhQ.text: A little pricey since it's in a tourist-frequented area but it's really good food. They marinate all the meat which makes it more flavorful than some other Korean BBQ places.

f0LYk7BwDMlkK_5kyPE5NA.text: We ate there late last night, around 12.15am. The food was good for the price we paid. The host was nice. The only complaint we had was our server's attitude. He was not friendly at all. He didn't smile, greet us at all, he only took our order, as if he was doing us a favor. He never apologized when he forgot to bring sugar for my tea. His response to that was just "oh yeah." He never checked if our table was ok, or even come by to refill our water or tea. Other servers  who delivered some of the dishes were way friendly and nicer.

hSUyrxlbbYa26IxRhnD8lA.text: Best happy hour! Can't beat the prices for a late night bite. Spicy pork is a must order. The service is quick too.

pyskof08zYHCn0aYWQKPGQ.text: although the wait is quite long during the weekend at night they have a waiting seat and a projector playing music video to entertain you while you wait  once seated the service was very quick our server served us our drinks and order within a few minutes of ordering we ordered the Meat Lover Grill for 4 people; the food itself was really good, all the meat was delicious and we receive a good amount for the price we paid ($99)

Q-rY8oWufLfOh7LnToJeQQ.text: Good quality meats and a fun experience. However, slightly slow service even during a less busy period. I ordered the mushroom medley as a side and, despite enquiring as to its whereabouts twice, it turned up quite a while after I had already finished my meal without an apology from our server, Li. My favourite dish was the Bulgogi sliced ribeye and I really enjoyed the fishtail complimentary side. The rest were not anything special but I liked that they were unlimited. When we went, they were offering free dessert in exchange for a Yelp! review so it would have been rude not to. You get to choose between a free plate of banana tempura with ice cream or a macaron ice cream sandwich (only coffee flavour was left and I'm glad we never paid for it).

lc8K12ZQS8WL07hGi21lMg.text: Brought my hungry husband here for a birthday dinner. It didn't disappoint. Ordered the Gangham combo for two and the waitress helped us through the ordering process. Enjoyed cooking on the grill. The wooden benches could use some padding but other than that, it's an excellent choice for a unique meal when you're hungry.

ZGY5_8Wy282-fmk7JRo7Aw.text: The food was great.  We ordered the "Premium choice for 2."  Highly recommended.  We loved the macaroons ice cream.  The restaurant is little small but it was worth the wait.  Wish there was a restaurant like this in Houston.

ZEz4MiqA3CWdDgwi1f46mA.text: I never really liked bibimbap, I find it basic, just rice, meat, veggies all mixed together, I can totally make this at home, however the uni bibimbap stood out to me. I ordered it. I loved it. I liked the flavors and how the rice at the bottom was crisp.

rXpbI6IOBrPd8ud4ESyeCg.text: Fun atmosphere. Break from the norm. Excellent service, and good happy hour specials. The food was great. Salmon Jalapeno poppers were the best. Toward the end of the meal our server disappeared. Seemed like they were prepping for dinner. Had to go search for someone to get service, so I dropped it to a 4 star review. Otherwise it was great.

OiiuYiSmwXEtV86BS8itDQ.text: I liked it here! It is better than Sura's by spring mountain. We got the meat lovers for two and it was a decent amount in there and we are pretty big eaters. Servers were great!

DLwZxHYGKh_-N4GqsvYjBQ.text: Really enjoyed the atmosphere.  The ordering system is easy. Not tons of meat per plate. Filet mignon was very tender. Jalapeno poppers were great!

pDpSV9d46i2vMfozLyzs-Q.text: Very good food and great service!They have good combination bbq meals to share,but we decided to just choose off the menu and it was cheaper with more varities. Wish they had more side dishes(bean sprouts,and veggie options)

-XKXvmhw9anYwaeKF5FuRw.text: Food and service are good with a fun friendly atmosphere. Portions are plentiful and the wait wasn't long for a Saturday night. I will definitely be coming back.

WYaL3eRKUQJT3C6PNtMZEQ.text: Got the Gangnam Menu for 6 people and it is definitely a lot of food. Good meat, service can be friendlier.

Lm-YHjmjS2W24eatbi7VHQ.text: Great appetizers, and good pescetarian options, nice value. Plus the deserts are super bomb. Service left something to be desired.

Sf_7iuh4sB4mrg-9ZwtGsA.text: Good prices and great side dishes.  Nice atmosphere, very well decorated.  Centrally located near the Hard Rock.  They also have happy hour and reverse happy hour in the evenings.  Happy hour is 3 to 6 and reverse happy hour is 10 to ? They had fish cake, macaroni salad, and bean sprouts side order.

dh-TjrmEwbDxZ3k_-TiPgg.text: Very good food, marinated beef is so soft, i overcooked mine but still perfect,  rice with beef is very good too. Wished they had more complimentary side dishes and they had the best service!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IWQLnp3-73ClBb2xrESGPQ.text: There was a wait but while worth it. #Bomb.com You won't regret it the best choices for happy hour I come as often as I can when I'm In Vegas.

efcjzsiptApSHxQKASHWAA.text: We were looking forward to some great grilled korean beef. We tried the wagyu similar to Kobe beef. It was tasty but very small quantity for 24.95.  Not worth it. We've had real Kobe in Japan and Waygu here in the USA.   They need to increase the amount for the price. The weight must have been about 4 oz.    also with the fatty rib beef and kobi style beef not leaf lettuce served we had to ask for garlic to roast.  I believe they'll give you what you ask for but you must ask.  While I'm writing this they just brought out another serving of kobi style beef. No charge.  They're working the issue.  We will return.   And we do recommend.  We had the uni with kobi appetizer it was a treat.  The kimchi is excellent. The other side dishes are as well. Great traditional or classic korean.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobi Style Beef.
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fatty Rob Beef. Excellent marinade.

3bWl7XMOPKH9zbV9KcpYRQ.text: I really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere.  It is a little cramped, ventilation could be better and the wait can be long.  The food makes up for all the shortcomings. Good food and a fun atmosphere.

0ytOJn-454nM97orWAj0jA.text: Seriously best lunch deal in town!!!!  Everything tasted great and authentic...   I'm so sad it's taken me so long to visit!  The place is cute inside, the service was great!  The bulgogi was delicious as well as all the sides!!

rerPl-GLBrDEbaSZpZQYwQ.text: I came back again with my family for my sisters birthday. The portions was huge, and we ordered more than we should. Everything was good.   You do leave the establishment smelling like the grill, so don't wear your nice clothes. =]   I'm reducing one star from my last visit, because I wish they would be more transparent with their gratuity. We came with a group of 5 and didn't expect that it would be an automatic 18% tip on the check. Most places it's 6 people or more. So I guess that's something to be cautious of, especially if you're not looking carefully and could double-tip.

p0s9hytTXAeBD9x5QGFTXw.text: I been to a few Korean bbqs but this one exceeded my expectations from the freshness of food to their great service, I'm from Southern Cali will come here again staff was very helpful. Price is well priced from what you get it's plenty. I ordered the meat lovers for my gf and I.. they also replaced grates when needed and make sure to check in for a free macaroon. Will recommend my friends to come here. Establishment was very clean. If your reading this, get off your phone and go here now you won't be disappointed.

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq area

i80pBcZWU_OCF6VMNqCHgA.text: They have a good selection of meats. The Korean prime kalbi and Kobe style beef is tender and delicious. I didn't care for the pork cheek, but the hubs liked it and said it was tender. The spicy pork was full of flavor and the soft tofu soup was yummy.   We liked how the portions are small so you can try and eat a variety of meats. Will definitely be back.

z1Iv7X1RALnlYfuEYj4SMA.text: I've never ate at a Korean Style BBQ before today. I honestly had no idea what to order. Everything is served raw & you have to cook it on a little grill at your table. My friend helped me to pick out my food. I am not an adventurous eater. I ordered the filet mignon & bacon wrapped asparagus. There are 4 different appetizers that you can sample with your meal while it cooks. I compare that to standard bread served at traditional American restaurants. One was like celery in a red sauce,  another was clear noodles and I really liked that one, another one I wasn't sure of, and the last one was kimchee. It was a fun experience. They give you three sauces to dip your meat into once it is cooked. If you check in on Yelp, you get a free ice cream macaroon for dessert! That was really nice and the perfect way to end the meal. I will definitely be back to try new food next time. This is in a little plaza near UNLV. It's not easy to find. Our waiter was very helpful in explaining the set up to me.

PGGRUzpMJn-iugo5rmN_Ww.text: Excellent concept and better food! You cook your own meat on a mid-table grill. Had several cuts of meat and each one was very tasty. The best part? The colorful ice cream sandwiches. If you like bbq, check this place out. You won't be disappointed.

lnR-6C1Z9z6eAEZX2-1Xsw.text: Tasty food at great prices.  Free Macaron was a big plus.  Definitely will recommend to our friends visiting Vegas.

0lNBc1fPpyjzbUR8orkbPQ.text: Service is great and the food was really good. I like how there is a large variety to choose from! Will come back when I'm in Town

3_B3vObuB8bWPfegPY3txw.text: So many options! Food and service is excellent! We had 6 adults and 3 children in our group and they gave us the back room which was really convenient. I highly recommend this place and would definitely come back again.

dd5zYgSPZMC3BgjWHbtKHw.text: Awesome place to eat! The meat tasted like high quality meats and sides great. Meat lovers is what we got!

YCV4lvPEDvPav_fH5nBPoA.text: I first dined here a few years ago and really enjoyed it. So I came back here when I'm in town. This time for lunch.  I ordered lunch special with 2 items. Perk belly and blugogi. Bulgogi was very  tender and flavorful. The portion was small so it was a good idea that I ordered 2 item choice.   I eat Korean food on regular basis and their banchan dish selection was one of good ones.  I will definitely come back here while in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5etVTKcT0L_tPdUsAnJbaw.text: Your food is the best. I just ate two bowls of bulgigo  and two bowls or Mac and cheese. That was the best food that I ever ate. Thank you Gangnam. You should try their food!

DJ0VK3D5XpuV9kc8ImT7zw.text: After seeing that it had good reviews i wanted to try something new. It was alright honestly.  Its not even all you can eat. The only food i liked was the brisket and the steamed egg.

cGdJdS0ZBUCaFGm0HzSMpQ.text: I came yesterday with my boyfriend around 2:30 and it was AMAZING! The service from all the servers was great as well which was a plus to our experience! We ordered the Gangnam meal and it was perfect for me and my boyfriend!!! They have a couple of sauce choices that all tasted sooo good! I live in socal, which has kbbq EVERYWHERE so I was hesitant to come here but now when I go home, I'm definitely going to crave this place instead...   If you're in Vegas, COME TRY THIS PLACE. So bomb!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dkpaOWoCcx1i4U1czSKOEw.text: Been meaning to hit this place up for a long while. I've constantly had a friend bug me to go to this place and finally we've gone. It lived up to the expectations. Whilst disappointed about the non-ayce the portions were filling and the sides were delicious. If you want a better meat and don't mind paying extra for it. This is the place for you.   Personal Kbbq Checkmarks:    ayce kbbq  radish wraps  Toppoki (a la carte tho :( )   Unlimited soda Refills   Extras   Thai Tea (surprising bonus !!! Thoroughly enjoyed)  Eggrolls   Gyoza (more like dumpling but it was good)   Japchae

7IXWajEorEgBr8sEaQXhZA.text: Got to go here for dinner tonight. We were seated right away and the waiters were very prompt and attentive when bringing our the items. Just FYI it is not ayce, however you get just enough meat for your buck. I recommend the meat lovers for a taste of good quality meat. Also, if you check in you get a free mini macaroon. For two of us it ended up being a little over $100 with tip (that's with two beers and corn cheese side). The ambience of the place was nice as well and you have your own huge table. I would definitely recommend going here if you're not planning on eating too much, but still want a good amount of meat (at least 2-3 lbs) of meat.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary sides
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rice, seaweed salad and salad
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso soup

yZTp5Sl1XVrZW9xwsQQb6A.text: Had no idea what was in store when we came here. Pleasantly surprised at one of the coolest restaurants I've ever been to! Good food & amazing service

tayVCk0CD3KoNn4DNjG8VA.text: The best KBBQ in Vegas. Literally my first stop every time I visit Las Vegas.   The portion size is quite large for kbbq. You really get the most for your money here. The grill isn't sticky like other places I've been and it isn't smokey.   My favorite dish is the Korean galbi. It's not too salty and has a nice marbling of fat without being fatty. The combination of sweet meats with enoki mushrooms coupled with a sweet onion and perfectly steamed rice keeps me coming back time and time again.   When you've had enough of the overpriced food from the overhyped restaurants on the strip, hop over to gangnam for a great meal the whole family will enjoy at a price that will keep you at the poker table a little longer.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Updated their grills since I was here in November.

ld0mvFjVjxUpESidT0RKSw.text: Trust Yelp and try this place.  Similar in style to gyu-kaku but much higher quality.   We did the 55$ meat lover for 2 and it's probably good for 3 people. They are very generous with their portions including the salad and rice. The meat is super tender and the side dishes are very good.   Ambience 4/5: Nice tables and cool wooden benches. It has a Japanese feel but modern. Music is low so you can carry a conversation.  The tables are large so it can be hard to reach all the side dishes.   Food 5/5 Good: filet mignon, beef toro, pork belly, prime kalbi, garlic flat iron  Average: spicy pork, beef bulgogi   Service 4/5: Attentive and friendly.  Most of the servers had a smile.  It doesn't look like they have individual assignments or sections because they all help each other out. That makes service quick.

gxbP7aTjXrluxXyErJq1Ow.text: This restaurant never fails me. I returned on my subsequent trip to LV because it is that good! I recommend getting the Gangnam meal option...meats are tender as well as the side dishes. Staff are awesome. This is my favorite Korean restaurant!

wPJ8N0NQwrO9zu7mXiPbeg.text: This place is great! Warm atmosphere, friendly staff,  and great food, especially the bimbimbap with beef. I will definitely tell people about this place and I will definitely be back.

DFdfS7h6a6P-TMr8258IgA.text: Yum. Got the Las Vegas and it was plenty for the 2 if us. Meat and chicken were delicious. Definitely would go again.

bk2dcE0QpS4weuMCqTr8ZA.text: Service: Always on point. There may be a wait when you come on a busy Friday or Saturday night, but they are always very nice and courteous.   Atmosphere: Cozy and cute. Much better decorated than a lot of other KBBQ around town.   Food: AMAZZZZING! Being a LA native, we are constantly being spoiled with $9.99 to $16.99 AYCE KBBQ so it was a change to get out of the cheap AYCE mentality, but this place is definitely worth it! The portions are good, it will definitely fill you up. I usually get the "Gangnam" meal.   Price: It is a little bit on the pricey side compared to AYCE, but the meat quality makes it more than worth it.   Highly Recommend!

2bXuOXSXnmJ8S6jPGUq0rQ.text: I always love the  weekday 3-6pm happy hour on select beer and drinks at this spot. I usually order the brisket and bulgogi as well as the calamari. The restaurant is always clean and staff is friendly. I've had the other items on the menu before and they are on the pricy side but good. My bill during happy hour or getting the $49 meal for two is usually  the same as an all you can eat with a little bit less but higher quality food.

MzluvJjej_ZfDe7HSVQW6A.text: Service was exceptional. The menu is easy to discern to suit your individual taste. While I enjoyed the the food, atmosphere, and experience I wasn't as excited as other Yelpers.

f5scNCq4bd2jDIXAEtV-Nw.text: Had lunch Pork Belly. Kimchee was perfect.  Everything was just like Korean Style.  Price was reasonable and service top notch!  Sides made us happy. We're definitely going back here since we're locals.

cEDIoTbCRx-MAise6oo1cQ.text: The food is just amazing.   You simply can't go wrong. It was a lot of food for two of us.  We manage to finish.  You have to get a beer while eating.

Jfw4uKs4cE4rTe7BU8NmYQ.text: Love the food here! The servers are so nice. I even got a beer on the house from my server. He was awesome. Definitely recommend this place. 10/10!

PbkOsXiPXtMPSnv5cLb9Sw.text: Great place, good food and beer. Took my girl here and she enjoyed it as much as I did.

y7NnaSQQCfccFriqCxu40g.text: This was so much fun.  We came with another couple,  got a couple of things from the happy hour menu and then got the Las Vegas for 4. We were so full but it was all great we will be back!

ocHGIfQQgsKDtQVRkJtIwA.text: We had the Gangnam grill that was rated #1 it has several starters including fresh oysters, calamari, green salad, etc. bbq dishes include Korean Prime Kalbi, filet mignon, Bulgogi, etc they had a big salad. everything was delicious and seasoned well. The food cooked pretty fast. The complimentary sides were great as well esp the dried squid, cucumber kimchi, & bean sprout. The decor is elegant and romantic. The service is great! You can write a review and get a free desert.

cofng05QlH5C4web8euRFA.text: This place has a nice modern ambience.  They have music videos playing on a giant screen, but not to loudly, to give a slight party feel without intruding into your dinner conversation.    The menu is a la carte but the food quality is extraordinary. I've been to many KBBQs in Vegas, and this is by far my favorite. I've been here maybe 4-5 times.   Their spicy tuna appetizer is really good. The beef carpaccio is average, I ordered it once and never again.   The skirt steak, galbi, toro, bulgogi and filet are all excellent. Their beef tongue is the best in Vegas. The chicken here is okay, but I always get the chicken cheese fondue because I love cheese.  Overall, a great ambience, location, never any wait and great food quality. I will be back!

MFGfqlvZ_NmH15CuH3oYhA.text: Cool atmosphere. Friendly staff. And if your willing to pay extra, they offer "Kobe" type beef! Yum Yum!!!

QVF5r5cdHfUa7DsZmcybDg.text: Wonderful environment, tasty food and good services. This is the best Korean BBQ I have been in US. The kalbi bibibam is strongly recommended. I tried the original bibibam and meat lover, they are good.

x2wg41d_Cwu0YaW38dfd8Q.text: Great Korean food! Wait was long since the restaurant is small. Being from seoul and having eaten at many places i can say this place holds up to the bbq restaurants there.

LB32cKDiBkodtIrxznu2Vw.text: this place is fantastic!  i've done the whole korean bbq thing where you cook up your meats on your table yourself in LA once, with some Korean friends showing us how it works.  this is perfect and the food is great!  we loved the spicy tuna kimbap and the bimbimbap and the choice beef selections, and they had a happy hour special for us at midnight!  Our server was a fantastic host, to boot.  If you are staying at Hard Rock, it is just across the street (that's where we are staying).  I particularly like to get out of the casino restaurants and away from the strip and tourists when i come to Vegas.  This place is a great stop!  highly recommend

fc_SMPo3Cznj_qkOO4txtQ.text: I would have given it a five star if they have slice pickle radish and rice paper noodle to go with the bbq. However, that's beside the point right. There is good choices of meat here. And their meats are fresh and well marinated. Server are on point and friendly. Give it a try!

JP9upxQXTbyqv1aVQ8GRkg.text: We are from out of town and came due to the number of reviews and ratings. I'm not sure if I like this... despite this I was not disappointed. We just ordered the 5 different meat platters for 6 people. We came in on a Monday afternoon and had to wait for 30min...due to limited large table seating. We just asked to sit in a small booth and squeeze in, which they allowed. Service was okay.

l8iPqujAd3ktw18hrI3f2A.text: We booked almost one month ago . When we come to the restaurant, the waiter tell us they cannot find our reservation! It is thx giving!! Bad reception,suck!!!!

o-Xrh0wIwK-WzvuB-kj43g.text: dont go here , the server literally chased us down for a tip!!! mind you that the service was so bad, we literally had to raise our hand to get the servers attention and it took so long to get our change back. when we got our change and left one of the server came out and ask if  their service was great i replied with a no then he says if it was bad let us know bc i did not see any tip on the table how fucking rude then he goes back in and gives me a side eye. im so livid!!!

E0FK93_xRLTk_v_xyW2MQQ.text: We were a party of 5 and ordered the meat lovers combo for 4. Thinking that the portions would not be sufficient for us, we additionally ordered 2 orders of the  chicken wings and the seafood pancake.  Our server proceeded to bring what seems like an endless array of meats. Everything was good quality ,except for maybe the pork belly(bacon), it lacked taste and flavor. They were attentive to our needs until at the very end when it was time for us to get our check, it took to long, you would think that they would want to get you out ASAP so the table could be turned to awaiting. customers.

osO4R4foPmeLT79AbNFjNA.text: Food and service was great. Came in Friday at 530 and there was no wait. Ordered the Gangnam set.  Free macaroon with review.

x8WLT_H7LEy3a1790eCWBg.text: This is my very first Yelp review.  Yes, I found a restaurant bad enough to inspire me to write a review.   We were drawn to this restaurant because of all of the positive reviews on Yelp.  I was surprised by the volume of reviews for such a small restaurant.  Because of this, I had high expectations for my meal and was extremely  disappointed.  The food was terrible and low quality.  Luckily, the food was so bad we only ate a small portion of the meal.  Yes, we were lucky because we returned home to stomach pains. So how does the restaurant get so many good reviews? Each table has a sign that says you will get a free desert if you show your Yelp review to a server.  No, I did not get a free desert for writing this.  If the quality of their desserts matches the quality of the meal, I have no interest in trying anything else from the menu.   I am writing this review from the comfort of my own home where I am recovering from my dinner and wishing that I had spent my money elsewhere.

yYu-pnulb0H7ktuXaD-rkQ.text: Food was very good. I love it nice and clean no much smoke come out from grill. They give me a lot of potion set of Las Vegas for 2 people can't finish !# also happy hour a good deal 3pm-6pm so yummy food.

KWpOVcz_6JwMLqluBzmk1w.text: The meat is very good, the service was very friendly, but price and portion size is a little unreasonable but food was pretty good

X5KA13vApiXUvQ1M1lgAbw.text: Great food and great service. Strongly recommend! They have happy hour in the late night. Cheap and delicious!

MeOpgLLSzCQIqALi63zgCA.text: My husband and I have had korean bbq many times before but this place is by far my favorite! Best korean food I've ever had!!! Great atmosphere and service was great!!! Definitely will comeback again.

6z4zJ_lCN-k0Ef9zyseOgg.text: Tried it for he first time today. Ordered the Las Vegas and had left overs! The portion was a lot more then I thought it would be, which is a plus! Definitely will scale it down a little next time! Would recommend if yall need your Korean bbq fix.

JjtoaG1dmIz8J5U-C8oBcg.text: My boyfriend and I walked all the way from the strip just to eat here and it was well worth it! Delicious Korean BBQ!  Great portions for 2. Meat was flavorful and the servers were so respectful and great.  If we live in Las Vegas, we would be here at least once a week!

QRqzmR_iilpaOgORAqOJBQ.text: Great food and amazing service.  The staff is very friendly we will be coming back the next time we visit Vegas!

4ZJh2leF2Fjh22MzM1ctlQ.text: Had some sushi here with friends while staying at hotel.  Everything was great!  Server was fabulous, checking on us frequently. Food was also excellent!  I highly recommend this restaurant.

4NqSVAG5KzHdTnlQpEda3A.text: Great service and food. They were nice enough to cook up my barbecue as I multi-tasked with studying for an exam. Everything I ordered was wonderful. The scallops wrapped with bacon, the Kobe sliced beef and the fried pot-stickers and brown rice option were the best. I flavor was great and so was the atmosphere.  I plan to return.

mbASBxrl0ZtQlNw2NJXJMQ.text: We got a bbq combo for two and a couple of extra vegetable trays and I have to say everything was delicious. Service was quick and friendly.   The meat and oysters were fresh, the vegetables crunchy, and the marinades just right. The miso soup could have been better, but overall I'll come back again.

ys-yaWBBTw3cYn9QJoge3g.text: Wow what a hidden gem. Do yourself a favor and get off the strip for some really good food. Do not mistake this place for one of those cheap all you can eat Korean buffets. This place has set menus based on number of people or a la carte if you want to make your own combination. The must have appetizer is Uni and pork belly. It's low carb, fatty and creamy. All kinds of yummy goodness. Seriously. One order has two wraps so order accordingly.  The meat is such good quality. Trimmed and perfectly marbled. You can choose marinated or natural. I recommend natural since the quality of meat was excellent it doesn't need much. This is how you know the place is good when you grill the meat simply and dip it in a bit of sesame oil, salt and pepper.  This is now my new must go to place when I come to Vegas. One of the best Korean restaurants in Nevada and I highly recommend it.

ovbeFoFBbzpPTrUz6_UZKQ.text: I was in the mood for Japanese bbq so I randomly yelped this place.  So happy I found it!  I called for reservation for 03.21.16 (Monday) but the lady who answered said "is your party more than 8 people?" I said "no 5.  I wanted to make reservations for tonight at 10". She was like "oh no reservation. Just walk in"  That was weird. Are you not able to make reservations for under 8 people or what??  Any who I got there at 10pm and there was a 30 minute wait. We were able to sit down around 1040ish and by that time the restaurant was half empty.    TIP:  make sure you talk to a competent hostess who is able to make reservations because I've read the reviews and you're able to.  Or else go after 11pm so there's no wait.  - Kobe style beef - prime kalbi - flat iron garlic - premium tongue - pork toro  All of the meat was very very good and tender.  I recommend them all!

9t-TNWbEmcbsKfl148ICnw.text: First and it was so good..... Must try if your in vegas!!!! Bomb.com We got lad Vegas for the first time!!!

OeZiGMHXUKjcxxZ4fZ8F5A.text: Food was great. Very tasty, especially the meat dishes. However, some of the waiters were not polite to answer the guests asks. I was ignored 3 times, and I had to ask another waitor.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yay!

iGveLuqt9SBDy8IVkqJPJA.text: They have the set menus, making it easier to order even if you are novice for Korean food.  Everything tasted so good. Great service too.  I will definitely come back!

EHTeAm3qrWyKdbL4NC3KXA.text: Food was amazing! We had fresh, delectable oysters and yummy gyoza for appetizers. We read all the amazing reviews from yelp with the food, but we honestly didn't expect such an impressive dining experience.  Service was prompt and efficient and waitstaff were very friendly.  We would definitely come back next time we're in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NMvCmWN5ABEIhW89taReFg.text: Came here on Saturday for happy hour, there were a lot of people waiting for a seat.  The hostess was nice and honoured our happy hour even though we got seated a little after six.  They were accommodating which made our party very happy.   We ordered and tried all the dishes on the happy hour. The beef Toro and pork belly were one of our favourite.  The fondue cheese was interesting to dip the meat in.   I liked how we each had our own individual sauces, 3 different type.  One was like a pretty ponzu, one was like a teriyaki, and another a spicy teriyaki.   We tried the premium prime Kalbi and it was really tender.  We had to order another plate so we could each get another bite.   The waiters are friendly and always around to take orders.   And best of all, for being a great yelper and doing a review, we got a free macaron.

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h0Oo2axeAO6Oq7FAApzEEg.text: Great Korean BBQ / yakiniku in the strip mall across the street from the Hard Rock.  We ordered the Premium Combo for six ($270) and were stuffed!  All the meats were of excellent quality -- we much preferred this over Magal in Chinatown, but it was also about 40% more expensive.   Really liked the beef carpaccio too, though the poke was skippable since it was over sauced.  We were a bit worried by the cheesy name but were glad we went!

BR7hGS-TGQHenXGg4Wo3Mw.text: Our first time here. Very good taste. I love the seaweed and salad. Meat lover as well. Affordable price. Highly recommended. They have a Good customer service.

-wnaX_2u_2KK6DG5PQJzgw.text: Everything was wonderful about this meal and restaurant.  Service and staff was excellent and the food was so delicious!  The value was very reasonable too.  I'd definitely recommend and will come back.

LwDx3N3d6nm2xpWB1I-67w.text: So my wife and I come to this place all the time. It's by far the best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas. The happy hour is awesome with 1/2 price drinks. The Korean Prime Kalbi and Flat Iron Garlic are faves. We love the dumplings (ask for them fried) in the spicy sauce.   The service is friendly, the food is awesome.   Be prepared to wait if you come at dinner time on Friday and Saturday. If you are still reading this review I will fill you in on a trick. Instead of waiting with the plebes in the waiting area, go sit at the bar and have a drink and appetizer. They encourage it.

FoGrzN4rtvCqyvm2YzuTog.text: Good tasting Korean BBQ for the right prices. Good serving staff and quality meats. Value restaurant.

1Oi-daQtESR2QQrtqBabPQ.text: Good experience overall we tried the prime kalbi,flat iron garlic, Kobe style beef and the best was the Korean prime kalbi. Good vibe and service by all staff.

P9zGk_saTtx4Q_jwt2-XbQ.text: The food here is so good , perfect place to go for a late night meal . Although, i would go anytime of the day. Wait staff was very friendly & food was served really quick. Will definitely be going back next time I am in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bimbimbap with Tofu !  So good!

34FR9XZO-OGuaNwSjh9CmQ.text: Staff was ok. They gave off an unfriendly vibe and looked like they're forced to be there. Must be a family owned restaurant. The food matched their service, "ok", not good, not special. Wouldn't come here again.

50wh0Ke5lkKkPEOIzAOEdA.text: Coming from LA where KBBQ is everywhere and amazing, this was a disappointment.   My friends and I came in late on a Friday night after a long drive to Vegas. We were stoked to find a KBBQ so close to the strip! Got there around 11pm as they close around 1am. The restaurant was pretty empty. We were seated quickly and told it was happy hour! Score! Here's what we ordered:   - fried calamari, 2/5 - chicken karaage, 4/5 - beef toro, 3/5 - pork belly, 3/5 - beef bulgogi, 3/5  Everything was mediocre. Nothing out of the ordinary and pricey for the size of the portions. We ended up ordering 3 orders of the beef toro! What really gave this place low stars was the service. They were nice and all but seriously nowhere to be found whenever we needed anything. Our orders took forever to come out and after the long drive, we just wanted to eat! Also, our grill was literally on fire until someone casually came out and changed it. Our server also made weird, awkward, borderline inappropriate jokes and just gave the whole experience a weird vibe.   Don't think I'll be back. So many other places to hit up that's ten times better!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Karaage, my fav from the whole meal!
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hOSOzm2cHXP6RS78fceaCw.text: Some of the best Korean food.  Always hot and they have fast service. Never had my order wrong. Been going there over 3 years . They have great prices for the amount of food!

ZpdRVw_VyAnB2-kprqHp8w.text: Super classy,  fun,  and tasty.  This is one we will come back to again for sure.  The bbq , meats,  appetizers,  and accompanied food are great.

YPfFHX3KfcFqQH7kLtcsAQ.text: Pretty great Asian BBQ! Came here on a whim after seeing 900+ reviews - well in accordance with the star rating.  Tons of food. Will definitely recommend!

Hi9hsK-xwL70TC5jieS5TQ.text: I've had a lot of Korean BBQ and this place is my favorite. I like how you can cook the meat on your own. This means that no meat gets cold and hard cause you're chowing on something else. Also the smaller portions mean you can try different meats without committing to one type. Servers came by and checked on us often, great service.

QLv2To644vOEucDltz2bpg.text: The food here is really good. We order a #1 set for two. The meat are very delicious and I think is enough for three. I also recommend Uni bimbambamp.

vlOjOFrxhExgnPaeoJiJvQ.text: I've had Korean BBQ before and this by far exceeded my expectations. The staff was exceptionally friendly and honest with their recommendations. I loved the fact that we got to do our own cooking! The meat was well seasoned before hand and the appetizers were great! I would definitely recommend it!

KK61dCXPtZDXjE3eHniSpQ.text: Amazing food. The kobe beef is so marbled and the banchan are perfect. They have teokbokki which i'm obsessed with. Perfect dinner!

dlilfDI7DDHWJFGunmsXgw.text: Surprisingly good Korean food with a large variety here in Vegas.  Only wish the filet was sliced more uniformly.

xetMmqNMPAWEYQPte1qBfQ.text: Service here was awesome again thanks to Andrew. He made sure everything was great making sure lemonade was topped and grill was just the right heat. This is family fav spot will for sure be coming here again and again. Thanks Andrew and the rest of the crew at Gagnum.

bmge4Vw71GpmCEEJf76Q_A.text: Love this place!! Amazing food! Must try! Good atmosphere! Must visit during your trip to Vegas. Unbeatable

j28tJrotO7wzPhND8LPbWQ.text: Mmmm. Very filling & delicious meal before Day 2 of EDC! My group had 5 people, and surprisingly... a 4 person set was almost too much food! Very awesome selection of meats + sides. Highly recommended. :)

cNDPYRFbhXaTojNFHQThMQ.text: Best Korean food in town.   Happy hour items are amazing.  We ordered every one of the BBQ and appetizer.  It was such a great value.  Our total cost was only about thirty five dollars for four people. In the end, we were all pretty full. Unfortunately here is no salad and rice is not include, but , can be purchased for extra cost. The Beef toro is really tender so we ordered two plates of it. I would also recommend all the chicken items. Not only that all of them were three dollars,but it was really juicy and tender. I was not disappointed with anything.  The grill does burn a bit but we only needed to change it once.  The side dishes were cake, spicy cucumbers, sweet suit, kimchi, pickled onions and macaroni cheese.  The service is really good. The waitresses were all really nice and kept checking on us.  The location is a bit far from where I live. It is tucked in with a Cvs and a hot dog place.

l0kvX6Tum37RXViI9XsEQg.text: We had a party of 7 on a Friday night and were seated pretty quickly.  Food and service was good.  The shrimp bibimbap was lacking though.  I am used to my bibimbap having an egg and lots of veggies but this particular one mostly came with rice and shrimp.  The side dishes were plentiful and yummy!

-AXMnRl7EQVJq21KQe3tGA.text: Food is really good and prices are decent but boy that service is awful.  If you don't mind bad service as in forgetting things you ordered than this is good place.  But good is good and reasonable.

N0FDaJJrKY3t0NNMDDslHQ.text: We got the Gangnam grill set and it was so filling! Would definitely recommend if you're looking for a delicious meal at an an affordable price.  Service is A+

wKLmoKupGPkIHzkwyZIuRg.text: Very good food and great service!  A little bit pricy but worth the money.

IMbwlVcIXl0hvj86-4T2mw.text: The meat was so tender, and everything tasted AMAZING. Will come back when we visit NV again.

u0DMcp4izjbsKlNiDXA6Hw.text: This was my first time here. Came with my husband, brother , and his girlfriend. They were very quick to get us seated , take our order, and get our food out. The food was very delicious. We got the meat lovers for four. I also got the egg ramen noodles, but I wasn't too impressed with that. But everything else was quite tastey. The reason that I didn't give this place a five star rating is because once the food was on the table no one came by to check on us. We all needed refills on water and my husband needed another beer. Also, the check was brought before asking if we needed anything else which we were interested in dessert. This is a huge pet peeve of mine. We ordered the honey bread and it took 25 minutes to come out. That's way too long for toasted bread and ice cream in my opinion. However, it was delicious.

DfajOzY-MeAFRk8nhDkOFw.text: Place was great. Very friendly waiters. The food was delicious. Great sake. Haramae miso is a must. This was my first time here and i am definitely coming back when I am in sin city.

tG_lMc9YA9C9XEBZEXpVcQ.text: Arrived in Vegas around 8-9 PM so we decided to come here since it was open late. Started out with Spicy Tuna Kimbap which was pretty tasty. If you never had it before it was just tempura fried sushi rolled topped with spicy tuna. We also had the fried calamari, I thought their tempura batter was one of the best I've had in a long time. We didn't pick any of their packages since there were some items we did not want. We had prime Kalbi (decent but I've had much better in KC and LA), pork belly, beef Toro, Tongue, and mushroom medley (this comes out cooked already for you). All in all the service was excellent, food was great but I think we had better in LA and Kansas City. I thought the best cut of meats was way better in Kansas City. Maybe the mid-west have better cuts of meat??? Since we got there after 10 PM it was happy hour so a lot of our items were priced lower than usual so that was a big plus. We both had all the food for about $40. For the price and great service,  I would still recommend this place and I would come back again soon.

C08sheS2TdYd1DB4otN90A.text: This was our second visit in 1 week and again it was quite honestly faultless. On our first visit the we ordered a large bbq set, and this time we got soup and noodles. Both were excellent. Service was attentive, yet personal and really quite delightful that all the ladies here are so lovely. The food was traditional and beautifully cooked and presented. Staff were knowledgeable and rather fun, it's lovely to see people enjoy their job! Food was promptly served and there was plenty of it.

7WId0j47R5szue04KTc9FQ.text: This place is not "cc", but the quality was so good.  Service was also exceptional.   If you can, ask for the rear private room for six or more.  The privacy made the meal a fantastic feast.  Do try to made it here before 5:30 and take advantage of the lower prices.

oTTGfAocYKXP8--8mSDP9g.text: Most of the staff were nice, but this one rude waiter just walked away while we were ordering. I guess he got bored with our order??I wasn't funny enough for him?? Epic wait between ordered food delivery to the table.

h_1fkNhZUABtIb2kTIQrzg.text: Fresh oyster Soft meat  Kkbq ready to eat Free macaroon Servers are fast and friendly

y1sdmj89Y2n1NfDWSmABMA.text: Love this place. It never disappoints me! I have came here a few times last few years. They always good bbq. Their meat is thin cut and easy to consume. I will come back again soon.

tyiKeBK_PFm-iyh_e3N-sQ.text: Went to the place for the first time off the yelp reviews. The food is ok, but the customer service was the worst I have ever experienced in my life. Servers were very mean and inappropriate.  When I asked if I can take away the unfinished alcohol drink after we finish eating, the serve questioned me whether I know how much it cost for their alcohol license cost. Personally, I think he should approach me in a more appropriate and nicer way. Will definitely not recommend this place to anyone. Will never ever go back for the rest of my life. Worst service!!! I am giving one star cause there is no zero star opinion available.

nXkrpgA_ZSniWfFDbmEbHA.text: Absolutely delicious. The garlic steak and filet was phenomenal. The noodles, sweet corn, awesome. I would highly recommend everyone coming if they get the chance. The staff is so friendly and quick. A great experience.

2PttWIb88ElxSnGSBkndYA.text: I am a fan of the place. It's near campus and the selection was really good. The quality of the meat and side dishes were standard and tasted pretty good. I liked the desert (honey bread I think), it was unique and it really ended my meal on a high note. The service was good, but not amazing, the facility was clean, only one person could use the restroom at a time which can be inconvenient if you visit during a rush.

ZQ-hdw0ee5J2BuEMwi-fKQ.text: This is the best Korean BBQ restaurant.  The servers are nice. They give you plenty of side dishes. Their fast and waiting tone is not bad at all.  Highly recommended always packed. Try it and and you'll always want to come back.

GZ87Pmo3gDpHu7ahNGPLSw.text: Best Korean BBQ I had so far!!! All their staff are nice. We came on a busy Friday but it didn't take long before we were seated. Our server guided us in the menu and we ended up getting the Meat Lover, prime kalbi (w/ is sooooooo good!) and bacon wrapped scallops. All their banchans are twice the size of the usual banchan from other restau. All meat are fresh and tasty. We enjoyed our meal and will surely come back!

xhIDGRRLwRF8_Vy7PWBnLQ.text: This place is as good as it gets for Korean BBQ.  We had the Gangnam for 4 and it was the perfect amount of food.  The raw oysters that came with it was fresh, BBQ was so flavorful.  The bulgogi bi bim bap was yummy in my tummy.  It satisfied 4 hangry Asians and a definite try if you're in Vegas.

OI69HrmhJIy9H7oQ4rG5BQ.text: Intrigued by all these yelp reviews, I decided to come forward and see what the hype was all about. I love korean bbq, I love japenese bbq, but I've never tried both at the same time. Where to start?  Staff was nice, only took about 7 1/2 minutes in between to refill my water from when it was empty and full. Ordered that $70 combo meal with a side of pork belly.  Sauces came out and dropped off with no description, but thank god for having taste buds I were able to figure out what each sauce was.  Meats came out before all the appetizers, and I guess raw oysters were to serve as my dessert? Lol.. The filet mignon did not go well with my raw oysters, as well as my super sweet and sauced up bibimbap. Teriyaki sauce galore I guess.  Meat quality was probably close to tofu hut which would of been nice if they had a $10 AYCE.  House salad was meh, soup was meh meh, everything meh. Granite the staff was nice and lagged on getting stuff for us, like water, dropped chopsticks, and napkins and all that. No biggie I'm asian, I'm use to eating with my hands.  I normally don't like to bash on businesses but I feel like this place has gotten way more love than they should. All the 4 or 5 star ratings might have come from drunks or people with no taste buds. Best of luck to this place, yelp you failed me.

TYtx5Tfa31ORJzLFkaUgsg.text: The food here is delicious! A great place to enjoy Korean BBQ. The service was attentive, friendly and helpful. The choice of meats was excellent as was the quality. I can say without a doubt that this is as good if not better than some of the places I have eaten at in Korea Town in NYC. The fact that this place is off the strip makes it even better as most people who frequent it are avid fans of Korean cuisine rather than a bunch of tourists.

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dK31DmxidAllEl7o1D7LdQ.text: This place is tasty and i had to go back a second time during my trip. Everyone is very friendly

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K3g7-5VbSP3_VmbEgV41Gw.text: We came during happy hour, and surprisingly, there wasn't a long line. We ordered beef toro, pork belly, fried calamari, and daengjang jigae (soybean paste soup). I don't recommend the beef toro because the tough texture. However, the quality of the pork belly was pleasing since it had minimal fat in it. Also, fried calamari was wonderful! The sauce that came with the calamari was very delicious! Lastly, the daengjang jigae was tasty. TBH you can never go wrong with daengjang jigae lol   I would honestly give this rating a 3 star, but a particular waiter bumped it up to a 4 star. I definitely have to give a shoutout to Joseph! There was a waitress who seemed annoyed and very impatient with us from the start, but luckily, we had a change in service halfway through our meal. Joseph was nice and actually cared about the customers! Thanks again for your kind gestures! We really appreciated it! :)

mxaoZPnXWOMkZ9AYTC1_PA.text: 10/10 maybe even higher This is my first Korean BBQ dining experience. The service was extremely quick, scary quick. Meals were out in under 5 minutes for us to cook. Service staff was happy and helpful! Beef was EXTREMELY juicy and succulent. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE. Straight off a direct flight from FLL to LAS VEGAS and this was the best place to head to first, even before the hotel.

nCvc-AMYMTvYW0DHEAuzsQ.text: Great place for KBBQ, I get hungry thinking about it. I don't even live in Vegas and I have a ton of checkins here. That's got to say something! Every time I travel to LV, I come to this place. Happy hour rocks! 50% off! I had Bulgogi, Beef Toro, pork belly, and chicken karaage. The bacon wrapped asparagus is excellent too. It was accompanied by the kimchi apps. I also had a ginger soju cocktail for $3.75. Love it. They are very busy so be patient and kind, you'll get the best service.   Great place to have what your heart desires, Gangnam brings the best of Japanese soups, pork Toro, and sausages with Korean BBQ, bibimbap, and Chigae. If you don't know those words, you have to try it. Order 4 BBQ items and get the complimentary side dishes. Also, to complete the fabulous fare, order soju with lemon or yuzu chum charum. Free dessert if you rate them on Yelp. :)  Seating is super hard, bring a cushion. They played too much hip hop and not enough KPop.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Order the Soju, it&#39;s so good

V-9LiSchJZtuf1_AMcBA-g.text: We were craving korean BBQ and walked 1.5 miles here to try it out since the place has 4.5 stars and over 800 reviews.   We reached in time for the Happy Hour and they have a great bbq and appetizer menu. We had jalapeno poppers with salmon (real jalapeno and it had a great kick!), fried calamari, garlic calamari, beef toro, pork belly, korean chicken with fondue, bulgogi and spicy pork and they are all pretty tasty. The price was also reasonable around $2-$4 for the happy hour dishes and around $4-$9  for non happy hour dishes. The servings are also pretty good sized.   The only down side is that we had to pay for lettuce and miso which is usually free. I would definitely come back here again.

xh4t3j74vC6bZ_IzUWHq1w.text: Open late and away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. Two thumbs up for late night happy hour. Lots of choices & really good quality meat. They also have soup, bibimbap, appetizer, and vegetable choices.   Try:   Meat items: harami miso, rib eye, beef bulgogi, spicy pork, toro beef, & bacon wrapped scallops!   Appetizers: poke, spicy tuna kimbap  The servers are all really friendly & accommodating. We were the only party there around 11pm but it worked out since our party had 15 people.

We ordered the Prime Kalbi, Korean Prime Kalbi (marinated), Beef Toro (brisket), Flat Iron Garlic steak, Bulgogi, bacon wrapped Enoki mushrooms and Jap Chae.  The meats were fresh and tender.  Brisket had very little fat for a change.  The Jap Chae glass noodles with beef is BIG and delicious.  Good value.

M1LFsqhQHmq2D6Di6yT_ow.text: Food was excellent and a good value. We had a party of five. The short rib friend rice was so delicious. Our service was lacking though. We had to flag down the hostess to get our drinks refilled and our check at the end of the meal. Our waitress seemed to be purposely ignoring us.  That being said, the food made up for it! ErGw9LKjaIm2V5SoGwjRXw.text: Second time coming here and quality and value still as good as the first. We were a group of 5 people. We got the gangnam for two people and added extra meat to it and it was enough for all of us.    Service is awesome and fast. Servers were attentive and friendly. Never felt bad to stop anyone and ask for a favor. Willing to come back!

mLS-xirToP2C9w2ST30Zhw.text: Great Korean food off the strip in Vegas. I consider myself a Korean food connoisseur and this place did not disappoint! The choice of meats and seafood as well as the great service left a lasting impression. I'll definitely be back!

KrJNSC-9_okmAy6_F2nCLQ.text: We came on Father's Day so I'd understand the delays and misunderstandings  Any way... We walked in and was told to wait since we had a 7 people party which meant our wait was going to be longer than the shorter parties  After what seemed for a eternity (40mins) we were finally sat down and ordered our food  Everything tastes great and was priced very reasonable the servers kept coming in with our orders and taking our requests for water.  All in all the only thing that keeps me from giving it 5 stars was the fact that the front seems to have a AC issue since is pretty warm in the front which can get annoying and it you have to wait it might incline you to walk out. But if you stick through it you'll enjoy your time here

ptg74NfUy_qNd2HMn035bQ.text: Food excellent...meat so tender...and such great flavor to Everything... Service A+....Friendly... There at every moment of need..Will be back again to try other selections...:))
