Zr5doK4ujWf-x_YKTQ4JYw.text: Service was great. Ordered kobe beef, pork cheek, pork belly, and kalbi... i would skip the pork belly next time and double the pork cheek cause it was BOMB! and the kobe beef just melted loke butter. Good side dishes also.

97HFW9Y4gdNDe18nSnUO6w.text: Great place! Good food with excellent happy hour. Everything was fresh and tasty. Short Drive off the strip and make it down here you won't be disappointed. Short ribs were excellent and so was the filet. The music videos are a a little annoying playing in the background with some edgy rap playing  at times

60ek34RtG0y4zPAeAEeWww.text: My boyfriend and I always come here when we vist. Love this place especially the Korean Prime Kalbi

RxIiuNdmGdSGrZmCkrje0w.text: This place is as good as it gets when it comes to Korean BBQ!  I have been here 4 times now and they never disappoint!  Top quality meats, friendly service and a good atmosphere.  This is definitely my go to place when I am in LAS!  Can't wait to go back!

LExANg7Ch5CFU13wnjXYBg.text: The food is delicious!! But, the service leaves something to be desired. I know the tip was already included because our group was 8 people, but that doesn't mean they could slack off. We literally were clearing our own plates from the table. And when we asked to have the table cleared before dessert, we just received a confused look. They definitely did not deserve the 18% tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hh_NBCOHbFD_k6k2RIx2Kg.text: Should not give any star. Last night around 9pm I ate at this restaurant. This morning starting 2-3AM, I had very serious diarrheas and vomiting.  Even right now, still having watering diarrhea and yellow vomiting. I  never had such  bad food poison before in my entire life. We ordered some Korean traditional rib and raw osyter. I guess raw osyter probably imported from Japan or bad sources.  US Government already baned importing from Japan because of    a lot of Japanese food contaminated from radiation.

n0m9rjROVnwN1tNm_0lS6A.text: Great food! Great service! Great prices for Happy Hour. Must get spicy chicken and spicy garlic edamame is to die for! Sukiyaki noodles are great!

noZagaZEs7kH0_sC0bxlVA.text: Be prepared to wait on weekends. Hostess said 30 mins. but ended up waiting over an hour. But once you sit down, food comes out super fast.  We ordered the gungnam set for two and it was a lot for two people. So come hungry!

OqB8Pi3btfqQmWKoELEG0A.text: Highly recommend. We had the daily special. Three of us had plenty of good food for lass then $50. If you like Korean BBQ you will love this restaurant.

fGIamKU0n6kMqzL5gGI7Tg.text: Awesome flavor and very spicy!! Always a good meal here. Good place to bring a group of to bbq or just to get noodles. I love the spicy tuna kimbapp but maybe it has a bit too much mayonnaise in the sauce.

CIoNRWQ5ZwWhycVN2bAxaA.text: For our last night here in Vegas, we were in search of something filling and delicious - and this place easily delivered!   The service here is awesome! We were warmly greeted at the door, and the servers here were very attentive.   THE FOOD! There wasnt one thing we regreted ordering. If it wasnt for the awesome variety of food to choose from, I wouldve ordered the Harami Miso all night! So tender and tasty.. do yourself a favor and grab 2 (or 3) of these.   Also, make your taste buds happy and grab the Spicy Tuna Kimbap. If i didnt love my wife, I wouldve hog cheese that thing and ate the whole thing. Im from Hawaii, so spicy tuna over cooked rice isnt uncommon, but there's were definitely the best i've ever had..  definitely one of the best cook your own food style of eating ive ever been too. great quality of food and awesome service. you cant go wrong by dining here!

8WQrO_c84C2BYC_duCfiRw.text: Awesome kbbq! Must try the Korean Style Kalbi :) Veggie grill dish are also good. Fun and delicious place. Highly recommend!!!

mSL1fzqT_zLbmGaRUP7ujA.text: Fun atmosphere and great food. Felt a little pricey for what you got though. Definitely take advantage of the happy hour special (3-6, 10-1am) if possible.

p3FI-ijRUkjoFUwrKU51Hg.text: Great Korean BBQ dinner. Great service. Really liked the bulgogi. Food served quickly.

IqSEFmwoDjT5kspXn4H5QQ.text: Ordered the meat lovers combo and it was enough for three people. The side dishes are amazing. We were in a hurry and the service was quick.

EsM80643QUWM-uxFOQHOYw.text: Food was pretty amazing. I ordered their bulgogi, spicy chicken, spicy pork, spicy squid, spicy chicken karage, fried calamari, and pork belly. The bulgogi and spicy pork had the best flavor and were my favorite, but everything was good. I suggest eating when they have happy hour. You get a ton of food for a decent price. Service was great as well. They were very friendly and always made sure everything was okay. I would definitely come back again.

1g242jbiPYuRlcaQNCFxfw.text: Wow. The food was great, but the waiters rarely came back to our table. But when they did, they were extremely nice. Overall, great experience.

MW5ZVv2PUepXOiaM6vx2Ag.text: Very pleased to report excellent experience here. We got the meat lover's spread and loved every bite. Also pleased when the check came and it was about half of what I expected. Will definitely return for more!

Y5l2xCtNTQJwlPeVucZRmQ.text: This place does happy hour on food 7 days a week! Til 5pm then 10-2am.  Really yummy, clean and nice. I don't feel uncomfortable for being a white girl at Korean BBQ like I do at other joints in town. Really friendly guy waiter every time I come here late night. Sapporo on draft too!

bg_Qb11YDFqN-SobgkCJYA.text: The service is really great! Great for late night groups to have a few drinks and good Asian BBQ.  The price is very reasonable. You can come dressed up on a date or totally casual. I recommend this place for people that wanna have a nice chill spot to eat good Asian BBQ.

QnvPE7nU0Nb4g_jsdq3mmA.text: So I picked this place on our weekend getaway with the family. This place didn't make any fake reviews after dining here.  Our server Andrew was awesome! It didn't take long for us to be served. He explained the menu clearly. Kids loved the food. Complimentary side of squid was pretty tasty. I just wish they had the rice paper available. All in all it was a nice dining experience.

LpOTUM4LVfqcZq3HNCuxqQ.text: The gangnam and bibimbap were good. But the ramen was like instant ramen (do not recommend). I would definitely come here again though!

rfHbSirfi44vVbqw9OvI6g.text: This place is really good, have large portions and the meat (for our meat lovers meal) is plenty. I liked it since the miso soup in the beginning and it was good through out. We also got the seafood pancake and that was great, but tooo much food, we had to do take home on a lot of the meat. Would come back.

ypg3sAsEDYCAhDw3ipfOKA.text: I like the atmosphere of this restaurant. Servers are nice. The food is also delicious. I love the spicy pork sooo much.

PzuwwMbspYguNVdT9wmvLA.text: Amazing place for Korean bbq! Everything is fresh, great service, and fun experience. Will definitely be coming back.

kTrzKfWIPHPteY2PAJDYpQ.text: This place offers great service.  The staff is friendly and the food taste wonderful. We had a combo for 2.  The portion is good and it was worth the experience. I would suggest people to come to this place for lunch and dinner.

-_IoulZMU_NC4PZil4U91A.text: Great restaurant. Great barbecue. This is definitely the best korean bbq in Las Vegas. Great service as well.

rfv2Caa9T-adIP5YdkwzRA.text: Enjoyed the feature of cooking our choice of food right at the table. I would recommend everyone try this at least one time.

QVAneutgWbl9AS-SvTeuxA.text: Because of their massive amount of reviews and high rating we wanted to try out on a Sat night.  Food: We ordered premium combo and they didn't serve us oysters and scallops. We did a lot of talking during dinner and didn't pay attention if they served the right food. We found out after we left and this is not cool. Can we say they treat on their menu? The Kobe carpaccio didn't look as good as the picture. And their shrimp Bibimbap tasted horrible.  Service: I understand Sat is always awfully busy. So we ended up eating without drinks. Finally we got our drinks on the halfway of our dinner. BTW, they use very cheap wine to make Sangria. I can't taste the difference but my friend is a wine expert. :(

25arERAxvsgpXcVU-rQxig.text: I can see why this place has so many good reviews! Food was great, service was great! You get to cook your own meat with the grill. We got the pork belly, basil chicken and a variety of other meats and veggies. The steamed egg was huge! And so good! I would definitely come back here again.

brGsbM1UALKpoIDR1SSAKg.text: Pros: Good place to sample decent Korea BBQs. Think of it like Korean food served in Japanese portions.   Con: It's a popular place and that means you wait...and wait...  Honestly, If you're looking for more authentic Korean taste and variety, there are other Korean restaurants near by.  The menu price seems a bit lower than other Korean restaurant price, but when you get your typical fill of meat, you do end up paying about the same.

54zHvy8je4HNx95AcUH5HQ.text: I love all the options here. My wife and I tried the Happy hour. We were impressed! The staff was very helpful!. We will be back A+ Service here.

tvgLIrDC1bXhby0qFjH-lA.text: We came during Happy Hour but ordered some regular items as well.  The fried happy hour items were terrible and greasy, like they were cooked an hour ago.  The Kal bi, brisket and bulgogi is still our favorite but there wasn't anything really special.  We get this kind of fare all over LA and Orange county in CA.  This still beats eating on the overpriced strip hotels.

MYPA8IDGaPmnDFLWI8A4ZA.text: I was disappointed with this restaurant. The idea of cooking our own Asian BBQ fusion seemed fun enough, but only if correctly executed. The meat came at least 15 minutes ahead of my broccoli fondu, then the fondue was overheated so half of the cheese was stuck to the container. Then they never brought our steamed rice either! After we asked about the rice, they asked us if we wanted to cancel the rice instead of taking it to go like we asked, because they were trying so hard to shove us out of the booth so they could give it to the next customer. To top off this poor dining experience, the waiter briskly dropped the check at the table without refilling my empty drink, or asking if we wanted dessert. I'm scared away from gimmick restaurants for life. Awful!!!

K-7ZiDO9m2xVVxonLZ_wgA.text: One of the best Korean restaurants I've been to. Good in pricing and the food was so flavorful and delicious. My favorites were the BBQ beef ribs and spicy rice cakes! I wish we could've ate more but it was just me and my husband so we wasted a lot of the food since we were leaving to the airport right after our meal. Will definitely come again !

6wrHGTYMAiq3dAGeGJhTwQ.text: Update: came back for happy hour and the prices were great. Service was great too. Would highly recommend for others to try!!  The food was amazing! It definitely is quality you can taste!! The servers were attentive and demonstrated teamwork. The 1.5 hour wait was worth it and we will definitely return next time we visit Vegas!! The only improvements I can recommend are the seats (really hard and uncomfortable) and the waitlist protocol. They should have a buzzer or take down phone number to send a text. We had to wait even longer because they supposedly called out our name four times and we went for a stroll since there were still 6 parties in ahead of us.

zjn1GmIY7-OF0V2AMP6aGQ.text: Even though this is my 2nd time coming and my only Korean BBQ joint I've had a great experience

y5SitSoWWj30zxasdYADbQ.text: We come here because of my friend's recommendation and their over 2300 reviews on Yelp. Nice and clean. Good food. Serve very fast and the staffs are friendly.  The reason why I don't give them 5 stars because squid and pork belly are not really fresh.

Et3SngOHHSN6SJxUfSo6-w.text: One of the best Korean bbq places! and this is coming from a Korean who is from LA :)  Def worth your money   One slight downside is that they don't cook the meat for u. But it's all good, ambience and good made up for it all

OtzyqJ47QrY76fvkHd7LVw.text: Great Korean BBQ! All the meats are good, especially the duck breast garlic and Korean prime kalbi. Glad we found this place and will be on our list to come back to when we come to Vegas again.

TJIhT9KZrBKm5Emwn4XMMQ.text: So one might say Korean BBQ isn't the best EDC-recovery food but we were around the area and decided to check this place out due to the raving reviews (and also because we were tired of paying $$$ for mediocre Asian food on the strip).  The wait was around 15 minutes at 1:30pm on a Monday (although the lady on the phone gave us an hour wait on the phone just 10 minutes before we arrived). We ordered spicy ramen with Japanese sausages, marinated Kalbi, Bulgogi, and thinly sliced toro. All were super delicious!  Overall, very impressed by the quality of this Las Vegas Korean restaurant, I think we'll definitely be back if we're staying on the strip again. My only complaint was that it was 110 degrees outside and either the AC was broken or wasn't on strong enough but we were sweating through the meal ):

HvO-xVx3E1ggvXj_ixQRqA.text: This was a very positive experience. The food was good and the people were friendly. The meat lovers hit the spot.

eLTe7MCWZVQx7gxklH4oSA.text: Between the strip and the airport - this is some awesome KBBQ that won't break your wallet. Service is great and it makes me feel like I'm back in Santa Clara's Ktown area. It's surprising and relieving to find some tasty food off the strip. I'm sure Vegas has a ton of it - I just never get to venture out as much and I'm glad to have found this spot.  They've got combo options that breaks everything into sets for a group which makes things easy. There were so many side dishes, we barely had room on the table for everything!  Clutch spot if you're hungover from partying and looking for some KBBQ to help ease the pain.

BFbRB7rIS8Ym9AIu93giHg.text: Best korean food in Las Vegas. Our family come to Las Vegas about 3 times a week. We always stop by here to get some korean food. Our favorite is bibimbab and galbi stew. Great food.

QYdK50mEJzmvETwWem6Iqw.text: My niece had 2nd thoughts. So so glad she/we did go. Really delicious. Fun. Do not miss out.

vHdDkqMblsKaILrPCoaPIQ.text: You can really tell that they use quality ingredients. The service is good and they do attend to your very need. I like how everything is catagorized, and you do get what you pay for. This is now our go to place for Korean BBQ fix.

qcimq1IppCxdHR60Gsq0Wg.text: You can really tell that they use quality ingredients. The service is good and they do attend to your very need. I like how everything is catagorized, and you do get what you pay for. This is now our go to place for Korean BBQ fix.

T8a8gGqKkO_j52hBmYprWA.text: Place is delicious.  Korean bbq is as good as anywhere.  The environment is like a traditional korean bbq joint got remodeled for millenial families.  Dig it.

wJ1CRZHoei_FjZugfA9ZMg.text: My wife and I recently had dinner at Gangnam and really enjoyed most everything.  We had the Premium selection and it was a ridiculous amount of food.   I thought the ambiance was nice and it is always fun to grill your own food - adds a little entertainment factor to the meal.  The service was good, but I wish they explained things a little better.  I felt a bit like it was speed dating.  The dropped the food off and ran.  The three sauces were also indistinguishable and I didn't know which foods they paired with.  I would come here again.

cl20fUwtCKSX3LLGc5090Q.text: Wow... Bomb.com Best KBBQ I've had in a long time. Seriously delicious. You might need to bring a change of shorts when you come. You'll bust over the taste.

gHmO-oTpfTE-c3Y5iV0wHQ.text: Great Korean BBQ place located in a small strip mall right across from the Hard Rock Hotel. There's some parking out front but plenty of spots towards the back. I was there on a Sunday night for dinner and it was pretty busy. I opted for a seat at the bar to skip the wait. The only difference sitting there is the food is cooked for you and bought out to you instead of cooking it at the table.  They had some combos for parties of two, four or six. You can also order individual plates. I think you have to order at least two to get the free sides.  I ended up trying the Bulgolbi, spicy pork and the sweet corn. All three were good. The pork was a little sweet but it was good.  The sides were Kim chi, spicy bean sprouts, spicy cucumbers, and three others that I forgot but all were good. A very filling meal.  Service was excellent even though it was busy. I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jsiR2alxd8baeieMFD63aA.text: Great food! Must visit. Yum! Try the Apetizers. Nice section. Very tasty. Come in groups.  Reasonable prices too.

YAfjf0B-DeI-XO8fJijRvw.text: This is such an addicting place.   I looooove going here, especially for lunch. They have really good deals! I'm one of those girls who can't really eat A LOT so this is the place to go. It's pretty cheap for a la carte especially since I don't eat that much. Their meat is really good quality. Comparing it to other AYCE bbq places is definitely not even close.   The week that I found out about this place, I went like 4 times again after that. I wanted to bring everyone to it and show them how good it is! I feel like it's definitely hidden, but it's right next to UNLV so it's convenient when I don't know what to eat, I usually suggest here for a quick lunch.  Meat I always order: Bulgolgi, Beef toro, Brisket, and Bacon wrapped Salmon. I always get their steamed egg too. BEST steamed egg I've ever had in my life!  Their three different sauces are to die for and they're great! They also give you lemon for your beef tongue! Really tasty!  The lunch special comes with rice, miso soup, and salad. The salad is huge! And it's reasonably priced at lunch, so do try to come in for lunch!  Their desserts are SO good too! We've had the green tea and vanilla ice cream. Their sundae's come with little pocky sticks too! MM What a great idea!!!  I definitely recommend this place if you're trying to find some prime meat!  Service is AMAZING. The staff are so friendly and accommodating.  Most definitely a 5 star place.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saladdddd.
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steamed egg.

-iLEXYqVleSld-mXpXQ2-A.text: Lots of food. It is a little pricey but worth it. It tastes really good. The food tastes fresh . They clean all the cooking stations usually before you sit down. If you don't want to cook your food they will cook it upon request. Every meal I had was very good.

GGv7vvvw797kw1zeAs6r4w.text: Super delicious with that variety. My kids love the broker leaving soon! Service was friendly and the place was clean. We will deathly come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UkgExO7NdNpI-fvhsXJtkQ.text: A little off of the beaten path but well worth the short Uber ride from our hotel, the atmosphere, food and experience were all great here!  I've only had K BBQ once before and happened upon this place via Yelp, it most certainly did not disappoint!  We ordered the wings (the only think affecting a 5 star review) for starters and the short ribs and rare beef for our entree. The meal came with rice and plenty of sides to make this a nice sized meal for two to share. We also asked for jalapenos and grilled them up too, if you like spicy as much as we do I highly recommend it!

SL0P56pTBnUy-kuNONwyyA.text: Kobe Saam is the way to go! Super yum! Nice ambience at the venue, too!  Highly recommended if you are traveling to the sin city!

C0_4_sYOin3pSEBPXShDJQ.text: Just awesome!  the best KOREAN BBQ Japanese style.   the course for 4 serves enough more than 6 ppl, so tasty.

S8ujFuRTPOT9jOAKnVQ3VQ.text: Checked into this place to see what the deal. I had to cook my own meat!? What!? Ok, I knew that. I got the meat lover combination which was a lot of food but I was paying a lot of money. Fair is fair. I couldn't complain. Everything came out pretty fast after you order. The side dishes were a good compliment. But I was busy eating all the meat and rice with the 3 types of dipping sauces provided. Yum, I am a carnivore by the way. The cuts of meat were fresh in color and no smell. The marinated meats had lots of flavor. The service was just there when you need them, otherwise, they just came and did their thing. Overall, I am happy with the food quality and taste.

xahH3QpP1276LbHid9VL-g.text: This place is so amazing. We found it through Yelp and have come twice within 3 days. They are super clean and their food is the best  Just be ready to wait because it gets packed!!

Mhm6bKMC14IleDjBAC7jCA.text: This place is amazing!!!  I have never had Korean bbq before and they explained everything and was super helpful, and we got a free ice cream macaron for checking in!  Soooo good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UeN9OEZI418hX_8dXs7C3w.text: This my jam! We always come here when we land in Vegas.  It has all of the elements of good KBBQ--lettuce, panjan, and meat!  Yet, it has a trendy feel. The meal includes the regular samjan and sesame oil, but also includes three dipping sauces. The meat is high quality. My tip is to get the boneless short rib over the Waygu--just as tasty, maybe better.  At first, the portions may seem small, but somehow it's adequate. Six of us ate here, had two rounds of soju and a plethora of meat and our bill was $160.  Additionally the Korean K-pop/R&B keeps you on beat while cooking.

qMXmQK-z8Hq4j8A-eUfzdA.text: The BEST in terms of service, quality and price. Would definitely come here over the others!

G0tIE-CF45P17oWcJHcxTw.text: Very friendly and helpful staff. The food was fresh, tender, tasty and it was FUN! Overall it was a great experience. Although a little pricey.

9wbUvv3DXl5Jd7bps4NPkw.text: Excellent Korean BBQ.  Highly recommend Gangnam.  Well worth the 45 min wait at 9 PM.  Great value.

iX5yFR5OZwXmHaFlweoPdA.text: Best place for korean bbq. Just have them cook the spicy chicken and dont forget to check in for your free macaron

zdSQyRkfsP9XFqsFX69TYg.text: My wife said that this was the best meal she has ever ate. The meat was so tender and the sides were all delicious. Our waiter was great and took care of cooking the meat at the table.

Y5IzXV3XHn31pNYvIaNcdA.text: What an amazing place!!!.  You cook Korean food at the table.   They have a wide selection of meats marinated that are simple to cook.  I loved the sides that we received.    One of the funniest expertise on this trip.  Skip a buffet and come play with your food.  Get the steamed mushrooms.  I like mushrooms but this open me to some new mushroom flavored I did not know.

OJ_QDyoa5Nc9oTFCDephGQ.text: Wow. First off. Great service. We walked in and was seated 2 minutes after. The atmosphere here is great. The song is perfect, that is, if you like r&b and throwback songs.   Our sever Calvin was very attentive and polite. He made sure we had everything we needed. In addition, he brought extra sides when requested.   I would recommend this place if you're around the area or in Vegas and craving for Korean BBQ.

F-yd03mIXA9mqSPSGQ81mQ.text: I was there last month for year end family trip. It's one WORD for taste was good. We didn't order BBQ that I don't have opinion. We ordered one pot dishes per each family members. The dishes were good tasty and quantity. THe problem were all about service. The waitress and waiters were all annoying my request. ANd they even forgot the order for my mom(took 30 minutes serve dish). They looks unkind except only one woman who was in reception desk. I think the problem came from service system which was not designate table. That means they may share the tips.  Frankly, I won't be there again even not quite super tasty. I don't want keep asking and waiting anymore. I will try other Korean restaurant.

NJaQTJIyW1sihcAYedOzGw.text: Love it. Don't order tofu. It sticks to the grill. But it tastes good. The portions of the spicy tofu soup is on the smaller side. The side dishes are good.

6VNahFGsI_PYPjcaSepckQ.text: Service started out a little slow but that changed after we were finally able to get our order placed. Food was terrific...all of it!

1ChpYbNdbnPNsL8r56Q-Rw.text: Great Korean BBQ.  Hit the spot for the whole family.  Ordered different meats and cheese fondue.  Nice decor.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance

Bf4sn5ixuIZR_Jo5OWJ_JQ.text: They had large portions but based on the previous reviews, I had high expectations.  The meat was average and do not provide the high level of quality that I have come to expect from Los Angeles K-town Korean BBQ restaurants.  They don't have to constantly attend to a table, but we literally had all courses in a meal when we bought the combo brought out within 10 minutes then the servers never returned.  I had to get up multiple times to ask for anything such as napkins, more drinks, etc.  I left full based on the quantity but was expecting the quality to be better. I guess I should've known when their ban-chan (korean side dishes) tasted average at best.

QedQ3sL9V3-TY2vO0kQLgQ.text: Visiting vegas for the first time and read amazing reviews for this place and I can honestly say I'm not disappointed! Food and service was amazing and free desert! Premium for 6 people and it was more than enough food for everyone. Kobe beef and kalbi was amazing but was not a fan of the poke (still semi frozen) or the oysters. Overall very happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lUSrX8_3jrCy8karzLf1bA.text: We stop by here last July for dinner! We were starving and they sit us promptly. The wait takes a while but it worth it. Service was great! They are friendly and answer whatever question you have. We came back here again after that trip! Even with our flights in two hours!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oZgSFfZr9QB7Fk2QF4HVww.text: Great quality meat, ban chan and awesome service. My boyfriend and I got 3 plates of meat and cold noodle and bill came out to be 40$! Not bad, we were both full afterwards.

yBniSlTBIVyecCazjB-Xjg.text: Complicated and unusual. No indication of oils or additives.  This place really is for locals or people that are really into this kind of food. I was a victim of the advertising and i spent too much and left hungry.

smztk8-NLE1XfF_5cZr_zQ.text: I ordered Korean chicken tenders and chicken fried rice. For the price of both, it was well worth it. The ambiance is also nice and it gave me a good first impression right as I walked in the door.

P54PqTERdf_aL3ezVx9fHg.text: Recently got free side there's the extra star they were missing A+ if you want Loren BBQ Vegas doesn't have any really good ayce options but this is one of the best places to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Regular Menu
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Happy Hr Menu

zVSYs_YGslCgYMJOQXOHVg.text: Great food!! Quality and service is great. Music is not too loud. Tables are large so you may feel a bit distant from the person sitting in front of you, but that allows for more table room and comfortable eating. Can't complain about that! They serve a lot of food for the price, we could not finish all the meat served.

yDcsv65t9S4yW2ShE8wL5Q.text: Seriously, one of the best Asian BBQ houses I've ever been to! Wonderful staff, extremely knowledgable, and honestly a valuable steal of a happy hour menu. I ate like a king on a working man's budget IN VEGAS. Think about that for a second  Get here now and leave those other places alone. My recommendation: The Korean Bulgogi is thinly sliced, perfectly seasoned and you get to cook it YOURSELF for only $4. Can cook and burn water? No problem...your wait staff will help you out.   This definitely receives 10 BGLS (black girl lip smacks) for me

zLi5qT8muqkcZ3lskAiU2Q.text: Happy Hour introduces reasonable prices on some of their more popular entrees.  The pork belly and beef brisket cook quickly and are delicious. The spicy chicken had a hint of sweetness that was not expected or welcomed.  Ordering a side of rice is a must and won't put your bill over the edge.  The wait stuff was very friendly and attentive. It was easy to order more entrees and we received them quickly.  The grill was spotless upon entrance and the menu is easy to understand with pictures to accompany all titles. They also provided a set of commentary sides.

JEjxOLPi1frjUy1Xp5P-MQ.text: The food here are great!  The service is good too.  The price is reasonable.  Want to take fiends to come here again.

o1IZLLB3gc5Um1i-RZKvDw.text: Easily one of my favorite Korean restaurants ever, and as my partner and I are particular affecionados, we've been to a LOT.  So tasty, so friendly.  A word of warning: the original bibambap is HUGE!

MeDXIaE9Pg9mfeExvNl6EA.text: If you're staying at Silver Seven or any of the surrounding hotels in the area- this is where you'll get the best value for your money. We got the harami miso, bacon wrapped scallops, & beef toro. The accompanying side dishes were just as delicious. Thanks, Gangnam!

1ZNA4bQMKUVA505aJ6i6pg.text: Best Korean BBQ I have had in a long time!! Excellent service and very friendly.  For the amount of food the price is very reasonable...plus the free macaron with yelp check in was legit!

0BOi6LB9lxL2QWcKCQMXcA.text: Great place in the middle of las vegas. We were craving for asian food here and suddenly this place pops up. It was a lot better than expected.

gLx2gJIVldJNc5uzmDJ8_w.text: We were 2 adults and 3 kids and ordered the Gangnam for 2, our waitress recommended it to us and it filled all of us up! We were also able to sub some of the starters for dumplings instead which the kids loved! The food was delicious and the banchan were average but good! ur family really enjoyed dining here for lunch.The staff was very friendly and accommodating and our lunch was affordable. Our family really enjoyed eating here we will definitely come back.

p7TeUQDrvt7yio9LQ8D4Dg.text: We went to a concert at the hard Rock hotel and we're looking for a bite to eat late at night. This place is right across the street. We have never had Korean  BBQ before, were very hesitant, but gave it a try. So glad we did! This place is amazing! We did the Las Vegas grill for 2 people and it was more than enough food. Also added in a side of the filet mignon. Everything was so delicous. Jin and Jon were so helpful, considering we were rookies at the grill. We will definitely be back and will recommend it to others. Thanks for the great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Las Vegas Grill

yICwI_y73FbdtXR9g4qHjA.text: Amazing.  I brought my friends here to show them "culture" and they were super impressed with the food, service , atmosphere, everything.  Highly recommend!

qimLN02neHdb6SIK23-4GA.text: What else can I say that hasn't been said? A-ma-zing! Get one of the combos to share with a friend.

GuTgwbcnS74pwrII8rD3DQ.text: One word....OVERHYPE  Saw all the extraordinary yelp reviews made me super hype. What a big let down.  We had a party of 5. Arrived 7pm. Place was pack. We got on the waiting list. 2 other partys ahead. Got seated 30 mins later.   Went ahead and order the Gangnam package for 4. $120. Spicy tofu soup $9.95. The server took our drink orders. 3 waters and 2 thai tea. Waters came out first. Thai tea came out late. When the thai tea came out with was in the smallest cup I ever seen served thai tea and it was just okay. Anyways the raw meats, sides and such came all different times. The server just drop off the mear to us and didn't help us throw the meat on the grill. All self service I guess.   Service was bad. I clearly needed water refill badly. Empty cup on the edge of table. Servers walking past me over and over. I had to flagged one down to get a refill. Also we ask for extra rice and received it at the end. Everything seem rush. We ask for to go boxes and the server even forgot about that.   We never got refills on the complimentary side dishes like other koream bbq spots. Their side dishes were good tho. As well as the meats we ordered. But the service totally killed it. Never again I'll go to this spot  Overhype. Overpriced. Just head down to other korean bbq in chinatown.

YK0piEoeGEkeKam15Q-boQ.text: Good food. Just wish there was an all you can eat. Great for happy hour 3-4 dollars per meat.

ZACkfGqMg4VE4HakWx_fzA.text: One of the best kbbq around the Las Vegas area. Little bit pricey but definitely delicious

-dtcYQCuEMkaYBm4GF9yHA.text: I surprised this place got 4.5 stars! Got here last night had to wait for an hour. I chose to stay because of the 4.5 stars. Got the seat and immediately order the $65 package for 2 person. Banchan were not fresh. Almost all the meat choices were chewy and tough. At least the salad was fresh. In LA Japanese and Korean bbq that has 4.5 - 5 stars they use imported charcoal and really careful with the meat. Overall experience: disappointed. Not worth the money.

-KPmMKZQ2ywsfofXH5lBXg.text: The food was really good, the Korean flavour really stood out. The beef was so tender but the pork was the best dish. The sauce was what made it so great. The service was not the best, it was quite slow.

956KXO_vTfKLDQTqIGedEg.text: Good food, particularly the spicy tuna kimbap and the house salad. However, service during happy hour starting 10 pm needs a lot of improvement. First, 2 servers are not enough for 10 tables and a line of people waiting to be seated. The staff was working hard, but I must suggest a major improvement on friendliness and appreciating their customers (instead of tossing our bill on the table).

BvU-JnTDUqwDRnykB0NVXw.text: oh so Ono!  tried many korean BBQ places and this one is by far the best.  it's new, clean, and not on spring mountain, bc traffic can be a pain. I love that they have specials that serve seafood with the meat combos and also incorporate dol sot bibimbap with the combos.   only downfall... they don't serve bachan...  to me that's the first thing I crave when I think korean food?

o1RxBo4qDR6E85mUrJjIBg.text: First time here and it was a great change from the AYCE KBBQ norm here in Vegas! Came in during the happy hour which was from 3pm-6pm and was seated right away! We ordered the cream cheese wonton, fried calamari, (2) beef toro and (2) bulgogi. They also gave us the ban chan (side dishes) when you order a minimum of 2 BBQ dishes. The rice bowl portions are pretty hug so depending on how much meat you get I think one bowl can fit between you and another person. I love how it definitely fills up 2 people with less of a price than all you can eat KBBQ joints here in Vegas (Tofu Hut, Korean Garden BBQ). Overall great experience, will be coming back again soon!

JDDtjw0h3kotabFuQYjSjA.text: Would like to come back for happy hour. The beef carpaccio is very good. The beef toro, prime galbi, scallops were what we ordered.

b5Pgo1GXI-UwXHp0GvtXGQ.text: Nice place, good food. Free desert with a review. I didn't like that they messed up my order for dumplings. I ordered veggie dumplings and got dumplings with meat. That's the only reason why they are getting 4 stars. Other than that, the food is great and the icecream too!

pECrhmHcYnrb5J49cQZQuw.text: Stopped here for lunch on a Saturday.  Located across the street from Hard Rock Casino and Hofbrauhaus and only about a $5-6$ uber/lyft from mid-strip hotels.  Ordered one of the combos but definitely could have just ordered individually off the menu.  Food was really good and you get a lot of it when ordering the combo.  Servers were friendly and attentive.  Checked in and got a free ice cream!

iDhyWeXl8bCO7_FGyGvqwA.text: Awesome place!  Lots of food for a fair price.  Tastes amazing and the atmosphere is nice.  The service is outstanding and the server Beck is a trip.  10/10 would do it again.

mzH-DwUs8SNBqsBG0g7AJQ.text: Best kbbq spot in Las Vegas  letsCook!!! Great service  great waiter   They fixed us a nice table for our party of 7

RG03zjioxHKHYsGSNfnkrA.text: First time here, and I quite enjoyed it. Came here with a group of friends and shared the Meat Lovers for 4. There was more than enough food and they were cool about substituting one of the appetizers for another. We shared the meal between 2 girls and two pretty big guys. We all finished satisfied. The table we sat at had two grills which worked great for keeping one of them pork free. The service was above average with a good amount of visits from the servers. It's fun diy night out with friends.

id45RCdo5_uXaRiwb2Hs8Q.text: My family used to live LA and there were so many great KBBQ places in KTown. With that being said, I enjoyed this place so much. They had excellent food and great service! The food is priced very well but the only reason why I give this 4 stars instead of 5 is because we asked them to cook our food in the kitchen but they didn't because the kitchen is expected to be very busy. Other than that, I was very impressed with this restaurant!

LYt0S4BL8xom8n_uErEwcg.text: If you want Asian food, this is the place to go. I went to try Asian food, and it was the bomb.

L45WoSQDI5P_bJmct6a13Q.text: We dropped in for lunch and were immediately greeted and seated. The restaurant was clean and since we had never been here, our server explained the menu and helped make recommendations.  We were shown how to cook the beef and service was prompt with our order. We opted to buy a la carte instead of one of the combinations.  Although there was music in the background, the restaurant was fairly quiet.

uRAtVRnj8vlAvOsNt39HTw.text: Came here not hungry so I was kinda on the negative side when I walked in the door. But the fact that I'm leaving 5 stars says something.   Brisket and harima miso are one of the best I've tried. Service was very very good and the place is clean and pretty hip.   I am leaving happy and stuffed! Great experience guys!

9alHIzhlY91gGFhffJ4vkw.text: Really good sides, good portions, great value and tasty... bring your appetite! We had a good experience and the staff was friendly.

jQQBuZTgVN4WARWTJAhj5w.text: I was a little surprised when I got here because the place was not all you can eat, and I'm so used to Korean BBQ being all you can eat. The place was nice, the service was good. All servers were very attentive and provided great info. We told our server what we wanted and he recommended the perfect package. Thank you. The meat were good n, and quality! We will definitely be returning! Don't forget to check in on YELP to get your free ice cream sandwich (:

EJdUIml4rW7__nuMV_rJ0g.text: I find it surprising how the reviews are so good. I ordered Gangnam combo with prime kalbi and bulgogi bibimbob. I additionally ordered calamari garlic and mul nangmyun. Their prime kalbi and Filet mignon were amazing. I would give 5 stars for that. Their mushroom medley was on point as well. Also, the servers were attentive and nice. However, their bulgogi bibimbob and bulgogi were too sweet and too salty. My mom and I had a spoon each and couldn't proceed with the rice. Maybe ordering white rice would have been a better option. Flat iron garlic and Harami miso were also too salty that it was hard to proceed. Their nangmyun is worth trying - one of the better ones I had in the US.   Overall, if you happen to go to this place, order non-marinated meet. I was between 3 and 4 stars and decided on 3 because the rating is too high and wanted to give people an honest opinion that is different from the majority. I hope this review is helpful!

_gQDL6al0Bt1LFBeTaZ8zg.text: We couldn't make a reservation over the phone(for 8 people), we were told that their large tables were booked but was also told that if we walked in early we might be able to get a table so that's what we did, the host was very accommodating and tried his best to get us a table, luckily a large group was just leaving but the catch was we only had an hour to eat, but the host said if we go a little over it would be ok which was nice of him to say. We ordered quickly and gobbled everything up in the hour. The food as usual was excellent, even got our free macaroons!

4gTYU_9ivFfaMp09-hvI-A.text: Excellent food and service! Wished we had a place like this in Orlando!  We visited and will come back next time in Vegas.

1jlSNHVbPYgv14kD5d7SMQ.text: We arrived here with high hopes due to the good reviews. They were very accommodating with our large party on such short notice. We were informed that there would be a wait as they only had two tables for large groups. We did end up waiting 45 minutes, but it was because the groups at tables did not want to leave and continued chatting. The workers were extremely quick at working and clearing the tables, so we were seated immediately. We got our food quickly and all the waiters/waitresses were very polite. The food was delicious, though a bit pricey. Would definitely recommend.  Tip to customers: when you're done eating, go home. There's limited seating and the workers are too polite to ask you to leave.

f_oENKR411CaU3UZwBmmQA.text: Nice Korean bbq, different options. Pre-priced options for multiple guests. Great place!

6PhyhiwykXoKW1YBLVZNLQ.text: Absolutely amazing!  I attended a conference and had to stop by to try. Locals come here. Their prime kalbi was flavorful and tender. Of course it  comes with side dishes and dipping sauces.

0Tgjwi8uy9h0XPkJ5Kp5Dg.text: Most bestest Korean bbqs in the world! Ain't even playin... we have never had such delicious food to cook ourself on a tiny little grill built in to our table. You can walk here from Hardrock casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Authentic asian, like my wifey...

-cpx4BwhJW5VnPsGcuMPRg.text: I'm not really a fan of yakiniku style restaurants.  Gangnam was a real treat. The fried rice bibimbap had bulgogi in it! My wife, not a real rice eater, finished it all. Service was quick and courteous,  just a short wait for the table. It was my wife's birthday and it was an amazing meal.

Q3rSm344AHB1rhtgo5yW8A.text: I love korean bbq, but we don't have a place like Gangnam Asian bbq back in Maryland so it was a pleasant surprise. We got the premium for two. All of the appetizers and complimentary banchan was good except for the oysters. The love oysters and eat them all the time back at home but these oysters did not taste fresh at all. The carpaccio was also amazing. The kobe style beef was the highlight. It literally melted in my mouth. I wanted to keep eating the Kobe all day. The only meat that I didn't enjoy in the set was the galbi and harami miso. I eat galbi regularly but the marinade in both items were too sweet. The shrimp bibimbap was not what i expected at all but it was good. Bibimbap normally has spicy notes to it but this bibimbap was sweet. Overall, it was a great experience. Definitely a good place to try while in Vegas.

WrKeh8ZHH7OKn8mndkmfRg.text: I would say this place is one of the best korean bbq I've had! I was super impressed with their beef carpaccio, the beef was full of flavor. You got to order this if you come here!!!! Also, I recommend to order Kobe ssam, which is urchin on top of beef lettuce wrap. It was completely different experience compare to Japanese style urchin. We order the meat lover combo for 4 people. The meat was really fresh, and it should be enough for 4 people. Last thing, don't forget to check-in and redeem your macaroon ice cream. If it's free, why not plus it is delicious

Zb95ky7V6LTD7QBmtSoXiQ.text: Here I am again enjoying my meal. The same quality and same positive service. Wait time was a little long but not long enough for me to walk away! Lol For those who hasn't tried this place yet plan on going during off hours so the wait time doesn't interfere with trying them out at least once...haven't asked if they do RSVP.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yums again and will be more visits!

5LFr0ANOqHLu9TP65gqyJw.text: I have never realized just how good we have it in DC as far as Korean food goes.  Our local KBBQ place isn't even the best in our area - but it FAR exceeds the food we had at Gangnam.  Most of the meat was TOUGH and chewy, and none of the sides was particularly exciting.    It looked like some locals were enjoying bowls of soup, etc. that may be better...but as far as bbq goes, this really missed the mark for us.

zabGNmUybrLSxoskrLHfPw.text: This place is pretty good. We got the meat lovers and split it three ways and it was just the right amount of food. (We did order extra beef brisket, though.)   All of the cuts of meat were excellent, the side salad that came was the best side salad I have ever seen at a kbbq restaurant before, and the grill we had was perfect. (Usually you come across bad cold or hot spots on grills, but theirs was great.)  The only thing I didn't care for was the speed of service. Took a while to get our food, and desert took a long time. Service with expeditiousness aside was fine. Hostess and servers were very nice.  Would I recommend this place to others? Yes. Would I come back here myself? Yes.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PUb7K9qnCuAx-bTUImWohg.text: We came in around 7pm on a Friday night and was told the wait would be 40 minutes or so. It's too late to go to another place anyways so we decided to wait. They have a nice waiting area with big screen playing music videos so it's not too bad.  After 40 minutes or maybe a little longer we were seated and offered menu. However it took them a really long time to come back to take our order. People who were seated after us got their orders taken way before ours. That was strike #1.  Finally the server came take our order and we opted for the Gangnam set thinking it probably has the most popular items. Since we had more than two people we ordered a chicken fried rice thinking it should be enough food. It took the server a long time to bring us the banchan and water. Nothing special about the banchan and it was a little disappointing from a non-ayce place.  Chicken fried rice arrived first before any other starter items. Which was okay because I was really hungry so any food that came to the table was welcomed. Fried rice was hot with huge chunks of chicken and nice separated grains.  The starters all tasted quite decent. Oyster was fresh and sweet. HOWEVER! Now that I went back to look at menu writing this review I realized they didn't give us the fried calamari! (I was going to give this place 2 stars but now it's down to 1)   We chose bulgogi bibimbap instead of white rice and Korean prime kalbi instead of the kalbi. The bibimbap was nice and hot. We started to grill our first item which was the filet mignon. Right when I was about to dip that into the sauce I found out the server didn't give us any sauce. At first I thought this place doesn't offer sauce but then it's kind of impossible because all kbbq places I've been to have some kind of sauce or at least salt? Then we looked around and saw sauce plates on every single table but ours. Then we had to track down the busy waiter before we could proceed to eat our meal. Strike #2.   Halfway through the meal the server came to take away some empty meat plates and my sister's bowl that she was eating her fried rice and bibimbap with. I looked at the server in disbelief because she was still eating her meal. Not only was the service slow the entire night but when they chose to be attentive they did it the wrong way. Since the server's too hard to track down now my sister had to eat her meal with no bowl. Strike #3.   The nice thing about this place is that we can do yelp check-in and get free macaroon ice cream sandwich for dessert. We got coffee, strawberry, and mango and they just tasted like any macaroon ice cream sandwich at most ayce kbbq places. The quality of the meat here is not better than other ayce places and that's a big disappointment from the great reviews they have.   I think this place is really lacking in service here. I felt that the kitchen was working very hard and able to provide nice fried rice in a timely manner so they're doing their job right. If they can better train their server I believe they can reduce the wait time significantly.

c-9mLAelkeDN990caLC2JA.text: We waited for a while to get a table but it was all worth it. Waiters are very attentive, good meat selection, everything was tasty. Will definitely come back for more.

Zj0yLuZgVa1bR1DbYvZwLw.text: Nice interior Kind service Good foods Safe location  Korean bbq here are very right choice  Above all, the side dishes are served. As requested free of charge.  If you want good deal, here is the place

b2OqMtDztBT212YxuYyybA.text: This place has great service..very prompt and attentive. My husband came and ordered the Gangnam special and did not regret it. It is a lot of food..more than enough for 2 people but totally worth it. Location is fairly close to the strip. Will definitely return again.

OhlUq4mmjNKPxniFG8AdIw.text: Great food. Great value.  Meat choices were great. My family loved the food. We come here every time we visit LV.

bKUCkpFmcXrgkOlxQAJ7Xw.text: Loved it.  We came with a group of business associates after a trade show.  We were starving and wanted plenty of food.  This place gets rave reviews from me because it's not in the strip (so very easy to get to), as its in a strip mall.  This place is the real deal, you self-cook your meats on your hibachi table and eat it as it comes off the grill.   We chose a meat lovers dinner for 2 which featured bulkogi, kalbi(ribs), thin sliced ribeye, pork belly(unsmoked bacon) and spicy pork.   This also came with 10 side dishes, rice and 2 kinds of salad. SO MUCH FOOD!!  This place is as good as value as you'll find in Las Vegas.  Strongly recommend!!!

mA5nWCDFteasrtPFqRdo3Q.text: Five stars for the great food, service, ambiance, pricing and menu! The Harami Miso was tender and full of flavor, making it my favorite amongst the other meats we had. They give you three sauces which were good but I also ordered a side of sesame oil and sea salt to dip my meats in. You'll also get seven side dishes just like you would at most Korean restaurants. I will definitely be back when visiting Las Vegas!

oRHlPbyfgimz51uTc9FjNw.text: Not AYCE but definitely delicious. Gangnam offers a great lunch special which was the perfect portion to finish cooking and eating within my hour lunch break.  The two of us both opted-in for the lunch special: One with bulgogi and the other with pork belly. The lunch special also came with rice & a soup or salad, and an appetizer (I got the edamame) We also agreed on an ala carte order of the Korean Prime Kalbi.  All 3 meats were delicious. The Korean Prime Kalbi was definitely my favorite. The meat was marinated perfectly and turned out to be juicy & tender when cooked. The bulgogi & pork belly were good too, especially with the variation if dipping sauces.  This is the perfect little KBBQ spot for those who are pressed on time or simply do not want an AYCE menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I forgot to take a photo before I started eating...it was that good.

P8WkDvXH_Sn6FEcXNBb1PQ.text: One of the best KBBQ I've been to and I'm from San Francisco Bay. Get the Toro beef! It's like having a party in your month bursting with flavors. Go before 7 o'clock if you do not want to wait in a long line.

CYsoIBsiWMf0d1LMt0B3GQ.text: Had a ball at this swank and hip Asian style barbecue bar. It feels like an Americanized Asian gastro pub. Very high quality Korean BBQ. Replete with the grill in the center and semi self-cooking (but enough assistance so you don't get yourself into trouble and accidentally give yourself food poisoning). Service is strong and sincere. I couldn't ask for better. Someone bright and foot- forward immediately greets you upon arrival. The atmosphere is dark and broody, but hilarious and elegant at the same time. How shall I say? It's a girl who wears Burberry but has a goth Asian tattoo. It was fairly busy on a Friday night after 9, but didn't feel crowded. They seem to keep tables moving, as our wait was only 20 minutes. And it was fine. The little benches make you feel you are part of the action. And there is cool K-pop (Korean popular music, for us gringos) as well as videos playing. Fun atmosphere. And you will feel just as comfortable whether North or South of 30.  Now for the food: The banchan (or side dishes) were a little uninspired, I have to say: Macaroni salad was the only whimsical touch, but  it lacked flavor. The standby kimchi was a little dull and off balance, in my opinion (though my dining companions liked it). The sprouts were good, though. I would have liked cut up hot dogs like some others are doing now.  But the bbq part, the meat, was fresh and delicious. Wagyu beef was rich. The bimbimbap was so deep in flavor and the shrimps on it were cooked perfectly. I was not a fan of the poke dish, but it was still excellent. If you're in the neighborhood of UNLV, and have the time and money, check this place out. The AYCE is a bit pricey, at around $30-40 for all the good stuff, but it's a good night out.

z_UaSC_2J3wehHfHJlMvYQ.text: Great service! Really good meats. We had a large group of 32 people. We were allowed to make a reservations. The kids got the private room in the back where they could make tons of noise. The rest of us fit in the two big tables right outside the private room. I really liked the brisket and the steamed kalbi. Don't forget to check in on yelp when you get there for a free macaron! Kids loved it. We will definitely be back!

FY_5kO7M8pzHoXuuYDvKBg.text: I thought this place was going to be better due to the reviews. It's my fault I didn't look through the menu before deciding to get non AYCE kbbq. They should just do AYCE kbbq here because the quality of the meat is mediocre and you can find this at any Korean bbq restaurant. There's nothing special about this place. We ordered the Gangnam menu which came with Bulgogi, Prime Galbi, filet mignon, mushroom medley, oysters, shishito peppers and Bulgogi bibimbap and some other stuff for $68. Maybe my expectations were high due to the reviews and thinking because this place is a la carte that the food was going to be good. But I was wrong. The only thing good about this place was the Bulgogi bibimbap. Everything else was mediocre. I'd enjoy this place if it was AYCE due to the quality of the food. Even the sides weren't that good. Some of it were warm as if it were sitting out. Don't come here with high expectations. You will regret it

rgAlz7rK5uUmWHO4K1rzIA.text: Very very good place. We come every year during our trip in Vegas. Nice service, nice food and Korean style atmosphere.  Much better than those AYCE choices of Korean BBQ. Highly recommend.

I got soju for half price off because of happy hour. A LOT of foods for a really good deal. The food quality exceeded my expectations. Will come back again next time when we visit Las Vegas again. 9NDe8gbrlbmD2ZwCqtwGdA.text: What a wonderful place with amazing food and fantastic service. The food was fresh and fun to cook.  Worth every penny to eat here!

tW7Pjj49yCwkckMxi3tOQA.text: Nice clean multiple selection can eat light at midnight friendly servers! My wife says good looking servers eye candy for her. I liked that food was on table to snack on immediately got seated down.

mWx5jszJsKbVVUaBTKMXwQ.text: We were in Vegas for my niece's 21st birthday. And all the kids kept telling me this is the place to go they made the reservation and we just show up and eat like crazy.  It was nice that they were able to accommodate our reservation for 15. We had 5 people per tabland we ordered everything there was on the menu. Our table of 5 we ordered the meat platter of $99 us and we added a few sides.  I have to say the service was excellent all the meats were fresh and all the sides were very good. As we're leaving there are a line of people waiting.  Would definitely do it again!

2miOBxRhepOvOjf6O6Sk1Q.text: One of our favorite Korean BBQ place in vegas. If you are looking for quality instead of AYCE, this is the place.

wfX0PRzCU5mVs1I0NY6jRg.text: Well I was visiting and luckily the Hard Rock Hotel was close by to this Korean BBQ joint. With all the raving reviews, I just couldn't pass up the opportunity to try the place.  I came at the beginning of the lunch hour and had a seat at the bar. Staff was attentive and friendly which was a good sign. I ordered mulnaengmyun (cold noodle soup), filet mignon, and marinated kalbi.  Mulnaengmyun - It's hard to find a place that serves slushy broth which they serve. Usually it's the broth with ice cubes that dilute the flavor of the broth. Nice touch definitely. It came with the standard buckwheat noodles. I really like the extra chewy chik/kudzu noodles but hard to find. Overall solid broth and decorated nicely.        4/5 stars  Filet mignon - Well I think the name probably sets expectations too high. It was solid morsels of meat with good flavor. But not necessarily the extra tender and soft texture that you're expecting.    3/5 stars.  Marinated kalbi - Definitely spot on. Not too sweet & sticky, enough fat marbling to give a buttery taste, and chewy but not rubbery. Next time I would rather make two orders of the kalbi now that I know.    4/5 stars  Overall, a great experience. The restaurant is clean, modern and minimalist in style. I will stop by the next time I'm in town and update my review.    4/5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi naengmyun. Always a good combo of fire and ice!

Cv0z28k5UncFyGCiYUXciA.text: Great vibes! Food is delicious there was no wait to sit down. The place was quiet and everyone in the restaurant was respectful and keeping their voices down while people was eating. Good came out quickly and the egg souffle was on point. Will come back again.

avAPi7llQREnGCHk7nDQug.text: It's really a 4.5 stars.  We've been to soo many Korean BBQ places and this place is top notched.  The restaurant is large and spacious not too smoky.  The service is on point.  They are very attentive but do not cook the meat for you.  We came for happy hour and got the pork toro. Pork belly and bolgolgi.  The toro is such a thick cut it's so delicious.  The pork belly is very lean which I appreciate so much.  The bulgogi is well marinated but when you cook it kinda falls apart into very small pieces.  The mushroom medley is precooked and brought out later.  It is drizzled in butter so it's very soft and tons of umami flavors.  Overall we had an excellent experience.  Even though it wasn't all you can eat we were so full and the bill was so reasonable given quality of the meats.

I came with a party a party of 9 and got 3 extra plates of meat and multiple appetizers along with the Gangnam family special. 6UXoogeEPGPUQ1tr4SeRzw.text: This place blew my mind.   So much food and the meat quality was excellent.  There were combo and al a carte options.  We chose the Gangnam combo for two which was $65.   The oysters were some of the best I have had.  Come hungry.

s0kWgdruNW2-oEPHWmeFqg.text: The food was good. The service was horrible. It was as if our waiter had a bad day and took it out on us. Right from the start I felt a bad vibe and then when he leaves my friend says "I don't think he likes us." The food was good. They never changed our grill when needed. The wait sucked but i won't dock it too much for that. It's mainly the bad service that gives me the reason for 3 stars.

jNdi2r6zKo1czwDgHLfOdA.text: OMG!!! I had been craving Korean BBQ since living in Korea and man oh man, this place did not disappoint. So many options for main courses (I'm a vegetarian and order tofu and tteokbokki) plus the unlimited amount of sides. You can't beat the price either--our total bill was $46 (3 people, 5 entrees to grill plus some apps). I definitely recommend the spicy tuna app--the flavors and textures Are like no other.

s3nMa2q0jIGVb2PUiG4CpA.text: Our entire family loved this place! The seven-year-old is already planning her next trip. We got the meat lovers for two and there was plenty of food for a family of three. The service was excellent.

TpVc-Ui8hw6Qnc7JcE5xog.text: Right off the bat the food is DELICIOUS! They served a variety of traditional Korean side dishes (kimchi, daikon, cucumber, etc.) and offer different meal sets for 2-6 people. With lots of choices of meats, appetizers, soups, and vegetables.   My family and I are from Hawaii and we were dying for some Korean food. We came around 8 pm and the waited around 30 minutes. The wait was supposed to be longer but lots of people left because they were waiting longer than is. Hence why we got to sit down pretty fast. The ambiance is nice, modern and up to date (as far as furniture and music). Booths against the wall can easily sit up to 6 people, tables in the middle 4, and they also have one private room/section that can fit a big party.   The guy who sat us was very nice and welcoming. But I feel like the servers, I wouldn't say rude but the tone in their voice and the way they talked to us didn't seemed nice. For example: I asked "what kind of sauce is this?" While oiling the grill, our waiter quickly cut me off at the end of my question and said "yeah hold on, let me do this first and I'll explain it." In a sort of rude tone. Even when my dad asked about the yelp offer the waiter cuts him off mid sentence, "oh yeah the yelp thing, we'll do that later" in that same rude tone.   I gave this place 4 stars because the wait time and food was great, better than most places in Hawaii (Hawaii has lots of great Korean BBQ, hence why I was so impressed) I would defiantly come back here, just needs improvements on the way waiters talk to their guest.   Tip: make sure to check in so you can get a free macaron ice cream sandwich, super good!

One suggestion I would make is that, although their service was very good, but for someone who's their first time, would want a introduction once they are seated which we didn't get. aajBSwSnbfIZ9sW4zsAI8Q.text: Chose this restaurant for my husbands birthday. It was excellent. The service was great! Everyone was friendly. The quality and taste of the meat was great! The prices were good and they even had happy hour specials on meats veggies appetizers and beers. I will definitely return on my next visit to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ready to eat! Everything looks good!

-b21RXHo7P1TtRxo439j0Q.text: This place is a smaller less expensive version of the Gyu-Kaku chain. What really pushed this experience from a four star to a three star was the service...as much as I hate to say it.   We were greeted and seated fairly quickly. We came around 11 pm. We noticed after we ordered everyone got a small green menu (the happy hour menu) that we did not receive. Their happy hour starts at 10pm. One of our drinks came without a straw. (not a big deal...but just careless). Had to ask twice for a refill for water when our cups were completely empty...not even any ice left.   We ordered the garlic shrimp (two orders). This item was really delicious! Probably the best thing we tried. The steamed egg is a HUGE portion. It was good but a little bit salty. The spicy lemon chicken was good...didn't taste like lemon at all. In the picture it looked like the lemon sauce was going to come on the side...which we did not get. Seaweed salad was about average. Pork belly was good. Asparagus was really yummy. I would recommend that.   Never asked us if we want dessert, just silently dropped off the bill. Service wasn't that bad but little things make a big difference. I wouldn't go out of my way to recommend this place. Theres better options in Vegas, but this place is open late and in a good location with tons of parking. The food is decent as well.

AhcFK8dmqKvUuUk9sR1amQ.text: We eat Korean bbq at least once a week. Vacations are no exception. Found this through Yelp but really it's pretty popular on every food-suggestion site for Vegas. Food quality was excellent. Service was on the slow side, considering we were the 2nd patrons there (arriving 5 minutes after it opened), not to mention that we cook the food ourselves. Our usual time at other K BBQ places, from sitting down to walking out, is 40 mins max, and those places are always packed. This place did fill up quickly though, considering it was a Monday at 11:30am.

LsXY4LuVmqF3_tO3dVzh_Q.text: The best Korean style bbq in Las Vegas with affordable prices, wonderful staff and great food!

Gw8ImP48aRCwy7bL8wNF9g.text: I didn't know there was a Korean BBQ this close to UNLV until I found this place on Yelp !   Their menu is very similar to Gyu-Kaku. Meats are a la carte. They have combination sets , lunch specials (before 3 pm) , and happy hour (3 pm - 6 pm & 10 pm - closing).   We settled with their lunch special which is a really good value since it comes w/ banchan , rice , house salad (or miso soup) , one or two meats and an appetizer. I ordered the bulgogi & the meats we grilled were well marinated and tender. I tend to skip bulgogi at AYCE places because they're usually not marinated that good but here you can really taste the quality. Prime kalbi is not included in lunch specials but ordered it anyways since we were dining here already and I wanted to see how it compared to other places. Their kalbi was excellent and had good marbling. Servings aren't necessarily huge , but it's an ample amount of meat. You would get pretty full off eating just one or two.  Love that they offer a lot on their dessert menu ! They have the Brick macaron ice creams (same ones they have at Gen KBBQ and No. 1 Boba Tea) , honey toast , ice cream mochi , banana tempura , etc. If you spend over 15$ and check-in on Yelp , you get a free macaron ice cream of your choice.  Interior is very sleek and modern. Ventilation is good , the restaurant didn't smell smokey at all. The tables are kinda too wide , there is quite a distance between customers sitting across from each other. Music isn't super loud though so it wasn't a problem having a conversation. They have a nice playlist going on too.  This place is a nice alternative to AYCE KBBQ. Staff is very attentive and friendly ! Most definitely a 5 star place :)

It's not fancy but if you just want to eat, this place for you. We tried carpaccio, appetizer with sea urchin and there types of meat. Everything was perfect! Highly recommend this place.

mJQGjvP2_REd_68kF6lyjw.text: My husband and I chose the #1 best seller Gangnam bbq set, which included rice, soup, salad, and a couple of appetizers and several beef bbq dishes.   We also added one order of pork belly and a side of lettuce.    The food was delicious and we enjoyed everything.  Service was great. The only thing that I missed was the leaf lettuce instead of Romain lettuce to wrap the meat.  Also I just remembered that they forgot to bring us calamari appetizer ... oh well, it is too late but I will make sure I get it the next time.

_CN9x022dNBuTgGfqhCXkA.text: Introduction: Ok, so I am super picky when it comes to my Korean BBQ.  Which is why it took me so long to try one out until today.  Being new to Las Vegas with so many choices, I did not want to be disappointed and traumatized not wanting to try anywhere else if my first experience is bad.  However, thanks to my fellow yelpers, I uncovered the AMAZING Gangnam Asian BBQ.  Quality: 5/5 Omg! Five STARS hands down.  Everything we ordered were top quality and the marinating was perfection!  Probably one of the better Korean BBQ I've ever had.  Cleanliness: 5/5 Very clean and organize.  Price: 4/5 The price was actually good, the reason why I gave it a four and not five stars is because they charge you items that I don't feel should be charge for.  For example, you get charge for steam rice. Pretty much anything you order, you get charge, but steam rice? I am not sure about water, but I hope not. Anyhow, it's really not the fact that we get charge, just that it feels like you get that nickel and dime to death feeling. Especially when the food is so AMAZING, it's the principal. Steam rice is so darn cheap anyway.  I must say that I was expecting a charge on my refills, lemons, lime juice and sauces, but I wasn't, so it was a good surprise. The steam rice one really shocked me, I can see fried or even brown rice.  But again, it's not that big of a deal, just peculiar to me.  Customer Service: 4/5 The service was great initially and when you are about to leave.  However, during the time we were there, it was ok. The girls were not as attentive like we would like them to be. For instance, we have to flag them down regularly for refills, more sauce, new grill, etc.   We're use to being checked on at Korean BBQ'S. Maybe that's how they role here in Las Vegas cause I remember reading a bunch of reviews at other places that has the same feedbacks.  We just have to suck it up I guess.  Tips: Clearly, this is not an all you can eat type of Korean BBQ.  There were two of us and our bill came out to $60 with taxes, two drinks, a brown and steam rice.  But we don't eat that much, so if you are a big eater, expect to pay more.  For us, it was perfect!    They have the BEST macaron ice cream and it's free if you check in on yelp.  We will definitely be back, the yummy food overrides the other hiccups.

nRtykkakcbopywFd5aXQ6g.text: Having just been in Korea and sampling a bunch of BBQ joints there, I have to say this is the real deal!  The meat, shrimp and sides were all fresh and if you have a problem with the cooking, all you have to do is look in the mirror to complain!  This is definitely a hidden gem off the strip and quite reasonable too.  I got shrimp and steak with all the sides for $16.00!  If you check in on Yelp, you get free Macron Ice Cream too.  Also, the service was impeccable.  Water always full and no wait for anything.

togbjW_UDfv4KxjPdGtWMQ.text: This was a real pleasure with great service.  Food was excellent with a decent atmosphere, several servers with quick responses.  Price for value is high for a middle of the road place to eat.

Li4io0nC7TIrj-CnStNQOg.text: I come here every time I come to Vegas. The service is always great. The food never dissapoints me. Top grade meats, super tender and marinated to perfection. All the banchan that comes with it is amazing.You have an option of having them cook it in the kitchen instead of cooking it yourself... I know what's the point of going then. I dont like going out to eat and then have to cook my own food. I can do that in my friends kitchen, Plus you end up smelling like the food when you done eating. They never complain when we ask to have it cooked for us. I have my friends meet me here to eat when ever I'm in town  definitely will be back again.

Jz5teZnRn2Jcd4pbxq4Tzg.text: Best best best I've ever had! Best price, best service, best food! Totally coming back again when I'm in Vegas! Drink price is very reasonable too!

phBW6aiT5bKBygcMOSqAnw.text: This place is awesome! Food is delicious, flavorful and something different! I've never had Korean dishes prior so I have nothing to compare but my taste buds say-YUM!  Also service is terrific! Waitstaff is on it, keeps things moving without feeling rushed. Go! It's good!

4K1qXdj2hlRFbzGGFQ1jAA.text: Great quality food and excellent service! This place has become a regular spot for Us every time we come to Vegas. I love that it's not an all-you-can-eat, but rather it's a la carte. Our Kids don't really eat this, so it's a total waste for Us when we have to go to an all-can-eat since we basically are paying for Our kids to sit. Definitely check them out if you haven't been, you won't regret it!

rb9yTNsVtwKzROKUBFgLPA.text: One of the best restaurants I have ever been to in my life. The waiters and waitresses are all very nice. The food is reasonable and worth the price. There is absolutely nothing that I regreted ordering. The interior design is very welcoming, traditional and the lights slightly dimmed. There is a proper waiting room and people are not just wandering around outside.  This restaurant will definitely be one of my go to' s whenever I visit Las Vegas. I am very upset with myself for not discovering this place earlier.

NqIt_mLcxnwxB4Ohr5b6sg.text: The strip is designed so that you can have access to nearly everything you need without traveling far, often without even stepping outside. Sometimes getting away from the strip is worth it though. My wife and I stopped in here for lunch and had a great meal, for a fraction of what it would have cost on the strip or in a hotel. The pork belly and spicy garlic ribs were my favorite.

iTZXAv00eGpdcmasOb85hA.text: The food was great. I felt like my friends and I didn't get our food in a timely fashion. Seemed like anyone who isn't Asian isn't a great priority for them.

8Dj1Se94CM_ebGPCY2DQkg.text: Whenever I travel with family, we always try to go to at least one kbbq place. On our last day, I quickly searched up a kbbq place right before we left. That's when I found Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining. I looked at the ratings and was a bit spectacle because all the authentic kbbq I've been to don't have this high of a rating. In my mind maybe this place is more catered mainly towards non Koreans; however, I was very wrong. This restaurant authentic enough where Korean people like me can enjoy, while still welcoming to people that aren't accustomed to kbbq. This place definitely is the best kbbq me and my parents ever had in America period! It is definitely better than most kbbq restaurants in Korea itself!   The quality of the meat is amazing and the meat is marinate well. Definitely worth the price. Not only the meat is good, the bachans(side dishes) are amazing as well! This is the first time where my family actually enjoyed the banchan at a Korean restaurant in America. Normally, they would complain that this banchan is too sweet or salty. But this time, they just kept on eating without even saying a single complaint.   For this quality, one might think that the portions are small, but no it was pretty big. We ordered for 2 people and by the end of the meal, we were full. Barely had room for that free macaron ice cream.   The food was good, but the service was good as the food. They were so polite and got us refills on bachans without us even asking. My family always hate asking servers for more banchan because they don't like talking to people much and usually it takes awhile. But our server instantly got us our banchan before we were even thought of asking him if we can have some more.   This was a good way to end our trip at Vegas. After some bad buffet food, this was a good breath of fresh air. Definitely coming back here if I ever visit Vegas again instead of those overpriced, terrible buffets.

Tlo9qloopwoHwfAFv6_mGg.text: Everything about this place lived up to my expectations. My husband and I came for our wedding anniversary. I have been counting the days down until I can indulge into some gangnam style....pause.   We ordered pork belly, filet mignon, salmon wrapped in bacon, tempura kabocha, oysters, the spicy chicken wings, spicy garlic edamame, and the famous spicy tuna kimbap! First of all, spicy tuna kimbap is mmmmbop good! It's a roll of seaweed with rice in it fried into a tempura with spicy tuna atop. It was deeelish if you are a fan of raw fish, especially the spicy tuna flavor. It is a MUST GET when you come. You failed if you didn't order it to give it a shot. Don't expect the sizes of the meat to be on steroids. The meat are sliced so when you grill it yourself it doesn't take forever to cook. I think the portioning were perfect enough so you could indulge and enjoy whatever other items you ordered; therefore, you weren't meat overload. Unless, you came in with your carnivorous spirit on green.  All the side dishes (banchans) come free with the meal were delicious as well. I don't know if these side dishes are on a daily rotation, but we received 6 different servings of side dishes. These were bean sprouts, kimchi, kimchi like cucumber, Mac salad, radish (daikon) in a pool of some sweet sauce, and cuttlefish. The cuttlefish was so tender. It was my fave out of the banchans. I mean honestly, I don't think I was breathing as I was scarfing my food down.   We came in on a Tuesday evening. The ambiance was perfect. If you've been following my reviews you'd probably know by now that I come from a family of 6. I'm raising 4 boys and a husband. Lol. So this quiet time, is so much needed! It wasn't overly busy when we walked in. But as the night progressed so did the patrons. On a Tuesday night to have such business tells you something. The servers were great. Checked on us as often enough to not make me start secretly grumbling as a waiter approached. They were very good at clearing your table off of empty dishes so that was great as I dislike clutter. They did seem a little overly eager on certain parts such as the grill being used or not, but hey...I get it. Don't wanna char the grill or waste propane. That'd be equivalent to me telling my kids to turn the light off if no one is in the room. Except, we still had pieces on the grill that still needed grilling. My husband and I did give each other a look after awhile. But no biggy.   I'd come back over and over until they give me reasons not to. The facility is clean. The colors are very zen like and I love that they have a projector screen of music videos playing. They played a mixture of rap and kpop.   Good vibe, enjoyable food...definitely recommend! They do have high chairs, but expect it to be busy so I'd keep the stroller in the trunk, though there's space for it.  Enjoy!
