g0Y4ENfFPBq-J4BM3eJMbQ.text: I haven't been this satisfied with Asian BBQ before! I've been to Sura BBQ and Tofu hut, but they don't even compare to Gangnam. Sura is too pricey and I am a little taken back by how they place the raw meat outside.  Anywhoo, Gangnam was a nice alternate to that, since they serve you your food like Tofu Hut. However the quality of the meat is far tastier. Everything that I had was delicious!   We ordered the beef belly, BACON WRAPPED SCALLOPS, spicy garlic edamame, fried chicken karrage and the banana tempura with ice cream. This is definitely one of the rare occasions where i can honestly say i loved every bite. The service was phenomenal and we came during happy hour. They also have a Robata special after 10pm, must try!  The proportions were excellent and presentation was beautiful. (Especially the beef belly and banana tempura)  The exterior of the restaurant does not give it justice to the inside because i was pleasantly surprised by how pretty it was in there, and I did not expect a place like that to be so close to UNLV.   The ambiance is appropriate for all types of parties from romantic to large parties. (:  I will definitely return & try the whole menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana tempura . OMG my favorite :)
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ohhh yeaaa :)

Dx7kFhFaPIdrUKQb4UOPLQ.text: This place is so bomb! Go here! Your tummy will b so happy. I'm def coming back! I love Asian bbq!

uRibc9646en5rSoZlnbUsQ.text: We have 3 people and ordered the Gangnam Combo for 2 (as recommended by the waitress). It was a lot of food, the meat is tasty, and so are the side dishes. We ordered a few bottles of Korean hite beer and they  went well with the food. We love the Kimchi!

xgeXscn1gdG5I9w-p2tqig.text: Excellent food with great service that's near the strip. Although a Korean BBQ, this place is also great for pescatarian and vegetarians as well.  What's great about this place is that it's not saturated with tourists. I highly recommend!

D572IkaEzNX1zX0qdsAvrA.text: My wife & I stopped by for dinner on a Tuesday night. There was a decent crowd. Unlike other Korean restaurant, this one did not have the overwhelming smell of grease & grilled meat.    We had a spicy tuna kimbap, prime kalbi (beef), spicy chicken w/ lemon, & asparagus. All items were very good. The beef & chicken were grilled at the table. They were nicely seasoned. Right portions for us.   The spicy tuna kimbap was chunks of tuna in mayonnaise laced with sriracha sauce, served over rice balls wrapped in nori, lightly battered and deep fried. It was very tasty.   Pieces of prime kalbi were tender & very good. I preferred them grilled rare. The spicy chicken pieces were well marinated and tasted real good when lightly dipped in lime juice. The asparagus was cooked yet lightly crunchy, the way I liked. Every thing went well with the Sapporo beer on draft.   We finished our meal with banana tempura served with vanilla ice cream, topped with whipped cream. I wished I ordered a cup of black coffee to go with it.   Our server was professional & friendly. She was running a bit ragged because she had many tables to attend to.   We will definitely return to this restaurant the next time we are in Las Vegas, NV.

mkljUHgGEwspNTJ7KndWJw.text: Love this place!  Always seen this type of restaurant on the TV but never experienced it.  Was in Vegas with my wife and we wanted to try something new.  I pulled up the Yelp app on the phone and this was at the top and had massive good ratings from patrons.  We decided to try it and were not disappointed.  We chose the meat lovers option for two and were thoroughly happy with the choice.  It is pretty cool to sit there and cook your food and eat it straight off the grill.  All the side elements are great too, some are pretty hot, but even for this wuss I still enjoyed the spicy sides.  Since our first time here we have brought friends twice and they all experience the same enjoyment as we did.

3UMVhXeUrtxvzJBM-t724A.text: Love this place.  It's great for a group of 4 to 6 people.  You get to cook your own food over a grill on your table.  Its a great part of the conversation.  Also, the food is very reasonably priced.  Few places in Vegas can match the overall value.  I am a picky eater, so a lot of the stuff isn't for me, but luckily they give you so much I can find a lot to fill me up.

5VHhmqHToLq4sb2qlaK3wA.text: Great food! Very clean, and stylish restaurant. It's very spacious.  Not over priced. And you get appetizers! Highly recommend anyone who loves Asian food to stop by.

SuovN2NryWkwYEJQ7TI8sg.text: I came here for the first time last week during their half off 3-6pm. The food was soooo good that I couldn't help myself, so I came again this week. Our waitress Maa was so nice and patient. I think I'm going to come again this week

EeyOSLYeiKbxKDuXgZ_ppA.text: We had the lunch special; we tried almost everything on the special menu amongst us. It was really good and worth the price. Service is also good and responsive. I would definitely recommend this place.

J5Mf9p4_Xb581ouocyXpiA.text: Just off the strip. These guys have great meats and fresh sea food to grill. Their steamed vegetable packets are yummy and the darn kabocha squash tempura is just absolutely delicious. Beats driving all the way to Spring Mountain Road. We've been here 4 times and it never disappoints!

X8-Pjl5ZJB-cM-B6jaOO-g.text: Ate here for my birthday with my girlfriend, and we both enjoyed it thoroughly.  We got the Gangnam. It was good, the oysters were definitely a first for both of us.  Some of the meat could've used more seasoning, but hey meat is meat to me! Service was good. I didn't use the bathroom so I'm not sure how that was. However, judging from the seating area, I wouldn't be surprised if it was just as clean.

tzDEuWZX27QKHOqfga2-1w.text: The staff was very friendly and attentive and the food was really good.  I definitely recommend this place if your trying to indulge in eating some good Korean BBQ.

yfPQYWkjh-NgHAT1YfKfQg.text: A solid Korean BBQ near the Vegas Strip  TIP: In case you want 1 free dessert during your visit, you have to show a posted Yelp review to your server! Just SHOW it!  Location (4/5): The restaurant locates in a corner of a big plaza. Watch out for the big Gangnam sign! From the outside, the restaurant looks pretty dark but it becomes divey when you walk inside.  Services (5/5): We came at 7pm in a party of 7 and quickly get situated! Our server was very friendly. She was also quick at prepping for our BBQ and bringing out side dishes! Since we came in a large group, they also helped us to calculate 18% gratitude fee in the bill.   Food (4/5): You have the choices of ordering individual dishes or order a set such as Las Vegas, Meat Lover, Gangnam (#1 bestseller) and Premium (best cuts). All sets come available for 2, 4 or 6 people with different prices. We ordered Meat Lover for 4 people for a party of 6 adults and 1 child. The portions were huge! It also came with complimentary side dishes, miso soups, rice bowls, salads and dumplings. It was more than enough for us! We also ordered the Kobe Beef Carpaccio ($9.95) and Salmon Carpaccio ($7.95). The Kobe beef was literally melting in my mouth! Soooooo sofffttt! The salmon, on the other hand, added a hint of freshness in a jungle of grilled meat! For dessert, we shared a vanilla macaron ice cream from Brick's! They have the macaron ice cream fridge right at the door, so give it a try if you need a togo dessert!    I will definitely come back for more :)

qOSjJNIr8GHfjTGNndul-w.text: Great food and they have macaroons if you check in. It's a bit pricey but definitely worth the money.

BR-w_uOi96Rwy48r--p7Lw.text: This is an amazing restaurant! The staff is amazing and the food has been excellent the two times I have been here for lunch. I never have to wait and they serve great complimentary appetizers. Everything about this place is superb!

5M88HkJRBp_P0imv1saI6Q.text: One of the best Korean BBQ places I've been to.  Reasonable prices for both combo meals and single items.  Great atmosphere and the staff is attentive and very friendly!  Will definitely be coming back!  We left happy and full!  Plus, those ice cream macaroons are so darn cute and tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice cream macaroons, sooooo good!!! Coffee (left), Mango (right)

infu1h0kHFgXZA3UJPH0mw.text: This place is about 2 miles off-Strip in a shopping center and offers great Korean BBQ options at a surprisingly decent price. It's probably the cheapest BBQ I've had that does not sacrifice on quality. There were many different options, a la carte or combos for 2 or more people- we decided a la carte was better since we could order exactly what we wanted. Pork belly is my favorite, so we had several portions of it in addition to the spicy pork. Also ordered kimchi jjigae on the side. The taste of the kimchi was a little off that day, so naturally, the jjigae had the same flavor, but it wasn't too bad. There was plenty of panchan, and all of the dipping sauces were complimentary, including the sesame oil and salt (they no longer charge additional for it).  Service was excellent. The servers were very friendly and attentive, refilling our drinks and panchan as needed. So glad I tried them out and would definitely consider them again next time I'm in Vegas.

skrWOLi94VC5bghljT2oxg.text: Just loved this Korean BBQ....currently as #8 of Yelps best Vegas restaurants we thought it deserved that rating and more ... get the #1 banquet for 4 (we had 5 peeps and there was ample for 5)... Gangnam ... plus a bottle of the sweet unfiltered Sake ... what I say but 'Superb'!!! Also the Miso was so good !!

19nds9Wm0Z1-41TSwPgDWA.text: Came in on Saturday night and this place was totally empty. I was a party of 1 because I had been desperately craving Korean BBQ. The prices are pretty reasonable, although I know most of you will whine that they aren't AYCE. They have slightly lower prices on certain meats during lunch and happy hour. I started off with the typical pork belly, beef brisket and seaweed salad. I must say the quality of meats is a step above the other AYCE places on Spring Mtn. hence you get what you pay for. Both meats were very delicious and I was still a tad bit hungry so my server recommended to me pork toro. The meat was just okay and I actually prefer the pork belly instead of this, plus it's cheaper too. The service was good for the most part, but since the place was empty, at one point the server and host both disappeared on me, which delayed me from ordering my second round of meat. It wasn't too big a deal because someone eventually appeared again in the dinning room. I live really close to this place and I will probably be coming more often. This is a perfect option if you want Korean BBQ, but your waistline can't afford to do AYCE. Also a nice place for lunch, because if I would of stuck to the beef brisket, pork belly and rice my bill would of been around $10. Can't wait to come back especially since eating here won't break my budget.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly cookin&#39;

rDrvm-ADshfdIlwKve_8qg.text: I recommend the gangnam combo, prime Kali is highly recommended. This is the best place to have lunch with friends. Marinated beef is also great, and side dishes are surprisedly delicious. Anyway, if you want to try authentic Korean BBQ, this is the place you should come.

X-bS2GG-FGrIdKOOlOIVjQ.text: Amazing Korean BBQ. Excellent service. Kobe beef was super. Side dishes are fresh and awesome. Portions a bit on small side, but reflects the cost. You can try more meats this way! Top it off ... they have PSY music videos in the background. Truly a Korean experience. Next time we fly by ... will definitely stop by. Also the ice cream macaroons were awesome!

ERMh34sOXJSvzfoBe8rs9w.text: Visiting from out of town and came upon this spot. Wish it was all you can eat but it was still pretty good. Pork belly and the seafood tofu soup was on point.

S5dPVDRH3t-c4Dy_fxeTrQ.text: Fun experience grilling your own meat in front of you. The combos for 2 people is a ton of food and everything was really tasty. Great service, kind employees.

BO-la2fK1RKLSMj0HnqYHQ.text: Great food and great customer service! Would recommend to anyone in Las Vegas looking for high quality kbbq

kajDK7CI96dgGTE_7vBTiA.text: love the food it's amazing....my husband is a big fan of Korean BBQ and he brought me here to try for the first time...i can say I'll be back for more!! :)

B-UlAh8qrURvzxWnuhM05g.text: This place is amazing!  It's clean and stylish, unlike some of the BBQ I have been.  Now keep in mind they do not have AYCE, which is good because you don't have meat just lying out until it is all gone; quality control is what I would say about their meat!  Now for beginners or people who never been to a Asian BBQ style restaurant like this, I would suggest ordering al la carte first.  I know they offer combo meal but it's a lot of food and you may be gambling with what you "may" like or not like.  You can always order as you cook.  Service is excellent and they check up on you in timely manners.  That was a big plus for me...we all know that server at that restaurant where the server just keeps coming back and interrupting...well that is not the case here.    As for location, it is situated in a shopping center that offers multiple eatery places, sushi, mexican, etc.  The only thing I would be caution on is that it is located across the street from Hard Rock Hotel and Casino.  I can only imagine just how busy they may be during the weekend.  If you don't want to wait or be in a crowded situation, I would suggest going during the week days.    The thought of them now while writing this review makes my mouth water again!  Hahaha!

GVOrS8PZMrUn8JOeceaDAA.text: The customer service was amazing. The server was very nice and welcoming. There was no wait. They walked us straight to our table.   The bulging And beef toro is very tender and tasty. The vibes and feel of the place was great.   The happy hour is very good. Amazing prices and food. Very affordable and spacious. I highly recommend.

guH2Ipo-qoC5-EhFcnbdDw.text: Visited during happy hour! The food was incredibly delicious. Value/Money is spot on.

zJ5wmMhf-Yp77wso1w1a5g.text: As a vegetarian, I found the menu to have plenty of delicious options. My favorite BBQ dish was the zucchini, which tasted great after spending a short time on the grill. Grilling the food was fun and it tasted great when all was said and done! It elevated dining to an experience. I also really enjoyed the atmosphere and the service was friendly and prompt.

3zFWPRxcWLiEgAk_QP5LbQ.text: sheach on yelp is really worth five stat.don't say anything.everything is prefect.just go!

hAz8cZz_XVuLy1GxZmzHUg.text: Amazing food. Almost too much to eat it all. We ordered a meal for 6 and were a party of 8 and we still couldn't finish it all. Highly recommend this Korean BBQ. You'll leave full and satisfied. The Macaron Ice Cream is worth every penny too!

n3WPdASzhKXHGZnc7TIi7g.text: Great food and having fun with the know. Ordered the meat lovers special. Everything this high quality that offers you a little bit of everything. The service is friendly and explains what everything is and what order to cook in. Would come back again for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This place is great for korean bbq. Got the meat lovers platter. It was great and I would totally come back. Service is great.

pDtMe830ZbJMriqMgzm5zA.text: This is our first experience with eating Korean barbecue with the actual grill the table. They were very patient, and the food is delicious. Side dishes are yummy, portions are good, prices are totally reasonable, restaurant is beautiful, and the bulgogi bibimbap is my favorite. My kids also loved it; pretty sure my 8-year-old ate three bowls of fish cake. The $45 Las Vegas combo was plenty for all four of us!

S8dAGyNZmrd3Io1NLWqxQg.text: Came in for a late lunch to a fairly quiet restaurant, with only one server who was hustling his few tables and doing an excellent job juggling them.   We ordered Bibimbap ($12) and spicy Sukiyaki Noodles ($9), our server tossed the dishes for us on their sizzling hot plates, brought us hot tea and let us eat our enormous portions in quiet recovery (this IS Vegas after all, who isn't having breakfast at early dinner time, and nursing some form of hang over?).   As the restaurant got busier, our solo server got some help as a new guy started his shift, and we weren't forgotten in the hustle.  The interior of the restaurant is soothing, Asian minimalism, a nice balance between Japanese and Korean stylings, as is the food. I love trying restaurants off the strip in Vegas, as they are SO much better quality and pricing than anything near the touristy parts.   Gangnam was so much more appetizing than anything we could have hoped for on a post-EDC weekend  ;D  Located in the corner of a mini-mall, if you love legit, delicious, fine Asian dining, you MUST come here!

viSISImxWXMD_UBw3_-n3A.text: The food was amazing and the service was even better! We had the "Las Vegas" meal special for 4 people and it was delicious. They give you generous amounts of meats (garlic chicken, spicy chicken, flank, and shrimp) and 2 bowls of bulgogi bibimbap.  The bibimbap is the best I've ever had! We also tried the sweet corn cheese appetizer which goes perfectly with the grilled meats.  Would come back again 100%!

FCIik3aQ4tmd-nfsxkVVLA.text: Came in here for lunch on a Tuesday. Was a little worries when I walked in for lack of people but was quickly greeted and sat.   This is a very trendy place with good Japanese pop music to go with the theme of this restaurant.   I ordered beef with a side of broccoli with the add on soup and salad for lunch. Everything I had was amazing. The beef so tender and steamed broccoli right on the grill was great.   Highly recommend this place.  For the excellent service and phenomenal food.  The only reason for not 5 stars is I want to come back for a second visit soon and make sure today wasn't just a fluke. Once I do that I can hopefully upgrade my rating.

EvZXODpgxeSi6VWNcR2Kew.text: ....well i would not even give it "one star"...this place sucks one girl a desk and two guys trying to get people done....sat in the coner...7 of us and they would not even wait on us for 15 mins we got up and left...!!!!

zUn-jwGQibzyZ8AwrcsqVg.text: Everything we tried is pretty good. Our entire party was vegetarian but we had plenty of dishes to choose from. They were able to remove the meat and seafood from many of the dishes we ordered. They also have a pretty extensive selections of vegetables to grill. The corn, zuchinni, and enoki mushroom were particularly good.

4rnC6-j0QFecnxtu7Ci8Uw.text: This was my first time here  and the food was amazing. The bulgogi was my favorite. The service was quick and very friendly.

IQJJS2x44kOjRhkI6gVgAw.text: Friendly staff, clean and good was pretty amazing.  The price was also pretty cheap in comparison to other Korean bbq

kiv3Irjt7_UZyQyMo6Pa_Q.text: Found this place on Yelp and it had really good ratings! I think it def lived up to expectations. We are not from Vegas, but if we ever come back we would for sure revisit! We got two orders of Kalbi short ribs, one order of the spicy chicken with lemon sauce, one order of bulgogi, and one order of pork belly. We were truly stuffed. We would've went with the meat lovers combo or the Las Vegas combo for two, but it would've been way too much for us.  All in all, great place, good atmosphere, clean and good service.

vrVRE7H3E5YUA74ZFVSu-Q.text: My family loved this place and we've definitely been around top-rated places in San Diego, Tokyo and Bangkok. This was the first bbq place that had duck breast and it was so fresh and flavorful. My parents were especially fans of the kalbi but I stuck with the half-priced brisket out of my ayce habits. Come during happy hour and they have good deals on drinks, appetizers and meats. Service was a little slow and we had to remind them of our order a couple times but it was probably because we were seated in a corner in the back. Nevertheless, this was one of our favorite meals in Vegas.

8ZyqgXiggJXDrl8WU6RnUw.text: This place is so good. We came for happy hour and had dinner and the prices were also great. The Korean prime kalbi and the bulgogi were our favorite but everything was amazing. I'd never had cucumber kimchi before and I really liked it.

seP3It-KaOMg1MZcAq9WAg.text: First time visit!  Quick and efficient service...great meats - tender and flavorful. Went with the Gangnam combo. Our favorites were the Kalbi Korean marinated meat and the miso meat.   Banchan was yummy - especially loved the fish cake, cuttlefish and kimchi.

XuwBwl8lTmqZhkRLT2Novw.text: Eat it, enjoy it, it's awesome. Check in for free ice cream. Get off the strip, the best food is not necessarily on the strip.

oW_2t1nfOMDYHoL6FvIjTw.text: This is probably one of the best korean BBQ restaurant in town! Highly recommended for Kobe and toro!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5CYMo7vWhG1uOVZEpVuX5w.text: Best Korean bbq in Nevada! Order premium dinner set! Legit quality juicy meat! We love the service too!

sjkZJu-hr3GvX0rbqYfjTQ.text: Ugh so amazing and so awesome for a date I got the meat lovers and it was the perfect amount of food I've been wanting to go back her ever since the last time I went

ZXct34xnVryVeoSVhFCJ5w.text: I love this place, definitely for happy hour. Not the most choices but cheaper & provide a good mix with their regular menu! The atmosphere is very fun!

LFhUuk3cZRwOMbDtTVQhNw.text: A Japanese restaurant in Korean BBQ clothing. First off all the 5 star ratings are rigged as they "Bribe" you with free dessert for a review and must see it. I will pay for my own dessert thank you very much(Best thing on the menu btw).  I live in OC and close to Ktown so I guess you can say I'm spoiled but when you ask for Korean radish and they have no idea what you're taking about and everything is in Japanese something is a miss. In looking around it was brilliant as there are many sushi restaurants in LV and 2 in the same shopping center as Gangnam (btw really I should have known better) so the owner thought hey we can serve Korean and then bribe yelpers with free dessert for the 2k worth of reviews. For all you yelpers that sold out for dessert SHAME.....ding ding.......SHAME!!!!!  It's not the worst place if you don't know better and could get 3 stars tops but I feel duped as I fell for the 2 thousand plus reviews.   Anyway do your homework and look for authentic KBBQ .

5KefBoImctuugG6Etypd3A.text: Awesome food.    Great service.     I am staying at the hyatt and walked across the street for some food.  Came across this place.   Not too expensive.   Tried the Las Vegas meal with my coworker and it came with a lot of sides.  I am completely full and have left overs :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. staying at the hyatt and got the Las Vegas meal. Food is deliciosu

zQ0PIltfnodey9tPc25eVQ.text: Had the premium combo BBQ. Starters in the combo were good, loved the Kobe beef carpaccio and tuna poki. Also ordered a steamed egg appt, really not that good. Egg is way too solid and over cooked. BBQ meats were overall good quality. Kobe beef was my favorite.   Wait time was 30-45 mins with 3 groups of 2-3 ppl ahead of us.  Servers were all very nice.   Good experience overall.

CmwzaINOMhwx3hg2XjrVuQ.text: Great food. Worked better for us since we don't really eat much. The meat lover for two was more than enough for three of us.

to9S01p1sLlqHmwtk0mC5w.text: The cuts are bigger than we're used to. But it was still delicious! The uni bimbimbap was bomb dot com! The tongue and kalbi was good too!

ecLFXqj19nAXkoDxPiQkZQ.text: The service was fast and I had not one complaint about any of the food.  My friend that I was with is usually particularly picky about chicken and had no complaints. He ended up ordering four portions of it.  Being a vegetarian obviously my options are limited but everything else about the restaurant was right on point to me.  For omnivores this is a must visit spot for 2-4 people to fill their stomachs!

1qMQAPcR6Y2rznK4FYV3aA.text: They were a little reluctant to give me by myself a table but once I insisted it was awesome. All the fun of coming here is cooking the meat in my opinion, like at a yakiniku place in Japan that I often miss. It's very reasonably priced too and everything is great. I didn't really like the sides that came with it, but that's personal preference (not a fan of cold pickled bleh kimchi and vegetables). But nonetheless, I definitely will return.

UiRuC4FU71v0UuodGU8lww.text: It was great! We would recommend getting separate individual dishes of items you want, comes out  a. It a cheaper than there meals for two options. The star rating is lacking one because the service can be absent at times.

s63siJV255E7KHnjBDg7ZQ.text: My friends and I always come here for happy hour and absolutely love it! To simply put it, a great place with delicious and quality Korean BBQ meat, popping vibes, and quick service. Will definitely go again and again.

x40atMpNu-xSSpE7Sm6ABg.text: This is our crews lunch spot. Very convenient/closed to the hotel I work at. I normally order sukiyaki noodle with beef in the hotstone bowl. They are perfect seasoning, just that the portion is a bit smaller than how I would expect, But again, delicious food. The place is normally not too crowed for lunch but definitely is crowded for dinner (we came here once for dinner). Would always come back and recommend to anyone for this restaurant.

wwz97kqJaFwge_pTeomyrQ.text: Great food. Order a couple at a time as it's not AYCE. Great service!

v2VumtMM5hBnYfGoK_eJCQ.text: Good god it's yummy! Loved my first Kor BBQ experience! Definitely get the Kobe beef, scallops & lots of saki!!

o6cnfQLDirMmzRH8gRSRNw.text: Decent Korean food and awesome deal with the combo. The Las Vegas combo is $46 and (though for two people) it can definitely feed 3. It comes with tons of meat (best of which is the beef toro), broccoli cheese fondue (amazing combination), bugolgi bimbimbap, house salad and a bunch of small Korean appetizers (fish cake is delicious). The meat came in raw and unlike other Korean bbq places, you gotta do BBQ yourself and it's definitely the fun part. If you can't finish all, you can get it to go. Came on a Sat noon for lunch and the place wasn't super crowded. The service was decent and food came really really fast. Don't forget to check in here as you get a free macaron ice cream sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Feast!!

I04nJGPpEFZV-t28M4zKpg.text: Being from Southern Utah good korean food is hard to come by.  This was the Best Korean BBQ!!  Our waiters were very friendly and made sure we had everything we needed.  Food was exceptional and we can't wait to go back again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We got the Meat Lovers for 2 and the 3 of us couldn&#39;t hardly finish all the food we had!!
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat Lovers!!  Best Korean BBQ ever!  So much food...so little bellies.

jzGU8omN1rqsRU_kOB00uQ.text: This is the best Korean bbq I had so far in United State. Price is reasonable and the set comes with a lot of food such as raw oyster, poke, soap, etc

wfVMSsGeBog7q0gi8bVKGQ.text: The guy said 15 to 30 minute wait.... turned our to be 1 hour and 30 minutes.  My kids are crying.  They kept of having their customer friends cut the line. 3 to 4 groups cut our line.  And even the restroom it will take you 10 to 15  minutes of waiting.    By the time we've sited after 90 minutes of waiting... we've waited another 15 min. Just to get a freaking bottled water.   The food is moderate. Quality degraded. And not sure if those wagyu Kobe are even real. For 4 to 6 BBQ which is only good for 1 or 2 at the most you'll end up paying a minimum of $50. Might as well go to AYCE Korran BBQ.   Totally not worth it.  Overrated, overpriced. Not coming back!

dfYb3vivLcb4oGcqvYKKoQ.text: The beef tongue and pork belly were good. Spicy tofu soup was salty but overall service was good

N3aUte_hXdyqisemTOrDvg.text: I meant to leave this review a month ago, but forgot. Really enjoyed the food.  The Servers were wonderful as well.  Spent a considerable amount of time explaining and recommending dishes to me.  They genuinely seemed happy to help.  Would recommend and will go back when in Vegas.

CzI3gl1IksvWyyRq9OdJIw.text: It was my first time having Korean bbq!  This place was very yummy and a wonderful experience ! I'd highly recommend this for a first time visit.

CXM5p945nP8QqOxDUYo_mQ.text: A refreshing spin on Las Vegas Korean BBQ.  Environment: The restaurant is located near UNLV and the area itself is in that less-than-impressive area behind the strip but the business of the area does help to detract from the somewhat uninviting surroundings. The inside of the restaurant however is pleasantly hip and reminds me of a cross between Gen and Hobak in that there are some neon lights as well as wooden benches giving the restaurant a trendy yet homey feel.   Food: As per usual for non-all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ spots, it's typically best to go with one of the pre-made sets, which offer a variety of meats as well as a selection of side-dishes. The one we went with seemed to be the most popular choice, and it was a little out of the ordinary compared to other restaurants. It did come with a variety of meats, along with an interesting salad, the standard Korean side dishes, and my favorites, yuzu shishito peppers and 4 oysters on half shell. Additionally, there was a bibimbap which was surprisingly delicious as well. The meats themselves were mostly marinated which was good, because the sauces we were given were underwhelming and blended into each other or did not have enough impact. They also did have a happy hour when we went in which was nice because it was a Friday night and half off any soju and beer is always a great thing.  Service: Service was appropriate and was prompt. Additionally, one of our servers was especially helpful and was helpful in changing the grill anytime we required it.  Overall, I was pleasantly surprised with this restaurant after hearing a lot about it and not really knowing what exactly to expect, and I will most likely be coming back again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat set
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters

pLLYFEYUg53lwSjkX_SZ2A.text: The only setback for this place is that its not an all-you-can-eat place, however the quality of meat is good. Service is prompt. Wait time varies...I have had to wait for this place before for an hour and this visit it was only 15 mins.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Only setback for this place is that its not an all-you-can-eat place, however the quality of meat is good and service is prompt.

_NQIp5zkXOLwFgs7FfCGLg.text: Awesome customer service, incredible options especially for lunch which was totally affordable! Location is prime too. Loved my experience  thanks David for being our server you rocked!

4r8PF_tRlbLo17_7bJmntw.text: The best Korean bbq hands down.  I like that it's not all u can eat. We pick as we go worth every penny.

iWCD1VnsufcQ9SoLS3VLtQ.text: very passionate service! love it! definitely tip them 20%!! their meat is from paradise, especially the pork toro!!!

aOW4EuDE-oam3UY5tLAjBA.text: Had  an all around good experience on a Thursday night at 8 pm. Sat right down  in a mostly full dining room.The menus are either a la carte or fixed menus of various meats and seafood. The service  was attentive and prompt , we ended up ordering 2  good apps seafood pancake and  fried dumplings. Then went in for 5 meat dishes of various cuts including the pork belly. Kalbi, Toro, Briskit, Bulgogi (recommended) .Most  had really good seasoning but also they included great condiments, 3 different sauces  and their kimchi was real tasty. It's a fun place with a clean interior, you can linger and enjoy relaxed dinner here. There was a lot of other tasty looking seafood dishes to return for.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gettin the grill goin

V8zGbOnIUfDimSscfYtYyQ.text: Meat selections were alright, nothing that was going to knock your socks off.  Service took a long time, the macron ice cream sandwich however was delicious, not worth the $4. Yelp offers a free macron ice cream sandwich if you check in, offer is good for 3 hours.

CwLj1FAyC-iekxBGDCkbSw.text: Introduced to this hidden treasure by a Vegas local. The food was mouth watering. The service was phenomenal. And that Kobe beef. Do not pass it up. Will be making a visit next time I'm in Vegas.

2jeggyNHLkE1nqOOr37FqA.text: All time favorite, the proportion is perfect doesn't matter how many people in your party. Super super good service, I never had any bad experience with it. Jin is the best one, carefully explain to us what thing or what should we get and very patience to accommodate your needs.   Definitely come back again!

KYrgusVeF5uKqyuHpEFomg.text: Great food and cheap happy hour! Service was great and it's not too far from the main strip. Small downside is that they charge for every little thing you ask for that most Korean BBQ places would include with meals.

Hus7EysToEE3K81ewZvN7Q.text: Great experience eating here. The food was great ! I would recommend it to everybody. The service here was good too......

7n6rD_paP6EgMx9dW2j97A.text: Food was good, but service was reaaallllllly bad. We ordered more bulgogi, and after about 15 minutes, we learned it was delivered to another table. The server took it off their table and tried to give it to us... Seriously?

UDpUJrdh8pDWOZMD2l_nXQ.text: Meat quality was good. Good soju cocktail choices. Happy hour from 3pm to 6pm lately. Great place for special occasion.

7fJEHsLPsooLfrh90zmIJA.text: At first we were intimidated by the ala carte pricing. $1.95 for rice and $1.00 for dipping sauce (salt & sesame oil), but it comes out to less then other Korean BBQ places and we left just as full. The portions were generous and service was great! We got cooking pointers and sauce recommendations. Atmosphere was trendy and clean. Would definately eat here again!

D20yoOmDr9_ixw0ZNd_5hw.text: It was good and delicious good place to dinner for two or more. We ordered the meat lover combo for two, it was enough food for two people and the taste was good too.

J9noQi01XjUUDWiTJXUexQ.text: the atmosphere and set up was very nice. food was satisfying especially their pork belly. i also highly recommend their chicken cheese fondue plates. will come back!

8tDFgdYi3Cc5xcQzmeEdHg.text: I came here on a Monday for lunch and waited 30 mins for seating. I had the lunch special and tried the bulgogi and Korean chicken for protein, house salad, cream cheese wonton for appetizer, and added beef brisket and rice. I think the meat was marinated a little too sweet (I am a meat lover btw). I really like the cream cheese wonton, but not the sauce that came with it. The restaurant was clean. It only have one restroom stall for each gender. I had a tall, Korean waiter and he was doing a great job even though he forgot to bring the macaroni salad I requested. It's okay though. I saw him running back and forth, so I didn't get upset. Overall, the food here was mediocre. I live in SoCal and I prefer the kbbq in or near my area because it an all-you-can-eat restaurant and/or buffet. The restaurant was clean. It only have one restroom stall for each gender. They also have a little bar area. So, I think this place is ok, not bad of course.

c5nUSZJ_RNsR4eXQuP_M5w.text: great service and loved the food!!! the rice was awesome and I loved the shrimp. I highly recommend this place if you want Korean food!

ZpHdIbii5nXQBX_NoRrnNw.text: Great food! Worth the drive from the strip. Will sure come back when we visit Las Vegas again. Kristine gave us great service and always had a smile every time.

qziTA3BEDGyCCWaUzF21Pg.text: As a non-meat person (I like my veggies a lot) this was a really great Korean bbq place to eat. The service was great and the people were super nice. Shoutout to Kristin our waitress! My friend and I (both of us eat an average amount) came for a later lunch and had decently fast service. We got the meat lovers deal and had almost enough food for two meals so definitely be prepared to eat or to take something home.

qdXZb4dhuQeQUKFoV1BNYg.text: The price is reasonable for Korean bbq. The food was delicious! I recommend everyone eating here. The service is good too

Uqu6jzx1uEx8aATmMbkrFQ.text: I tried numerous things on the menu and I have several favorites. some are great and some and just okay. Overall, I recommend this place.

ei-wGcnCuKf3dGY3tAVSiA.text: Food was good and the staff was friendly. The portions, however, were not worth the price paid. If there were specials that rivaled Tofu Hut in value then my rating would surely increase.

SDPCmxDLkXKy7DXI42cDvg.text: Great food, decent prices, convenient location. Nice variety of small plates. I recommend the dynamite shrimp and the jalapeno salmon poppers.

53qe9eaHj8N6zCvB0UHVkQ.text: We loved all the meats  and mushroom dishes. We would come back again. Last year when we came with a group of 8 we ordered the different dinners for 2. This time we ordered a LA cart and it was perfect for the 5 of us.

2rpBHY_uICeh6aZLiWbjVg.text: Arrived in Las Vegas from Los Angeles, got to our hotel and looked for a place to eat... They're the first one to pop up since our hotel is very close to this restaurant. Checked the reviews and decided right away to try the place... And guess what?! EXTREMELY SATISFIED!!! Especially that I am a big Korean Dish Lover!!! I enjoyed my Bulgogi Bibimbap! Really tasty! My family opted for some Bulgogi, Pork Belly and Brisket since they have a HAPPY HOUR SPECIAL!! This is such an awesome spot!! The meats are really tender and juicy! I loved the Pork Belly the most! The environment is really clean and the servers are really friendly and informative! They made sure that we know how the menu works. They also offer some Japanese dishes! But I recommend the Korean dishes more. The side dishes are also amazing, they are honestly to die for! I always go to Koreatown in LA and yes, it has the same quality as it is in KTown! Will definitely come back whenever I visit Las Vegas!!!

1_G4co39zI-gwyEsBZryIQ.text: Great find! Place is super clean, decor is modern and atmosphere was really good. The ribeye, kobe and chicken  were delicious. Bonus for us was when the waiter told us the chicken was organic!  My 10 yr old loves to grill at the table so we frequent gyo-kaku grill at home BUT this place has better food and prices.

fXvrj8fLOpKBNJhPXYI8Ig.text: The host was very nice in updating me how many tables were ahead of me, even though it really did not shorten my wait.  It took them about 5 minutes to take our order since it was a rather busy night.  The server brought us the side dishes right away.  When I asked a passing waitress for water several minutes later, she told me that MY server will bring me water later..........the water came 3 minutes later but with quite a bit of attitude.  Just placed it on the table without saying a word and with a rather annoyed look about her.  My experience with the service so far has been average., although may be typical for a Korean restaurant.  Now on to the wait for the food.........(the longer the dots....the longer the wait)..........is 10 minutes a long wait?........3 of the 6 items ordered came at the 11 minute mark........5 more minutes later 1 more item came.......3 minutes more and my fifth item came......I don't get how long it takes to cook udon for my little daughter.....anyway, 3 more minutes later and my daughter finally has her udon.  The food was actually very tasty and worth the walk from the strip but I am not entirely happy with the service.  Would I come back again ($64K question)...probably as long as I can tolerate the wait and service.  Time to hit the slots and win me back some money.

Pq50etoXtGNr2V352ya5iw.text: This place was a real let down.  I had dinner here with a couple friends and we were all of a similar opinion.  First off the prices are a bit over inflated as is evident by the constant "sale" prices on the menu, everything is apparently half off and it still is not worth it.  We ordered a combination that allowed us to try just about everything they had on the menu.  The only items that I would have given more than two stars were the bulgogi and some fried chicken bites in a spicy sauce.  The scallops we ordered were not cooked properly (almost raw) and had a bit of funky fishy taste to them (in an old scallop way).  The service was very poor and quite slow.  When we brought the quality of the scallops to our server's attention, he commented "well, that just how they are here." As someone who enjoys good Korean BBQ, I had high hopes for this restaurant, but it simply failed to impress and for the money you would be much happier going somewhere else, like Honey Pig.

WW3y0x0Ib2BqlhbiGlXrUA.text: Fantastic food and service! We had brisket, pork belly, bulgogi and sausage and were pleasantly surprised to get table BBQ service for lunch. Everything including the appetizers, salad and soup were delicious -and at a great price!  We had a baby with us and everyone was friendly and helpful. This beats the Korean BBQ we've had in NYC.

mufK6CJXops-7ynwWczHIQ.text: Pretty good, good banchan. We ordered the Las Vegas meal with the mushroom medley instead of broccoli which was really tasty and a good call. Was a little pricey but the environment was pretty.

p51lhEyrP-7vD7z1JTuU2g.text: Decent price. Meat was pretty good quality. The service could be better as far as attentiveness but overall a great experience.

gym8qaWbbzZhfkX-RCH8Qw.text: went here last night after the fiance got in and it was pretty good. I was surprised though that our bill still came out to $50. I thought everything had a lot of taste and the staff was very nice.   We got the following:  House salad - good size for the price Squid - about 5 pieces for $6 but it was good Kalbi - We got hte $8 kalbi meat which was like 6 small pieces so i felt that could have been a bit bigger cuts Bi Bim Bap - $10 - big portion and bf said it was good Also got a couple of veggies - mushroom melody and peppers - both were good as well.   overall not bad if you are not looking for AYCE.

GQe1PNwUMpVjP1Lr5MwmyA.text: Came here with my brothers and sister-in-law during a trip to vegas, and was more than impressed. We had our own private room in the back (even though we were just a party of 5) and the waitress was very attentive, and explained the menu well. The paradise A combo i split with my brother, and we got more than enough food for even 3 people.  The Harami Miso, prime kalbi, and calimari were all top notch. The meat and veggies were brought out quickly and you could cook them to whatever liking you choose. I'd come back here on future vegas trips.

LNBKSZMV2o-6j_RG3arX3A.text: Really delicious food, fun experience. Easy menu, we ordered filet migon and garlic shrimp you get to cook to your liking which is a plus, most restaurants never cook my steak the right way. They give you a bunch of sides which were interesting, my favorite was the fried squid. Chicken fried rice was really good, really big portion good for two people. The sangria was awesome !! If I ever come back to Vegas we would definitely come back. Wish New York had something like this it would do really well!

JeVv8oRQ8Q0WYVD-G2M-Tw.text: We've never trier KBBQ in Las Vegas, so this is a first. The restaurant is in a plaza surrounded with other restaurants as well. Its nice and the staff were friendly. The food is good but can be a bit pricey.

-jf23JMcxi34GB-fBw9GEg.text: Taste good. No staff helped doing barbecue. People will not ensure where to start if they never try Korean BBQ before.

1uSN3JC7f1k72uRqaDNLkg.text: The food was tasty and excellent. The kim chee was fresh and tasty, and the green salad was exceptional. The restaurant was hip and there's a cool vibe happening while dining. The meats were fresh and high grade. The marinated meats were succulent. I'd recommend this place to my family and friends.

tcrZLCSsYfWghlWxbDYlXw.text: Lived in Vegas 2 years now and this place is up the road from me. Second time here in a month and it is so good!!

2d5zsasLXM3T88PUjZNI5g.text: Visiting from Chicago. Boyfriend wanted some Korean BBQ, this place was amazing. I liked the music they played in the background. The seating was roomy. Service was fast and food was delicious! Meat was high quality. We split the meat lovers meal for 2 people and it was more than enough food for a reasonable price. Go go go!

QACKODsq9w-kaf1cjaWCyA.text: Korean BBQ is always fun and a great option if you want to get away from the strip. We had a group of 8 and called about 30 min ahead and our table was ready for us when we arrived (around 830pm on a Friday). Service was super fast and most of our dishes came out within 5 min of ordering. Our fave dishes were the steamed chili dumplings, dynamite shrimp, spicy chicken with lemon sauce, bulgogi, kobe and the filet mignon. Everything was perfectly seasoned and gobbled up immediately. Honestly the veg options were delicious too--particularly the sweet corn (which you can grill) and the broccoli and cheese fondu (already cooked.) The best part though was that all the complimentary sides (and there are a ton) are brought to you immediately so you can start snacking away while perusing the large menu. Cool place to check out and especially fun with a large group. Also don't forget the Yelp check-in offer for a free dessert macaron! Not amazing, but hey it's dessert and its free.

3P8PVATpZpqJ3YbbUtlMKg.text: Very satisfied with our food! Food is good and customer service is awesome! I got the original bibimbap with tofu. Such a good option for vegetarians which is a plus for me!

21kZqXKlLVaJSTp6bhndFQ.text: Outstanding service. Great food and atmosphere!  Great value if you try the Gangnam combo, we did it for two people and we had plenty of food.

Ma9c_wBiRnHYjuA_6qiuNA.text: Came with group of my friends. Place has good variety of food. Great to come for happy hour.

WJiWiXVwyg6xErknCr97Xw.text: Nice ambiance, nice presentation.  Food is good! It's always warm because of the hot stone. You can even have them cook the meat for you which is convenient. Love the environment. Server was super nice! The food on the menu may look small, but it's shareable. I'd come back.

OpQRvXqxsyYA-LP8MHJ9jw.text: It smells great in here if you like food. You can't help but get hungrier when you walk in. The servers were helpful about recommending what's good. The food was really good too. I had the steamed galbi and the marinated beef on the mist try menu. I would definitely come back here when I'm in Vegas.

OeMuhQtd7_5ym5wcgwhC0w.text: Not expecting such a long wait for a Wednesday night, but apparently this place is popular!  The servers were helpful in choosing from the menu. Ordered the original bibimbap, squash tempura, and flat iron garlic and bacon wrapped scallops for the grill. You MUST order the scallops!!!! So delicious!  Everything else was tasty, too.  Atmosphere was great, people are having a good time, the place is super clean, music is fun. Great spot for family meal, catching up with friends, or an adventure in grilling your own food!  Did I mention the servers were fantastic?? Jihoon took great care of us tonight.

UtE7cxs402ZeuXJbjVTB9g.text: We came here for happy hour and I was starving so I order everything on the hh menu and it was so delish and I'm so full I also order a soju cooler green apple flavor it was good also but I'm so full I couldn't even drink it. But this is a good place close by the strip I would definitely come back again.

GbqATYbmn9bmXjreJypwyg.text: First of all - we were inspired to come to Korean BBQ after setting an ad for another place on a billboard. After Yelping some nearby options, the 1300 reviews and a 4.5 star rating, drew us in.   At 7pm on a Saturday, we just weren't sure we could get in so we called ahead and a friendly young man answered. While they don't have a call ahead or reservation list we were able to walk right in.. Though apparently it's not uncommon to have a wait.   After being immediately seated, we were promptly asked for our drink order. And moments after asked if we were ready to order -- through out our meal the service has been efficient,  immediate, and impeccable!   Let's talk about the meal!  We selected the meat lovers meal for 2, though you can order piecemeal - this included 6 meats, 7 sides, and 3 appetisers for $60 after tax. So if you aren't familiar with Korean BBQ, the premises is that they provide the food and you cook it at a grill on your table.  Breaking it down:  APPETISERS Miso Soup Green Salad Steamed Chili Dumplings Spicy Garlic Edamame   MEAT Spicy pork Bulgogi Beef Toro Flat Iron Garlic Pork Belly Filet Minion  SIDES - I am guesstimating what each of these items are, we did not get a rundown.  Bean Sprouts - Good, nice crunch to them, and not particularly strong in flavor. Kimchi - very flavorful without being off putting (assuming you don't dislike kimchi in general) Fish Cakes Jalapenos, Onion, and Ginger - they were in a mild marinade of some sort, really good when we grilled them too! Macaroni Salad - noodles were a little soft for my taste and too mayonnaisey but my friend liked it.  Spicy Squid (I think!) - really delicious (and I don't like seafood, at all), the dressing/marinade was flavorful, almost like the kimchi, and the texture was just right, not too chewy but hardy  Spicy Baby Cucumbers - may have been pickled, but overall nice crunchy texture with a  Rice - sticky and white.. Just a vehicle for everything else! (Forgive me for the constant 'flavorful marinade' comments but I have no idea what it is... Just good! Ha!)  DESSERT Banana Tempura Lava Cake  SAUCES - provided in a little side dish per person!  Spicy soy sauce Sweet soy sauce ? Mild soy sauce-type  Now, you'll notice the extensive reviews for this restaurant... Because they offer a free dessert per Yelp review. They definitely follow through and not based on the score or content! They only check that you post it!   A couple thoughts on improvement --  Provide some direction for cooking each item (meat and sides). While I was familiar with the process, its always nice to hear tips and tricks to making this a  delicious and easy meal.

O3yZOY-Laihse1juNzFDIQ.text: Soooo.. I was looking for a nice spot to have Valentine's Day dinner & happened across Gangnam. It might be off the beaten path, but it's definitely a diamond in the rough. Got here for happy hour & waited about a half hour to be seated. Ordered pork belly, chadulbegi, bulgogi, chicken fondue & a few other things. Bulgogi was not exciting, but everything else.. Wow. Simmered to perfection. Topped it off with a refreshing Sapporo & dinner was complete. Will definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas.

It's in is clean and the interior of the restaurant is modern and tastefully decorated--and again; CLEAN.  It is open until 1 am and we arrived about 11:45 pm.  Although it was late and near closing, we still received excellent and friendly service without ever feeling like being rushed.  We ordered the most popular meal package: The Gangnam which came with a variety of meat cuts and marinades, rice bimibap and assorted dishes like Kim chee and what have you.  They also brought out fresh oysters as well as steamed mushrooms.  Again, everything was super fresh and absolutely delicious!  Highly recommended!

6NuHICBbFLKKSVCujEVbWQ.text: The food deserves five stars, the service two - I'm averaging.  Gangnam does not take reservations. The average wait time for dinner is 30 min if you come with a group, it might be shorter for a couple. We ordered a variety of meats, drinks and rice. The food came out super fast. All of the meats were beautifully marinated and we enjoyed grilling them to perfection. We would've ordered more food and would've had another round of drinks and would redeem our Yelp desert offer if we weren't given a check while we were still eating. After the food arrived we could not get anyone's attention for more drinks and more rice. Finally, I caught one of the guys that was running by and asked for what we needed. Got the rice, not the drinks... Our experience was short and largely unsatisfactory since we felt rushed watching all the staff constantly running by, but seemingly not stopping anywhere.

MpOEunHorpnmZWyjQxLNbQ.text: I have to explain first hand why this place gets a one star.  It's not like this place deserves a low rating and that you better stay away at all costs but having relied on yelp ratings for my first two Korean BBQ meals here in Vegas for Magal and Hobak (both with 4.5 stars with hundreds of reviews) I thought for sure this place must be just as good with 4.5 stars with thousands of reviews.  So with the bar being set from my experience at Magal and Hobak, these are the the things that fall short here.  Service - It's not like it was bad.  It was attentive enough but here you have to do all the grilling yourself.  This was the major disappointment for me when I found out I had to do my own cooking.  Heck I would have stayed home if I had to do my own cooking.  Price - I was able to feed my family of four for $100 at Hobak.  Here it started at $120.  Here the steamed egg side dish was extra and so was dessert.  Both of these were included at the other two.  If you checked in Yelp here you were offered a free macaron ice cream sandwich.  We shared this one macaron amongst the four of us each taking a small bite LOL.  Food - Maybe I overcooked the food or something but the food just didn't seem to taste as good and the beef cuts were just not as premium as the other places.  I think you can order more premium cuts but you had to pay more for it which I guess would fall into price and value just not as good as the others.  I really didn't care for the mushroom medley or the jalapeno peppers that were provided as part of the Gangnam combo.  So with the bar being set with the other two who are at 4.5 stars, Gangnam just doesn't come close so that's why for me it's at the other end of the spectrum.  Maybe I had high expectations going in but we came away very disappointed.

i0V2c1uJHvp9L70v3duOag.text: This is my favourite Korean BBQ place in town! I had the original bibimbap and it was fantastic! Will definitely be coming back here again.

ZEgsvdRG3ieAUkayHaT8Tw.text: We came during EDC weekend on a Sunday evening without a reservation and thought that we would have to wait long, but surprisingly, the wait was only about 15 minutes.   We ordered a la carte because we wanted to try everything, and ended up getting mostly meat dishes. The meat dishes were good, but not as flavorful as I would have liked. However, they were still good. The beef carpaccio was AMAZING and highly suggested. The vegetable dishes were meh, and took forever to come.   I like this place because of the value and the fact that the food was pretty good. Also, that it's an authentic Korean restaurant run by Korean people. The service was attentive and efficient. I recommend this place if you're looking to get your Korean bbq fix :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We ordered so much food they had to give us an extra tray next to the table.

hj87aRtiN9EcoihH7s687g.text: We arrived and were promptly seated and given menus. We decided on the Meat Lovers but substituted spicy garlic edamame for the seaweed salad that was standard. Our sides arrived quickly.  I noticed that we were the minority and the clientele was primarily Asian so I took that as a good sign.    Having never had Korean BBQ before it would have been nice to get some instruction on what to do with everything. As an example, we cooked our meat on the sides instead of in the middle and it kept sticking to the grill. When there was just a little meat left on one plate, the server placed it on the grill for us and that's when we realized our placement error.  Another thing that might be helpful is some type of labeling on all of the different items so we would know what we were eating.   Everything we had was delicious.  I think the standout for me with regards to main dishes was the marinated pork.  All the appetizers were amazing.  The miso soup was so rich and flavorful.  The dressing on the salad was delicious and just the right amount of sweet.  The chili dumplings had a really tasty sauce and I thoroughly enjoyed the spicy garlic edamame.   We discovered why they have so many reviews, too! Free dessert for posting a review. Overall, I really enjoyed my experience and would like to try it again, maybe someplace else to see if the experience is the same.

6VzahkEBYqgXF8KUbg-crw.text: Had a chance this past weekend to visit this KBBQ location. Although it was not all you can eat the amount of food that was received was more than enough. I went with two of my buddies and it was our first time there. We were greeted and seated promptly. Little did we know but we arrived during happy hour. 50% off pitchers and some of the dishes were priced at or around $4.00.  We advised the waitress that this was our first time and she recommended that we do the special for two people(+15% off for happy hour) and if we wanted to order some additional sides. I believe we ended up ordering the #1 with all the different beef options and also two sides of toro. The amount of food that came out was really overwhelming. As with any KBBQ spot the side dishes arrived (kimchi, Mac salad, salad, and some other items) along with the sides came 4 oysters, bibimap(fried rice), mushrooms and I believe that was all. If you have a chance definitely stop in because the food was great. With the three of us the bill came out to around $34/ea.

XVfOf__SdHWmdBZDIcFxAQ.text: I was excited to try out this Korean restaurant while on vacation since the one near me closed down and left me deprived. The complimentary sides were good --- macaroni salad was a little odd but still okay, but the kimchi had some nice heat to it. I ordered garlic duck breast and bulgogi along with a bunch of appetizers...tuna poki, salmon jalapeno poppers,spicy tuna bimbap, and seafood pancake. Oddly, when the meat came out, rice didn't accompany it. Is that common to order rice separately? Bulgogi was flavorful and tender, and so was the duck breast. Tuna poki was spicy...not my favorite...spicy tuna bimbap was so yummy! Seafood pancake was a HOT MESS. Not cohesive...fell apart and properly need a few more minutes of cooking and a lot more seasoning. Salmon poppers had too much going on. I personally didn't like most of the appetizers but the main meats were really good.  I wrote this honest review in exchange for a free macaron ice cream.

z3wvHOttBbQv6bfOB5CDeg.text: Another amazing KBBQ experience down. It's become a tradition now for me and my best friend to have KBBQ at the start of the new year. Not wanting to do AYCE this time around, we found Gangnam and decided to give it a try. I am so happy that we did!   Gangnam is located pretty close to the Hard Rock, next to a lot of other restaurants. Even on a Friday night during rush hour and Gangnam's HH, parking was not difficult to find. There was about a 10 minute wait for us to get a table, but they were busy, so no worries.   As I said, we came during HH and it was a pretty good value for the price. Some of the things we ordered off the HH menu were: beef brisket, beef bulgogi, pork belly, spicy garlic edamame, fried calamari, cream cheese wontons, and sweet corn. When it comes to the HH menu, I would recommend focusing on the meats. Nothing else wowed us, but I did like the wontons. The bulgogi was excellent, the best part! We ordered a couple of things that were not included in the HH menu: Prime kalbi and cream cheese corn. The price for the amount of kalbi you get might seem a little steep, but the quality and taste were great.   The service was so-so. Our grill was checked on frequently, but we were not. Nobody was particularly friendly, but I chose to look past that because I only came there to eat.   I had a pretty good first impression of Gangnam. It was a nice change to get away from AYCE. I feel like I ate about the same amount of food as I would have at an AYCE place, but ended up spending less money. It was definitely a good value. I would go there again.

fJ1Ey1CXbMUTAg459My2KA.text: I'm not a big fan of korean bbq in the first place but I usually like a few items at each place I try. For this place, definitely get the beef toro. It just melts in your mouth cause how thin it is and marbling of the fat. The Kobe beef is super tender but tends to be oily. you might want to add some wasabi and salt to cut down the oil taste. For $25, it's a pretty small portion but Kobe beef has always been expensive. I've tried Kobe beef in Japan too. I still love it with shabu shabu more than bbq. The spicy lemon chicken was okay but I didn't really like the korean kalbi. The kalbi has too much of the marinate so it was too strong for my taste. Ended up spending $47 for myself but mainly because of the Kobe beef.

96-MfsiiDEtfRYKSlJKu0w.text: This is one of the few places that we tried in Vegas. My cousin was the one who recommended this and i would say it's just ok comparable to many bbq Korean bbq places that we tried.  We had the pork bulgogi, marinated beef, chicken wrapped in bacon, marinated shrimp, oyster, bibimbop .  It was quite a meal but a little pricey I would say maybe because I am  comparing it to some Korean BBQ restaurants which you will pay $25 per head with unlimited serving of all the different meat choices.  The oyster to my husband and cousin is a big hit.  It's  a hot plate and you cook the meat but what I noticed is that they don't change the plate which is why some of the meat got burned.  In some places, they change the plate several times well that is for unlimited serving but I would suggest at least do a 2nd round of hot plate especially if there's more meat ordered.   We had a good ice cream desert macaroons and it's worth a try.

-JbYnkzmDe9fu9SSlVJGgQ.text: Gosh!!! The food is simply delicious. We got the Gangnam feast for 4 people. Plenty of food - meat is fresh and marinated and flavored well. The side dishes are refillable and have generous portions.  Drinks - we had sake unfiltered. The best to mix with the dishes.  The staff are amazing - very friendly, outstanding service. bNIqO0AqlFDR1p_DRIdSEA.text: I have never had Korean BBQ before. This was amazing! We got the meat lovers for two and there was SO MUCH food! It was a fun and original experience and the ambiance set it off perfectly. The staff was very attentive and kept things flowing nicely. We tried this place based on the YELP reviews and it totally lives up to the hype!   This will be a new MUST DO for us the next time we're in LV!

5qJiAc6lcyj62jxBFOgboQ.text: Free, big ice-cream macaroon as a check-in for yelp! Don't you forget. That's a five dollar savings right there.  Gangnam Asian BBQ --lauded for big portions, reasonable pricing.  Ordered the Golbi prime rib for around ten dollars -- ordered twice the portions. With all the extra side items like Kimchi, potato salad, seaweed, rice, you're getting an incredible deal for a ton of food.  Compared to Los Angeles Korean BBQ, while it quite doesn't match the quality, it makes up for its pricing. Soowon Golbi is good -- but fifty dollars? Gangnam Asian adjusts their price to compel a repeat visit.

ZxUZ51WfVXl-u_t5mvUkEA.text: Great place for Korean BBQ. We ordered the Las Vegas set and one bowl of Korean cold noodle soup for my husband and myself. We had a choice of having 2 bowls of white rice or 1 hot stone pot Korean Bbq with rice. Of course we chose hot stone Korean bbq with rice: we let the rice sit in the pot after mix so it will form nice crust. Oh, yum! Banchans and salad were great, too. The food could have enough for 3-4 people. Everything was delicious and seasoned perfectly. We ended up packing leftovers because it would have been sin if we left them to be thrown out. We thoroughly enjoyed the leftovers as well. Yum !!!

I8-9I2E8vI2C5UFBhWmiDg.text: I would give this a 3.5 if I were basing this experience on only me, but my friend really enjoyed this place so that's why I'm rounding it to a 4. The staff is friendly but a little slow to take our orders and bringing out utensils and other things, which baffled me because it wasn't busy at all. I ordered the spicy seafood ramen and my friend ordered the bibimbap. For my ramen, it tasted like instant ramen that I can just buy at the store. They did add some calamari and other seafood in the soup, which was just ok. Also, it wasn't spicy. For the bibimbap, my friend loved it! She said the meat was flavorful and the veggies were crunchy. We both did enjoy the side dishes that were brought out to the both of us.  I am willing to give this place another try, but I might just have to go with their BBQ next time, since this is what the place is known for.

T3pdD9mqCJwfUjcry-erDA.text: What a gem in Vegas. I have had plenty of good BBQ places in SoCal etc, but this place is definitely one of my favorites.  It's located within a small plaza, only 7-10 minute drive from the Strip. Parking lot is relatively small but we had no problems with it.  The restaurant is relatively small, but I like the ambiance and seating arrangements. The waiters are very efficient and helpful. The meat can cook pretty fast if the heat is set on high, so adjust accordingly to your own pace.  The food is amazing. While I don't have the most discernible tastebuds out there, I liked everything in the Meat Lover combo there, which consisted of banchan (some of the best I have had), miso soups with rice, seaweed and green salads, dumplings, and all the meats, which are very well seasoned (spicy pork, bulgogi, beef toro, prime kalbi chuck, pork belly - amazing, and filet mignon).  You get free ice cream with Yelp check-in, and that was also delicious. I would highly recommend this place and will definitely come back if I go to Vegas again.

KUiCk_9A0IdQLHdmCHY44w.text: This place is AMAZING! I am SO glad we found this place on Yelp! If your in Las Vegas, stay off the strip and come here! You will be amazed! We love Korean food and wanted to experience the  BBQ dining experience. Our waitress was marvelous and so was every server that brought our food and changed our grill. We decided to go fill out and have the Premium and boy were we not dissapointed! The money spent here was well worth it! Gladly would spend more here than one of those ritzy buffers on the strip.  We kept receiving plates after plates to our table, different cut meats, tuna, oysters, rice, kimchi and etc. It was heaven!! There was so much food! I told myself I'd eat as much as I could, the grill was then set and we cooked our meat according to our liking.  Their Thai tea was amazing also! Great, great experience!  *****Check in on Yelp and you get a free ice cream macaroon. The macaroons are delicious! Recommend the green tea one! Overall, this has been the best restaurant we've been to thus far during our visit here in Vegas. Definitely recommend this location! Great food, great experience and great staff.

Pd_8lZ35OlPLaUCBEQkupQ.text: My 21st Bday dinner couldn't have been any better. The service was amazing and the food was delicious. Shout out to Daniel, Joseph, Donggi, and David for making my experience wonderful!! They were attentive to our needs and gave us awesome recommendations too.   We ordered the Gangnam combo with another order of pork belly and a couple of drinks. Every meat in the Gangnam combo was marinated, high quality and made it a sexual foodgasm experience to the max. I wasn't blown away by the pork belly, it was meh.  And as for drinks, The peach soju is the bomb dot com!!! Delicious and easy to down.   Hopefully you get the same awesome servers / experience as I do!!   Tip, happy hour for drinks are from 10pm to close!!

KRpTKQ-LNTAD8tIVClssPQ.text: Delicious, fun, great service - what more can I say?  We showed up with a party of 4 at 6:00 on a Tuesday and were seated pretty quickly.  Since we had never been there before, our server recommended one of the combos.  We chose the Gangnam combo.  It was more food than we could eat!  Everything was very fresh and tasty, and the servers were very attentive.  They changed our grill top out between every course, and our waters were refilled continually.    All of the meats were delicious, and we all loved the bulgogi bibimbop.  Make sure to check in to get your free macaron ice cream.

zD175M1eGQkGuyTF6mCmpQ.text: Best Asian bbq we've ever had. Such a treat while visiting Vegas. We will be definitely be back. The service was outstanding as well. Highly recommended

WFK5GotvSqbXk7Cm7WC9Cw.text: I was craving for KBBQ and came across this place after looking for highly rated locations. We came right when it opened-- there was a line waiting for the restaurant to begin serving and certainly im Glad I came here.   Here is the breakdown:  FOOD  You can order a la carte or go for the set menu, and they came in a couple of different tiers. My friend and I went for the most expensive one and it did not disappoint.  Good quality meat, good selections and it is very generous portioning for the price. Definitely felt that my money was well spent and was getting what I paid for.  SERVICE  The food came at a reasonable time and definitely appreciate when they let us have the experience, cook at our pace and enjoy each meat nicely without feeling rushed.   The waiter was very nice and had a nice small talk with him while he offered to cook for us.  DECOR/ AMBIAnCE  Definitely a casual environment but a nice casual environment.   OVERALL  Good experience and make sure to check in for the free dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $98 special for today

X2AeSUZUJ2TNRd-OIBZLxQ.text: Came here with a group of 10 on a Saturday mid-afternoon and was promptly seated.   I immediately noticed the banchan (Korean side dishes placed around our table's 2 grills). They had all my favorites ranging from fish cakes, kimchi, cucumbers, macaroni salad...we ended up requesting another round :)   My group was starving from our drive into Vegas so naturally our eyes were bigger than our stomachs when we sat down to order. Our plan was to order their prix fix menu enough to feed 10 (2 orders of Gangnam [1 order can serve 2 people for $67]; 3 orders of Meat Lover [1 order can serve 2 for $56/order]). These packages comes with a variety of starter dishes like oysters (by far, my favorite starter), salad, various cuts of meat/BBQ dishes. Our waiter, however, recommended 2 orders of each instead as it is A LOT of food. Good thing we listed because you will NOT leave hungry here.   Oysters: I'm usually hesitant about oysters at BBQ dining establishments but surprisingly these were sweet, fresh, not too big/not too small, with green onions, ponzu sauce?, and sriracha I believe.   Cuts of meat: they vary from Kalbi, prime rib, filet, pork belly etc. Some were heavily marinated and a bit salty but the flavor profile was on point. Due to long grilling, some cuts came out particularly dry, however, so be careful not to overcook.   Overall - I'd definitely come back when I'm back in Vegas. Great for big groups; come hungry and leave happy :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters - so good!

Ga0TBpxeA1wsoO2H6Gf0gw.text: WOW! So blown away by how amazing this place is. Very comparable to famous KBBQ places on the east and west coasts. The restaurant was very clean, service was extremely fast, and the meats were delicious. We got the "gangnam" package for 2 which includes various BBQ meats and starters. I was just getting over a stomach virus and didn't care for the oysters or calamari and asked if we could skip some of the starter items and substitute it with the galbi soup. Our waiter was so nice, flexible, and made it happen without any hassle. The galbi soup was cooked so well -- the meat was tender, soup was light but had great flavor. All the side dishes were tasty and replenished when they were empty. The BBQ meats were all super tender and well seasoned. The staff there were so attentive and multiple people came by to grab empty plates and check on us. Definitely one of the best KBBQ places I've ever been to, highly recommend!

5XtXv5iuEymneIjypQbRaw.text: My boyfriend's brother and sister-in-law told us that when we visit they wanted to go to Korean BBQ with us. So we gathered up the family and checked out this place. Pretty decent sized menu with a lot of good options. There were 8 of us and we were all pretty hungry. We ordered a ton of food. Of the banchan was ok. The favorite was surprisingly the fish cakes. I ordered the bulgogi bibimbab and the cream cheese wontons (really just cream cheese inside ...) while almost everyone else ordered BBQ. The two least excited about it got fried rice and tried everyone's dishes. The bulgogi bibimbab was delicious. Perfectly cooked and flavored bulgogi. The rice was nice and crispy like it should be and the spicy sauce for it was a little sweet and a little spicy. Perfect dish! Everyone really enjoyed their first Korean BBQ experience. Would love to go back next time we visit

i0GHIbu78gyVfS5I0zRaMQ.text: First time here. 4.5 stars with over 4k reviews caught my attention. Plus, #1 on Foursquare for Korean BBQ. The one slightly bad thing was  the wait time to be seated...25-30 min. But, it was Saturday night. It's only slightly bad though because you can walk around the strip mall or up the street to pass the time. Food was good. I esp liked the Flat iron garlic, not fatty with good flavor. You get complimentary sides with 2 BBQ options. My faves were the fried squid. Sweet and spicy with a wonderful chewy texture. All in all a really good dining experience

Y-AnllUYPwrY7JyCZxp_Dg.text: Exceptional food and service!  I passed on the 20-30 minute wait time for a table (Monday night) and opted to sit at the bar for dinner (limited to non-bbq items only).  As busy at the wait staff were, they managed to always be a step ahead of me when it came to refilling beverages and replenishing side dishes.  I was so impressed.  I ordered the braised gal bi and beef jap chae.  Portions were reasonable and the braised dish was so tender and flavorful.  This will have to be a tradition whenever I visit Las Vegas.  I checked in for a complimentary macaroon ice cream for a sweet finish, which they seemed happy to honor.  This place fully lived up to their ratings.

3VKAIQjwE0IK3NyovpQzyQ.text: After being told our wait would be around 30 minutes.. and then waiting almost 90.. my party of 8 was not happy with Gangnam Asian. NFKKD7c0HOblcyBT0baO0A.text: Great tasting BBQ.  Loved that were able to order a la carte. Side dishes are awesome.

9owAQQCF5IGcaJRZIjyiww.text: A belly busting, jolly good time!   We cruised over on a sunny Sunday for happy hour. My party of 3 was famished so we went to town on the happy hour menu; available everyday 3pm-6pm and again at 10pm-12:45am) - the HH menu isn't huge, but it had a good variety so we stuck to it.   They only offer complimentary side dishes (banchan) with a minimum of 2 BBQ dishes per person, but we had no problem meeting that quota. All of the sides offered were fresh and flavorful - we also enjoyed extra rounds. Also, they offered 3 dipping sauces light, medium, and a dark one. They were all tasty but my favorite was definitely the darkest one - it was salty, sweet and a bit spicy.   HH items we tried: Cream cheese wontons - 4/5 Sweet corn - 5/5 (very sweet and buttery but tiny) Mushroom medley with butter - 4/5 Garlic in butter - 5/5 Jalapeno poppers - 5/5 (delicious) Korean chicken cheese fondue - 3/5 Spicy pork - 4/5 Pork belly - 5/5 (we loved this the most!) Bulgogi - 3/5  When dining outside of happy hour, the regular menu is massive so I'm sure you will be able to find something, even for the the pickiest of eaters. Also, pricing seemed fairly competitive with Gyu-Kaku (their direct competitor.) The grill tops and ventilation setup at each table worked very well; they conveniently changed out our charred grill per our request and the restaurant wasn't smokey or smelly.  After the feast you know we all needed a cup of caffeine to snap us out of the food coma.  Good times!
