1HHx9nvASvBoUSJjToxkNw.text: Second time here...love it. Great service, great food. My introduction to Korean BBQ, and I'm a fan!

2AThWIE2pLt8DC3wHPFFFQ.text: Phenomenal Korean BBQ!!! Everything was tasty and decently priced.  Went with a group of 7 and the service was great.  Best customer service i have experienced in a very long time.   Definitly going back when i return  to Vegas.

PuN7W-sEHdcecxbmIsNkHg.text: Amazing food!  Service was good too.  I was a little worried because of a few reviews about poor service but I had no issues.  Defiantly going back when I'm in Vegas

S4Omk4twYW-3zE7BW3Rtrw.text: I came with my family to this kbbq and I got to say we all left very happy. The service is great and they always come around to make sure I was doing fine. The food was very good aswell. If I'm ever in Vegas again, I will be making a trip to this place again. One thing gor sure is you walk out smelling like kbbq but that's the whole point.

SyFEVWLJytKOIbqsstZxfA.text: Great service. Amazing food. For 5 of us, we got the Gingham food share that meant for 6 people. Keep in mind, we were 5 hungry mofos. We ate until we were so full, I suspected some of us went to vomit so we could make more room. Hence the bad bathroom smell (only negative but not enough to deduct a star) The food consisted of meats, plenty of veggies and side dishes. I ordered the squid as a side dish. It was a little disappointing, 5 pieces that shrunk into nothingness. But the meats were more than made up for that. You grill your own food, there are 3 sauces to dip it into. Overall, great flavor, great service, painfully full belly afterward.

5j-JFwcvmO-RSGxEYVIPUQ.text: AMAZING FOOD! Must come back (when I visit Vegas)! I thought it'd be super busy on a Friday; not too bad. We didn't have to wait long.  TIP: get the sets. It's worth it. Of course, always add the dessert. Haha.

UEdRqV2CzBZYb2QxXCzLkg.text: I got here at 9pm on a Saturday and the wait for 2 people was only 15 minutes. Super cute place with a great authentic Korean atmosphere!  We ordered the harami miso, the Korean prime kalbi, the beef toro, and the bulgogi. Everything was great but my absolute favorites were the Korean kalbi and beef toro!!! Next time I want to order two of these! Haha. The portions were decent and the food came out fast! The service was good and very attentive, the waiters all spoke English super well so there wasn't a language barrier like other Korean places. And I love that this place wasn't ayce since I usually don't go to ayce bc I can't eat that much and it's not worth the cost hahaha but here you can order as you please! :) I left here feeling full & satisfied but not stuffed and gross like I do after ayce!  P.S. i'm use to eating kbbq back in ktown in LA and this hands down is wayyyyy better than any other place (including non-AYCE places). I wish this was closer to home, i would be going here every weekend! This is as good as it gets!

VoBfR1PSLUHAVA2P4NGXnA.text: The serving sizes are quite large and the Korean bbq was absolutely amazing! The side dishes were also great and really added to the experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mgDZa7bT5WRaCI2pzsdP3A.text: Favorite korean bbq in Las Vegas, great service and atmosphere. The quality of meat, specially the kobe beef was to die for... I can't wait to go back

I56yi45LT67RsnCHDXwLrA.text: Sadly, one of the worst kbbq spots I've dined at in a very long time. Do take into account that my palate has been spoiled from dining at all the kbbq spots in LA.  I've had this place bookmarked for a long time now, but never actually got to going because of the mixed reviews I was getting. Four and a half stars on yelp and a visiting friend from New York finally got me to pay this spot a visit. We ordered the gangnam combo for a party of three which was more than enough food. This combo is meant to feed two people for $66. The combo came with five kinds of meats, fresh oysters, quartered sweet corn on the cob, bibimbap or side of white rice, miso soup, and mushroom medley. All cuts were subpar in my opinion. Bulgogi was too sweet and chunks were not cut up. The filet mignon was my least favorite. The chunks were rather large. Putting in work for something tasty was worthwhile, but for meats that did not taste at all fresh, that's just asking for too much. The bibimbap was simply sweet rice and beef. Not much veggies and hot sauce mixed in like the typical bibimbap dish. My favorite part of he meal was probably the soon tofu we ordered in addition to the gangnam combo. Soup was tasty and the seafood bits aroused surprise with each bite. This place also does not cook your meat for you. So roll up your sleeves, tie back you hair, and get cooking!  Would I come again? Definitely not. Not worth the money. You might as well go elsewhere that will cook your meat for you for cheaper with better quality meat.  Free dessert with yelp review post.

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raw oysters
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gangnam combo

3LjjyoCdQpaOcHIcFjGkEQ.text: Excellent service! Quick changing of banchan, and most importantly, delicious food all around! The cuts of meat that we had tasted of high quality and preparation, and the venue is well equipped and class. They have a real efficient system going so that we never had to wait long at all. Thank you for the meal :)

HPrCz4TNz_ywxC5COS1a0g.text: Their Galbi Tang (Short Rib Soup) is so damn good!  Their Galbi Jim (Braised Short Rib) is perfectly seasoned and soft/tender.  The price is outstanding... especially for Vegas.  I'd put this place up against any of my favorites in K-Town LA.

9I4ld-675y9hUpVdV0CkdA.text: Meh was pretty good, marinated meats are sweet which we liked  You get a free dessert if you rate at the end   The meals for two are enough for 3 people.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious

6Xa7j0I3hJftizKJDzxPwA.text: Celebrating my friend's birthday and craved Korean bbq. Great quality meat and attentive service. Prices not bad for good quality near. Nice and fun ambiance. Will be back with family and friends for sure. Gotta be here for the reverse happy hour.

A8rQMPG3vwyazIA5Cl3k0A.text: We went out for a late dinner after our show. Eating a lot of meat at 9 pm did not sound too appealing so we ordered the Las Vegas set, which comes with the least amount of meat. I can't believe how much food we were served. This was supposed to be for 2 people, but even with the 3 of us we couldn't finish all of it.  This restaurant is very very efficient. We were asked if we wanted to be seated at the bar. We said yes and all of the sides and food were being handed to us at the speed of light. The only thing they didn't do is feed us so that we could get out sooner. I appreciate fast and efficient service!  I loved their spicy chicken and regular chicken!! The chicken was delicious and perfectly cooked. My friends worked on eating the beef. The restaurant gave us freshly made miso which was light and refreshing. I am so used to eating the crappy instant miso. This use of real miso paste was a welcome touch. Their sides are good, but nothing to write home about.  The amount of food and decent quality definitely justified the $45 cost.

hrYnX2M6RO3bvfM8iasSyg.text: Awesome food delicious for both their meat and veggie items that you put directly on the grill

j_s7PG-lKb8F2D5pusyZ-w.text: This restaurant was recommended by locals... and I am so glad I asked about Korean BBQ!  I am in a food coma...trying to absorb what I just indulged in...'! Got the meat lovers starter...and a side of pork belly Amazingly generous portions of meat... and Korean sides. Loved the kimchi!  So much food to taste, with great spicy sauces for dipping. Fun concept with cooking the meal yourself... enjoy the slower relaxed pace, will try it again, so many choices....

yO-0E3SkX0POMrMDDNqd-g.text: Best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas! Quality and taste of top meat selections are delicious as well as the sides! Green tea macaroon is to die for! Looking forward to eating here again!

Pp8d_62r70UrH1cERXaJAg.text: Best Korean food I had in a while.  Shrimp with garlic was my favorite, although the Korean spare ribs were also delicious.  You can't go wrong with this place.  Very attentive servers.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y_PPYvqULrkDSTp0a5kpFA.text: Fast service and great atmosphere. We had more than 8 with us and we got a room to ourselves. Food choices were of a great range. The top picks include A5 kobe. So good. Must do and prices aren't bad.

sHDRnbiGS0hs7b72uaNjPA.text: We order Gangnam meat combo for two. So much delicious food and dessert!!! BBQ here is great!  Meat tender and flavor, great start to our Las Vegas vacation.   Ugh, i will be daydreaming about this meal as we hike Death Valley!  Oysters fresh, mushroom tender, and squid so QQ tender  Will definitely recommend this!

_b5RAFR8mtMQsfEHCwSx0Q.text: Pretty good KBBQ. Meat quality is decent, staff is helpful and friendly. They changed the grill many times and our meat grilled up well. The side dishes are pretty tasty, especially the squid. Portions are big. Our party of more than 8 can't finish 2 4-person meals.

wo9iYSVFY4bhjymyzJyx9Q.text: Fantastic off the strip Korean BBQ!! Must try the Kobe beef and garlic calamari. You get the traditional Korean banchan that are very fresh - kimchi, cucumbers, sprouts, dried squid, pasta salad. We ordered the Kobe, pork belly, squid and Japanese peppers. Every bite was very good and memorable.   The restaurant is very clean and has nice ambiance, additionally, the waitresses are very cute    Definitely recommend!!

uXYcgO6NtdfypGWEb0F_rw.text: Great service, great price, tasty food. Go here. Avoid the strip for food. Type more words so you can post a review.

OzKoiy5Eyz0ISv7baXEMaQ.text: I was looking to go at a good restaurant in Vegas that wasnt typical and not too expensive. It was a really nice surprise! My friend and I ordered The Vegas combo for two and it was incredible. The quantity was huge and there was a lot of vegetables and different of meat. The drinks were really good too. The service was perfect. The people that are working there are polite, sweet and sympathic. The price was amazing for the quantity of food we had. I highly recommend that restaurant. Its a must try if you are in Vegas. The restaurant isnt on the Strip but that really worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9Vem5BziZW4QGznL7uJatQ.text: The quality of the meats is average. Compared to the Korean BBQ restaurants in LA.  Service was nice and the side dishes were decent.  The lunch special is a good deal that comes with 2 sides of meats, soup or salad, rice and appetizer for $12. Just for the quality of meat I am giving 4 stars. But good service and clean interior!

eJf6NPszF36TvDbUX36lsw.text: Great place !! Would definitely come again! If they see that you're a yelper, they'll give you a macaroon ice cream sandwich in exchange for any Yelp review. Nevertheless the food was quite tasty & portion sizes per cost was quite worth it especially if you go during happy hour

avWkacw7dIRYdGpdQqr7Kg.text: Badass Korean bbq! Great service and food! Great happy hour! We got the combo menu which gives you a great sample of all the meats.

tO5G8_zmFMEVFhCV3HRaOg.text: Everyone was incredibly nice, friendly and helpful. My 16 year old said the music was really good (and she never says that). Lots of options on the menu. Get the bop. So good

JDsnRIkhA5YEVAhjowAjlg.text: Fairly priced menu, great food, outstanding service, and easy parking.  I was surprised to find good Korean food in Vegas

45pqnOfHvkHKH-QL34127A.text: Best KBBQ in town! Ordered the bulgogi, beef toro, flat iron garlic and prime kalbi. My bf likes the pork belly and broccoli cheese fondue. First time here and didn't get to try any seafood.  If I'm ever on this side of town again I'll definitely come back to try other things. This is my gfs go to for KBBQ and I'm glad we came here for lunch! Free dessert with review!!

C2iua02T9CXL0V97-Iswrg.text: This place is amazing!!!  The meat is fresh and the portions are great for the price.  They have a lot of options so you can choose what you like or you can go with a combo.  They also have ice cream macaroons!!!

Lncm-gv50fn9Sah8ZpMGYA.text: Legit Korean BBQ style restaurant right by Thomas & Mack Center and off the strip! It's a trendy but intimate type place that kind of looks like the place in Rush Hour 2 where they're singing karaoke. But be different than me and order 1 of their 3 best sellers, I tried to order brisket and filet mignon like I was in Texas because they will cook that filet well done! But the short ribs are legit, and so is the flank steak! It comes with 6 authentic sides if you order two or more dishes and the cost are reasonable per dish! You can eat 2 or 3 by yourself or go with a large group and order the whole menu and share everything

PLbKu8ZA_GJic7T9gtyezg.text: Customer service are great. Food was ok, we ordered sushi for the whole family and my toddler seems to like it too.

xVLBDcCycPtEneliqwPuIA.text: I'm going to tell you something... I lived in Koreatown for a year before they raised my rent and was forced to move to a gentrified neighborhood. Having said that, my standards for Korean BBQ are pretty high. I'll say Gangnam does the trick and will satisfy your cravings, but nothing blew us away.   Service was good. Beer was cold. And we didn't get sick that night. So if your fixin for some meat then go no further OR go a little further to Koreatown, Los Angeles because that's the real standard.

i7m_F5ydzNT3dfZ8ik8gZg.text: As far as a Korean bbq place goes this place is nothing special. The food is good not great and the staff was good. The only convenient thing about this place is that it's located next to other restaurants and that they are not located on the strip. Other than that I feel there are other Korean spots to go to that would be better.

qIX5iiGSKdWCegKDZbI_VA.text: Left here with happy bellies! My girlfriend and I got the Gangnam set and boy we couldn't be happier. She likes variety so it was perfect for her. Quality meats with fresh sides, no complaints here. Would not hesitate to come back on our next trip to Vegas. Check in with yelp for your free macaroon ice cream sandwich.

HtFhBsMB9NkqpACw5M05Mg.text: Bad choice for a wedding  anniversary, the food don't taste good at all. I don't recommend this place we are not going to come back again

1hhEjt18JcHnr_MGrnboxA.text: What a wonderful Korean barbecue restaurant. The food quality was excellent along with the service. I have been there a couple of times and will continue to visit this establishment. Every time I go to Vegas I will come back to enjoy another meal here.

eGtZ_dEXNWrPCfEWv5sYHQ.text: My Go-To spot to fill up especially on Happy Hour. Awesome food at an Awesome price!!! 9.50 filet mignon and get to cook it yourself!..how do u beat that? Great staff! oh and Music Videos playing on the Big Screen..Just All around Awesome in my opinion

Lw72m3PySh3CWNgzOBWagA.text: We got the Gangnam combo.  The meat was good and the service was attentive.  The reason why I didn't give 5 stars is due to the kobe ssam.  From other reviews, it is a must-order item, so I ordered it.  It was OK.  The urchin did not seemed or taste as fresh as urchin from a good sushi place.  FYI, for the free ice-cream macaron, it is one check-in per person.  Therefore if you have kids, they all need a separate phone to check-in to get the free ice-cream.

7Nzzedpa35-Axr1zXM9ECQ.text: This place was actually really good. You get ALOT of food as well. I couldn't finish everything they placed at our table. The wait staff did take a little long to get to our table and take our order though and refill our drinks throughout the course of the meal but other than that I thought the food was great.

wEMmxXUnQHaiIKlrgRQoxw.text: The service was perfect. My husband and I are from out of town and we were so happy to find this place. Their happy hour deal is great. We got to drink a Japanese beer for $2.50 which you can't beat that in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_MNfvXnZF9pIJCEpFXkFBA.text: Full on flavor! I'm from Houston and I can say we also have authentic Korean BBQ. This place hits the spot! The meats are tender and the sides pair well together! Good customer service! I highly recommend this place!

5--n8hL3u8hbdYRwljFW_A.text: Great service and the food was simply amazing! The decor was great too! The stuffed chicken wings, pad Thai and Chinese broccoli and pork belly were delicious! I'll be heading back there the next time I'm back in Vegas!

WCstKPgygR-Ntnr7SbTDbA.text: I seriously NEVER give 5 stars but I'm giving one today. I'm from out of town and based on the reviews, my family and I decided to eat here for dinner. The food was AMAZING. The service was AMAZING. UGH the best experience ever.   FOOD: MEAT: We ordered two types of meats: tenderloin and the galbi. You cook it yourself over the grill korean bbq style. The meat is honestly the best I've ever had. Quality was amazing, so juicy and tender. I'll be dreaming about this places meat forever. Definitely recommend ordering meat. The price was great for the amount given and quality. My brother (who was fairly hungry) was about to finish and feel perfectly satisfied.  SOUPS: my mom ordered the spicy tofu soup. ($9.50 I think). She said it was salty (it kind of was) but the flavor was SO GOOD. Had tons of seafood and a nice smokyish flavor. They give you white rice to eat it with to help with the saltiness. I   I ordered the Yuke Jang ($9.50) which is a spicy beef soup with clear noodles. It was okay. It was not salty but spicy. I kind of wish there was a more depth in flavor. I would skip this dish.   RICE: my dad ordered the original bibimbap ($12.50). I didn't get to try this one but this bowl is huge and my dad finished it all and said was good.  SERVICE: so fast and attentive. Usually I have a problem with places not being attentive and being slow to bring the checks and stuff. This was not the case here.   Make sure to check in on Yelp to get the free macaroon ice cream!

hVi8Y8rDtmVFosr-7L-tbg.text: Not my favorite. Higher expectations than what was presented.  The meat wasn't fresh tasting compared to other restaurants I've been to.

f65Y8NmS9sDmtzosM-oIew.text: Dinner in Vegas!   Ordered the meat lover set. It came with so much meat, and a lot of sides. This meal came with 5/6 types of different meat, salad, seaweed salad, soup, rice, and a lot of sides that I can't name them all. Throughout my entire Vegas trip, I'd say this was definitely my favorite place to eat at. The meal was perfect for two, and I'd come back to eat here if I lived in the area. This would definitely be one of my top favorite kbbq restaurants. Service was superb, and very attentive. I love their food, I don't have anything bad to say about this place. I loved everything about it, and it was my favorite place to eat! When I visit Vegas again, I'll come back.

B21S1kz4h9ORNwsPNyWQKA.text: This was some bomb ass Korean barbecue!! Their ban chan was on point as well!! I checked in on Yelp and received a free ice cream macaroon dessert!  Bonus: Sexy staff members

UBp20f5mCTTZsv94lapo3g.text: Sooo good! Do yourself a favor get off the strip and come eat here!! Everything is amazing especially the bulgogi and miso steak. Definitely coming back here!

z28lEBoj0oi88DLr3qrm4g.text: Service is a bit slow, but you just need to flag them down and they'll come to you.   The food was good, fastly served. Located in a shopping center, it's small so you can miss it if you take the back way into the center.

_DE8pH1kk-xOzVS77HXRjQ.text: Great quality food for a great price! Got the Gangnam style package and it's a lot of food for a moment I thought I wasn't gonna finish but pushed through and did haha. Only downside was the wait time but it is NYE weekend so it's to be expected with the amount of tourist that are in town. Oh one last thing to finish the night was the macaroon ice cream sandwich my party ended up getting mango and coffee flavors well worth it and delicious!

JbrltrHUuQweIvq_vgeSfg.text: We were visiting from Seattle and went here and loved it. The quality and the price was good. The service was good also. We ended up ordering instead of the combo options and it was a wise decision because we ate everything we wanted and it ended up cheaper!

0KzVYg12K-12SrfBxuVw9A.text: Great food. The meat quality is amazing and a pretty wide selection. Thanks for the amazing food!

eEF_76HMtXIOtqOrDGXewQ.text: I was just visiting Vegas for the weekend and a friend recommended the place. I've been to plenty of Korean bbq places and this one was one of the best. The meats were on point, huge portions, and service was great. I'd go back again next time I visit Vegas.

juHuxTNUW6vgPNhFznTvtQ.text: This was by far the best Asian food in Vegas! Make sure to check in because their ice cream macaroon sandwiches for dessert are to die for! It was a very fun experience with amazingly seasoned food! My complements to the chef (which is yourself)!!

n4lBsBU7y18r5YqQUx7dOQ.text: This was my first time at an Asian BBQ and this was awesome. The prices are pretty good for Vegas and they have a couple of great options for groups or families. One of the best meals that I have had out here.

upCOSVMZtqEm1NE5KFzpEw.text: Dinner. Table for 4.  Korean BBQ is great for dates, groups of friends or anyone who is NOT in a hurry and loves food. It really forces you to take your time, pace your eating and engage in conversation!  I like when my Korean BBQ spots are dimmed with spot lights at each table. The menu was easy to read and the service was very friendly. They were great with answering questions and once we ordered, food just steadily start coming out. You know it's going to be good when there is a struggle to find space on the table because there is sooooo much goodness.  Along with banchan, we got bibimbap, edamame, miso soup, house salad and dipping sauce. The meats were deliciously marinated and we had a great time.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So much goodness! !

3EJfCo7Lxe_RqIAuxbDoKQ.text: Efficient, friendly service. Clean and extremely well ventilated (so you don't smell of BBQ after) and quality cuts of meat that make for a good value meal. We opted for the individual dishes and were exceedingly satisfied with our meal and the whole experience. Two people- beef tongue, pork toro, garlic flat iron, Korean prime kalbi, mushroom medley, squash and a bowl of cold noodles. Their kim chi is bomb too.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ow0YM8jbrFkkG4Dhy9ESdQ.text: Meat quality is good. Nice and modern place . Won't smell anything after BBQ . Good service and full bar here . Will definitely be back soon.

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy octopus
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short ribs

2lnU5vKtmYw-9xnC05Orug.text: I have found one of my new favourite spots in my travels! Holy cow. Great food, barring the asparagus yet the bar I've raised the asparagus to is super high. The asparagus I grill at home is crisp, tasty and fresh. In other words, it cannot be beat and I look for restaurants to come close. The asparagus was good but not great. However the rest of the food exceeded expectations. The service was OUTSTANDING! The servers work as a team and quietly came to pick up plates, bring food and stopped in often without interrupting my dinner. I can't say enough about what a great experience this was. Of note, I'm headed to the airport and was in and out within the hour. Great food, great service. I'll be back. PS. The prices are excellent. Reasonable and well worth every penny!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Almost ate it all before I remembered to photograph haha. Mochi ice cream

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus! Good yet didn&#39;t have the tops on them and they were a little mushy. Just &#34;good&#34; not fab like the rest of the food
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seaweed salad. One of my favourite staples

Wsiq8f42oqjdIRNkaRxJZg.text: I don't understand the over 3,500 reviews on Yelp and averaging 4 stars. The people were nice and efficient. The wait wasn't too long. We've tried to come before, but heard the wait was over an hour. I think we're spoiled by the amazingly authentic Korean food in the Bay Area where we live. We have a neighborhood in Santa Clara on El Camino filled with great Korean restaurants on both sides of the street.   There were 4 of us, so we doubled up on the Gangnam dinner and we ordered the steamed egg. They delivered the meats promptly and it was plenty of food. I just didn't think the meat was well seasoned and high quality. It was just okay. We were almost done with cooking and eating the meat and the steamed egg still haven't arrived. We asked our server and a few minutes later, it came out. Unfortunately, the egg was completely overlooked. It was already deflated. The other ones we saw on the other tables seem way better than ours. Seems someone forgot to take it out.   With all the awesome restaurants in Las Vegas, we have better options for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So much food!

wxvWv39qSM4M1Kt7G4jinA.text: Date :6/20/17 Day: Tuesday Time: late evening   The set up of the restaurant is very much the same as gyukaku BBQ. The way to order food, grill, dishes, and similar atmospheres. The server we had was wonderful and accommodating as we arrived for a late dinner 9:30ish. At that time, the restaurant is very packed for a late evening on a week day. I would call in for a reservation to be safe. Happy hour starts at 10pm, therefore we ask the server for the happy hour menu ahead of the time. We then placed items that was not on the happy hour to get started and later order happy hour when 10pm roll around. They there generous with the side dishes, food portions are decent, and most of all we were surprised at the final bill that came up to approx $176 including tips. The total was half the price we normally pay for gyukaku in NYC for a party of 6. That night we have a party of 8. I would come again for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

brnApDWSlxQ2U6X7R39cXw.text: This was our first time here and we were amazed! Great food, good service and a fun experience. We were celebrating a birthday and received top service!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6dJbRNxhkEyeGZ3_3J8yZg.text: Omg this was my first Korean bbq ever and it was so bomb! The meat was flavored so amazing. The staff was super friendly too !

9hKNXHoLQIVp7LXwtPbkhg.text: It's my first time dine here, and I am not familiar with the food and how's the serving . A good place to dine in  if you love  to chit-chat with a friend while you  grill your own bbq. It's pretty cool. Foods are in small portion and price is cheaper.   I gave three stars  because of their  restroom,toilet papers are all over the floor and their trash can was full. They should check the restroom and keep it clean since it is restaurant.

bqhSDnT5zKLapfN4brVbmw.text: My first time visit was good. This Korean BBQ is not CA style. This is more to cater to Vegas visitors but not bad at all. Meat portions seem smaller than CA style, but meat quality is good. Restaurant is smoky but not overpowering. Decor is pleasant modern. Place is clean and staff is friendly. Happy hour is currently 3-6 PM and some items are discounted up to 50%. I'm about to enjoy a free macaron ice cream courtesy of a Yelp check-in

pfy0AvF_57_SjZjB5uGjGg.text: The best Korean Barbecue Experience ever! Such good food at such affordable price!! If you are in Vegas, make it a point to visit!!!!

SRfuq7gIHZN_Y7iPrkMvMw.text: First things first - their kimchi was DELIGHTFUL. I ate two servings all on my own. Does anyone know where they buy it or if they make it in house? I straight up just had their kimchi and fried rice.   Ordered the Premium set with a side order of pork belly. Everything came out great, except for the beef carpaccio (which was SOAKED and DRENCHED in sauce. I had to "wring" out the sauce to enjoy the meat) and their poke (couldn't even take a bite).   The highlight was not even the harami kobe style beef, it was all the other parts.   Left sufficiently full (despite not eating the poke) and like their banchan (their kimchi man....)

Bi8CrccFZ3ui3HjC6LAWXA.text: Amazing!!! This was my first time here and the food was delicious.  I had the Korean chicken, fried calamari, and zucchini.   Our server Anthony was very friendly and super attentive.    I'm so happy.  I can't wait to return.

zVzLWlugbL0gF532wr0zPA.text: We were looking for something good , yet close to our hotel, that wasn't going to also break the bank. Gangnam hit a bases loaded home run ! Having had some REALLY. Good KBBQ in the past , i was prepared to be disappointed. Def NOT the case.. The food was outstanding , the service sterling , and the ambience was top notch. The staff went above and beyond for us,  when a member of our party became ill shortly after we arrived, they were simply anazing...

ur8ObQ66Gxo_MveT0IQp1A.text: Great food but way too much, food for two would easily feed three.would recommend if you are willing to try different things

QtzWxxvAAo8AZs60Zmnoug.text: Minus 1 star due to paying for rice. 2 bowls were almost $5.00. I've never paid for rice in the Bay Area.   The banchan selection was good, 7 total and they will refill one time free of charge. We had the Korean short rib, beef brisket and spicy pork for meat selections. For apps we had dukkboki and squash tempura. All were delicious.   The service was prompt and pleasant. Unlike hobak and goong you have to grill your own meat. I rather liked grilling myself so you can pace the speed you eat.  Price was very reasonable. For the three meat choices it was under $20.00 which was plenty for two people.   For free macaroon ice cream, complete a yelp check-in. The coffee flavor was awesome and it hit the spot.  Will definitely go back again.

I love all the little side dishes especially the ones with the jalapenos  lemon chicken and garlic shrimp

05bX5SrIAwusBKaFlBKj-g.text: Randomly found this place off the strip while on an adventure for a good lunch. It's no AYCE, but the meat quality here is really superb, and it was nice because I didn't feel pressured to stuff myself till I explode (like every avid AYCE KBBQ eater does). Check in on Yelp for a free ice cream macaron. The only thing I wouldn't recommend is their corn cheese - it had wayyyyy too much mayo. I'd recommend going during lunch hours to take advantage of their happy hour specials which helped us cut our bill a lot. We will be back the next time we are in Vegas!

qmKi9eAONYpamivUJ8Z5Bw.text: Pretty good food, excellent service! Good ambience but construction going on near by.

_fmbUGbZRA8hYKlPII5ueQ.text: Great service and great food. Good quality and selection of meats. A lot of different flavor profiles with a good selection of dipping sauces. Each well balanced and different enough to cover all bases. There's an acidic Yuzu based sauce, an sweet chili sauce, and a savory garlic sesame sauce. Fantastic all around.

msgIuQ9f6F6SQEXBR4d3Bg.text: the food tasted good, but a bit pricey for what it was. The service was good. The environment was good.

RvPUnzlZrDFWGQzNYCdQDA.text: Oppa Gangnam Style!   Oh, wait! that's PSY's line. Actually, Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining is Tapa Style and not all you can eat Korean BBQ, (keep in mind, AYCE KBBQ it's not big in Vegas than it is in Cali).   We happened to come here during their Happy Hour menu offerings. So we paid for some of the meat choices at a really good price. For that we ended up doubling are orders of the: Toro Beef, Basil Chicken, Bulgogi Beef, Spicy Pork and Pork Belly. The portions we got were good for a party of three.   - Toro Beef: Its marbleized beef brisket and very flavorful. Not as fatty as the ones that you"ll find at cheaper Korean BBQ places. It was my favorite out of our five choices.   - Pork Belly: Standard cut pork. Not bad at all, they were seasoned. The quality of the pork was good, and had tastiness to it.   - Spicy Pork: Tender cut pork. Smothered in spicy sweet marinade sauce makes this super delicious.   - Chicken Tender Basil: Tender white pieces of chicken. With touch of lemon and basil. They were simple but delicious and it accommodated well with my white rice.   - Bulgogi Beef: Beef was really tender and marinaded with a lot of flavor, very good!  nuff said.   The sauces that came with these were: Spicy Soy Sauce, Sweet Soy Sauce and Ponzu Sauce. The Spicy and the Sweet Soy were good. I even combined the sauces and it even adds for more taste to the tip of your tongue. The Ponzu, was the one I enjoyed dipping my meats in. It had that vinegar, sweet flavor to it.  Overall meat quality here, Excellent! The five choices we got didn't disappoint. Every meat was tender and easy too eat. Again, they were less fatty. We enjoyed every bite that came out of the mini-grill.   We got friendly service here. Our server was very personable, and she turned out to be a cool chick. We even got some Kimchi's on the house. Atmosphere here is modern. There is a big screen TV in one side that would play random upbeat music videos. Also there appears to be space to lounge or dance for the late night vibes.   Even though they don't offer all you can eat. They do combinations, but anything extra outside of that, can get pricey. That's why when they offered the Happy Hour menu, we chose meats with deeper discounts and for a party of three the portions were just right, for a tab around $35.   Eh, sexy lady...nom,nom,nom,nom...Oppa NomNom Style!

CFiXJMczr30d0Cd8Er70qg.text: I really wish it wasn't the holiday season so we could have tried out the lunch specials. Oh well, our loss. On that note: Lunch specials aren't available during the holidays!  Our last meal in Las Vegas was supposed to be Korean bbq. Instead, since we don't eat beef and the bbq options fed 4-6 people, we ordered a-la-cart. No regrets, the food was still delicious! We got an order of the spicy seafood ramen and kimchee bibimbap. I can handle spicy foods really well and enjoy my mouth on fire, but the *spicy* in spicy seafood ramen was no joke! However, the spiciness did not overpower the flavor of the broth. The kimchee bibimbap was amazing! I was happy to see it served in a stone pot to keep the temperatures piping hot. Servings were huge for such a reasonable price. Shout out to the sweetest hostess around too! She gave my mom suggestions on Korean beauty products and tended to us when the waiter was busy with other customers.

6ZddZvznUe4vaDceki-r2A.text: Stopped by here on our way back from Hoover Dam because it had 3000+ reviews.  It hit the spot, even my 6yr old son who's a picky eater was grubbing and got a kick out of us cooking tabletop.  It's near hard rock hotel in a shopping center with a CVS.

NZuM2RxDbWNJj1fqUNNGyg.text: Not sure what the hype is all about for Gangnam.  There are significantly better kbbq places in Vegas.  I agree the portions are generous bit the quality just doesn't measure up to other places like Goong, Hobak, or Magal.  Organization was rough as well.  They started being out food and we ended up not having enough room at our table for everything so their solution was to start stacking plates on top of each other so the plates were sitting on top of other food including raw meat.  Although staff was always around our requests for more banchan never seemed to get filled as we had to ask several times.  Came here on the recommendation of someone we know but will be sticking to our preferred places mentioned earlier on this review.

JV8b63Rzz4-aV7IdCsInNA.text: Great food and service! The happy hour prices are awesome and our server was super chill. I loved the barbeque in the middle of the table - it was a really cool experience. You get a free ice cream sandwich with a check in too!

nVPpGiFH6Cq5DBUBI1_ZxQ.text: Went here for the 3-5 pm happy hour. They have pretty good choices on the menu so we opted for...pretty much everything on it lol. It was delicious. Flavorful and definitely fulfilling. We also ordered fried rice and the sukiyaki noodles that were not on the HH menu. Both were very good, but the noodles were amazing. So rich and they don't short you on the chicken either (in both the noodles and rice). The honey bread dessert was probably the best honey bread I've had.   My only problem was the service. Our waitress was really rude. We felt rushed when we were trying to order, and while I was still clearly looking at the menu, she asked me to give it back to her. We wanted to order more food but she never came back so decided against it. We waited approximately 15-20 minutes to order dessert and then another 10 for the check. She was doing side work and looking at us but chose not to come over while we sat there waiting. So two other waiters came to help. It was really off-putting.   Nevertheless, I'll probably be back because the food was delicious. If the bad service continues however, I'm not sure it'll be worth it.

ChMAzBqiS0irWu-bhnXq2Q.text: Great food and atmosphere. It honestly reminds me of gyukaku but the Korean version! We got the meat lovers set for 4 but felt like it was enough for 6 people. Will definitely come back! :)

CTiWv1FErrhiTvwSCMA7Yw.text: This was my first Korean Barbecue experience. The food was absolutely delicious.  I'm relying on memory. I believe it was the Las Vegas meal. There was bulgogi bimibab (Korean fried rice with barbecue steak), garlic shrimp, spicy marinated chicken, brisket, sweet marinated chicken, and we ordered short ribs on the side. Everything on it was delicious.   My only complaint was that, once we were served, the server completely forgot about us. Not one drink refill. When we were finished, we waited and finally got up and went to the hostess for boxes (there's a lot of food) and the bill.  Still, the food was very worth it.

O-q0B7N3OEQEsWgkgKiW2w.text: My boyfriend and I stopped here when we were passing through Vegas on our cross country road trip. We made it with 10 minutes to spare to get happy hour prices and I have to agree with other reviews that you really do get a good amount of food for the price here. We ordered 2 types of kalbi, happy hour pork belly and bulgogi and happy hour edamame and seaweed salad. Our total was only $46 including tip (which is a great deal for 2 people when you're used to LA prices). The food was good quality and they give you plenty of side dishes. We didn't even really need the edamame and seaweed salad so we probably could have gotten away with spending under $40 for 2 people. Granted, this obviously isn't the best BBQ I've had, but it is a great value. I would come back here if I was ever in Vegas with a car again.

My kids will beg to come back here, so yes for another successful find on Yelp! Now I can enjoy my free dessert for posting a review

HYgRxFhHWHRejZJFC_mEXA.text: Love this place! We stop here every Vegas trip on our way to the hotel. Such good food at such good value. We eat A LOT and are always surprised at how little we pay! We brought friends one time and for 4 ppl who were starving, ended up only paying like $100 total for dinner! If you like korean food, would def check out this place.

8yYie9-1KP3j7DqsQfEshg.text: I think this is one of the better kbbq places in town. My first visit was maybe a couple years ago and since then I've tried a handful of places and tonight I realized that this should be my go to spot for Bbq. Service is great the reverse happy hour menu items are reasonable and there is a variety to choose from.   The set menu options are also great with a variety of meat items and appetizers to choose from. Just seems a little pricey. We ordered the meat lovers for two people and it was more than enough for the three of us. Meat was seasoned perfectly not bland or too salty. And the side dishes are ample. Definitely will be back here more often.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c_HjZhshwkwlvZTsCynjcw.text: Over 4,300 reviews at 4.5 stars?!? We have got to try this before heading home to Daygo.   The wait: none, we were seated immediately  I'm going to try and remember everything we ordered:  Appetizers: -2 steamed eggs: so fluffy! -1 Kobe beef carpaccio: yum! -1 Tuna poki: this was alright -1 shishito peepers: just like anywhere else -1 house salad: nothing special   For the grill: -1 Harami Miso: thinner than expected  -1 Pork Belly: inconsistent meat to fat ratio where some were almost all fat whereas some didn't have enough fat.  -2 Prime Kalbi: this was the best out of all the meats. So freakin tender and buttery. It was beautifully marbleized.  -2 Beef Toro: just good -1 Korean Prime Rib: had a good marinate to it -1 scallop with bacon: it has bacon- nuff said -1 enoki with bacon: love these little mushrooms -2 kabocha squash: it was cut too thin, just a tad bit thicker would've made it more enjoyable  -1 Japanese peppers: no kick to it   Just because: -1 mushroom medley: already cooked, meh -1 bibimbap: I didn't try but everyone that did liked it -1 spicy ramen: the broth was flavorful but needed a kick to it, it is called "spicy" ramen after all.   Overall experience: Good food, great company, and friendly service

9e9aDlQ3WF-DLpl6JaBwxg.text: Service and food was excellent. I love the music videos playing in the waiting room, that was neat. The prices were fair since the quality of food was good. We did not have to wait long on a Saturday night. I highly recommend this Gangnam Asian BBQ!

k3CmDbFQdGbL-1FMgpEFJg.text: It is a great restaurant if you love Korean bbq. My husband loved it so much, we went and then went back again two days later. You cook your own entree-which is fun if you like to cook. The atmosphere is very warm and welcoming.

JJHESGqUT9osKnckudOrAw.text: Gangnam was INCREDIBLE!!! It was actually my first time at a Korean BBQ restaurant, and it was the best dining experience I've had in awhile. I came in very hungry and waited less than 25 mins on a Friday night with no reservation, and the food came extremely fast. My friend and I (him and I both eat big eaters) were overly full and the food was all amazing. We did the Las Vegas combo for $45, with a side of oysters for $7 and it was all crazy good! Can't wait to go back. The concept was awesome, service great, and food was all really yummy. Go here for sure!

7I6Esn4n99hpBPn0krQZaw.text: Awesome service! the food was far better than expected m for the price and we had the honor of being served by Alex, and want to i've him a quick shoutout for the awesome service! thank you taeyang:):)

3aJeRh1aFZ9Md-7vxNiPSA.text: Excellent prices and great food! Everything was delicious. We had two portions of bulgogi and one filet mignon with a side of white rice between two people and we were stuffed. The coffee ice cream macaron was awesome as well. I'll be back!

bax2jAn6tuwOEHAC2jQwNA.text: The portion size is reeeeeally generous. like, couldn't finish the 6 person Meat Lovers with 5 people and we are all big eaters. All the meats were fantastic, but the steak options were fantastic. The bulgogi too.  actually, it's all damn good. Great sides, with the kimchi, fish cake and squid standing out as favorites.   Service was attentive and friendly. I thought it was pricey until seeing how much food is included... price and quality

4KhzFLuFb0c2t_-J2rw3DQ.text: They have this hot sauce that will numb your mouth but still gives your meat that right amount of spicy to kick it up a notch.

QsVs_I0_Q7XNqETV2eP11Q.text: Delicious Korean BBQ!!!   The Gangnam set for four was perfect for 5 people. This place did not disappoint at all. The meat was super tender and nicely marinated. The service was great and super  quick. I highly recommend this place.  If you come with a big group make sure to call in advance.

cW7E-rxoqave9FCpp082vg.text: Yummy! Las Vegas plenty for 2. Meat and sides were delish! Free mochi when you check in on yelp.

6UtT-DoWtKwFPp52zQU1Ew.text: Super yummy food! Vegan and pescatarian options available. Don't skip the salmon jalapeno poppers!

06sAa5vF4dbYeMCkv5OQxg.text: Walked in on a Friday night at 10 and we had a short wait. Our party of 5 probably waited like 10 minutes before we got sat but it was fast nonetheless!   First thing I gotta say is that the interior was pretty nice. Every booth looks like there's a window from an old Korean palace haha. Modern interior though. The grills were great and kept the heat even and cooked everything nicely.  The food was also really good. Our party ordered the meat lover set ($99) for 4 people but trust it was a lot of food. They brought out soup and salad which was also included. Side dishes were on the better side when coming to a Korean BBQ place as well. All in all this place is worth a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Galbi for gainz

t0XBZn2X3MxONIwvou9duQ.text: Yum!!! We have tons of great KBBQ places in Southern California and although this one isn't AYCE, it matches up!! So tasty and such a nice break from the hectic strip. Great service and great food! ~10 min wait for a group of 5 on a Sunday night!

pbyvzGFPLJipqd4vis80eQ.text: So fun and delicious. Stand outs are the marinated meat and salmon poppers. Delicious!

k36tjOXohHpz5Ase14wH8A.text: I should give this place 5 stars just for the service. The service here is one of a kind, all the servers are helping each other and it makes it so easy for the costumer.   As for the food, we ordered a lot of things and everything was delicious. It didn't feel 100% authentic Korean but this will do to satisfy my Korean craving while in Vegas!

VG__kW_XIkIVAQi75OaDyw.text: This place was fabulous! All of the meat was high quality and delicious. It melted in your mouth with every bite!  The staff was wonderful and explained how everything worked (it was our first time trying Korean BBQ). The next time I'm in Vegas I will definitely be back. Highly recommend anyone try this place for a fun experience, well priced, and a delicious meal.

atCMKok-YRU8VdCZ3ajubw.text: Loved it from start to finish. Kids totally enjoyed cooking meats to their preferences. Great cuts of meats. We didn't overindulge and found the price very satisfying for five of us. The macaroon ice cream, free with check in was amazing!

xkBHf44zVtNYD7QgInpT1w.text: My boyfriend and I always look for Korean BBQ when we go out of town since we don't have many options back home. This popped up on my radar with all the many good reviews so we decided to check it out. We decided to get the premium menu for two which included all of the higher cuts of meats and side dishes. Let me just say the food was never ending it seemed! It was delicious and we managed to finish a good portion of all the food we got (which was A LOT!) Service was fast and friendly. Definitely would come back next time we are in the area!

EcB_uQZSMpQdXLcXBTFt4Q.text: Food is tasty! Can be a little too loud because sound bounces off the walls and ceiling, and the hostess desk gets a bit crowded!

zBopdHTAxOOyg-ugbfVLPA.text: VERDICT: Clean, newly renovated, but tough meats.  QUALIFIER: Came in right after happy hour and right before dinner rush on week night.  FOOD: Went with Gangnam package. Even the tender filet was relatively tough, but still softer than other served steak. Salad was refreshing and not too sour. Favorite was Harami Miso for the flavor.  SERVICE: Very attentive waiting staff, quick refilling drinks, coming by asking if food is ok and side dishes replaced.

uLWU3PhmvpGxRLeWKhSAXQ.text: The Service and Servers are awesome. Food was spot on. The KimChi was slightly under cook, but everything else was awesome.

tI2wGcNd6Z5ngCchL4ChKw.text: Waaaay better than the best Korean food I ever had in Nyc for three times the price of what it is here. The banchan are delicious. The meats are very good quality and very well flavored. The bibimbap wasn't the best I ever had, but it was good. The dipping sauces are spot on. Very flavorful. 16.95 for a pitcher of Sapporo isn't revolutionary, but it's a good deal. The lettuce wraps are better than pf changs, and that's saying something ;) Saturday night and we didn't have to wait longer than 15 minutes And they have macaron ice cream sandwiches for dessert. Can't complain about a single thing here.

_t1btqDG5La6a5I9SKRHFg.text: Loved this place! I was hesitant for years because it opened shortly after that Gangnam Style song came out, but moved to this side of town and I didn't want to go to Chinatown for Korean BBQ. This isn't all you can eat, but it's actually a lot more fun ordering and you get to be a little more selective. We ordered the spicy karaage, Kabocha squash tempura and the shishito peppers as appetizers. All delicious, especially the squash. We had reservations so all the complimentary side dishes were arranged around the grill upon arrival. For the grill we ordered two orders each of the scallops with bacon, bulgogi, harami miso, and Kalbi, along with an order of corn. We had five people in our party and we didn't finish it all, but got pretty close! It's a really fun experience and it doesn't feel as rushed or impersonal as other places. The decor is also really nice and it doesn't feel like your typical all you can eat/buffet place. Loved it and will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped scallops, harami miso, and bulgogi

UmA80b76C5K0XrGh7eZr0Q.text: Simply put: great staff. Good food. Not the best meat per se, and a bit too fatty otherwise good selection of Korean bbq.. minus is that you come out smelling like bbq as system to absorb air doesn't exist

ki3YThSx5m0QPsRBnIyWHQ.text: It's Asian/fusion style now where you can pick what kind of meats and dishes you want.  It's not terrible, but I want daenjang jigae not miso soup with my kalbi.  The fried rice thing sounded fun but I wasn't a fan.  Not bad, but definitely disappointing if you want Korean barbeque.

2OqsZblTMmBqykIJT6bocw.text: I am visiting Vegas for New Year's... Got sick. Like had to go to the ER sick. Finally made it out of bed and looked for a Korean place that had soup. Came upon this gem. Funny how I just drove and pulled into this parking lot to make a Facebook post asking if anyone knew of any ramen or Korean places bc I needed Asian soup to help heal my ailing body. This parking lot was the same parking lot I was at a few trips ago when visiting Azusa Hookah Las Vegas and left my extra set of car keys. So I was destined to get in touch with my Korean roots. It is a perfectly sized place about 14 BBQ tables. I sat at the bar. I ordered the kimchi jigae. Soups are priced about $9.95 comes out in one of the Stone hot boiling pots. Before that came out you also get lucky  #7 banchans and the kimchi was perfectly fermented, stir fried fish cakes, cucumber kimchi, ojingeo muchim, spicy beans sprouts, pickled radish w/jalapenos and the famous pasta salad (or potato salad at other Korean places). I am one happy salty half Asian clam. My body is in sodium hell.... But that is the perils of Korean eats... But that kimchi jigae broth with the pork was making live to every taste bud in my mouth.  I will come back again every time I visit.  and

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchi jigae... Is Seoul food. Nom nom nom nom

D4AZeffPHojYgBD_yJV81w.text: great Korean style bbq in Las Vegas!great beef with sauce and side dishes. Steamed egg is perfect! But the digging sources are a little bit salty.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet corn and broccoli !

zLb0PMyJ56oV1e2wCNXPzA.text: The female servers were so friendly. The male server who took our order was lazy. We got there at 11:30 when they opened and didnt leave until 1. We ordered veggie bibimbap, scallops, calamari, shrimp, mushrooms, onions, dynamite shrimp appetizer, asparagus, and king oyster mushroom. Also, hirami steak for me. Mainly seafood & veg bc my husband doesn't eat meat. The dynamite shrimp didnt come out until halfway through our meal. It was supposed to be appetizer. I think the server forgot to put it in bc he didnt write our order down. I think he got offended that I asked if he was going to write anything down. Oh well. Food was ok. I prefer gyu kaku. Faster service & better taste imo. We ordered the honey toast & it took fooorreever. Literally 20 min. The girl asked us twice what flavor icecream and she still gave us the wrong ones. If you've had honey toast in Hawaii, you know that the bread inside is usually hollowed out, cut into cubes & toasted with butter & drizzled with honey. This place did neither of those things. They left the bread inside whole & scooped icream on top. It was so hard to eat. We tried cutting it but it became a disaster & was so messy. We took a few bites & left it. The lazy male server was busy talking to another female server and left another female to clean off 2 of his tables & ours. He just kept yapping & didnt lift one finger to help clean off his own table. Unbelievable. The tip should go to the girls who helped us & kept checking on us but im sure they share tips. Would not come again.

Food was Awesome!!!!!! You can tell all meats are fresh, are good quality food. Server are really friendly, tough us how to eat and how to order. Also I did check-in, they gave us a free ice cream for the table. Nice experience!

W_pdUad4gGry_Yai3n49ZQ.text: Meat on meats!! A great experience here. $65 for two people is a great deal. Will come back again.

d97BSImX_nu-oQh-IL7H4Q.text: Amazing food and great service!   Enjoyed Korean prime rib kalbi.   A must try if you are in the Las Vegas area.

BhvouKkRFf8OIa_FSaWO4w.text: Good service. Tender meats. Enjoy eating alone or with company here, just such a chill and friendly atmosphere. I've even come to study while my meat cooks. :) recommend the filet mignon! If you like squash definitely get the squash tempura mmmmm!

Everything was delicious and nothing was over seasoned.  Quality was top notch and all of the side dishes and appetizers were great as well.  A must if you are a local or even just visiting from out of town.

VT91eQScYY3cGHJ1b9JpwQ.text: Kalbi BBQ yum, Jigae delicious, pan chan scrumptious, wait staff the crowning jewel to a perfect meal!  A must visit place off the strip.

8T1IqRqULYnaio2TTmg_sg.text: Very good service and food. We recommend the filet mignon and the miso beef. The sukiyaki veggie noodles are delicious as well! Enjoy

GGUuV5WivzoUmc2cpHEjvQ.text: Great food and reasonable prices- menu has a wide variety of options to please any palate. I definitely recommend beef toro. And while you wait for your order to cook, they bring out small side dishes for snacking. I definitely will be coming back!

bkZmYfezcT3cEUsh1MuLRw.text: Ahhhhmazing!! Food was plentiful, service was on point, and overall I'm stuffed!!! Definitely a place to frequent for all occasions and one of my new favorite spots. Love it!

X2QYuzNo0EWth-YrauN-Rg.text: The ramen here is delicious and the atmosphere is good. Really enjoy eating here. I really hope I could live here. Only cons might be food is a little small in quantity

yxWBUsS98Cy6gHKaJ7ZeEA.text: If you're in Vegas and you like Korea Bbq; you should definitely try this place! The food is good, the staffs is nice and it's affordable! They deserve 5 stars in my opinion. :)

58sf7bBrssD2gD4biDOBcQ.text: Very good food and service. Got the gangnam bbq dish and were very satisfied.  Also got the macaroon ice cream sandwich, which came in many different flavor a--strawberry, vanilla, mango, green tea, etc. The restaurant is a little ways outside of the strip, so you don't get the same sense of crowdedness and frustration that you'd get closer to the hotels.

qkKpfiaoq4znlSqeuF_4Xw.text: The udon and the sukiyaki were outstanding. The meat dishes were all delicious. Service was very good. The fried rice was even good.

Qjr5-sl7xd0huG2C2rT_Gw.text: The chicken sukiyaki noodles were only $9.95 and they were so good that I'd order it again. The only thing is that it stays incredibly hot for about 5 minutes, so be careful not to burn yourself.

moWKu6bV0EMI2NMos4avaQ.text: My favorite kbbq in Vegas. Service is always friendly and food is on point. Atmosphere is trendy, just a great place to have dinner with friends or even a date.

ICVQ5U7zBTI8cOKtNJnAaA.text: awesome japanese korean bbq!!  servers are awesome and most likely the food!  and you get a free macaroons if you do a yelp review!!

kjMa1eBwrTHGxkoTmG5ImQ.text: I was surprise that food was really good and priced well. The service was awesome! I will come back.

X7vLWwibW7BV1Qpx85Vjlw.text: Good service. Awesome price. Great tapa like korean bbq idea. We loved it.  Beats all the other korean places in lv.  Trust me. Im korean and from so cal.

WL6LDqIPIgQE6UcavG4DJQ.text: Great food and service. Had the Las Vegas for 2 - enough food for 4. Recommend the spicy tuna. We ended up taking half of our meal home. Looking forward to enjoying it for lunch tomorrow.

FMR62BLGb-LBPtvS_xAFSA.text: I was starving, haven't eaten all day, and was in the mood for some great kbbq. Although not unlimited, the servings were way more than satisfying. The servers are very helpful and friendly! Yummmm filet mignon!

6ldIy0sX_GLe4wXUuVnYVg.text: Bomb.com easily. Fresh meat, perfectly marinated and seasoned. Bulgogi and prime kalbi was my favorite for sure. Great service and ambiance too. Imma go back and eat my food. Doing this review at the same time. Peace.

Ymk70TbLr5CDP2ODoSodRQ.text: Trying a new Korean BBQ restaurant in Vegas.  We've gone to Ginseng in the past, but it's gotten quite expensive, so we decided to try Gangnam off the strip.  The decor is modern and well laid out, esp. if your group is larger than 6-7.  Ginseng can be tight for bigger groups.  We ordered the "Meat Lover"s" for 6 people and added a couple of additional appetizers and dishes for our group of 7, and there was plenty of food.  Service was fast, friendly, and all of the dishes tasted excellent.  Well worth the trip off strip if you're in the mood for tasty Korean!

xd_S3DhmS9mRAx0tioIwLg.text: Great food. Higher quality than AYCE.  Service is a little slow, but the place is busy.

HVrO3iK2yQufgcrbvJL2IA.text: 3rd time fab food excellent service. Food is fresh love the ribeye and asparagus. Definitely will be back locals eat here

n_-0O-nY44_8ia7hbkG-vA.text: Great place and massive portions for the price. The set for two could easily feed three or even four I would think. Don't forget to ask for the sesame oil/salt or gochujang sauces if you prefer those since it's not provided by default.

k3kP8kUsIiXeulqwAbry9Q.text: The food and service was great! You have to get there early because it is busy and fills up quickly. There were people waiting outside before they opened. :) Despite the amount of people the waiters were very attentive and were always checking to see how we were. Not only that but ALL the waiters came and checked on us! All the food that we had was great (original Bibimbap, fried dumplings, Chicken Karaage, Tteokbokki, Bulgogi, and Korean Prime Kolbi)and easy to enjoy. They had good music playing in the back ground that was not too loud and had a good mix of both Korean pop music and American pop music. An amazing find, thanks fellow Yelpers! :)

Qt2yGdDwZu00vbDAkO-T2A.text: Good food and great service. The meat is seasoned great. Will definitely come back.  Venue is great as well.

7D2PZk37sj1ZdDsGPdu15A.text: Very good Korean food for 45 bucks including free dessert! Even comparable to the Bay Area . Service is top notch and for the amount of food two people cannot finish it. Keep up the good work!

_LIgShygGenj12VsEtzJSA.text: Great food, great atmosphere, great cook for a great price. It's a must visit on a trip to Vegas.

mD9U-HEmeallVN-AVYnL2A.text: Went here last night with my husband for dinner since we haven't had Korean BBQ in a few months and we saw this place had some good ratings.  When we walked in we were greeted and seated immediately by the host/server. He was very polite and, thank goodness, spoke really good English!  We already looked at some of the stuff on their menu before we got there so we had a pretty good idea of what to order.  We ordered a few choice of meats: Bulgogi, flat iron garlic, beef toro, Korean prime rib kalbi, and the Harami Miso. The last two I mentioned were definitely a must have and it's also in the top two of their best sellers. The meat was really great quality and flavor was perfect.  They also had three different meat sauces that they provide which is perfect for the other meats that may not already be seasoned.  I love the little booths that they had as well. Only thing I probably would improve from this place is to have refillable hot tea and to have the sesame oil with salt side as something already provided for. I've never been to an Asian BBQ place that doesn't already do that so I guess that's why I mentioned that.  But other than the last two things, the entire place was awesome and highly recommended. I would go back there again with friends for sure!

shWAzX2iQmCfIKD6zZ7WKg.text: This was an excellent place - really delicious food and great service. It's family style which is pretty nice and you get to grill your own food. Definitely a great spot to go to if you're around Vegas - would highly recommend

TtcN89H-Mj-VJV8LKKP4dg.text: For Korean bbq, I usually frequent all you can eat places but here you pay by the order. A little more pricier but the food is well worth it. I really enjoyed the Korean Prime Kalbi, it was so juicy and perfect-- exactly what I want from korean bbq. I would definitely come here again!

YdeCYEGWw9jR0SdIfuEW6w.text: Great food and great service.  The steamed egg is so fluffy it's almost souffle-like.  The Korean prime kalbi is also very well marinated and the quality of meat is excellent.  Lastly but no less important is the service.  We didn't come on a very busy night, but the waiters were very quick to remove dishes from our table and refill our beverages.  This makes for an overall great dining experience!

d-X6Hk_CHLC1NGhHBeQe8Q.text: Great place for lunch or dinner. BBQ dishes are perfectly marinated and  seasoned, great variety of starters. Good service.

molCXZK5_RIInyxEUsC5aw.text: The food was good and service was good. Came in a group of four for lunch and ordered tteokbokki, pork belly, kalbi, and beef brisket. The wait for dinner time was very long, which is why we ended up going for lunch instead.

lwa8Sg-bHDKxnnPwCkmG0w.text: Pretty good for Korean BBQ place. Good service (5 stars). Food was good, just wish they offered more side dishes.

wRZ1k6fNXo5gIKtyJOCrNQ.text: Very good meat quality, good protion size, not all you can eat, but definitely enough food per order.

-4Tl9JjOhOggt-ccYn5rJw.text: Our first Korean BBQ meal in Vegas, found it in Yelp rated almost five star. The place looks very clean, and the waitress is so nice! We ordered beef tongue, pork belly and other meat. The meat tasted awesome!!!!

-OXHfRb4p0hSB_TUhyg31A.text: Very nice korean food! Definitely try their Gangnam combo if you do not have a preference. The environment is nice and the waiters are friendly. Very good experience at Gangnam.

s1m5u1XbO5jkdAPmYisEyQ.text: Oppa..  Every time we come here it is an excellent experience.  The cuts are mastered perfect.  I learned to appreciate tongue here, not talking about making out either.  The pork belly  is fatteningly addicting.  Although theres no AYCE we have tried almost every tier of the menu.  Service is quick and pleasant and really makes dining here enjoyable.  As far as Korean bbq goes they all have the same basic ingredients.  The way it is done here makes us keep returning.  Just the way it is served and the intricacy of the cuts pertaining to the grain of the meat.  Also the Japanese fusion appetizers are good as well.  Sometimes in life you learn quality over quantity.

8FIx-B7CkvrohkRTtSxBwA.text: Yummy food. Decent prices. Staff could maybe be a little bit nicer? :) I would go back though. We were super full.

jomE1e_xlsSN_5f9v2nwSw.text: First time doing Asian BBQ and we're definitely not disappointed! Started off with the calimari and wontons which are probably the best wontons I've had. The chicken fried rice has huge chunks of chicken which was nice to see.   Thanks to the happy hour menu we tried the Bulgogi which was marinated to perfection and the waiter helped us cook it. Also had the garlic shrimp which was good. I've always been nervous about he little side dishes you receive but everything was so good! Minus the pasta salad thing which didn't seem to fit.  Probably the most perfect end to our Vegas vacation! ________________________________________________  After submitting my review we were ignored for a good half hour. Our waiter was too busy being FED by a friend across the restaurant. Really? I get if you're friends come in to eat and you want to say hi or chit chat for a few minutes, but to completely abandon your table? That's rediculous. Actually nobody checked on us during that time, we had to flag a waitress down who really didn't seem to care. Finally a second waitress stopped by and asked how we were doing. They were having a promotion if you wrote a Yelp review your got a free dessert, so we showed our reviews and then waited and waited and waited for dessert. The waitress was very apologetic and even gave us macaroon ice cream for free, on top of our 2 free desserts. The only reason this isn't a 1 star reviews is because the food was amazing and the last waitress to help us was very nice and helpful.

Oxhy2uXkLinvDVe6Mux-Sw.text: So came here for Lunch on a Saturday. Food was okay. However, the service was absolutely horrendous.  They weren't very busy at all. It took 45 minutes to bring out our beef toro and we asked about it twice, and they said the kitchen is still slicing it. We ordered combo fried rice and specifically said only chicken and beef. They brought it out with shrimp too, and when we told them, our sever said he'll just take out the shrimp for us. Umm.. No.. The rice tastes like shrimp now. Overall service was horrible, has to request more water 3 times, request for the grill to be changed, request for my check after waiting 15 minutes.  The reviews on YELP are totally FAKE because they offer a free dessert if you review them. No body is going to show them a 1 star review to get a dessert.  Definitely do not recommend.

Dvn-kK91a1L_kkrxA4L7sw.text: Amazing good. One of the best spicy tofu soup yet. Very generous with the meat portion.

40aZT5x-MG3qK_zjwufN7Q.text: The food here was amazing. We ordered the Las Vegas platter for 4 and there was a ton of food. For 4 adults it is a really good amount. Make sure you come hungry. I also recommend the bulgogi bibimbap. It was so tasty. Really, there was nothing we did not enjoy. The sides were good and plentiful and the meats were seasoned very well. The only thing we regret is not being able to finish it all because we got so full.

AvBxI4KmpEQJu2UuzdkARg.text: One of my favorite places to visit while in Vegas!!!! Happy hour after a day of shopping!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-hxMa86R4faZ9v89xhj_OA.text: The food is great but for the price, it's not. I've been to Gangnam a lot of times since it's the nearest one to where I live. It's a great place to try out! The bad thing is that sometimes, the line is just too long. The last time I went there, they told us it was a 30 minute wait but we ended up waiting an hour because they entertained the reservations first. So make sure to put in your reservation or else you're gonna end up hungry and grumpy!

yS2b1m2Qz593YpaXstMYlw.text: Food was good. Service was okay. The bulgolgi is the best meat we had with the meat lovers combo. hella food and I'm full! Next time will only order bulgolgi. Also ordered a side of jap chae noodles they forgot until later. it wasn't very flavorful like most places. All the sides were bomb. seaweed salad is fresh and food here. I'd come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Got the meat lovers.

_eNIYm8DpHYx-vZA99Zz5w.text: There was a short wait when we came on a Saturday around 2pm. It was only 10-15mins so it was not too bad. I wanted to order from the lunch menu but they don't have that option for weekends. However, they have the happy hour menu from 3-6pm, look good but I already over ordered from the regular menu. Onto the food, we got harami miso, Korean prime Kali, spicy tuna kimbap, fried calamari, bibimbap, and spicy tofu soup. Imo, everything was good, except the tofu soup. The meat cut was high quality, so tender and well seasoned. The appetizers are fried perfectly. Bibimbap was good, but at $12.99, i think I rather get another meat dish instead. The soup was just so so, not memorable.  The service was okay, no smile when greetings, but otherwise attentive. I would definitely visit again, with a reservation, since I don't like to wait an hour wait for any food.

TMhuiwDREcEKnmogrDcTCQ.text: Excellent place to have a nice dinner.  If you like to cook your own food this is for you.  The price was very reasonable and the food quantity was quite good.  The waitstaff needs a bit more personality but that was the only flaw as all aspects would be recommended!

yzR93wVfBhTeyrZfeopxdw.text: The food here is delicious, high quality but the service is horrible. They didn't check that often to see if we needed to order more food. They almost charged us for some Kalbi ribs we never got. Food is very good but the service is bad.

Yv-ZUMuSazFO1MSJSk8jHQ.text: Great quality, very attentive/friendly staff and always good vibes! I love this place! We're here at least once a month!

csQlipa8x0XLKYL7dnGDzw.text: Grill your own meat places don't excite me but this one got my attention due to quality and service.  Don't be fooled - it's a lot of food for two people!!!  The price - you can't beat it.

bgTQK4nsDBUsBneDFnJMVg.text: It's ok. Nothing to write home about. Service was ok.they dropped off the meat and didn't come back. Still don't know what I ate. Nice K-pop music in the background though.  Tip was already included on Bill no wonder service is mediocre.

EuTgi6WovOOMpdXA42eTpA.text: This is my first time trying Korean BBQ and I gotta say this place exceeded my expectations! The staff was extremely friendly. The food was delicious, my wife and I tried the meat lovers. I'm usually pretty picky but there's nothing bad I can say about this place. I was beyond satisfied. Highly recommend it. My wife and I will come back.

6n1iv7HoWqRt3fvEyibkug.text: It was great for a group dinner! We had 5 people and shared the Las Vegas dinner. It was plenty and so delicious.

xZSgDKBc6xdoIJ9qD8f2fw.text: Came here with my bf on a Thursday nite... It wasnt crowded but the service was kinda slow. Our waitress brought out all the meat before the banchans even came. Matter of fact, I had to ask for the banchans which should have already been at our table before our meats came out. We ordered the prime kalbi and it was sooooo chewy. i never had kalbi like that before .. Maybe becuz im from LA. We also ordered the steamed egg.. But it was like a souffle..  They must have used some kinda leavening agent to make it puff up ... But sadly to say.. It was super BLAND. Don't know if I'll come back.. But if i do... Only for happy hour.

RB8sHx1Ya9dfLB59rJCzkA.text: So good! Its a fun way to have dinner and tastes amazing. I always wish I could marinate my meat like they do. Bonus, it's not super pricey- so we don't feel like we need to hold back. We always get the spicy pork, mixed tempura, and double of my favorite: Bulgogi!

nBUQl9aispu5MyEfRcNwWw.text: We got the Bimbibop and it was great! First time having one and I think this was as authentic as it gets. Great prices for where it was located in relation to the strip.

mB2MoyaCXQcdpyu_bZO2Qg.text: Love this place... Big portions and the food was amazing!

lnw8ljrqNi80IX8jgLjDjQ.text: If you want real korean food, this place is not the place.  Service was poor and quality was poor.  Agree with some that other korean BBQ places wirh korean people there eating is a good sign of good korean food at a restuant.  No korean people present except myself at this place.  They charged us 18% tip atomic ally for 4 people. ?? A diet coke was $6 and one half Corn was $4 .  Not worth it at all.  Go to a real korean BBQ restaurant if u want authentic tic food and don't waste your time here.  Been to LA. New York and atlanta to name a few...and this was not even comparable to those restuarants.    If you are ok with eating over priced non authentic korean food and being charged for $6 dollars for a diet coke and getting bad food and Service,  this is definitely your place.

x8JgDKeVTL7zmMKxJXis6w.text: This was so so good!!! I loved it and it was one of the best Korean places I've been in a while! I loved the food and how nice our server was!!!! I hope you all come and I hope to come back!! It was so cool to make my own food. I loved the service and I likes how I was able to be comfortable. The service speed was very quick and efficient and you can tell they are busy because they have lists of tables. Also, every single time I take a bite into the macaroon ice cream it gets better and better..... Mmmmmmmm it is absolutely delicious!! I loved celebrating my birthday there!!! It was so so good!!! Loved it!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious seaweed!!

YCvAlMAkfmEXxJDYyZn06g.text: Great food!! On the particular night we went we had an extremely long wait. Almost an hour. That was not good but everything else was amazing.

KuE4pfDzV02WCj1snOCHzg.text: Haven't had Korean BBQ since I've moved to Vegas but this is by far my favorite restaurant for the moment! Dave was an excellent server/ bartender and made sure we were satisfied throughout our entire experience and even pointed out a free macron ice cream sandwich was super delicious! I'm coming back here for date night at least a few times a month!

MvQMAQE0H7YAEqx8iBr6CA.text: So good! Love these style restaurants and the food quality was great! 4 of us ordered the gagnam and it was a perfect size.

E2IInJJwGZZT7ml6R6VNSw.text: The beef pieces are around twice as thick as normal korean bbq restaurants.  So in other words you get a lot for your money here.  The nonmarinated korean prime beef was my favorite as well as the pork belly.  Write a review and get a free dessert here.  Prices are in line with other kbbq.

nuWX0RFXMJbs46qtwXjv0Q.text: Good barbecue, poor service. Appetizers were alright. Bulgogi was average, good short rib and brisket as well as the filet mignon.

nIR4-svuMNexitRp33i96Q.text: JJANG!  Best Korean food in Vegas! I'll definitely be back!  Must get: Pork belly Soju

heFxGEDtN5kvAU4MQYqOuQ.text: Found this place on yelp and it was the perfect meal for dinner!    Service: the service was awesome .. All the waiters/waitresses were so attentive and asked if we needed anything. Refilled our drinks, we didn't even have to ask!!   Food: we got the "gangam" which was the #1 best rated. And it definitely didn't disappoint. All the meats were tender & soft. Lots of side dishes to choose from. We really loved the bulgogi fried rice. Extra bonus was the free dessert but you gotta write a review.   Price: It depends on which meals you get but it can be $$ or $$$.   Will definitely come back

4r1nSfF3OMlHnmMrHsIvAg.text: I wished this place existed when I attended UNLV. This place carries a lot of value with the amount of different (yet satisfying) portions/packages that even a poor college student can afford.  My friend and I got the most basic Las Vegas package since we're hungry but obviously not capable of eating a feast by ourselves. It was $45/person and the amount of food cannot be more fulfilling. You get the tradition side dishes + a house salad, along with rice, sauces and miso soup to go along with your proteins that includes beef, spicy chicken, garlic shrimp and pork.  You are however required to cook things yourself comparing to places like Honey Pig when a server would occasionally stop by and manage your food. The place wasn't busy at the time we were dining so the servers volunteered to rotate our proteins for us as we were engaged in a deep conversation catching up on life- What a nice touch.   The ambiance of this place is on the smaller size but comfortable at the least. The service was friendly and attentive and most importantly, the food was amazing for the price that you're paying. I wasn't sure if it was Happy Hour when we dined but when we received our tab, it only came out to be $55. A lot less from what I was expected to pay (hey I'm not complaining) but regardless of it being a mistake or not, I'll happily return.

OXcVKqV17oAqLuZ1T3W8Lg.text: Loved this place! Best Korean BBQ I've had.   Spicy chicken with lemon sauce and the beef toro were my favorite meats.   For veggies, the thinly sliced squash left on the grill to char was great, along with the broccoli with cheese fondue.   The one feedback I'd give the management is to develop a cocktail menu.

IGfDUPoCe_NGVbleHfM3sg.text: One of the best dining experiences. More than just food and service. This place does it all right!
