Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango macaron ice cream

GHFzcTO06c1Jreml80IKLA.text: Nothing special.. i ordered duck, brisket, pork and some dishes. Side dishes was good but meat wasn't fresh. brisket was too thick and tough duck was like chicken breast. I maybe come back for side dishes but not a bbq.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fWDFoted5ANWujD9u1yNfw.text: Food was really good. Got the Mongolian beef and the meat was not over cooked, which was nice. Not bad.

c-U7_B53tEWuBa2l3N3nmw.text: Wonderful food and great atmosphere. Recommend it for large gatherings! We ordered the meat lovers and it was plenty of food. You can't go wrong coming here.

rihV-znyOCGCQuSVip9-fQ.text: Loved it! High quality meat and sides. Puts my home Korean BBQ to shame. Attentive service and a great meal. Well worth a stop.   First meal this trip to Vegas. Won't be the last time we are here.

XH192mov22DlIXDll7Meiw.text: Great atmosphere!  The Gangnam special was awesome, got the meal for 2 with 3 people and added a couple tapas it was perfect.  The beef bulgogi was delicious.  Highly recommended

RYw48ga-yuHE_gSpTFB0qA.text: Upsold and undercut!!! Came in with a large party and was seated in a private room in the back. Our server told us a family style meal would be a great fit for us and it is "a lot of food" and you get everything included three times. It was not enough food, and we did NOT get three servings. They turned off our grills and we never saw our third round. When we asked where it was they told us "that was three rounds split over two plates." WHAT?! Absolutely not. They didn't even offer or suggest purchasing more plates. I came ready to eat and left HUNGRY. We paid more than what we would have paid for an AYCE place and didn't even get a fraction of the amount of food or service. Our drinks were constantly empty and because of our fancy private room getting the servers attention was a struggle. Nice tasting bulgolgi, but their other meats are too thick and really fatty. Hit up anything on Spring Mountain for quality, quantity, and if you want to have money left over. Will not return. Do not recommend.

fOfqKs4qVJcycATd3C71-Q.text: It was ok. We were in Vegas for the long weekend and thought we can try this place since reviews are good. We chose Gangnam grill, it came with bunch of side dishes, big bowl of salad, 2 soups, beef bulgogi, mushrooms, corns and variety of grill meats. Definitely a lot of foods for 2 adults. However I feel like the meats were rather bland, not marinated enough. Price is on a higher range, but service was great and the place is clean. Not sure if we are going back next time, maybe I'll compare it to Hobak next.

acDbU9m_p3mMkXQQIWUs7g.text: This place is mediocre and extremely overhyped, and I strongly suspect that a large number of the glowing reviews were written just to get free dessert. I gotta admit I nearly did this myself--it would be awkward to show the server a two-star review when asking for a free dessert, wouldn't it? That's how they getcha.  We ordered the Meat Lover's BBQ for two, which at ~$56 for a single serving of meat, was obscenely overpriced. In cities with good Korean restaurants and more competition, you can get all-you-can-eat BBQ for $20/person. To top it off, the $56 doesn't even get you lettuce wraps, ssamjang, or sesame oil--you have to pay extra for each. Are you kidding me?  The meat itself was good. I mean, it's hard to mess up raw meat. However, the grill was electric! That was a first for me, and yet another disappointment with this restaurant. The meat obviously came out with no grill flavor whatsoever, and I could have cooked it better at home.  Our waitress was nice, and she was very good at topping up our water. However, not once did she offer to refill any of the banchan, so we ended up paying $56 for a single serving of meat AND sides. Lastly, she dropped off the check before we were even done, and I had to make several attempts to flag her down so that we could order dessert. She didn't clear the table for dessert, and we had to awkwardly share it among a bunch of empty dishes and leftover food, hunched over the giant table.

PTpOxDw7W-lIv8S0hvlGKQ.text: This was a fun place to visit just off the strip in Vegas while we rented a car for a day trip. We made it during their happy hour which provided a good deal on some of the cuts of meat, some sides, and some drinks including beer and sake. The restaurant was quite busy even at this off hour and I have to imagine it's really busy during peak times. The food was really tasty though we didn't care for either the sake or soju that we tried. Overall would recommend for an interactive dining experience that comes at a much lower cost compared to restaurants on the strip.

ACKDhfevKTxT_sNGtaL1jA.text: I had great meal here. The waiter Donggi is amazing. Thank you! I'll definitely come back soon.

xpy1DEg2UyzzabUwPV4wTA.text: My husband and I walked over to Revolt Tattoo from the strip and everyone recommended this place. We went and weren't disappointed at all. The food was a great value. We had a ton of sides before our meat came out for us to cook at the table. The food came out quick too. We cooed our meat right at the table and enjoyed the great taste of everything. We would definitely recommend and return when we're on Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TmrzOGKl4Qugf2VKw1mIAg.text: Stopped in on our way home to Utah from California... Great food... LONG WAIT... Service was mediocre... We tried one of the combo's for 2 and it was enough to feed 3 of us... We'd definitely recommend this place to others because of the quality of the meat... Great flavor and very tender!!!

rUHr5j5o_K3pEIqJA9puqQ.text: This is an awesome first time experience and great atmosphere!  Food was amazing and the people working were very friendly! I'll for sure come back every time I come to Vegas and also recommend to all my friends!

Ihyc2aZdPwBCJnfsnC0NIA.text: This is definitely my favorite BBQ restaurant. The food is amazing, and the staff are always helpful. The first time I ate here i really had no idea how to do anything so I'm glad i was with friends, but in the end i always wanted to come back here. I've been here so many times in each month, I've become a regular & i think some of the employees remember what i order.  Now this is my go-to for dinner, and being on yelp you get free macaroons with a check in.

N-sImrhp99odbSRG9donQQ.text: Should wait long but worth to try! He served meat may not be enough so you should order 2  or more dishes. Gimchi zzige and egg zzim are so great!!!

WNPxUv0386gG1fMrVmpj8A.text: Good food and great prices. Menu is interesting tried the spicy tuna kimbap very good. We had the seafood pancake which was not oily as it usually is. They use gas here and you are left to cook on your own. This is fine sometimes we want to do it ourselves sometimes we are lazy. The annoying thing about this place is the giant screen playing rap videos. I get it its Vegas, but at lunchtime it can be a little much.

vTiyBfPsWUs9CJA11bYLJw.text: Great food fun environment good prices but it was just too hot in there with no AC running

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_UJ9epiJJAqnrkoknEFKbA.text: My husband and I were excited to try Korean BBQ during our recent trip to Vegas so we chose Gangnam over some other choices because of the plentiful and rave reviews. We did not have to wait, which was a plus, and we were given a large array of different sides (banchan) that we started sampling right away. We ordered way too much meat for just the two of us, but before we could even try to get our fill of the BBQ, we both started to feel nausea and stomach pain. We asked for our food to-go but never got around to eating it back at the hotel. We crawled into our hotel bed and slept away the pain. We never figured out what could have set off our stomach troubles. Our experience could have been a fluke and it should not be a reason to avoid visiting. The service was friendly and there seemed to be a lot of other happy diners!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. And.... THE MEAT
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Part of the Meat Lovers
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More sides

StWCfs9sGcV_2taegp49xw.text: It's sooo good here! Great flavor and great service honestly has to be the best KBBQ in Las Vegas

uFEy9VsXckWLn0aQYqYgkw.text: Perfect place for kalbi and sides. Will come here again. Delicious food! Will recommend to family n friends

YUy1tBKVv0eTgL65dS_ugA.text: What a great Korean restaurant! They give you a ton of food and it is all delicious. The service was really good, and they were ready to help whether you were a new or experienced Korean food eater. Great place to come in a group, order one of the specials and try a wide range of meats. Also there were some wonderful vegetarian choices even though this place is a meat eaters paradise.   Quick tip: there is a lot of parking but if you are a Las Vegas visitor without a car there is a hotel very close by where you could pick up a taxi.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their bimbimbap is really good!
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They give you a lot of food!

1TJchjDik8HFooCpevXr_A.text: Cheap, good happy hour near UNLV. I love coming here after a hard day of work. Beer, meet and macaroon what else can a girl ask for. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CUXvTbmlqRQHf-dfy20khA.text: My son and I love this place! The good is great snd the staff is wonderful. I just wish it was a little larger because we waited for a table a long time a couple of times but it was totally worth it. We order the meat lovers selection. It's a lot of food so come hungry!

JiZwQhgbiWZ03Hk1I7ZiGA.text: Came here on a Sunday night fairly late.  It was almost 10pm and they were still busy.  We were greeted at the door and the gentleman was very pleasant.  He explained there was abother party in front of us but they just finished a rush and alot of tables should be opening up.  We were seated after about 10 min which was not bad at all.  The server came over promptly.  We ordered the 2 person upgraded meal for about $89.  There was so much food.  It was an awesome value.  Everything tasted awesome!  The server was incredibly attentive as was the rest of the staff that helped us.  We had a check in deal for macaroon ice cream.  I had mango it was delish!  Going back and recommending to friends!

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango macaroon ice cream sandwich.

PtyHzSNX0qjpQaIU7O0xsQ.text: A very clean place. Food isn't very traditional korean food yet most of them tasted good. A great service.  This is one of our favorite Korean BBQ place in Vegas.

cZ7Kk5UBJYImwhYUq9W75A.text: This place was recommended to us by our Airbnb host and I'm so glad we followed up and went! We went at 5pm on Sunday, so during happy and whoa was that an awesome surprise when we got the bill. We got three meats, sides, two rice, two veggies and an appetizer all for under $25 (not including tip). The meat was marinated and had plenty of flavor. The rice was a heaping portion. Our broccoli came ore cooked and a little burnt but whatever. Overall, food was great, staff attentive and we left with our bellies and wallets full.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too is chicken with lemon. Middle is beef bugolgi. Bottom is spicy pork.
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desert if you checked in via Yelp
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried rice balls with spicy tuna. SO GOOD

RRL9_jBzXZhQD3xRViLq0w.text: I'm from Cleveland and I look forward to eating here every time I'm in town. Affordable delicious kobe beef! Also highly recommend the steamed eggs! If youve never tried it, here is where you need to get it!

VX10Gvkeel4szOI-KPhayw.text: This place has an awesome happy hour. You get a ton of food for a great price. We were coming here so often at one point the servers remembered our orders. It can get a little busy sometimes but it's worth waiting for.

_bDUx3-ON7fySnA8RaMaeA.text: Having come to your place for a long time  and everything is still amazing. The meet is fresh good tasting the sides are amazing I highly recommend a bigger size of the macaroni salad. I always do ask him to bring me some bean sauce and oil with salt just to intensify the flavors. Good choice when my favorite in Vegas

1-zIGjtXOXsohfkdsKa_hg.text: This place has such a high number of reviews which is surprising that the score is really high. In my opinion the most that this place deserved is a three star. We came in around 7pm with a group of 11 people and was seated within 20 minutes. The place looks fairly clean and nicely decorated. The food was good but not great. The portion was really small. You would have to order a ridiculous amount to get full off of their portions. On top of that, they charge $2 for a small bowl of white rice. Their banchan was good and we were given a good amount. The waiter that we had were not very friendly. I couldn't get him to refill my Coke until the end of the meal. Over all this is not a place I would go back to again with a large group of people. I may revisit if it's me and another petite person who doesn't eat much. Don't go here if you want more bangs for your buck.

6WDTbPvWkFcSglwSEqRkzw.text: Best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas. The meats are top tier and the marinated meats in particular are where the money's at. Some may find them a tad on the sweet side but it's perfect for me. Come during happy hour to get some small discounts on a few choices such as pork belly, beef toro, and bulgolgi. Also half off drinks during this time so not too shabby.   The one minor annoyance is the extra suecharges for what I would consider standard at most Korean BBQ joints such as lettuce and sesame oil but servers are nice and sometimes willing to just throw them in so it doesn't feel too bad :)  Check it out and enjoy!

-7JopELDydyy7PYQKecjQA.text: This is one of the best Korean BBQ places we have been to. The food was tasty. The servers were considerate and polite. I had a party of four adults and two little children. And we ordered their best selling combo for four people at $120, and a serving of noodle. It was more food than we can handle. Another thing I have to warn you is it was too hot! A room filled with grills should have AC cranked up a little bit higher. I'm normally cold everywhere I go. I even packed a long sleeve jacket with me. But I was sweating. Everything was great till we almost paid tip on top of their mandatory 18% tip, and that 18% was based on the total price plus tax. We were not aware of the mandatory tip and on the credit card receipt there is an blank for tip. So if we didn't look closely enough, we would paid double tip. I wasn't too happy about that. But before I gave a lower review I decided to call the manager and see what their response would be. To my pleasant surprise. The manager Jin not only listened and apologized to my concern, he also offered to reverse the tip. Of course I didn't take it and told him their service and food deserve at least that amount of tip. I was just simply addressing the mandatory tip thing may upset some customers. We ended up thanking each other for the nice gesture. And I will definitely go back there and refer my friends there!

BY_SyMmE_ihNKvKdVtSa0w.text: Pretty good Korean BBQ. Not a fan of many of the sides but did enjoy the radish, fish cakes, and Mac salad. Meats were really good and flavorful! Definitely a place to try while in Vegas. A far walk from where we stayed but took uber to this place. So fairly close to the strip.   EDITED:   Service is not so great. Definitely HELLA slow!!!! We wanted the check and our desserts but they did not bring that out right away. We finally got up and told a waitress but she was slow too. The place was not even packed to have this kind of service at this kind of speed....

Coming from spending 1hr wait time & $$$ on Bacchanal's the night before, I had a glimpse of thought that we should have come straight here instead for half the price.  As we bit into the first bites of our meal, we thought that it actually may be better than Ktown LA BBQ.  We ordered few extra dishes along with the premium meat combos.  All great, but next time, we'll eat the uni rice bowl without having it mixed for us by the waiter. We also got galbi tang, which was fantastic, and a cheesy corn appetizer that smelled and tasted a bit like dirty feet. I ate one bite and left the rest alone. ZO_D-w4iuynhO3ZZUcIv_A.text: So I'm giving this place a solid 4/5. One point off because the service was a little spotty near the end. I got the feeling that all the waiters were simply very fast paced and if they thought you didn't need them, they simply scurried about their business.   We went to Happy Hour right when it started at 3p on a Sunday. The menu is overly large and exciting which made us very indecisive. So we started off ordering only a few things with the plan to order more from there. Here's all of what we ordered and what I thought.   Bacon-Wrapped Asparagus - pretty simple and hard to mess up. But with all the other exciting options, I'd pass on it next time.   Sweet Cheese Corn - one of my favorites! It was sweet, but not too sweet. And adding cheese never hurts. I would definitely order this again!  Fried Wontons - This is obviously of staple of just about every Asian menu. They were yummy as always, but not noticeably different from any other place.   Filet Mignon - Again, very simple. But so enjoyable. Be responsible and don't over-cook it! The meat quality was great and is very tender and delicious when you keep it medium rare. I would order this again.   Bulgogi - Very easy to over-cook due to the thin slices. But if you watch it, it comes out very tender and the marinade was everything I wanted! I would definitely order this again!  Cream Cheese Wontons - The wonton wrapper was super thin and delicate. It had the perfect light Crunch before breaking through to the cream Cheese. The sweet sauce it came with was great! I would order these again!  Chicken Karrage - I had never had this anywhere. So I was surprised to see that the pieces of fried chicken were cut in all different shapes and sizes. In fact, at first I thought the waiter had brought us the wrong thing. I thought it was fried calamari! The chicken itself didn't have much flavor. But the spicy dipping sauce it came with was great! Not sure I'd bother ordering it again, though....  Korean Chicken Cheese Fondue - I enjoyed this chicken even more than I expected! I loved the Crunch that developed from grilling! While the insides remained tender. The cheese came in a little foil bowl. It was shredded and cold and immediately put of the grill. It tasted like an American cheese. I would get this chicken again.   Vanilla Ice Cream Macaron Sandwich - the Macaron was purple and I'm not sure what flavor it was meant to be - it simply tasted sweet to me. Even after being frozen, it still had that perfect Macaron chew. And the vanilla ice cream was so creamy and smooth!  We had a great time at this place and will definitely be back to try more!

fdjtImewAGkG7qUorAaUnw.text: The wonderful menu for 2 served three of us very nicely. Excellent meats, great pickles and sides, tasty miso, yummy sauces. This is very good!

yqSuMWFE2VpUah8LSOIz4A.text: Probably the best kbbq I've been to kalbi and bulgogi were my favorites. Service was also great! Will definitely visit again when I'm back in Vegas.

1vaOiX6DxkGUMT21nYCNRw.text: I was visiting Las Vegas with family and this place was perfect! We went around midnight having been at a show( Hamilton!). The meat for the barbecue was top notch and the matcha ice cream macaroon was delicious. I would absolutely dine here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SlJPRqXsMaIrSMszshjVfA.text: They told us that this was a 20 minute wait... we waited more than an hour. It was not that crowded, it was a Monday night. Their staff is just super inept and inefficient. The food itself was so so and the meat very salty. I think most of these reviews are made up or paid for. It also took them like 15-20 minutes to get us our change... I had to walk up to the counter to request the change because they were taking ridiculously long and I had called a uber thinking it would take 5 minutes tops to get the change. Considering it was not too busy, this is ridiculous.  Plus the Asian cashier guy looks like a stereotypical Korean tool with the tool haircut and tool vibe. Plus he lies about the wait time.  Also, this place is literally a rip off of Gyukaku. This part is kind of funny... I think that they may have used to been a gyukaku since they still have the gyukaku logo on the front of the restaurant. Perhaps they just changed the name so they don't have to pay the franchise fees... but at the same time the service and food is a lot worse than a gyukaku

2N7N7GwxhBZkHRsgrvhxfg.text: Excellent! Food was phenomenal! Every beef dish was well marinated and completely tender once cooked. The bulgogi rice was on the sweeter side, but so yummy.  The service was fantastic with friendly waiters who didn't skip a beat with the food service and getting tables ready for the next guest.    The restaurant itself is very modern and clean with pop music playing in the background. Fairly easy to get to since it's just behind the Strip on Paradise.   Definitely recommend the Gangnam Grill for 4-6. It's more than enough food.

LEDp4lSAvAt2kaQTxUXCJQ.text: Excellent service and food! Some of the best Korean BBQ I have had since moving back to America from Korea.  We just enjoyed an amazing lunch here. We ordered Kobe beef carpaccio to start, which really started the lunch off right. It was tender and flavorful... I would definitely recommend it. I would also recommend the pork belly and prime kalbi, but all the meats we tried were delicious!  Oh, and the interior is a plus too. I love the modern look and mix of American and Korean pop music played through music videos on a projector screen. Great place to go with friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really quality food.. Bacon wrapped enoki mushrooms, filet mignon, scallop, pork belly, and prime kalbi. Delicious!

qn2FxToNIAzsxX21Jv6V7A.text: Almost no wait! Yeah!!! The line last night was super long with a 2 hour wait!  We tried our luck again today and waited maybe10 mins:) early dinner at 4:20pm tho! We ordered the white peach sake. Wow! Do delist! Be prepared, it's the size of a wine bottle! We love Korean BBQ. And have had the best at Parks in Los Angeles. We ordered the Las Vegas combo for 2. It's a lot of food! Perfect spicy chicken yum!!! Loved the sides. Attentive staff. Great tasting food. No wonder the wait was 2 hours! We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super my white peach sake

My group of 5 got the signature Gangnam combo for 4 people and it was almost too much food. Almost.   The combos were for 2, 4 or 6 people but the staff was very accommodating in providing us an extra miso soup and dividing the 2 bibimaps into 5 bowls.   Highly recommended.

There was a particular song with video that was about the rap group chasing down and killing cops.  I brought it to the attention of the waitress that it was very offensive and extremely distasteful. g3G7N668GNpc9eQX2xjuow.text: really impressive service. the servers are on it the whole time. the happy hour is really ludicrous. three of us had 2 saporros, broccoli, corn, mushroom, spicy chicken, lemon chicken, calamari & all the panchan you want to ask for for, whaaaaa, 30 bucks?? too good. thanks to these guys.

AQLOcUrBkGRgUBfNoUKFQQ.text: After a hard core night out on the town, Korean BBQ truly hits the spot! And Gangnam delivers!!!   My friends and I ordered the Meat Lovers combo for 4 and it was amazing! For $100, it comes with 6 different meats, 3 types of salads, chilli dumplings, miso soup, rice and side dishes. The quality and quantity is superb! We ate to our fill and still had food leftover.   The service was phenomenal. Very attentive and friendly. The place is packed but they are well staffed; only had to wait 5 minutes to be seated.   Sure, there are all you can eat Korean BBQ places, but I'm all about quality and flavor and will be making Gangman a regular stop when in Vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean BBQ done right! Meat Lovers combo comes with 6 meat types, salad, dumplings, miso soup, seaweed salad, and side dishes!
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the meats in the Meat Lovers combo

vTw1I5ccuTzQ7oRsQDvcMg.text: This place has 4.5 stars from 700+ reviews and it doesn't disappoint! The service is friendly and fast. The restaurant is clean and inviting with fun pop music playing in the background but most importantly the food is SO GOOD!  I highly recommend the Korean Kalbi - for $9 you get a generous portion of high quality, thickly sliced and deliciously seasoned meat. It was so good my girlfriend and I immediately ordered a second plate once we were done. The shishito peppers and mushroom medley were also amazing. Hell, everything we ordered was fresh and delicious and tasted amazing off the grill. Heck even the rice was really good and I'm Picky about rice so that's saying something.  We also ordered a bottle of soju to share (Jinro Chamisul) and it was the perfect drink to go with the meal.  My only complaint is that they do charge you for the sesame oil which is usually free in most korean BBQ places. But for the amazing prize, potions and quality of food who is complaining?  I would fly back to Vegas just to eat here ;) this place definitely was a huge highlight of my Vegas trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing Kalbi and kabocha

EfjUKvFNXk4bBnfOrESvPA.text: The food was amazing! Really nice lunch special that will leave you full! Easy parking and great prices. Also a very large desert menu.

xFZwGwFiiDE1LdfT9ChDyw.text: This is the most bland food I have ever had at any restaurant of any type. I've eaten at several Asian BBQ types of places in the Los Angeles area, and we're glad that this wasn't our first experience because we never would've eaten at this style restaurant again. We chose this restaurant (driving through the state from LA to Utah) because of all the positive Yelp! comments, and we were just so surprised at how flavorless the food was. In addition, one member of our party ordered the beef gyoza appetizer that comes with the lunch menu,  and it was ice cold. We had to ask the server if it should've been served hot, which it was. We waited quite a bit for the appetizer to be prepared properly.   There are six mini appetizers that come with your lunch menu and after the gyoza experience, we weren't sure which of the items should've been hot or cold, and they were mostly unappetizing.  Service was also slow, could have been far more attentive, and the restaurant was not busy. It took an hour and a half for our lunch.   I hesitate to post this comment because obviously so many people think differently and really seem to love this restaurant. However, that said, I read reviews to get an idea of everyone's experience so this post is to reflect our experience. It could just be a matter of taste!

QSeiymYAYZiziOdp4xFuaA.text: This place is so much fun and whenever we are in town and want KBBQ this is our spot. Our last couple visits to Vegas we've made it a point to come here. Both times we came for the late night happy hour. The meat and veggies are really good, the staff are friendly and the prices are right. The combos are a good value, we opted to add to it with a couple dishes from the happy hour menu. The side dishes are good and have a good variety. I haven't been to any other KKBQ's in town, but I don't think we need to. They have everything we want and more. Some day we will hopefully be able to bring a few more people with us and really get more meat and veggies so the two of us can try more items. Definitely a must try and fun for the entire family, away from the craziness of the strip if you need that. (Yelp LA Challenge #44 of 100)

yuUPHTfSgKVwAfTuO1FO1g.text: Hit and miss.   :( We were really in the mood for Korean and had high hopes for this place.   The good: The seafood tofu soup had great flavor but it was seriously the smallest portion I've ever seen in any Korean restaurant.  The original bibimbap was yummy (nothing extraordinary but solid and at least normal portion size).  The chocolate lava cake was delicious.  Warm and gooey.   The not so good: side dishes were icky.  So sad because half the fun of Korean food are the yummy side dishes.  The seafood pancake was tiny and for $9.50, so not worth it.   We are normally huge fans of seafood pancake but just so tiny here (two small silver dollar pancake size ones and at most places you get one the size of a dinner plate).   The pork belly app was so so.    Our waitress was really nice though it took a while to get seated and for someone to come and take our order.    Overall: small portions, pretty good service... But there's gotta be better Korean places in Vegas!

Wished they swapped my grill mid meal since I got that burned crust on top, but that is minor. Adds flavor.  Easily 5 stars. Recommended for people who feeling food before 1am. _ZkLjY7gyM1A-NTqoc_TgA.text: What can I say, this is the best Korean place I've gone to in LV ever and I've been to almost all of them. What makes this place good is that the service is attentive and the prices are affordable, especially during their happy hours that run from 3-6pm and 10pm-close. The HH is worth going to if you plan on eating a lot and drink alcohol. I don't drink that much alcohol anymore so when I'm in LV you can catch me here beyond HH.  The variety of the food items is pretty stellar also. I'll admit the value isn't as great as some AYCE Korean places like Gen but the quality is good and taste better than what I've had in LV before going here. The atmosphere is pretty cozy also. I like the hugeness of the booths and the quality of the grill that cooks my food. I highly recommend this place if you are looking to eat off the strip or away from Chinatown.  Plus, they give you a free dessert if you write a review of the place. No, I'm not being bought off my rating with a dessert it really is what I think of the place.  It doesn't hurt that they offer this for new reviews of the restaurant though...nice!  Oh my...I started writing in Yelp again for a dessert.

IOzm9k26y__vBNEZkUfjpw.text: Let me start by saying that I don't like Korean barbecue. In fact, I don't like Korean food, other than the occasional tofu house--and by occasional, I mean once a year. But this place swept me off my feet.   We, a party of six, arrived before the restaurant opened at 11:30 a.m. and waited outside for the doors to open. As we stepped in, someone started to set our table with all the side dishes; as soon as we were seated, we started nibbling. These were high-quality side dishes, from the fishcake slices to the kimchi. There was also macaroni salad, pickled cucumbers, etc. All of these items are "refillable" upon request.  While the menu includes weekday lunch specials and meal sets (four different options for parties of 2 or 6), we opted to order a la carte so we could get each item we wanted: -Kobe beef carpaccio ($9.95): So good! Thin slices of meat heaven, really. There was enough for each of us to have 2-3 pieces, too, so definitely a generous serving. -Spicy tuna kimbap ($6.95): Kind of like a spicy tuna with crispy rice roll that you'd find at some Izakayas, but the rice is rolled up in seaweed, and the tuna is poke-style. You get the soft fish and the crunchy rice with a light sriracha mayo flavor--comes together very nicely. It's four rolls, but we managed to share between six of us.  -Tteokbokki ($4.95): Consisting of soft rice cake, fishcake (same as the side dish), and hot sauce, this dish took me by surprise. It looks like a simple bowl of rice cakes, but is full of flavor, not awfully spicy. Make sure that you get a fishcake slice with the rice roll to get all the flavors together. A good, cheaper option for something that's a bit more filling. -Spicy ramen egg ($6.95): I was skeptical, but boy was I proved wrong! This was one of the most enjoyable bowls of ramen I've had, even though it really was just ramen, egg, some greens, and spice. Like the tteokbokki, it's simple, but so good for the soul and for the tummy. You can opt for the Japanese sausage/ seafood options for additional cost. -Bibim nangmyun ($11.95): Spicy cold thin noodles. This was my least preferred of all the dishes, but even then, I'd give it a 4/5. Nothing bad about it, just that it's not as savory as it looks, though you can add whatever sauces you want. I'd recommend mixing in some of the spicy fishcake side dish for additional flavor.  -Original bibimbap ($12.95): Our server helped us mix everything together and even dished it out to each of us. Best bibimbap I've had, hands down. Flavorful, filling, and "healthy" (because of all the veggies in it, of course). -Beef toro ( 2x$4.95), beef tongue (2x$8.95), flat iron garlic ($8.95), Korean prime kalbi ($8.95): I couldn't really tell the difference between any of them, but it doesn't matter, because they were all so delicious. For the meats that aren't already marinated, definitely use the three sauces provided to you--in fact, I recommend dipping the same piece of meat into all three sauces to get a slightly sweet/ tangy, and definitely spicy kick to your otherwise unflavored meat.   All of this cost only $125--including tax and gratuity! All six of us were extremely stuffed and very happy. Oh, AND with Yelp check-in, we each got a free macaron for dessert... Maybe not the best life choice, but who can turn down a free dessert?

8YJSidmbmmJZ21XzRu34Zw.text: First time there (about a week ago). It was sooooo good! There was 7 of us. Bf and I got the Meat Lovers, 2 other friends got the Las Vegas, 2 others got the Gangnam, and 1 friend just ordered apps. I loved the Meat Lovers! Seems pricey but you get sooo much meat! The Las Vegas has chicken if you're not so much into meat. And the Gangnam has fresh oysters, although our friends opted to exchange the oysters for something else. Either option you choose, you get a lot of food. It's super fun to cook and eat while chatting. Everyone was full and happy at the end. The macaroon ice cream is delicious! I recommend it. It's the perfect size dessert after stuffing your face lol If they still have it, check in  and you get one free! (the macaroon).

zp7Vnrni4-txwuHRREHWUg.text: It's known for its bbq but we opted to try other things. We had the bibimbop and it was fantastic! The Kobe beef carpaccio appetizer was tasty and it's a must try. Overall, we enjoyed our experience and we'd come back for the bbq next time.

JrLPh3DtXDOHVh0J7InY5A.text: It smell delicious even before you enter. You are in for a food ride. The teriyaki chicken and the bulgogi were my favorite proteins. However, you cant go wrong with what you order. The dumplings were perfectly cooked and that cake they have, is a must try. it not, you will regret it. As with all the Korean BBQs, $$ can add up quick but they have reasonable prices.   Since people seat and order a little at a time and then cook it yourself, you might have to wait once you get to the restaurant.   Service was efficient and the proteins would come out rather quick.

5c1PgsJeSnhrH74Ef-Zzpw.text: This is how Korean BBQ is meant to be.   Hidden behind the Strip, in the heart of Vegas, is the best Korean BBQ in the area. As soon as you walk through the doors, the wonderful aroma of charred marinated meat will tell you, you're in the right place.   Me and a friend came here and between the two of us, we went with the "Gangnam" set which includes a soup, rice, side dishes, and a variety of meats. Don't let anyone tell you the filet is the best, or the miso is the best... Hands down, the prime rib galbi is worth a second dish - and that's exactly what we ordered.   Oh yeah and we're writing this for the free ice cream macaroon :)

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Write a review, get a free macaroon ice cream dessert! (Green Tea shown)

zm9Ob2CK2UhKMcz9NfldTQ.text: Food was good , limited choices then other Korean BBQ places , but the lady at night was really rude , we walked in from a urban club next door and she instantly frowned her face up ! She judged us before we could even sit down , (three black people). One of our friends was really drunk and couldn't even lift her head up to eat , she rested while another friend and I ate the food , our friend that was resting didn't even touch any food and the lady still charged us full price for her basically sitting there , She was really rude and not very welcoming , will not get any business from my friends and I ever again ..

ZngAAVeDX9J0lkh4bUMaAA.text: Great KB! The sides were all great! And if you go during happy hour you really save money.

EmttuP8E1E6uanivTOi3Kg.text: Okay. Real talk. We're still at the restaurant while I'm writing this. I needed to write my review before we left the table because I'm currently trapped in this weird mystical place where everything is beautiful but everything also hurts.   This food is so delicious that I'm questioning the physical limitations of my corporeal form. Every single meat we've tried has been tastier than the next, and every bite sends me to this agonizing happy place somewhere between "I love my friends for showing me this amazing restaurant" and "I hate my friends for putting this unreasonable amount of good food in front of me."   We bought the Meat Lovers combo for 6. There are 5 of us. The meal comes with enough to feed probably 8. We finished most of it anyway. It was just so good that we wanted to try everything and I have so many regrets for not sampling instead of shoving endless amounts of meat in my face.  Please eat here, the food is ridiculously tasty, including all the sides. But tread lightly, friends. The grill won't be the only thing burnt out and covered in sauce by the end.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not even half of the meat in the Meat Lovers combo for 6. You could feed a small militia with this combo.

XDLSnArH8RNx940WUg2nYg.text: We went to Vegas to celebrate our anniversary. We had dinner reservations in a lot of different restaurant in different hotels. But what came out as our favorite meal, that we had to come back for seconds before our flight, is Gangnam. Service is great. Never had to ask servers to refill our water. Food service was quick. We ordered the premium set, and we wanted to substitute other items on the set, and they were easy to talk to and was able to change things no problem. (With a little extra $$ if the substitute's price is more). Every single thing on the set that we got was really good. We really liked the Uni bulgogi. The dish was very buttery and they don't skim on the uni pieces. And if I have to go back to Vegas, a trip to Gangnam asian bbq is a must! Totally loved the free macaron ice cream when you check in on Yelp!

MGL7F1dkcDqWpe5sMLxggw.text: Went there for dinner! Amazing bbq! The kalbi was delicious! Pork belly was good too! The Kim chi is decent.  Was too full we don't have space for dessert.

UMKvXkyv2l5qt-6IMe22ew.text: As a night owl and broke college student, I'm really fortunate to live in Vegas where there's no shortage of late night specials in restaurants open past midnight. Gangnam has been my go to for KBBQ cravings since day one with their smashing reverse happy hour deals of meats and apps all $4 and under.  The menu is not AYCE but the quality of meat is substantially better than any AYCE joint around town. From my experience, four grill items, an app, and rice/salad is more than enough food for two people to share. The complimentary banchan is plentiful both in variation and amount they give, and I'm pretty sure they're refillable as well although I've never tried considering how full I get each time. This visit, we left satisfied (and with leftovers!) at under $12 per person plus tip. If that's not a great deal for KBBQ I don't know what is!  Our food came out fast despite the restaurant being packed, with banchan arriving as soon as we put in our order. The toro was fatty, pork belly was thick, and the chicken was marinated to perfection. You can't go wrong with any type of meat you choose. It's all fresh and of high quality, and even the veg is good! Mushroom medley is a personal fave- it comes precooked in a foil pack to place on the grill. The butter base provides a delicious decadence to the umami mushroom flavors.   With consistently good food, good prices, and good service, Gangnam deserves all five stars. If you love KBBQ and have never been here... do you even exist? Kidding, but seriously, you gotta check this place out

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean chicken, pork belly, and beef toro (top to bottom)

TH4NdlmCIdnioyyIdGoY1Q.text: I'd never been here before, but a friend suggested it and so we trusted her opinion and I'm glad we did! It was so good! I could have done without the rice and miso soup so I could order more meat. The only downside was a 45 minute wait on a Wednesday night. But great experience overall. Can't wait to come back!

HabOJEyBbUAZ1SjCvmTzFQ.text: Great Korean barbecue. The staff was helpful and friendly. The food was excellent.   For those who have not been, Korean barbecue involves cooking your own meat on a grill at the table. Side items, including miso soup, edame, beans, kimchee, salad, etc., are brought to you.   The side dishes were all good, though the salad is not particularly memorable other than the fact it contained exactly one hard boiled egg and two cherry tomatoes. The miso soup was amazing  While the meat can be ordered a la carte, they do have "bundles". The one we chose had items my wife could not eat (she has a severe shellfish allergy). The restaurant happily substituted alternates with the same price from the a la carte menu. All was very good though thinly sliced beef cooks down much smaller than you would expect.   Why four stars? Grills need to be changed fairly frequently as the meat bakes on. Other Korean barbecues change the grill multiple times during a meal. Ours was never changed.   Additionally, the other Korean barbecue places I have been to have been like sushi restaurants -- everything for one price. Not here.  Worth going to? Yes. But caveat emptor with respect to my criticisms.

xdYZjTCnKegnO_HfZpvByg.text: Always a good time!!!   Worth the wait. Always. Service is impeccable. I do not look elsewhere for kbbq and suggest this spot to all the visitors.  Hit it up.

hhd-aLzcW5_938kfap_WZQ.text: They don't take reservations, just walk-ins. And we got very lucky, because we only waited 20 minutes. And yet, then they said they were "booked" after that, so if we hadn't gotten in, the wait would have then been 90 minutes.   The food was FAST and pretty good. I liked the seafood pancakes. My friend loves the Bi Bim Bop. And it was totally reasonably priced.

6AcDFf5wJRYwbQ-f24MYUg.text: My fiance and I came here for dinner the night he proposed to me. It was late about midnight and there were only a few other people there. This place is fun and romantic, definitely setting the mood for the amazon night ahead of us. We had the premium combo with Kobe beef, need tongue, shrimp rice bumpy bop or something, among other yummy things. This was my first taste of Kobe beef and I certainly fell in love. The meat is fresh and well as the veggies. I love how you can cook your food perfectly the way you want it.  The staff was very friendly and not very invasive. Always refilling our drinks and occasionally checking on us, making sure we were enjoying our experience.   The price is a little steep, but what do you expect when you order Kobe beef. I would have paid more. I'm sure there are less expensive places in china town but this was close to home.   Over all we had a very good experience, the food was delicious and the staff was very nice. I will be going back.

H4-OAFH29BmeMqdvN4322A.text: Amazing food. Enjoyed everything. We ordered pork, spicy chicken, beef, bacon wrapped mushrooms. Plus so many  sides. My personal fav was tofu and marinated radish. Checkin at yelp and get free ice cream

cHKDJBQMLeM8CJuY-Vd0Dw.text: Pretty authentic Asian bbq! Everything that we ordered tasted great. The 2 mile walk from our hotel was definitely worth it. Still loaded with people after 12am Christmas Eve...

07Gz18IajPxG8UUiWWwFlQ.text: Fantastic KBBBQ. Great flavor, the grill is perfectly designed and the rates are decent. Expect to spend 20 per person at the  least. You enter to a nice aroma of the food and you leave with a great taste of meat in your mouth. If you've never tried Korean BBQ before, you owe yourself to experience this self grilling experience!!

EsoO19sFGARaoDxvFgWGIw.text: Place is pretty hip. It is a KBQQ joint, and they sell their meats tapas style. I'd suggest to order their korean prime kalbi, brisket, premium beef tongue, kobe style beef, spicy pork, and their filet mignon for meats. They also offer happy hour in which some of the dishes come at a discount that ranges from $2.95-9.95 per tapa order depending on the meats.   Mixxed veggies are a good choice for sides, kimchee, japanese pepper, mushroom, and asparagus. The stuff with the cheese sides aren't really worth it. I wasn't too fond of the whole cheese dipping thing, and didn't end up using it.   For the combos, the first time we came, we ordered the Paradise combo. It says it's good for two people, but we split this with a family of four. We don't eat a lot, but it was still enough to fill us up! Well, we also ordered calamari (which was also good! especially their sauce!) and their fried dumplings (beware. it's really spicy).  This place is pretty hip, they also have a nice private room for a big party. They feature this big projector screen that plays a mixture of popular music videos from here and Korea. The Korean music videos are so fun to watch even if I don't understand the language. It's a good way to help the time pass.   It's a fun hip place to go to, but every time I go it's barely full. Maybe one or two areas are taken.

tk651lxH_SIA2jcWQaJzVA.text: Maybe because I live in NoVA and we have a slew of great Korean BBQ. My gripe with this place is not the food per se. It can be considered above average. I think we ordered the premium combo with a few a la carte.  I can't remember what meat was what, but I can tell you that some were good and some were ok. The biggest problem with this place is service.   The only time they stopped off at our table is to take our order, drop off the food, and give us the check. Never came by to pick up empty plates. Had to scream at them to get their attention for ordering more drinks and water. Never came to refill the side dishes. Never checked on our sauce. You get the picture. They didn't even pretend to care and help start cooking.

tj79K6GD2wPzACwnkc7-Hw.text: Shady business practice. They advertise a lunch special on their website but when we came it they said they will not honor it and it's not even a holiday it's a Tuesday at lunch. No mention of any restrictions on their website.   Beware of supporting this business.

Unlike other Korean spots I've been to, the vibe of this place is decorated nicely and really clean which made me feel even more comfortable with stopping by for some lunch munchies.    Ordered the Meat Lovers meal for 4 people which was $99. They start you out with a nice salad topped with an Italian like dressing. Miso soup is served shortly after. The main entree consisted of Kalbi, Bulgogi, Pork belly, Spicy pork, and the only meat i was really craving on the menu, Filet mignon! Unfortunately it was also the only meat that turned out bad with whatever marinade they used. On the another note, we had reached our belly limits. The meal filled us all perfectly with a little desert room to spare.  Our server was great, and he was very consistent with checking up on us. Recommendation: 1) meat: prime kalbi ; pork belly; beef toro 2) all sides are good 3) seaweed salad and miso soup 4) bibim nangmyun  5) Tteokbokki (my fav) Japche seems good too, maybe try next time.  In words, you must try this. Love it.

YI6RnMjTQ8ZTc0gVlufZ-g.text: Had a 4 hour delay at McCarran International Airport before our flight back home so my bf and I yelped up this convenient nearby restaurant and Ubered here in less than 10 mins!  Upon arrival around 4 pm, we were seated right away. There was only one table occupied. However, shortly after people came in nonstop and all the tables were taken. The interior had a modern cultural vibe, making the experience feel relaxing. Although this Japanese Korean BBQ does not offer AYCE, the combos are reasonably priced for the amount of food included! We got the Meat Lovers combo for about $60, my faves were the dumplings, beef toro and of course filet mignon. The servers were all friendly and comes by to change the grille if it becomes too burnt. We flew back home with more than a happy tummy!

nCc_hwDLfDXkPj4eW1uTfQ.text: This place is awesome. Multiple servers were constantly checking on our table. Each table is set up with it's own grill and has a hood vent. I  ordered the Gangnam grill. Phenomenal.  I'll be back soon. Cheers Brady Bunte!

5Msw8-40ntkXAUnfWijxrA.text: Fantastic menu and lots of options!  I had the scallops cooked just the way I love them and had a couple appetizers. The food starts adding up quickly so make sure you pace yourself or you'll have enough leftovers for the rest of the week;) Make sure to check in for your free dessert. Staff was incredibly friendly and the restaurant has great ambiance and very clean.  Any time I return to Vegas I'll definitely come again!

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops!

FJphxuLZK5BalHUA4XZ27A.text: Korean BBQ!  During the whole trip in Vegas, my friend and I didn't eat anything good.  So for our last dinner there, we had to find a good restaurant to eat at.  We found this place on yelp and it was a good choice.  They are located just outside the strip.  They are opened till late as well.  When we got there, there was a wait.  We were told 30-45 minutes wait.  It wasn't too bad so we decided to wait.  An hour and half passed by and we were still waiting.  My friend went to the host to check up.  They told her the table to should be ready in a bit.  We finally got a table and things got better.  We ordered the Las Vegas meal.  Which is a good portion for 2 or even 3.  Depending upon how much a person can intake of course.  Each person gets 3 different dipping sauces.  I don't know what they were but all were good.  I alternated between each one.  The options for rice were either 2 steamed rice or 1 bibimbap.  We got the bibimbap.  I think it was a good choice.  The rice was on the softer side but it was flavorful.  Had bulgogi and veggies.  Side dishes were nothing to rave about.  Just normal like other Korean restaurants.  Everything else that came with this meal were all good.  Omg, my friend and I overstuffed ourselves.  We tried to finish everything but we couldn't.  One bad thing about eating Korean bbq is that you will smell like the food afterwards.  It may not be a good idea to go anywhere after lol.  Overall, this is a good restaurant to eat at.  The wait is like average for Vegas for the most part.  Happy grilling!

U6Cz-YWxIDM-Dw2V7eK-Mg.text: Delicious food all in all, just perfectly marinated meats. Accompanying sauces were killer. Only complaint is the bimbap bowl was disappointing... Don't call it ribeye meat in the original bimbap bowl when I can't barely see any ribeye other than huge bowl rice and veggies and remnants of meat. Do it right or dont do it at all. Servers were great.

3vmPG9EJiXn9a7SRAXXAgQ.text: This is the second time dining here in the last few years. Each time, I brought people who have never had Korean BBQ and it was a hit. They offer a good variety of meats and other foods in their packages for a very reasonable price. No one left hungry!

mi82T53CQu-HwWlj2Cf5hw.text: Awesome place! The reason why this is a beyond awesome place is because: 1) Greeting at the door, 2) Table prepared and ready as I was seated, 3) Surrounding very clean, 4) Appetizers prepared on table as seated, 5) Servers was beyond kind & courteous, 6) All the meat was tender and not "chor chor" 7) Fast and efficient service, 8) Great atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #1 seller, Gangnam Meat selection.

tAFn0Nnd5kfC-KDVELB3Fg.text: Solid flavor, amazing price and good portions!  I live near K Town in LA and have some of the best Korean food available. I will vouch for this spot, solid flavor but what you get for the price is insane!  The Kalbi is my favorite...give it a try. Some nights are long waits but on the night we went it was only 5 minutes.  The staff is pretty cool and make good recommendations.

qatc9PJxb8AEXtc_dk6XLw.text: 5 stars for the food and experience.  4 for the value and service.   Came here for a belated birthday dinner. The first time we came was on a Monday at 7 and the wait was already up to 40 minutes. We decided to try again on the weekend. We then came back on a Saturday at 4:30 and there was NO wait - and we were in time for happy hour. If you can time your visit around it, I recommend it.   They have lots of different meats so here's what we ordered: Duck Breast - yummy! Would get again  Short Rib - So good - shoulda gotten more.  Pork Belly - I liked it but husband was just so-so Beef Toro - Husband likes this. I thought it was too thin and a pain to cook.  Calamari - Tricky to cook. Would not get again.  Tofu - Also tricky to cook and kept burning. I'd pass.  Bacon wrapped Enoki - Not bad but would probably skip next time.  Mushroom medley - I was underwhelmed but husband loves mushrooms so he was content. It's already precooked which I was bummed about.  Broccoli - Also precooked. I thought we'd get to grill it. Ahh well.  House Salad - Not bad but nothing like the picture.   So overall I'd stick to more beef next time although it was fun to try different things.   The service was just okay. It took a while for people to help us both days and we weren't really given instructions on how to cook. When we asked, some staff didn't know.   This is worth trying once. I wouldn't make this a regular thing since it gets pricey in a hurry.

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side accompaniments

1KCoER75VyQmnXJe4Pk4jQ.text: We stopped here for a late night dinner in LV. Unlike other Korean bbq restaurants I've been to, this one does not offer unlimited choices of meat for the price you pay, but you still get plenty of food for half the cost which for me is a win! We came during the happy hour which allowed for great pricing on the meat choices and appetizers. With great food, great service and a free dessert for $35 for 2 people, I cannot complain about this place! Highly recommend when visiting LV!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour dinner

C5_BHNWsyjozMRnSZ7mKZg.text: great food great service. Used to dislike kimchi but somehow this place cooks it and I started to like it. Meat is high quality and ice cream is good. fair prices too. great for a party of 4 or 6!

KKkLEEu4GepwMzm0A_ynzw.text: Originally our party was supposed to have a dinner at Shang Artisan Noodle, but the police blocked the entire plaza and we were not able to get in. In hindsight if one of our friends actually comes with us a hour earlier then it is possible we would all get stuck in a potential horrific situation. Anyhow I quickly checked my bookmarks on Yelp and picked Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining as our alternative dinner option. The wait was so long (about 45 minutes) that I even had time to chat with a complete random stranger about foods in LA as well as various career advice.  This is NOT an AYCE (all you can eat) Korean BBQ restaurant, but there are four different combos (with 2, 4, and 6 people options available) - Las Vegas ($48.95 for 2 people), Meat Lover ($58.95 for 2 people), Gangnam (#1 best seller; $68.95 for 2 people), and Premium (best cuts; $89.95 for 2 people.) My friends had zero interest in getting the Gangnam combo because they had buffet earlier today and didn't want any starters. As a compromise, we ordered from the a la carte menu and got all meat options from the Gangnam combo instead (meat only for $44.40 vs meat + oyster + sweet corn + shishito pepper + green salad + bibimbap + miso soup for $68.95).  We all got three dipping sauces (one was definitely sweet soy sauce) and our waitress was very good at changing our grills. She kept giving us a new grill each time we finished cooking a meat plate. I counted and it happened at least 4+ times!  [Complimentary banchan]: Squid had great flavors, but it tasted slightly too spicy and flavors were somewhat overwhelming. The sweet sauce on cucumber was good and kimchi tasted more sour and less sweet. Fish cake had fairy firm texture and flavors were there, but quality was just a-okay. Lastly bean sprout was pretty average.  *** Orders ***  Filet Mignon ($9.50): A-okay meat.  Prime Kalbi Chuck ($9.50): Juicy and chewy - very good meat.  Harami Miso ($9.95): Another juicy and chewy meat. Another thumbs-up!  Gulgogi ($5.50): Sauce tasted slightly too sweet, otherwise meat quality was excellent. It was not as good as Harami Miso.  Korean Prime Kalbi ($9.95): Sauce tasted slightly too strong, but good meat quality.  **  Please do not forget to use the Yelp check-in offer because you will get a free Brick macaroon ice cream! Trust me you will want to get it because it tasted surprisingly good! The green tea macaroon ice cream didn't taste too sweet and macaroon certainly had a nice fluffy texture.  A solid 4.5-star on meat quality and flavors - round up to 5-star due to excellent service and free Brick macaroon ice creams!

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0uiwJRJIzG7MH5U7KVgNBA.text: Food was excellent. Took some colleagues there for the 1st time and they loved it. Options are excellent, prices were really good and service is great. We had a party of 8 last minute but they accommodated us well. This will be my goto Korean BBQ place in Las Vegas from now on.

O0ZvEz7SwJiZ06ve9n50sA.text: This is a must every time we come to Vegas.   Vegas is so commercial, and everything is go,go,go. But it's nice to relax and have some home cooked bbq.    KBBQ at its best.  I usually get the Vegas set for 2.  Today got the meat lovers for 2 and some add-ons that can feed 4.    Came with bugolgi, pork belly, couple steaks, spicy pork, and a couple more. Rice and miso soup for two. Salad bowl and a seaweed salad.    Addons were Kalbi, Ramen and a egg soup.    Too it off with macaroon ice cream and we are stuffed.    Delicious.

1agyvjGeUTYBbYFE-Ar7Og.text: I would rate this place higher but the service was so bad.    Our server came by once to take our order and  again after we were done eating.    In between, we sat with empty plates of meat and needing to order more.  Our water glass was empty and our banchans were empty.  We tried to get several servers' attention and they all ignored us.  They stood around most of the time and avoided eye contact.  There was only one other server there, a girl who ended up getting all of our orders promptly.   We put in our egg order with 1 male server.  It was over 40 minutes and we still didn't get the egg.  We had to remind them again and they said it would take another 10 minutes.  By that time, we were done eating.  The meat is good.  The banchans are okay.   I would not return due to the terrible service, not worth it.

AklKpnxvNQBkyP9gmI0zVA.text: Excellent prices with good quality meats. Try the soups too cuz it's delish!!! There is a happy hour from 3pm to 6pm and from 10pm to close. The prices are very reasonable and a great value. You can try a bunch of different meats. The ban chan is tasty as well. For example, pork belly order is only $5. Prime kalbi is $9.95.   Service is efficient and courteous. One of my favorites in Vegas. Opens late too!!!

Probably some of the best KBBQ I've had. Two people can fill their bellies with 50$. We didn't do a special, we just picked 6 or 7 meats and some rice and were very happy!

oYSSxM-x-Ewasu-AeSwDdQ.text: Would definitely recommend to others! The service was good and the price was so reasonable for the amount of food we received. When in Vegas, I'm definitely coming back again. (We had and would recommend the Meat Lovers Set)

Hk8Uw6v1AkiYfcHKcunBhw.text: Awesome service.  I must say this restaurant has the best service of any Korean Restaurant I've been to.  The food is delicious.  Will definitely be back!

-Jd1oFkcwolu0ZVvtUfTCA.text: Waited for over 20 mins and the seat was given to the other group who came after us... The girl at  the cashier was very rude and careless. We were too hungry after the show otherwise we would have left!

3iWTkNFCey758hVo27vt_w.text: I came here on a Friday night with my mom when we were in town. We didn't want to eat buffet two days in a row so we decided to check this place out. It's off the strip btw so you'll need to drive or take taxi/uber/lyft. We got there around 7:30pm and we put our names down. We waited roughly 45 minutes to hour. It didn't seem that packed when we got there but I guess people put their names and came back to walk around. I was getting super hungry and the smell of the food made even hungrier. We got seated in the back room and it was some-what quiet which was nice but the one thing that kind of sucked was that it was hard to get the waiters attention since not many come by so I had to get up and find someone. Anyways, this place is NOT an AYCE but they have set menus that you can pick from and we ordered the Gangam set. For two people, it is a lot of food so it is almost like an AYCE to me. There was tons of meat (kalbi, bulgogi, pork belly, toro and veggies). All meats were very juicy and marinated well so you don't really need to use the sauces that they provide. The sauces all tasted a bit salty to me so I don't recommend the sauces to be honest. Other than, the food was amazing, service wasn't bad and pricing wasn't too bad ($60 for two people). I'll try some other menu next time I'm in town!

eFy-v-zklyX_4atEmqLZFA.text: Great place! The line was long even at night, but it was worth the wait. Food was amazing. My favorites were the pork belly, miso beef, and bibimbap.   Service was prompt and everything was very well-priced for the quality. I would definitely come back!

G857-r8DTIhuW2IONx3q9g.text: I think this is a great find on Yelp.  The place was very inviting and and immediately got serviced. Food menu is different from most of these types of Korean venues.  A little touch of personalization with the menu items.   Definitely worth the price you pay.  Staff sometimes are a little more focused on themselves than the customers BUT are always ready upon request and very accommodating.

g0XcAuTAt6Kgg7JJzHiTQQ.text: This place is sooo good! We got the Las Vegas grill and it was delicious! Andrew was really nice. It was our 1st time here and he cooked for us and told us all about the different dishes. I'd highly recommend this place!

QPLhdUvxp3BDgg0jiZhSWg.text: Really fun place. Lots of food experiences available. We went during happy hour so took advantage of all the deals getting lots of choices then adding the sides they bring to everyone we had more than enough make sure you don't mind cooking as the meat is self prepared at the grill in your table. Fun!

adGtZlHXG8Vs7Lh_BLVYMw.text: This was my first time eating Korean BBQ. The food was delicious and everone was helpful, patient and polite. I would definitely recommend this place to family and friends.

mbbA6ejBOnx3hApArpTiQQ.text: Everything here is so good! We were served by calvin this time but usually our server jin takes care of us. They both were so friendly and cute!

dK7_lkanzRMnHu8swvxf6Q.text: Perfect place for a late night meal after a 5+ hour drive from CA to the Vegas Strip!  The restaurant has a relaxing ambience with efficient service from a very courteous and attentive staff. The tables and grills are spacious, especially for our party of five. The  items we ordered were served quickly and with great pacing. Everything was delicious! And we had the good fortune to see Mr. Carrot Top here :) can't wait to come again!!

fiyC1RKXZNv1giuk1bgorw.text: Came in for lunch we were the first ones there so we we're quickly seated. We both got the lunch set which comes with rice, miso soup and a salad. We chose to do the al la carte option because we weren't too hungry. We got the marinated Kali, bacon wrapped asparagus, the spicy tuna something appetizer and the spicy garlic sauce. We ordered the green tea mango cheese cake with mango ice cream for dessert. The portions we're small but we weren't very hungry and we're full. Our bill was $35. I liked that we had the option to either cook it ourselves on the grill or have the kitchen cook it. Everything was delicious will definitely come here again

KLrIyInUgvncB7kKIycUjA.text: wonderful dining experience. if you like Korean BBQ you will really be impressed by this place. The four of us ordered the Gangnam special for four and it was enough food for 6 people. the meat was fresh and a the marinade delicious. the side salads were very good especially the cucumber and cabage kimchis. bulgogi rice rocked!

ArZcHHmW5GSFW-v1qPLzKg.text: I just finished eating at this Korean restaurant and it was delicious! The moment I walked in it was very clean and eye opening. It is centrally located so it is perfect for anyone looking for a good BBQ place. Even though there were only two servers tonight they did a pretty good job overall. It started to get packed as the evening went on so I knew that this place was good. I tried a lot of things actually: prime kalbi, bulgogi, pork belly, oysters, miso soup, and even dessert. I wish I could have tried everything but I will save that for the next time I will be there. I even have a feeling that the owner/manager was out and about seating customers, smiling, and making people feel comfortable and right at home. To top it off, they have a projector screen on the wall to provide a little entertainment while you are cooking or enjoying your food. My server, Kristin, was very nice, polite, and outgoing. She really took care of me, always asked if everything was okay, and making sure I was never thirsty. How can you get better than that? I would recommend Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining to anyone who wishes to have great food, great service, and very reasonable prices.

Y1f6ZByaLO_sTx-gkxVOHA.text: good place to have a late dinner. fresh food and nice stuff. good to try. the kobe beef is very juicy. the appetizer is a lot. i like the calamari. always seafood go first to me. every kind of beef has its own taste. thats very nice.

For Korean, if you are craving spicy korean food, that will be the only reason you will go to this place.

LQn9wP8CMF4rjVGIDx9ItA.text: first time here and service was extremely poor. I dont know if it was short staffed because only two servers were working the late shift at 11pm. orders were wrong and so was the wait. no refills on water. get the check, no tip.

qc3CvsWLSkh58epweVYVqg.text: great environment and music. service was also good. we ordered a soups and ramen, and they were  good. the ramen i ordered was very korean, just like xin ramen.

Eb0QiXt4zLy37DwINlwAog.text: best Korean BBQ i've ever had  &service here is also great .if you gonna go to restaurant with friends it will be your best choice to make

XYtnfjBpluKAHqHVyTiQgA.text: I love their bulgogi bibimbap and tofu chigae. I have come here for so many times and their service is really good. I also love the other menus they have like their original bibimbap. It's super good. If you want some really good Korean barbecue this is the place!!! Worth every penny.

_D9AwiZ2iaCbilznDJw7RQ.text: We did a la carte because we just like the Korean marinated kalbi and it melts in your mouth! Add the lettuce wraps for only $2 and you check in to get a free macaron!

seNE8WPSt4MKTQhLjv7JKA.text: I recently went here for a birthday dinner. We arrived around 5PM and the restaurant was only maybe 1/3 full.  We decided to order the Gangnam special for 4 people. The meal included salad, raw oysters, shishito peppers, corn, mushrooms, miso soup, several kinds of meat, and bulgogi bibimbop. There was also the standard kimchi and other appetizers you get at almost every Korean restaurant. We were there for Happy Hour so we also got a pitcher of beer for half-off.  Overall, everything tasted fairly standard to me. Nothing really stood out as amazing. I felt the salad lacked much flavor at all and the miso was just standard miso. The bibimbap had no chili paste or veggies and was pre-made when it arrived. It was more like just straight Korea style fried rice with some bulgogi inside.  I guess having been to Korea, nothing ever is quite the same; however, I have had other places that are much better than Gangnam.   My biggest issue with the place was the speed in which they serve you. It was way too fast! Within minutes of ordering you have everything you ordered on the table. We didn't have time to finish a single appetizer before the next thing came out. At one point our table was so full there was literally zero room for anything else. I really felt like they were just trying to rush us out.   I have to say that I don't think I will return here next time I am in Vegas.

pDwAcbVCujfyspUuUP_lOg.text: We really enjoyed ourselves, the quality of the ingredients was super! Fresh, well cut and delivered. This is the cleanest well engineered Korean BBQ You can find, great venting, ands grille that was changed with a clean fresh one bout half way through the meal. Not cheap but you get what you pay for, this IS a great "Splurge" meal.

Sk8cz9e8dihnowMNzjHv4A.text: Ok so this place was AMAZING. We did a preplanned meal (meat lovers) and were blown away!! There's tons of delicious appetizers and the meat. Omg THE MEAT was so so good. Music/atmosphere was nice. Good for a date or with friends. Only reason I didn't give 5 starts is because the service wasn't great. The waiter never properly greeted us and was super short with us whenever he did speak.

gOQyTjZ1FSxs6LZ7LY64iQ.text: It's more like a 3.5 but I'll round it up to a 4.   Their set meals(and they have a few you can pick from) are really awesome. We had 10-11 people and they gave a huge portion that was able to fill us up with only $20-22? each. THe reason why it's more like a 3.5 is because the quality meat is only okay. It really could be better but of course it's still better than your typical AYCE bbq. I actually think the meal went from great to good. Their appetizers( the little small dishes that korean places serve were great and we got soup, bibimbap(which I thought was really good and flavorful). They also had their happy hour from like 9-close? or something like that but i have to say the meat(pork belly + beef toro) weren't great all even though it was the happy hour price.   Regardless, I think for a bbq place like this, they give you a great portion for a good price is the reason why I gave it a 4. It's not the best non-AYCE place but their set meals are nice and worth it.

BrxdwLQC-igVwQfrJK7ymw.text: Wow! I should be eating here once a week! The hubster and I just had a BIG dinner with a large bottle of sake to boot and our bill was only $25.91! Can't be at that! We got there at 5:30pm, so it was HAPPY HOUR. We got corn, broccoli, dumplings, wontons, bulgogi, rice, spicy garlic edamame and all the kimchi sides. It was all good. Was it the best I've ever had? No. But we really enjoyed it anyways. The wontons are all cream cheese and the sweet and sour sauce is watery. That's my only complaint about the food. The service was friendly and quick. Next time we will try a dessert, for sure!  Edited to add: we still love coming here for happy hour, but I was disappointed by the portions tonight. Our macaroni salad was dry and very small. We ordered and paid for two orders of bulgogi and only got one. When we mentioned it, the server said, "our bulgogi portions are small. Hmmm... we have been here at least ten times over the past three years and never got that little. It left a bad taste in my mouth.

OPCAmwsfvOmY0EeVMl-xwA.text: Although Gangnam isn't AYCE like we're used to, it's definitely a good spot for KBBQ.  We've had dinner here twice, and ordered the Meat Lover's with an order of Japchae and Kabocha Tempura.  The cuts of the meat is superb, and we liked that all the meat was seasoned perfectly and quite tasty.  Japchae was solid as was the tempura.  Although it's not AYCE, we left super stuffed and satisfied.  Service was good, they worked as a team, so our glasses and banchan requests we're always attended to.  Wait times vary as our first time, we went on a Thursday at about 7:30pm and waited 30-minutes, and the last time was on a Saturday at 9pm with no wait.  I just wish they had better seating, than the wooden benches they have which are uncomfortable, then again, it's probably on purpose so people wouldn't linger.  #LVKBBQ

Servers were attentive, decor was nice, and the food was solid. Would recommend if you want a change from buffets or hotel restauran while visiting Vegas!
