_Absh3nYSs05n6HFyuqyRA.text: This isn't your usual Korean BBQ place, no all-you-can-eat here.  But the portions are generous, the staff is courteous, and happy hour just makes everything better!  We happened to arrive during their happy hour, and we were greeted promptly.  Clean, classy atmosphere.  The music is a mix of top 40 and big Kpop hits.  Service is prompt and courteous.  Nothing really noteworthy up to this point.  Then the food arrives -- everything was well-seasoned and good quality.  The meat we ordered was never chewy, a welcome change from Tofu Hut.  Their prime kalbi was surprisingly marbled, definitely my top pick of the evening, followed by the green tea/mango cheesecake for dessert.  If you're looking for tapas-style Korean BBQ, Gangnam certainly makes the grade.

vV5JBt8b92-_xYdb2fh4Yw.text: Omg soo amazing!!! All the meats and marinades  are amazing! My fave was the kalbi!! Don't forget to finish your experience with some honey toast and macaroon ice cream! The complimentary small dishes are tasty themselves!!

aPTPryaOFTCMJA_5IDLaAQ.text: Best Korean BBQ in Vegas. Quality is A+. We got the Gangnam platter an it was more than enough food to feed two people. The steam egg is superb! It's a must try. We will definitely come back later on whenever we are in town.

zWxhQggvGhVR4jABPWpiyA.text: Awesome Korean BBQ, loved the spicy chicken. Should have all you can eat option. The desserts are also good.

Bg0CXp9BiK27mVuz4c-0nQ.text: One of the best Korean BBQ I've ever had! We came with a party of 7 and got seated immediately. We ordered the meat lovers combo, Korean prime kalbi, original bibimbap, and the spicy soft tofu chigae. Everything tasted really good! My favorite was the bibimbap.  To top it off, Calvin, our waiter was amazing! He was really attentive, efficient, and nice.   Overall an excellent experience :) can't wait to be back!

Ra0CH_uInOMMjhKxlW9Rhg.text: Came here entirely because of the quantity and quality of the Yelp reviews. Turns out they offer free ice cream dessert if you write a review while at the place. That not withstanding, this Korean BBQ joint is great for lunch: one meat, rice, salad or soup, one side (dumplings, edamame), and a load of toppings and sauces for $9.95. You cook the meat yourself at the table. Overall, lunch was really good, and the high rating is real. We ended up getting desert, but not the one offered free for this review.

PJfZ1WFQ4yus7O2zW4kveg.text: Very horrible service. We want add something, call waiter about three times. I'm allergic to onion. Order told him "we every food no onions" but still had Onions inside, The waiter like didn't hear.   We come here for the first time a good time. We order the combo, it's a good deal. This is the second time come here to eat with friends. The same order, of all the food are reduced. The service also very poor. Two waiters in flirting and chating, didn't listen to the guest's calling. Empty plate on the table and no one clean. I never come again.

V6TGJDM2ufnToLMRjjdiwQ.text: Came here for happy hour. Prices were pretty good. Try the beef kalbi, so tender. The service was great. Will definitely come back.

qJeD35xpcHmPMwyvb5vzew.text: The kobe beef is awesome!!!   I came here alone at 4 so I sat at the bar. All my items were cooked for me which was great! I didn't have to worry about charring my meat.   I got the Kobe beef, spicy garlic short rib, bulgogi, and the beef toro. I pretty much liked everything except for the highly recommended beef toro. It was extremely dry. I'd probably opt for the brisket instead.   Anyways I had a pretty good experience. The male server was extremely attractive and all the servers kept checking on me to see if everything was okay.

QQtDl2muQdOYWOmFZTPvkA.text: Picked the perfect time to visit before the dinner rush...no line on a Saturday night. Panchan was more than enough to keep us fed before the food came out. Food was delicious! Can't wait to eat their macaron ice cream and honey bread!

S3rk5yLcEkPQ1Td1flIkgg.text: So many reviews it has to be good!  We arrived super early at opening and just ordered.  Can't wait.  Brought two people who are new to this style of food/restaurant.  Will update later!

LbVuWJb2aTtTYgDZMh_byQ.text: I had never had Korean BBQ before, and was in Vegas for a conference, so when a co-worker suggested it, I jumped at the chance. Gangnam did not disappoint. The decor was lovely; dark (and blessedly cool!) and nicely appointed. Seats were very comfortable. I had never seen the bbq trays on the table before.  Fortunately, my co-worker knew what to order, and she made some recommendations that were just fantastic. I had bulgogi (pork) with a mushroom medley that was absolutely delicious. The portions were very generous, too. It was fun cooking the food on the little bbqs. Service was a bit slow, but the poor waitress was having problems with their cash register; she apologized and explained what the issue was, so we were forgiving of the situation. The lunch special was very reasonable, considering the amount of food we received and the quality of it. We were extremely happy campers when we left and went back to the conference. I told myself that next time I go to Vegas, I will *definitely* be back to eat here.  BUT.... the REAL gem of this experience occurred two weeks later, when I got back to work and submitted my receipts. I had misplaced the credit card receipt (still had the itemized one) and my work was on my back bugging me for the credit card receipt. I contacted the restaurant with my pathetic request and the gentleman who answered the phone was very understanding, and sent me a reprint that satisfied the dragons in Accounting. So... GREAT food, outstanding portions, good value for the money - and EXCEPTIONAL customer service. Gangnam, I hope you open a restaurant in Ventura, California someday!! I will definitely be back to visit!!

nZyWNBCJ87loeFgVfOhXxw.text: Seated with all the Banchan (side dishes) setup nice and orderly around the grill. They have a tapas style menu and a combo menu for larger parties with a variety of foods. We stuck to the basics pork belly and marinated beef short rib. Everything was delicious and the different dipping sauces added the perfect twist. Great service and cute waitresses. Definitely would recommend.

U41FD_8A4Ftx2r0HpNP0bQ.text: Food is FRESH, great service and the cost is very affordable. They have a great selection of items to choose from. We have 3 kids and as you know, kids can be picky eaters. Because they have such a good variety there is something for everyone....even the most picky eaters. All and all, I highly recommend this Dining establishment. Dave Sac CA

Tm6guBKRcUIjrW153H34Aw.text: Great food, atmosphere, variety, customer service. Reasonable prices for filling portions  (we ordered 5 meat dishes for 2 ppl & one white rice each. Filling!). Cant ask for much more

I did enjoy the food and the fact that this was not AYCE. This definitely was above the norm KBBQ if the service was only better.

AzFMz3Q-ZQvLJbkiXYsYug.text: Suddenly craving for Korean BBQ in Vegas, what should you do? You Yelp! Found this restaurant on Yelp and immediately decided to pay it a visit. I went on a Saturday lunch time, I expected there would be a line but the restaurant was pretty much empty.  I got the Gangnam set. It included soup, appetizers, salad, rice, and meat. The best part is it costs only 59.95! I especially love their fresh oyster, Korean Prime Kalbi, and Bulgogi Bibimbap. That Bibimbap was a bomb, it's the best I've ever had. I can now understand why this set is their number one best seller. It's a killer! I was so full that even breathing hurt my belly. Gonna enjoy my food coma now, see ya.

5WbETeF7K1--6iI6aSrMDA.text: Quiet simple, the best Korean BBQ in Vegas. Very popular place with great food so always a little bit of a wait but kind people, good service and good food.

9DKAIEZbwJ5MyYpIJGY7EQ.text: the food was so delicious... our servers was cute and really nice.... I been going to all you can eat restaurant and you can taste the different with their meats... I will be back soon

3D-EXNON6KN-_dDc8hP5LA.text: The marinated meat has got to be one of the best Korean BBQ meats I've ever tried (and coming from the bay area, I've tried a LOT). The bibimbap was amazing as well - I'd recommend getting that instead of two white rice if you're going for the Gangnam bbq set. The macaron was really delicious too! Would def come back if I lived here (unfortunately it's an 8 hour drive for me)

tlOZvJBlRpgaEbQ7ysTtUg.text: Wasn't sure how to start but our waitress explained everything and it was all really good. Service was poor. Waitress took our order and never came back. No refills, no check on us, we had to flag anyone down that we could.  Read the reviews, don't go by quantity..  They offer a free dessert for a Yelp review. I got mine for this one.

0yz10TSWqnOEKmqYtzJS2g.text: This place always has good food, and it's a classier place to eat if you're going to be near UNLV. They don't have an AYCE option, but everything is reasonably priced. At a table with four of us in total, we ordered the following:  Steamed chili dumplings Peach saketini Fried meat dumplings Miso soup         Fried calamari w/spicy sauce Fresh oysters Prime kalbi (short rib without bone) Beef Toro (brisket)  Kobe style beef Salmon Basil Green tea cheesecake  You can also either choose to grill the food yourself or ask your server to have it cooked before bringing it to your table.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uj-uTjYkBNd4ypKWKvE3CA.text: A must visit when you're in Vegas. We got the gangnam style platter, their cheese corn and spicy Kim bop. Everything is delicious and the meat and seafood were of the highest quality. The raw oysters didn't have the seafood after taste at all and went down smooth. The appetizers came out quickly and they keep giving you more if you ask for it.  Service was excellent. The staff is attentive and friendly.   Ambiance is chill. It's like most of the other Korean restaurants I've been to with kpop music in the background and they're willing to turn on sports for you if you request it. Overall a satisfying meal and experience.

4em1QM09AeTMM7yqVguEow.text: One of the best Korean BBQ restaurants I've been too. The servers were all really friendly and accommodating. Such a great atmosphere With friends and family. The food was delicious and the price is is just right.

nEFljc2aI7dUGg76vRnFeg.text: Woohoo, I never knew there was a Korean BBQ place this close to UNLV.   The interior is quite authentic with its red walls and wooden window frames. There are both booths and regular tables that fit up to 6 people. The tables are a little wide for my taste, since it puts a big distance between customers sitting across from each other, but over all, it is a comfortable setting.   My friend and I came in during happy hour. We ordered $16 worth of food, which was more than enough for us. The meat was top-notch quality, and I actually liked all of the the sauces they have here. The side dishes were plentiful. As always, I loved the fish cake.   The service was fast, attentive, and efficient. I will definitely be back here for Korean BBQ, even though they are not all-you-can-eat.

dQUVnhyhY34nKwI6GYgLOw.text: Best Korean BBQ in LV. The Kobe beef was so good. My kids loved it. We had a coupon for a free ice cream macaroon and the staff gave us 2, so my kids would not fight over it.   Great place for family dinner or a romantic date. Come early, the wait gets a little long during dinner time.

ly9Th5ns70ryuV8xEI_vDA.text: They served us a bunch of sides once we were seated. They tasted were delicious esp. the Fish Cake. We went there in a large party, so we ordered a lot of entrees. I would say they were all good.  But the best part was the desserts. The Ice Cream Macaroon was really yummy.  I would really recommend this restaurant for the location and the price.

0Oypqr0tyN6H_z32z3LhFQ.text: One of my favorite places for korean BBQ in Vegas. The best friendly workers there with great customer service and the food is AMAZING. Price is fair not too expensive. Also I would recommend getting the macaroons they're the best to end dinner with.

bdoPTxc61R3Mbf1airL8MA.text: Please take a break from the franchises on the Vegas strip and take a trip to Gangnam and enjoy the Gangnam platter or the meat lover platter. The food is exquisite and the service is phenomenal. Highly recommended and will come again.

Ldv_9GYIRzmcY4agYxiyGw.text: The food is awesome and the experience is just as good. The service is amazing.  We chose the Gangnam for 2 and it could have easily fed 3.  You will definitely not be disappointed.

2D3BpUwEelvVFDn2PKBCcQ.text: Great Korean BBQ but we had to wait 2 hours. We arrived at 7 pm on a Tuesday and weren't seated until 9 pm.

oD9mEXzUpV0zMCNXxeqQWw.text: Checked in on a Saturday, June 16, 2018.  Ordered a set by recommendation of staff.   The premium had something for everyone in our party of 20 to enjoy.   We enjoyed each and every dish, plus sides.  Went during early happy hour.   Men drank by the pitchers.   Wine, sake, soju for women.

M-lDdNxQ6F_rFLf74tu83A.text: This place was amazing! Everytime I come to Vegas this will be my first stop. Excellent customer service.

DYkEBBOCJKxwURKHKHlPtw.text: We saw this place and yelp and wanted to give it a try seeing all the great reviews!  We ordered the Gangnam special for 2 people but easily can feed four.  It came with calamari, fresh oysters, bibimbop, salad, miso. Kalbi, pork belly, and a bunch of other dishes I forgot.   Everything was perfectly seasoned and well executed I would definitely recommend and come back again!

szBzqjAt3YXgSuZlvDK4Mw.text: food is great, but the server that was assigned to us was not very attentive and was not very well informed with the food. We asked him if they have gobchang and he just shrug his shoulder. We asked him how come are side dishes are taking a while he said they are still making them. I ask another server and he had it for us right that moment and he apologize for forgetting to serve it to us, maybe he was new. Other than that, I recommend this place because of the quality of food there is great. I just wish they offer the AYCE there.

I0pCDMEd8zRVmznm9fcyTQ.text: I liked it very much. I like the service as well as the food! the waiters served food very quickly. they quickly cleaned the dirty dishes.

ScRahxECLiBXCD7sFd1BTw.text: This place is just ok.. I can't say it was the best korean bbq that I've eaten. I'm surprised that it got such great reviews since it's not that great. The rice wasn't the same as most korean place it tasted like they mixed other rice in it. The service was great and the ice cream was awesome but beside that it was just ok.

j2Hurtb25eR24cZZJhXDsQ.text: Simply the best Korean bbq in Vegas! You have many choices for banchan (side dishes). Many assortment of meats and a fish choice which is salmon.   Appetizers are plenty, from dumplings to tempura.  You need soup, there is 6 different choices.  Soup not your thing, maybe you can try some bibimbap , so good.  Don't know what to eat, they offer you meal sets for two, four different choices.  Prices are fair and you better come hungry.  Oh, and don't eat too much banchan, do you can reserve your tummy for the good stuff.  Also, they have free wifi. It's kid friendly.  Great staff Fair price  Clean establishment  Air conditioned Great happy hour menu  Overall,  the best Asian meal that I've had in Vegas..

n6bWIn1tEsBYNbG_4uroIg.text: Brought here as a treat for our team holiday and I am already planning multiple repeat trips

yc419EJYFmq39fQfIX7F8g.text: Yummy all I can say! The meat were excellent with a free ice cream too .. will definitely come back again

N2j7UaGvGsuY8OQzQvPqXw.text: This place is probably the best Korean place i have been to. The service is very good, everything got there very fast, and all the food we had to cook was very well marinated and seasoned. Would come here every week if I could! Definitely recommend it!

QWc4Wjw07JMfC4Q7sh3Paw.text: Everything about this place is amazing; food, service & macaroons! Definitely recommend. Sadly not from the area otherwise would be here weekly

9d05NXA0lOj2orZjYIIsJA.text: I love this place! It gets a little pricey if you have a big appetite, but everything was very flavorful and delicious. We weren't sure what to order, so we chose the best sellers or ones that were recommended. My favorite was the chicken with lemon sauce, and either the #1 or #2...can't remember which one was which anymore :(. The salmon carpaccio was really good too! It's pretty much salmon sashimi with ponzu sauce. We also liked the japchae...very flavorful and full of assorted veggies.   The filet mignon was tough and chewy so we didn't' enjoy it as much. The spicy tuna kimbap was okay...there was too much rice for me. I didn't realize it's just spicy tuna over deep fried rice. We also ordered the yuzu soju, but it tasted watered down. I was kind of skeptical because the menu shows that its yellow...but the one we got was clear (like the lemon soju)  I would definitely come again if I was in Vegas. Our hotel was on the strip, so the cab ride was only about 15 minutes...I think it cost around $13-16.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5CFSioYtLPP4Cq7AKORq5Q.text: If you're in Vegas and you're looking for KBBQ, you ABSOLUTELY MUST come eat here! This is the best KBBQ I've ever eaten. Literally everything was really, really good.   We ordered the Gangnam to split between 4, and subbed the miso soup for the kimchi chigae for no extra charge. It was enough food to provide us another meal. I really appreciated that the meats were fresh, had their own flavor, and were not overly salty. Food highlights/must haves: kimchi and bibimbap.   Staff here are super nice and accommodating!

1kQ5ivSdpRnHwNaXjfnjjw.text: The seasoning on their meats was so good. Service was fast and their portions were good. You pay for the plates of meat per person. On down side was that their sides were a bit on the skimpy side. Service was a bit slow, but we did go during a busy time. They have macaroon ice cream!!

FAaVxJaJM3rA8m08LrQmfw.text: Okay. So this place is pretty awesome !  You order what you want to eat , and pay only for that. The best thing is that it's not AYCE & whatever is left overs you can take home.  The Korean prime Kalbi is so good! A must try.  We also likes enoki with  bacon!  Our waitress was also very sweet, she even charged my phone for me.   The sauces , you get three. And they all were great!   Despite the menu saying you have to pay for the salt sauce, it's complimentary.   Ill update more once this food coma passes!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LqKA_x-J4Mvg-3iDbh15jg.text: Really neat concept, you purchase the seasoned meats and veggies and cook them yourself on the grill, but it's so much fun with friends and family.

bHvLtClgaC5Zb4UfEw80Pw.text: The food was great and I love the concept of cooking the meats on a small grill at the table, but I have never been as cold in a restaurant as I was tonight. I don't know if it's the elaborate ventilation above every grill, but this place is DRAFTY.

gy8mSXzI5vdDVOH-V61Xbg.text: Went here on a family trip to Vegas. We all enjoyed the meal. Fresh ingredients and friendly staff. Definitely recommend.

TnvUievIHlMn2-skAzafAw.text: Great food great service great selection.. Will definitely come back.   Gets very busy make sure to call in advance for wait time

WgemGUODcRfCD_sr8LC5Eg.text: Good happy hour. We got the nice big table in the back but needed to be out by a certain time. Service was good but one of our party members got his cashmere sweater burnt by one is the guys bringing out one of the hot grills. They gave free Mochi dessert for apologies.

iBpmizs0jQ77f_OUkZdA9Q.text: Cool spot to hit up when you're feenin' for some asian BBQ. Trendy and inviting local restaurant in a strip mall. Beware of parking as it always seems jam packed.   The food was reasonably priced. We got the gangnam special for $65 for two people. Well worth the money if you're going to eat everything. I do mean everything. Otherwise I would have ordered a la carte. All the meat was seasoned and marinated very well that you didn't really need the additional bbq sauce that they offered. We also ordered the steamed chili dumplings..... Don't get those. It's a big dose of spicy sauce with otherwise bland flavors.   We'd definitely come back only if we felt like splurging. After dessert, drinks and taxes, $90+ is a bit more than we'd like for a quick casual meal.

PxTDOGi8sGoqkLIc5_9c4w.text: Great cuts of meat, clean, great ambience and music, service is pretty quick once you order they pretty much bring everything out fairly quickly. Definitely go with the Korean Prime Kalbi! I wish they had japchae as part of the appetizers. GRILLED PEPPERS WERE THE BEST!!!! Also do yourself a favor and order a Lychee Calpico Soda, it's the nectar of the gods....or at least the Korean ...pagan gods. The service could be attentive though. Had to wait until the end of the meal to get my first water refill and it wasn't even busy. Come here for the food not the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The calm before the storm
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled peppers
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macaron ice cream

GaGGB0UH5dyfU3e4tq9LbQ.text: Some of the meat is pretty good, such as the prime kalbi.  Other meat quality is inconsistent throughout a single plate, especially the pork belly.  Side dishes aren't that impressive.  The corn is bad.  The steamed egg isn't good.  Food wise probably 2-3 stars.  What is horrible is the service and attitude of the servers.  We came for lunch and weren't given lunch special menus.  When I asked for the menu, the attitude started.  We didn't end up ordering the lunch special, but not one smile or happy service for the entire meal.  Each request was met with a grumpy grunt.  They don't refill side dishes without being asked like good korean restaurant experiences.  They don't see a utensil falling to the ground in front of their face and move to address it.  They don't move out of the way when you are trying to walk down the aisle to the restroom.  Terrible service will ruin decent food everytime.

EXRk7zJ47d6HJevcrOdQQQ.text: Just ate here for the first time and the food was pretty good! The portion size is fair, and the dinner for 2 is good enough for 3 people. The quality of meat was great, and once you order the food comes out instantly! Overall a pretty good experience (:

HVfgFCJTLrub7RSRFPLjLQ.text: Food was great and with decent quality. We ordered premium set for four and we almost can't finish it. We also order beef tongue and I have to say it's the BEST beef tongue I've ever have!!!

uTgYExxG9tcJaNBtxkzM_g.text: Spicy tuna bimbap is a must.  Kalbi is excellent.  Meat was tender and the flavors are all good.

WluQ3cW8j8xSbfDFIEQG0g.text: This place seems nice, very dimly lit but flattering light, You get to choose ur own meats to cook at the table, and servers are friendly. Kind of expensive for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plenty of seating!

gluSZgkDz8Hb61TTz36-Dg.text: As far as Korean bbq places, this is probably not the best place. Meat is lacking in flavor and is pricey unless you come during happy hour. Better off going to AYCE at Tofu Hut and deal with the wait. It's also always strange to me when they don't give rice at start and you have to request it as extra.

3GLQ1WxYFZGNfWVikWyfWg.text: Good service! Very attentive servers! Good quality cuts of meat.. definitely will come again when in Vegas !

-g9KDS9ocv3bhFk0zUZ04A.text: It was a nice experience for the time of night and money spent. There we a few happy hour food specials that were pretty good. Check it out.

7MXh_Z3hXpKvKTAfVN6Upw.text: Gangnam BBQ rocks and definitely lives up to the reviews posted. We have tried many high end restaurants while here in Vegas over the years and have found most are expensive, over rated and at times , leaving still hungry. This place is a gem. Due to reading about the waiting time being long in the early hours ( 6pm to 9pm ) , we waited to 10:30pm to show up and just walked in and were seated. What was even better was that it was reverse happy hour and the already great prices were even cheaper for food and drinks. As in most posts, found that the service was excellent and prompt. They have the team effort approach so the whole staff was either bring or picking up something regularly. The food was the bomb! Fresh and tasty. The flat iron garlic and bulgogi was great. We ordered the meat lovers combo and it was quite the spread for 2 people and you won't leave hungry. Also great place to go if you want to talk with your date, significant other and family and not have everyone on their phones looking at the internet constantly because their cooking , chatting and having fun!!!

u38wozRokOsxubBhwHCvKg.text: Amazing! Delicious! Meat lovers is the best. Macaroons, um yes!! Service was great. Will definitely return and try again

cZLNYtRIaGRN_RmKX_mDWQ.text: Great food food at a reasonable price. A good find not to far off the strip.

kly34ObOPZJwZYDj4MSPAg.text: Great design and menu. The only negative point is sweetness of the meats, they r mostly marinated in sweet marina sauce. Too much sweetness!

IDTFyOrdiH2nSvcyIC-BjA.text: Place was great. Good portions. Service was excellent. Our server was Jennifer and she was fantastic. She was friendly and bery attentive. Im from LA, and this place is far better than the LA location.

Kgv_UY9Bp0xYSzEQl2DFXg.text: Our new favorite place to eat in Vegas!  Great food, great service, great prices, good ambiance! What more can you ask for! Definitely coming back again.

5E1inA2S6fLGJG-k5J7y0A.text: First time at KBBQ in years but I loved this experience. We got the meat lovers for 4 even though there was 5 of us. It was enough food and the other 4 were all men. I loved the filet mignon! I also ordered the chili chicken and it comes with a side of lemon juice that you can use on the other meat.

lrvcw1PGIgFVaGxR45D7iA.text: Love lunch specials there! Good food and always enjoyed free macaron ice creams from yelp check in.

PemzFLPfJa6e2v01reWu0w.text: Food is great. Meats are fresh and service is good.  The only reason I give 4 start is because the wait time is over an hour.

61Z2SIslNMxWpAwRKF2Nsg.text: Good spicy pork. I ordered three of them at once, never regret. The staffs were very nice. They kindly answered and suggested about the dishes. I will be back if i have a chance to travel there again.

v-6rjPMytawQWpO58eqYlw.text: Nice Korean BBQ restaurant. Great value and service. Would go back next time when I'm in town. :)

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Da1GISWh-okuSKtfpdSRfg.text: This place reminds me of Gyu-kaku with the variety of appetizers they offer along with the different types of meat and seafood that you can order; even the layout of the menu is strikingly similar to Gyu. In terms of food, however, Gangnam is more Korean influenced, and the meat quality here is far better than Gyu's. They also provide banchan here, and the kimchi was really good! Kimchi Gangnam style!!   My buddy and I ordered pork off the lunch set menu (looked like pork shoulder), and it was really chewy for me at first (even though it was fully cooked). But I started to enjoy the texture the more and more I ate it. It was better than the actual pork belly in my opinion. The beef toro was pretty good, and its cuts were thick.   We also tried the chicken wings, steamed dumplings, and the spicy tuna kimbap. The chicken wings were tasty and flavorful. There was too much going on in the spicy tuna kimbap, and it was too sauce heavy. The steamed dumplings were just not very good, and even my buddy said that they tasted like packaged ones.   Not sure if this place is worthy of their 4.5 star rating. I wasn't impressed by anything, but maybe I'll give it another shot if I'm in the area.

_WFnicmmcAjbEj05cWWG6Q.text: A party of six all really enjoyed Gangnam.  We even had  a few first timers to this type of dining and they both thoroughly immersed themselves.  The condiments sauces where on point.  I like a variety of dipping sauces to change up the meal and I was really surprised how good they where (we had five different ones.)  The meats where perfect and plentiful.  While nothing really stood out above the rest, they all were consistently good.  We ordered the meat lover combo and we were not disappointed.    We were lucky to get the room in the back to ourselves which made it a very enjoyable experience with the loud personalities that were in attendance  I will be back!

_TWiHU-zOl5xQLG4oyHvuQ.text: Loved this place.  We did have to wait to get in on a Saturday night, but it was well worth it.  We ate so much food and it wasn't too pricey.  It was definitely a good value.

CKqk3IAGUJqXTjmpNQlM3A.text: So good, I do Korean bbq a bunch and this was a nice change in flavors. The veggie options were great too, get green onions the butter garlic. Wasn't a big fan of cheese and chicken at first but when in Rome.

c8AEKPWIMb5_3gkAvFOz8w.text: Awesome service and food! Always a favorite stop when we visit Vegas. Ordered the premium special. Great variety and the oysters tasted fresh.

6r3MPjSz1Kt7dSOOUo7GiQ.text: This place is simply amazing. We make it a point to stop by every time we'rein Vegas. You can tell all the meats are top quality and the slices are generous,not paper thin like other places. In addition, meats are well marinated and extremely flavorful. I've been in numerous korean barbecue and by far this one ranks at the top. I should add that the vibes of this place has always been warm and welcoming. And the customer service has always been super. I especially want to point out Alex. He goes above and beyond the call of duty and he's also a comedian at heart. Keep up the great work Alex. If you're ever in the area, I highly recommend stopping by. You won't be disappointed.

ty8xJsHji16EDZ6MWngPSQ.text: My spot! Korean prime Kalbi for the win! Open pretty late which I love. I eat here all the time before work. Got a free macaroon ice cream by checking in on yelp tonight too. Holla!

FQMgFa4Evr5LoKLSXpd1kQ.text: Alex and Dylan were amazing servers providing the best customer service possible. They gave us always the most prompt attention.

pt8A83Z5765O8CNnZbiBZg.text: You really can't beat the awesome deal this place has on meat dishes like the spicy chicken or spicy chicken with all the sides for just $3.25 total for their 2 happy hours (mid afternoon and late night) daily!  Always delicious and never fails to satisfy my appetite each time I visit Vegas.  HIGHLY recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y9i_kyunKvbuhvX0u6E7CA.text: A Korean BBQ that's not all you can eat but the quality of the meat, service, and other food items was exceptional. Big area and benches fits up to 6.  Pleasantly surprised by the customer service. Not alot of employee but somehow very attentive with every table. Since there was a wide variety of choices on the menu, the waiter was really informative of the sauces and questions we had about the menu.  Along with good service, the food quality was pretty good. The side dishes included fish cake, macaroni salad, red sauced squid, kimchi, bean sprouts, and pickled cucumber. Pretty standard.   For a party of 5, we ordered: -chicken salad: random but good, comes with a honey mustard dressing -tempura udon: standard -house salad:  -kimchi chigae As for meats -Korean prime kalbi -premium tounge -bulgogi  Overall will be back next time im in town- perfect for family gatherings and a place to relax. I recommend the meats.

-_-40xtfEJ1HrvKRcR2A1A.text: My goodness, this is the best Korean BBQ restaurant I've ever been!  We happened to drop in during happy hour (3-6 pm) on Saturday.  We ordered 4 happy hour menus, Fried calamari ($4), Chicken Karage($4), Spicy Chicken BBQ with Lemon Source($3), Korean Chicken BBQ Cheese Fondue($3) and Filet Mignon ($8.5) and Sukiyaki, all delicious! Every menu was much bigger portion than we expected, plus endless refillable free 8 side dishes come with meal!  We were sooooo stuffed.  They give you 3 kinds of dipping sauce for the meat besides lemon sauce and cheese we ordered, all tasted excellent. Beer was a half price during happy hour. For all the above tasty meal plus beer, the total was only $37 including tax. Unbelievable!!! We'll come back again! 1-2!3-637

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ

sI6oEMYQDuRxNkF9P6tnzg.text: We went back again for the happy hour and wondered why we don't come more often. Half price beer and hot saki.. of course. The service was fantastic and we had interactions with multiple employees through the meal. This time we ordered apps from happy hour including the edamame and jalapeno poppers. So good and such a value!  On the grill we bbq'd the ribeye with Their own sweet Korean sauce first (on happy hour)!  That toasted the grill up with some flavor before adding filet, duck, scallops, and bacon wrapped Udon mushrooms. Everything caramelized and cooked perfectly. All we added was some garlic butter which toasted nicely on the grill in very thin slices. Topped the night off with a macaroon to share. Strawberry was very good. Such a great value and experience!!

E4HKQ1_sUR1xfHEH4l-YvA.text: It was our last night in las vegas and we decided to go to gangnam for dinner. There was about 45 to 50-minute wait but i can tell you it's really worth it. I recommend this place if you love asian bbq!

A1_3d2oP25wGqBJ63XxKFQ.text: Here for work and decided on Korean food. Best decision...the meat is favorable, side are fresh and delicious, price was reasonable and service was excellent. Definitely will come back if ever in Vegas.

1T1qqpNDsppIw4ptCkBoPA.text: This place is so close to where I live so I was very excited to check it out with all the good reviews. Came here for their nightly happy hour after 10pm. Ordered cream cheese wonton, mushroom medly, jalapeno poppers, calamari, pork belly, beef toro, spicy pork and Korean chicken cheese fondue.  Cream cheese wonton: All it was is wonton wrapper with literally only cream cheese inside, fried and served with sweet sauce. Pretty bland and disappointing. 1/5  Mushroom medly: Just different types of mushrooms that was mixed with melted butter. 2/5  Jalapeno poppers: Pop of deliciousness! Jalapeno sliced in half stuffed with cream cheese and crab and deep friend drizzle with sweet dressing. 5/5  Calamari: Crispy calamari with the spicy mayo dip sauce, average. 3/5  Pork belly: So good, you can never go wrong with pork belly. Slapped this on the grill and once crispy on both sides... With rice it's amazing. 5/5  Beef toro: Basically brisket... My friend enjoyed this very much. 4/5  Spicy pork: Meh 2/5  Chicken cheese fondue: Grilled the chicken and cheese however once dipped into cheese it was way chunky and not good. Aye the chicken alone. 1/5  Overall the food was ok, but I prefer Korean BBQ at tofu hut. The dipping sauces don't really stand out to me, one was sweet and one  is spicy... But I still love my sesame dipping sauce at tofu hut. The quality of meat is better but as far as the taste, tofu hut is way better. I didn't know during happy hour they don't give you rice? I had to ask for rice for both of us, but my server only came back with one bowl of rice... So we split the rice.   Overall, this place is good... My first time trying Japanese BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0xCY8mD4FTuG0SlppH6giA.text: Best place for families and best place for happy hour!!!!! Iv been to 2 or 3 other places and nothing beats the price !!!! Or the quality of

1v9Jw-DEszjTZPz5XKxuPQ.text: it has been way past overdue for this post. this place is awesome. foods are fabulous. it's not ayce, but you can eat just enough and not having to feel heavy afterwards. one of places I'll come back to eat and this place never fails me or my family or friends. nice and clean ambient place. you grill your own section of meats and/or other otions. price are reasonable.   good foods & drinks here.

m9oa-JOFgl8wgSAeTsDmZg.text: Wow!  Being accustomed to the LA scene, I was very impressed with the Korean food here at Gangnam.  Unlike most of the customers, I am reviewing the items NOT from the set menu.    I had the Uni Sukiyaki, which was scrumptiously creamy!  They mix the uni and the udon noodles in front of you in a hot stone pot.  It is a must try!  I also had the beef tongue with green onion, which was super yummy with raw garlic!  I am not too sure about how this dish is different than the premium beef tongue, but I think it is a slightly smaller portion.  There are a few different sauces that you could use for dipping, which was placed in front of me: bean flavored, oil and salt, soy, etc.  There was also the typical banchan: kimchee, cucumber, bean sprouts, macaroni smothered in mayonnaise, raddish.   At least, this was all I could remember.  The wine menu was your typical red, whites, roses, sparkling, etc. Finally, the free macaroon offered on the Yelp check in was just delicious!  Flavors included green tea, mango, strawberry, and a few others.    Ambience was modern and non-pretentious.  Servers are very nice.  I sat at the bar, where there was a huge screen TV in front of me.  Overall, I was very happy I chose to come here.  Yelpers were very accurate in rating this one.  Thank you for a great dining experience!

FLVzHgmPhjBBT-5J_oPI9g.text: This place was a perfect birthday spot! Great food, lots of fun and laughs. I only gave 4 stars because we weren't sure of what a lot of the "sides" were and they mostly went to waste. We did attempt to taste each one, though. It was a lot of fun sipping on our drinks while grilling!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Gangnam meal
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Gangnam meal
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach Soju

csEXAPxVFLql4IBIdMRgFg.text: Came here with my boyfriend and his brother. WThis Korean BBQ Restaurant is Al La Carte,  NOT AYCE. You order plates of meat, each with their own cost (some can be very pricey, while others are more reasonable). You can also order cheese corn, tofu soup, and other dishes. We thought about ordering a combo package that comes with different appetizers and certain meats.  We decided not to and instead ordered meats that we wanted and a pitcher of beer. The quality of meat was amazing! I was not disappointed with any selection. I think it came out to about $20.00 per person which is quite reasonable. We were completely satisfied with our meal which is super nice compared to going to an AYCE place and you feel like you just might explode. We loved the spicy pork, brisket, bulgogi, and the galbi. Which basically means we loved all of it. If you want to splurge, then you can order premium meats too, but personally am so satisfied with the basic meats which are more than enough. The dipping sauces are really good too, but I have no idea what I'm eating. I also really like the soybean paste which is a bit salty and barely spicy. It costs extra for some lettuce leaves, but it serves as a really good balance to your meat.  If it's your first time, try this:  1. Rip a piece of lettuce off (about 1/3) 2. Take some soy bean paste and put it on your lettuce 3. Dip your brisket (or other meat) into the different sauces 4. Place the meat in your lettuce and wrap it (like a taco) 5. AND ENJOY!  The marinated meats are better by themselves or with rice. My boyfriend always gets rice, so I just stole a small amount of his. Some of the free side dishes were really good! I liked adding some kimchi to my "mini tacos" too. Also, IF YOU CHECK IN, YOU GET A FREE MACAROON ICE CREAM SANDWICH. :) Yay Yelp!

oydJMi0qY3uwvSOBOfLsMA.text: This place is not cheap but they use high quality meat and you get LOTS of food and I mean LOTS. Expect a long wait if you come during dining hours. Their 6 person set dinner can easily feed 8 adults.  The staff here are very friendly and even though it's a fast pace environment yet staff remain professional and very accommodating.   Their Soju was very good too, so good that almost all the adult in our group had one.  Their meat quality is top notch and you get large portions. Oysters were fresh along with their seafood. Their filet cubes was one of the best I've had. If anything the only one that we didn't like was the marinated meat. it wasn't anything spectacular but nonetheless it was still good. The salad was very refreshing and put a good balance with the meat.   If you come here, go for the set dinner and order less than you need. If you have six order the 4 person set dinner and get a few appetizers.   Make sure you check in on Yelp as they will give you a free macaroon ice cream sandwich on your way out!

AxLdgUPma-xnD7Ho7Aj6vA.text: This place is good, but not great. First the pros are: it's fast, delicious, has plenty of options, and the dining specials can be substituted. Also, if you check in to yelp, they give you a delicious macaron ice-cream for free! The cons are: it's a bit dirty, noise levels are high, and they don't help you grill the meat or replace the grill when it's all blackened. Overall it's a good value for money, but I'm sure there are better places out there. Would go back, but won't be a "go-to."

tTf4jH0dpCST5Lo2Y9hktw.text: Not only the food quality is great, the service is top notch! I was blown away how much food we got for what we paid. Definitely a must try place!!

fGe5AQ-JA5x4qMuzmHnH_w.text: Good food, superb service from the staff! I surely will recommend this place to everyone!

94Tqz6olqGhz5Ci7lTdnuw.text: So this place was the culinary highlight for us at our last trip! So first of all: we have never been to a korean BBQ Place! So the concept was new for us! We had the meat-lovers plate and it was veeery much food! Everything was delecious including the sides that were brought immediately to our table after we ordered!  The best thing was their bulgogi - i enjoyed that very much! Also the korean beer was tasty and ice-cold!

3zI-ZGDMnA4aM02v3cjzEQ.text: Incredible. I can't adequately express my admiration for the 5 star service, high quality ingredients with choice cuts of beef, clean dining space, and impeccable atmosphere. Unseo is a rockstar: he is the most attentive (without being intrusive), efficient, and genuinely friendly server I have ever encountered - his service made dining at Gangnam feel like eating at a favorite relatives house. Honorable mention to Andrew for always being there to clear used dishes. I wish I could elaborate further but me and my wife split the premium meal, which contained 10+ courses with items such as sea scallop, Kobe beef, fresh oysters, rich miso, and shrimp rice (not to mention the unlimited banchan), and I am closing in on food coma territory.

Vn9lVwfJ02phfP0tC0LEIg.text: I visit Vegas twice a year for business and Gangnam is a ritual at this point. Very easy to over eat and get the satisfaction of being a gluttonous animal.

KP6BtYK8Mp1IyCvaxoTxhw.text: Not sure how the food taste yet, (ordered to go)but customer service is awesome! The young man Andrew!Is very polite and delightful.

CfvQAdYadTxG-E-96HLI0w.text: We love coming here especially during happy hour. Everything is so good and I love all the sides!!

a6Emp1PAcSgnDvPbv2GEdA.text: The best place to get Korean bbq! Our server was Dylan! And props to him. We are fairly new to Korean bbq so he told us how to cook the meat, what the sides were, and checked on us often to make sure we were liking everything. We had the harami miso, prime kabli chuck, beef toro, and the pork belly. Harami miso was the best hands down! We also got the spicy edamame () and the squash! Everything was lovely. For two people it came out to just under 25$ a person!

ez41qhqVE_rrR05ZKUz0-A.text: I was visiting out of town and found this spot in Vegas for Korean BBQ. Came in with a family and we were pretty happy with the quality of food here. We ordered the gamn course meal for two people and believe me it was a lot of food. The service was really  good. Multiple servers were constantly checking on our table. If you're in town for vacation give them a try.

E4KJTfIJz1ZnLBaBrmCJxQ.text: Overrated.  Sticky floor.  Food is not at best quality.  Be sure to cook it well done.  Good service though.

t-nOX4e3T6XE6Cdi28NE8A.text: I've been wanting to try this place for so long, and I was very excited to have an opportunity to go...  The Good:  The meats and banchan were all very good.   The service was great.   The macaroon (free with yelp check-in) was excellent.  The Bad:  The banchan selection was on the slim side. Yes, they give you whatever you ask for, however, there was not too much variety beyond the 6 or so side dishes offered.   The spicy tofu soup was bland and tasteless.   You come out smelling like the joint.  I don't know if its poor ventilation, or that they don't change out the grills, the place, as well as your clothes will smell like Korean BBQ afterwards (more than anywhere else). This place is NOT an AYCE.  I knew this to begin with, however, it just felt wierd.  We probably would have paid less at an AYCE place.  I wanted to like this place more, however, it didn't seem to any better than any other AYCE Korean BBQ in Las Vegas.

-qVWEejnMHM754V6kv3AHg.text: Such amazing service and food is always fresh. Meats are fresh and veggies ripe.

NZFpXEE5AFFnzw9GWPpdXQ.text: Amazing marinated short rib but my spicy ramen was literally from a Maruchan Top Ramen Packet, I've had hundreds in my days and I know what it tastes and looks like. They did it justice though not gonna lie. Also took us over an hour to be seated so make a reservation if you can.

es-8yKo4HG0-wg5BMxzsdA.text: Came here for their late night menu. Meat was decent quality, the late night menu has a good appetizer selection but a more limited meat selection. Only had like three things. We got all three and then also got the uni roll thing they had. It was surprisingly delicious! I was expecting not so fresh uni but it was actually very good quality so I would highly recommend getting it. Everything else we had was pretty normal. I think the sides could use some refining, maybe more pickles. Overall pretty good experience.

yCkX-j5XuDH3fTcH25Z1_w.text: I don't usually give reviews unless it's absolutely bad. This place has horrible service. Asked how long is the wait, the waitress said she has no idea. Very rude. Looked at the food people are eating, average Korean BBQ. Noting fancy. Not worth going.

i7ipU1J5u35L8zOVm7LFXQ.text: Great place to eat with family and friends. A lot of good quality meats with great service. Although it can get pretty pricey, If you leave a yelp review you also get a free dessert!

fPhWrSpMeVwwuU9IeETKEQ.text: Great staff and workers. The food is even better. The prime rib is very flavorful. I would recommend this to all my peers.

P0GhASXCcpkJW6jyDZ6QIA.text: The restaurant is located near the strip, vegas, just pass through the hotels and casinos and you will be there soon. a decent korean bbq which quite unusual in Vegas. the portion is tapas style so you need to order a lot. the meat is juicy and tender but I would like the meat to be cut more  thinner. overall, It was a quite fine experience !!!

LdTUPIFgI5wfadAz3GtHJA.text: Came here because of the 4.5 star on yelp, but the food actually only deserves a 3 star. It's good, but it's far from anything 4 stars and above.  If you are wondering why this restaurant have so many reviews and high ratings this might answer your question. (See photo) Yes, for every review you write on yelp, you get a free dessert and the server screens your review. "You must show posted review to your server." After seeing the so-called "Limited Time Offer" poster (placed on every table) I felt cheated by yelp. I always use yelp for honest reviews, not reviews that have been somehow influenced and manipulated by the restaurant. It's one thing to give people discounts on their bill if they check-in with yelp, but it's another thing to bribe people with dessert and screen their reviews. My utmost disappointment to the unethical promotional strategy this restaurant uses.  Never coming here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The do-a-review-get-a-free-dessert poster.

FgxvGL8WZTpFyvGuqlRU3A.text: Good Korean flavors. Meats are good and relatively priced ok. May need to up their ban chan cups a little so people don't have to keep asking for Kim chee . Service has been good to average the three times I've been. Overall a good spot for good Korean food. My lady friend loved the free macaroon with the yelp check in.

YVSIGPZl0HZWij7fJR36iA.text: Came here for the first time. I can say this is one of the best Korean restaurants I've ever been. Service is good, and the food is bomb. But, if you don't like to wait for a long time, I don't suggest you to come during dinner time cuz they get really busy. I came around 5pm to avoid the wait. Would def come back here again

3PeEPoFkLOR10RKK9OpxHg.text: It was our first time in Vegas, and the food was great! You get to cook the meet on the grill right in front of you, and there's nothing quite like the sizziling of meat to get your appetite started. The drink special are also great. Good food, good drinks, I would definitely come back the next time I visit Vegas!

M0QMwSKVrdqX3Aad_-2fpQ.text: The service is very good. Within a few minutes we had some side dishes. The side dishes are very good, especially the cuttlefish fish and fish cake. We also got the meat lovers special. The meat was very good.

C4zz7Yz4iLOdEpco1af9DA.text: It's pretty good. We ordered the combination for 2 people. Not bad. Kimchi is good and the meats are pretty decent.

_bqgpgCE18All9Q2ajjeLQ.text: This place is great and the seaweed salad is the best. I am currently in a food coma and I am enjoying it

-XP90H5N2JSY-F9GI1Ny1g.text: Great food and service! Sides are fantastic! All of the meats are freshly prep. The servers are quick to refill your sides.

BGXofo58e_Ocvq9t8tpOIw.text: Decent prices good food. The flat iron steak flavor was a little off putting but everything else very good! Time for dessert!

pGC3kQBM9sh33Q-G3AYUaQ.text: This place is awesome...we ordered the korean prime kalbi..pork toro and beef toro..they are all good and we ordered spicy pork also good..and finally we ordered fried dumpling...I think this korean restaurant is the best in the city..

ZfjMzwtL0mCVkhrsUPkH9w.text: Really delicious Korean BBQ! Very fast service with grill your own meat style. Meat lovers for two is perfect and has a lot of meat and rice and side dishes. Would definitely come back.

wT5MQNZanJjt2nUey2XM5A.text: Food is delicious. The set of 4 fed our party of 4 adults and 3 kids well. They are generous w their serving and side dishes. To top it all, the people are very honest and understanding. I left a great amount of money on the table in a a bag. Only discovered it an hour later, yet the whole amount was intact. Good job. U have won a faithful customer.

vXQD64xlYsCkomvU6jZagw.text: We chose the Gangnam special for two. It was WAY too much for two people! It was like 6 kinds of meat, three side dishes, and about 6 little sample-sized bowls of seasoned veggies. It also came with a large salad. The environment was fun, you get to cook your food on a grill at the table. I'd say the amount of food for two would be better for 4! We are not from Vegas but I would definitely go back again, but if we did we would probably order off the a la carte menu and pick the meats we really enjoyed like the filet, or the seasoned flank steaks.

z99Y8btURKdcDwEb9hxQ3g.text: Craving for some bbq and found this restaurant on Yelp.  Though I'm accustomed to all you can eat prices, we chose a la carte.  The plates of meat were smaller portions but plenty for me and my husband.  The sides were tasty, the meat tender, and happy hour prices were great.  Loved the fried calamari.  Great location, nice ambiance, and close to the strip.

fHOfw3n1Kv_DyfE2oZUgnw.text: Very good Korean bbq. Much better quality, good serving size and more reasonably priced than eating on the strip. A bit odd that they charge separately for lettuce to wrap the meats - not common at a Korean restaurant. Anyway, good food and would definitely come back again.

IW4PCUN0ShRNmS9rFS0XYQ.text: Ordered 2 paradise meals for a group of 6 and had plenty for everyone.  Service was excellent.  Food was fantastic, loved everything.  Needless to say looking forward to coming back and would recommend especially if you are staying at Hard Rock.

QORJzNcRmR86LWySGKaEeA.text: Always excellent!  The happy hour is a great deal but make sure you get here early since the wait can be long. We loved the Korean chicken cheese, beef toro and bulgogi. Also, the sides served at the beginning are great, the kimchi is always phenomenal!

u7L3bmcl54jSMm9alNtqag.text: Not quite sure what is the hype. How this place have over 3k of food reviews is questionable to me.   Got here after the happy hour. No wait. Got seated pretty quickly.   Notable dishes -  1. tofu soup (probably the best item on the menu) the tofu is silky smooth. The seafood in the soup is yummy.  2. Corn cheese - yummy with rice  We also ordered kalbi, Kobe beef, bugogi, filet mignonette, steAm egg, and the uni....nothing to rave home to mom about. The meat was flavorless and not really tender. My suggestion is to save your KBBQ fix for AYCE at LA in Korea town or hit up Han II Kwan in SF. Now, Those spots are places you should rave to mom about.   Almost forgot, we did the check in on yelp for the macaroon ice cream. The macaroon was a bit on the stale side.

Fi7J10X4LIMXeuz__P9S5Q.text: I recently came here and everything was mostly good.  I had the bulgogi bibimbop, the taekbokki, haemuk pajeon (seafood pancake), and kimchee chigae.  The bibimbap was ok, the taekbokki was delicious, and the kimchee.chigae was decent.  The seafood pancake, however, was not good at all.  The pancake itself was flavorless and when I asked about the dipping sauce, I was told that it didn't come with any sauce. I've had these pancakes at several places in several cities, including my mom's house (I'm korean) and it always has a dipping sauce with it.  AND the restaurant's own pictures of the dish show the dipping sauce.  Any way...these flavorless, almost disgusting seafood pancakes definitely needed something else with them...some sauce perhaps.    PS, see the pic of their menu showing the seafood pancakes with sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at the seafood pancake... definitely a sauce in the picture even though they told me they don&#39;t have a sauce.

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood pancake, flavorless.  They definitely need the sauce I was told they didn&#39;t come with.  These were the worst I&#39;ve ever had.
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchee chigae, decent.

I8kH29C5FcPXP-vVGijIaw.text: Pretty good. The meat was fresh. But overall, still lagging behind the best of the best KBBQ in LA Koreatown. We got there at 11PM, and there was about a 15-minute wait. We were a group of 3 that shared shared the meal for 2, plus some happy-hour items. Got all full for about $40/per person. It was easy to request grill change.

Service | servers were great and very quick changing the grill and bringing the meat  Parking | plaza lot

DFc9N_4x17jZLGEzKtsL0A.text: Had a great experience here! We had a group of 6 and were seated super quickly. They brought out a ton of banchan which were delicious. I especially liked the japchae and the bean curd. The BBQ prices are super reasonable - between $4-10 for most items. We ordered a bunch of items but our favorites were the marinated kalbi, beef toro, and beef tongue. They also give lots of complimentary sauces (ponzu, sweet soy, spicy soy, bean curd, sesame, salt) and you can ask for complimentary dipping cheese fondue and garlic butter.  We were all super full and the bill came out to $15pp after tax and tip! I was impressed by the value.  You can also check in on Yelp and get a free macaron ice cream if you spent over $15pp. They have a variety of flavors including mango, green tea, and vanilla. It was a nice sweet treat to end the meal!

-SAO-d-_TrQtMSd_b8rbnw.text: I stopped by here for lunch and was very happy.   First, they serve for one which is somewhat rare but also very satisfying. I'm not sure what the setting they have first is called but I enjoyed the Korean salads and their Kimchi is very good.   I tried a variety of meats and was pleased with the overall quality and taste.  The staff was very attentive and helpful.

2nZJK9aHe7slP9aWXMGjdA.text: One of the best places in Vegas for a fun relaxed night! It's located a little off the strip so for locals (me) it's actually not too bad to get too!   The place is on the cozier side and since it's popular be expected to wait for at least 20 mins during cocktail/ dinner time 6:30-8   Their happy hour is 3-6 I believe and it's a great deal! Have been here during HH and for 3 of us drinks included 50 bucks!  Without happy hour and ordering about the same it came out to 75! None the less still a really good deal  The food is so amazing and authentic you can tell it's a family owned shop all their food is so delicious! I love how they bring out little snacks for you while you order drinks my favorite is their squid and the Mac!  The meats are super good for the thin cuts the best are the bulgogi and we like the marinated ones! They also have super good chicken and salmon too! This place is perfect for a group of friends to cook your own food and have a great night!

wmzOvWGJWlA180cQPuHSNg.text: This place is a good if you are new and wanting to try out korean bbq for the first time because they have a range that can get you your K-BBQ experience in without having to break the bank.  The service is friendly and the food comes out pretty quickly once you order. They have your normal cuts of meat including chicken, beef, pork, and seafood as well as some higher quality cuts of beef that you can order as well. Anything you get here is tasty and you get to cook it yourself!  The location is just on the edge of the strip and has a large parking lot because it is in a plaza so you don't need to worry about paying for parking.  I'd recommend this place because it's affordable and has a welcoming atmosphere.

OSzAmxWTy8nTxUYUygj_vQ.text: First off the full table set before seating was great.  All sauces, veggie sides, water and share plates were set.  Helped to expedite quick service once seated.  All the meats were tender and juicy.  I couldn't really find any dipping sauce I didn't like.  They were all delicious.    Seating was spacious and lots of bodies on the floor for assistance.  The grill was cleaned and changed as needed.    Been to similar style restaurants but this one was one of the best.

PACF-Adlgo8YM7nCgJNCnQ.text: Loved all the dipping sauces, ordered lettuce along with kalbi & bulgolgi& bacon wrapped salmon & corn cheese & chicken karage ( was good, but will skip next time). Rice was very fluffy .   Enoki mushrooms  Kambocha squash   Will be back again and again.

hBARHbZK7x8WaEDZvjOA0w.text: I was pretty happy with the food but this isn't the most authentic or the best place to visit for Korean BBQ. We were craving Asian food after traveling through Utah, Nevada and Arizona so this place definitely fixed that craving - but I would recommend the marinade be less sweetened (very Americanized - rather than authentic Korean), and servings were coming out a little fast. Otherwise, they were attentive and happy to re-fill banchan!

We got to talk to them and this in of it self is pretty cool in my book, Marvin speaks German... I need to write more but on our way to the hotel aka BlackHat Convention....dang hackers I can't write more about this awesome place. When I get home,  edit time with a truly awesome experience. ZhniN2U_06ZPm-FhGbErNQ.text: This Korean BBQ is truly authentic starting from their kimchi. The first taste of the food amazed my Asian taste buds. All different kind of the meat we grilled were tasty and soft.   Their menu is full of verities that they even have oysters. I wish I could visit more times to try all the menu.  After many days I dined in so many On Strip restaurants, including some high end ones. The food here pleased me and my husband the most.   The atmosphere is cozy, not too fancy. And the price is super reasonable.   Highly recommend if you have an Asian stomach. This place won't go wrong.

-mc9DQPNR8hYnmiMohl7Cw.text: I wanted Korean food so I stopped by for the Kimchee Chigae. Easy place to find that is off the strip.   The Chigae was served in a cast iron bowl that kept the soup very hot. Yummy.. The flavors were perfect and not too spicy.  When it got too spicy i would just eat some ban chan. My favorite was the cucumber kimchee and bean sprouts.  I've had a lot of different chigae but this is one that is on my top list.  Six ban chans give and I'm sure they would refill it.   Service was okay and nothing really stood out. The mule i ordered was also a bit weak.. overall a great place to dine at if you Korean BBQ or other favorites like Bibimbap.

zaA8xWKCIUvs0vf5B1IcTg.text: Yum! You really get a bang for your buck here. We had the Vegas dinner for 2 and brought so much food home because we couldn't finish it all. I like how the table is already set for you with water filled, menus and utensils down, sauces already poured, and side dishes placed!   We came on a Monday night around 7 and waited 10 minutes for a table. When we left around 8 there were so many people waiting so you can tell this place is busy every night.

956vJ3JDadfEAJYtWIWN0Q.text: This place was really really good! First time trying Korean BBQ. Different experience and reminded me of Japanese Steakhouse (with the grill in front of you) except you cook it yourself!  We tried the lemon chicken, spare ribs annnnnd bulgogi all were tasty with the sides and rice.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ymzc3SNQGR5RrTX1k3YG7g.text: We ordered the Gangnam special for 4 people and there was so much food!! The option of having regular rice or your rice with the meal turned into bibimbap is great!! The service was impeccable and side dishes were flavorful.  Check in for a free macaron Ice cream!

oCOpLbT2IJp9qpZOh6MToA.text: Came here for lunch and was surprised at how happy we left!  We were not quite into many of the items in the set menus so we decided to order a la carte.  We tried the beef bibimbap which was crispy and hot.  The steamed egg was really good and maintained it shape even after we dug out half of it!  The seafood hot tofu had a wonderful flavor and lots of seafood tucked in, I even found an egg towards the end like a hidden treasure!   The marinated prime kalbi was delicious as was the brisket and beef tongue (both lightly seasoned with salt and sesame oil).   The yelp check-in gets you a ice cream macaroon!  Lots of flavors to try.   Very good value and was cheaper and better than many of the places in K-town, LA.
