R9aV2pjBEos2yST6xFIVwQ.text: real good place for families. reasonable price and good service. I like the spicy tofu soup so much highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. good place for familys

pqHRJ_bGLyWJzi2c_dw-bg.text: Great place love it will diffidently come back, came for my brothers birthday and as soon as we landed to Vegas we decided to come eat here party of 10 very nice.

3OXtDZMGN8pR_57v___-4w.text: Our party of three adults and two kids arrived on a Saturday evening just before the end of their happy hour, 6:00pm.  The place was already quite busy, but we were seated immediately. Staff was friendly and attentive, and the food was excellent.  One of the things we appreciated was that we were able to order the dinner for two, despite our larger party.  An AYCE-format restaurant would not have permitted this.  We added on a couple happy hour food items and the food quantity was more than enough.  One thing I missed from other korean BBQ places was the dipping oils with the salt at the bottom.  They gave each diner a three-sectioned dipping sauce variety bowl and the sauces in them were fine, just not the salted oils I was hoping for.  Our dinner experience here was very positive and we would gladly return.

QZr33VK7ISTcvP3VNj1AAQ.text: The staff are sweet the food is amazing  Great selection in choices   Will definitely come back when we visit Vegas again.

QcOg2Pgv_fDgFZiHhAh97A.text: We got the Premium and it was incredibly delicious. The meat was tender and perfectly marinated. We also got the tempura kobocha which was probably my favorite thing. Our server was super nice and everyone was very friendly.

4i8j2H1jLbR92r2r7gm0Qw.text: So much meat! We got the Gangnam for 6 (combo meal) and were stuffed. Quite a good deal for the quality meats we got. Everything was delicious!! My brother who is a carnivore, was actually satiated.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GjAujDJfDlcMUR3bufvAXg.text: Love this place! Always come here when in Vegas! The food is flavorful and yummy! The service is friendly and accommodating.

ooxkiSsYfjPNf65I2SOyeQ.text: Great food! Server forgot a few things but it was quickly remedied. KPop videos on the big screen. Delicious side dishes.

FOtiJWKdE-6mzdxnscFEkw.text: Awesome food and service. One of the best Korean I've had. I ordered Kalbi and Harami Miso - their #1 and #2 best sellers of BBQ. Having eaten Korean BBQ a lot, I can say that this one will rank in the top. Very tender, rightly spiced/marinated meat. Loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wnL7eZieVnoOSoDvE3505w.text: I would call this a hidden gem of Vegas!  I found Gangnam on Yelp and Yelp reviewers did not steer me wrong!  It's off of Paradise and Harmon, just across the way from the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino (in the same area as the CVS).  We had to call because we didn't see a sign  in the advertisement section, but it's there!    When we arrived it was happy hour.  Their happy hour beer was INSANE!  We paid $8.50 for a pitcher of beer!  $8.50!!!  Our server was so awesome!  Since this was our first time here she helped us figure out what we wanted on the menu AND also helped with putting the meat on the grill and letting us know when it was ready.  This was probably one of the most reasonably priced and filling meals we had in Vegas!  They're meal for two combos are huge!  Don't be afraid to ask for their help (cooking or picking something to eat), everyone is really nice!  The ambiance is really good too! When we were on our way out there was a bit of a line, so I definitely recommend calling ahead and making some sort of reservation.  If you're trying to walk to this place from the strip and it's well over 100 degrees, reconsider!  There isn't much shade, the sidewalk is narrow and it isn't worth it!  I learned the hard way lol!   We will definitely be back!

CYwgB26ZyX1ENWstl3TWRQ.text: Oh. My. Gawd.  This place is worth a trip to Vegas... just to eat here.  I don't even know where to begin with Gangnam... everything here is delicious. We prefer to get the Gangnam combination (it is on their menu as an option).  This option allows you to get a serving of multiple items on the menu at a great price point.  I like it because this allows us to find out what we really like before we go again next time :)  Our favorites are the Kobe beef, bulgogi, all of the sides, house salad, fried calamari and miso soup.  I could go on for days about how delicious this food is, but the more I type the more I want to book a flight to Vegas and go eat one of those delicious bites of food.  Oh, and don't miss the check-in offer for a FREE MACAROON!!!! Who could be mad at a free adorable (not to mention delicious!) cookie and ice cream sandwich?!  Hurry, come eat here!!!!

ew1EU9ia1mfQzBuaalMK4A.text: Went there last night, it was delicious! Few things I'd recommend staying away from that were pretty boring - the calamari, shrimp, asparagus, and pork belly just did nothing for me. However, the bulgogi and bibimbap were straight up amazing.  If you get the bibimbap don't order a side of rice, you don't need it.

ag7MLNGNjtaffktHuGvEyQ.text: Fabulous service! Tons of food, reasonable prices. Yelp review earns you a free dessert :)    We ordered the Gangnam meal for two and we are stuffed!! Only enough room for dessert ;)   The food was good. I didn't give 5 stars cuz it wasn't eyes-rolling-back-in-your-head good, but it definitely was yummy :)   Would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c4sLstgU4p4YsQ-3L97E-Q.text: I really wanted to give this place five stars. They were very friendly and efficient. Even though it was busy they got us a table in under  15 minutes. We ordered the Gangham Special which is their most popular combo. It had a bunch of different appetizers including miso soup and salad. Then they brought out a serious assortment of choice meats and each was delicious in their own way. We didn't want it to end. However, the next morning we all had gurgle guts to varying degrees. My tummy was just a bit upset but another guy spent the morning in the little boys room. Seeing as how we were the ones cooking our own meat maybe we had no one to blame but ourselves. Or maybe the meat wasn't as fresh as it appeared. The world may never know.

hy-tNUYpcElm_0SO6B-fpw.text: Was a long wait on a Monday night. Was our first time and told the waiter but we got no instructions. I asked for an explanation of the combination meals and all he said was "the meat lovers is our most popular" even though the menu says the Gangnam is the most popular. I inquired about the Gangnam meal and again he said the meat lovers is what we should get. So we ordered the meat lovers for four.  When the food arrived he put it on the table and started to walk away. I asked him what we do with the food and he pointed out the beef and pork dishes and the only instruction was "cook the pork well done" and he walked away.  We each started taking a piece of meat and cooking it and eating it which took a long time. After watching some other tables it was clear we should have cooked lots of food at one time.  While they do have vents, we left not really satisfied and smelling like grilled meat.  Was not bad but definitely not something we'll do again in Vegas.

Ltn_B71890-MYK_LWTyK4w.text: Big portions at reasonable prices. If you miss steam white rice, highly recommend this place!

LkbI5EtVokb415mkdF6bkA.text: Actually the food was good but the service was very unfriendly. Especially female servers in the morning. It was really difficult to ask for something. I don't think I will go there again because of service.

Gdpos4ZHEX395bsR5KEPDw.text: I have never been to a Korean BBQ that wasn't one of those counter-serve buffet lines, so I didn't know what to expect. And I wasn't expecting much when I found it was in a strip-mall. This turned out to be a great meal and a great experience! The server explained how it worked, and we picked a combo-package for about $55 for 2 people. They brought all our meats, fish, and veggies (and sauces, salad & miso soup) to the table, where we cooked it on the grill in the middle of the table with tongs. Terrific & delicious!

ifbYIwLjrl4UEX5Z2JD59g.text: Great service with amazing happy hour deal. Went with a group of 8 people and didn't wait too long to be seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3RSxKdas5FhzwbQ3MtWvyw.text: Everything was top notch. Most satisfying Korean dining experience I've had in a long time. Got the Premium package for 4 and it was just right-plenty of deliciousness at a reasonable price.

5YBOF2fUc4c23cXiWSNb7w.text: I was surprised how many excellent reviews this place got. It wasn't horrible, but it's far from a 4/5 star restaurant. The parking was not ideal, service was not good (they weren't even really busy), we didn't get any extra banchan when we finished our first set, and the kimchi wasn't really good. I think a lot of people who have never had Korean food are impressed, but this place was nothing to write home about.

iWzfLei6-eLwzb2oqb5QLQ.text: This was my first time here, and it was so good! We ordered the beef toro, the spicy chicken with lemon sauce, bacon wrapped asparagus, zucchini and sweet onion to put on the grill. It was bomb. We also ordered the kimchi soup. Loved it. Great friendly service, hot waiter. Sounds good to me :)

0ggCCLfPseoyAEu5DbgA5Q.text: Wow great food! Great price and good service! We had a spice tuna dish that was to die for.

TunuHkQa69CeBoxKIfm1Kw.text: Came here with my fam, and we loved the bbq beef and spicy chicken! The food came really fast and we didn't really have to wait for a table.

udD4q9n9xA7sFYRLkIqvoQ.text: Love this place! Quality meat here is incomparable. Their service was superb and I was very impress with their menu. It's not AYCE but it's well worth it. Would definitely come back again!

Yg1xnz7UQjIhPUx9MCoCIA.text: This place is delicious!! The only thing that I recommend is to have rice paper and radishes for the meats. Great experience for the whole family.

kvcKogaccV4jhCT3M9zuuw.text: Worst service ever took longer than average. Rice was over cooked as well. Good was subpar. Not going back there again. . Parking and location was fine. Very disorganized crew. Needs to attend better care with customers.

6P_qNbhHQSxitEiM2xvzjw.text: Great value, tried the meat lovers and it was filling and tasty. Very fun experience especially for group

5QZMkTnDxr-ZDaroX609kg.text: Visiting from SF Bay Area and the food was delicious. Enjoyed from the Happy Hour menu, as well as the regular menu. Staff was great & accommodating.

fSFzDbtikEuu92z6M0OugA.text: First time eating here at Gangnam. Really great service and food here is 10/10. Im for sure going to come back here in the future. Really like this place.

QVjuLu6f_CCjCo6ITGVkiQ.text: Great happy hour deals! Service was attentive, food was good. Beef tongue was exceptional. Hope that the grill was not too sticky (GyuKaku has better grill). You get a free dessert when posting a review on Yelp.

qELUqf5jDMLqpxXWH0nq0w.text: Came here with 5 adults and 1 baby. Got the Las Vegas and Gangnam sets and that was more than enough. Good quality meat. Tables too high. Friendly staff.

lk2cymYyQwL-FI5TgdciHA.text: A very nice and fun restaurant. The food tastes great. We trusted the waiter's recommendations and were not disappointed, or maybe we were too hungry around the midnight. :)

fm4YtRT9Hd0bN3-4FuZUcw.text: So I meet up the homie Mike C. at this place. Been wanting to try it for a minute now. It's eveningish and not busy at all.  It has a nice, dark, and clean ambiance. I'm not too sure on the dynamics of this establishment. We were the ones manning the grill, which I had no problem with. I've had places where an angry looking Korean lady snatches the tongs away and takes over. It wasn't the usual AYCE but I'll still pho'ks with it.   The dishes we sampled was the carpaccio, pork belly, brisket, filet mignon, and prime kalbi.  I saw on Yelp that this place had beef carpaccio. Ever since Woonam Jung stopped serving carpaccio, I've been looking for another joint to replace that empty spot in my heart. Gangnam's carpaccio wasn't as extravagant as Woonam's, but just as good. Served on an oily sauce and some greens on top. Simple and delicious. This was my favorite during the feeding.  The pork belly and brisket. What can you say? It's always good. There is nothing special about these other than the pork belly being thick. Dip them things in the sesame -salt & pepper concoction and you got a happy customer.   ALRIGHTY THEN!  Now to the beef. The filet mignon was good and tender. We cooked it quickly to a nice medium rare. It was perfect! Again, I'm glad we were manning the grill. These could have easily been over cooked and ruined. We actually got another order of the filet mignon. The server finally brings in the prime kalbi. He says that this is their signature dish. It was very tender and sweet, but it didn't leave an everlasting impression with my palate. Would I still pho'ks with it?  Sure. The first four orders is a definate though. So in the end, the crack that will have me on the come back is the carpaccio and the filet mignon. WINNER!  Yay!, I'm a fan!!!

_U6j4B-LYwuZSiCuH409Hg.text: Recommended: seafood pancakes, Harami beef, beef toro, garlic calamari, and mushrooms medley. For the best deal come during Happy hours. Drinks are 50% off. We got a pitcher of Sapporo for $8.50

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macaroon ice creams
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CiXHeFXZIBUgZiB27I18fg.text: This review is too long over due, this restaurant is how do you say Awesome!!! from the time you walk in and is greeted by the hostess which is a good looking, sexy , hot Filipino lady, the second thing that came to my mind was order your food,the Interior and ambiance was definitely up to par,there is a flat screen TV that was showing Asian news and a large projection screen  TV that was showing a Asian dance videos, teppan style tables,also a sushi bar area in the rear,you can have your photo taken and place on the wall with the others 50 plus there.I had the make your own lunch set, fire cracker chicken, spicy cucumber, chicken basil, rice, and miso soup,the food was season very well and delicious,buy one beer or sake you get one free (Sapporo, Asahi, Hite, Soju, Sake..cold or hot) happy hour is all day long the menu has a lot of tasty Item to offer,Hard Rock Hotel to the west and UNLV is the the east......Recommended.

3PD66_P13VVStlBmmHp3tQ.text: Just a short drive from the Strip. We ordered a variety of meat dishes. We recommend the beef toro, the bacon wrapped salmon, and the beef kalbi soup. Come with friends and a big appetite!

D9JDdMw1uB9v-f0l-36b3w.text: the service here is really great. everyone's super attentive and polite. also the food though  the meat is of superb quality and even the side dish are bomb !!!

Uth6nThMxYB4Ym535MhypA.text: 4 of us had the Gangnam for 2. We ordered a bit not al la caret and it worked out really well. Great food!

8DD9YaqufEgQ4Fz7XFI82w.text: Went here for late lunch and was promptly seated. They had fixed menus but we opted to order ala carte. We got the Kobe Ssam for appetizer. It was okay, but will probably not order it again. We got the japchae and we loved it. As for the bbq items, we ordered the bulgogi, salmon with bacon and spicy pork. Loved the bulgogi, salmon with bacon was good too. Spice pork was okay. Service was good and food came out in a timely manner. Btw, free dessert when you write a review!

HUaM55YNG5cUcWFWwmgy7g.text: This place is incredibly good. And the serving size they provide you with is huge, enough to feed several people. They provide an assortment of appetizers along with the main meats. You have several options to choose from and a must is their bulgogi fried rice!

VkjOFJwi-i8W-saryMGGuA.text: great food , the staff seemed nice not as attentive as I would have liked but I will be back for a second chance for a better review

rMv-ozmfvMXwz1vKgcXFeg.text: We had to wait for our seats despite having had made a reservation. This is a big deal to us because we have two young children. We ordered the pork belly, kalbi, skirt steak and bacon wrapped asparagus. It would have been a better deal to get the combos but we were not that hungry. The portions were pretty small (4-6 pieces each; 4 ozs) but were quite tasty. The panchangs were pretty good but you have to order two bbq dishes each person to get them for free. Nice atmosphere.

0vnuResQQI4PenMuaFKeCQ.text: I was so disappointed that they don't even offer seafood, not worth the one hour wait for sure, way overrated...

ls9tfo7qUI7AInahStGp5w.text: I really enjoy this place and used to go every Tuesday for lunch. The servers are great and friendly and they are very attentive.  I love the calamari here it always is crispy, flavorful,  and doesn't have too much batter.

T9GTD4U1BmwRkqg6ZiWjtA.text: Service was great! We ordered course for two and there were lots of food enough for two ppl. Meat quality was alright but bulgogi? And one of the steak was tender and delicious! Overall loved it! :)

8CEmzsvSzuoZhZTjZQEkSA.text: The gangnam meat combo was surprisingly filling and the quality of the meat was very lean and good.  the side dishes were diverse. the combo for 2 people was more than enough food.  Recommend  this place for people interested in higher quality korean bbq

XY6dwSOboulnpGfCkqETTQ.text: Craving some Korean food and my friend recommended this place.  So glad I came here.  I love macaroons and ice cream and this place offer macaroon ice cream.

kDtPRCIhtMWjjjAhjCJhrQ.text: Good food. Nice service. Sucks how the management makes the restaurant open on thanksgiving until 1.

v2mMZhuvu-_yDDRa01UPsQ.text: This place was amazing. Stopped by on our way home from Vegas and it was the perfect ending to a great trip. The staff was extremely friendly and attentive and the food was amazing!! They have great deals and the food quality is great. I highly recommend to anyone who enjoys nice ambiance and delicious, reasonably priced food. We'll def. be back!

ffvrF5dBB-A0wGDTGuUplA.text: Great dining experience! Everything was delicious, especially the Harami Miso Beef. Definitely stop in if you are looking for something different for dinner.

nbXCZxneK7arO4l_KJPUCA.text: Really good Korean BBQ. The bulgogi was the best. Also the spicy lemon chicken was very tasty! Highly recommended.

hHQQPjCmGCbBVvbQjmFceg.text: Fun experience (you grill the meats at the table). Food and service were both good. I would recommend the harami miso skirt steak. I'm definitely curious to try a few other meats on the next visit.

GTir3Xdi__WCQ0pouPzd2g.text: Absolutely delicious. We got meat lover plate for two people and it was plenty. Well worth the money.

Vwy6dKcq3c8Z8wQCqv8Ouw.text: Food was average at best. The low rating was for the horrendous service and bogus 18% gratuity (for a group of 4) at a restaurant where you cook your own food.  We had to constantly get the attention of our servers because they never checked up on us.  Any request we made had to be asked at least twice before thy actually fulfilled it.  We were finished with our meal for 20 minutes and nobody stopped by until we got the attention of one of the servers and asked for check.  Then after submitting my credit card, I had to wait another 15 minutes to get it back.  I'll reiterate, the service here is awful and I will not return.

Y7yH_nZ7uGNEHakBz-tt6g.text: We came here for my lovely gal's birthday dinner and I was overjoyed to learn that the place had a Japanese flair to their menu. And if anyone knows me, they know I have a sick addiction to edamame. Sick. This place didn't make that addiction any better whatsoever with their delicious garlic stuff, but it definitely hit the spot good. And that's just soybeans, I'm not even talking about the awesome meat! We chose the brisket, the filet mignon, the pork belly, just about anything and everything; all were delicious! All decently priced. They give you 3 different sauces to dip your protein in- there's like a ponzu tangy one, a house special one, and a spicier version of the house special- which I preferred- cause I loooove spicy. Only thing that was so-so for me was their steamed egg. It's one of my favorite things to eat when I go out to eat Korean BBQ and I was just a little disappointed considering everything else was so good. But if anything try some of their gyoza. Deeeeee freakin licious! Service was good and the room we got was pretty awesome. I'll be back for sure.

Afz1uutPR11-4YcF1EcnwQ.text: I will definitely be coming back here again. Aside from a delicious selection of meat, they also have scrumptious sides. Their macaroni salad and fish cakes are great. Location is good as it is close to UNLV and it is just right outside the Strip, so if you feel like Asian bbq and you're in town for a visit, come here. It is definitely worth it!

Ffk_7lsyahdxo5GCGDraxw.text: I enjoyed this place so much last week when I had lunch with friends I decided to come back with my husband today. This place is decorated nicely and food is good too. My favorite is the steamed kalbi.

XVJkiiIGDhkrG0na0wwBMQ.text: Came here over 4th of July weekend. Most of the meat was excellent and well flavored including the marinated Kalbi. The brisket (beef toro) was only alright. Most of the staff was friendly although it took awhile for anyone to notice we were there and seat us. Overall I will probably come back eventually.

sx-7677_Q-4ax7ENK2vhGw.text: Was recommended to this place for dinner - service is friendly and fast, and the meat is pretty solid. We ordered the kalbi, beef toro, pork belly, bulgogi and spicy tuna kimbap, and everything was delicious (they also served banchan). Located in a plaza with CVS and close to the airport - highly recommended especially if you're in the area!

gOxLYCvhrz56rS5DVAIZ3A.text: After reading all the reviews on here we decided to gave it a try and it was awesome!!! The food was very yummy and the services was super great (shes was a cute little korean girl).  We did the happy hr  menu so for less then $35 for total 3 ppl and we all walked out very happy. I'd definitely coming back as matter of fact we all ready planning on coming back tmo night.

VQEtuoQdAc9AW6IjbTGDdA.text: Gangnam Asian BBQ is amazing! It is a little restaurant tucked between two tattoo shops. We visited late at night around 10pm which was the start of happy hour. After ordering a plethora of food, we started with all the sides. The meat finally came and we indulged! Very high quality meat and grrat grills. We ate until our stomachs were full of beer and meat and then we got the check. Because it was happy hour our bill was less than $30!! Almost unheard of! I will definitely come back here!

bpYSf9sAozkYlJ-HHyC3RQ.text: Pretty good, but not nearly as good as the Korean BBQ places in Los Angeles. The meat was okay taste wise, but you really needed to dip them in the sauce, even the marinated meats like bulgogi and kalbi. Quantity wise, portions were also very small for side dishes and meats. Not sure why they have such fantastic reviews. They're okay, but not "as good as it gets." The free macaron ice cream with a yelp check-in gets them an extra star.

KaYFu1yAHH8tIRaTCbcN7w.text: First time here. we came a few minutes before the happy hour and the host graciously allow us to order from happy hour menu. we ordered pork belly, salmon, mixed tempura and chicken tender in cheese. it didn't disappoint :-) i also like the side dishes. definitely will visit when we go to LV :-)

ZwO_jzK5iu9CSBTqoGWHoQ.text: I've been here twice; it was absolutely amazing both times. The second time I had to drag my friends along as they were dead-set on staying on the strip and eating overpriced food in a snooty environment. They were grumbling through the ordering process, but once they got their Soju and the food started arriving, they were all instantly converted! We had a fantastic experience - such a wonderful restaurant!

jLJhQfFJW3R9sSni9OkTvg.text: Outstanding food - fresh, healthy choices, excellent service.  Recommend spicy tuna kimbap and the mushroom medley was great with my beef dish.

96IsF2h7Jqwv6OTYG0oZkw.text: This place serves high quality meat. We tried the most expensive course menu, and it was totally worth of money. The course includes small plates coming along with meats. I absolutely plan to come again and highly recommend Korean style BBQ lovers.

AuumYHwzTYruYUjjvOhBFw.text: We ordered the Las Vegas meal ($45 for two people) and there was plenty of food. As a matter of fact, it was too much food for two people. I don't know how they stay in business with a deal like that. Either way, we'll be coming back here whenever we're back in Vegas.

WRoqtzExHSAwRMTZ3InSPQ.text: BBQ is Great. Sides are good.  Now I knew why 4K reviews  Cannot wait to try macaron ice cream  Pork belly is very good  Will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We ate it all

pjavia3CC8PaDXNlUetiVA.text: Pretty yummy place! My family and I are traveling back home, they were nice enough to let us store our luggage to the side.

5m5SlounFkBLRnZB0ob4TQ.text: Great ambiance and felt like we had our own private space. The place was super chill and spacious. Great place to be in outside of the strip and away from the touristiness( but what isnt not toursity in Vegas?)  We ordered the gangnam set, beef toro, pork toro and pork belly. Side dishes were great, my favorite was the macaroni! Meat quality was actually pretty good, might be better than some of the kbbq places in LA. Personally, I like it more than Honey pig and Quarters in LA! Also wayyyyyyy better than all those AYCE places. The service was great too! Price wasnt too much as well. Would recommend to revisit!

MVnddDl5Tb6H3fadbhMgmw.text: Love eating here.  Super yummy Korean BBQ without the super expensive price tag.  If you like Korean BBQ you will not be disappointed.

P26mnNxzKNzmOeqAtlUaZA.text: Really awesome BBQ place with tons and tons of options. The long wait is well worth it (up to 90mins+) It's not just Korean bbq but much more because of the price. Super affordable, which allows you to enjoy more things. But know that those "things" are tiny hehe. Lots of side dishes and small portions. Highly recommend!

oNCQDPrSVZh-u452nBQgMQ.text: Joseph is a really good server he is awesome! Attitude amazing customer service is just beyond good!

lxwEhOBj6l0hErneD5ih8Q.text: I've had this place bookmarked for a while so I was pretty excited to come. Our favorite dishes were Harami Miso and the Korean Prime Kalbi. Desperately wish they had all you can eat!

0_m1odSXBJBGi-5oyTXA-g.text: As soon as I found this restaurant I wanted to try it but don't be fooled by all these reviews and stars on Yelp. The restaurant was freezing cold, the service was awful, the food wasn't very good, and to top it off the server gave us some other person's credit card and ran away before we could tell her it wasn't ours! In no way is that ok. I will never go back to this restaurant again.   When we got there we were greeted with the most unfriendliest server I have ever seen. She made us feel very unwelcome and as if we did something wrong by coming into the restaurant.   After we were seated we were ignored for a bit. She never asked us if we had been there before or explained anything to us. After we ordered she gave us some kind of sauce and some side dishes. There was no explanation as to what any of it was. We tried 5 of the 7 side dishes and only one of them tasted like anything and that was cucumber. They were not good and the 2 we didn't try looked really unappetizing.   When the meat came out again no explanation about how to handle and cook the raw meat so that there is no cross contamination or cooking times to make sure the meat is cooked properly so that we don get food poisoning. Ever other restaurant that has you cook your own meat that I have been to tells you these things. The meat was alright. It was nothing special. For the amount of stars and reviews this restaurant has I expected something better than mediocre.    When we were finished we had to wait at least 15 minutes to get the check. We noticed that the server kept looking at us but was trying to ignore us. The table next to us who sat down while we were eating got their check before we did. We finally got the check and gave them our card. The sever then brought back the card and basically threw it on the corner of the table and ran away. She had actually  given us the wrong credit card. She ran away so fast we couldn't give it back. Luckily a tall skinny male server came an took it and brought our card.

efhwkv1g9HG0pIqkxi8HnA.text: if you are ever in vegas and want a real korean bbq this is the spot to go to. One at the strip is no good. highly recommend all meat . customer service is very good and somewhat attentive with water refill. . very tasty.

8wSGq3a9ddL9I6go28v5zg.text: If you're ever in Vegas you have got to try this place out!!  The service is excellent and super friendly.Best Korean BBQ!!!

_tOkaW1apJdbpPQwUJ7DVw.text: Really great atmosphere, music, location, customer service, but best of all.... The food is spectacular!

6xtVj-bTaJChNn8Q7bwPHQ.text: Good meat options for the price. I really enjoyed the spicy chicken and the iron side steak. Super fun and a great time.

OazVJtXRPgO9NN4WIUxRlg.text: Great foods and awesome customer service!! Recommend anything with Kobe beef in it, will not disappoint. Ordered for 6 and we could not finish all the foods. RL7rSXNdAK76RYJuq5UMIg.text: Happy hour 3-6pm...pitcher of Sapporo $8.50, beef toro $4, bulgogi $4, & free ice cream macaroon with Yelp check-in...this place ROCKS!!!

o7m-kGKtlt4g0oVySg54Rg.text: Really good korean bbq. Its been a while since I had some food this good with good quality. Recommend to anyone who wants authentic korean bbq

E5zpKLavz2TFA4AXSwSgJg.text: Party of 2 on a dinner date visited on a Thursday night, first time we were there and were pleasantly surprised how nice it was.  The booth we had was cozy and our server was excellent at explaining the menu and made sure all our needs were met.  We shared the Paradise combo.  I like that you can get bimbimbap instead of steamed rice.  There was lot of food to split up between us and we left satisfied just like we just had AYCE korean bbq. Everything we tasted was very good and we'll be back again to try another combo because we enjoyed it so much.

8qvA53CtGaNXCNqy1ube4Q.text: Pretty nice place. The happy hour prices are great. Standard Korean BBQ experience - grill in the middle of the table. You have to grill the meats yourself here. Side dishes are complimentary - who does not like kimchi! Good selection of beers for only $2.50 during happy hour.

0kxjuw7v6h6ku4cKc2a5ew.text: I am a Korean and I strongly recommend Korean prime Galbi! It was amazing!  Also try bulgogi bibimbap.  I went to this place 3 times in 5 days.

z3KxHr0VL02j2oNOGQ1fiA.text: second visit here within the past year.  i had excellent bibimbap both times, others had various jigae.  the mark of a decent korean place is the panchon (side dishes) imho.  gangnam's are just right, including odeng, my favorite.  very clean (hard to do in a bbq place).  friendly/informative staff.  i lived in korea for five years and gangnam is a great go-to spot.

dazPM-9VgEXGwm12oUH9zA.text: We are here in vacation and decided to try this restaurant.  The Spicy pork was well marinated.  The filet mignon was tender.  The garlic beef had a wonderful garlic flavor.  We also had pork belly and it tasted like what we ate when in South Korea. We will definitely return to this restaurant.

-D7pLUh6s-oU_M-ULuQZsw.text: I've been to a lot of K-BBQ places in So Cal.  This place is near Hard Rock Cafe.  The food is average and the service is ok but it seems understaffed.  The atmosphere is nice and comfortable.  They play music videos on a large projection screen for a bit of entertainment.  We would stop on again if it was convenient but not make a special trip.

7dqPKRkwqIOeF6UU7LiA5g.text: Long wait but it's pretty worth it.  Great service and food.   Loved the bacon & scallop!

okRWy6YAmAeHgg2-WVJIhw.text: By far my favorite kbbq place in Vegas. I tried all of them: Hwaro, Tofu Hut, DJK, etc.  Pro: the price for the a la cart menu and the service. Oh and they can cook for you if you don't want to cook.  Con: your shirt will smell, but that's in avoidable if you want kbbq.  Def. recommend it.

jXzpgWcOyJ66XJTTvDslnw.text: This place was amazing. Great food and good service. The thing that made this experience a lot better was our server "Donkey" he said we wouldn't be able to pronounce his name right so he said call him donkey. Best server in the whole place.

zWv7v-nyagxPaUnuC8RgPg.text: This place is great. Food great. Service great. Price is good too. Very affordable. Fed a family of four for under $70. Will come again

TeZIZWEHchdCS7u_WIUx1A.text: Wonderful place for a late night dinner after a long exhausting flight. Love all the sides selection , highly recommend to try the wagu beef, very very good value for the cost.

jqletxQJk9LOzIk3yFzQ-g.text: Efficient but friendly! It not only tasted great, but it was a great and fun experience. Highly recommend if you want something new!

-rI5-CWVqElO3BOKNlfnJA.text: I have tried many Korean BBQ places and I have to say this restaurant stands out the most! I have heard so many good things about Gangnam Asian BBQ and finally gave it a try tonight. The ambiance of the interior was really intimate and it was very clean. It really sets the mood for dates or whenever you're in the mood for binge eating KBBQ with your friends, which is what I did.   The food was delicious! The meats were served fresh and presented nicely. What came to my surprise was that they served Thai Tea, which made my visit even more satisfying. We ordered the miso soup, pork belly, prime kalbi, bugolgi, the bacon wrapped enoki just to name a few and Yuuum! Belly was satisfied! What adds variety of flavor to your meat is the three different sauces they present you with. There is a vinegar like sauce, a sweet sauce, and a spicy sauce, which really gives you multiple choice on flavorings for your food.Of course trying their desserts was a must so I went for the banana tempura. This was so goood. The banana tempura was served hot off the frying pan and what helped balanced that out was the vanilla ice cream. It was a great ending to my meal. The prices overall are perfect for what they serve you.  All in all I have to say my visit was great! The owner even came out and checked on us. He was so friendly and he looked happy to see his customers. I will be coming back for more!

X3qx_ZZRiOio2dqx-_Rwog.text: Nice experience..if you don't like spicy ask for assistance choosing your dishes. The beef was wonderful. The service was a bit slow even though the place was fairly empty

9QfjSImHTZUWCqsenhDgew.text: Reminds me of the better Korean BBQs in Southern California. The bulgogi and kalbi are delicious but what impressed me the most was how much my vegetarian girlfriend really enjoyed their veggie options. Make sure to come during happy hour too, their deals are really good.

KnPupGUNMirpz-HfSSyFgQ.text: Pretty clean Korean BBQ restaurant.Small portion plates but good for the price.  "You want White Lice" (rice) lol

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tuna kimbap ! Fireeeee !

ty5jAmsSZ6eqdovtCsTNpw.text: Really wanted to like it,  but it fell short of expectation. About 3 stars short. The food was average,  service was not consistent.   It's not a large restaurant, so it's not the place to get a quick bite.  Yelp, you have disappointed me.   Will not be returning, you have lost a foodie costumer.

3PPStk_aiM_kCs1okD1HRA.text: The only complaint is the tables are enormous making it hard to have conversation. But it's a ton of good food for a reasonable price. The chicken was particularly tasty. Nice find off the strip!

XX9AB_d9I5UBWkXTT5ddzg.text: This restaurant has a chill ambiance with good music. They have a nice happy hour prices. Affordable cheese wontons, mmmmm.  I think the meat could be more flavorful but the additional sauces complemented them well enough. Sides were good but the kimchee was a little too strong for me. Spicy tuna kimbap was booomb, though, get it.

hd9fHRQUXxKbHQwUn-m1Kg.text: Seaweed salad was amazing along with the cuts of meat. Lovely find.  We ordered the meat lovers for 2 and needless to say, we're stuffed. I can just rollover and sleep happily.

GHNLgGQZdRL5AONGEpkQgA.text: Outstanding food, service, and value. Our waiter was very helpful He suggested perfect amount and very tasty food. Food was outstanding and plenty. Price was so reasonable. Highly recommended.

7NBF04CukOWWyzVefp36gA.text: This is my 3rd time being here and I plan to keep coming back. The meat here is prime, the sake is to die for. And the food is top. The prices are right, and it's fun! You cook it yourself on a BBQ in the middle of your table. I love this place

vxJIs0xCeNnz3gQ2x2acOg.text: Very clean and great atmosphere for young people. Also great price for trying a bunch of different dishes!

odpYnzSIkSi32TYZOKaG4Q.text: Great flavor on the meat.  You can tell they definitely use good quality meat.  The Kobe carpaccio was awesome!  Service was spotty at first but then got better.   Ordered a la carte but the sets were definitely cheaper.  Would do that next time.   They kinda nickel and dime you for stuff like sauces and things that typically go with stuff, but all in all.  Pretty decent.

WAnh9j1-8npIZBfzChbGYA.text: The foods is great here!! The service is pretty good,too. I love one of  broccoli with cheese, my favorite is the short-ribs. Spicy chicken!

t_dRzSBw1bt8UfNkS-yPpg.text: First time trying this place and very cool!  It's not a True Korean. It's more fusion and there are a lot of AYCE but this is different.  Very cool and excellent food.

DNB215IUrvsXc5Flgi9MlA.text: Great traditional Korean bbq Kimchi Gigae was awesome! They have jinro soju that i haven't had in years!  Really good meats that were marinated well. Took me back to the days of living in the land of the morning calm!

3g7XMLX0slING9vONa7NfA.text: Great menu, including happy hour menu! My favorites were the kalbi and bulgogi. I'm also a sucker for noodles so got ramen and cold noodles, yum. Loved the sesame oil w/ sea salt and cheese fondue sauces. Also get free macaron ice cream w/ review. Definitely worth getting off the Strip for good, affordable kbbq!

WW5b2fbUHXsdz5I10eugMg.text: What a treat. A fine Korean restaurant that I can walk to from home. Heaven. It has a terrific ambience without being overly expensive. I've met clients here twice and both were very appreciative. (I was glad for the access to WiFi as well as the great food, service and atmosphere)  I did miss getting the free banchan, but the Kimchee is free upon request. Don't forget to ask. And the price is less than I expected so you can still order little side dishes individually.   Get the Bul-Go-Gi and grill it yourself.   Oh and they'll play the Gangnam music video for you on the big screen if you ask. :)

9oFOB3lMEwIJ6RrQxST--w.text: Updated review:  We celebrated my sister-in-law's birthday here last night.  None of us have tried this place.  We were really impressed with the food.  We loved the side dishes, especially the squid. Right behind our booth, someone else was celebrating their birthday and the staff sang a  birthday song and gave him/her a complimentary dessert.  So we had to tell them it was my sister-in-law's birthday also.  Our waiter assured us she would get a dessert too.  On the corner of our booth, I was excited to see that they give a free dessert if you rate them on Yelp  at the time of the visit.  It was a limited time offer so I wanted to take advantage of that. I showed the pictures to my 4 year old nephew and as soon as he saw the colorful macaron ice cream, which he called "ice cream burger", he asked for it right away.  I had to coax him to finish his food first  before we  get him the free ice cream.  He agreed and waited so patiently for it.  While everyone's eating, I downloaded the Yelp app so I could rate the restaurant and get the macaron ice cream for my nephew.  I followed the instructions and gave them a really good rating based on the food itself which was a 5 star for everyone.  I got up to use the restroom and asked my husband to show the review to them (as required). However, when I returned, my sister-in-law's complimentary dessert  was already there.   They didn't sing her a song either. It, unfortunately,  wasn't what my nephew had been waiting for. Our server told us that they would only honor one.  I'm not upset about not getting the free dessert cause we could have bought him one right there instead.  For one, it was already late. I just  didn't want to see my nephew disappointed.  We'll just buy him one in the morning from somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Disappointed because he didn&#39;t get his free dessert  (macaron ice cream ).

coR0VF6L0gL9s7rLea7RGQ.text: The steamed Kali bowl was 10. So tender. I will definitely be back.  Was Busy but service was good.

6LULwu4NU9TzWCoxuE1wcg.text: Good quality, tasty.  Very nice prompt service.  Smallest 2 person combo for barbecue was more food than we could eat.  Nice atmosphere and diners, very varied.

yQYL8emvbPHqi7IwiDKSsA.text: Great service and close to the strip. Crowded is good sign with minimal wait! Great time with kids.

LTPFfgzXsVjr1Ggvj-ofkA.text: I love this place!!! We were immediately greeted upon entering and was welcomed into the restaurant. Service was very fast as well. We had happy hour and I tried the beef toro and bulgogi. Both were extremely delicious! Highly recommended kbbq! Amazing!!

jjF6HOWge8_REmFNfxERug.text: Wow! We finally found our new KBBQ spot! My family and I ended up getting the "Gangnam" it came with fresh oysters, soft tofu kimchi, sishito pepper yuzo, green salad, bulgogi bimbimbap/white rice, miso soup, mushroom medly and for the MEATS... Harami miso, prime kalbi, flat iron garlic, filet mignon, bulgogi (All beef). Plus all the banchan. Waaaaaay too much food for us but super yummy. Everything was fresh and everyone was super attentive even though they were very busy. Inside the restaurant is super clean and nicely decorated. Definitely will be coming back!

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6I4YqmLJEBOyrfBbpQB6Ng.text: Amazing food and a great experience.  We ordered three meat options, a starter and a vegetable. Delicious and top notch.

anZQBOLGyL0EOBGfdDQrlA.text: Amazing food - lots of fun with a group. Especially for people visiting Vegas. Make sure to try the mushrooms and the fried rice stuff whatever that is

cueEG79nsqX98rLVlmU8ug.text: Delicious food, wonderful spices.  Abundant portions as well. Service was attentive and friendly  Highly reccomend for anyone wanting excellent Korean food in Las Vegas.

Y-nnjxtf-XhuhJiKYIrK2g.text: We visited during Sunday noon time. Not crazy line, waited about 15 mins. We ordered prime Kaibi, beef tongue, beef toro and bulgogi. Pretty good for all, meet the 4 stars expectation. Sweet corn is the only vegi we order. 4 small pieces as showed in menu, only enough for 1 person.  Overall, it's nice meet our expectation.

oM9WGV22MpdeUdm665D2tw.text: We go to Vegas for memorial weekend and want to have some good food. This restaurant happen to be the first one showing, so we are excited to try this out.    We arrive at around 5:30 pm and we are seated immediately.  We are party of five with 4 adults and 1 baby.  We ended up ordering the gangnam meat set.  Food is huge portion and very tasty, beef quality is excellent.  I never have that amount of meat in my life I would say.  Everyone is satisfied with the food they offered.    I didn't give them five stars because I think their servers can do a better job in treating their customers.  I literally saw the girl roll her eyes in front of us when she takes our order.    **They give you free dessert if you write a *good* review about their restaurant on Yelp**

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iJLW5vUUtiZxWW-anhY_AQ.text: Great first experience. Everything was fresh & delicious. As an appetizer the spicy dynamite shrimp was the best I ever tried . Definitely recommending & definitely coming again . The waiter was very friendly and easy going . The atmosphere is very hip and oriental .

LHAwyAQQedGhIT8yeZF4xw.text: Didn't expect good kbbq in vegas but this place delivered.   Was it the best? Nope but it ranks pretty high up there. I'm from LA & OC and have had a lot of good kbbq so I'm a bit spoiled.  Got the Gangnam combo to try everything.

bDu3tV2EAfTawZrfays_dA.text: Amazing food. Wanted something off strip and tried this place on a whim. Was not disappointed!

y28rSJoLd8_GgsEXMAirDQ.text: nice service and nice little dishes. The combo is good for 2 people. But u still need to wait for 15 mins up even on Monday night after 9pm. must be a popular place.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. nice little doshes!

OXFr6MEUSWdo6bGZlZ9ucw.text: Good food, great service, nice atmosphere, and good value for the quality of the melt-in-your mouth, delicious, marinated beef and pork.  I recommend the Gangnam meal with bulgogi bibimbap.

Iqa66ghJCtSckBB8yV-XcA.text: We made a reservation here for our wedding rehearsal dinner on a Friday @ 6pm for about 45 people. Patrick (the owner) was easy to work with and very accommodating. When guests started arriving, all the tables were together, available, and set with place setting and sides. As soon as guests started sitting down, our preselected Meat Lover Combination meat plates started coming out. All our guests raved about the BBQ and the service was excellent. We're so glad we listened to our fellow Yelpers on this one!

vzHkcCPJk0kxWwSUGwCCgQ.text: Korean BBQ spot with premium meats. Definitely get what you paid for. You can order A La Carte or they also have set packages if you don't know what to get. I ordered A La Carte and the price was good. They have packages for 2 people and up to 6 people. A must try in Vegas

nfNzBYgUE66TfMbBOfDCEA.text: Korean BBQ at midnight on a weekday! Everything we had was fantastic! Really great service too! It's amazing to find such great late night food in a strip mall.

KnaQhX6Ilf9-pwLizK8Pmw.text: The food was good. Even on a busy night we were never neglected. The happy hour specials are good. The music and atmosphere are nice for a nice but not formal dinner. Great for friends or date night!

NnAJxVBR_YSJZYk3Dw5MVg.text: Our party ordered seaweed salad, marinated ribs and bibimbap...every bite was delicious!

EJbOxzq5LEQeyynNS0r2uQ.text: We got the gangnam combo and it was a bit too saucy for my tastes. But if you like it saucy, you'll like it here.  Service was attentive. Made sure we had enough food and water and such.  I thought they were generous portions. I'm stuffed.

4RvXucsMS9hWSGn2McZ86Q.text: This place is not as flexible when it comes to AYCE and the seating was very tight. The food was mediocre and the staff was slow. I don't want to go into much detail but the prices are pretty high for the amount of set food served. I will give them 2 stars for trying though and I believe that is pretty generous.

Q7HF-61eNK7gdMMf2shlRQ.text: What a find.  We Yelped a place to eat near our hotel but we wanted something off the strip.  We found this Asian BBQ place and it was not only a lot of fun, it was great food.  Everything was fresh, tasty and well put together.  The wait staff was very helpful and quick on request.  If we come back to Vegas, we will be back.  Oh, and make sure you order one of their ice cream sandwiches, the were a True delight!

-yGKhvqeoaeueKUHTi-_VQ.text: I will definitely be back here! The food was amazing. The KBBQ places we have back at home are nothing compared to this one. The Macaron Ice Cream we received at the end of our meal was a great dessert to end our lunch with.

qRoTisBGu6SD2Prx5tqKfw.text: Awesome place! Super friendly staff and very fair happy hour price! Come before 6 pm. A great difference from all the fatty food around. Food was delicious and in big portions. I used the happy hour menu and was even able to take some home for lunch tomorrow. When I'm back in the area I'll come again.

AvT7K_yK6KSRi64JWQ-AQg.text: The place is clean and food quality is great.. I recommend the cream cheese wontons and Dynamite Shrimp

QmGNCboNTGSpQKValnrU8w.text: It was great.... more to come  Ordered the Harami Miso, bulgogi, pork bulgogi, and pork belly for bbq and the Daenjang Stew and Kobe Beef Carpaccio on the side.

t6OwGePx4uuBbBVnPMkmcw.text: While in Vegas for a conference I checked Yelp to find something delicious in the neighborhood and ended up here.  We came during happy hour and tried a variety of meats and appetizers.  Most of them were excellent with the harami miso being my favorite.  The happy hour prices were great.  I had never been an Asian BBQ before and it was a fun experience.  The racist in me noticed the place was filled mostly with what looked like Asian people so that was a good sign.

1FJRDCXaD7pIkxzS3uXjBw.text: we ordered the gangnam for two it was amazing but it was incredibly too much food for two people not very hungry. if you can put some food down its well worth the money.

U-yRkjuVcHRYRwpx-vv6dw.text: Great food. Nice service. The only thing I don't like is the location. Long walk from the strip. But it's worth the time cuz you can't find this Korean BBQ place on the strip.

W3TR-g1xPWGyGR4541YsqQ.text: This is the place to go if you're looking for an authentic Korean BBQ experience! Everything from the food, down to the service is outstanding. You won't regret. I promise. I come here anytime I'm in Vegas!

WNXUYDHnu3APEbfRE7CiAQ.text: Lots of fun for a group or just dinner. Good happy hour prices and the grilling is enjoyable. I've had bbq Korean in Korea and this is just as good...but understandably without charcoal.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cooking!

PyxWmaST687SSN2_VU6WrA.text: Great food. Perfect for hanging out. Even ran into an old buddy from my military days in Korea!

begLRkvc_leODDVpiw6NXQ.text: Great!! Food, Great Service!!!  Will definitely come again.  Ordered the Las Vegas for 2.  Got our money's worth.

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From top to bottom; Korean Chicken, Spicy Chicken, Garlic Shrimp.   Yummmm!!!!

yuIzqF02lEhM8aeGS7POqA.text: Outstanding place! The food, the service and environment are just great! And it's cheap. If you love korean or seafood then you must go to the place. It's only 5min from the Strip street by car. Unfortunately, there is no affordable Korean restaurants on the main street. Good place for 4-6 people.

cyP-DeINW59JvYmi3a9aiQ.text: This place was great! Had to heck out why the reviews were so high and this place does not disappoint!! We got the Premium for 2 and we're stuffed!!! The skirt steak was incredible when you dip in the sweet sauce your given. The Kobe, albeit good, is not certified as Kobe beef; it is wagyu beef. Other than that, come here if you love food in general! Amazing!!

lb3Y4StkhBYaKVMnSAw98Q.text: Sooooo good. The Gangum for two is enough to easily fill three. Excellent variety on their combos. We were in-town and in the mood for shabu/hot pot, but this blew away our other options.  Just do it!

_0W2aud4I8LMr6HngmO7pg.text: Great food, fast and friendly service. Modern upbeat decor, privatish booths.  Honey bread took over 20 minutes, but was great - order ahead.  Close to the strip, across from the hard rock hotel and Hofbrauhaus house (and kiss minigolf).  No frills, would be happy to go back anytime.

wY0we2xcq0DBvyYHjqSXbQ.text: A great find! My husband is Korean so he's VERY particular about Korean restaurants. We were kind of hesitant that it was a fusion between Korean and Japanese. First impression, very cute place. Greeted right off the bat... Very impressed with the food we ate. Full of real authentic flavor.. The Kim Chee was fermented to perfection. Reminded him of Momma's. Great service, cool music videos playing on the big screen. We were very happy customers!

P-2dO2D9Rpagw_vnBHfx5A.text: Excellent food and value for the price!  Service was prompt and courteous.  The meat lovers is a great selection for those who are looking for a wide verity of beef and pork.  Will certainly be back!

4AYZ7qARlZxo49pAABMnAQ.text: Friendly and knowledgeable staff were really helpful in getting us situated and recommending delicious items on the menu.  The two of us ordered three portions of meat, but with all the side dishes, we could have been fine with just two. The bulgogi was our favorite, but make sure you eat that last, as it is the most flavorful.  They only take reservations of eight people or more, but the two of us only had to wait about twenty minutes to be seated on a Tuesday night.  It is a long (but doable) walk from the strip. We d have given it 5 stars if they had one more server for slightly faster service and if the kimchi was on point. The other side dishes were very good though, especially the green onions. Yum!

_N1ACvhQMlFcpep24ElxAA.text: This is a sure place with no mistake to go when you`re in vegas. The food is wonderful and the service is great !!! Really loved the place and it`s a must go in Vegas

UiaVIpVAJwXLQbLDCzF5cw.text: Very good quality K-BBQ.  Ordered "Meat Lover for 2" and was more than enough food to feed the family with a teen Alger and a toddler.  Will definitely visit again the next time in Las Vegas

CouwRvaGk9Nyv52iRtJw-w.text: It was messy the order they brought in the food. I paid fu%#^*+ $66.00 for the 2 person Gangnam special and they brought out the bi bim Bab(item with rice) last! You don't bring that when the meat is all done eating. We didn't get our drinks til half way through dinner. Other waiters kept coming by and asking if we got so and so. They basically don't have a tracking system of what you got. I will never waste money here again. Overpriced for what you get. It's not all you can eat. The meat trays are so small.

gv3AzZRBa6W6vPzszZkv6Q.text: The food is great here! This is by far the best experience I've had at a Korean BBQ restaurant. One problem was the quickness of the food getting to the table.  Otherwise I would go here again.

o6qpoMr4acpF1fwr24_QEw.text: Possibly the best value in Las Vegas.  If you really like authentic Korean BBQ you won't be disappointed.  Meat quality was real high and the sauces were great.  Careful with the Korean sake, it packs a punch.  Just 1.5 miles off the strip so very convenient, don't let the strip mall location fool you, this is real good stuff!

x3M4ppBFr4ILlvS6tl0YCg.text: First time here.  Food was great!.  Good service. Very nice location. Will definitely come back when I'm in town.

6SxqDC8cVqr1UYpzdhT23A.text: The pork belly and jalapeno poppers are definitely worth trying! The macron ice cream cake are good too. Happy hour is fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute macaron ice cream in green tea flavor!

LxqFyFqx0OSIiVP5QhMfFQ.text: Nice place for a first date as the seats are fairly far apart in the booths to allow room for the bbq pit in the middle of the table. A good way to keeps hands busy as well throughout the meal (not a chance of awkward hand holding) but dimly lit enough to make it feel intimate.   Being overly prepared we called in advance and made a reservation for two along with a toddler requiring a booster seat. Upon arrival right before the dinner rush around 2:45 pm Saturday we were promptly seated and greeted and drinks came out immediately afterwards. Seemed to be the best time to come because it was empty when we first got in and filled right up starting at 3:15. The ice tea was delicious, we had refills. I noticed that the booths basically were benches and were kind of uncomfortable, with a very utilitarian feel that assured me that men probably love flocking here for happy hour with their buddies. I was not wrong once I saw the happy hour menu as it was mostly geared towards beers. We dove right into the menu and ordered pork belly and marinated Kalbi strips to bbq with rice on the side ($1.95) and I ordered the Korean soft tofu soup with seafood.   Our server was attentive, not overtly friendly but helpful. Since it was just us two girls and we don't eat much we didn't get any appetizers or dessert. The first thing to come out first were the sides, which you get complimentary if you order at least two bbq dishes. There was a variety of them, what I noticed was the pickled vegetables were good, the kimchi was great and the bean sprouts were bland, but that was fine with me. Throwing them in the marinade they provide for dipping might help. Then our meats and my soup arrived. Oh my, delicious. We threw the meats on and I dug into my stew and it was instant love. Although the stone pot it comes in may seem small, the portion was perfect for me. The chef made it perfectly spicy, with a kick of kimchi taste and an egg cracked right in. There was a respectable amount of seafood in there which I appreciated, and the meats, once seared with a nice crust, were super yummy. I only needed half of the large helping of rice that came with my soup before I was full.   I then turned to the sangria which I order partway through my meal just to try. It was delicious, but made with a dry red wine I didn't love, with blueberries and raspberries floating within. Perfect sweetness though so no complaints, I'm just more of a non-dry white wine person. If you enjoy red, get the sangria. If not, the plum wine might be a better choice as I love Asian plum wines, plus it's cheaper. As a side note, the women's restrooms are well-kept and clean but no place to change your baby so not too friendly for families with babies.   Overall, thoroughly satisfied with the experience we had there is go back again. The only reason for the one star deduction was that it was a great experience but didn't knock my socks off with value for the price. I would go back though. A definite must for Asian cuisine foodies visiting Vegas!

czYOHHxHOJS5mDnMR5Uz-Q.text: Came during happy hour for the food. The portions were good and the food came out very quickly. Love Bulgogi and the seaweed salad. The mushroom medley was awesome too. Will definitely return!

Overall I give it 5 out 5 because of professionalism and True balance of the variety of the food.

GA_HjAGLhOkq2xTxMKmkmg.text: Not AYCE?! Meh. I'm over stuffing my face with as much food as possible to make it with my money. I'm glad they didn't have the AYCE option.   For the price, which is quite reasonable, the portions are a good size. We had three meat plates (beef toro, pork belly, prime kalbi) and a few sides (oysters, dumplings, calamari, seaweed salad) , shared between three people. I was stuffed! We also ended up getting banana tempura for dessert. All in all, it was a good meal. My least favorite item probably wouldve been the calamari. But there are so many other items to order, it's not a big deal. It wasn't bad, I just have a high expectation for my calamari.   As far as service, they were on top of their stuff. Never had to ask for water. They checked on us just enough to not be annoying.   We went around 530, and we were the only people there, which worried me a bit. But by the time we left, about hour and a half later, the place was packed. So if you don't want to wait, be sure to go early.   All in all, I definitely will be back.

We liked this place so much that before we went to the airport on our last day, we came back again for lunch! The waiters were really friendly and helpful and I would definitely recommend. I'm glad we got to start and end our Vegas trip with this place :)

eqwLsBhZFPYaIbmBax8SuQ.text: After looking at all the good reviews, we finally decided to come to Gungnam Asian BBQ. The overall environment was great. Service was wonderful. For appetizer, we ordered chicken karage and tobiko. The spicy mayo with the chicken karage was an amazing combination with lots of flavor. The tobiko was cooked to the right texture. For our entree, we ordered beef tongue, beef toro, beef Kali, pork belly and mushroom medley. All the meats were really fresh and delicious. 4XmRQ3YonUB1D6fu4Hy0Yw.text: When I go to a Korean barbecue place, I always go for all you can eat because I can get most of my money worth. Gangnam isn't all you can eat, but you are still getting your money worth.  Atmosphere is that of a high end restaurant. Dimly lit, fancy decorations, expensive looking grills, professional looking servers, & popularly hip music. What caught my attention the most was a projector showing music videos of not only well known recent English music, but they also have popular Korean groups also. I find myself dancing & singing along.  The servers are very helpful in recommending what to order. They're able to describe each dish or drink well enough to make a decision. They also give honest opinions on whether one thing is better than another thing.  The meats were served looking really fresh & presented really well on a plate. Of all the Korean barbecue places not one where I've seen the meat served already seasoned.  Not many Korean barbecue places I know have a Happy Hour or lunch special. This place has pretty good deals on their appetizers & meat. For the money you spend at all you can eat places, you'll have a better experience here compared to any other Korean barbecue place in Vegas. Drinks, meats, food, desserts - you can definitely taste the difference in quality & you can even make others jealous with a picture of a nice presentation too!

y48PYzRzLkJ4tXLUULir8A.text: Wow! New favorite restaurant in Las Vegas hands down. The amount of food in the 'Las Vegas Dinner' was enough for me and my girlfriend plus some extra. The service was great! Joseph, our server, was attentive, friendly, and checked in on us the right amount of times (not too many or too little). 2tbBrwyiY6vjTLmyn9HAQw.text: Awesome! Best Korean bbq, nice setting too. Meat lovers for two was enough for 3 of us. Will definitely be back

rzlX-Z05MnbJNHh0ubVxtA.text: Great deal for Happy Hour ! Discounted prices for appetizers and meats. Its like $3 for an order of pork belly or beef toro (brisket).   Came here for "dinner" before an event i had to go to, with a friend. She had been here before and was on the way, so had me order (before it hit the end of Happy Hour time). She liked the Pork Belly and Pork Toro.   Service by this young korean waitress was superb. Very friendly and funny.   We had ordered 3 pork belly, 1 pork toro, 2 toro beef, and 1 prime kalbi.   The pork toro (pork cheek) isn't discounted. - $5.95 - As the "toro" name suggests, it is highly marbleized with some thick areas of fat on the edges. This isn't the first time i've had pork cheek (similar to pork neck meat as well). When cooked properly, and a good quality meat, it should have a super tender texture, and "crispy". Not like a hard crispy but like crisp to bite through. I cooked it in a way where it seared the fat giving it a nice crisp in the fat. The pork toro is NOT marinated or seasoned in any way. Quality, to me, seems not up to what i had imagined. Overall still not bad, but could be better. But pork cheek/neck meat is quite expensive. somewhere along $10-15/lb, wholesale. X_x   Prime kalbi - $8.45 - quality wise, wasnt that good either. For them to put the "prime" name, id expect a high quality cut of meat, flavorful and tender. Not to the point of aged meats, but you know what i mean. The prime kalbi is seasoned with some slight marinade topped with some finely minced garlic? Pieces are a fair thickness. Cooks nicely. Not as tender as i hoped, nor was it as marbleized as i have had this cut in other places.   Toro Beef - $3.45 - otherwise quoted as "Beef Brisket". By no means it is the Toro i was thinking of. It is straight up brisket, similar to that of what you get any where else. Misleading name, but i guess it was my fault for believing it may be more towards to the Toro name vs the quoted brisket name. Thin slices of meat. Cooks fast. Simple as that.   Pork belly - $2.95 - surprisingly, this was probably the best of the 4 items we had ordered. Even compared to the pork toro or prime kalbi. sad but surprising. Lol. Simple pork belly cuts.   Overall, not bad experience. Priced fair during happy hour. Pretty sure i wouldn't be ordering the meats not during happy hour though. Nice place to try if you are in the area.   They have a lot of appetizers discounted during Happy Hour as well. Didn't try any though.

0OxHg75EAFk3psyrZU_gTw.text: Holy moly no wonder there are so many 5 star reviews of this place on Yelp!  If you have time while you're in Vegas and want to get KBBQ, come here! It's not AYCE but the portions for the set menus are more than enough. It's even numbers so 2 or 4 people (or 6). The tables aren't really meant for more than 6 people though it doesn't seem so don't go with too big a party unless you're willing to sit at different tables.   Otherwise, just go here already. Don't bother reading my review or any of the other 4000+ reviews. Just go and order a set and any other extras you want. You'll be satisfied, guaranteed. Not only is it good, but the price is great considering you don't have to eat on the strip. Just do it.

xpbLLUNWoQFf7pt-ESmSsw.text: This place is wonderful. It was very fast service. They also brought us extra stuff. Please a relatively small place so expect a wait if you go during peak hours.

QAiVhq7Fm22Kk4lvPoLXBA.text: After a 14 hour drive from Oregon we were starving and got there around 10p to find out it was Happy Hour, Score!! The happy hour portions were just right. The meat was soft and flavorful. We had the bulgogi, pork belly and Spicy Chicken with lemon sauce. Mushroom medley was simple, but paired well with the meats. The macaron ice cream sandwiches topped off the evening. Staff was kind. Will definitely visit this place the next time we are in town. Aloha!

VOUu2OSfMpvzi_tskwRrRQ.text: Great food we had the meat lovers BBQ! Food was delicious and the service was great ! Would definitely come again !

OW629t232KctM9NZhB1H1w.text: Best Korean food I think I've ever had! The flavors were spot on for EVERYTHING (and I mean everything!). We ordered 6 different cuts of meat (spicy chicken, spicy pork, harami miso, kalbi, bulgogi, and regular pork). It was deliciously marinated and juicy and easy to cook yourself. I didn't even need the side sauces. The kimchi was perfectly spicy and the cucumber side dish was nicely sweet. The miso soup had the perfect temperature and flavor. Rice was perfectly cooked as well and service was extremely friendly and very attentive. Best part of it was all that came out to a price that was very affordable and reasonable for lunch (because you're off the strip). Highly highly recommend!!  Edit 3/1/17: came here again by myself and sat at the bar. I ordered several cuts of meat and the rock shrimp. When you sit at the bar you don't get to cook the meat yourself which I didn't realize. Honestly I was kind of happy about that because it takes so long to cook everything that sometimes it's just nice to sit back and relax and eat instead lol. They brought everything out quickly and it was just as tasty as before, as far as the flavors go. The cuts of meat were a little on the chewier side compared to last time (although ever so slightly it wasn't a big deal) but maybe also thicker and bigger from what I remember? ... maybe lunch vs dinner portion? Not sure. But still a great meal overall and this time I tried the side sauces which were really nice. Wait staff was on point again as well. Funny enough, they saw me on yelp adding this edit and my mochi ended up being on the house. Again, lots of great food for a great price with great service (why I always prefer to eat off the strip) Woo!

vkGnONie2g2ezYC6TOhlFw.text: Such a banging ass restaurant. They placed Korean K pop hip hop rap videos - pretty cool. I'm from NYC and love KBBQ - this place was dope good food ! Service was coolio toolio. LV REPPIN

kayNB7V62pZBqikj-kvFow.text: This is PERFECT for all of you that do not want AYCE KBBQ. There aren't many of you, but if you're like, who really can't eat all that much in one sitting, it's excellent. Come during happy hour (1130am-5pm and then again after 10pm) and it'll be better bang for your buck.  We didn't eat much and was still really content and full (for me, at least). We only got short ribs, which they do remove the bones for you so it's just all meat. Then, we got beef brisket, which is pretty typical, as well as 2 orders of pork belly. I'm sad no tripe but I'll live. There are a lot of other things on the menu but I'm not a fan of marinated meat at KBBQs.  During my second visit, I got pork cheek, which was my first time eating it so I'm not sure how I feel about it yet... I wouldn't say everything is awesome-tasting but it's not too bad.  They've got a small selection of desserts but we only got ice cream ($1.95). Flavors: vanilla, green tea, and strawberry. It's a good portion size.  I doubt I'll come when it's not happy hour so there you go. But if you're in the area during happy hour, why not?
