gsWoG_qTTgSMLWTpsRZK4w.text: Food was average, but if service was even "okay" I would've rated this place higher. The service was an absolute mess. It first started with our extremely rude server who gave us attitude after we put in our order(???) Then we were completely neglected throughout the meal but they were so quick to pick up empty plates. Priorities right? Well, we then put our card out on the check and out of the 6 servers, 4 looked at it and walked right past us several times.   I work at a korean bbq place and was expecting a little more attention because that's just how korean bbq works, but nope. They had about 6 servers on an (extremely) slow weekday afternoon and it still seemed like they weren't tending tables well.    Definitely won't be recommending this place to my friends who are visiting anymore.   (There was ONE server who was so so kind and he def was hulling everyone else's asses. Wish I could've gave all the tip only to him..)

RZGXv2hm9H3SWnvK2Z50sg.text: Another day, another opportunity for KBBQ. This place is always a must go if you're having the same craving. Located near the strip and the airport, it's a good place for a wide variety of delicious food. Sometimes it can be picked, but for the most part you won't have a long wait. The only downfall compared to other kbbq places is that it's not all you can eat; other than that there's no cons of this place. Always check in on yelp for a free macaroon ice cream of your choice!

t7ISMhS9tX8jHmGMrYY7BQ.text: Really good food!  Went here twice on our trip to Vegas - Bulgogi and Spicy pork were amazing - loved the mushroom too. The icecream Macaroons were delicious too! Really fast service.

bDvK387Uh0UnFj5iFsQbDQ.text: Awesome dining experience!  The meats were amazing.  Definitely a fun memory and we will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YDJuEc84fA3xT0mDwohOPw.text: What can I say? Place has a good selection of meat. I love how the pork belly is not too thick. I also like their salads, it's very light compare to other BBQ restaurants. I also like how this is not an all you can eat place. Too much meat is no good. The sides are OK. This is actually my third time coming here when I'm in town. I'll be back again.

zTGtehngETN17f2sV4nNlg.text: Great food condiments/sides.  Room temp macaroni salad not so much.  With that said still gets 5 stars.  Typical Asian BBQ and what you would expect.  This place was clean and servers attentive. Bulgogi and spicy chicken was very tasty. Make sure to check in on yelp and get your complimentary macaroon. This was delightful.  Basically, this is a sure thing for a great experience.  Can't miss.

ANSDhyv4f17O_AZHVGPpqQ.text: Delicious!!! We had the 2 person premium dinner for the 3 of us. No pictures to post because we gobbled it up too quickly. Highly recommend this off the strip restaurant.

kCHtLM0CEzGXRskFh3RNNw.text: So worth it! We ordered the meat lovers package and didn't try a single thing we wouldn't order again. All the sides compliment the meats perfectly and their chili dumplings are perfect. Definitely coming back. Laid back environment. Friendly staff

868iVqfC5vswJCI3WGnXWg.text: Wonderful Korean restaurant located just off The Strip. We ordered the "Gangnam" dinner - at $65ish for 2 people it's not bad for Vegas prices, AND you get a ton of food that was way better than any buffet here. (My favorites were the fresh oysters and bulgolgi bibimbap). The main course is a medley of beef dishes that you cook yourself - we cooked them one at a time so we could enjoy them separately like a wine tasting. Fortunately all the beef cuts had a distinct flavor and texture so we didn't get burnt out on eating a ton of the same thing over and over. (To be honest, we probably could have saved $20 and got the "Las Vegas" dinner for 2, which also seems like a ton of food, but that has chicken and shrimp dishes instead of beef and I don't trust myself to cook those properly)  The service was friendly and attentive, the wait time was reasonable, the location was easy to get to and parking wasn't a hassle. Plus the ventilation was excellent because we didn't walk away smelling like food. Absolutely no complaints about this place and I would even go back next time we're in Vegas.

KOxNrIS5DD4IxHN8njgy-A.text: One of the best Korean BBQ places here in Vegas. The service is always great and really fast. Happy hour has some really good deals that will save you a few bucks.   My girlfriend and I always order a variety of meats and sides. Bulgogi, spicy pork, tongue, brisket, steamed egg and cheesy corn.  Bulgogi has the perfect marinate of sweetness to it, spicy pork is deliciously spicy. Tongue is my favorite, super thinly sliced and the brisket is great too. Steamed egg is always cooked to perfection and my girlfriend is obsessed with the cheesy corn. They also bring out a few sides on the house (kimchi, mac salad, dipping sauces and other veggies).   This is not all you can eat, but for the price and quality I would choose this over any AYCE Korean bbq place.

AZ-_JkObWxYj2E1x774ulw.text: I don't know much about Korean food scene in Las Vegas. Coming from SoCal, I'm relatively spoiled. The meats here are just average. Likewise for the side dishes. I like that the restaurant is spacious, grilling tables are probably the largest I've ever seen.

eFjn1T5pBDxHU5fNYLh8mw.text: Amazing place with excellent service and a friendly atmosphere. Jin was an awesome host and Eric was a terrific server. Thanks for a great meal.

N2L0iilnDdtIDPtJSX8sdw.text: Excellent food, excellent service. Definitely on my top 5 of places to eat in Vegas. Get there early or be prepared to wait. You won't be mad about the wait as soon as they start bringing out the food.

4L4yiNDprRL-7g_RJBm4NQ.text: This place is amazing. So much to choose from and everything was delicious. The noodles and the marinated kalbi was my favorite. The staff was super friendly and I'll definitely be coming back. Btw try the banana tempura and the strawberry macaroon!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

68uXGPrrYJ4Ex8TJX168Rw.text: Great quality meats and the staff was amazing! Always kept my cup of water full! The meats didn't have as much flavor as I would've liked but over all great experience.

QUPTnMI3oXt5rz-xv97Rsw.text: We had the best experience here. The food was exceptional and the staff was delightful. We had an awesome time and next time we are in Vegas this will be one of our top choices.

OPPdOkW93RAR5ZdOmKBwag.text: Great food, worth the price and you cant even finish it all because it was so much. Loved it! Will come back. Nice stuff, everything clean

tRm76z4AvucaaUCDKIYgfg.text: The amount of raving reviews is what brought me to Gangnam the other night. It felt like it was meant to be by the way that we found parking right up front and once inside the wait didn't seem as long as I imagined it would be on a summer night.  Sadly to say I can't write a review about how great the food was or comment on the attentive service like everyone else. I really wanted to stuff my face with KBBQ but as we were waiting for a table, a giant cockroach ( I mean, that thing was huge! That's what she said) blessed us with his presence in the waiting area and so our party decided to find somewhere else to have dinner.  Sure, I know that this is the desert and there are bugs everywhere but how appetizing is that?  I guess it just wasn't meant to be after all.

OQxm6liqOHyBNz4iXtF1Yg.text: Great service quality food would love some lettuce wraps included but the place is in a word awesome.

k4bNlqQnzKcLm-sHrNz4nQ.text: THE BEST Korean bbq in town . Reasonable prices and amazing staff the remembers you. Definitely my go to place.

xlOsoNDM9ud8qlkKnR70ng.text: It p good.  Food is good. infinite appetizers. Nice service.  They got a dope projector in the restaurant that shows constant music videos.  We came for lunch and paid the 12.95 for two proteins.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You know food is good when they playing Young thug in the joint

K15FG0MaDJ5DQMYbo5Kc8g.text: Excellent happy hour twice a day. It's like the Korean version of Gyu-Kaku. Also the servers are awesome. They're fun and helpful. Try their BimBimBap!

WDwS5JcCE_R_dsSI29Jd8Q.text: Hands down the best Korean BBQ restaurant I've visited. Their happy hour is everyday from 4-6pm and the menu is solid; Three different types of meat- bulgogi, pork belly, and beef toro; a handful of veggies and handful of appetizers in addition to their free appetizers. You can also get pitchers of beer on happy hour. I've gone with a party of 6 people and spent around $100 with everyone getting well fed. Plus, if you check in, you get free ice cream. Who doesn't want free ice cream?!

UCrOkUuRkyucqiitZHn7rw.text: Amazing food and wonderful service. Our server Ryan was awesome!!  The portions are really big. We went here after a week long hiking trip and ordered the Los Vegas dinner for two and it easily could have served four people. If you plan on going with two people order individually and if you go with four people order a meal for two- you won't be sorry.

nrLTKIpslha90y7Cf7imKQ.text: I've been to Vegas many many times in the last 5 years and never knew about this place. It's off the strip but only about 1.2 mi away (26 min walk). We made it just in time for Happy Hour and was surprised how good their HH menu was. 50% off appetizers/meat/beer/soju/sale! We ordered so much food for two and only spent about half of what we would've back home in San Jose!!   The food quality was really good and the service was even better. Everyone was super friendly and very attentive. Someone came around every few mins to see if we needed anything. They didn't try to rush us out even though there were people waiting to eat. This was probably the best experience/service/quality I had for Korean bbq in a long time.

The Kimchi and fried squid on side dishes are perfect. It could be the best kimchi I have eaten in Korean Restaurants.

KcN7eTltFWGpm2KkiBHVNQ.text: We waited for almost an hour before sitting down at a table. This place was packed and all the waiters/waitresses were very busy running from one place to another. We didn't get much service or explanation of what's what. We had Las Vegas for 2. The side dishes were delicious. The meats were just ok - two types of chicken, one beef, and 4 pieces of shrimp. The bibimbap was small and salty,  with no veggies or egg, not what we expected of a typical bibimbap. Overall portion is good, we were full and had another meals worth put in a box. The macaroon ice cream sandwich (free with yelp check in) was the best of the whole dinner.

3PlmTmdYbWXz85qqfgFtEw.text: I love the aged beef dish there. We usually just order the aged beef, Korea. Pancake and the kimchi soup.

xczc3oLYH1bcQ1fYt0GXBg.text: So this was my first (definitely NOT my last) Korean BBQ. It was actually subbing for a Wedding reception!  Where to start. Everything was great. Food quality was solid. I've been to plenty of Korean BBQ places and this place by far has THE BEST SERVICE HANDS DOWN! I can't say enough good things about this place. If you're in the mood for Korean BBQ and you're visiting , this is the place. If you live in Vegas, you're so lucky! Love this place!

It was so appreciated that they actually and wanted to make our visit right.  We definitely be back!!

8bVMS_oZPLRVhGoUn5xgPw.text: When it's cold outside BBQ inside! Great cuts of different varieties of meats and marinades. Delicious. When I come back to Vegas I will be coming back.

4TzsFlbfYrrOFpSflzUXBg.text: High quality meats and side dishes. Great prices for the deliciousness. Recommend the combos as they are a good value.

GansxqdsiIDXZBEweTGv1w.text: Fun place! Good food, complimentary sides, and free dessert! Got the steamed chili dumplings, which are made in house and are very good. Then the asparagus with bacon which was amazing. The prime Kalbi was delicious. The pork belly was good, though I thought it could have been better. Overall all the food was excellent, it's a fun experience, and you can check in on yelp for a free ice cream macaron!

8eMehXV4-BcNnaXOakoAyw.text: Gangnam is on point lots of meat and great flavor... sides are ok but the bulgogi bibmbop is fire.

Cp6Rm0kadBD3BFJgPeQ0kA.text: Marinated short rib....enough said!! Staff is awesome and food is better. Haven't had a bad dish here yet.  Look forward to trying others on my next visit.

wB_oJUZjh2VK74EKm7QX9g.text: When I'm in Vegas, I don't typically leave the strip, but we did last time. We came mid-afternoon so there was no wait. I'd say this lives up to the hype! Everything we ordered was really good, and the portions were generous! We had 3 people, and we ordered ordered one of the Korean BBQ sets for two plus two extra meat orders, thinking the set for 2 wouldn't be enough. It would have been enough. :)

mnG-vR7UceitPZKQSxEWLQ.text: Best Korean BBQ in town ! Portions are very generous and side dishes are great . Raw oyster, Kobe beef , and pork belly are must have here .

UJzr6tYWwai-CUn0sRDYVw.text: After reading such amazing reviews about this place my husband and I decided to stop by for a late dinner. We arrived around midnight and the place was still packed with people. We had to wait about 15 minutes to get seated at a table. The place was clean, dimly lit and had the ambience of a club. There was music and music videos playing on the big screen. On to the food -- my husband really wanted to try the Kobe style beef since he's been craving it ever since he got back from his trip to Japan. We ordered a plate of the Kobe style beef, a plate of the flat iron garlic beef and a plate of the pork belly. The pork belly and garlic beef were good but nothing that we can't get back home. The Kobe style beef was a huge disappointment! They cut the slices extra thick which is not how Kobe should be served. The texture was really rough and hard to chew. Normally I would be craving more after only one plate of beef but their Kobe beef made me not want to eat meat ever again. Needless to say, we ended up only eating 2 pieces and leaving the rest to be thrown away... there goes $20 into the garbage. I ended up just eating the side dishes for the rest of my meal. Other than the food, the service was good. The guy who checked us out was friendly and accommodating. For dessert we tried the mango macron which ended up being the best part of the meal. The macron was super crunchy and soft and melted in your mouth and the ice cream was easy to bite into and didn't melt in your hands. I would only go back for the macron ice cream.

oe2lTb8G-TRFX-e-QxKuLQ.text: On a Saturday night, this back of the strip mall restaurant provided an enjoyable time and good food (that you cook at your own pace). The place was 50% full when we went there round 8pm. However, I think this place draws a late crowd as it is open until 2 am. Attractive staff and modern style furnished the space.   Be aware when sitting down. Check for water from the exhaust hood above. As Korean BBQ gets hot and the ac runs cold to keep it cool, condensation builds and can drip on to the table or seat. The underside of my shorts got wet when I slid into the bench style seat. (-1 star).  This place is good for 2-4, and larger tables of 8 are in the back. Super fast service! Don't be shy to flag the servers down. 3 people ran the front of the house. All 3 were at out table at some point.  We ordered a set combination of things and every bit was great. They prepared bibimbap table side and opened our mushroom foil pouch too. The grill didn't get too hot but would try this place in the winter time.  The good was of high quality and at some point, thought it may be too much. Food, 4 beers, house sake = $85 before tip. Not bad!

Kdfydc2lVllB5RNs7n_6lw.text: This is probably the best Korean bbq I've had in Vegas to date. Good prices, great variety of sides, good quality of meat. Service was a little slow but not terrible. They were just quick to leave before everyone could get a request in. A little hard to find off the strip. Overall good experience.

R6MX1LVbKLp2y6ePYEXWSA.text: I haven't tried them all, but the best Korean BBQ I've had in town. The Harami Miso was great. I especially enjoyed all the Kim Che side dishes, they were very fresh and flavorful without being buried in heat. First review for a free dessert. Well worth it, the macaron ice cream was awesome

YMYFwP40Zgn0e7p-Az5Ncg.text: Food and service was great. Would def recommend it!! The marinated short ribs and the bulgogi were fantastic.

OlEbVJMLnSCtMfMU38CTwQ.text: We came here because of the great yelp reviews....the reviews don't lie!  The food is excellent and the staff are extremely nice.  The marinated meats are absolutely the best options...they're delicious.  That's saying a lot for someone that very rarely eats animals.  We will 10000% be back really soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice set up

PtF0Hyb8LE-Gkxj24_20bA.text: My favorite place for Korean!  I usually go here for their BBQ, but lately I've been coming here to order off the menu.  They're soups and rice dishes are over-looked because, well of course, they're BBQ is freaking fantastic!  Everything is seasoned and flavored properly.  The service is extraordinary!  Although it's not "all you can eat," they have great packages for an inexpensive price... It divides out evenly the same price as its "AYCE" competitors.  The quality is better than the competitors too!

PT4vOIvxpvzApJuETY4Zow.text: Best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas! Service is excellent, prices are great and the food is delicious. Will definitely be back again for more!

BFv3WJtvc6DnjGLMoQpzpg.text: Don't let the 4000+ reviews fool you; the only reason Gangnam has this many reviews is because they hand out free desserts when customers show them completed yelp reviews, and they are undoubtedly skewed high as no dogs bite the hands that feed them.  This restaurant lags far behind other Korean BBQ joints in New York and Los Angeles particularly in terms of service, and while the food was solid it was by no means outstanding.  Food: We ordered the steamed egg which was way overcooked.  The BBQ dishes were decent however and the portions are all solid given the price.  The japchae was also on point.    Service: Nothing against the waiters as service was prompt, but the level of service was just not up to par for a Korean BBQ restaurant.  At the other restaurants I've been to servers cook the food for the customers, not to mention that beef and pork dishes are cooked on different specialized grill tops.  Once the meats are cooked the servers will slice them into bite-sized morsels.  Gangnam leaves the customers to do all of this on their own, and throughout dinner there was only one grill top which no one bothered to switch out even after the top was charred black.  The fan above the grill was also either off or not very strong so smoke was everywhere.

9zyX7dgd9KfB1FWHqNLPMQ.text: One of the best Asian bbq places my boyfriend and I have eaten at. The egg souffle was surprisingly amazing. We had the gangnam which was good. Top few dishes we had were the bibimbap and Kobe carpaccio and of course the egg souffle. Must come if you are visiting las Vegas only 6-10 dollars away on a uber.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gangnam - with egg soufflé (must get) and beef carpaccio.

q1h7-wXjGhj7seN83VgbQA.text: Nice ambiance, friendly and efficient service and tasty food! And close to the strip :)

PNjR0ZAUNo9UXbTU6A76zg.text: The food and service was great but it was weird we had to cook the BBQ. Every other one I've been at they cooked it in front of you.

DtVExzRffS1sV7L4ISfeWQ.text: Great service and great food. Came here right at the lunch hour and we got our seats right away. The best part, to avoid smelling like Korean BBQ all day, they can cook the meat for you. No lunch special menu during the weekends tho.

DYdF7DT3C64GZtfH20fteQ.text: sooooooooooo goooooooooooooooooooooood. tons of awesome banchans, fresh meats, and the dipping sauces are great.

Bulgogi rice - also too sweet  Come if you are hungry! Fun atmosphere. Won't come back though, unless I am craving sugar

xXweDzZxJITBKiG3NwRiDg.text: Very disappointed with our experience at Gangnam last night.  We were a party of seven and before our six and seven were seated the waitstaff were already trying to take our order.  We were then persuaded by the waitstaff to order the 'Meat Lovers' combo for six which they informed us comes with three servings of each meat.  Two servings of meat later our grills were turned off and the dessert menu placed in our hand.  We informed the waitstaff that we were expecting another serving of meat but we were quickly shrugged off and informed that we received our three servings and that they were split among the trays on either side of our table.  Problem is they never brought the second tray with our third serving of meat.  Save yourself the trouble and go somewhere that does all you can eat with better pricing and doesn't try to swindle their customers.

P5GdMCLXQMzI3Dm3s7hK8A.text: Came here for dinner with my friends for a birthday. The food was amazing. The staff is friendly and very quick to bring out your side dishes and meats. The food was delicious and the restaurant was kept nice and clean. I had a great experience here and will definitely be back. Our most favorite item was the marinated short ribs. Also I am a big dumpling fan and let me tell you the steamed chili dumpling is a must !!! Also they were so nice  to keep the birthday cake in the fridge and brought it out lit with the candles I brought! Awesome customer service !

nzNUoiYfBoqvYwZmYp5P0g.text: This was my first time that I was at a Korean restaurant that does not serve roasted corn tea.  Instead, they offered me black or green tea ... which was brought out as a cup of hot water with a tea bag in it.  Very disappointing.  Should have left right then and there.  Asian place that serves tea like that can't be good.   We ordered three beef sides for our bbq.  Banchan included macaroni salad (?!?) and old, soft kimchi. The meats were tender and had good flavor, but the portion sizes were so small!  These were the smallest portion sizes I have ever had in a Korean bbq place. We also ordered lettuce and miso paste side ($2.50) to make bbq wraps, but what we got was celery sticks and romaine lettuce.  How do you wrap romaine lettuce?  In total, we spent ~$50 and left filled with mostly rice...   Service: although served relatively fast, the waiter never stopped by to ask if we need a refill (water, sides) on anything.  Considering what you get for the money spent, I do not recommend this place.  And all the people giving this place five stars ... do yourself a favor, look for a better place.  There are better places.

qHTAi_MLGBqqSWLR2ohqSw.text: So Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining has been opened for awhile, but I only just noticed it very recently.  It is a Japanese and Korean DIY BBQ restaurant, where you can order items a la carte or from one of their many preset combinations.  It is a similar concept to Yagu (on the West side) and many other J or KBBQ restaurants in California.  Based on reading the past reviews (very helpful in convincing me to drive to this side of town for just a meal and go then back) and the photos posted for this business and comparing it to my first hand experience here, I can deduced that the restaurant has experimented with various promotions before settling on their current all day Happy Hour promotion.  Gone are their lunch special menu or previous versions of their HH menu.  Now you get 1/2 off selected beverage items and discounted menu items.  The food I was served was good and tasted even better when cooked properly and to the exact doneness that I want.  And since it was not AYCE, I did not felt subconsciously compelled to overindulge during the meal with the final destination dangerously close to meat coma station.  Price was reasonable, not cheap when you add everything up, but you get good quality for the price.  The server was very friendly and helpful, as was the owner or the restaurant manager/model (yeah, she definitely exudes the essence of Gangnam style). The restaurant itself looks very nice (posh with well executed design and decoration).  Suggested party size for dining here is up to 4 per table, as you have to share the grill built into the table.  Don't wear anything that you don't want smelling like it was generously sprayed with the delicious smell of sweet BBQ smoke after you leave or have a change of cloth for going back to work. Best time to come is after work so you can take advantage of their HH drink specials without having to feel like an alcoholic for the 2nd part of your work day.  Bulgogi, Korean Prime Short Rib and the Kurobuta (Japanese Pork) Sausage was what I ordered to be grilled and is what I would recommend to others trying out this restaurant.  No free banchan here, but you can order their Kimchee and Pickles (both are $0.00) to compliment your meal.  Solid 4 stars experience based on the service, food, atmosphere and price to value.

Fk_-MOJirn6d5zcJ-LnVMQ.text: My wife and I went to Gangnam at a time that I thought was way too early for lunch. We arrived just before 4:30pm and casually walked into the restaurant only to find that every table was occupied. We were put on the waiting list (we were the only name, but look at the time) and had to wait about 10 minutes for our table. By 5:00pm, the waiting area was completely packed! What had we stumbled upon?   For $59, we ordered the Meat Lover Combo for 2. It included complimentary banchan (sides), 2 bowls of rice, 2 miso soup, a salad, seaweed salad, 4 steamed dumplings, and six meats including pork belly, spicy pork, bulgogi, kalbi, brisket, and filet mignon. We could have splurged a little and gone for some higher quality cuts, but my wife and I are pretty simple people. The setup is very thoughtful and patrons are encouraged to cook their own meat (at some Korean BBQ's, the servers get annoyed if you grill yourself). On the table includes a pair of scissors, two tongs, and just about everything you'd need to grill on your own. Even still, the servers were very active and ready to take care of your needs. The whole combo is well thought out except the dumplings. Since the theme of the dishes is Korean with Japanese influences, the dumplings (very Chinese style) are very misplaced. I would have preferred an order of romaine lettuce ($2) in place of the dumplings.    One side note about the side dishes-the kimchi was so good! It was perfectly ripe, which can be tricky at restaurants that do such a high volume of business.  My wife and I definitely enjoyed our dining experience and would love to order using the a la carte menu in the future.

7CS2UGpB8vIDhc6Lc1WCZg.text: We saw the reviews on this place, so we decided to have lunch here. We came on a Saturday afternoon, around 2-3pm. The menu was easy to read, the staff were friendly and accommodating, and the prices weren't bad. The food was great. We chose the "meat lover's"  package and ate everything. Mg9qZ3Bkv10c2sP4dnXcNQ.text: It was delicious. Excellent, fast service and my best friend absolutely loved it. She said it was some of the best Asian food she's ever had. And Jin, the host, is super cute!

9WuU3ryfn473KrwrYL0Tqw.text: When I first saw this place on yelp, I was pretty ecstatic. Who can beat four thousand reviews and 4.5 star rating?   The servers here seem to be pretty nice and the customer service is pretty good. I didn't have any issues with ordering food or having things come out too late.   The meat quality is alright. I ordered the Korean Prime Kalbi, Prime Kalbi, and Harami Miso which looked amazing, but it was the ultimate blue ball. They were well marbled which I loved, but it was surprisingly tough... what a disappointment. The beef looked to be on par with that of Magal Korean BBQ, but when you bite into it, you can tell that there is a huge difference in quality. The banchan here was surprisingly good, but the bibim nangmyun was not quite where I wanted it to be. They need to put less chilled broth in it because it was almost indistinguishable from mul nangmyun.   The only redeeming quality of this place is the price. I ordered 3 plates of beef and an order of Bibim Nangmyun and it came out to roughly $50 with tax and tip. If I were to order the same stuff at Magal, it would be roughly $80 to $90.  All in all, this is a so-so korean bbq spot that made me reminiscent of home, but it was nothing spectacular. The service is good, but the beef quality is forgettable. After my experience here, I was wondering how so many people could think this place is so damn amazing, but then I saw a little sign on our table. They offer free macaron ice cream for every review that is written. They pretty much bribe people into writing good reviews for a free dessert.   If you come here looking for Korean BBQ nirvana, keep on looking. If you want a moderately priced and decent quality BBQ joint, this may be for you. Just don't expect amazing things from here.

pDQWLXw2knBfK6RnV8sfoA.text: I came to Gangnam during happy hour and ordered a la carte. At first I thought I was kinda sucky that this was a Korean BBQ place that wasn't AYCE and I thought our bill was gonna end up being really pricey for all the things we ordered (spicy seafood soup w/ tofu, cream cheese wontons, salmon carpaccio, toro beef, and pork belly), and I also thought that I wouldn't leave feeling full.   But I was SO wrong. The quality of the meat blows Tofu Hut, Sura, and all those other KBBQ joints out of the water. Yeah, it's a bit pricier, but the quality definitely makes it worth it.   The soup was delicious. It came with rice on the side, which I used to eat my meat with. THAT SALMON CARPACCIO THOUGH!! That was probably my favorite thing we ordered that night. I highly recommend giving it a try. Even the cream cheese wontons were really good!  The layout and decor of the restaurant has a modern feel to it. They have big booths along the side walls and tables in the middle. They also play American and Korean music videos on the wall.   Not to mention the service/servers are beyond excellent. My waitress was attentive, informative, and very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon carpaccio, spicy seafood &amp; tofu soup, cream cheese wontons, toro beef (front), pork belly (back)

1xnufb9AHRPzFMIaauQjxw.text: Enjoyable evening.  Limited choices of meat vs other KB we've been too.  Limited sides.  Ask for one of the sides to be replenished was told no longer available.  Staff attentive but staunch.  It was good but I've had better.  Not sure I'll be back.

Wlw03yFbK6lD3xEamjVCzA.text: I've found my new favorite place. Basically, if you ever thought, "I could cook this myself!" well then, you are in heaven. Tons of options and only yourself to blame if it's not cooked right.   Great appetizers, tons of meats to try, REVERSE HAPPY HOUR 10pm to close. Even if you got something you didn't like (or just messed up cooking it), the prices are great.  Spicy Tuna Kimbap:  awesome as an appetizer to start. The serving is HUGE. You won't feel shorted when you order. You may get scalp sweats, but that's a good thing.   Chili Garlic Wings: These were fine, not the best wings you've ever had but pack plenty of meat and flavor.  Bulgogi: People seem to love this. It's not great. It's the meat I liked the least. Consistency is gummy. It's a sticky meat. Has a bit of a jerky taste to it. Impossible to really cook on the grill. It's a pass for me.   Pork Belly: It was good. It wasn't as flavorful as I thought but it melts in your mouth. They do give you plenty of strips so it works out that way. Plenty of trays to dunk it in too.  Filet Mignon: How could you say no to this? Of course, the cuts are tender and succulent. Probably the thing that works against it is that they are THICK cuts. Eating it usually involves putting the WHOLE chunk in your mouth. But it's filet mignon, it is delicious.  Flat Iron Garlic: Great garlic flavor, thinner cuts make cooking and eating this a tad bit easier that the Filet. Plenty of meat to dip too.  But really everything we had was good. Even the Bulgogi wasn't that bad. Seems like you can't go wrong here. That's a sign of a great place to eat.

TZQKOcadwJYsgRGjqAbp7g.text: Great food with great service! Really enjoyed my time here with my girlfriend. Love this place!

You get soup, appetizer, and the meat along with rice. What some other reviews were saying about how this place is a less expensive version of Gyu-Kaku, I would agree. You'll be super satisfied so it's a must-try if you're ever in Vegas!

When we walked in, there were so many people waiting inside. So I thought this is a great sign. This place must be good. We waited over an hour and finally got seated. We ordered some short ribs and balgogi, soft tofu soup, and a clear noodle dish.   All the meat just taste like balgogi, pure sweet, has no kick at all. Soup was too salty. Calamari was blend, I don't understand why they mark it as "must try".  I have korean friends, and I visited bounch korean restaurants. Nothing were like this sweet.   I am very disappointed, since I saw this place on yelp when I was at salt lake a week ago.   The only thing that's okay was their kimchi.

The side dishes are also underwhelming. The deokbokki was perfectly al dente though, and the kalbi was also super tender. The food comes out fairly quickly and the staff was very pleasant. The bill came out to be about $35 a person. However,  compared to other korean BBQ places I've been to for the same price the offering tends toward measly.

kLauT53btd_XWzwiWo4O2w.text: Ordered a Meat Lovers special for 4 and a Bulgogi bimbimbap, fed enough for 6 people. Service was for the most part good, a little slow due to the Christmas Day lunch rush. But most importantly, food was delicious! I would recommend this place for Korean BBQ around Vegas.   P.s. Ask for Jin, he's very nice and kind.

StTHzZ9RgkNADWCxUKFLqA.text: I'm puzzled by all the good reviews of this restaurant. Has nobody in Las Vegas ever had well-prepared Korean food? I was appalled by the meal I was served this evening. It was a graceless, ill-seasoned, flavorless mess. It was as if someone had decided to prepare a "Korean meal" at home, threw  "Asian sauces" on a few vegetables, made a salad, put chunks of cheap raw meat on a board, and served it up with a big hopeful smile.    I was able to eat the oysters, and there was some tofu thing that wasn't awful, but the rest of it was either offensively nondescript or downright repulsive. Has this place never heard of doenjang?  The surprise hard boiled egg hidden in the salad gave me sufficient energy to get back to my hotel. Otherwise, that was a rather expensive non-meal.  To be clear: this isn't Korean food. This is crudites and cheap raw meat. You could do it at home for $5.

J7XUKkIEGWgBjTPVWScDEQ.text: Food is very good but service not good. Maybe needed more help. Example we asked for lemon, we had to asked 3 times .

CbHn-Hb8A1an1fqHQACgRA.text: This was probably the best Korean BBQ I've  had. All the meat was extremely tender. We did the meat lovers and I was expecting the meat to be tough and chewy, but it was so tender. All the sides were delicious. I also tried the spicy tuna appetizer and the fried wontons which were also super yummy. The server was super sweet and even asked if our cocktails were made to our liking! Who does that? I don't live in Vegas but if I did this would definitely be one of my go to places. So in the meantime I will recommend it you you tellers. Enjoy!

1yPnnoW6Kvh0N0hEPZyupQ.text: The wait is long but it is 100 and 10% worth it! I love how all their meats a juicy. Also if you get any of the marinated meats they are amazing! Also The service here is impeccable!! They always get great tips from me. One thing I recommend is either getting here early or getting a reservation because it's always packed.

qYMaDJeDAVYyEaIJCvhU2w.text: It's so delicious ~ I feel happy and excited. . This is so amazing services. .I prefer  choosing bibmbap and kalbi.

gHUdA4hrFggEDdkWZXQ7VA.text: Food was awesome! Had a big group so we decided the gangnam feast. Definitely a lot of food. Unlimited Kim chi plates. Six plates of flavorful meat. And good mini starters. Definitely recommend if your with a big group!

In fact,  I am going to soak up the meat juices off my plate with a napkin so I can smell it later and reminisce about how great this restaurant is.

oj1FnZcKjbpesvyb_iaJ1g.text: Second time here and love it every time I'm in town. On this occasion brought my family and my parents and we all enjoyed it!

Q14_dCzBMO1oq80eKPWKDw.text: Tried this place when we were in town for a night. Ordered WAY TOO MUCH food. If you get one of their platters it is enough food without adding any apps. Would have given this place 5 stars because the food was great but the service wasn't as helpful as I would have liked. But I would have ordered the Tuna Poki and Cream Cheese Rangoon even knowing that we had too much food. They were both amazing!!!  It was out first time there and with Korean BBQ and we didn't really know what we were doing. The waitress we had disappeared for a while and didn't explain very well what was going on. If you are familiar with self-grilled Korean BBQ I'm sure you'd love it. A heads up if you've never had Soju, it tasted like vodka to me, not Sake. Sake is much easy to sip, I had to drink the Soju like a shot.

5JZF0aKgQElbZkOZIMeobw.text: Great place to eat. Had happy hour and dishes were definitely affordable. Just wish rice was free.

gxJLjNNNn8pYLdop0U2zWQ.text: Excellent food and service!!!  The servers are very prompt and attentive. Will come back.

53Dci3obAv4PMuIgfEPGtQ.text: My fav K-bbq spot in Las Vegas! The location is great, good hours for late night grub, great prices, and quality of food is amazing! The dynamite shrimp is a must have. My favorite meat is the Bulgogi beef and the Korean prime kabli. The Kimchi is always good and aged well. Servers are fast and attentive. Eventually I did notice some leftover grease splatters that took away from the ambience, but it was high above the tables.... but don't touch the wall light. It's gross. The selections could be mixed with different type of veggies instead of all looking orange colored.

NKuvWnnvF6mgvVtntzRtfw.text: Marinated beef Kalbi is delicious , flavorful, and tender. Must order this! Green tea maroon ice cream sandwich is very good.

K5GXsLtE-3Tz8_nqUEoJ0A.text: ATMOSPHERE: Went in on a weeknight and there was a large party in the back and a few tables taken in the general area. The atmosphere reminded me of an upscale clean Korean BBQ restaurant that I had visited in California and you can't find that in most Las Vegas locations. It is well-ventilated, dimly-lit and the dark and red tones are romantic.  FOOD: my boyfriend and I ordered the Original Bibimbap $10 and the Korean Pancake with Thrifty's Vanilla Ice Cream $5-6. The Bibimbap was delicious and the stone pot was so hot it made the some of the rice crispy, cooked the vegetables and marinated beef well but kept the juices flowing and our stomachs satisfied! The Korean pancake was kind of small  but the ice cream was Thrifty's and that alone was a point.  SERVICE: accommodating and quick! Served us quickly and efficiently. The servers took time to talk to us and find how we were doing.   Definitely a must try and the people working there are very nice. I say give it a try =)

nHThdlVJBgw9CX9lUC9hkQ.text: Absolutely delicious! This is by far the best Korean bbq I've ever had. We had one of the pre fixed dinner for 2 and everything was SO tender and well seasoned. The honey toast and macaroons were to die for! Definitely coming back!

i9PQWqAgiutcBXeWQzt8lA.text: Very welcoming environment. Very public place so expect a tad of a wait sometimes depending on when you go. Always a great place to have lunch or dinner. Do recommend to friends. Will be back soon, like always

1-AbLEYp0loafOG6hlXwAA.text: We went off the strip for our final meal before leaving Las Vegas on Thanksgiving weekend.  This Korean BBQ restaurant is on Paradise Road just behind the northern strip hotels.    Although the strip mall it is located in seemed busy, the restaurant itself was pretty vacant for a Sunday night at 6:30PM.    They gave us a menu with "happy hour" pricing on most of the food packages, which I'm not sure if that is given at all times or not.  Anyway, 4 stars.  The decor is really nice, the service is very attentive, the food was great.  They bring all the food to you. The Miso Soup was delicious. The meats were brought to our table, and they ask if you want assistance in cooking them at your table; however, we declined and cooked them ourselves.  Everything was fresh and delicious.    Minus one star for one reason only.  I thought the prices were a bit high with the "happy hour" pricing.  If the prices are truly higher during peak hours, I would definitely not come back.  At the "happy hour" prices, I would consider a return, although it is still a bit expensive for what it is.

8cEM6YIsUTvxWVrgqHfiIQ.text: I came here for dinner due to missing home cooked food during a vacation in Las vegas. The service compared to New York wasn't great. We had to cook our own meat, and the fact that we heard the waiters talking about tips in the background was getting annoying. The side dishes were sort of blend, but the meat quality was better than new york.

lgrj33m0gbh0yGjaI6e3kQ.text: First time having kbbq in the Vegas area! Definitely impressed by the quality of the meat but ESPECIALLY the seasonings. We ordered the meat lovers special for our party of 3. Even though the special was meant for 2 people, we were all content with the serving sizes.  The price is reasonable for the amount of meat they gave us. The service was exceptional as well, the female worker was very nice and friendly.  Would recommend to all friends who are in Vegas and who need their kbbq fix.

d3oI2feokiKXEQynrh9cuw.text: Great food! Great service! The meat lover is the way to go if you love meat! The extra Korean dishes are also very tasty.

xCTngXswkfxNxogcFsgKmg.text: Best Korean BBQ restaurant I've been too. Happy hour is the best time to go as you get the most bang for your buck. I only give it 4 stars instead of 5 because their bar was far bit too limited, and their regular menu outside of happy hour seemed pricey. But great service and amazing food.

kBKex32n9O8aAsOwduEFgA.text: Great food, great service, and very accommodating to my large family with a stroller and an active toddler. We will definitely be back!

XL21zttkT6Mt0VZpfE0Pew.text: They have a huge selection of Appetizers! It's not all you can eat but they do have combinations so you don't have to order the meat individually. Overall, we really enjoyed our experience! Definitely recommend :)

MOtm-JF1yzeKgtYTELuWyg.text: The food,service and atmosphere... all are great.  Meat lover set was big enough for 2 people. Free refills for Side dishes too.

sxKzQYKcbVhaZxdntBsmew.text: My boyfriend was craving some Kbbq and we wanted to try something new apart from Sura and Tofu Hut. I found this place on Yelp so we decided to try it. I wasnt expecting much since yelp stars cant be trusted sometimes. But OMG just as we walked in..Cute Korean Dudes.. lol. No but seriously, the staff were very accommodating and friendly. The place looked very clean, modern and spacious. We got there around 6pm and the place was packed. We got seated shortly after and Calvin, our waiter was very helpful in deciding what to get. We then ordered their Best Seller: Gangnam for 2, $65.95. We felt that the portions were perfect, mann we were stuffed. Then we had Honey Toast and Lava Cake for dessert..yummy! Apparently if you make a yelp review you get either a Lava Cake or Banana Tempura Ice Cream for free.  Our first time experience at this place was awesome. It just might be our new go-to place. The food, and the staff was great. I definitely would recommend this place. It is on the pricey side, but definitely worth it.

ZR897isILtqaUVmU87KNUw.text: The Harami Miso is really really good, definitely enjoyed it.  Pay attention to your temperature when grilling!  Very tasty at higher temperature! Wrapping with lettuces is a great and healthy way to eat too.  Was on a conference in Vegas, I am glad that we walked into this restaurant tonight.

SkOFqSaCIffBqODN2fIobQ.text: Hands down the best Korean BBQ I've ever had.  Great service, excellent meat and the price is affordable.

CVEaZqPaLYPgfWdvLTcfGA.text: Took a taxi all the way from the hotel. Ordered spicy seafood noodle and korean bean soup, first the bean soup is really salty. After they took it back and recoil seems a bit better. I recommend the spicy seafood noodle if you like spicy food, but no the bean soup, only few onion, cucumber, and tofu. There are 7 different side dishes, taste average. But the happy hour fried calamari is pretty good with the happy hour price.

3sSoxmmfnxAcJmnybpLsAQ.text: As a local half Korean, my Korean mother and I  frequently go to Korean restaurants while we are out shopping. We were in the area and decided to give this spot with over 4,000 reviews a try. We had big expectations! Perhaps this spot is a hit with tourists but we weren't impressed. First of all,  it irritates me as a culinary professional when restaurants use culinary terminology so loosely. I ordered Sukiyaki Noodle with Beef. If you know Japanese cuisine you know Sukiyaki. I was expecting noodles along with something that resembles Sukiyaki. After all that's what it's called, right? What I got was stir fried noodles with chunks of beef and sliced red peppers served in a stone pot. What is so Sukiyaki about this? Nothing in this dish is anything you would find in Sukiyaki. In Sukiyaki, the beef is thinly sliced rib eye and there is no red bell peppers in it but rather, spinach, shiitake mushrooms, onions, green onions, tofu, bamboo and yam noodles. More appropriately this should be called Yaki Noodle with Beef which simply is stir fried noodles. It looked nothing like the photo on the menu and the portion was very small. My mom had the bean paste soup and it was nothing special. The pickles were bland and lacking any flavor. We ate our lunch but knew we would not come back again. The service? My tea cup sat empty without any question if we would like more hot water.  I finally asked for more hot water since I was never offered it. For $2.50 for each hot tea? At other Korean restaurants in town, hot tea is complimentary.

svCh-qRblLIdgoDETvTRBw.text: Got the meat lovers for 4 people which was more than enough to feed the 5 of us. Food was great. Especially the marinated meats. Service was on point as well. My only complaint is that I wish they didn't server such small portions of side dishes at a time for a table of 5, which made it annoying constantly having to ask for more.

p2JQhJa5rffqK_IeEWIL1Q.text: This is the best Korean BBQ place in Vegas.  Quality of meat is superb.  This place utterly represents the best value in town.

vYMFvY4pNQf7qfFIzWYUaQ.text: Service was awesome. Went during happy hour 3-6pm which is a good deal for the selections they had. Food was delicious. A must try!

PcEXsYhA8VU4gDnGVoGLfw.text: My husband and I decided to go with the Gangnam combo. It was way overpriced! I feel like a fat ass for saying this but it was not enough meat. I'm spoiled by the generous portions from the other KBBQ places I've been to. The vegetables included in the combo were random and awkward too. The combo does not come with your traditional banchan (Korean side dishes). No kimchi, no lettuce, none of the usual Korean sauces for your meat. We did get three sauces-ponzu, glazed sauce, and a somewhat spicy sauce. It wasn't terrible but without my banchan, there was something lacking for sure. Yes, I realize it's not a traditional KBBQ restaurant-some Korean/Japanese BBQ fusion. The service was good though. The restaurant is modern, clean, and trendy but that's not enough for me to come back.

aX1OJcnnQzyQX39LQiW7qQ.text: Good price but some of the food was so so. I sampled a friends bbibimbap (sp?) and enjoyed that the most. The marinated prime rib was good as well. Beef tongue was not as enjoyable and the quality was not as good.

3FsSSGFjBrH_HC5pxzjNXg.text: Good food and plenty of it. The cuts were great and service was good. No complaints definitely recommend to try.

gNbFtMy06fMRu-0giA4xyA.text: Service was very good and the food was delicious.  This place was more of a fusion between American Japanese and Korean style BBQ.  The reason I say American Japanese, was because most of the marinated dishes was generally sweeter than the traditional Japanese meat marinates.  Overall it was a great experience.  Yummy

dP_NcIoVMwnEkAJOTZ1xbA.text: The meat and sauce are so good, very delicious!! Love it  so much!!! I've had meals at many Korean restaurants, but I'd love to say that this is one of the best Korean restaurants I've ever been! Also, the green tea Macaroon is excellent! This restaurant has many different choices, even people who do not have a very big appetite like me can also enjoy! Not an ad but I strongly recommend!!!

Hdo9rIlIct46iFemKvGcuA.text: Great place. Great atmosphere Great food. I would definitely come again. I enjoy the marinated short ribs the best.

FRhrlf3O-jhF1Nk80NrUBg.text: We came here for the happy hour after 10pm. We loved Beef Toro, mushroom assortment and hot sake from happy hour menu! In addition, the place got a nice ambiance, cozy booths and friendly stuff! Will be back again.

ps-2qSOJhfdvHSZdl6xqjQ.text: Legit Korean BBQ. Came here for happy hour although the meat off the regular menu was way better!

agDJeW5SCCJWn3XH-9Bw8w.text: Comming in on a bad day i guess. Restaurant does not have people to server everyone. People were cutting in front of us and got themselves seated. Waited a very long time for food. 40 min or more. One star so owner hire more people.  Free desert for honest review.

usM3Q1h2Qo4W4F412rGVsA.text: over all food is mediocre and very over priced. Service was also mediocre at best. They never came around unless we seeked them out even though we had a large group. Meat quality was below average. Meat was very tough to chew. And they charge for each side items. Tvs are also small and it's non HD. Even for Las Vegas standards the meet quality was sub par. Compared to LA/oc, this was a 1 star.

rGlYwGlToMTu29-zK7FxwQ.text: Great service and food it delish! Will be back here next time when I'm in vegas. Definitely recommended to all you food lovers.

ffXXsOIDae9YDw43Chk3uw.text: I love food... I love KBBQ. We found this place on Yelp, and we're in love with it. Great food. Great prices. Great service.  If you need KBBQ when you're in Vegas, this is the spot. Although it is a bit off of the strip, it is so worth it. We used lfyt to get here, and it was only about $10 from our hotel room. We were considering going to a restaurant on the strip just so we didn't have to pay for lyft but this was definitely worth it! The food was delicious, I especially loved the spicy tuna dish! It was amazing! The bulgogi and the spicy chicken were tied for second place in my book.  This place is very clean and food's delicious. Definitely coming back when I come to Vegas! What an amazing restaurant!

hyvcaWf0o_RL9s-Ao1vTlQ.text: The interior of this restaurant is really nice! I love how it's red and black, gives it a really chill environment.  As a huge kbbq fan, I would have to say that the meat isn't as great as it could be. Some of the cuts were thicker than they usually are at other places which is why I docked one star.  Despite that, I find myself coming back here frequently. I enjoy the food and I like the service!   Thank you guys for another great experience!

tml-BJMXzuLKDUK44xIcmg.text: kevin.... you are SO RIGHT BRO!!!!!!! gotta get me that pork toro... my friends and i call it "PORO" Chicken was amazing.. and make sure to get the brisckot of beef its wicked frickin tender.  Got a free mackaroon for checkin in on yelp.

vMCckg4XfcewcZ2Od_UjTw.text: Let me start off by saying this is the best Asian bbq place I've ever been to and being from NYC, I've had my share.  We stumbled upon this place after getting a tattoo at Revolt next door and omg, it was delicious!! We ordered the premium dinner for two and not only did it satisfy my steak craving, we have leftovers to take with us.   The service was fantastic from the second we walked in until we left and my sister and I totally enjoyed ourselves, I'm just sorry there isn't a place like this back home.

d4zrP3PDNykZSOgmcVIi3Q.text: Amazing food and service. I loved the diversity of the menu. Definitely need to get the uni bibimbap and the Kobe ssam! their uni is SO fresh!

s9t7A5trWyuiTlwnrcPEkQ.text: This place is amazing. Every bite was DELICIOUS. We got the combo with the Kobe beef, capriccio, and kalbi for $89. It said it feeds 2 but we had 3 ppl and still couldn't finish it! Great place. Will def come back.

gIbKsOTs36Li82khPdRtXQ.text: Very ordinary with enormous amounts of food for those looking for a budget and who want variety. It caters to a non-Asian/non-Korean crowd who are beginners to Korean BBQ. We had the "Gangnam Special" for two that could have easily fed four. Too long of a wait for an average restaurant. If you're willing to travel away from the strip a little further you will find more authentic, nicer Korean BBQ restaurants. The service was nice and very quick. I would have given it a 2.5 if they had half stars because it's friendly and clean.

rZlg0ajen5z3hK5nKDLTsQ.text: This place is a little heaven in the wall. Walking in, you can smell the aroma of cooked BBQ meat. We were so excited to try this based off many positive Yelp reviews.  There is a 2 order BBQ meat minimum for the sides, which isn't hard to do because we wanted everything!! We ordered bulgogi, spicy pork, spicy chicken, Kalbi, and pork belly. All the meat came out perfectly marinaded and so tender! The only thing was the pork belly, it came plain with no marinade. I would definitely order round 2 if I had the stomach to.  We also ordered the spicy tofu soup, which was also equally delicious. The tofu is very soft, which is the way I like mine.   The pricing here is definitely affordable as well. They have a happy hour menu from 10pm-1am. Appetizers and BBQ will be either $3 or $4. And they have half off drinks!   I definitely left here feeling full and satisfied. If I lived in Vegas, I would definitely come here for Korean BBQ.

hiRyh_IAnYhGoLvCMkgrvA.text: Great food and service! Loved it! It's super fun to cook your own food. The meat was delicious and the kimchee was awesome! We will come again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Hot sake fragrance starts the meal of delicious tender marinated Bulgogi, spicy pork, chicken in lemon and even unique Korean chicken with cheese fondue (interesting, but not quite match K flavors). Reasonable prices, nice decor good for 2-4 dining. For large group, private room for 8 can be reserved.

I love love love this place and if anyone tries to convince me that there's a better Japanese BBQ restaurant around town they are fooling themselves! I've been 3 times since June 24th of this year....and I am ready to go back again....prices are great....the sides they bring you are slamm'n....music is on point,  and staff is always friendly....this is a must try!

ByyEUFw2V8tgn5abMyTpag.text: Loved the free ice cream with check in! Typical Korean BBQ. I enjoyed everything and the kind service. I wish they were more attentive in aiding with the cooking. Even though I've been before, some of the meats were new to me and it would've been nice to get some help.

k3Qg5y6Vvs3i6tcoLgzCNw.text: YUM!!!!  Soooo good!!  Can I give it more stars?  So good I woke up craving for more!  Japchae & Bulgolgi are the best I've ever ate.  It worked out to be cheaper than All you can eat for our group of 8.  Well worth the over an hour wait.    8 people = $20 each! 2 Japchae 4 Prime Kalbi 5 Bulgolgi 1 Filet Mignon 1 Chicken Sodas & Beer

5DSfgAgwcMt8F1D9loqN-w.text: Actually the food was much better than I expected. I eat Korean food a lot since there are so many choices around NJ/NY area. So I wasn't expecting to get something as good as that. We had a BBQ set for two people and then ordered couple more dishes. Everything was really good. The rice and noodle dishes which are usually just normal stuff but they were tasty here. We also like the best two appetizers on their menu, one uni and one beef thing. BBQ are good.

NCUhCFJ4SvSmYjKFqNdcug.text: Best solo lunch date to date. I ate like royalty for $13. Ban chans were perfect, the meat was marinated straight from the gods, the service was a little slow but acceptable given the time of day. Seriously one of the better KBQ I've had in a long time.

UmqC8AyaerfyEaj9l1bwIg.text: Great service upon entering right up until the very end. It wasn't too busy and we were given a huge table for only the 2 of use pretty soon, the entire table was covered with the complimentary dishes and the rest of our order of:  x SUN DU BU ($9.95 with rice) The best I've ever had and I've had a lot. The calamari was so soft too although there ended up being too much calamari to soup ratio. x STEAMED EGG ($4.95) this was not very good as it was over-steamed and not silky as it usually is at other restaurants.  x HARAMI MISO ($8.95) This was really succulent and tasty. Must order! x KOREAN PRIME KALBI ($8.95) This was tasty although a bit too fatty for my liking.   The lettuce is $2 but it is so fresh and crispy, it is a must for complimenting the bbq meat.  Rate them on Yelp and you get a free dessert. We got the Mocchi which was OMG.  We were so full at the end but the prices were so reasonable. I would definitely be here more often if I wasn't a tourist.

VvI9Ui4NGR3R9bE2KTGFrQ.text: OMG amazing cuts of meats. One of the best KBBQ places of all time!  Decent pricing, good service, long waits & you smell like food when you're done which is indicative for all KBBQ places.

gg059Kt8T_Qj4OzD5TAAXg.text: They have a nice atmosphere and good food for the price. We chose our own meats instead of doing the pre-set options. This allowed us to get more of why we wanted and less of what we didn't, as we didn't care for the soups or wontons.  They bait you to write a review on here to get free dessert (only 2 options).

n3sYZiHuSPUCnRpLvoo1OA.text: The service is nice.   Food is average.  A bit surprised with the amazing reviews. We ordered all 3 recommended meats but only 1 out of 3 were tender.

ORnMUv1MrnLrMC0hr4TQgg.text: The happy hour is bomb.com! The amount of quality food you get for the price is so worth it. Ordered the bulgogi (duh), beef toro, stuffed wontons, corn (boring, but good after grilling and adding sauce), broccoli all from the happy hour menu. Also ordered the kimchi chiage (perfect noms for winter). PLUS they came out with the millions of/standard Korean side dishes. Everything was flavorful, and I am craving this place again as I write this post. I have also been thinking about the Banana Tempura dessert ever since I finished eating it. Will definitely be back.

sbSpu87KGh6-po-ab--Suw.text: Best Korean BBQ I've had. Food is great, very clean place and arrive is top notch!! It's a must do in Vegas.

X6HKi6wRheYnJIt9rqF__A.text: I try first time Korean food in Las Vegas and it was awesome. Everything is fresh n best thing is u can grill it by ur self. It was plenty of verity in very less prize. Service also very nice. Server is alway active and taking care of ur needs. I highly recommend this place. Not even single thing witch will disappoint u. 100 % 5star.

T2hLjHh_PBLthF_eI3efcw.text: Its like Oasis in the city. Those who crave for a spicy Korean food in the middle of your gambling days will be saved ;)

uKuEACmYQNATf5dwrGAu1w.text: Best Korean BBQ. Thanks to yelp we found this restaurant .we visited and stayed    on the strip but wanted good Korean food We were not disappointed! Quite te opposite! We ordered a meat lovers meal for 4 people,all meat was delicious,specially the filet,great quality.

pOXZ4B7YYBPuOhEauTo5Jw.text: We came in during happy hour and tried salmon jalapeno poppers and seafood pancake appetizers.  The poppers were awesome!! The pancakes were good.  Be sure to have the shrimp along with the bulgogi it was the our fave of the beef.  We also had the toro and kalbi.  Happy hour prices are definitely worth the trip!

WxKJLAIcvyry-OF92K-Irg.text: Great food, great service and fresh meat!  My favorite would be the bulgogi beef! The best Korean bbq in Vegas!

qQcZBScNaD3D2kaGkQ4kMw.text: This restaurant was good. The meat was pretty good and the service was also good. The food arrived at our table pretty fast and the environment is also very clean and well kept. Definitely recommend this place!

cIz4TKcJm7eOUw5V587O2Q.text: This place is amazing and they gave us so much food. We ordered a two people gangnam dinner and definitely fed the three of us and we were super full! We will come back again!

HWYJ1PmVoBLsEs_rfQ53uQ.text: By far the best korean/japanese bbq yakiniku place ive been at. We ordered the prime kalbi the korean kalbi. They were so juicy and u can tell the quality of the meat is superb! We also had the toro pork cheeks and that was heavenly as well as the pork belly! The side dishes were pretty good as well like the sweet and spicy squid and mac salad also the kimchi was bomb! Will definitely come back here again and again.  Only thing is they may need more servers specially when it gets busy.

iLbIm4Zjk87bX-FOQka_CA.text: Now one of my favorite places in Vegas! Authentic, fun. The food was perfect. The service was more than excellent. And the atmosphere in there was very nice. I love the k-pop videos going into the background, the striking colors. I had a Somek to drink, ask for that it's fun and tasty. We also had the Yuzu, which was excellent. Then we had Kobe beef, Japanese peppers (shishito), asparagus, cheese fondue chicken, and a variety of other things. It was tasty and filling!

AaTyOHaDdI6haBOIHTxBaQ.text: I've been there a couple of times and I am truly amazed by the fast service and the quality of the meat.  Atmosphere: I love the decor! The big projector screen is perfect for entertainment. I can eat my food while watching and singing along to music videos. The restaurant  looks very clean.  Service: the staffs are friendly and courteous. They make sure to constantly refill my glass. My server was Kristin and she was amazing! I didn't know how the menu work the first time I was there and she took the time to explain everything.  Food: OHHH MYYY GAWD. no words to describe those succulent  pieces of meat.   The only reason why I didn't give this place 5 stars is solely because it's not an AYCE BBQ :p

UZNSIMHPEw3TuC0Kn5jETA.text: This place is great! The quality of the meats are very top notch! They start you off with a variety of tasteful side dishes from spicy in your face kimchi to the creamy macaroni salad all circled around the grill. Personally the bulgogi is my favorite because of the sweet and savory blissful taste it leaves after you swallow every bite. Brisket, kalbi, and filet mignon are also good. The only thing about this place that I disliked was the service. They don't visit your table too often and when they take the side dishes they take forever to bring them back on several occasions but other than that this place isn't bad. Give it a try!

SgoKixKUVaNgz5fVbQM7EA.text: Wow, these people need to get their butts to the east coast because MAN WILL I MISS THIS.  For Asian BBQ, yes, it looks daunting and overpriced when you first look at the menu. 4oz for 7$ is like paying 7$ for nothing. But when you order the combos for 2 people, you're actually getting enough for 3 or 4. Get one of those and a la carte the few selections you really enjoyed and you're bill will be about 100$ total for 6 people! Not bad, right?  When they ask what kind of rice you want - normal or bulgogi mixed - definitely get the bulgogi. That stuff was the bombbbbbbbbbbbbb. Perfectly sweet to go along with the savory meat!

Zojc9k7h0-FOt0GHfy417A.text: I always come to this place because it's location happens to be near my house and the food is yummy. U order the food a la carte but still fills me up and is kept in my budget. I like to come here with my girlfriend because the booths make me feel like I'm in a private place. The restaurant looks like it is brand new and I enjoy the music videos that they play on their projection which is a mix of Korean, American Pop, and some funny ones like Boy Dance Party from SNL. If you get Kristin as a server, you're in great hands! She is very helpful at suggesting food items and checks on our table at a consistent rate. She actually looks like she enjoys her job and enjoys serving you . The staff has always been attentive with my water also as I am a fast drinker. Their servers speak fluent English too   My usual order consists of brown rice, kimchi (free), salmon jalapeno poppers (sooo good), 2 orders of toro beef and 2 orders of pork belly. The owner is friendly, and willing to help out with anything .   This is my favorite Korean BBQ spot in Vegas , check it out!

_deeW6DbmpD5icouATBxLw.text: Great menu! The food was delicious. We chose the family portion which was perfect, even comes with soup

Qwlw9U4v5BtSyzVSkUpL7g.text: A ton of food! This is Korean BBQ done right - definitely worth a stop if you're in Vegas and hungry.

RyYLfSs3zLdysgYlRDctpQ.text: Best Korean food I have ever eaten. Wait staff was excellent. The place was very clean.

PWHNy-57c2rGKIxnxzqYjQ.text: Really good Japanese/Korean BBQ fusion. The ambiance is nice and clean with a modern edge, well ventilated tables meant my hair didn't smell like smoke after, and servers are pleasant and eager to please.  We did NOT get a combo, but instead ordered a-la-carte, mostly premium meats with a simple bowl of rice, kimchi and pickles. We satisfied our hunger, enjoyed almost every meat dish, and cleansed our pallets with a dessert all for less than the combo price...the difference? We didn't fill-up or waist money on the appetizers (that come with the combos).

rhRULCsAyq360Qq10-Nvng.text: Service and food were both really good! Would recommend for anyone looking for high quality kbbq in Las Vegas :)

YuAMbk2O3qfYJSvFDP25UA.text: It is good place to eat Korean BBQ. It could be expensive if you order the better meat, but it is very delicious, I will be back again soon.

yHS-dxA_rybRVLs6zGb_hg.text: Best Korean restaurant I have ever been. Super tasty beef with a fair price. By the way, deliver food in 5 minutes, impressive.

2070_a9Rqx-nnGqns6QdyA.text: Great Korean bbq in Vegas with a very good happy hour for food and drinks. The Toro and bulgogy were really tasty and the complementary sides are great.

SMELVNGNiWD13MZCIC_NSw.text: Good quality meat at reasonable prices. Perfect way to close out a weekend in sin city.

9q9gfsuwMyEBXNHqd2dbjQ.text: We had bbq combo. It comes lots food all over the table.We definitely will come again this bbq place. It's so yummy

MvzD9gzl5WEZ4GRAcmx9kQ.text: Very disappointing! I think this restaurant is both over-rated and over-priced. Soup they serve is full of msg, not taste from natural ingredients. Not worth to visit again.

XGPxL_UJezRB6gUQDQK72w.text: Highly recommend - it's a great experience! We chose the "Las Vegas" option - so much variety and so much food!  We might have been better off choosing individual items but we wouldn't have gotten to try everything we did!  The miso soup was one of the best I've had, very flavorful.  The cream cheese wontons and edamame were good, as expected.  The 8 side dishes were a nice touch.  The shrimp were excellent, as was the korean chicken; the spicy chicken was too spicy for me so husband had that to himself.  Alternatively, I had the beef toro to myself; it was very fatty, in fact tasted like the fat on a grilled steak which I love but husband doesn't eat fat on purpose...(!) Get the bulgogi bibimbap instead of white rice; it's a more interesting rice dish with beef in it. Only had 1 piece of the broccoli cheese fondue, was just so much food something had to give!  The salad we didn't even touch until the end of the meal; we were pretty full but it had a nice light dressing that was a good ending.

zozQxgfMOgR0jd60UxwHIg.text: Must try the Kobe beef carpaccio, it was mouth watery and delicious. Service was attentive and friendly. Price was extremely reasonable.

LIJ5AR2FpfMujjAsu3su0Q.text: Clean and modern. Not very busy late nite off the strip easy parking in strip mall toward back. Good smells. Half price menu after 10pm. No Korean barley tea. Pork overdone in kitchen tried to spare the servers of cleanup for one person. Beef also cool ok marinade. Kimchi excellent as were the other Namul. Cukes, chili and radish,shredded dried fish, bean sprout, fish cake. Chap chae was quite good. Paid bill. Came back in one hour because my cousin was hungry so I brought him here. Happy hour continues. Noticed a note the new table offering dessert for a Yelp review. I had already done one. Waiter kindly offered dessert of fried banana and ice cream. Cousin enjoyed sukiyaki. It smelled good. He also ordered chicken salad. He was too full to try it. Overall good experience but just not the "best" in the Korean experience. I would still recommend for price point, happy hour, and location and parking. Not a bad thing.

A5n8rFvqn7FJun6sAnmzsw.text: Nice, inexpensive, young Korean BBQ place. They cooked the BBQ in their kitchen for me so that I don't have to bear all the BBQ smell on my clothes. Very nice place.

W-MRVybtT90hZTOBzchi2A.text: Clean environment, friendly servers, lots of food. Meat was well seasoned. Included lots of sides. Cooking food in front of you is always fun!

uQSIFU18Rfjq2-cHAzjJgg.text: Normally I go to Korean BBQ restaurants for all-you-can-eat. My friends really wanted to try this place. Even though we could not stuff our faces till we puked, the meat was really great quality. We were able to sample 6 different dishes, all were marinated to perfection. However, I wish there was more quantity. Customer service was alright. It took a while to get our grill changed. There were times where we thought they forgot about us.

y4wSfEVJNkTOGa0Z3DsjAg.text: Came here on Christmas Day and waited for an hour and a half to get seated. The food was ok. The server Sue was bleh!!! No personality and a nightmare attitude.  :( The place was freezing, they kept the air on all the time at a temperature colder than outside in the winter time! Love Korean food but This one has absolutely so much more room to grow! And until then I won't be back nor will I  be recommending this place to anyone either!!!

_czqH7xXqa1EX88Cx5NfCw.text: Really good food and a fun experience. Make a reservation or prepare to wait a long time.

HyJ3MmDmR6lyI7aY3mr0RQ.text: Good food.  Long wait though. Comfy seating inside as it is not crowded.  Meat was good quality.

V-171uM09KnBp3VFw3n2EA.text: The meat was very soft and tender. All of our family members enjoyed it so much!! When the meat sizzled as it was cooking, it sounded like music to our ears. I believe this time, it was the best music of all. The kimchi was well flavored and I enjoyed the pickled radish. Overall, the meat is delicious to be eaten in any way and the side dishes and salad is fresh and yummy!!

yJzPoEyhW2XBNGe7KFJ6nQ.text: Good food...authentic stews...rather small portions...but if you are in the mood for good Korean BBQ in Vegas this is a good place.

taj-bQdKFBLZydx9RseIXg.text: This is the best Korean BBQ that I've had in Las Vegas to date.  The servers were very attentive and the food excellent; and I'm already looking forward to my next visit.

msPE02FZ3WVhEayarPt7zg.text: Location is easy to find , close to the strip and near airport in a shopping mall . The bbq at table has good ventilation.  We walked in without reservation and were seated promptly . We enjoyed our dinner here. Even got free dessert with Yelp review... Bonus.

WVG8Ez8_wYjdFKDfYB0spw.text: Great Korean food!! A lot of variety and great service. Definitely coming back here the next time I'm in town!!!

ozcJJilnuia8NcUPbzWRTg.text: Wonderful gem in the Vegas town. The meat is super fresh and great service. Will recommend all who loves Korean BBQ.

gII8UcT9TNdikdtpl_cp2A.text: It was ok food. Not as authentic as I would've liked. Marinades were on a bit sweet side and what's up with charging extra for rice and side dishes? Rice is the main dish and everything else is the sides...

erFygSm4OcVe9X5q-Rpimw.text: Great BBQ here!!! Some of servers looked unhappy but I'll go back to Gangnam Asian BBQ again soon

mwB9rSmroSHZIXTJXec_vw.text: This is the best Korean restaurant I've ever been!!!!!!!! The side dishes are great; the appetizers are awesome; the BBQ meat is so fresh and juicy.   We ordered steamed egg, chicken karage, and tuna kimbap for starters. Omgosh, they were all a fantastic. We ordered scallops, Korean prime kalbi, sweet corn, and enoki with bacon. I have never had such great kalbi before. The meat is so juicy and palatable, and I ate the meat with the sesame veggies in the house... it's like a taste of heaven.   Recommend recommend recommend!!!!

MXXB2TYDM0vs9cl306Fe9g.text: Good quality meat and good service. Not ayce but it's still worth it. Free macaroons ice cream! That's a win win situation.

PhH5YENE_6PDMEtC-nh_BA.text: I was recommended to check this place out by a Korean friend, and am glad I did.  A large selection of things to BBQ at your table and for the newbie, they had set meals with suggestions. Recommended that you get a reservation, it was quite busy while I was there.   Will definitely be back next time I am in Vegas!

UyC8Rp5mq46smG14CkYRxw.text: Customer service is on point and the good laugh were delicious. We ordered the premium combo for two and the foods were plenty  love!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious foods with excellent customer service. The shrimp bibimbap was definitely on point  Love!!
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Premium combo for 2. Delicious meats and the shrimp bibimbap was definitely on point  Servers were super friendly  Loveeeeee!

2jNqRVeOV5cVCS0nrXx06A.text: Excellent Korean BBQ!  They offer a few cuts you don't normally see such as skirt steak and beef tongue.  The kalbi was particularly good.  I appreciate the small order "Korean tapas" style menu.  This way you get to try a little of everything.  Three dipping sauces are on the table, which is really nice.  The free ice cream sandwich was the perfect dessert.  I'm only knocking off a star due to the slow service.  It wasn't very busy and yet our waiter would vanish, and his replacement would also vanish.

Fr64GdWaKrQ31XRqrvbEgQ.text: Terrific Happy Hour meal once again.  The wait was about 30 minutes at 10pm on a Friday which is honestly pretty good knowing the notoriety of Gangnam.  Once seated food and drinks started flowing quickly and the banchan was very good with the fish cake and dried squid the standouts.  The bulgogi and spicy lemon chicken were both very good with the bulgogi coming out on top.  The bulgogi had great marination while the chicken seemed a bit dry and tasteless, though the lemon dipping sauce was refreshing.  The corn is great once grilled as well and a perfect addition to the meal.  Add in the fact that flavored soju is half off, at only $6 per bottle that's almost market price in this city.  Ridiculous deal on drinks and fantastic options for food on the Happy Hour menu.  If you pay over $20 per person after getting full and drunk I'd be surprised.  One of the best deals in town and with great food to match.

UT7aRsIMKltcCqFDNI0RSQ.text: Omg, omg...this place is so off the charts in every way. We ordered appetizers of firecracker shrimp, squash tempura and the urchin over Kobe beef. We then ordered the meet, which was ribeye, prime rib and beef short ribs. It also comes with lots of little sides. The beer selection is great our service was excellent with Kiki and Jay. We will definitely be back. Btw, Yelp gave them a 4 1/2 out of 5 with over 3000 reviews

KcwzEbi00y9wQ9KtQf9PzQ.text: Man oh man! So good! So much great food for the price! Only down fall is it's a small establishment, so when there is a waiting list, you waaaiiittttt. But it's so worth it!

JVFvHWJ2SRn2UekS80CGMQ.text: First time here and it was amazing! The service was fast, the food was excellent and the people who worked there were really nice. The meat was so fresh and the sides were so tasty and the macaroon ice cream sandwich was the icing on the cake. Will recommend this place to everyone and bring my family who'll be visiting next week

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macaroon ice cream sandwich for dessert

SpQyDg6KLx_r-t0CAt9KkQ.text: Great customer service.  They hopped right on getting our drink orders.  The food came out quickly too.  We went with the Gang Nam for 2.  A lot of food for a reasonable price considering the amount of food you get.  The sides are endless.  Their kimchi is good and the cucumbers are too.  The bibimbap is awesome also.  The fried bananas are so bomb!  I actually don't like bananas that much.  When I eat them they have to be almost green.  But damn these were killer!  And the mochi was yummy!    After a meal here I am gonna go home and sleep until tomorrow night.
