2IBqwf8pv44t_5vxUR1OyQ.text: This place is great but the service is horrible. My table wasn't cleared once and I had 8 empty plates and ran out of water for at least 20min. Train your staff about service and cleanliness. Never coming back to this establishment again. Honey pig or DJK is way better. Save your time and money and go somewhere else besides here.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ikt7UuXTo3PjKa4jiKYMrA.text: Food was great, beer was cold and service was good. This was our first time here so I wish the servers made more effort to explain everything. We ordered meat lover for 6 people and it was a lot of food. We did not touch salads and did bot cook all of the meat so we probably would have done better with the meal for 4 and add as needed. Pork belly was the least favorite. In order of preference filet mignon, pork, brisket, skirt and toro. Miso soup was great and the appetizers gave you the chance to try lots of different things. I will definitely be back the next time I am in Vegas.

8rioJ3w7oJS_u52P4Zm75Q.text: Got a call from a friend whose birthday venue turned out to be overbooked. She was frantic to find a place that served Asian food, was affordable, but great enough for the dozen of us to enjoy--in  a couple of short hours from her call!  Of course, I turned to Yelpers and the fact that Gangnam had over 2,500 reviews with an average rating of 4.5 stars convinced me this was a safe place to recommend. My friend immediately booked their private room for 7pm.  While the restaurant appeared small from the storefront, it was surprisingly well laid out for groups, couples, and we saw singles dining, too. So don't hesitate to stop in if you're dining solo.  We were seated in a private room toward the back, large enough, yet cozy for 12.  As soon as most of the group were seated, the ban chan was brought in. Large variety of appetizer were laid out, including the requisite kimchi mixes, sprouts, taegu, and more. Our friendly server guided us to the combination selections.  It was unanimous that the Gangnam combo would be the way to go as the more people you have, the better the price per person. The ban chan had the requisite various kimchi, sprouts, and much more.  Onion miso soup, large salad to share, fresh oysters on the  half shell, grilled shishito peppers, mushroom medley, choice of steamed rice or bulgogi bibimbap rice, and beef ... lots and lots of beef ... kalbi, bulgogi,  etc. Food seemed to just keep coming until we were overwhelmed and finally tapped out!  We enjoyed the experience and the food so much, we're planning on heading back with another group of family coming to town in a few weeks.

gC06UmI_qvWPlWrhmdjyDQ.text: Omg so delicious food is great. We love coming here. Service is ok needs a lil work but still worth it. Everything about this place is great!!! Always a good spot for some bomb ass Korean food!!!!

h2V2blNI2tIVN4KcY-rcTw.text: The combo packages are surprisingly big!  Meat lovers for 4 was enough to leave 4 people VERY full.

UksKiIibwqmowg9DZR8oPw.text: Got here around 5:00PM and barely made it for happy hour (3-6pm). Appetizer, BBQ, and drink items were listed on the happy hour menu and we got a little bit of both. The jalapeno poppers really "popped" out for me.  For the main course, we got the kalbi bbq (marinated) and prime rib. The marinated meat was superb. We also got the glass noodle and the tofu soup, also memorable. Prices were much more reasonable than prices in Silicon Valley but on the more expensive side when compared to downtown LA prices.  Service was fast and the food was great. Would definitely return again!

-R-YpMJ4nplxZG6eY4-PVQ.text: No wait on a Wednesday for lunch!  +fast and great service +clean and nice set up (good vents!) +solid variety of beef +parking in the plaza  -not the best kbbq I've had but def worth checking out! Overall, 4.5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Before the devastation

8QoYTdAj2soGIM34-2GvVQ.text: Good experience..meats were well seasoned. Come with an appetite..a lot of food included in the Meat Lovers meal..

-GiIDoWF2T2WaSrQ4AkItQ.text: Easy, fun and fabulous atmosphere.   Great for a date night, working lunch or with the kids!!  Pick your meat and veggies and they arrive raw. You cook them on your table top grill. Fun way to get the kids cooking. And the prices are Great!!  Ill be back for sure. Good music as well as a tv playing sports!! Great selection of sake too!!

cC1pSUOiezY9rJH2n6Qd2w.text: The food was excellent, I was especially impressed with their blugogi. The portions were large and they had a good variety of side dishes.  I used to live in Korea for 2 years and I am a snob about Korean culture. This place didn't have the standard metal chop sticks, free lettuce for wrapping meat, and they served us a salad with a hard boiled egg in it. I tried to talk to the waiter in Korean but he didn't speak the language and looked at me like I was a crazy person. Also when we ordered a bowl of lettuce there were only about 12 leaves and then the bottom of the bowl was randomly filled with celery

pKNY4LWvtc-29vf0FCadIw.text: Best kbbq restaurant I've been to so far. Try all the favorites, they're worth it! - miso harami, spicy tuna kimbap, and prime kalbi. 15+ minute wait on the honey toast so order ahead.

MPdAGOtswI8L-xMG8GKQAg.text: My husband and I found this place while we were visiting Las Vegas. The reviews were very positive, and so we tried it. Never again. Very pricey compared to the quality that was prepared. The staff was nice and offered good service. The restaurant decor was great. The quality of meat was poor considering we paid a lot for a small amount. We walked in excited, but left disappointed.

VDyRF9erfkf7mXGZ25SUtA.text: I came with my roommates for my birthday. I love the decor and selection of food on the menu. There was 3 of us and we ordered the meatlover package, it was plenty of food for us! The quality of meat was excellent and and the side dishes were delicious. I will definitely be back to try more of the menu!

cy7gqxbIWcrYJWDQ35zt2Q.text: Excellent korean BBQ for a great price. It was a long wait, aside from that it was amazing.

hzuPa7_l8Dgacq6nsFed8Q.text: ! It seemed like it's really like a restaurant in Chicago called guy Kaku! So if you like Japanese BBQ and Korean BBQ together, it's a good fit for you! Tried the oysters and it is so fresh! Enjoyed it and the sauces are great

xXKWsrFMVm7CCH1NmXZaPQ.text: This place is amazing omg yummmmy. You definitely need the here it's very affordable All I  can say is yummmmy

L48U8_UlD2Kf4VKql4ti9g.text: This is the perfect spot to take friends who are unfamiliar with Korean cuisine.  The menu covers appetizers, some fusion (Korean-Japanese) dishes as well as traditional Korean BBQ meats.  The restaurant is nice and clean and there is a grill in the center of each table to cook the meat.  We had a party of six and two of our guests had no previous Korean dining experience. They liked the fact that we prepared our own food. They even had forks for these poor souls.  The outcome was that everyone had a great time and wanted to come back again when we return to Las Vegas for next year's convention.  All the items are per portion so I imagine it might take a visit or two to get the quantities right.  The server was very friendly and hip and ready to assist all the various levels of guests entering Gangnam.

i1bUfb7X5eFn5cq7HNV3xw.text: The reason they got so many reviews is probably because they offer free dessert if customers show them they have submitted reviews after the meal.  Food-wise i would give them 4 stars especially on BBQ meat but a 3 stars for service. Don't get me wrong the servers have been doing their best to serve / attentive and quick to respond , it is just that the service level has fallen behind a typical Korean BBQ restaurants . For instance, the extractor fan was not on (or was not working) all time it was hot by then and our clothes were left super delicious; they never bothered to change the burnt charred black grill, and  unlike many other Korean BBQ when meats arrived they never cut it into smaller size for you to grill.

CDfdl547CPcprpmX1ijUYg.text: Awesome Korean BBQ place! We wanted to try something different from the normal Vegas strip so we searched and found this GEM great food service is excellent and desert is great! A must when visiting Vegas

1FR3LKGAGVEbNrsetDqckg.text: Last time I was in Vega$, I stopped at Gangnam Asian BBQ with co-workers!  It was SO delicious, we visited twice during the same visit!  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

JTqGLs4EN8_ojG3t-yGrBA.text: Great food! Really cool experience! So much food for a good price! We had the chicken and the beef! It was a neat experience to cook the food in front of us and it was my first time having Korean.

SbwQadiM2Ilw5uFe5M7MrQ.text: We ordered the kalbi, bulgogi, and naeng myun. The meat was marinated well and the side dishes were also tasty. The naeng Myung was cold as it should be but lacked flavor so I ended up added some spices from the side dishes.

QSnbcfY5x0GfTJ4j8xbzcw.text: Fast service!! Friendly staff! We had a really great time and will be back. We got the meat lovers for two which was more than enough food for 4 with a few extra sides

ihl4csQBVGEQEX1-ntfHMg.text: This spot is so good! Everything I've tried was so delicious!  I definitely recommend their salmon jalapeno poppers and their bacon wrapped asparagus! They have a wide variety of  delicious meats and their happy hour menu is def worth checking out! The servers are friendly and the the vibe is real laid back and my overall experience was such a delight! I'm coming back for sure! :)

PvU11ZTbUz_aln74F0tLOQ.text: Super yummy BBQ! Good mix of Korean and Japanese BBQ flavored. Close proximity to Hard Rock Hotel, will be back on next trip!

rSDsEMK9ugkI7Ty2xbsnnA.text: I came to this restaurant for the simple reason that I had to get out of the hard rock hotel. This was right across the street and I figured anything was better than spending more time at the smoky trashy hotel that was trying too hard.  My first reaction upon seeing the menu was to be a bit taken aback by the printed discount signs on the menu. Made me think of "regular price 9.95 but just for you it's 7,50--- maybe because the food is old or no one wants to go there."  I worried too much. The food was reasonably good. Tasty Korean BBQ at an affordable price. Service was pretty indifferent. "Yes we have a smaller table but it isn't set up: why don't you sit at the bar."  And I had to wait for a fair amount of time before getting any attention to place my order. The indifferent service might account for my bulgogi being a bit on the cold side. But the food did taste good and was a good value for the money.  I

_KBMhitTsgwU3Fsov6wS0Q.text: Put up a review and get a free macaron ice cream. Food was nothing that you couldn't get elsewhere. Portions were a bit on the small side

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free ice cream!!

n9_bc2x4huH883pvhdjuWA.text: Had the best dining experience at a KBBQ restaurant. Had the premium meat selection for two and it was delicious. Will definitely come back when I'm in the area next

v96JhKUi7039cC1OQ7sydg.text: Their marinated green onion is the best I've ever had, hands down. I've started coming every Friday night after work for the happy hour specials. Can't recommend it enough :)

b_xUJEAw9XfAihTB30IbMg.text: The servers move quickly between tables and don't give much time to ask questions or understand the menu. Mostly just ordered what looked interesting and looked around to see what others were doing then imitated them. Bulgogi and garlic beef were my favs. Would have liked to know more about the sides. Cool mix of hip hop and pop music from different cultures playing with the videos on the screen.

5BYcjN5ykSAm2_bJB5Hksw.text: Decent Korean in Vegas with quick service/hardworking staff and a decent happy hour from 3-6pm then again from 10p-closing! Give it a go....

i1iTSTTtpeDp6nGXJfnQow.text: Wow!  This place is awesome.  It's a lot smaller than I imagined compared to Hobak or Magal...but what it lacks in square footage, it more than makes up for it in quality meat.  We had the premium combo for 2 even though we had 3 guys.  It was just the right amount as we had an appetizer while waiting at the bar plus earlier some happy hour food elsewhere.  It is superb!  Now it's not cheap by any measurement at $90 for 2 people so keep your AYCE mentality out of this establishment.  This is not what you are coming here for.  You are coming to enjoy the quality over quantity!!  So be ready to just have melt in your mouth fun with this place...

hs1pM1rCwcCxDeFiPComlg.text: Such good food here! If you get the bundle, bring your appetite - everything comes in a small plate but the whole table is covered with food.   The smoke does get heavy and you will come out of dinner smelling like bbq. I wish the restaurant has a place to hang coats that is a bit more sheltered from the smoke.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jcVGxAzunDgKHv6dG_J3hQ.text: We were there twice since my boss really liked it and it was close to airport. We went with meat lovers the first day. even though it was for two people, it was just the right amount for the three of us girls. We switch to uni rice and added more money. It was on Stone pot and we left it longer so the rice was charred and crunchy. We each checked in to get free macaroon and we liked the strawberry and coffee flavor. The second time we got the premium beef. The meat was more melt-in-your-mouth and unfortunately the uni rice was not available that day, bummer. It was good quality and great first stop from the airport before going to our hotel or vice versa.

jPYnLJkraBI2bs-gw84m8g.text: This place is a fusion korean bbq restaurant. If you are looking for a traditional meal, this may not be for you. I am korean and was expecting something more traditional.  The servers are super friendly and helpful. Don't skip dessert. The macaroon ice cream is the killer!

pk0DMFMZV6hqr1uTO0SlyA.text: I've had some amazing kbbq on my travels across the US and abroad in Asia, but sadly there is nothing great in my current city. I was SO looking forward to this meal and it was the first stop after leaving the airport to kick off the weekend in Vegas. We arrived at 3pm, so the restaurant was really empty (it can get packed!). The service and the timing for the food was perfect due to the slower time of day we dined. I believe that dining at 3pm def allowed us to have a better experience.   Each table is set up with it's own grill and has a hood vent. Although the hood helps, be prepared to still smell like grill when you leave the establishment. We settled on one of the pre-selected bundles 'meat lover'   at $56 for 2 people-which had 6 proteins and an array of salad, soup, and apps. Of course the bonchon side dishes were complimentary and delicious. The best meats in the meat lover set were the beef toro and the flat iron garlic. Both were melt in your mouth delicious.   I think the sets are a good way to try more of the menu if you're new to the establishment but when I go back I'll be likely to just order cuts that I love.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0AWyeKT1wzSfdMDJa9A_qA.text: Fantastic!!!!! LOVED IT!! Highly recommended!!  We are 5 girls. We order meat lover for 2 and premium for 2 and a spicy tofu soup. It's about the right amount    Nothing speaks louder than some good pictures.  My friends and I loved this place and was the BEST BBQ experience in the state ever.  Not super pricy and great food and service!!

ZOP90Q93pDi5-o0QAgp80w.text: First time here and ordered the Las Vegas bbq.  Food was excellent.  Thanks Mam and Eric for the great service!

4iARWZmcMYoF96CT8p-KLw.text: This place is amazing!!! The service is exceptional. The food is so delicious and we got an ice cream macaroon for checking in! I loved everything about it. I'm so glad we tried it. My husband and I will be coming back every time we're in Vegas. I can't say enough good things about this place... My stomach is happy and satisfied!!!

FjMyDIaxygSZoxvyU41DWQ.text: What a great fun restaurant! My husband and I went for lunch and we'd only been to Korean BBQ once before a long time ago. The staff was super helpful at teaching us and making suggestions, even giving me a couple of recipes!! We chose the the Gangnam Combo per the servers suggestion and he (David) even let us switch out a couple of things that we liked better. I got to try a few things that I'd never had before including what I'd call spicy pickles. They were awesome along with the jalapeno & radishes. I also got to try the squid which was chewy and not something I prefer, but I always love trying new things! We switched out our soup and salad for the ramen soup and it was not good, just tasted like they opened a packet of ramen from the store. My son would have loved it, but we passed. We had tons of food besides the ramen and walked away way too full! Oh and one of the best parts is you receive a free ice cream macaroon cookie sandwich for a Yelp check-in and it was very good (I had mango)! We will totally go back when in Vegas and we will be taking our kids to Korean BBQ over Spring Break in our hometown now! Fun, fun, fun & filing!

wZWn050QjPg893UNrLVqCA.text: Good customer service, fast serving, good food and my daughter loves the shrimp garlic.

0VJF7X6Ll5uGlppeiAV1pw.text: This place was so much fun! Meat sweats included.   I like that they offer set menus to take out the thinking of what all to get. I was so full I didn't want to try the other meats available.   With so many options available in Vegas now I can't say that this is my favorite. But definitely don't mind to come back and eat again!

f8ywS12H2kXZXfUGz9Y7vA.text: Automatic 1 star for serving nasty tasting tap water.   Vegas tap water has been  reported from local news sites to be as bad or almost as bad as flint Michigan's water. It taste terrible and I instantly recognize a restaurant that doesn't care enough to buy a filter when I am served tap.   What else do they not care about health wise??? Or do they need the $6 for a bottle of water that badly?? It is scummy either way to serve something questionably safe to save money or make more.   That being said we already ordered by the time our inital tap water came and the food was okay. We had to spend extra money on bottled water. Honestly I will go to Hobak or anywhere else. I kinda can't get past the nasty water thing. They present like a nicer restaurant but can't afford a filter for their water. I'm sure they are cheating customers out of good quality food.

SPLmV3QCS4NE-7raLOCARQ.text: Service was awesome. The food was great! We got a lot of food for our buck. My only con is that we had to cook our own food. I didn't know beforehand so I was confused. Also the heat was too high so some of the meat was burning. But I still had a great time. Also, you get free dessert when you check in!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LeEbjbvuudLummj8karTnA.text: Excellent food, highly recommend you try this place. Been to many Korean BBQ places and this one is one of the best.

PIWCcH0QMowLX5fkVVbEPw.text: First time coming to Vegas and decided to try this place out. Excellent food and excellent service. There was so much great team work shown and have excelled my expectations! My wife and I didn't have to wait to ask for any refills on our beverages nor have to ask anyone to take out our extra plates. I applaud for this! Keep up the great work and great foods! Will definitely come back before I end my vacation!

rZsYuUtm7OATP5pMGtYBJg.text: We arrived into Las Vegas looking for a late night meal.   This place did not disappoint.    I come from the Fairfax Centerville area where Korean restaurants are abundant.  KBBQ really comes down to the quality of the meat and skill at marination.   We were hungry and it was late, but the meat was fresh and the side dishes tasty.  A macron ice cream sandwich was tasty.    Kobe beef was a little pricey - although hey, we were on vacation.   Wouldn't mind coming here again.

tlV-aTs6OfE5Sv29iVRmTQ.text: We finally came here to try their food. Korean food is authentic and service was not bad. You should come here try their food !

NXbawijGgQnhKtupriRJ7w.text: The wait time was very long due to several large parties being ahead of our large party but the staff tried really hard to accommodate us. Aside from that, it's hard to mess up Korean bbq and this was no exception. There food was delicious and came out quickly once we were able to order.

D0mMmtSJ2_qFEpViCOCSsg.text: Very good, delicious bulgogi! It was fun to cook the meat--great interactive. The service was very good as well. I would come back to this restaurant and would recommend it.

5VOBmUtrI71ozwtx7i5Ybg.text: Delicious meal! The Korean prime kalbi was delicious, as were all of the sides and the bibimbap. Tons of food for under $15 each and good service. I highly recommend!

rVDqchytDUX__fB_fXUNCA.text: Very good variety of items to choose from and high quality meats. We went a la carte since not all the set menu items were for us. The kimchi pancake was very crispy and yummy. The oysters were fresh and sweet.

_a9JkA9Z2XJ1hTRhYIg5LA.text: Very good, saw on Yelp and it didn't disappoint!  Got the combo dinner with husband.  The meat was very tender and flavorful.  The wait staff is a bit Juliet or miss, but we came just after the lunch rush.  They were very friendly.

CjuaPVxTxcXI6BiVW_hTOg.text: Ate here on Valentine's Day with my fiance and we were amazed on the price and good quality of meats. Great food and great service. A hidden gem off the strip. Worth visiting again.

ur9_7PGa-SJjliLw3qXtqw.text: Its hard to find a good Korean BBQ place in Las Vegas.  This place is definitely a good place to try. My favorite was the kalbi which was very tender and juicy. Lemon chicken was also good. Side dishes were great too. I'll be back very soon.

_YbxVXurAKK5d7MXbqp9Ew.text: My first but last time here.  I went there because it stayed open late.  Terrible food, very friend staff.  Price not acceptable for what you get.

964qptD53HuPKt4-dBu6pA.text: Just wow! Some of the best Korean I have ever had... And I've been to Seoul! The portions are just right and so is the price so you can eat everything you want! My fav? Pork toro and pork belly :) the green tea ice cream is also amazing. Just try it- well worth the trip off the Strip.

rxMRu0J1J8f0ox42jw0LpQ.text: We were a little skeptical when we walked in because it wasn't too crowded. It started to fill in after awhile. We got the Gangnam set dinner and everything was really tasty.  Service was fast and friendly.  I wasn't sure it was going to be enough food for us, but we're going to leave with a happy, full tummy.

XXfgqbFbxkpqhYKE7Sye8g.text: I love the Marcoon but perphas it is only because of free marcoon they can have this review rate. The meet and BBQ itself is just so so compared to other places' Korean bbq

mfXOdB5ep82Bnwphan8N2w.text: Love this place . The Kobe beef so delicious . The overall quality meat is A. Service great and price point is reasonable and comparable to the dish portion they serve . Anybody love Korean BBQ and visit LV should try . Won't be sorry ...

VV-i_vpc76a3-OhYRt5rcw.text: Pretty delicious and extremely reasonable pricing considering you're in vegas. Everything tasted amazing. For 2, we ordered 4 meats (harami miso, Korean prime kalbi, bulgogi, and pork belly), corn, zucchini, steamed egg, dynamite shrimp, calamari, and an egg ramen. The only thing I'd skip on is the ramen, there's a perfect amount of food without it. Currently running a promo for free dessert for a yelp review so that's good too. :)

Fu_MUBmhwjwQdh56jPAJCQ.text: Fancy and clean place but not for Japanese food and also original Korean food. This place is only for Korean fusion food and BBQ. The BBQ is really good but not Korean people because of fusion style.  So many black pepper with meats and salty side dishes. Additionally,  the small quantity lettuce (kind of romaine) is truly more expensive than single order of pork belly. If you are rich, you can go there and enjoy their great foods. I hope they would be considered price such as volume sales at a low unit margin of profit.

-nU7sW5uThvQTkicIksQVw.text: Terrible service! Too slow to prepare table! It took 30minutes to complete the order. It's unacceptable!!

VFgjrKzPdVJN43qooP8nzQ.text: Let's be honest here. How many of you gave a 5 star to get free desert? Sure it's not the worst, I think it's fair to say 3 star in term of food. However in term of service I gave it a zero if I could. 1. Ultra long wait, not because it's crowed. it's just because the people there are not prepare to serve people. 2. The server pretend not to see you raise your hand, even though you do it right in front of her. 3. Talk about happy face, these people look grumpy. 4. I did notice some table get serve better than other. 5. food arrival after order = 1hr. eek!  PS. It should be illegal to bribe people for good review.

2hZ0rWn8ykK4fT9HDTOaxg.text: The working efficiency is almost zero. We ordered bbq and we don't need them to cook meet in the kitchen, we just need them to give us the fresh meat and we cooked by ourselves. It cost us almost 30 minutes just wait for the fresh meat. The waitress is rude and seems she served Korean people first. I noticed there are two tables who coming behind us, and they almost finished eating and we were still waiting.

GERJiJnlZSUcpQRN_sysyw.text: Fantasic and very prompt service. The food was exceptional. I will be returning soon and recommending to friends.

aLgiTiHObQJS6eSACyQVOg.text: Super delicious and affordable! I will definitely come back when I'm in Vegas. The only problem we had was that they forgot to bring out the side dishes and that they took forever to give us their check.

ZaWJmYaDVQP2Gy1eqe0frA.text: Cook your own BBQ.  Options of 45, 55, 65 for 2 with preset menu or pick your own.  Amazing

SNPAXf7PkiAloR0e_Rf3EQ.text: Obsessed. So freakin good. Great service too. You can't go wrong here! Try the broccoli fondue. Mmmm

fgmNd-_kDxC50QSiriiOxA.text: The food and service are great. We didn't have to wait too long for a party of 7 before 6. We got the meat lover for 6 and it was plenty. I have to say that the quality of the meat is much better than other Korean BBQ places.

Oe6HkhPRtk9za_0Kldiwzw.text: Love also going here when I'm in Vegas. Super close to the airport to grab a quick bite before your flight. If you check in, you get a free macaroon ice cream sandwich!

Foe7kYzE9OpqPo3C8KZH4A.text: Excellent food. Great service. As soon as I enter the restaurant I was seated with sides and fresh water already at my table something I've never seen before. Omg I will definitely be back soon. Smh way too good to be True

j_skfznARdMJvzWG1hy38w.text: This was our first meal in Vegas and really, not a bad one. The place is not huge, but does have accomodations for a few large groups. We weren't a large group but still had to wait around 20 minutes for lunch to get seated.  The food itself is more Korean style - not the most authentic Korean BBQ you're ever going to get, but it's not bad at all. The prices aren't terrible (could be cheaper like in other cities sometimes, but still not bad). Nothing stood out at me, but it was all decently solid food. Our main waitress kind of seemed like she didn't want to be bothered though. It wasn't bad service, but she still kind of gave off that vibe for some reason.  Anyway, if you are in the area and need something like Korean BBQ, this is not a bad option at all.

_bXIMikcceHKEohfqGtNpQ.text: Nice Korean food! Great beef, and sauces taste super authentic too! Will come back when I'm next in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super yummy desert!

eomhByMDnUOHTZSHupYvgg.text: I love their happy hour food deals and they offer quality choices of protein for cooking!

8Vrm-ST1MuiH0PNTcELgiw.text: This place is so incredible. The best food we had while in Vegas! Came twice during a weekend trip!

eDISTZRPTmfYY0KXU2r26Q.text: I eat here way too often but it is so good.  There's a ton of kbbq in this town and I've tried them all, and Gangnam comes out on top.  Maybe because I've never had to wait four thousand hours to get in like other places idk, but the overall quality, selection and consistency beats the competitors too.  The only other place that competes for my time is Gyu-Kaku, but that's jbbq so technically different.  For kbbq it's Gangnam all the way.

Epk48EhHQC-mMDRlzR-lWg.text: 5 stars 5 stars.  This place was delicious.  They have a nice grill in the middle to grill some yummy meat and tons of sides.  Everything we tried was good and large portions.  If I lived in vegas I would come here every Sunday and eat like a pig!

KPwpM1E676knHiRfwYxJyw.text: Generous servings, high quality ingredients, clean and reasonable prices. We got a 2 person meal, split 3 ways and still all were quite full at the end. Japanese and Korean fusion style bbq. Go for the set menus. Atmosphere is Koop meets gangsta. Was a lot of fun. Definitely recommend. Will go again

e5OkR61Xa1nOM1kgJQubPQ.text: My daughter who's into BTS (korean boy band) is craving for Korean Food. Thank God for Yelp app we found this restaurant!! Curious for having 4 1/2 star, I thought this might worth a try. And I'm so glad that we did. The set menu ( called Vegas) for 2 people is just perfect servings for the three of us. It starts with soup, appetizers and salad. And then comes the shrimps and 3 more kind of meat. Plus the yummy bibimbap!! Fast service, clean and welcoming ambiance. And of course awesome korean food. We will definitely do this korean food tripping again

b_yfN7TPeW_hdB-cz8830A.text: Amazing experience at this place.  The service was great. I found this place by looking for great happy hour spots. They have a late happy hour with great deals. This was first time at a Korean Japanese bbq. The idea of cooking my own food at a restaurant may not appeal to everyone but i loved it. The prices at happy hour was low enough to be able to try a little bit of everything.  After they tske your order. They turn on the grills amd bring out an assortment of sauces and sides....most of which i had no idea what they were but they were good.  We ordered broccoli , chicken cheese fondue, bulgogi, pork belly, spicy chicken, shrimp. Everything was delicious and fun. I can't wait until a place like this comes to my town.  Great food, great time.

uFAMIxeoZ7X9uJZ3Ay_VJQ.text: Today is the second time I have come to Gangnam Asian BBQ, and I absolutely love this place. Granted, both times have been during a week day and lunchtime, but, the service was prompt and friendly. The food is amazing! The decor is lovely. I like the low key music video playing on the large screen you can choose to ignore or enjoy.   As for the food, the Tuna Poki was fantastic - not fishy at all and the combo of tuna, seaweed and radish was fab. The spicy edamame - awesome. Lastly, the Fire Cracker Shrimp was no joke. It is not for the faint of heart, but if you love spicy food like I do, you will love the combination of crunch, spice and a bit of sweet. It was really tasty.  Would definitely come back again,

IGPj-BMpde_SbCO7dBmCuw.text: Omg yum! Went on a Sunday night, had our food in front of us so quickly! Def recommend the bulgogi, hwayo soju, and jalapeno poppers. Open late, and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum, green tea mochi!

OznEg6JcS4qcYze2CZWf5Q.text: We went here to celebrate a friend's bday. There was 8 people(4 couples) and they definitely accommodated us from corner dining, food options and table settings. Food was great and worth the group package deal. The service was fast as well. It was definitely a great experience.

diuJ7hEqa_lA7uSPN8UPYA.text: This place is awesome... especially during happy hours with happy hour prices.  We weren't sure what to expect at first being from LA with a huge Korean scene in K-town and Garden Grove... but the food is amazing, especially the spicy lemon chicken and Korean chicken fondue.  The chicken was SOOO tender ... I even asked how they got their chicken to be so tender, our server said it was because their chicken is free-range chicken.   Speaking of our server, Mam, she is as super attentive and overall amazing.  The rest of the servers were also great, they all seem to help out unlike other places were other servers won't help out other tables. Will definitely come back.

55D5yJ5fU5EHsR66YXKIPw.text: This was the best Korean we've eaten anywhere! We were staying at the MGM and wanted Korean. We were given 3 suggestions and chose Gangnam...we chose right! The device was excellent- very helpful and solicitous. Every thing was super fresh and top quality. We got the Premium for two...so much food but oh it was worth it! If we lived here we'd eat here every week!

c_EswpJwY55sQzkrhmJjPQ.text: I don't know many places for kbbq/jbbq in Vegas. But I found this gem thanks to other yelpers. It is in a random plaza behind the strip by Hard Rock.  All I have to say is the next time I'm craving kbbq when I'm in Vegas I know where to go! No wait to get seated. The food is quality and the service is great.   Another dope thing about this restaurant is that they have happy hour everyday from 3-6 and 10-close. Their happy hour is a great deal and for sure get you full for a cheaper price.   If you love kbbq, this is heaven. If you haven't tried, this is a great place to start. Definitely coming back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A la carte style menu

PbhzxBdorCq9gm_8U8irXA.text: I had this joint on my list of spots to try while in Vegas this time. I saw this on Food Network and coupled with some Yelp reviews I thought it was a good idea. Right before we left the hotel to go to the restaurant I read Yelper Betty N's review and was hoping her review was off a lil in relation to the majority of Yelp reviews. As the evening wore on I quickly realized Betty N was on point with her review and the rest were skewed and off kilter. We ordered the Las Vegas which is a meal for two, and added the ribs. The ribs were ok but for me this was the most flavorless meal the whole trip. I was sorely disappointed. I have nothing more to say about this.  Oh wait...the drinks were ok.

WqlX3tvMSNXoA8N65pByxQ.text: One of my favorite places in Vegas.  Great food and great service! Definetely give this place a shot!

aQ7jLcqEbM4GxlI_mKbvLw.text: Lived in Korea twice for one year each time, first authentic eatery in the US--and i searched in many places!

5bsOf_ic797yCtPXe_hG4g.text: Best Korean BBQ in the city. Very nice selection of food and authentic. The steamed egg with white rice is one of my personal favorites and the selection of ice cream macaroons they have will make you have a sweet tooth after your meal. It's gets pretty busy at night which is a sign that the food is good but the wait time is never too long. Very n

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

8WhtgZVOL8aLyPbBaYsjEA.text: Best place to have Korean BBQ!!! Food has very good taste (better than GEN) and the customer service top of the line. The guys are on it!

DoRVd8BP1zn1e78NT12inA.text: This place is solid. The meat is a good quality, and the salad was fresh, we liked the mushrooms they gave us to grill in a foil pack, and the corn.    We ordered the Gangnam special for 2 people, and a side dish of corn cheese. I have had different type of corn cheese in la, so this one was just ok to me.. maybe a little too creamy? and it didn't get really burned on the bottom of the cast iron dish it was, (neither did the bulgogi bibimbap, but it was still tasty).  Ended up paying around $90 including tip for 2 people, and we did not have any drinks, just water.  Overall I would say that the quality and taste of this place is pretty good, however it is a little pricy if you are expecting typical korean bbq stuff. For example, the Gangnam didn't include Brisket, or Pork belly, which is usually one of our staples for korean bbq. It did however include some oysters, which was nice (although I don't like oysters too much myself).  We are used to korean bbq in california, where you can get AYCE ranging as low as $9.99-$30 per person, and I'm also used to wrapping my korean bbq in radish and rice paper and a plethora of sesame oil plus salt and pepper sauce, and lots of sliced green onion.  You can order meat ala carte, so they do have a customizable menu based on how much you want to try/order....  The side dishes were pretty good, I liked the fish cake, etc.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. different meats on the grill
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. banchan (sides) and miso soup

3DBv9k0K-JFZh6-DWlPpug.text: Me and the group I was with went to this restaurant because I saw Korean BBQ on a sign while passing by. I hadn't had bulgogi in a while so I pointed it out.   We hadn't been to a restaurant like this so we were a bit confused, about how to cook the meat. Someone who worked at the restaurant came and helped us out so much. He basically cooked the meat for us, which was amazing. Now I'll know how to cook it myself next time.   I wanted to ask him if he was the chef because he seemed to know so much about cooking. We later found out that he was the owner. He was so humble and just helped us out no questions asked.   His customer service was so beyond amazing!!!  Everything that we are was really good as well. When I come back to Vegas, I will defiantly come back here and I highly recommend this place.

5ywVUw2m6jZntGLNtdcbtw.text: Everything was very good. We ordered the meat lovers combo plus the wontons off of the happy hour menu. Great for date nights.

ADj5Z0vEFBxrNmsJhqMIsA.text: Once again, Yelp! provided an awesome assist in finding somewhere to eat that would satisfy our cravings. Las Vegas is ever changing; the Korean eatery we used to patronize seemed to lose its luster in service & food quality. Having confidence in our Yelp!ers, I went with this place.  Food = yum! Portions = great! Service = on point.  Restrooms = clean. Parking = free.  Only concern? Our grill kept flaring up & scaring not only is, but the neighboring patrons as well. We laughed it off--nervously--and the wait staff quickly came to our aid. They had to change/fix our grill three times!   In the end, we would come back again. We know we just experienced a glitch and was glad no one was hurt.

eS_nExFw9-TlJOYB9T7YqQ.text: If you are staying at the Hard Rock, go to Gangnam!!! If you are staying on the strip-Uber to Gangnam!!! The food and service were great!!!

Jt2Ds-7Kgdb97aMoWyqs-g.text: This is a Korean BBQ place that is trendy and fun. The servers have a funky, friendly attitude that translates well with the interesting cuisine and atmosphere. There is high energy music playing and even if it's your first time, they make you feel like a regular.   The best part by far is the food. This is the best Korean food I've had in the Valley. My goodness, we ordered a lot and we finished every last bite. I think my husband's beef stole the show. It was delicate and flavorful. We both agreed we had to come back soon. What a grand experience!

lvSdIe4EC1e0M5zUe4Yjxg.text: It was great we had spicy chicken Korean chicken and beef brisket ribeye short ribs and some other beef with rice salad dumplings and broccoli it was all pretty tasty cheese was a little bit sweet wasn't a big fan of that they came in traded our grill out numerous times frequent refills great service the wait was kind of wild but it was the Thursday evening w/o reservation and upside with a yelp check in I got a free macaroon ice cream sandwich yasssssss btw I left so crazy full I was super

ArpaeyGgxa2T0rwweIFZiw.text: This is the best Korean Bbq of all the Bbq places i have been. Yummy side dishes!!! I ordered vegetarian version of Japche ,Original  Bibimbap  and Everything tasted pretty good. Don't miss the macaroon ice-cream .

L9jj7Zq-93fyIx0EJIQ6Wg.text: WE WERE SURPRISED  **2016 Yelp 100 Challenge #9**  The place was empty & we were seated right away.  They have a PRIVATE dining area as well.  The place looked clean but I was a bit EH because I looked up & the filtration grills looked absolutely DISGUSTINGLY dusty & oily.  To the point I was scared that the dust might fall into my food....  I used to work at a  ASIAN BBQ joint so it literally looked like they haven't cleaned it for a month.  =[   The service was quick & fast but definitely would say they could work on smiling a bit?  Ahahahah our server was AWSOME though cuz we also knew her from the sushi resteraunt that we love so much in north Vegas!  (The second time we went the service was definitely slower even though there was no one in the place...  Like asking for water and side dishes multiple time from different people before receiving.  So maybe need a little work on the employees).   The quality of the meat was SURPRISINGLY good! They are a Korean joint but they have the concept kind of like Japanese BBQ in style of serving.  You get a whole bunch of side dishes like any Korean resteraunt & the side dishes aren't bad at all.  They were a good amount & good quality for the amount of money you pay I would say.  I can't really say the other dishes were that great as for the NORMAL palate....  I would have to say it is a bit on the SALTIER side...  But I LOVED IT.  PRIME GALBI $8.95 - just straight up melts in your damn mouth!   HARAMI MISO $8.95 - this is out skirt steak & loved the extra miso flavor.   GARLIC SHRIMP W/ HEAD $5.95 - what a steal. On the price I personally think for jumbo shrimp at only $6 bux & it is lightly seasoned w/ garlic.   ENOKI W/BACON $4.95 - no difference but you do get a lot of enoki mushrooms which is great & you get 4 pieces.   ASPARAGUS W/ BACON $4.95 KABOCHA SQUASH $2.95   BROCCOLI $3.95 - this comes inside a foil already steamed for you to finish off on the grill to give a little char.   PORK TORO $5.95 - ummmmm my FAVORITE part of the pork & you get it at pretty much a $1 a slice!  Where as most places I have been to it is $2 a slice   SPICY TUNA KIMBAP $6.95 - this is literally see weed wrapped rice & then tempura battered.  It has the PERFECT chewy texture like mochi & then stopped off w/ spicy Mayo tuna!   CHILI SPICY WINGS $6.95 - this is what typical Korean wings taste like & I love it.   SPICY SOFT TOFU SOUP $9.95 - I absolutely CRAVE this damn soup....  I'm sure there is some crack in it...  & doesn't really taste like your typical Korean spicy soft tofu soup but I loved it!

Will definitely come back when we visit Vegas again.

JB94g9hSXK514mamkn6bng.text: Came here after a show and got here just in time for Happy Hour (after 10pm.) The food was really good. Marinaded chicken and beef were flavorful after the cook. Ordered 2 bulgogis, chicken w/cheese, seaweed salad, edamame, 2 bowls of rice, a soft drink, and a free macaroon for free check-in and all came out to be $25 and change for HH price. Left $35 cash and out. Friendly staff. Food was brought out quick. Started grilling within 5 mins or less. I'll be back in the future.

qIJwUcYdB0MT-Y7zsZordQ.text: Clean and chic Korean restaurant! Came here for lunch on a Friday.  This place serves quality meat you can taste. Service is very quick and friendly. The side dishes are all tasty. There are korean music videos playing inside, keeping patrons entertained and in the korean mood. The spicy tuna kim bap was the surprise of the meal - very tasty. The Kimbap  was fried with marinated spicy tuna in a bowl. Korean prime kalbi was excellent as well!  The only caution would be the meat portions are VERY small. For example, the prime galbi only comes out to be like 4 or 5 tiny pieces....bulgogi portion was also very small...I killed it in literally two bites.....if you want to get more meat, stick with samgyupsal because it looked like they give you more portion for pork meats.  Also, for limited time only, if you write a yelp review and show it to them, they will give you a free dessert! We got the fried banana tampura with green tea ice cream..it was really good!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Kimbap app!
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Galbi - portion is ridiculously small but tastes amazing!

ufY70ioyyPU62aG0tVczeA.text: Went here for dinner tonight. Since I was alone, they asked me if I would like to sit at the bar and like a fool I said Yes, not realizing that it meant not getting to grill my own meat. Oh Well... You live, you learn.(I wish they had told me that though).  They started me off with a plethora of side dishes and accompaniments which all eventually went really well with the meats and a bowl of white rice; everything except a random macaroni salad that is which I didn't quite understand being there.  I ordered the Kobe Beef which was the main reason I went here and the Garlic Calamari which they recommended. They serve 6 pieces of beef and some sea salt which you absolutely must sprinkle on. It enhances the flavor exponentially. This was my first time eating Kobe Beef and I now understand what all the hype is about. It was just juicy, so flavorful, so amazingly tender. Without a shadow of a  doubt the best quality beef I've ever had.  They did overcook it a tad and it was medium-well which is maybe how they do it, but for such a cut I would most certainly have preferred a mid-rare. Very highly recommended, even though it's ridiculously pricey. The Garlic Calamari was a huge fail. They were cooked well and tender but had no flavor at all and I had to douse them in hot sauce and soy to finish them.  Overall this was an awesome meal. I would definitely love to go back here and try some more cuts and also grill them myself this time by getting a table instead of sitting at the bar. It's actually pretty reasonable(except the Kobe obviously) considering how much meat they serve. Definitely recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Calamari - Meh. Skip it.
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe Beef was heavenly. They did overcook it a tad though.
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The kimchi and the pickled cucumbers were my favorite.

SW_YZoAdQKA7-wi1tPwsrQ.text: So bomb! You have to get the jalapeno poppers and the bulgogi.   This place gives you a whole bunch of free yummy side dishes!  Cook it yourself ;) it's a lot of fun :) the service is very good and you should all come for happy hour! Good choices on happy hour and 50% off drinks!!

ODIKQ_qJXysRnZfxVAFEqw.text: I come from Boston, where there are only a handful of Korean restaurants. Even in Boston, they do not charge extra for 'ssam/ lettuce wrap' for the meats and for the salt/ sesame oil dip. This place charges an extra $2 for the lettuce, another $1 for the sesame oil sauce, and about $1.5 each for a bowl of rice. My husband dines like a True Korean, so he had to order those sides for a complete Korean BBQ meal. I found these surcharges to be very unappealing for a Korean restaurant and won't be coming back to this restaurant for this reason. It comes off as cheap and not allowing patrons to get the full Korean BBQ dining experience.   Quality of the meat is good, but portions are ridiculously small. The samgyupsal (pork belly) pieces are sliced very thin and contains much more fat than meat (not in an appealing way that typical pork belly fat to meat ratio contains).   Due to their current promotion of getting a free dessert for writing a review, I believe that the ratings here are highly skewed. The waitress reads your review on the spot then gives you a dessert. I highly doubt these reviewers here are writing an honest and thoughtful review of this place.

ZjU_vQqiOxW64O-6IWMr2w.text: With so many great places to eat in Vegas, Korean BBQ is like a comfort food when we're away from home. We had a table of 6 people and we're all from Denver. When I say this is the BEST Korean BBQ I've ever had, I'm not just pulling your leg. We ordered the Premium for 6 people and there was SO MUCH FOOD and it was all incredibly delicious! Unless you can eat a cow, you'll definitely be having a ton of left over food. You also get a free dessert if you check-in (one time use for first time check-in) and I suggest the green tea ice cream macaroon. We all agreed we'd be coming back to this restaurant whenever we visit Vegas. We're all wishing there was a place like this in Denver. Gangnam Korean BBQ is seriously killing the game.

qyY4IIIcGpzxmqG8OzRaVA.text: This was my first experience with Korean BBQ. I was in Vegas last June and tried this place out based on Yelp reviews.  It was outstanding.  I've had Korean BBQ at several places since then, but no one can match Gangnam.  Still chasing the dragon of that first time.....

Led9bm21KKX2T9KQlFIKGQ.text: We went here for lunch and got the lunch special. There were a variety of meats to choose from along with a huge variety of side dishes. The flavor and cuts of meat were very perfect. The customer service was on point and at no point did I have to look for a server. My water was always full and we were well taken care of. The menu selection is easy and not complicated. I have no issues granting a 5 star review for this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very nicely laid out and decorated dining area.

eMaaD_hWpYpL13t_tyLMgw.text: They offer free dessert for a review which is, I believe, why it is so highly rated.   Depends what you are looking for; reasonably priced, tasty food, this is an option.   Fine dining with ambience; probably not the right place.   The food was good, the service was good and the pricing was also good; but I would definitely not say it was great.  The decor was ok.   My wife and I went, based on the reviews; it is located in a nondescript strip mall, thankfully my wife noticed it.   We arrived during happy hour.   We ordered a few items from the happy hour menu and a few off the regular menu.   We also had one of their specialty cocktails.   The food was good, some better than others.   We had the calamari, while tasty, it was a little dry and perhaps overcooked.   We also had some beef items based on the reviews and they were good.   The veggies were delicious.   I have been to Korean BBQ before, and I had enjoyed it. For our meal, I think we needed some sauces for the meat dishes.

2CRCm9Ig0EYi9Pp7zcmXUw.text: Such a nice atmosphere! The meets are great quality and filled with flavor. I love how they also give the customers different sauces as well since I love full flavors and sauces. Hehe, definitely coming back. The happy hour is great. Their drink menu is awesome as well, you MUST try the lychee martini, so yumzz! :)

9Psr-e_TUQPwar2RytNtfA.text: Gangnam is not AYCE and I'm used to AYCE bbq so i get worried that these type of places won't satisfy me. Having that said, the meat lover's dinner for 2 and a side of Pork Toro for myself and my wife was MORE than enough. We could have easily done without the extra dish. The quality of meat was really good and we were very pleased with everything. The restaurant is clean and we didn't wait long.

a2TW1W6JnBENHQp6qj2a9A.text: Macaroon ice cream for the win!  Legit bimbimbap served extra crispy in a flat skillet.  Great service, good vibes-will be back next time in town!

5nmgnbKsFDmdLu7u7vNs4w.text: For a non all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ, you get a TON of bang for your buck. We opted on a la carte options for happy hour and got beef toro, Korean prime kalbi, pork belly and bulgogi for our meat options. All were delicious and almost as good as my moms! (Just don't tell her.) The banchan (side dishes) are delish, as well! Will definitely be back!

gEwJdiP47Sx2EORqVjW1VQ.text: I discovered this place recently after walking the areas near unlv for good places to eat and I have to say I'm very satisfied with the food and the customer service and quality of this place. The food doesn't take long to be served once ordered, it tastes good and there are plenty of complementary side dishes served with any order. The quality and quantity of the food are good and reasonable and definitely a place I will be visiting for lunch and dinner. Also my first time trying Korean food was this restaurant and my first impression is definitely good . I'd like to try more different Korean food and possibly from here. Bonus: I got a macaron ice cream after doing a yelp check in and it was delicious!

ghtf2qKGbiOrc3M1y1jvvA.text: Fantastic high quality food and even better service, get the filet. Try the combo meals. Cook your food right at the table.  Better than any other place I've had in vegas. Yum!

V6tVRDHr9OkvUV2zNtjlXQ.text: Decided to try this place because of all the reviews on here. I love Korean bqq a lot and normally go to Sura but wanted a change. Came here, and instantly liked the atmosphere. Experience was not good at all.   The food is good. We got their number one seller Gangnam combo. Which would've been perfect but we never got our sides that came out with it. It says you get complimentary sides, and they just never came. We also ordered an extra side of rice, again never came. Basically when ever we ordered things, it either came out super late or not at all. Service is also slow and not attentive at all. I guess we made it inbetween shifts because near the end, we didn't see our waitress at all and a new server took the rest of our order. It wouldn't have been bad, but it would've been considerate to just let us know. We waited way too long for everything.   I will not be coming back purely because of the experience. Food was decent, but nothing to make me want to come back.

Z7lbL39muz9hdl_tZ3v_Vg.text: Brought my sis and best friend here for the first time, they have never done a Korean BBQ and they loved it!!!  Can't wait to be back!!! So good food service and price! I think it's the only Korean BBQ in vegas I would go to...just right benone the strip!

tcRuTQzEzazqUTuGUDxCgQ.text: Love this place!! Great atmosphere, good drinks, and good service.  We've been to sura BBQ before, but it does not compare.  Clean place ands good location. -CQ5wOfDlqxXNjmOvKXDog.text: Poor taste and meat quality.     Koreans will not like this place.   Worst food experience for $70.00.    All the Asian food has been adjusted to be suitable for American taste.

f-UGgXtzLb_qVt_LEnOP8g.text: Great service! great food! totally will come back. ambiance is pretty nice nice outlet for a date or family night! it made my night for me and my family. they also made sure everything is well taken care of

PZIneNfIHMagfwWigVCoKA.text: the food here is pretty good. the pork belly literally melts in your mouth. the only reason why I'm getting three stars is the shit service. my boyfriend and I were visiting Vegas out of town, but didn't wanna splurge on a hotel buffet. we walked in on a WEDNESDAY afternoon, no rush or anything. our waiter was extremely rude, nonchalant, and looked as if we were graced with his presence, lmao. it took forever 20-30 minutes to get his attention, he never checked on us. too bad they didn't wear name tags here. i was appalled! ive never EVER received such terrible service.   if you'd still like to eat here, i would order a lot of food in advanced and double up on your banchan.

yvhKMmRg0asx1-MZt3U8dw.text: Lots of folks love this place.   It's got lots of positive yelp.   I see why.  It was not expensive and the dinner was amazing.

WDtVZAti_YlFPPsTjV_owA.text: Stumbled across this place on my last day in Vegas. This is a go-to place if you're looking for good Korean food at an affordable price (much cheaper than restaurants on The Strip). I liked everything I ordered (beef toro, pork belly, bulgogi, kobe style beef, tongue). Keep in mind, you will definitely leave here with a strong odor on your clothes and belongings.

59DrNFtynU3dJPunPM7h8w.text: I always wanted to try a Korean BBQ and so I found this place on yelp and food was great, it's was opened late too so definitely another plus. Servers were friendly but hard to get their attention. Also checked in on yelp so free macaroon ice which was perfect.

This place lives up to all the reviews on here. The dessert as you enter draw you in like a moth to a flame. The Beef Sukiyaki in the hot stone bowl tasted very good. I definitely recommend it.

w_WxgQH4KUDKAomDFxnzdw.text: Service was excellent.  Meat quality was great.  Sides were good but not amazing.  Improve your sides a bit!  The salad was really good though.  Dinner can be a bit pricey ~$32+ a person.  Lunch can be from $15-20.  Recommended.

hRtKVea0fRC_DNVM9xmfNQ.text: Loved the spicy chicken option for BBQ. Cream cheese wontons were great. Didn't enjoy the shrimp and calamari as much- bit too bland for my taste. The biggest pro of this place is the free macaron sandwich with yelp check in

Even food is good, some staff is nice, it is hard to come back.

jKxK47dz6D-ZpKqmd-oTeA.text: I think that the food is not at all authentic Korean food because everything tasted like a Fast Food version of Korean Food. Not only the food to complain about is that the service was horrible. The staff members seemed obedient at first but when we ordered, the food came out super slowly and the staff members seemed like they just forgot what we asked them. I think that this is the worst Korean BBQ restaurant ever cause of their service and horrid quality of food.

fPnTmEfymHzWHWX0Tie0nA.text: It started off slow but only improved from there. The food was very good.  We ordered the beef tongue with green onions and were impressed. A good start.  From there we also got harame miso skirt steak, beef and pork toro, more beef tongue and stuff called veggies including the mushroom medley, tofu, kabocha squash and Zucchini.  Everything was good to very good. Hit the spot perfectly!

I2r7iVR4kG6xw0AsEaBc6w.text: Great foods and great service . Drive 5 hours from AZ. This a great foods to help me recover.

-kwnp66XYTAG_gwRC21QUQ.text: By far,  the best Korean food I've had to date.  Everything was excellent!   The staff was courteous, attentive and the atmosphere was great.  Definitely coming back!!!

7UJ3dSrdRcSOGR-CsDMIuA.text: I told a friend of mine that I wanted to have my birthday celebration here. They give plenty of food but it's hard to flag down service when you need something. We had a party of 8. I'm also used to the servers giving tips and helping you cook at times. This was more of a 100% own and if you need help, like I said, you have to catch eye contact with one of the waiters that are standing around. I've had better Asian BBQ experiences in town.

VrRKI3ZL9KK7bsSzfz6Y8A.text: I came here cause of all the great reviews!  Services is great  Food is Good  Side dishes was Good  Will be back when I'm in town

ChArlgBvBPgmmlf4eA07IQ.text: Good food, a lot of food too, the fried rice and miso was amazing! Some of the meat didn't have much flavor. Depends of your preference. Service was great! I recommend trying this place out!!

jHeg2v19v4RsN2UnDlCsFQ.text: We were in town for the weekend and really enjoyed our time here!  Clean, good energy, great attentive staff and best of all, amazing food!

9upznP3B0tbGeH90x24YNQ.text: So glad we decided to eat here instead of some overpriced place on the strip lmao. Really good variety of meats for the bbq, awesome side dishes. I couldn't find a single thing I didn't like. There was a bit of a wait, but the staff was friendly and helpful, so that more than make up for it. Do yourself a favor and try this place! I would definitely go again.

KdFsg_2MutkUKM-40hF9eA.text: Best Tempura Udon ever. Seriously.  So good! Korean Prime Kalbi and Bulgogi - to die for! Very cute place. We will def' be back. Steam dumplings are a must have to.

fS6GwtiDCID6QbdxwXzhPA.text: This Korean spot is average. Their banchan is okay. Only liked half of them. Other half was bland. This place is cheap for what they give you. The meats are really good. We got the Gangnam set and you are able to substitute dishes that you don't want so that's a plus. For the amount of food we got, $65 isn't much. If we ordered them al carte, then it probably would've been even cheaper but we were really lazy and hungry.   The service was attentive. 5/5  The reason why I'm deducting a star is because the seats is far from the table making it uncomfortable while eating. Also it's super hot! Been to maybe Korean bbq spots were it was cool and refreshing to eat. Also maybe the music. I like the music but not what you really want to listen to while eating.  Probably won't come back. Nice spot to get full though.

o4dFv65fBmhbeHSjkVANfQ.text: Delicious Korean BBQ in a beautiful place. Service is good and food is plenty and tasteful. We had the filet mignon, short beef and pork belly. All super good. For appetizers we had the cream cheese wonton (I loved it, my husband didn't because it was too creamy for him) and the spicy tuna. The tuna came was like a tempura with a sauce on top. Delicious but a little too spicy for me. For my husband, it was he best dish we had. For sides, we had asparagus and zucchini. Simple but good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jgpmYQzosXdjAXCDvVrhWg.text: Great food and environment! The prices are reasonable, especially happy hour. We loved the kalbi and bulgogi, and the service was excellent. The spicy sauce is also delicious. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone!

6ymSbltpSf6a8D1ONRgVXA.text: We paid for a $15 cab ride to get to this place 40 minutes before they were supposed to close only to be told that their kitchen was already closed.  What a disappointment and waste of money.

qNhUT5BNyGfxG11hDDX5ew.text: Excellent. Loved this place! We got the Gangnam platter and had enough food for 4 ppl!

XVztE383DhVH5kTBPH1I1A.text: The food is great! I liked the side dishes and the meat is very good quality. The beef bulgogi is great and the beef brisket is good.  I like the look Olof the restaurant and the service is good!

VTUZvtFUcq3LFTrXJDZBtA.text: Traveling from MD for climbing. Stopped after a day of climbing in Joshua Tree. Arrived around 9pm on a Friday. Waited about 15 minutes. Three of us, two males and one female, ordered meat lovers for 2 people and it was plenty of food!! The food came out really fast!

_suZVea_rEivWsUE1rONJg.text: This is the best Korean BBQ that I always love to go when I am in Vegas :) Coming to try them by yourself and hope you will agree with me about their  delicious food and friendly services!  Enjoy!  Annie

mXq1u87ifta5RGE_5tApXw.text: Fast service. Food came within 5 minutes about 20 dishes.  Cheap prices and great quality food. Also free macaroons if you order $15 or more and redeem on yelp

ZiXzwR7Vq4YKmkE_1B9TPg.text: What a fun way to have dinner!  We ordered the Ganghan for 4 people & there was so much food, we couldn't finish. The sides were plentiful & tasty. Ask for the special sauces - there are 2 red sauces that are much better than Siracha with the beef. My favorite side fish was the bibimbop and my favorite meat was the filet mignon, but all of the meats were marinated nicely.

JgKzO2lSa8rPnwFrzZ_MZw.text: This place was way more than I expected.  We had just arrived in Las Vegas (we drove), and our rooms weren't ready yet at our hotel, so we decided to have a late lunch.  This happened to be the closest to where we were staying at.  We had the Gangnam option for bbq, and man did we have a lot!  We had so many meat options, and all I can say is that the meats were so tender, and even without any dipping sauces, it had so much flavor.  The sides that came with were also super amazing.  The service was excellent.  Our waiter was amazing - he walked us through all the meats, which ones to eat first and last, and really went above and beyond in making sure we were satisfied with our meals.  Will definitely come back here!

xwB2Xc4AZ4o8SH6xyeUhiw.text: Got the premium special for 2 people and it was awesome! The quality of the meat was pretty good and there was more than enough meat/seafood to fill us up. My only compliant is that one of the meats was too sweet and it was the least favorite meat. The Thai tea is also tiny for $3.95. However, everything else is great. Service is awesome too

OcHSestiQh4fum2fue3U6A.text: I try to expand my horizon when it comes to food and asian bbq is one reason why. Finding a delicious place is hard and finding good service is harder. I found this place to be above average in both. It is perfect for families and short groups. Not good for take out obviously atleast with the things I ordered.

VOFGoObvkAV9YmUSb6M3tg.text: Tourists and locals: save your money and go somewhere in China town. It's easy to find a place with the same or better food with the same atmosphere for way cheaper.  Food was average and the service was less then average.

9QegQaBd38F3ubOCUhK6kw.text: The wait was a little long. The wait for food, for service... The food was delicious! I got the korean prime rib and the garlic chicken with cheese fondu and filet mignon and garlic squid. We also got the spicy tuna kimbab which was AMAZING. And some fried calamari. This place was nice but only one girl served us well. The others were very busy, didn't teach us how to grill or put oil in the grill or get us drinks but the one girl did.

zw_E85HZNg9QfMkIbXRAYw.text: This was really good and happy hour prices can't be beat. Our favorite of the meats was the bulgogi and Korean prime kolbi.  Would definitely come again if we lived in the area.

Km0J9vX9GtRsj-mUYP5c3A.text: Wonderful food and great service. Reasonably priced and amazing find in Vegas! We had the bulgogi and the kalbi with white rice and sides and it was amazing. Would highly recommend.

5cIYTEx3iyQ419zXNn7nBQ.text: Great atmosphere, service and food!! All of the meat cuts are fresh and delicious! The banana tempura is amazing! Will definitely come back!!

DMLSncWhhqCfaNToAy1zgg.text: Great food, good price. Amazing people working here. Their music sends an amazing vibe throughout the place. Also #freedessertswithyelpreview

SEb78NzDKCuVOVh3Vktiaw.text: As usual I discovered this place on the go. Didn't read any reviews but I was looking for some ethnic food and saw the sign.  When I pulled up it wasn't quite open for lunch but the people waiting outside said it was well worth the few minute wait for the doors to open.   Once inside, the decor was traditional for Asian cuisine. There was also a projection screen playing a combination of Asian and American pop videos which was pretty amusing.   There was a variety of menus options which was typical for Korean BBQ.  So if you've ever been to one of these places, the food is as good as you cook it.  I was surprised by the edamame...a buttery garlic delight. The green tea cheese cake was much better than expected.  The bottom line is that this place is pretty good and I would definitely come here again when in the mood for #cookedbyme cuisine.

sioeUCpD49Rt23NViNUHQw.text: The food here was great. It was definitely one of the better Korean foods that I have had so far. The customer service was top notch and were very friendly. I would definitely recommend people to come try this place out!!

QYf_iUlCypQAJExke3-bAw.text: The best Asian barbecue in Las Vegas. You should come here for lunch it's a very good deal, you get two entrees for under $12. Order the pitcher  of sangria

V1M4k1yReE6HETcMJgOl6w.text: My expire nice for this restaurant is a 5 star rating because I really like there food- by cristopher

p1_UkAjO1DajHW-VdnV9Nw.text: We made a reservation for tonight as we had family in town. They accommodated us and the food was great. We liked beef toro (brisket), flat iron garlic and bacon wrapped scallops. Kimchi was average but overall great experience. Highly recommend!!!

Z42KcveIYk6VaYu_lLyBgw.text: Food is good. We came in during happy hour, ordered the steamed dumplings with spicy sauce..delicious.. the calamari was good too... Ordered the steamed eggs for my son and he loved it... That's all that matters... Bimbibap was good according to my hubs... We're still here waiting for the chicken karage and spicy egg ramen..

xWqsLZPt_5lVGm9X8CVKQQ.text: The worst experience in Vegas. According to my own experience, the yelp rate of this restaurant is fake.  We waited for one hour to get a table. The room was freezing. The waitress was very rude. It took forever to get the menu and wait for your order. The restaurant is obviously incapable to handle those many guests. The waitress ignored us for several times and when we stopped her, she told us she is so tired and worked for more than 10 hours. Maybe this is another consequence after they faked the rate here.

igK36f-nFn9AEt0XPtwgNQ.text: They have great lunch specials. The spicy pork is delicious and grilling your own  meat is easy. Will return again!

P_5lYoQHaTWJs_gbuYxNSg.text: Good but slightly pricey. What we liked was the fish cakes and the sweet onion. The Kobe style beef was pricey and not really worth it. Try to miso beef instead.

wpYs7aXB2xIj8KwVRN-tiQ.text: I love the spicy tuna kimbap appetizer. They even let me tweek one of my orders. The service was friendly. I always come to this spot when I'm in Vegas.

TeyrCPg_5AekLHgWWtUGCA.text: Not AYCE but the combos gave a great, delicious variety. My family got the Gangnam combo special with the bulgogi bimbimbap (which was AMAZING). It came with various side dishes (which you can request more if you'd like), miso soup, oysters, soft tofu kimchi, salad, and 6 bbq dishes; all of which were great. It's a little on the pricier side but for what you get, it's worth it! Will be coming back for sure!!

LSgema1apXKp2RB_BSVAKg.text: Came around 10 on a Sunday. Had a wait for the booths on the side but nothing too serious. Had a good assortment: kalbi, bulgogi and pork belly. Also got the bibimbop. The bulgogi was some of the best I have ever had anywhere. The kalbi was actually disappointing, it wasn't bad it just wasn't great. Also the kimchi was too sweet for my taste. I assume that number of reviews comes from the fact they give you a free dessert for  a yelp review.

c50Wr76Wu77LyyaAffUMAA.text: The happy hour menu was excellent -- we ordered nearly everything off the menu! Order the BBQ meats -- they were tasty. Great service!

jZW5D85v5jXqtVzowocUiA.text: It was great to stumble upon this place. Everything was pretty high quality and they've got lots of variety. Seafood pancake was excellent and well priced. Late night happy hour. Will def be back.

YUAHbQXaSDaazDN--79qDQ.text: We came here on New Years and he wait was oretty long but understandable. Amazing kimchi jjigae. Seriously perfectly balanced. Great Galbi. Sam gyup was alright. Overall everything was good.

ZpZg8TRvoy2N41rXWTtdlA.text: Yummy food and great service. Webcam as a group and surprised there is big enough table cooking table for all of us. Very comfortable seating and friendly service. Will definitely come back the next time we visit!

5VOeB_iWRkyCnd1_SNXgJA.text: Great place for Korean BBQ. Everything tasted good. The service was a little slow initially.

VzoY2R14JpUkFC06gIJnJQ.text: Amazing quality cuts and decent prices, bulgogi is to die for. Definitely recommend this spot to friends, and I will be coming back next time I'm in town.

Ta-24KKE9E7zNJHdzE9_ZQ.text: My girlfreind and I came in here after searching on google for korean bbq place near the strip and we found this place. We are from la and we have gyu-kaku which is very similar to this place. The parking is very convinient and easy to fins. The food was delicious. We ordered chicken karrage which was actually better than gyu-kaku so thats a huge plus! The harami miso melts in the mouth so that's another plus! The service was quick and everyone here has a smile on their face. 5 stars hands down. Definitely a place to check out if your craving korean/japaneese style food.   Tip to the owner: advertise on the strip and you will get way more customers, because this place is awesome!!   Food: 5 stars Service: 5 stars
