i9cUReEmv2yIaXCxvfoGUA.text: This is one of the best Korean BBQ places in LV! Don't leave Vegas without stopping here!

HEu6B_I30vdRUy3Ptp1w2A.text: Meat is seasoned to perfection! Sweet and attentive waiters! Came during happy hour and prices are way good. Very cheap actually. Ordered the toro beef, bulgogi, and chicken cheese fondue. They offer three different dipping sauces, all were tasty. Free dessert with each review, ice cream macaroon or banana tempura. We got both since the boyfriend and I each wrote one. Both were delicious. If you're looking to share, the banana tempura portion is large.

Oj9ZcympmQ2RjlAgIgXhug.text: The service here is great. The was good. Especially the bugolgi. Check this place out if you like Korean bbq

Hevk2iERse0l32vK0MVejw.text: My sisters and I have been coming here for four years now every time we go to Vegas and it has pretty much become our place to eat. It's sooooo delicious and not expensive. I always get hot stone bimbimbop and they mix it for you which is great. Last time I went they took off something I love from the menu but they made it for me anyways! I'm not sure where else I would eat if this place was gone, good Korean bbq never gets old.

XYASgfembjapkXWrBGRq2Q.text: This was an exceptional good meal. Came here based off fantastic Yelp reviews and Yelpers didn't disappoint! I love the atmosphere and cook it yourself at the table. Ordered a few different things for table and had a blast. Everything was amazing. Cheese wontons and their sweet & sour was out of this world!   Tried the chicken, beef, bacon asparagus. Fantastic. Worth a stop here if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CejudustIp7O69yPBY7UpQ.text: Great food! We went in for lunch on a very HOT Saturday escapade. We ended up ordering ala carte from their wide variety of choices on their menu. It came out really cheap. The serving size was decent. The restaurant was almost 80% Full, and surprisingly we waited almost an hour for our order to be served.   Good thing the food tasted sooooo Great that it made up for the lost appetite and delayed service. Try the Kalbi Steak and the Beef Tongue

gHnzvo2RWVyA7NxuxG2JvA.text: "Went here with my family of 4. Needless to say we left more than satisfied with a lot of leftovers! The typical Korean self cooking style made it a very fun experience. Our waiter assisted us on every dish. 10/10 will go back when in Vegas." - Ansel Ponce Diama

fyaNpFHrrFUMSdCLSsoB_Q.text: I absolutely love coming here. The food is amazing and they have really good banchan in my opinion. However, the wait is always extremely long. The one time we were able to get in without waiting was when we went about an hour prior to them closing.

2I7FoJoIGqmDs0yWK4vzaA.text: Good service and good Bbq choice and the only thing not liking it that tip for 5 person  are 18% automatically added to your bill.

6wNOUqQr9Z4JzFEyJcuKsQ.text: Service was outstanding !! And to top it off the food was excellent. Five stars. Loved the music and vibe in this place. Grill your own food or enjoy a spicy ramen like I did , one I will not forget.

dL1SQm3Ao9c6-YICdzwuyQ.text: So, I genuinely enjoy korean bbq. I don't go often, but when I do, 9/10 I enjoy it. So now, this restaurant had good food. The meat was good, the pricing wasn't too bad for the quality, and they had a lot of options. Why I give this restaurant a 3 star is because of their service. Honestly, if their food was bad too, I would have given it a 1 star, but it wasn't so thank god. It wasn't all the servers, but this one korean server with glasses and kinda tall. God, he destroyed my groups experience. His demeanor was terrible, and he kept talking about extra charges, instead of just bringing us the extra bowl of rice like we asked. He even forgot about it after we ordered it. I really wanted to come back and like this place, but unless they fix that guys attitude, this place is going to lose a lot of customers

dHYeJIq7KMQDGFvVDiOh_A.text: came on Christmas Day for dinner with the fam. i knew it was going to be a bit of a wait because of their "no reservations" policy, so we were prepared for the hour-long wait time ahead of us. we hunkered down at the bar for some soju & appetizers (dumplings, chili-garlic chicken wings, both great) and patiently waited for our table to be ready. *highly* recommend the apple soju, it was like boozy apple juice, not too sweet and dangerously delicious.   when we finally sat down we were STARVING; luckily our free sides were already at the table waiting for us and the plates of food started flowing immediately. we ordered the Meat Lover's package for 4 people and it was so much deliciousness that we had to tap out before we could crush it all.   highlights for me were the bulgogi, the spicy BBQ pork, the macaroni salad, the spicy cucumber, and the chili-garlic dumplings. we also checked in on Yelp for the free macaron ice-cream sandwich. (i got the coffee flavor and it was RIDIC.)   service was great; very attentive but barely noticeable throughout the meal. (ie: whenever we wanted a refill of something it was brought very quickly, our empty plates were quietly whisked away, when we asked for a fresh grill-top it was brought over immediately, etc.) considering it was a *very* busy Christmas Day service i'd say the staff ran like a well-oiled machine.   our total bill for the Meat Lover's package for 4 (with extra sides of asparagus & zucchini), plus chicken wings/dumplings/edamame at the bar, plus 1 beer, 2 bottles of soju, and 2 glasses of wine all came to $175 which is a pretty sweet deal imo. ($43/person + tip for a fully loaded Xmas dinner + enough booze that some of us had to Uber home? lol yes plz.)   my family had never been to a KBBQ before so i was very excited to introduce them to a new experience and Gangnam definitely delivered! everyone left fat and happy. :)

3NjLuDZ5NyE_o2A78EKesw.text: With close to 3K reviews it's easy to get carried away with the crowd. It's a good Korean restaurant but would not fall as best for me. They've updated their service and I can say their staff are very friendly and service oriented. They have fast service and their meats are great. However, the taste is somewhat so-so and came across as the same on their variety of meats - sweet.  Maybe we should have ordered the cooked bulgogi instead of the set menu Gangnam BBQ that we have to grill ourselves. I would probably return just to try out their cooked dishes, but will definitely check out other KBBQ resto first whenever we visit LV.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love their salad. Adds a different perspective and taste to the meaty ingredients.
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh meats. Oysters were a suprise!

X9wOKcVqpGOFW-p47lKLDg.text: The lunch specials here are amazing for 12 bucks you can eat like a king. service was good and prices were Fair. try their desserts the mango one was good.

bhMw7_VLyqvO_Ywwk7YJAA.text: We were there during a non-peak hour of the day and the service was great. We were greeted as soon as we walked in and handed both the regular as well as the happy hour menus. We ordered from the HH menu. We both thought that the food and drinks were really good, but what made this stand out was the service. Our grills were changed twice and they also offered to change it the third time to which we declined as we were already done eating. The price is also very affordable especially if you order off of their HH menu.

13N0aITUoKkDmDCmnjISYA.text: great service, better food.  They didn't have the egg custard left so they made a bebimbap that was to die for for our side.    This is my third visit here and consistently good.   Coming here every time we are in Vegas.

lHKLVW3_aZS86fSqXhXzLA.text: Both food and service was excellent!  Went during happy hour discount on a few menu items. The regular price is already very reasonable.

rIqZ_HdH18B7-T_0GXCoQQ.text: This place is great! Great food. Service, awesome employees! Tasty meat and is a must go to! I highly recommend the beef toro. Great meat quality!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This place is great! Great food, great service! Awesome employees and are very friendly. A must go and try!

f5I_daFrPOBqiAIDCytGlg.text: Outstanding set up they have here. Food was brought out quickly and the staff tended to us often and politely. The stove popped a couple times and burned my girlfriend mildly, who reacted very poorly for supposedly having ninja blood in her. Such a shame. Anyways other than that food was outstanding as mentioned and the experience was outstanding and we really enjoyed ourselves. 4/5 for us.

lC6yD8Yo_Nj-ayyJ1GX0Vg.text: One of the best meals I've eaten in my entire 41 years of life! So worth the walk or drive!!! I will never come to Vegas without coming here again!

rg5Wto65U_5uNDnVU4c8yQ.text: We came on a Saturday night and the restaurant was not busy at all. It has a cute asian decor and very nice ambiance. Patrick the server came and acknowledged us and seat us right away. Since nobody was there at that time he let us chose our own table. He was very friendly and answered all our questions about the menu. He recommended the bulgogi bibimbap to my husband and it was so good! I had the beef kalbi and beef belly. Loved the kalbi but not the belly. After dinner we had dessert. I ordered the friend banana tempura with strawberry ice cream and Man oh Man! Their banana tempura is the best of its kind! Better than PF Changs banana spring rolls. It's worth every calories! I'll probably come back just to order this. :)

y-NkCTPBkPsah7w0W-2jvA.text: Sooo loved!! From the ambiance to the food..def be back. It had a fun atmosphere/feel to it. Music vids playing while ESPN highlights (for the bf) played! S2a_E1jQyXOghPFTyNqjlA.text: THIS PLACE IS NOT AYCE!! But besides that, the food was good. Unlike AYCE KBBQ where I usually leave really, really full, I left satisfied. But don't go here if you have a huge stomach.

l_hm7oryQV8H5avo624oYg.text: Variety of food options. Large table with space to cook and have other dishes. Will come back to bring visitors.

sjK9LAH9lUTZCFxGMHtZLA.text: food here is alright, meat is the same as other kbbq, service was a little slow at night and some food was not brought out

nOF0fedmvukmqCnePuWt8g.text: The food was good. The Kalbi meat was my favorite. I also like the bulgogi cut. The pork belly tasted like bacon. The karage chicken was delicious. The meat portions to grill were small. You did get free Korean side dishes though. We came during happy hour, so some meats were half off. The food came fast and the service was fairly good. Just be prepared to smell like barbecue after you leave. Airing out my coat now.

t7sydPl5di2ov4r7DdIoCg.text: Great food, comes out super fast. Service was good too. Would come here all the time if I lived in Vegas. So much better than all the buffets at the casinos.

C1bESmatI5J74XNSwOuKQQ.text: Wonderful food and service. There was more than enough food for our entire party of 3 with the Gangnam meal. We also ordered some extras and the bibimbap was a standout. The marinated meats were also exceptional and everything was really fresh. Go and enjoy!

B1P09g5AHUrcOFdTdh4FKw.text: The restaurant has a nice setting and is very pleasing. The servers made sure I had water and silverware but it wasn't busy at all.  The food is a tad expensive for the size portions. I paid 8 dollars for some small chunks of beef. I ordered a side of white rice and it was very little in a bowl and cold. I would give this place a 3.5

c9N19Y7pf8Cxsysg4y4JbA.text: Seems family owned. Not very attentive wait staff. Came here late for dinner. I wasn't impressed with how little meat they provided. Mainly rice... I found that to be cheap. My biblogi or whatever was too sweet and as I mentioned lacking on the steak/meat that I wanted. Just a bunch of sweet rice. Will not be returning.

jzUwqRD-SUfIJZ6QowS5cg.text: Combination portion is perfect for two, if not too much. Kobe beef is a must try; kalbi is very good too.  Filet mignon is so-so, so is the shrimp.  Kobe beef carpaccio and tuna poki are both very good.    Also ordered a separate steamed egg and the uni Kobe appetizer.  Uni is great.  Steamed egg is the worst I have ever had; way overcooked that I can't even tell it was egg.

vON0N-6gDw0fSfNhr-vuBg.text: Pretty good.  Two of us and we ordered 4 of their prime beef - tongue, filet mignon, prime kalbi, and toro - all good, except the mignon - it could be a better quality but it is priced appropriately.  A little skimpy on the mushroom medley but it also could have shrink during the cooking process.  The biggest con: we waited for 1.5 HR but it was during CES so it may not be typical.

ccj3cROh-2In2KxYkQrO_g.text: Very tasty Korean BBQ with large portions and reasonable prices. The place was also nicely decorated and the service was friendly and professional so we will go back for sure the next time we are in Vegas. We went for lunch and the place was pretty busy.

owYQuNuazcKW5BMhhxkHnw.text: Great service and good size portions.  I wish they would make the bulgogi with shaved beef as it is a much better texture.

sgKM2HPJ1_NSfIRIoFfmGQ.text: New to this style of Asian food, nevertheless the wait staff were extremely patient with all of our questions. They also made suggestions that enabled us to try more dishes for less money, which was TREMENDOUSLY appreciated!  The food was fresh and delicious. A few items were too spicy for me, but they were still flavorful. Service was excellent! Prices quite reasonable.

VNhGMmPcdZdZKX8Zg6vosg.text: Amazing   Beautiful place with mind blowing Korean BBQ  Friendly fast service   Phenomenal good including side dishes  I had read all the Yelp reviews and had to check it out. It was everything I had hoped for and much more.  I have been to many a Korean BBQ in Los Angeles and this one was the best one hands down I have ever been.  Service was very attentive. They tried in a very friendly way to get the Bolgogi a little too quickly  -- I hadn't scraped out the crunchy delicious bits from the bottom of the bowl :)  The waiter and I had a good laugh over this and I quickly scraped the bottom and let him have the bowl.

ueYdirdyM5_KfSGdTwN8BQ.text: This place is bomb af, don't miss out. It's a little off the strip but totally worth it. Great experience!!!

djJiv0H1M7I89YXcCOlAvA.text: We went to Gangnam on a Friday night  and the wait was too long (over an hour ). We went back on Saturday around 4:30 pm and had a 20 minute wait which was perfect considering when we were leaving the place was packed with people waiting again .    The reason this place is popular is because they serve small dish Korean BBQ so you can try a few more dishes which is especially great for 2 people eating at Korean BBQ . Service was really good and attentive although we didn't get our Korean sides until halfway through the dinner . The meats were good especially the duck breast . The cheesy corn was delicious and the enochi mushrooms were great . Overall one of my favorite KOBBQS in town and will be back !!

Here's what I got: Miso 10-10  Salad w house dressing 10-10 Sweet corn with cheese 7-10  Chili wontons 10-10 Edamame 10-10 Asparagus 10-10 Bulgogi (10-10 Prime Kalbi 72-10 (favorite)  I will definitely be back here next time I'm in Vegas

2SHdk-umCNnvsXRVHh8pRQ.text: Nothing special the food is good just your standard kBbq. I'm from LA so I'm spoiled by amazing kBbq. 4 stars for price and quality.   Kinda pricy for 3 people when It's limited food

P77l_HHyMPLsdzDgCSbOoA.text: Awesome food, the food packages have the right amount of food.  Meats are good quality and every side dish is tasty.  Spend your money here and not at a buffet.

FvMv4tn9Hsdzj4VovI4aIg.text: Go premium! So much good food and well worth money. Service is great as well. Bibambap could have been fried longer so that rice was crispy, but flavor was still there.

_vS6Te8CXGGiPqtQ1Nb87A.text: Overpriced but not had at all. Couldn't definitely improve selection and ventilation as well.

KGdXHbpSi_2QNimSMShZMw.text: The best Korean restaurant I've ever had in the whole state! Love food, service, and atmosphere.  Just perfect for my taste :D

dtfRpSVMGc0qHZdLcKHqOQ.text: We had never been to a restaurant like Gangnam before coming. But after probably one of the best meals I've ever eaten I am for sure coming back.

5G1rVSYsK-Hoo1bDlVGV3w.text: In Vegas on vacation and wanted a local favorite off strip.  After checking trusty ol Yelp, I found this place with 2800 reviews and an avg 4.5 stars...pretty easy decision to come here.  EDIT:** I now know why this place has 2800 reviews, if you tell them you are reviewing them on Yelp they will offer you free dessert. **  Right away, you notice this small restaurant has limited tables due to the nature of the way you prepare the food.  What an awesome time.  Come here with a group, sit around a table and order one of the packages.  They come with a feast!! Appetizers, kimchis, salads, rice and tons of meat.  Everything we tried was great...the bulgogi and the pork were my absolute favorite meats.  I also loved the seaweed salad and the different Kimchi.  The music, was an interesting choice to say the least...not sure it fits the atmosphere.  We came on a Sunday night and it was gangster rap...it made us literally laugh out loud because of how out of place it was in a place like this.  The price was also not bad at all.  It ended up after tax and tip being about $40 a person for the 3rd package option..I don't remember the name.  You can get it down to as low as $20 per person on the package if you wanted to leave a few things out.  I would absolutely come back here again.  We all had a great time!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura Banana with green tea ice cream
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The feast!! I had to stand up to take this picture to fit it all in!!

0nk7LEyxFxKzBXmSQokf6w.text: After a packed day of wandering the Strip on a wedding trip to Vegas, we had worked up quite an appetite.  We had originally planned on going to Lotus of Siam, however upon arrival discovered that the wait was over an hour and they didn't have a liquor license - the combination of which, I am fairly certain, is a violation of the Geneva Convention.  We called an audible, wanted something close by, and stumbled upon Gangnam - which turned out to be a serendipitous find.   The wait time for a table was quoted at ~35 minutes, so we bellied up to the bar for some pre-meal drinks and appetizers - the chili dumplings, shishito peppers, and (one of my personal favorite appetizers) the dynamite shrimp.  The three dishes were perfect amount to share among the three of us, and we all enjoyed each one - the dynamite shrimp was especially a hit as neither of my friends had ever had it before.  We were seated almost immediately after on round of appetizers were polished off. I didn't check the time, but it had to be pretty close to the quoted wait time - an impressive feat, given that Korean BBQ is more prone to people lingering at tables given its interactive and social nature.  The menu features options for pre-built combos (containing a mix of starters, meats, and sides), however we opted for ordering a la carte so that we could each try specific items (and we had already had a round of appetizers).  I ordered the spicy pork and the Korean Prime Kalbi, as well as a bowl of sukiyaki noodles (beef).  The Kalbi was flavorful, tender, and easy to cook.  The spicy pork had excellent flavor and a nice kick, but I'm a bit paranoid about cooking pork so I probably over-did it a bit.  The sukiyaki noodle bowl was a perfect way to fill out the meal - much needed after a long day of walking around the strip.  The atmosphere was upbeat and we had a great time. All three of us left stuffed to the gills and all-in (with 3 appetizers, 2 beers each, our various BBQ selections, and my noodles) our bill came to just over $100 - a pretty fantastic deal for a great social meal.    I highly recommend Gangnam to cap your long Vegas day.

3Pe_sp8umxh2Dak3qy-iWw.text: They had great service. I went to several korean bbq but this place had the best service. Highly recommended

649fslHh7FJGsDWy_kNiyw.text: Near the strip and pretty much one of the best korean bbq places I have EVER been to. Service was excellent too. Will come back!!

Gq3Bk9NmsprO9noOyQHWJg.text: Great lunch option off the strip. Tender meat and free green onion salad. Had the yukke Jan soup too! So full!

WlIe3pnJQmmDMbc5E-UkKQ.text: People don't understand when I tell them I fly to Vegas just for this Korean BBq! Thank you for always being on point!

vRN92hN0ZB2VPmgX1X7uNw.text: The food here was pretty good. They give you  just enough for the money you spend and just enough to get you full. The only thing that wasn't good was the server we had. He took our order, delivered it, and disappeared. I believe it was the bus boy or another server that helped us towards the end.

WGqBBSxanaaufBAm8tPZgQ.text: Off the strip but if you have an inkling for BBQ and some Japanese appetizers, this is a solid place! The meat was great, side dishes plenty and the appetizers (One with meat, Uni, shiso on seaweed) were great! Good job!

jy0BGkmOnldJbFKwp9TZ3g.text: Went here for my anniversary. The environment was great. I like the concept of this place. Customer service here was on point. No need to ask for refills, servers just come and do it for you. There is a wide variety of meat to order. I would 100% recommend this place.

Cygeaje22ttbrRdRg98-1Q.text: Good lunch special! Choice of 1 or 2 kinds of meat with rice and choices of soup or salad....plus the normal mini side dishes that come w Korean bbq like kimchi etc.

gTB4KSFGWTKtmFWa7sTbTQ.text: Amazing food! There are tons of option, including sushi and ramen bowls. We opted for the 4 people bbq package, and were able to make it one for 5. It came with 5 different kinds of beef, 8 oysters, corn, rice, miso soup, two giant bowls of salad, mushroom medley and unlimited sides. There was so much food we left feeling stuffed. The macaron ice cream sandwich was out of this world. Its a little off strip but definitely worth the visit.

WjRuIRAn64uho3GwhoKI-w.text: Food was good, but the service ruined the entire experience. While there, my group decided to switch tables to fit more people. There were two servers who showed attitude (rolling eyes, muttering). Rudely said to wait for a few minutes to set up the new table. Hopefully other people won't need to go through this treatment as well. Disappointed.  Edit- One of the servers names was Marvin.

h8xSzXKmFOGPfd9Devm13g.text: Delicious! So much food, but can get smoky - it is a Korean BBQ place in Vegas, after all. Don't forget to check in to get the free the free macaroon ice cream.

fz-URrJnoPkfuYdK1UE8Fw.text: Worth the 45 min wait! Their Kobe beef was amazing. The service was fast and amazing. Between the four of us we got 7 tapas which cost less than the combo and we got to choose all the meat we wanted. We were so full from the tapas but if you check in you get free dessert. The meat was so tender, juicy and flavorful.

It was a great deal and included a variety of meat and sides. The miso was the best as well. I'm not a big fan of miso soup but theirs was amazing. GgaNIvHdXe3oGq69eXUKZg.text: This is the go-to KBBQ place when you're in Vegas. We came in the afternoon around 2pm and didn't have to wait at all, there wasn't a lunch rush or anything on a Saturday! And we had a group of 9. The sides were all really good. I liked how the kimchi was fermented and the bean sprouts, fish cake, potato salad were all nicely seasoned and tasted good! The meats came out fairly quick, and were great. I do think they should've changed the grill throughout cause both of our grills were pretty charred halfway through eating. We asked for some rice and sauces, here and there but didn't get some stuff. I think the servers might've been too busy or forgot. They also have a check-in deal on yelp for a free ice cream macaroon.

The whole time we were there we were never checked up on, no grill change, nobody asked if we were doing okay, the head Ryan just dropped the check, no thank you. Service was beyond non existent. Pretty sad since the food was good. The happy hour is amazing of course 50% off drinks and almost $1 off certain food items. Will I be back? No. Considering me and my fiance gets off at 10 we considered this to be a good happy hour place but I guess not. Don't come in after 10 or else you'll be rushed to eat and finish

L13A_JqnK9u5PwxWAZtyyQ.text: Great place for Korean barbecue! A must place to go and visit. You can choose your options for different types of meats for grilling and it accommodates large parties! They are very attentive, fast, and friendly! Anthony was our server and was really friendly and helpful!  Don't forget to check in for your free macaron!

9My6CJLZZQ7wX5N8fxagQg.text: This place is a 5 stars from services, foods and atmosphere. We arrived and got seated right away with warm welcome and smiles. Services was fast and professional. Meats was really good for the price for the quality. Will definitely come back when visiting Vegas again.

Cw4zsSO-DhxwGqqc6Bmz5Q.text: Cozy restaurant for BBQ.  Staff were friendly and for the price and location (proximity to the strip), the quality was good value for money.  They also have a dessert promotion where you get a macaron ice cream sandwich for checking into Yelp!  Would recommend this place to anyone looking to escape dining in the Strip scene while in Vegas.

r4fmvHv2l6cCGZyDI85Xxw.text: Good Korean BBQ with nice setting. I came in with 3 other friends and paid $100 total. Not too bad but could be cheaper. Ventilation inside the restaurant is bad so if you are planing to head out after dinner, beware of the smell on your body.

Sk5ZgTAhciPnZa6VLWtJiw.text: I feel bad writing an okay review but to be honest the whole experience was just okay. The waitress who took our order was not the slightest bit friendly. The food was alright. I did enjoy the cream cheese wanton and their thai tea but everything else was ordinary. It was nice of them to give us a complimentary dessert for checking in on Yelp.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_btQx54z-IKggxk9TnXZdQ.text: I am so happy I found this place on yelp! I came here for happy hour on a Sunday evening around 1130pm and the restaurant was pretty full. We didn't have to wait at all though! I can imagine this place having ridiculously long waits during peak hours.   We just ordered off the happy hour menu which is such a great deal. My favorites were the beef toro, pork belly, and chicken karage. I didn't really like the cheesy wontons. You also get a free macaron if you purchase at least $15 and check in on yelp!  This is located in a shopping plaza with plenty of free parking :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef toro - highly recommend this!

We have gone about three times and we haven't been disappointed at all. Brought friends and household family and everyone left full and happy. Keep up the good happy hour!!!

hNo2LMlQLh-XmyGBVb4XpA.text: Meat quality is good, marinades are on par.  Can't complain.  Great service!  Will come back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Harami Miso, Korean Prime Kalbi, Prime Kalbi, Beef Toro

_jyebFFSu7SdY4pTO_n-0g.text: Left a bit underwhelmed based on hyped expectations from reviews.   Overall the food was good, but didn't wow me. Perhaps Korean BBQ just isn't my thing, or perhaps I need to try more of it.  Our party ordered items a la carte which came out less expensive than the preselected combo platters and allowed for ordering exactly what we wanted.  We tried three beef and two chicken meat dishes, a few vegetables and some chicken fried rice. Everything was fairly tasty. I didn't love most of the side dishes that came complimentary, but was still grateful to be able to sample a bunch of different Korean tastes.   One of my favorite things was the ice cream macaroon at the end of the meal.   The servers were nice but it would have helped to have been given some direction as to what we should do and what sauces and sides would be well paired together since it was the first experience doing Korean BBQ for our entire party.

L0NRVPLK7kvdhYqjK-vmjQ.text: Every time I'm in Vegas I eat here.  Hands down best Korean BBQ there is.  Happy hour options are perfect.  Service never disappoints even when busy.

NAYd3m5fPzrAPpxtEzOeeA.text: Solid! My husband and I wandered by while exploring Chinatown and went in on a recommendation from our uber driver. This wasn't the best Korean BBQ I've ever had, but the service was fast and polite and the meat was tender. What more can you ask for?

MEk5xqsHZK4iKQRQJmv3ow.text: We came from LA and been to many KBBQ places there. Surprisingly, this restaurant has a new approach in preparing its dishes and meats.  The portions are good enough for one couple and we had to take some to go in the end. Not many waitress inside but the service was great! They now removed the traditional wire griller, but the new Korean type griller is also useful to get rid the greasiness of meat. Also, their bimbimbam (stone rice) is a bomb, recommend everyone to come and enjoy :)

_BpIof_1DbNEOzMrMVD24w.text: One of the best new places I've been to highly recommend... A lot of choices. All marinated stuff is on point !!!!will definitely come Back next time in Vegas

zUzUew2ApWIbyMol5ID_EQ.text: We went during happy hour. Got some cheese wontons, calamari, spicy pork, bulgogi. It was delicious and quick service. This place will definitely be on our list of restaurants to visit when we are vacationing here.

_DwcJXzp0mJC0RPzoNzlMw.text: Stay away... The people are so rude!!! We just got up and left as all the tables that came in after us were being served.  The gentleman finally took notice that we were standing at the register to find out why we weren't being served.  His excuse was that they just forgot about us!!!  What 2 people sitting in the middle of the dining room with tables all around us being served and us just sitting there!!  Get your act together!!  I would not recommend this place to my enemy!!  Kind of odd that we were the only Caucasians in there and every other table in there there were Asian,  they certainly were being catered to!!!  Very disappointing!!

W73S-_UvFlfhhijii6yuTQ.text: This was an awesome find for something other than the Vegas strip! I love Korean BBQ and this won't disappoint you.  Try the marinated meats they are tasty.

ibicXZNFTNR70UDBAqTrcg.text: This place is the definition of the word chill. It's a nice little locale. Friendly staff and the food is cooked to your liking because well you cooked it! The hostess from the servers are running all over the place trying to mKe sure everyones doing great very attentive i was very impress with the hostess never in my life seen someone go over and above to do more than stand there!! rcPQ5Ar6aCEA1AKzs90zRg.text: Probably 4.5 stars food-wise, but we fell into this place because it was late-night, and the happy hour prices were hard to beat.  My girlfriend had never had Korean BBQ so we got the basic proteins.  The help wanted us out of there, but snobby service is expected.

dbLPxrLQUl8rFE6zMHKl3A.text: During my stay at the Rio on this trip I had the pleasure of eating dinner at Guy Fieis El Burro Borracho this dinner was a real pleasure I was waited on by Betty and Rose excellent service manager is Sal great guy his expertise has rubbed off on his employees cuz they are excellent the food was fabulous I had their hard shell tacos that have picadillo inside cheese and lettuce but it was so tasty and so enjoyable the beans and rice were also very well done not over served just the right amount that's why I gave this restaurant a five star I will go back try something different and I'm sure it'll be excellent I will more than likely go back the first chance I get my stay here at the Rio was my first stay I've played there before but I really enjoy the venue if you're ever at the Rio be sure and try this fabulous restaurant out I'm sure you'll not be sorry and you will enjoy it I've been to a lot of different restaurants critiquing The Fabulous foods that they have that's why I come to Vegas in any case it's a must-do !

V5draz8OFKrvkRYxR77VWw.text: It's hard being from LA and trying a Korean bbq outside of Korea town so Gangnam starts at a disadvantage.  First the good:   Fantastic seaweed salad and a very presentable mixed greens salad.  The spicy chicken wings are fantastic.  The sauces are a nice touch. Also the make waiter is great (female not too friendly).  The place seems clean and inviting.  I like the squid banchan but not as good as my daughter's  We got the 4 person meat lover.  It was the size we are used to for two people.  The brisket was tough and the shoulder was good.  The filet was flavorful but a little tough.  The banchan was generous. The pork belly is the thin type which is fine with me because I like it crispy. Asahi dark is a good compliment.  Dweji bul gogi is nice and tender and just the right spice.  Overall a very nice experience

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice salad

79Ka5hzWcTCAM0OtDmpvpA.text: This place is so yummy had a great stay was fun ate a lot of BBQ not to expensive and was a great atmosphere for everyone

92imVohk8OKcgziFy1Etyg.text: Everything was delicious! I have Korean BBQ a lot in China, and I have been told it's very authentic. This place is much better, great flavors and excellent quality. All the meats and seafood were very fresh

T_s3-xPqgm-0cMIaRpFJVg.text: The food here is great quality and you get a ton of food for your money.  I recommend the set meals with a group of four or more since it comes with appetizers and entrees.  We shared a meal for two and it fed four people!  Great place for group dining and happy hour!  Staples include the pork belly, brisket and kalbi to name a few must haves.  I like mixing it up when I go to gangnam especially during their happy hour after 10 pm.  Make sure to try the broccoli fondue, sweet corn and mushroom medley.  Only issue is the ventilation as I always leave gangnam with a smokey odor on my clothes.  Desserts are quite delicious so make sure to save some room for the decent variety.  Easy location to reach if you're near the strip as it's located across from the hard rock hotel.  Plenty of parking in the shopping center which has many places to check out.

NPz7PuLQoMdnEPclrHyjpg.text: The happy hour is always on point at this place.. Definitely my go-to kbbq spot in town..

c3FI0vKtG3Cyv6gay_bt-g.text: The food is delicious. The restaurant is beautifully decorated. Thanks for a great, authentic meal.

rBf2XOjkBR6u93_LtQQ43w.text: I was very puzzled at how this place can get a 4.5 stars until I saw on the ad on the dining table that you get free desserts if you review on Yelp. That explained the rating well for me.  I would have given it a 2 star if it was located in LA. But I believe different city should have different standards especially with Asian food.   The food itself wasn't that bad , it was random. The brisket definitely was the worst I ever had in any k bbq place. It was thick and watery.  Steam egg = 1/10.  Fried yakisoba = 2/10 - the noodle was edible , but the beef was not.  However to be fair, the other meat plates were good, especially the prime rib - one of the best I ever had in kbbq.   Now the service. There was no service. Never refilled our soda, never attempted to change our grill plate despite it being totally unusable, and I saw they saw how dirty it was, but they just passed by! If it was back in LA, the plate would have at least been changed 3-4 times.    So all in all, will never go back , and won't recommend to anyone who truly enjoys kbbq.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yeah that&#39;s how dirty the grill top looks , but no one ever tried to replace it. Talking about service

2Sjac3KBK-a_d7Jg-DItjg.text: Loved the place because of it's unique concept and great flavors! We have been to Korean food joints before but this place was way different. Looking for a light lunch, we turned up at this place. It was happy hours and most of their menu was at half price! We ordered some soju to start off which was great - do try sometime! Got the Spicy Chicken Karaage which they give you seasoned and you cook on the grill at the table. It was very good and we ended up ordering it again.  Also do try their dumpling soup which is fantastic! We ordered a lot of those too. It's a real steal during the happy hours as the items are really cheap and it's great if you can go with a group - that way you can try a lot. Also, this place gives you a free smores if you review them there. Sure it's cheating to get those reviews coming but why would you not review just a great place. I would have reviewed anyway! Good place - do check out.

7amwDijwOAVMVh02HwPHdQ.text: Short version: the best korean BBQ in Las Vegas, though not quite as good as Kang Ho Dong in LA (but then again, what is?).  Took my parents here for their anniversary, and again came back a few days ago with my friend. It is very well situated on Paradise and Harmon, in a plaza with lots of parking and easy access. The establishment is clean and well lit, unlike some of the all-you-can-eat korean BBQ's around here. Staff were kind and helpful, and often go out of their way to help you even when times are busy. The grills are also clean, and appear well maintained. The only thing that I wished they did more was that the staff cooked the meats for you, like Kang Ho Dong, so that the meats are perfectly cooked if you're not very experienced in cooking yourself. That being said, our server was kind enough to go out of his way to cook for us several times.  We ordered the premium prix fixe for 4 ($160), which comes with the following:  Starter Kobe Beef Carpaccio - was absolutely delicious. I'm not usually a fan of carpaccio, but they marinated the meat very well. It was a bit oily I thought, but the flavor was just right. My parents are not crazy about raw meat, so I pretty much finished all of it by myself.  Tuna Poke - standard poke  Fresh Oyster - was surprisingly good. Fresh without hints of fishiness. I didn't get any bits of the shell at all, which is nice because a lot of other places have it. They put some tobiko and small amount of what I think is sriracha on it, which I think really enhances the flavor.  Green Salad - standard salad  Shrimp Bibimbap - standard bibimbap  Miso Soup - standard miso soup  BBQ dishes Kobe Style Beef - was very good, but I personally don't like my meat this fatty.  Korean Prime Kalbi - The second best after the harami miso. It was very well marinated and the meat was just the right amount of chewiness and texture. I heard the regular prime kalbi (non marinated) is even better, and will have to try it next time I come.  Harami Miso - absolutely fantastic, the best out of the meats I've had. The marinate was perfect, not too salty. The meat was amazing, a perfect combination of meat and fat. It will just melt in your mouth, then allow you to roll your eyes back and moan.  Filet Mignon - was a good filet, but I thought there were better meats. The cut was kind of large for my liking, which takes awhile to cook. It was very lean but still tender.  Scallop - typical scallop  Shrimp - typical shrimp. I was kind of surprised that they have shrimp here, but I'm guessing they're trying to do the "surf and turf" thing with their meats.  Asparagus/mushrooms - the enoki mushroom was actually very good. They come precooked inside a wrapped foil, but you can heat it up some more on top of the grill. It was a bit too much butter for my own taste.  Since the table is not setup with ssamjang (korean spicey dipping sauce), and gireumjang (sesame and salt dipping sauce) I recommend that you ask for it. The standard 3 flavors they set up for you is good, but I thought the ssamjang and gireumjang brought out the meat's flavor more.  We also got the macaron ice cream sandwiches at the end, and they were also very good. I liked the vanilla flavor most.  Overall, I was very pleased with my experience. I will never go back to the all-you-can-eat korean BBQ's here in town again after this. It is totally worth the money, and even then it's very fairly priced. Will definitely come back time after time!

-Hy-31_sMc73QQXtjIL5jA.text: Amazing food and good service. A wise choice for a fun dining experience . Also make a reservation they do get pretty busy on the weekend.

fLmbxT624u1wG7qiHlw6gw.text: Came here with a group of friends and ordered the Gangnam combo for 8 people. There was so much food that I was eating leftovers for the next 2 meals! The quality of the meat was really good though, and they even had oysters and carpaccio which I really enjoyed. Overall I felt like the price was worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Worth it!!!

x9-oFnLhWP44sOf3g_JAAw.text: This Korean restaurant is fancy!  The decor is super contemporary with spacious seatings. Even the waiting area is spacious.   I like the fact that the meat and veggies are tapas style. However, when we flipped over the menu, we quickly decided on the meat lover, $55.95 for two, and an order of pork toro.   Everything was delicious, but if I had to chose, the pork cheeks were our favorite. So juicy and tender melt in your mouth!   Service was wonderful as well.

UCehHrWzybD-zLqEGMoDRQ.text: Very yummy Korean BBQ restaurant even if you put this one in Korea! High recommended! Especially Miso, kimchi!

xiTaRoedciOmIJxeJvLgqw.text: Friends and I just finished having lunch here. We decided to get the Meat Lovers for 4 and it was the perfect amount of food for us all!! We've had Gyu Kaku before and this place is very similar but IMO the food is a lot tastier here!   I will definitely come back and bring friends and fam here when we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat Lovers!

dpiTTVQu_dG-d1j7AuZ-SA.text: Came in for a late dinner during the week. The restaurant is in a strip center and parking was easy to secure.  The interior of the place is decorated modern and has 2 flat screens to watch your fave sporting event. Each table has a grill to cook your food. My Hawaiian waitress was friendly and sweet but for a Korean joint I was disappointed the only banchan you receive is Kim chi. I ordered shrimp with head on and sliced prime rib beef. My order  didn't include miso soup and steamed rice so there was an up charge. I did enjoy the three dipping sauces for the entrees which were ponzu, sweet and a spicy sauce. The beef was tender but it was a only 4 ounces for $11.95 The shrimp was decent but was priced at $5.95 for 4 pcs and were on the small side and I've had fresher.  Overall I thought the decor and service was solid, but the food fell short on value and quality and don't think I would return.

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Bfi-hUisRVSxIpTfqUoe7w.text: My fiance really wanted to stop by this restaurant on our short trip to Vegas last week.  I was kind of skeptical at first because I'm more used to the Korean BBQ scene in the LA/OC area.  And I was wrong!  This place is legit!  We got the combo for 2 people at around $65, and it filled us up!  The meat was delicious and great beef, and the sides were cool.  We devoured everything in an hour! And the waiters here are cool too - they gave us a free macaron ice cream upon checking in.

o8PlTYkxNlh3HK-t1zt1kQ.text: It is very delicious! I was happy because I could feel the taste of Korea that I missed while traveling.

w0gjfuneTIddo9qtAakN8g.text: Came here to try their happy hour. Food is delicious. I ordered the beef toro and bulgogi. Prices here are affordable and restaurant is clean. I like their design on the inside of the restaurant. Music choice playing was also great. Food came out great. Great customer service and I got side dishes with my order. Definitely will bring my friends to this place. Plus free dessert if you write a review for Yelp for a limited time. :-)

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Got the beef toro and bulgogi

QDxlLNCehEQxhCNnAT5biw.text: First time in Las Vegas. Yelp recommended I try this restaurant because of the many reviews and positive feedback.   The server sat us down and automatically spoke to us in Korean assuming we were Korean. He was very short with his words and seemed very unhappy to be at work..   We ordered prime rib Kalbi and another Kalbi and pork belly. Holy crap.... Pork belly isn't worth .70cents a piece. Kalbi was okay. Meat was tough but marinade was good.  I am actually writing this review as we sit at this table and await our server to come by to ask if we need anything for once. Sat here for about 30 min without a single visit..... LOUSY SERVICE.   I defintely won't be coming back to this place. Total rip off. Every thing you order on the side is extra so be careful!

AMjUqE4sLiLkvSAlJLteuQ.text: Really kind price and service. You can't complain about anything. Good for family, friends, and even lovers. Thank you. So much like it.

D6uA8hVftW6qfNHjXlf5yg.text: A must in LA especially if you're looking for something grilled late at night!! The ambience is also nice and the staff are very welcoming. I suggest that you try the group menu since they have several choices for the meat!

u6Zi6UJL10Wit-PbzPGQVg.text: This place is great! We got the meat lover platter for 99$, which came with 5 types of meat that were all well-prepared. The staff was polite and accommodating, and they gave us lots of ban-chan. The location is nice, the inside is cozy, and you get free ice cream if you review.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea macaron ice cream

69DgangukCWGy3WHun6w_Q.text: Loved it!  Happy hour was fantastic and you can't beat prices!  Beer was also really good.  Best part was being able to cook the meat ourselves exactly how we wanted to.

EPEzhhVhl22aKYf7K2uReA.text: So good! We got the Meat Lovers meal, $54.99 for a ton of panchan and meat dishes.  Food quantity and quality was excellent, our meal came with pot stickers, salad, rice and yummy sides. I recommend the pre-fixe meals if you are new to Korean BBQ or have a big party. Our Meal fed two adults and two small kids, and sent us away full and happy! Clean restaurant, nice staff, excellent location across from the Hard Rock (we stayed at a nearby hotel).

udYJxNyKR5sDYri28gTYsA.text: We showed up at gangman and it was packed - an hour wait.  But they had 2 seats at the bar so we took those.  Food was great but the service was even better.  We found one of the four corn pieces was a bit burnt.  They replaced the dish and took it off the bill.  We will go back for sure.

KzpPROIStjyoIA94sYj7AQ.text: An annual pilgrimage and just as good as ever.  Server very helpful and happy for us to split the 2 person Gangnam Special amongst the three of us.  We will be back again next year, a pleasure as always.

JnJ8oXaevNmJW-QasNSloA.text: Great place if you are looking for BBQ korean food where you cook it yourself. I live near the strip and have been to Kimchi before, and this place is way better. Great service, excellent food and reasonably priced. Only problem is getting a parking space.

0WJKd_ZN1AQDELsQiefbVA.text: my girl had to work NYE and we wanted to have a nice meal close to the Strip, but not too close.  a quick search on Yelp and decided on Gangnam.  Great decision Yelpers!  you can order everything a la carte or order one of their combo specials for two.  We did the Paradise A combo ($56 for two ppl).  our server said it was the most popular choice.  there was easily enough food for 3 people!  everything was tasty!  Five starters and five dishes to BBQ. I especially liked the spicy dumplings from the starters, and all the meat was top quality.  Service was very helpful and attentive, without being annoying.  Great place for date night (slightly romantic, but more hip and cool).  we will definitely be back!!

aKe48805TAesMohBESuCwA.text: We love Korean food and found this great place to enjoy a good korean bbq.  It's a nice restaurant with a bbq in the middle of the table for cooking the meat or you can opt to have them cook it in the kitchen.  Our favorite meats were the Harami Miso, and Spicy pork.  The bibimbap is also delicious although smaller than other korean rest. I've been.  Bulgogi bibimbap was really flavorful too.  Nice atmosphere.

W6a2JVWh1d-11HuuA9_-6w.text: This place is freaking legit!  Coming from California, this place is easily one of the best I've had. The wait was a bit long but that's expected for any Korean spot that's this good. We had the Premium dinner set. I wanted to try their best cuts and you actually save some money by going with the preset meal rather then ordering them individually; trust me I did the calculations.  They also said that the portions were the same whether you order through the set meal for the individual dishes. I don't think any place has authentic Kobe beef in America but this place has the Kobe style beef which was really really good here. If you haven't tried that type of beef you should definitely try it once in your lifetime.  All four of the different meats that came with the meal were all really good so I would recommend you try the filet mignon first otherwise if you eat that last you will be disappointed. The tuna pokey was also really good and so was the beef carpaccio. The meal also came with different dipping sauces to go with the meat and all of them were very good. My wife also said that the salad was really good, I ate a little and I would agree. Even the asparagus came out really well, not overcooked. They put it in foil and cook it in butter and you can taste it. The side dishes are just OK. The bibimbap wasn't that great, the rice wasn't that crispy. All in all, one of the better Asian places in Las Vegas. Service was very good as should be expected in any Korean joint.

91B2UhkFSnTNQoh6TzYddA.text: Great food and service! We were able to do the Eat for 2 for 4 people and there was plenty of food.

wsIm1Y6jfFrqxBJvgdNPng.text: Staff is super nice. Great staff. I only ordered the brisket (beef tomo, I think). I'm all about the brisket when I go kbbq'ing. I didn't like it. Not to say the quality isn't good, I just like my kbbq brisket to be thin, like 1/2-1/3 of the cut here. Fatty too, the meat here, to me, is pretty lean. Definitely not the type I was expecting. It's more like a slice of steak. I don't know if it's any fault of the food here, but I eat pretty fast and I was in and out in 30 minutes from sitting to exiting. My hotel is half a mile away, I almost didn't make it... Before I even exited the plaza I needed to number two baaaaaaaaad.  I'm so glad I was being lazy and drove l rather than walked. I would of liked to try the Kobe meat as the pictures other posted looks great, but after this close call I think I'll play it safe.  Oh and the cream cheese wontons, I liked!!!

SJRaNyaCbR2lok263QTTOg.text: Great service, good quality food! I had never had Korean BBQ before and was super scared! Thankfully I had a veteran with me and he ordered. Everything was super fresh and delish, I loved the entire experience. The best part was the meat of course and it was super tender. I would recommend this place to anyone new or old to the Korean BBQ game.

Y7WsNxEk_8AQKijlrJXYUQ.text: First time at Korean BBQ and I loved it! Great food, great service. Highly recommended the spicy pork!

_mIZ3yRLvdf61mi9WuPSyg.text: looking for a good korean meal off the strip? Well, you can stop looking. Just come to gangnam, you wont regret it.

6pmNbg3bziKF-Zfa2QM4Dw.text: My son suggested this place and so we went.   If you have never tried Korean BBQ, you are missing out and this place was fantastic.   They were very helpful to show us how things work and made some excellent menu suggestions.   We had the Las Vegas and split it between two,  could have fed four.    Wow!!!!  All of it was great!!!

1Teu2TgRpZYL-tzkPg57Tg.text: I came here Sunday night and the servers were awesome. Same for the food.  Due to having such an awesome time we came back for lunch on Wednesday.  That was a big mistake. Horrible service! One waitress actually smiles and the other one acted like we Are there to eat without paying. We had to ask for refill / new drinks. The server wasn't attentive at all. Throughout the stay, she came by maybe 4 times and that's just to drop off food. We constantly have to ask for her to bring us stuff (drinks, napkins, bill, and change).   I work at a restaurant so I know how gratuity work.  Restaurants usually charge gratuity for table of 6 or more. And I'm pretty sure my group isn't a table of 6.  I usually don't care if you add gratuity to my check because that save me the time of calculating. But with this service, our waitress clearly did not deserves $25 tip considering how horrible of a service it was.  We could have complaint but we're not about to missed our flight. Thanks for the food gangnam and we will tell our friends to never come here due to your rude server.

Lz82PQO0Cua3Oxmxf60s5w.text: Harami miso and prime Kalbi were delicious...great quality meat and marinated to perfection. Will definitely come back again.

s576DP9e9RGZbteuasYAdA.text: The place is well decorated and crowded even at late hours. Beef tongue is my favorite, Korean beef kalbi is also great.   However, the plate is small, around 4 pieces per plate. So for more than 3 people, you might consider ordering 10+ plates.

PHAcnFJzDY4lAPCKdtHKXw.text: Was highly impressed with this place. Super clean and nice, plus the food is amazing! Just wish the booth seats weren't so far from the tables, but besides that I loved it. Would definitely come again.

hZh_tg2H4gdmbMV10wPzbA.text: Very good. Had the Las Vegas and meat lovers between 4  people. Plenty of food. Wait staff was great.

FYbFkmATJvM70GkUslrrDg.text: Good Korean fusion food.  There was a wide variety of dishes offered.  We ordered the premium combination.

48Ss5zi3YTK01SPm0qka_A.text: If you like grilling your food at your table in a modern atmosphere with nice staff to take your order and bring you drinks (and help you use the grill), this is a decent place to eat right across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel behind CVS. Priced kind of like tapas, it's not extemely cheap but we thought it was yummy and worth it!  Thanks for a great meal!  :-)

gmEYndT7gEe-_RWjaiBUaA.text: Great food and great service, would be a 5 star if there were refills for drinks and/or side dishes.

yBkiPJdZRoM6keoeiNv6wQ.text: Great food for good price ! Spicy pork was good and they didn't joke about the spice.

THvh93E5SUWdkftEfzAgiQ.text: This is my second visit with family and friends excellent food and great customer service.

We chose Las Vegas and ordered more meats on the side. Very clean establishment but only downside is that we didn't get water until halfway through our meal. Go before 6 pm because it got busy as we were leaving at 7 pm.

aNalFUJINOSHiyu9LbOHQA.text: Expensive/ poor service  Servers ruin the expensive high quality meat by over cooking them.

nyyz17VOoDdeJ8iMYZXtig.text: Maybe we are spoiled by LA K-town selection - but we thought this place was really only ok.  Decent meat quality, but nothing to get excited about.  Too long of a wait for the food to be honest, but perhaps relatively speaking, very good KBBQ place for Vegas?  I suppose if you crave some KBBQ might be worth while, but with the price and no AYCE hmm... yeah, wasn't too memorable or fun.  We completely smelled of meat though, so don't wear anything fancy.

ZqVcs_L3dL_btHmR7CJKFw.text: I've been here wayyyy too many times to count.  Every time I stop by LV, it's the first stop right after getting off our plane.  On this trip, we came here 3 times out of the 4 days we were here.  It's insane how much we like this place!  For one, the food is delicioso!  The meat seems high quality.  I'd recommend sticking to the bulgogi and steaks.  I found their chicken, shrimp and anything meat wise to be ok. I like getting extra lettuce to wrap meat in, mushroom medley and broccoli fondue if you want a different kick in eating broccoli.  The other things that were ok was the macaroon (too old in that freezer so it was a bit stiff and way too sugary) and sauteed shishito peppers (we can make it better).  Overall, definitely a place we keep coming back to.  Service is a mix between ehh and decent depending on how tired or disgruntled the waitor/-ress is that day.  The price makes up for it and a really great deal for what you get!

YCqnrWCg2Hvokm505Nq2Nw.text: This restaurant sure is a fun one! The idea of cooking your own food at your table is super cool.  Your meal is served with 7 complimentary side dishes. The price of the entrees is very reasonable for the amount of food that is given.  Fun atmosphere.  There's a screen with music videos played on it, which is cool!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g7asP9x9xu7w-OMbjZQCHw.text: WOW!! Great service, great meat, great sauces... MUST EAT!! With our family of four, we ordered the Gangnam style for two and switched some appetizers and added some meat for our self- proclaimed pescaporkian (she only eats fish and pork). The Gangnam for two gave us enough portions for our nine and twelve year old to share with us. Their house-made dipping sauces were divine!! The quality of the meat was CAB or better! The service was excellent and the atmosphere was great! Our table was large enough for all of the small plates and bowls we would be acquiring throughout our meal. They did a great job checking in, clearing off empty dishes and keeping our drinks filled!!   A (9 yo): Filet Mignon was really good!  J (12 yo): Delicious salmon!  B: Yummy salad and filet mignon. All the beef was great!!  N: Sauces were the winner!!   We will be back next time we are in Vegas again!!

88zC06nhms9nQSlcAfT9QQ.text: Exalent Back our waiter was amazing will be back soon from Texas loved everything about it! Everyone was so helpful and always making sure everything was good !!! Great service

EA11cgcKWbM8vDiBwIwNbQ.text: The food is amazing at this place, coupled with courteous and fast service. The portions are large and you can have as much side dishes refill as you would like. If you check in on yelp, you even get a free ice cream dessert.

l-TlAlRkBDCGpIr6k7IJMA.text: My sister, cousin and I swung into Gangnam on a Friday around 7pm, famished and ready for meat in our mouths. After being promptly seated and minor hemming and hawing over the menu, we decided to order the meat lover's combo for 2, a hot sake, and beer for sake bombs to start our weekend. Between 3 people, we opted for the combo for 2 because we figured we could always order more and didn't want to get too gluttonous by ordering the combo for 4.   First came the booze, then the side dishes, then all of the meat. The grill heats up very quickly, however it is only hot in the middle and burns the meat rather quickly. Also, don't bother with the onions and assorted sliced veggies; they will burn too. Those aside, my favorite was the spicy pork. Everything else was decent, but not standout. The side dishes are standard and decent too, but the waiters did not come to refill them until we flagged them down.  Their sound system is not very good. They alternated between old school hip hop/R&B and Kpop, which are both my jam but the low sound quality actually irked me a bit.   Given the many options for dining in Vegas, I likely wouldn't come back here unless I had a huge hankering for kbbq when in town.

uIiSpWi9n6aoEpfGP0zR7Q.text: All the reviews here said there was going to be quite a wait and they were right. The wait was about 1.5 hours when we got here at about 7. The man at the front was very helpful and polite when I kept asking him how much longer.   We had never been to a Korean bbq before so we had a little trouble with figuring out how to grill the meat. The chef came out to help us multiple times and told us when to flip the meat and how to arrange the meat on the grill. He also came and cut the meat for us when he realized we were struggling a little bit with eating it. All the staff were extremely friendly and the service is very speedy.  The waiter came and checked on us multiple times and refilled our water constantly   We started our meal with the edamame which is a great way to offset the oiliness of the meat. The meat was so juicy and tender. I wanted to splurge a bit and get the kobe which was pretty expensive but it was definitely worth it. We ordered almost every one of the bbq beef options and they were all delicious in their own way. My favorite was the pork belly and the Kobe.   The portions are reasonably sized for their price, and it's a little pricy but at the end of the meal I definitely felt that it was worth it. Don't forget to get that free macaron ice cream by checking in! It was a nice way to end the meal.

SJG8YlkfLFUdpXfa58eVWw.text: Great place, we really like the food. The service was helpful as well. Great spot to stop on Las Vegas

mG1W1hmpRJoze_iqo9a5TQ.text: I just cannot believe this place has 4.5 stars review.  Before starting off, I'd like to mention that I don't normally write a review on yelp but this time I had to. I used to work in restaurant industry for quite a long time and have tried out pretty much every Korean bbq place in Las Vegas. And so far, this one has the worst service ever.  There's a security convention going on at sands expo this week and today was the second day during the session. My two customers, who visited Vegas all the way from south Korea for this significant show, wanted to try Korean food for lunch and I came up with Gangnam. I've never tried at this place before however, I was recommended by my friends a couple of times. And its location is also close by the convention center so I though Gangnam would be a great choice for us. With high expectations we made our decision to go eat at Gangnam not knowing how terrible this place actually is.  When we walked in, it was around 1:30pm and there was about 4 tables filled which was not busy at all. As we got seated, a server who was Korean came up to our table and asked if we wanted to order. (By the way I was the one that ordered with the servers and asked for them because my customers were not familiar with American restaurant culture) I asked her about the menu selection and she explained how it works, how the meats and foods come out. We first placed three orders of pork belly(ala karte), three bowls of rice, two different kinds of stew, and a glass of bear. After we ordered, meats and side dishes came out quickly, but we were still waiting for the beer and stew for quite a long time. So I had to look for the server and remind her about the beer. According to her respond, she seemed to have forgotten to bring it and she couldn't even remember what kind of beer we ordered. I could kinda understand her because sometimes you forget things when you don't pay high attention to it. Okay but what annoyed me the most was since we got seated she NEVER checked up on our table NOT EVEN ONE TIME till the very last minute we finished our food and left the restaurant. Wow she could've asked us at least once if everything was okay or if we wanted to order something else. But she didn't AT ALL! There were two other male servers working at the hall too but every time I tried to ask for any of them they were like nowhere to find. Maybe they were all in the kitchen and doing some back up stuff?? But excuse me, can we just get some spoons please???  And I really want them to learn how to make an eye contact with customers so that people can let them know when they need some help. They didn't even try to make an eye contact with me or show up to our table except for when dropping off some foods that we ordered earlier. Even though they came to our table to serve food, they dropped whatever they have on their hands and just walked away!! My salad ran out after eating the half of the meal and of course none of them even noticed. I didn't want to ask them because I saw one of the guys look very annoyed when I asked him to change a grill. They just didn't care about what we need more than messing around at a register.  I ended up leaving the restaurant very upset with my customers. Now I assume that they didn't want to care about us because we don't look from here and they probably thought we wouldn't complain or feel offended anyways. And that's what makes me even angrier. Well you cannot decide if you're going to give a customer good service or not by their appearance.  I feel so sorry to my customers for suggesting this restaurant. I can't explain enough how embarrassed and mad I was during the whole meal.  Well thanks for giving us a terrible experience, Gangnam. I would NEVER go back or recommend this place!!!!!!

I'm always looking for spicy soft tofu soup and this by far is my favorite. The service is always quick and a friendly staff.  Save room for dessert they have a nice selection of ice cream macaroons!

Q1fTOTPMpNikSc8IB2U3Zw.text: We ordered #1 combo, the food was average. The small dishes were below average, not many can eat, fish cake was hard and cold. Only kimchi was fine. The waitress was inpatient, I asked what were the differences between Korean prime kalbi and prime kalbi? She answered "one is Korean prime kalbi, the other is prime kalbi" was I blind??? I couldn't read???  During our dinner, there was no one asking if we needed anything or if we were doing ok. No sauce refill, no water refill, no plate replacement (even after they saw the whole plate became burned/black).  In summary, average food+awful service = 1 star.

ST_5hjgzYrDaipPST-UqyA.text: I went in here for some BBQ, but rather for the yook gae jang (spicy beef soup) since I had a craving. I probably went wrong in walking in here for the purpose of eating this soup, since it's a meat specialty place.   The menu, decor, and set-up totally reminded me of GYU-KAKU. Even the little details like the color of the plates and their logo. I got to try some meats off of a set menu, and the meat quality was quite impressive. They have good meats, if you're willing to shell out the price for it.   As for the yook gae jang and soon tofu, it tasted like salt with no other flavor, and totally was ruined in my opinion. The side dishes however were good.   Service was slow, despite the restaurant only being half full. I had to ask for water and certain side dishes multiple times to get it.

nMpCqv9kBohPM12_6BzqnA.text: When looking for a very well deserved alternative to the wondrous world of ayce joints in Vegas, we opted to try this highly rated and mega reviewed spot.  And guess what? it was hella good.  Not that you really had to guess since my four star rating clearly indicates I liked it. Oh Dan B, your redundancies grow more and more with each passing day. Anyways.  First of all, what looks to be a fairly standard strip mall restaurant from the outside takes on a very unexpected turn once you step inside and behold a very sleek, modern, and spacious layout.  What really got my attention was the absence of the billowing smoke wafting around tables when people are grilling - it's something I both fondly and annoyingly associate with most Asian BBQ places.  The staff was super attentive from the get go and really helpful when it came to best deciphering which combination of set menus and a la cart items would yield the best sampling of what Gangnam had to offer.  And I have to tell you the selection, quality, and flavor of the meats we grilled were impressive: tender, well seasoned, and fresh.  The servings aren't necessarily huge, but it needn't be when it's that good and so reasonably priced that ordering extra isn't too exorbitant.  Overall, Gangnam has to be one of the best BBQ experiences I've had in awhile: great food and drink, stylish decor, and somewhere my little one would enjoy going. It's also helps reminds me how nice / necessary it is to take a break from buffets every once in awhile.

L-aOYk2QgTi0LAHwKq7zuQ.text: The cheese chicken was by far the best on the menu.  I think my favorite part of the meal was cooking it on the grill in front of you.  You start with a perfectly clean stainless steel grill in front of you. As you start cooking  the different meats the grill becomes coated with the diffrent juices and flavors.

S57T5zIIGMJ-DzbhdwDy5Q.text: Solid, not especially great but gets the job done.    Banchan was meh, bean sprouts in particular tasted like dishwater. But hey, you're at a table with your friends, being served by friendly kids, in front of open fire with a plate of kobe beef, scarfing it down with romaine, sesame oil and salt for $21.. add a large bottle of Chamisul Soju for a few more, so.. there's THAT!  Life is good..

KWP4Mlp_mzC71PrdmtSocg.text: This was my first experience with Korean bbq.  I cant imagine it getting much better.  I definitely recommend the toro.

7P7WzeTCbvZIl6y-GVX6pA.text: Very good selection beyond traditional Korean barbecue here. Very fresh food and very clean place. Good energy.    We had the premium meal for two. The food comes real fast and before you know it, you're done. But with plenty of leftovers. Wagyu was nicely fresh and marbled, but tough.  The salad was awesome and fresh.  Shrimp was so so, kimchis were also so so.  Very Americanized meal.  Seating in the booths was very uncomfortable. So if there is an other option, I suggest you choose a table. Booths have very hard wooden seats with semi soft backing that was also WAY too far away from the table. Awkward seating situation that made us squirm through the meal.  They promote that you get a free dessert if you rate them on Yelp, which I think, contributes to the ratings here. They don't require a high rating, but would you eat a dessert after you show them that you just gave them a bad review? Nope.

-MIj4rQs78D0XrWsZHU0Zw.text: Came during Happy Hour with my husband and daughter, so instead of getting the Meat Lovers, we ordered 3 orders each of Beef Toro & Pork belly. Food was really good here and if you order right, Happy Hour can save you money! Not for us bc we ordered too much. Haha...and catered for non-Koreans a bit more. Everything is a la carte or you can get combo deals for 2.  Beef Toro- slightly thicker than I am used to compared to L.A. places. Wasnt that great in tenderness or flavor so not sure what the good reviews are for.  Gave us more than expected and couldnt finish all 3 HH orders.  Pork belly- was decent and only finished 2 HH orders of it.  Dwenjang jigae (bean paste soup)- a bit sweet and less salty than Im used to but was good. Not a huge bowl but enough to share as a side to meats. Know that this takes longer to make so it doesnt come out right away! Rice - only 1 comes with soup order but they give a decent amount. Also got a bowl of brown rice.  Should've just shared the one bowl. Udon- good variety and amount of tempura. Would get tempura on the side if u like it crispy and not all soggy.  -Spicy tuna kimbap- was yummy! Started with this (not on HH menu). 4 little deep fried rolls of plain rice in toasted seaweed but yummy cubes of tuna in spicy mayo sauce all over. Yummy!! Everything is a la carte...side of green onions in sweet  vinegar  (pretty good), lettuce and bean paste sauce, rice...just ask bc it probably is extra, unless u ger a combo.  -side dishes were decent and refillable if i get ar leadt 2 orders of bbq meat per person?  -If we ordered less at first and waited to see how much came out, we wouldve saved a good amount during Happy Hour. Would have stuck with 2 HH orders of meat for each person and share one bowl of rice. GOOD SERVICE TOO! -Can also get free macarons for yelping but didnt do that.  :)

nWTAleswnR5hm_xZNS5gvw.text: I am satisfied. Coming from Chicago, we have a decent amount of Korean food/BBQ. I ordered the beef bibimbap and it was on par with what I've had before. My friend order the original bimbimbap, and it looks awesome as well. The order came with the standard appetizer dishes, which all tasted great. I would recommend this place to anyone with a craving for Korean food.

68zE5t_Kn2M4LzhYZ7fhOQ.text: Wow.  Wow!  Wow!!! My friend took me here - she's been a few times, and thought I'd enjoy it because of the type of diet I am on for a while. I think this restaurant is in my top 5 of all time. Basically, you select your meats and seafoods and they bring them to your table - portions are similar to what you'd get at a Tapas place.  You grill the foods at your table.  Some of the dishes are cooked in the kitchen, but pretty much the meats are all grilled by you, at your table. This food was absolutely some of the most delicious food I've ever eaten!  Anywhere! The quality was outstanding. I almost can't wait to get to Las Vegas a year from now, just to go back to this place. :-)

cZUiwqgZX7jtuBhSCmbjFg.text: By far the best kbbq in town! We went in for happy hour; ordered beef toro,pork belly abd bulgogi which were only $4 each. Also all the drinks are 50% off. Enjoyed all of their food we ordered. I have been going to Hwaro but will come to this place. This joint is legit!

HPWnyKA1uOA3GMfZHNQcig.text: Nice clean and good tasting food here.  We ordered the largest combo menu with lots of meat choices. The meat quality was good but a little lacking in quantity. Perhaps that is the trade off between good meat vs the bad stuff you get at AYCE joints.  Not sure.  The variety of banchans were sort of meh but you do get the nice oysters that come out in the combo selection. Other thing like clean cooking environment, good service and sanitary bathroom make it better than your average Korean BBQ place.  I'd go back here with family.  I'd rather go somewhere else with a bunch of guys since food quantity is somewhat on the skinny side.

T1LWgH7lth9CQ4MzwHHEMw.text: I stopped by this restaurant on the way to the airport. I was concerned that my clothes would later notify my entire plane that I ate KBBQ for dinner, but I was surprised to leave odorless! They take their ventilation fans here seriously, people. I even saw a guy standing on the chairs to wipe fans down after people left.  Anyways, we got Gangnam Style for four people at an affordable price ($120), which included tender meats and a plethora of side dishes. Service was impressively rapid; all the food was out within ten minutes after ordering. As for taste, maybe my expectations were too high, but I wasn't blown away by anything in particular. For me, this Americanized, trendy style of Korean BBQ is less satisfying than the AYCE style Korean BBQ places I can find in California. Their playlist was also a strange mix of kpop and American pop/rnb.  Bottom Line: I left with a full belly and a free macaron for checking in on Yelp, but I don't expect to be back anytime soon.

CL4KUXZvJwwYUk78ecPi_Q.text: This is not an AYCE Korean bbq joint but they do have options where you can order per entree or do a package option for parties of 2 or more. The meats tasted fresh. The sides were typical of any other other Korean barbecue place but I really enjoyed the macaroni salad the most!   The service was excellent and quick. Highly recommend!   Tip: check in for a free macaroon ice cream sandwich!
