MR2gQaQGm-Y81wSorSFUXA.text: What do you do when you have a flight at 11pm, and a whole day to venture around Las Vegas? You eat. Duh.   My father and I devoured every last bit of this Asian BBQ.  Our waitress was so kind when she was explaining what each dish was, what the sides were, and how they made/seasoned them.   She helped us cook each bowl of food, and each was SO GOOD.  I think the short ribs were our favorite!   There was no wait time, and for about $25/per person, we got an unlimited amount of food. Yum!

3JjjGfY83g7IwX6JzdHPdw.text: Good value for money, nice atmosphere and great food. A good place for a laid back evening for large and small groups off the Vegas strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MNnCm8ObinG2Tg49SX0CaQ.text: Fantastic Korean BBQ, huge portions, quality ingredients, preparation and service!  I look forward to returning every time we're in Vegas.  Thank you!

rBeypasaoDrCmYi2kgEFtA.text: My go to Korean spot when I Vegas.    The staff are super courteous and the food is good.

mTIVa5SDhHYtj2uHwQYlWQ.text: There was a big variety of different kinds of meat, each with its own unique taste. They prepared the meat well, and it was juicy and chewy. If you check in on yelp on your first visit, you get a free ice cream macaroon! We got a very nice nice privet room, even though we didn't have reservation. The tofu soup was delicious. It was spicy, hot and the tofu was soft. Overall, the meal had good variety, color, and tastes.

4auI17FWiSpUHaqi88qamA.text: The best kbbq I've ever had in my life!   For my entire life until now, I thought the Korean food in Toronto was already the best outside of Korea, but this restaurant surprisingly exceeds the Korean food in Toronto! The prices are very decent and the portions are huge!   We ordered the Las Vegas set for 2 and it was more than enough for 2 people! The bbq also came with some side dishes from kimchi to macaroni salad to deep fried cheese dumplings!   We tried the mango and strawberry macaron ice cream for dessert (free with Yelp check-in). I love macarons and ice cream, so this dessert satisfies both my cravings at once!  Not only is the food very good, but the service is also excellent! Never in my life did I have the server mix the bibimbap for us!   Usually, after eating kbbq in a restaurant, my entire outfit and myself smells like the food, but here, there is no smell at all! There is a ventilation right above the grill that captures all the smell.  I'm for sure coming back before I leave and for my many Vegas trips to come!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macaron ice cream (top - Strawberry, bottom - mango)
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert menu

2_c56QHEfEtdqmRArqk_Uw.text: The food was amazing and the service was spot on! We had the meat lovers platter for two and we loved all of it! We are stuffed but already looking forward to the next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Preparing food by the table

c35C7w9Ca69wmAOZeqXQ0A.text: Just ok, I had LA galbi & chicken bbq. the galbi was fatty & overly sweet. The chicken was ok but nothing special. The Bachman's were good & I could have made a meal on them. I however only paid just under $20.00 for my meal so at least I didn't have to pay a lot for an ok meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AkSci9ySGawWZQfxoBlYug.text: Great food, great prices! Brought our friends, who have never tried Korean BBQ...they LOVED IT!! Order the meal for 4, so much food that we each had leftovers for later.  Always a stop for us when in Vegas!

e2lePqVMAnaFy9krG35C_A.text: I always enjoy gangnam restaurant...when it comes to korean food this is my go to spot. Always crowded but worth the wait...they also have wide variety of food selection...make sure you check them out on happy hour its cheaper.

Nc-2kBhUgZ_GUwxyx56OGg.text: Personally, I don't typically do the whole ala carte because I'm a fat ass and I like to roll myself out of a restaurant when I am done eating. The thing about Gangnam is that the quality of the meat exceed all expectations when I took my first bite into the succulent meat. Let's be real. We all want our bang for our buck and that's what I got and then some. The biggest highlight for me was the bibimbop. The sauces are amazzzzzzzzzzzzzzing. Don't skip out on the beer and soju selection as well. Happy eats my fellow yelpers!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Bwce0BaDz43nO3dTgPYDIA.text: I lived in New York, LA, Seattle and by far this place got the most generous portions of any Korean restaurant I've been to. Food tastes awesome, too! Old fashioned banchan (side dishes) reminded me of mom's cooking.  This is the only Korean restaurant I am eating when I visit Las Vegas. Holy cow! Still amazed...

2G9-5YV8cjlDV1OtTRzDew.text: First time eating at this bbq spot and Great customer service and great food.. would definitely come back.......

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The start of a great dinner

SxO882Dbzm2ravl1f9L69Q.text: What really blew me away here was the fast service, Korean Kalbi barbecue, and dipping sauces! The wait was originally an hour but several groups cancelled cause of the wait and my group was kindly welcomed by the attentive host. The restaurant's interior is very clean and modern with Kpop music videos playing on a projector by the waiting area. Some food I don't recommend are the pork fried dumplings (tasted like they were defrosted and lacked flavor) and the bacon wrapped white vegetable/mushroom (inside was way too chewey and tough). Something that tasted odd to me, but another member of my group enjoyed was the bell peppers included with the Bulgogi. Overall, I would definitely recommended this restaurant and I noticed many of the customers were Korean too.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QEtz6R-bJp6gxNVCXRfr1w.text: A mix of both Japanese & Korean BBQ which was perfect since I like Japanese and the fiance likes Korean. We came here on a Thursday night and waited about 20-30 mins. WORTH.  SERVICE - Very friendly and accommodating staff. We were able to substitute items in the pre-set menu and even customize my cocktail to the way I like it :)  AMBIENCE - Casual and cozy (especially sitting at a booth), very relaxed, great for couples or families  FOOD - We ordered the [PREMIUM SET - $89.95] for 2 which was a lot of food and variety with both Japanese & Korean BBQ. Even the appetizers were all amazing. Definitely get what you pay for. It was the perfect indulgence while visiting Vegas :)   [KOBE SSAM] - Uni on top of a piece of kobe beef with fresh wasabi. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. SO GOOD.  [TUNA POKE] - A LOT of tuna pieces! Pretty good but the fish was not quite at room temperature.   [MACAROON ICE CREAM SANDWICH - GREEN TEA] - Free with Check-in. YUM!

LOvmRW7Mqcm1N52gGrZpZQ.text: Each time we come to Las Vegas, always visit this restaurant probably the best Korean bbq in Las Vegas! Great food and super amazing customer service... our servers Soo and Jaeyong are super friendly... highly recommend Jaeyong for customer service server of the year!!  The Kobe beef is definitely a must try!!!  And the beef tounge  All the food here are delicious, but the Kobe and tounge are the top 2 definitely must have!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ucSbHaIkoFw9oHCh51T9KA.text: 7 mins drive from Palazzo hotel! Awesome location off the Vegas strip because not only this is a good place to eat but right next to it is the sushi place called KaiZen! That place is good as well! Sorry for the side track, back to this amazing BBQ place. We had meat lovers for 2 for lunch. Wow it was for meat lovers for sure because there were plenty of meats for 2. The banchans were good and generous.  The filet mignon was definitely not as good compared to Niwa BBQ that I had in Dallas, TX. I would rather have quality over quantity. And another cut which I forgot the name (long slim cuts) didn't have the fresh taste. As I was chewing it, the taste felt like it's been out for a while and the meat started to have a smell. Didn't like it.  But over all for Vegas, this place is decent.  The complimentary Yelp check in macaron ice cream coffee flavor was amazing. I want to come back for more of that ice cream.  Our server was very nice, always a smile on his face. Thank you.  Plenty of parking spots because it's located in a strip mall..

KYaZz8oNkdzeVq8VwJMTJg.text: Went to celebrate Mother's Day and everything was really good. Ordered the meat lover option and it was very tasty. The meats came marinated and were very tender. It's a lot of food! We'll definitely be back soon.

Ik7TyXcDZSEpvqsXJx52fw.text: Food was good. Slightly on the pricier side. However service was prompt They have a lot of selections to choose from. The ambience here is phenomenal as it takes you back to the roots. Would definitely come back if there was more availability of their lunch menu into their dinner menu. Staff was very pleasant to deal with and they even remembered us from last time which is great knowing you are being acknowledged

JecLMt47ow1Mz-uKY_RofQ.text: Great gathering for family and friends. Service and food was very good!! This was our 2nd time and it was just as good.

t_smtRXSR-OZXdLb2NO11Q.text: I picked up my friend from the airport and we were pretty hungry. He wanted korean bbq so we chose the place closest to us, which was gangnam kbbq.  This isn't an ayce kbbq place, but i was pretty full from the amount of food that we ordered.   We ordered the 2 person kbbq set, which came with 5 cuts of meat, oysters, corn, grilled mushrooms, unlimited banchan, and bulgolgi bibimbap.   The service here is really friendly and welcoming. They help you to cut your meat and cook it if you want.  I prefer my meat to barely touch the grill so i prefer cooking my meat myself.   The cuts were on the smaller side, so if you have a huge appetite or are super hungry you should probabaly order more.  I really liked the side salad they had, the dressing was really refreshing and light.  The bulgolgi bibimbap was too sweet for me, and i dont think i would order it again .   Good place to come,  if you are near the strip /airport, otherwise there are alot more affordable ayce kbbq places in vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JmcNFk6t0IE-6VLavQixnw.text: Amazing quality cuts of meat that just brings out the flavor! We just had one item that was forgotten from the initial order. I am a bit disappointed that the 18% service fee was added for adult family of 4 and 2.5 year old and 3 month new born who didn't even eat or drink anything. I understand there was 6 total people.. but seriously a new born in baby carrier????

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary side dishes

xUnwVzLlzUQE2ZtuyHY53g.text: Very romantic little restaurant off the Las Vegas Strip. Service was good too. Price was very fair.   I always tell my friends to get off of the Las Vegas Strip when they want local Vegas food. The beef here was so flavorful.   I cannot wait to visit Nevada again soon so that I can come back and have more good food.

S0OnMneoANuo6wmN7tmH9g.text: Overall great experience. The service waa great, everyone was on it. The Kobe beef was melt in your mouth greatness. The ambience is comfortable, and for Vegas weather nice and cool inside with tabletop grills. We will frequent this place.

hnX002o2HDb2ofYOcchekg.text: Japanese & Korean BBQ just 10 minutes off The Strip!  We were a group of 13 & dined here on Saturday night.  They did not have a big enough table for all of us but sat us in 2 tables that were side by side.  Friendly customer service.  Delicious food.  You can order one their set meals or order by dish.  We each ordered their most popular   Gangnam= $66/2 people or $120/4 people or $170/6 people.  Many of us are used to AYCE & assumed that this set would not be enough for us.  But omg, it was a ton of food!  We could not finish everything & were forcing ourselves to try because everything was good.

HGVoESsHAP01FDwwWhjY1g.text: Every time I come here it's amazing! The meat is fresh and the grills are always hot!

Au8rCdMgySxt2mIrjkX0WQ.text: Omg!!! you must try if you are craving for Kbbq in Vegas. Great meat! They are not all you can eat but they foods are so good and very good amount. The only foods that taste a bit off is the kimchi lettuce and kimchi cucumber. Very expensive for the selection they have but they are worth it.

cK0nLpeysjl342_8cpEsLw.text: Have been there 2 times and never disappointed. So good. There is nothing bad on the menu. Love going there when I'm in Vegas. Great BBQ meats and sea food. Sauces are amazing and service is on point. Great spot to eat.

F6zbpNsaFeYPxnNMtWCTVA.text: I would definitely recommend this place for a good meal with tasty side dishes and very friendly staff!

f9EKu18T4vfy2UzImHf3ew.text: Serious bang for your buck. I came with my family of 5 and ordered the preset menu. I believe they had size options for 2, 4 or 6 people on the preset menu and with my two brothers, we decided to order the 6 rather than 4. Food was great and service was superb. The 5 of us literally rolled out of there wondering if the serving for 2 would've fed us just fine...and we like to eat!

ndRLAEqApw0rSo7gE97kFg.text: Dined in with my parents  Ordered meat lover  Staffs were friendly and food was petty good

05-T3xah-OEb33sfeAI40Q.text: This place is good, but not great. Decor is beautiful. Big red tables for all your many dishes to come, however the grill itself is not the best like gyu-kaku because the meat we were grilling kept sticking on, even if you brushed oil on grill. We had to change grill twice and we didn't even cook a lot of meat.   *SERVICE WAS GREAT, FRIENDLY STAFF   Gangnam is Korean with some Japanese flavors. Located next to "get nailed" nail salon. Open til 1am! Bring all your friends. Food was average, kind of lacking in flavor. Our bibimbap that comes with the combo took forever to come out, we really wanted to enjoy it with our meats. I wish the beef brisket was sliced thin. We just the "LAS VEGAS" combo for 2 people. I love how they give you the korean side dishes (banchan) especially the cuttlefish!    I couldn't wait to try it, now I did, and now I'll move on. I'll stick to my gyu-kaku and tofu hut. It wasn't bad, it was like I said average. Great to bring out of town guest.   Oh btw don't forget to review here so you can get complimentary dessert! That was nice!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I wish we took one of these home! Macaroon ice cream sandwich!
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uLgRE6bwHYH7uilazsERgQ.text: A Korean / Japanese barbecue mix. Gangnam is trying to be both, however Korean Influence is stronger - K-pop was constantly streamed through the TVs.  Their barbecue items were decent, but when I ordered bulgogi bibimbap for lunch, it didn't come with a bunch of side dishes like most Korean restaurants. None, in fact. That made me feel like they are a cheapskate and the prices started to feel pricier.  They should research on what Yagyu offers for lunch... Yagyu is much better in all aspects - food quality, portion and prices. While what Gangnam offers is decent, I fail to find a reason to go back. Also, Gyu-kaku is getting ready for lunch... watch out!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi bibimbap

JaJDruj0uMx2lV9lBr4kzw.text: Not realistic with waiting times. They run the establishment like it's a club with folks that can pay their way through the waiting list

YC5eECm-YL1Y04ppX_zLDw.text: 5 star food 4 star service  And decent pricing.  The traditional are all good. The chicken with lime is good too. Beef is best

zGuMD5-jlP8GcNqcYJaE6Q.text: The meat was very exquisite but the side dishes could be better. I do love that if we check in we get free macaron Ice . The waiters were great definitely was there when we needed them. The price is definitely average for the type of meat you get

Hy5ZXyn10Sn2NOhio9MkBg.text: This is the first japanese-Korean BBQ that I've eaten at. At first I was skeptical cause you don't normally mix two different types of asian style foods (for those who don't know the difference between Japanese and Koreans). To my surprise however, they found a harmonic balance between the two. It's like GyuKaku Japanese BBQ with free Korean sides and additional korean meat options. The bill could add up cause all their shit is delicious, but it's worth it to be adventurous on the menu.

waDMVccfjiPr3SeN3U6tXQ.text: Got here in time for a great happy hour.  Food was great and fresh.  Highly reccomend.

Kd0i4_Fm0d55XkuLzkRr9A.text: This place is a little out of the way locals but I think it's pretty good. First of all they give a bunch of side dishes that were all pretty good except for the macaroni, it tasted like it was full of butter.   We got prime Kalbi, both marinated and not marinated. The not marinated one was the best thing I had this meal. The beef tongue was aight. If it was sliced a bit thinner or a bit thicker it would've been great. Pork belly was typical pork belly. We cooked it to crispy. The filet mignon was meh. Would skip. We also got the king oyster mushroom. It was aight.   Get the prime kalbi. So good. So fat. So worth.   Also get the sesame oil with sea salt. It's well worth the one dollar. Adds a lot of flavor to the meats.   Also free dessert if you do Yelp reviews rn. ;D

EzmuRJXKiD8uwXtIXsLItw.text: Great decor and delicious food. Got the Las Vegas for 2 deal at $45, and it was so much food. Could have fed 4 easily. Love everything about this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uA0iTKqQwnUJL6ojVVcGBA.text: Great menu selection for the price. Very filling menu items for 2 or 4. The dinner combos makes it easy to select. Comes with rice, appetizers, meat and other veggies.   We tried thr gangnam combo and it had oyster calamari. The filet was very good as well.  Going to do a more updated review later. This review comes with a dessert

MttuyZHlndGLrCXHqBr3qA.text: This is definitely my favorite BBQ! We ordered the number 1 (Gangnam) the quality of the meat is Premium, the flavors of each meat is awesome, all the complements and sides are delicious and last but not least the service is A+++ all waiters are super friendly, kind and efficient. If you are visiting or live in the area, you must come try it.

uan2vck8yoTBlVn1OHfdCw.text: Really really yummy Korean BBQ that you cook at your table. The side dishes were tasty and plentiful. Meat quality was excellent. Vegetables we ordered (mushrooms and asparagus) were already cooked when they brought it to our table, so that was nice. We went around 3, so not many people. Service was great. It's s little pricey by San Diego standards but probably on point for Vegas. It's right across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel.

yD7-iBeTsMVORTJWfYftoA.text: Unreal.  Don't waste your time on the strip at a chain eatery. This place is great!  Trust your servers. They are very knowledgeable.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aftermath!!

CwTzwPc-3ZWXiLyzRcQ-OA.text: Best meat I've eaten in a while. Love the macarons as well. Totally recommend this place for any gambler in Las Vegas.

el73dXnzXQMJlH-pybkUuQ.text: Excellent food, service and experience! Honestly, a must go if you are in Vegas. The only reason it is not a 5 star is because of the wait. I'd suggest a text messaging system if waiting is longer than an hour. During our hour wait, we walked around CVS and they local shops, but kept running back every 15 minutes to make sure our name wasn't being called. Either way, it is worth the wait! Great quality food and extremely well priced!

pUYLEloOHNONFUTX90q-Ug.text: Came on a Tuesday night around 10:30 to try their happy hour as well as other items on the menu.  From the happy hour menu my boyfriend and I ordered the  cream cheese wonton $3 spicy tuna kimbap $3 Ordered all 3 meat $3 each (pork taro, beef brisket, and bulgogi) and a pitcher of Sapporo beer for $9.  Everything was delicious I feel like the bulgogi, tuna kimbap, cream cheese wonton was our personal favorite. The bulgogi was very tasty but kindve small in portion so would recommend order of 2 instead of one.  We decided not to go with the set combo menu and order a la carte of marinated galbi, side of lettuce and paste wrap (comes with celery), and raw garlic as the side dish to make a Korean version taco (aka "Saam")   Overall the place is very clean, attentive servers, good quality food and affordable price range for everyone (can do set combo meals or a la carte). It may not be the best Korean bbq I've ever had but the quality and the chill ambiance is nice for the Vegas area. Had a pleasant experience and would come back again.

YyoP44pUFnmbhMk6iyHf5g.text: This restaurant look better and taste better than it says in Yelp. I wish they have little bigger space to have more rooms.  The decor is very modern and the vibe is great, good enough to accommodate various age groups. Food was prepared clean and professional manner and the server (her name is Jay) provided the excellent service. I will definitely come back again.

YVoME0uxmQYGDZDxwR1wdg.text: Preaching to the choir; the be-bim-bap is pretty good!

nXahj1pg_70xrgHe1O38og.text: When just went there to try it out. Saw it in yelp. I wouldn't give it a star.  How the hell did he get his position as a manager. Soo fucking rude! If you guys want to charge gratitude cuz we 9 people (4 adult & 5 kids under 10y.) THEN HAVE IT WRITTEN I  THE MENU!!!. THERE SERVICE SUCKS. NOT FRIENDLY OR HELPFUL.

8sZWDyDUvX87HsOkfcXIHg.text: Incredible place ! Kid friendly and the best macaron ice cream I ever had in my life.

blAyOWdAFwJ4yimQtAgOkA.text: It's my first time coming here. now i know why they have so many good reviews. the quality of the food and the service was superior. i would like to recommend to all my friends who is coming to vegas!!!

Wnp1MR6drP8-4KwjthtqpQ.text: I visited this place because the review was quite good. Yes, as other people mentioned, quite nice plce for casual dinner. We ordered #1 appitizer Kobe Ssam. For 2pieces are expensive than others. But most of this kind of place is like this. Not bad.  Steaned egg is quite nice. Quite clean and new.  Staffs are nice.  But a bit noisy.

lBfBcbzdEKjROONRJbw5xQ.text: First Korean dining experience. I had Bulgogi and Gyoza. They give you a lot of sides, but only 4 oz of meat per entree. The service was not terribly friendly, but the food was good. The water was good. I'm doing this for the free dessert.

Te75KRBovJ_404hcj6outg.text: Very good food love the meat lover special they have an assortment of berf and pork meats. Grrat customer service.

PDAJHrDLQ9sf4h_Je3u0ug.text: We had a pretty good dining experience here. Dining atmosphere is great and food looks good too. We ordered Gangnam for two ppl. Everything is perfect except ... almost everything is too sweet for me. Meat is sweet and complementary appetizers are sweet too. I expect to get various flavors. Anyway, great experience.

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GunEkV8kfXrH3qSLB4KRtw.text: Great customer service! Food came very fast and The food was delicious! We will come back in the future.

t7TsP27thV8IVZ-YJtI8xw.text: First time eating asian bbq. I loved the presentation. All the proteins were served raw and there is a grill in the center of the table. This allowed me to undercook my meat while my friend charred hers to a crisp, we were able to enjoy our food at our own pace without having to wait for the longer cook time for her food.

p3JYKaMGueYP_YkLW4UMNg.text: First time here. Everything was great. Came during happy hour and bulgogi was my fav !!

mm_h2ajklG2k5OZGvoDUBQ.text: Great service, delicious food. My nail salon expert recommended it, I am so glad he did. I will definitely recommend it to others

ylBQAqztomcrzbCMb_VQCA.text: We sat down and then didnt see a server for 30 min. If we werent so hungry we would have leave left. We put in the whole order as soon as he came over... He then had to be reminded to bring out each individual item, He was so busy Drinking sake with the cute 21 year olds at the other table. Then when we asked to split the check he just charged one person double and not the other... *FacePalm*  The Food was ok. The music was very offensive rap music (I wouldnt mind in a club) Dont bring your children here.

FTkmFFtBoff-tUNoW9huGQ.text: awesome Korean BBQ. Great atmosphere. The Las Vegas combo is something to try for sure!

m5pbCUTMm-A-SOKTs4SAAg.text: Great place with friendly servers and awesome food!

49yQqBzlnPmdqlOh8vnI7Q.text: First time coming here and the food was amazing! Fills you up for a very fair price! Staff is great and friendly.

PaxOaLj35eaEfyUazOPuLw.text: Been going to different Korean restaurants throughout the Valley and may I say, they have good food, decent amount of meat BUT bad customer service! I was still looking at their menu and our hostess snatched the menu book from my hand, didn't even apologize  also, my sangria drink not even half full when it was served.

XwXnEQcV0OAnesMd_0wSgA.text: The place is cozy and very nice! I've heard so many good reviews for this place! It is highly recommended! The staffs are friendly

vmMk7KjYxfXNYdrsQhpLYg.text: Delicious!!! Good food and great service!! Lots of sides, decent price.... Family friendly.. no wait...

dI34ENzYcwBn0plj0hygLw.text: Cute little place with huge tables and spacious seating! Great price and an even better happy hour :)

SCRRoUKdURDTEXcVKdZ08Q.text: We ordered the gangnam family entree and it was very fulfilling for the 4 of us. $120 and it came when 4 meat dishes, dual orders of raw oysters, shishito peppers, fried tofu appetizer, full salad, grilled mushrooms. Meat was very tender and moist. Flavorful, I must say that it was worth the price. Overall would recommend. Happy Hour on the weekends start at 10pm till close. They're usual happy hours start at 8pm. Servers were attentive and always clearing up our plates as we finish up plates.

NZh1suKXf1Otgc4GvHyuCw.text: First of all, the staff is super friendly. We ordered the gangnam meal for two and it was a lot of food and delicious. I particularly enjoyed the fresh oysters which is surprising because I'm not usually a fan of oysters, but whatever they topped them with made them delicious. The marinated beef was tasty and tender. The price was not too bad for two, considering all of the food that comes with it.

vTV5cNumdnJmjIYr6nCLww.text: Came by for lunch while on a work conference here in Las Vegas. The service was wonderful and the food was absolutely delicious! I had the Korean Pork, chili wontons, edame, and the house salad. The salad dressing was very light and satisfying. I definitely recommend it for anyone in the area!

TA7X68hjRza85kIVqt7aJw.text: High quality meats.  Get as much variety as you can.  Not many banchan, but ok.  Can pass on the fried stuff.

ZrifAziMpSxT1SkehZSxSg.text: Great customer service, staffs are excellent, place is clean and inviting, easy to find. Many different food selections, lots of food, so be sure to come with an empty stomach.

kaQrZJltV0rznC24g-FF6A.text: Ambiance and service were phenomenal.  I will definenatly be back. Now for the bad.  They don't carry side dishes which is my favorite part of a Korean meal.  So I will still make a 20 minute drive out to Soyo because of their high quality kimchi side dishes and complimentary barley tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bi bim bap

PG3e2fFov0ovC2Nf4rekeQ.text: Didn't expect any good BBQ place in Vegas but this one is awesome. I went with my friends and we have party of 6. So they have as two separate table. Good value and good food. Yummy!!!

L6KREXQwkIeq1tiHHqvcyw.text: The beef is so tasty. Was kinda bummed out about the long wait before getting our food though.

yKn0GHRUR3zsGJULA7TXwQ.text: I went to use the ladies' room and had to wait for a very long time. Finally, the person in the restroom came out and it was a MAN! He was an employee of the restaurant and was not apologetic at all.

DyoQvmQj6WzwUVZigbvWZQ.text: The meat quality is good and the service is decent.  The steamed egg is bit overcooked.  Other than that the overall experience is great.

jD5bymXuQXo66kEfBolJ8A.text: Decent atmosphere, reasonable price and great meat! This will be a great place to escape from "expensive" buffet in strip. :p

AyllzkL4HteIeKcrf__ZWQ.text: Good food and fun atmosphere.  The free dessert is awesome.  A bit off the strip but still worth the extra walk or short drive.

E27dA7wSCBxYrLyQ-rc11w.text: It was like eating a very delicious dinner. The service was great and the workers there are very kind. But the meat is the best!! Although some of them might be a little too spicy, it was great. The side dishes were so good!! Especially the kimchi. It is well flavored. Our children enjoyed it and overall, it was a very good and memorable meal.

yy8QRGgcZKECSuJ2NHnn-w.text: We ordered a meat lover set menu, it is really delicious and enough food for two persons, table is clean. And I also liked the side menu which is really good for my taste.

SyAzegD3Ljmy6SX3Yuaa0g.text: I was very disappointed. I had high expectations due to the rave reviews. Too much sauce. We hardly finished dinner and had to leave due to bad head from the smoke. Need a better ventilation system. Won't go back. However service was good and that is why I'm giving 3 stars.

NDi0I2EKExKhy06n_9tKqQ.text: Okay food, kalibi was not as tender as it should be the bulgogi was good. IT os In a Good location.

h5TACqeegCqLvVMdKQC4nA.text: Food was delish overall, but wasnt a big fan of the spicy chicken kaarage-it wasn't bad, but i was expecting crispy fried chicken and it is covered in way too much sauce for my taste. Meat was very good quality! Ordered beef toro, pork toro, pork belly, bulgoggi bibimbap, fried calamari, spicy chicken kaarage, kalbi, bacon enoki.  Place is nice and clean, Service was awesome too! Will definitely come here again next time we're in vegas. You also get a free dessert if you post a yelp review during your visit,  so we got banana tempura, lava cake and a macaroon, all were sooooo yummy too!

7fK-WGwLob8-RSrB8SzM4w.text: Good for Vegas , wish they had Pori-cha and rice paper. Jap Che was oily - waitress was super cool and took care of it. Pa - chan decent. Still a little hungry , meat size could be bigger. Kalbi was great , loved the tuna appetizer , over all good experience. Skip the macaroon deserts

4sbFXHCyfhzltrSgOqOo7w.text: Food was awesome, service was very attentive! Great late night dining spot too.  Get the Kobe beef!

aTBBnilpbbNYyMuqLFpzeg.text: This place rocks! We're from out of town and come here every time we go to Vegas, sometimes multiple times. Happy hour is great because it's the same meat we already order, only cheaper. The kids love the pork belly and we love the toro and bulgogi. Refillable side dishes are delish. The enoki mushroom is really fresh tasting and healthy so it offsets all the meat you're about to devour. The steamed egg looks just like the picture! My only wish is that they served rice paper with the meat. It would make the meal over the top! The restaurant is really nice and the bathrooms are clean. Overall a great, well-rounded experience!

hlMsRvngzsoLhhyEfD0AZg.text: Great food with an authentic Korean taste. Any of their combo meals are a great amount of food for the reccommended servings. You will end up spending about 25 to 35 a person if you purchase around the middle of the price range. They keep your empty dishes cleared and glasses full. Its a delicious meal and lots of fun with a social group for a competitive price. The nature of the meal does make it a bit loud though, so keep that in mind. Location is just 5 minutes from the strip so that's a huge plus

WhccKYltIWrg9XxA6dLiVQ.text: Delicious and great prices! The staff is very friendly and it's a fun atmosphere. I recommend the bulgogi. Everything is great. It's really nice because you can order a la carte.

QIk4YcZ5KlwPEANLVAt9AA.text: A great new hidden find in vegas! Their lunch happy hour is amazing prices and food is actually better than most in china town. Dynamite shrimp is a hit!

cKluH_Cq4GqG64TYq26jbg.text: First time here! We went during happy hour and the prices are very cheap, but they only have a few selections. Also take note that at this place, you have to cook the meat yourself!  Overall, everything was delicious. However, the beef toro isn't as tender as I've had before. The beef tongue is really good!  Honestly if you come to Korean bbq, order beef. The other meats aren't as good for the worth, but they are still tasty. Also if you write a Yelp review, you get free desert!

tNAhC1VnCZwTMJ1-c3yMiw.text: Good quality of meat. But the service is terrible. Doesnt give all the food listed in combo menu. Hard to grab servers. All marinated meat are extremely sweet. Even with the burn stains, doesnt change the grill at all. I asked it to be changed and the server was dumbfounded.   Just order non marinated meat if you can handle their rip off price and terrible service.

ku52lElsuPgGJ_p6GCkXYA.text: My buddies and I came here a random Wednesday night where it was dead. They ordered several combos while I had to look elsewhere on the menu since I was a vegetarian. Despite being envious of the sights and smells that came afterwards, I was happy with my order of veggie ramen and bimbimbap.  When the ramen first came, the noodles looked like they came from an instant ramen package. When I taste the salty sour broth though, I was happy and let the noodles continue soaking the broth and focus on my Sapporo. Once the noodles were completely hydrated, it was delicious.  So was my bimbimbap. I didn't notice any tofu and it didn't have an egg either but still flavourful without any obvious protein. Not only was my meal filling. It was cheap. My large ramen noodle bowl was about 6 dollars while my rice bowl was 8. I can't say no to large cheap portions of tasty food.

YDoqxM3IF7K7Dw_9xRsqCA.text: Pants won't button after eating here. Get all the beef entrees, they are amazing. I loved the steamed egg, omg so good. The firecracker shrimp is not very good. Focus on the meat here.

MrF28APbB_hYlgWhJ-VPmw.text: Having been to Seoul, and experienced firsthand The amazingness of cream barbecue, I can see you this place doesn't quite stand up to the authentic Korean standards.  The meat selection is quite extensive, and the "Kobe style" was actually pretty good. The fried calamari, and marinated short ribs and spicy pork, were actually very tasty.  I would call this upscale and twist, as far as the restaurant very nicely laid out with her every single table in the corner was very clean and atmosphere was very mellow for a New York/Las Vegas style restaurant. I would call this fancy, I wouldn't necessarily call it good for kids, but if you've never been to the Korean barbecue place, The authenticity, and the experience of cooking your own meat in the grill in front of you on the table is very very fun. With over 1200 reviews and many more photographs, and I'm feeling like this place is a hit, even being off the strip. A good place for locals, and definitely a place I'd recommend to those traveling.

M44OFZWhKe3MlbxJk4ChWg.text: This place is very good. The people are very professional and the meat lovers combo was delicious. Be sure to check it out!

cndnncou2q3gYzyu6y_R4g.text: Travel here, yelped and came. Very disappointed. The food is not fresh and not tasty at all. The waitress here is very impolite. I don't understand how they get this good rating. I would give it zero star if I could.

Vs-jUCeHbkkyAYuk475J9Q.text: Amazing!! Favorite in Vegas so far out of all restaurants went too. Great place to bring your friends and family too. Great staffs! Great food!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qQclngqfRysOlreAu57LGQ.text: Best Korean Bbq! Superb! Wait for 1 hour in line. But it was worth it. All the meats  were delicious

EJwo3ELY3wDYTIbRLBoiEw.text: Totally amazing dinner tonight.  This is my favorite Vegas restaurant.  Great meal.   Outstanding meats.   Great flavors.  Awesome!

hpTlhQGkkuKUDiyOConAVg.text: Food is not bad and when I paid with cash, the server told me they do not accept old version of $100 bills without the strip!!!

EnZ579hv7vs-WZHepUhenw.text: Awesome Korean bbq place! I'm from LA and I have no complaints whatsoever! Whenever we come visit Las Vegas we always come here and my son is picky with meat so if he likes it then it's legitimate meat. It's high quality Resturant with excellent service.

YBDv9FE7C5JP58zCgo3ZKQ.text: Brought my wife here for her birthday and service was great, food was great and reminded me of Korea Town Los Angeles!!!   Can say it's the best in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K7gfFDRLmV4jJMFxXQRCpQ.text: This was your average Korean bbq experience, nothing really special. We ordered the combo for 2 with shrimp,fiet mignon, pork(total of 6 meats). The spicy pork belly was amazing the rest of the food was a little above average. Overall the service here was average nothing to write home about!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clean environment! Really flexible with menu

exy1Lwc0wzgY6xLo5IpwTg.text: This place was tasty and fun! The food was fresh and we loved the spacious tables. There was plenty of food for all four of us and it just kept coming! Saki was great. The music was a little loud but the service was great. Wonderful dining experience.

Nw253XisUhhDUT2cU0eIlQ.text: Food was very good! Service was friendly and attentive, if you're at the area make sure to drop by and give it a try!

JQOvln4exsf0YycBup-80w.text: I was picking my husband up from the airport around midnight and we were looking for something we could sit down to enjoy, we were very impressed with the food and service. Can't wait for our next visit.

VnANGrfw4FzQLHb61lffcw.text: Great service and good food. Only down side is the wait times during dinner, prepare to wait around an hour

ciNwC9tDqx2pQfK6cDD6MA.text: My friend and I went down here to try out their Korean BBQ, it was great! We got the Las Vegas for two and couldn't finish it! Very yummy and filling

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IsSpfIgz6iRFdc0mFbWeSA.text: Delicious and the price is great too! Definitely try the Macaroon Ice Cream Sandwiches!

gGxR6yJzpbT2AS_beN5muQ.text: Pricey.   Meat was all tender and well flavored. Definitely recommend ordering some lettuce to cut some of the meat flavor.   Ordered the harami miso, Korean prime kalbi, filet mignon (oh so tender), flat iron garlic, beef toro, enoki with bacon (interesting)  Service is kind of slow.

spDxJnymAG_tP0m9iY8n0A.text: Good Korean food for reasonable prices. There was also pretty good service. I would recommend the Bulgogi and the Korean Galbi in particular.   P.S. If you dig watching very sexy music videos while you eat good Korean grub, this is the place.

CjDfHcpf4Ix31ax6wNl6Ag.text: Pretty positive experience overall. Great ambiance, relatively private dining area with tall dividers in between booths along the wall. Always enjoyed the concept of korean BBQ and this place did not disappoint

YXWqpwYqkFifg_7LnrU0oQ.text: I am not a big fan of Korean BBQ, but this place is amazing. It's a hidden gem across from Hard Rock and it's open late. The service is always quick and friendly. My favorite thing on the menu is the rock shrimp!

UjbNI7zz04iXqL5gvXBKyA.text: I went to this place after a convention to get off the strip.  Made it right on time for happy hour half price drinks and deals on bbq and appetizers.  Excellent!!!!

G38wAk8RL2snP9Ed44aEgQ.text: Seated quickly and the food arrived shortly after. Great selection of proteins and drinks. We ordered a la carte and everything was delicious. Great service. I would come back!

XZs2ujrLofjNDkII8hGjng.text: Really great service and very good food.  We wanted Korean and found Gangnam on Yelp.  My kids and I loved the marinated Kalbi and bulgolgi.  We ended dinner with macaron ice-cream.  So good!

LdGv9wXzwEhe7vTF99ETbA.text: Very good service! Food was delicious and superb. Will come back again! The meat was savory and it was a great traditional Korean BBQ experience. The banchon was fresh and tasty as well. The two person Vegas meal was plenty enough for the three of us. We left feeling very satisfied.

tmn_BAy0Q5fW2LNM7k4gmw.text: Great food. Unfortunately no all you can eat option, but the happy hour plates are super reasonable :)

3B4goqtQ5Q2qaj5DctmMYg.text: Good service, nice portions.. but honestly, the meat isn't the best. It's ok.. just not top notch.

iXM5XAVwmUbAYb7m32V8Ug.text: Terrible customer service at this PDQ store . Will not be back . Went in for the first time . Saw a posted sign at the register advertising a three peice tender combo meal for $5 bucks .  I clearly pointed to the sign and told the cashier I would have the $5 combo special.  She rang up my order and charged me $7.46 . I took the food to my table and looked at the receipt thinking the combo special probably didn't include the soda . But why would soda be an extra $2. 46 ?    I told the cashier I thought the combo was $5 dollars ? She said " oh that special starts at 7 pm . I asked her to tell me the time since I didn't wear a watch . It was 6:48 pm . I asked her if she could reimburse the difference . I had assumed it was already 7 pm (my fault ) .  She went to get someone else . The manager ? Shift supervisor ? Obviously someone who was in charge .  I explained that it was my fault for not knowing the proper time . But since I had clearly pointed to the sign when placing the order , I should've been told that it was 12 minutes too early to receive that special . In a not so friendly manner told me he was unable to refund the difference. I asked him if I didn't like the taste of the food or if the food was too cold would he refund the entire price ? He said yes . So I then told him the food was cold and he gave me a very slow and drawn out refund for the entire amount . Plus then he took the plate of food which I had already handled and put it neatly back on the kitchen where I'm assuming he planned on re selling it . ( health code violation) . So for the difference of $2 dollars and 12 minutes in time ... He would rather refund the Entire price of the meal , and also lose a customer forever ? No problem . This is Las Vegas and we have many different  choices on each block to choose from.  The reason I give ONE Star and will never come back is the poor customer service combined with him not throwing away the food I had already handled .

lmwOBlPEfZlhO2ZJPqce_w.text: Super good! Pretty damn pricey! We got the gangnan combo for four, very fulfilling and satisfying!

UtFuphXdsGfGLtSqpDKaxw.text: Nice style for decoration. Nice serves.  But all source is all sweet. Meets are good flavor.  They need more serves they are too busy for  us.

rcCMMpf2o4FFwMBsx4f13A.text: Great food. Excelent!!  We were waiting before we got our table, but as soon as we sat, they took our order. The meat is so juicy n full of flavor. But the only problem is a lil pricey for local people. Anyway we Definitely will come back!

--0e6CLC1aWYdx5j22F3sw.text: I like the food, it was really fresh. The service was also on point and it was a full house. The beef is really good, any of them. The fried rice feeds about 3 ppl. I love this place, I come here often. And always bring ppl here who come to Vegas to visit, they all love it. The price is also very reasonable. For 2 ppl I usually spend about $40 but leave STUFFED.

1Nv4_kHNWwbxey8jPXeJBg.text: I love Korean food, especially Korean BBQ. Why you asked? Because of the variety of taste as you enjoy eating. I like to roll my meat in either rice paper or radish or both and clear my pallets with the condiments. This place, although the service was good, the food taste was not bad, but the lack of the essential Korean food restaurant experience was a turn down. For example, they don't have rice paper, radish, seaweed etc. Some of you might say that is not for you, understandable but it should be an option for some people. Anyway, if you like a relaxing experience and not picky about the food experience so much, this place maybe for you..

GNaRj3G-1l0v5CcjwbHkzg.text: I haven't been able to try the food due to the overwhelming long line of 90 plus minute wait time.   Just not worth the wait in Vegas!  1 star for the long wait.  I would give it no star but that's not an option.

SkaieprSv2PBGYRVJz9XeQ.text: Is not one star but I'm tempted to give it.  Do not be fooled by the 4.5 stars.  They offer free desert for a good yelp review.  Hence the reviews.  The food was 3.5 stars at best.  Throw on atrocious service they deserve one or two.    The bbq wasn't horrible but it certainly was no where near 4.5 stars.  It took 30'minutes to settle the check.  The bbq wasn't warm enough, they didn't provide scissors to cut meat, the seasoning was just ok.  They meat was not cut appropriately.  They brought 3 glasses of water to 5 person table. None of the little things went right.  The seasoning was meh as well.

uszewuLGLXf90ApXc1decg.text: Found this place based off all the 5 star reviews found on Yelp. I'm sorry, yes I have to give this place 3 stars and not the shiny bright 5 stars that everyone else has provided. Don't get me wrong, the food was absolutely delicious. The pitcher of sangria was absolutely amazing. The price for the amount of food you get when you order off of their combos was definitely decently priced, but the service... my visit was at 1:00PM on a Friday and there was 1 table  with guests dining there. We walked in and kind of stood by the door waiting for someone to come greet us. It seems like the entire staff was on their break or something. Perhaps I am not with the Vegas lifestyle, and people don't come in to eat at 1:00 PM? Maybe we missed the lunch rush? Was no one working? It took a bit for someone to seat us. After we sat down, it was like they forgot we were there. We had to get up and find someone to explain the menu, take our order, change our grill, and re-fill our water. This place is definitely delicious, but service at 1:00 PM was not the fast and friendly service I had read in all these reviews.

sK0fWoHVNINpg2MnKYuffA.text: Decided to stop by on a whim and boy was  surprised. Great food for the happy hour special would eat again

t-8QbvWnUkZY8UIfDbzSEg.text: We came during lunch hour. Excellent ambiance. Very chill and down beat.   The food are beautifully presented. We ordered the Gangnam menu and it was plenty of food!  The marination is in a sweeter side. A tad too sweet and saucy for my husband taste, but they have great flavor.  Service is awesome too. Prompt and kind.  There are plethora o resto in Vegas, this is one of the handful that goes on my list.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Well done! Great char and taste.
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat!!

ryLffo1-sSNoFORAbvtoSQ.text: The food was okay but the service left a lot to be desired.  They serviced another table about 6 times more often than ours. Maybe I'm used to gyu-kaku and their excellent service but this was really bad. No one explained what any of the sides given were. No one ever turned off our grill (my boyfriend).  Update* a new server just asked about our experience and I told him about the service. He's really nice and even offered us complimentary ice cream.  I don't think I'll return but the food was good. It was just the service.

G34VwHdncaaGkcz67rjIeg.text: Ths place is awesome! I went in with a group of 5 and we ordered the meat lovers dinner for 6 people. Warning though this meal can probably feed 8 maybe 10 people. Everything was delicious right down to sauces! Definitely recommend!

VMYtiNv67vYt0TkdEs3pGQ.text: Kangnam was recommended highly by one of my friend who is also a chef with exquisite taste buds.  So my expectations were high to begin with, but we were on our way back from Los Angeles dining at best Korean restaurants, so Kangnam could have been at a big disadvantage.   Nonetheless, hands-down best BBQ as well as other foods!  You can truly expect top quality meats, sauces,  foods as well as exceptional service by best looking staff!    We went there after 2 weeks long road trip with toddlers.  As soon as we walked in my sons were acting up from being cooped in the car all day.  The staff promptly sat us in a private room so we were able to dine without worrying about interrupting other guests. Huge kudos to them since it was Friday night and place was packed.    Then one of my sons threw up all over me!  and again the staff immediately came with napkins and made sure we were ok.  Super attentive and kind folks!  During our meal I think staff rotated and quietly checked up on us dozen times.  Just making sure we had everything but without interrupting our meal.    The night started out rough, chaotic with kids and vomit but we all left the restaurant stuffed and extremely satisfied.  I would give them more than 5 stars if there was an option!  This place triumph the best Los Angeles Korean places we visited by quality of food and service!

ABHES9N_jcJPaJqLFvGUCQ.text: Excellent BBQ.   3 guys and the food just keeps coming.    We ordered the 2 person meal and 2 extras - this was plenty of the 3 of us.  Topped it off with the honey cake - again shared between 3 of us - plenty of dessert.     Enjoy!

ANwD-a4ElrVoz5BY2grYvA.text: This was a highlight to my Vegas trip.  Never have tried KBBQ, so my boyfriend and I thought it would be a great time to. We got the meat lovers deal and it was ALOT of food! Plus, it was very affordable! Such a great experience. If only we lived closer!

MjZr3LDG3MMzyuw6wLwY9g.text: Talk about cream of the crop meats! This is my favorite food spot in Vegas aside from Bacchanal. This is pretty close to the strip. Be warned that there will almost be a pretty long wait, I feel like its always understaffed and there's this one younger guy who works his butt off. When we were there he answered phones, rang up customers, grabbed foods, bussed tables, changed out grills, he pretty much did everything. I felt bad for him because he really was working super hard. Anyways, the food here is AMAAZINGGG. I love their Hirami Miso, you must try it. Also their steamed eggs is out of control, like MASSIVE in size, it's an overflowing fluff when they bring it out. And it's not all fluffly and airy like most steamed eggs. This thing is dense and could be shared with 2-3 people even. I don't particularly care to get appetizers or other items aside from the meat here.

8VCsLyjzr20g6tyM5RDIYQ.text: Authentic Korean food! My family loved the food and atmosphere so much we are there 2 nights in a row! If I could give 10 stars I would! I travel all over the world, and aside from Korea itself, this is one of the best Korean BBQ restaurants in the US! Thank you all for such great service!

lLmBgf8rm0xY3dmQOca8gA.text: We ordered what felt like an infinite amount of food and were stuffed to the gills by the time our check came.... Which was only around $25! We are vegetarians, so that helped, but the value+quality was very real. I *highly* recommend the egg souffle as a side dish.

SD9s1oeEYjJJiJwAJdxqOg.text: Service just sucks, food is nothing close to any of the newer KBBQ in town, I really don't understand the hype and how they got so many reviews. Awesome.

Yt_bDgjQzjnws_qSM93yuw.text: Good stuff. Prepped raw food delivered to your table where you cook your own to your preference. Pricing is a la  carte or purchase in groups of 2,4, or 6 people. Quality ingredients, included free sides. Amazing. We will be back.

t0N1SWXY0UvQSErIRomUMQ.text: as a korean, i hold very high standards for what authentic korean bbq tastes like. i typically complain any place i go but by far one of the only restaurants that i feel came close to what mom's bbq tastes like. got a macaron ice cream that was a perfect finish to our meal.

xHRBkkim9htDlqkSLdn2Hw.text: The Kalbi was so delicious and the bulgogi was also savor I also liked the chow rice Great service too! This will be go to korean bbq for us in vegas !

wyiRkDua8vcoH3M6YrTFJg.text: Probably one of the best Korean BBQ places in town . We paid about $80 dollars for 2 people and that's including desert . The meat was amazingly tasty and so was the rice . It's up there with habeak . I would for sure go back !

k31qWP3caZ7yoN3vdmEUfg.text: It's my first time in Las Vegas, and this place is the BOMB DOT COM. They have quality meat that is so savory and tender. The sides are very tasty and fresh as well, and all for a really good price! I wish I had come here earlier! Also, I got their macaron ice cream sandwich for free just for checking in! Whenever I come back city, I will definitely come back here!

n15uT6dY3FU491XMT5GMdA.text: Always great food and service. I've been going here since it opened. Always recommend and bring my tourist friends.

NRjlg0g7qqZYRxttwpHPUQ.text: An absolutely great overall experience. The variety of options and fantastic flavor will definitely bring us back again.  The bulgogi Beef was by consensus the overall favorite. The wait staff provided great recommendations and was very attentive. Not to mention that 6 people walked out stuffed under $170! Can't wait to return in the near future.

uvVO5eu0s0mx5Y1GL1djeQ.text: This place is so good! The staff there were really nice and the food was really good. I shared the GANGNAM combo and it was so much food. The meat was pretty good quality & was a well balanced meal. The side dishes were yummy too !  The GANGNAM combo came with 5 cuts of meat & lots of side dishes. Too bad salad wasn't refillable but it was good. There was also an kimchi tofu and bulgogi bibimbap.   The meat was so good and we were so full after!

i5vMe2WRlz6H1l_f5RiBmA.text: Beef bulgogi was an absolute must! Super tender and the glaze was amazing. Salmon was a little bland but still good. Would recommend the bulgogi for sure. Only comments are that I wish the sizes were bigger and the BBQ sauces were labeled, but the sizes you get are what you pay for. Yum!

IJsDxdEYfdOm2ZY-mI_Qtw.text: Just best of the best. Outstanding service and excellent food. I've tried many korean bbq places but this one left me only one impression "WoW". If you're ever in town and are craving for Korean+Japanese bbq, this place is perfect for yall. I'll definitely come back if I'm ever in town. ~ from Houston, Tx.

ZopjdcGqMCIR8gkCFCsBwQ.text: Great portions and great food would like to be able to do susitutions since me and my faily do not eat beef but other than that it was great

vSNgw6yXreBbakNiXjmHsQ.text: If you are considering a la carte Korean BBQ, I would believe that this is the best place you can be. Servers are amazing, attentive, and every time  I visit there, they have a great quality of meat compared to the price range that are paying. They are usually around $7 range per meat, if party of 2 is going here, you should expect to pay around $35-40 which I believe that it is reasonable. This place is like the place I come every time I am craving some KBBQ. Yeap, and please make a review about this place by the time you are dining here, they will give you comp macaroon ice cream no matter how you write your review.

N9AzZ9L2bwBGMZm0-l0Q3g.text: Got here around 3pm. Got seated very fast. We got 2 combo for 5 people which was perfect amount. We were all very full. Good quality meat.  Woot.

6r6Yayry6qX7LhlWCihVdw.text: Great service and meat! Came here on a Saturday afternoon within a reservation and was seated fairly quickly. Our group of 5 ordered a meat lover for 2 and a gangnam for 2 and it was the perfect amount of food for a hungry party.

n0dmMZdkVCLTEnRMk47eIw.text: Phenomenal korean!  Short walk from Hard Rock Hotel and Casino.  The bulgogi bibimbap was very good.  Looking forward to coming back to try even more culinary delights they have to offer!

Y4KoxnunmZPL1rNg67PyMw.text: Loved this place! Modern Korean BBQ joint. Second time I've come in one week! Good portion size and quality meat. Desserts were yummy too, especially the macaroon ice cream!

Ifjny_zuyFaCTsftEVNGoQ.text: Awesome experience! This place was recommended to me by my friend, and she was spot on. Definitely try the spicy tuna kimbap! Super tasty and filling. The harami miso was tender and seasoned right. Grill changes in between are always a good thing. Come after 10pm and you can get Happy Hour!! We will definitely be back on our next trip to Vegas.

3WEYDEF9XNaH3cW6SznTjg.text: Loved the food!! The meat lovers was enough to feed 3 adults so fed recommend that for the price.

p3E6NFXFpwKfROsAczvMuw.text: Tremendous VFM amazing food and friendly staff along with your favorite K Pop videos.

7nG9nMi04psf3n2QAF1uVg.text: Did the gangdam for 6 but had only 5 people with us thinking it won't be enough. We were wrong it was way too much food!! It was delish!

u8T4Ziae8vIVHBF3mCGJ2w.text: Incredible...got the gagnam for two people. This included an insane amount of incredible food. The meats are cut perfectly and in a way that people afraid of grilling wont mess it up. All of the sides are awesome and the bibimbop is great. The value and quality of this plsce are some of the best in Vegas.

t7Z4fEXYgvQu_iEfmQAiTQ.text: The marinated kalbee is good and the sidedishes as well. the place is nice and clean.  I didn't like the music videos in the front of the restaurant were playing with explicit language but they quickly accommodated us to a table where my kids can be seated far away from it. The service was quick and good too. The mulnyeng myun was bland and tuna kimchi had too much mayo. I would return for the kalbee though...

RfgMREOidQPo-R-ppwjIiA.text: Great kbbq place. We both felt it was worth the price and the food was great and delicious! You also grt a free dessert for posting a review afterward!!

slMy1rNfPT-RUmQ8TVFj8A.text: All around 5 stars  Service was timely and accommodating. Especially when it came time for the check even with a full dining room. Nothing ruins my meal more than a laggy check. A plus plus.   Food is a decent price for the variety and quality of meats, appetizers and sides. No all you can eat. But I definitely left full and satisfied with what I paid for. I feel like you can't go wrong with anything you choose. But something def worth mentioning are the desserts. The green tea cheesecake is fire. I would also suggest getting the yuzu sorbet to accompany it.   Haven't been for happy hour yet. But totally seems worth it based on my experience with dinner.

RlZI_a7jJqTp6Arndnd85A.text: This place is definitely one of the best Korean BBQs in Vegas. We have tried quite a few and the quality here has been on par and consistent from visit to visit. Unique options of tapas are available as well and the service is impeccable!  Will definitely come back here at least once every time I visit Lost Wages!!

G6EpvRrtUbzxUVzyk8qsAw.text: Wow!!!this restaurant is on my top five best, the food was amazing the service was also great and you get a free Ice cream macaron with checking in. The most reasonable price I have seen from this type of restaurant.

DCDvjgqOUDY8V5L90HqszA.text: Good quality meats and a great assortment of side dishes.  We had the Gangnam and there was more than enough meat for the two of us.  The oysters were also very delicious.  We came during happy hour so our sake was half off too.  Great value!  We'll be back for sure!

BkYzWsY-JEFS6PpYgS35NA.text: I usually cringe at the cost of a restaurant where you cook your own food but Gangnam is surprisingly affordable, especially if you take my advice and order the combos for your group. The menu says they are for 2 people but we had a group of 4 and the combo filled us all.  You can always add one or two items a la carte if you are still hungry.  The meat is surprisingly well marbled and tender and fresh.  The sauces are perfect compliments to the meet.  I thought the salad was a little bit of an afterthought as it was mostly lettuce but we still ate it. Our favorite was the bulgogi bibambap.  The service felt a little off as they had a difficult time understanding and we were very conscious that they were watching us the whole time.  I understand it is your job to clear our table as we finish a plate but there are ways to be less intrusive about it. Also, they were fixing a light in the restaurant while we were all there.  Still, this place is very enjoyable and reasonably priced.

y_Z2ZMVz0ofBmCz-Ig_9Aw.text: This place is da bomb.com. The portion is huge!!! I mean their 2 servings probably could feed 4 people. And the meats were delicious. We had the las vegas set and i felt like i was going to explode. The chickens were so tender and juicy and seasoned just right and sauce was just the right amount of spicy. The service was pretty awesome too. I would totally come back again.

XGG4k7HWB3gBp2idsRZMjw.text: This place is must visit Korean BBQ when you in Las Vegas! The prices is reasonable and the food is fresh! And the restroom is clean!

F8uyoRbd6mp7-XC3jwnamw.text: Great food !! I've been here 3 times and I love the dishes served, mostly sukiyaki noodles. The restaurant has nice and pleasant ambience that kept me active. The sides served are delicious and has wide varieties for vegetarians. Finally, guys you'll like the music played. :D

ByWWACpbx-8A1BElR9WKUw.text: Great environment. Waiter and waitress are responsive, fast and friendly. Food is great. Recommend their Jalepeno Poppers.

NtmRxl9dd_uuM_TRHdQ44A.text: I'm a big fan of happy hour so I decided to check it out here. Excellent choice! The food is fantastic and we received superb service the entire time. I will be back! My favorites are the bulgogi, spicy chicken, and ginger cocktail. Wonderful!

rQIm58RJxQ2sWSEo5Erp8w.text: Really cool concept.  We had a little bit of a wait but had the ice cream cookies which were great during the wait.  Definitely will visit again next time I go to Vegas

ZdJs-Anjl9LrPSBF1ajNGg.text: This is the best restaurant! Love the way the waiters and waitresses are so polite and nice. They are truly fantastic! I wish every restaurant was like this. One time I went to a place similar but it gave me a tummy ache but no bathroom accidents here! The end.

mYjmzlVa5RZ9-zNkdWURiA.text: Very solid kbbq for the strip area. Price is very reasonable. Could go for some more banchan (side dishes) and a bit much that rice does not come included with the minimum bbq meat order. Short ribs were the best out the meat we got, which included pork belly beef brisket. Sauces were also a little sweet for my taste, but overall a solid experience!

Qul2LX_8mBmBAkT_REl8Kg.text: Brought my 95yr old Grandmother, who loves meat, to try something new! I was worried if she would turn up her nose since she's used to her good ol steak, but she was very happy with the food. Good meat, yummy flavors for affordable price. Service was very timely too! Away from the busy strip with plenty of parking. Dinner was a success!

XAT-Dwgdm7we5K3aaCa8BQ.text: Worth the cab ride off the strip.  Staff was great and ordered for 2, enough food for 5.

_HbzMkDeanW-AklvjGzy3w.text: Food was great, price was reasonable quality of meat was very good. No need for a AYCE this fill will still fill you up. Services was attentive and great.

yHwDXvugvfkUMk0oEw2sEw.text: Checked out this place with my friend while we were in vegas. He just returned from a trip to korea and loves Korean food. This place was good although it was missing the sides that generally come with korean bbq and we were surprised to find that the sake was more expensive than the soju. All and all, I'd try it again.

ONrT_f-0rSTG7GI5iErk3g.text: Just walking by to see what Gangnam had to offer when the friendly hostess popped outside and talked us into coming in for dinner. I'm so glad that she did. Second day of being open, and they are killing it! Really fresh decor, SUPER friendly staff, neat concept for dinner. We tried the stir fried sukiyaki veggie udon noodles, spicy garlic edamame, mushroom medley, BBQ rib eye, and the Korean honeyeyed pancake with ice cream.  Everything was so incredibly tasty. The sauce on the udon noodles was so delicious and the veggies were fresh and cooked to perfection. The edamame was the perfect appetizer. I would definitely recommend to give this place a try.   I really hope that they do well- I can't wait to go back!

-6Ma1iR0EuIMgofS9CF-Ag.text: My first experience with Korean BBQ. I was a bit intimidated at first. The place was busy and my rookie flag was flapping wildly. I was able to get through the ordering process with the help of a super friendly waitress that set me at ease from word go.  Happy hour prices made my experience even more palatable.

5hfQQSK6pAjL7FJbFh2MvA.text: My family and I had a wonderful experience at this delicious Korean bbq. Fun music videos playing on the side, very kind & respectful staff, & every choice on the menu was oh, so tasty! Would definitely come back again next time we visit LV. Skip the buffet and all the extra calories. This place is fantastic.

WureE6vbfnI_ymi6J5z7sQ.text: Had dinner here last night. Not really the authentic Korean barbecue that I was expecting. We had one of their popular combination specials. Meat was good, but Kimchee wasn't too good.  Service was pretty good with an easy location to find. Next time I'll try one of the other barbecue places.

Fg70tA59PyVPDU5hzI6vnQ.text: Coming from an experienced La Korean BBQ vet, it's hard to be compared to anywhere else. Gangnam Asian BBQ is no exception. I ordered the bulgogi bibimbap, and was sadly disappointed with the selection. It was rice and bulgogi....that was it. The waitress came by and she even look as displeased at me. What was surprising was that she didn't do anything about it, which was saddening. I can't say that it was their fault, since that's what I ordered, but if a customer looks dissatisfied it should raise an alarm to do something about it! Learn from this, the restaurant has potential.

JnFe4nZj_5CSGfl42sX-uw.text: We just LOVE Gangnam. Excellent food and Amazing Atmosphere. Whole family can enjoy dinner. AWESOME :0)

P6uCnoW2c5fJKjDU1LLUxA.text: Delicious! Favorite was korean prime Kalbi. We also tried prime Kalbi, harami miso, pork toro, pork belly, steamed egg, steamed dumplings, kimchi tofu. Service was prompt. They could have been better with refilling our water and small side dishes. Pork belly was a little tough, but the toro (cheek) was tender. You can always get a free dessert when you submit a Yelp review!

8J2BHoMJQ2rw-pxplRVYYQ.text: So, we came here on a whim, having resolved to try all the various places in the area.  We walked in at 6:30 PM on a Saturday, and the place was a ghost town.  One other couple at a table.  The cheerful staff seated us promptly, and equipped us with menus.    The usual suspects on the beer list, plus a few oddballs which made for nice variety, and also a choice of sakes and other asian alcoholic beverages.  For those of you unfamiliar with the asian BBQ style of dining (as I was) each table has a small gas grill set in its center (and exhaust hoods with fire extinguisers set above them).  Each place setting comes equipped with a pair of tongs.  You order off the menus small (4 oz) batches of raw meat, and then grill them at the table.  It is not quite like Benihana, in that 1) there is not a chef doing entertainment-cooking in front of you, and 2) you are not in a mixed party.  Our waitress did come by from time to time to flip the meat , and to cut it with scissors so that it could be eaten with chopsticks.  The service was quite prompt and pleasant.  The interior of the restaurant was nicely finished, although the 2-person bench seats on each side of the table are so heavy that it makes it difficult to manhandle them into a comfortable position.    The grilled dumplings were tasty; but oddly my girlfriend's less expensive beef tasted markedly superior to my pricer order.    One thing that was irksome were the televisions.  They were showing women's college softball on ESPN 8 or something, and it was just annoying and distracting, cheapening the feel of what was otherwise a refined restaurant.  Why anyone installs TV's in restaurants other than sports bars is beyond me.    The food was ok without being great.  Nothing that made me say "we HAVE to come here again!"  Prices seemed fair ($50 for the 2 of us, including tip, and we ate pretty well).  I admit I am terrible at using chopsticks, and so getting food into my mouth without making a mess is a challenge.  I didn't ask if they had forks, knives, spoons, but I was thinking about it.  When we left, we were the only patrons.  I wonder if Gangnam BBQ will be able to dial up their food to match the good service and beautiful interior.  I will be rooting for them, but don't know how soon I will be rushing back.

g5Kqc_FpTDqxoV00_n3hug.text: They opened pretty recently so we were the only folks there for awhile. Their sauces (ponzu, sweet, or spicy) are yummy, but even if you're not a fan, their meat is perfectly marinated already (we got the bulgogi). All the waiters/esses are super cute and helpful, and they will notice if you are leaving your meat on the grill for a long time and adjust the fire level for you accordingly. The cheese wontons were delicious, and so was the honey pancake. Although, don't expect it to be textured like western pancakes- it is much sweeter, stickier and eggier.

6k_uc847sNMZ7iSUZrC1Mg.text: Great food and service. The bulgogi is very tasty and the skirt steak is delicious. Looking forward to coming back again.

Lh9CJmfyqvvQrV9IRMooYQ.text: Excellent food, the meal for two can actually feed four. We WILL return next time in Vegas.

Nh3bjfc2KuKE3cFihUEv0Q.text: Came in with no reservation but still got sitted down right away on a Saturday night. The athmosphere is great. Really clean, there's music, but not too loud, just right.  The menu is extensive and it's a la carte  style. The prices are worth it. The meat is very high quality compared to some of the all you can eat kbbq  places. There's also a drink and spirits menu.  I recommend the marinated kalbi  steak, it's very tender and juicy. Also, try the bacon  wrapped sparagus, it's crunchy and crispy at the same time.  Very appropriate place for a date or a group gathering. Not recommended if you're single haha  The service was great, atleast 5 people came by multiple times to make sure that we were properly serviced. The staff was also friendly and easy to talk to and they explain the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VzB4umwPaBE4-zV4Cbsgvg.text: Pretty good.  Pros: Food quality is pretty good. We got the meat lovers amongst four and it was filling. Service was good but a bit disjointed.  Cons: Background music is terrible quality. Extremely distorted. The value for the food is not good. High prices for the atmosphere. Finally, they give you a free dessert if you rate them on Yelp. I'm not sure I like this since this inflates the reviews.

1r_-00oCN448JPJynMW9Mg.text: On my trip to Vegas on April 6th this place was next door to the hookah lounge we went to and decided to get some food here. The service was great. The food and pricing were amazing!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h3jn9yibBdk7Z4QUswA3Ww.text: First time eating this style of dining. Excellent experience both food and service :)

Qjg6-CIapw0OiyZmpKVUjQ.text: I was in town on a business and found this place by accident....am I happy with the food we had! The jalapeno poppers was excellent, the kobe beef was very tasty, and the bulgogi was full of flavor. I am not Korean but I  think  the food is pretty authentic based on the amount of the Korean clientele they have. I always love the little dishes they have for the accompaniment to the entree. On top of it all the price is very reasonable!! My friend and I will definitely come back next year.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e-b0G3NxfgctJlg5PMttiw.text: Really great service and high quality meats. Came here with 2 gfs and we were so full that we didn't eat the dumplings. The miso soup was a bit salty but I was surprised to see that there was quite a few small tofu pieces. Other places usually don't have tofu in their miso soup.   We ordered the meat lovers ($55.95) which is supposed to be good for 2 people. It came with 6 different meats. I wasn't a huge fan of the bulgogi but the filet was amazing. It literally melted in my mouth! If I come back, I'll just order the filet.   Side dishes were ok, nothing special. I wish they gave radish slices instead of tiny pieces of radish though.

BcDi4ble-JB43i-lNRAUVg.text: Got food poising from the eating the raw oysters and was in bed for two days straight! Also, you will come out smelling disgusting like you were working in a kitchen all day. This place is all hype! Pay a high price to cook your own food, yea no thanks. I rather pay to have someone cook my food and not smell like I was working in the kitchen all day. But seriously, the food poising is the only reason I writing the review.

VxvwJWilltN2y-AGgc_MXw.text: Wonderful Korean barbecue we had a great lunch I would highly recommend coming here and I would come back again and I am a professional chef
