IzZn6P0LHHXjPUmAYrF_Qg.text: Had the prime Kalbi, pork belly and harami miso.  Great food and good service... I'll come back when I'm in town.

doSUbK9EaWS5xpCNK3RN-A.text: The food here is fresh and tasty we ordered the beef platter and raw beef.  The food comes in 5mins later, I like how they grill the food for you which gives you time to enjoy the food.  I took out one stars because my server forgot to come back to turn the meat so it was a bit burn.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All small plates

jHK0XkCgdWZDtkFwQOxifg.text: I came here for happy hour (3-6pm, 10pm- close) based on all the great reviews. We called ahead to try to make a reservation, and were told that they don't take same day reservations but they weren't busy at the time so we came in anyways.   We ordered beef toro, bulgogi, pork belly, and mushroom medley. We also had the chicken wings, fried calamari, and jalapeno poppers for apps. Each dish was $4 with the exception of the mushrooms ($2). The meats were really good quality, and my favorite was the bulgogi which was really tender and had a great marinade. The chicken wings were average, crispy but pretty bland. The poppers were filled with cream cheese and salmon with a tempura batter. The calamari were okay as well, but the breading was disappointingly flavorless, much like the chicken wings. The dipping sauce that came with it added some much needed flavor to the dish.  The service was relatively spotty. We were seated immediately and our waiter took our order quickly. Afterwards however it was kind of difficult to get anyone's attention as the restaurant became more busy, so we had to flag down someone each time we needed something. Our appetizers also came out way after the meats, so we were pretty much done with our food by the time our last appetizer came out.  Also keep in mind rice is not included when you order dishes a la cartel for happy hour. It's $2 for a bowl and 1 bowl is enough for 2 to share.  I must admit though that I think the reviews for this place are somewhat inflated because they give you a free desert if you write and show them a posted Yelp review. To avoid the inevitable awkwardness associated with showing your server an low or average review and the fact that you are getting a free desert, I feel like people naturally give this place a higher review than they normally would. Definitely wouldn't expect this place to be averaging 4.5 stars.  Overall Gangnam Asian BBQ is a solid restaurant for your Asian BBQ fix while in Vegas.

n-hFTUDlnMOs6n1k401Oyg.text: What an abundance of delicious food for the discriminating palate!  There was Filet Mignon,  Flat Iron Garlic Rib Eye, Brisket,  Spicy Pork, you name it!! An incredible assortment.  Not to mention a very tasty Chicken Fried Rice to balance out the meats. Definitely come with a hearty appetite and even then, you won't be able to finish.  Great food, great speedy service, and even some great happy hour drink deals.  5 stars without a doubt!

kuzaZ-XdW-PfJule5KE_1A.text: Great BBQ, decent prices. Just do yourself a favor and do not order Kobe Beef- its really not worth the money. Every other meat on the menu is way better.

yqqUmuBDJbJHYqBGNx2Oug.text: Ehhh... found this place mediocre for an Asian BBQ experience. I was really iffy on going here because it was a fusion of both Japanese and Korean. Off the bat, I already felt like it wasn't going to be an authentic food experience. But I got there at the time of happy hour that started at 10 pm so I said, why not?! To start off I got a salad and tried their tteokbokki. The salad looked very different from the one picture on the menu. It had bitter lettuce, which I try to avoid in a salad at all cost. As for the meats, we tried their brisket (Toro?), bulgogi, and pork belly. I found that the meat was cut too thick, which made it difficult to bite through. On the upside, the staff was really nice and accommodating. Oh! And if you check- in, you get a free ice cream, which was a nice treat!

1d9I1sFzel_q7ief2WpjmA.text: I came this place a couple days ago and I came here today with my gf again. we are from NY and We really love this restaurant. I will miss this restaurant !!!!

wn7Zb0dVFZ7ZJ_CUvOowKQ.text: Food & service was decent. A bit pricey, also as a spoiled San Jose resident, I felt like it was a copy of Gyu-Kaku. Even the chili dumplings tasted the same. I like GyuKaku so I definitely like this place! Favorite is still harami!!!

PjFgML7jChEW4U81SN7Krg.text: Really great food, here, and I'm not really a big "Korean food" guy. I've never had such tasty raw oysters, and I'm from the south! The bibimbap was also really good, usually very bland at restaurants. Only knocking a star off for the K-Pop-wannabe server guys, all trying to act cool and barely acknowledging our existence. Also, the weird knock-off rap videos on a projector (the songs were real, but I don't think it was really the artists...looked like some celebrity look-alikes); just didn't get how this fit in a place like this. The food made me forget all that, though!

12v41ihbigxjgpipo-MNIQ.text: Service is excellent. This is a self cooking only korean q joint. They have a variety of meat. The meat lacks a little flavor from the normal korean q places. Not a whole variety of the sides you see from a traditional korean place. Enjoyable but not 5 stars.

IqovI_mTlHWL0DQZeAMBzg.text: One of the worker will stop by to get your name on a list when you walk in. The wait was about 20 mins for 2 of us (There were 4 parties ahead of us) We got sat on a huge table towers the back. We decided to order individual items since I didn't like everything I saw in the combos. It was a great choice because we got to try everything we wanted. Nothing went to waste.  Our favorites: beef bulgogi, spicy pork, enoki bacon. The flat iron garlic was good, meat was very tender but lack in flavor. They do give you 3 dipping sauces for your meats.  We also got the Korean marinated short rib. Flavor is similar to the beef bulgogi, meat was tender.  For the price difference I would just stick with beef bulgogi at $3.95 instead of the other two mentioned above that cost $8.95.  Sides included: cucumber, Kim chi, sweet onion/daikon, weird spicy noodle dish (not our fave), Mac and cheese salad. Husband ordered the steamed egg, it looks really big but not as fluffy and airy like the one from Tofu Hut.  I ordered the house salad. I liked the variety of mixed greens and cherry tomatoes, Lao came with an egg cut in half. The dressing sauce had a hint of orange citrus flavor, yummy.  Service was decent. They switched the grill out as soon as it was black.   Stick with the marinated items if you like flavor in your meats.   Our total came out to be $58.   Will definitely return.

hBihBdsZJMpv0_sU8_H0aw.text: Love me some bbq grilling! everything and smelled delicious! We ordered the meat lovers for 4 took advantage of the happy hour and ordered a side of broccoli and mushroom medley and the amount of food was plentiful! The only downside was it seemed the grill wasn't oil'd enough, we kept having to ask to get our grill changed-- which they were very efficient in doing. However, I've been to other bbq places and don't ever recall having to swap out grills that much.   Also, we checked in on yelp and got a free green tea macaroon and OMG(!) it was worth every bite!   Great food, great service! Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

qSYEzUl_uiVOR5bkmHsibQ.text: My friends and I were really in the mood for Korean BBQ and Gangnam did not disappoint. We were a party of 7 and they did not have a table big enough with 2 grills to accommodate us so they split us. We ended up right next to each other so it was not a problem. Three of us got the meal combo for 4 and it was plenty of food! We had slight issues with the grill turning off during middle of cooking but the servers were attentive and fixed it right away. Overall, it was a great experience with good food.  P.S. if you check in on Yelp, you can get a free macaroon ice-cream sandwich.

SAs-q9hJn4ION5DMsV13fQ.text: Came with a big group of 12 hungry eaters, left stuffed!  Great BBQ!  Got way more Food than expected.  Very happy with the quality and the service.  We will be back!

s46zL6E6yvYEk8g_Yitv0g.text: Delicious meats and sides. Wonderful people there. Super friendly and accommodating. We had a party of 20. 10 kids lol they're family friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber Kim Chee

Rh-uZmTHuHzbVwQCyMWQJg.text: When you get tired of American food and suddenly craved for a good Korean meat, this is the place to be!   Service was excellent and even though we waited for about 6-8 minutes we're so comfortable in the waiting area while listening  their kpop music hehe!  We ordered a set and its craaaaaaaazy to get a lot of order for 2 heads but nah!! We didn't mind since it's really good! Think we tried 4-5 kinds of meat along with these yummy sides (too many to mention) but the best is their korean meat!  It's out in the strip but come visit! Hype is real!  *check into your Yelp and get a macaroon for free!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yumyum!!!

QrPS-WrdyORhV1Mtg2Oifg.text: It's a really cool place to hang out with friends and cook your own meats . The food is really good and not that pricey. Also, their happy hour is super amazing. Highly recommended!!

bo0i_iGd_Bw745igvfrUEQ.text: Delicious Korean BBQ! The two of us went Friday night around 6 PM and were able to sit at a table immediately; however there was already a good line forming by the time we left around 7:30 so get there early! We opted to order dishes a la carte instead of getting a combo which ended up saving us money and we didn't have to waste side dishes we didn't even want. My favorite dish was the bulgogi (SO good) and my husband's was the beef toro. We ended up spending about $45 plus tip and both of us left STUFFED! I will say our waiter wasn't overly friendly or attentive but he did offer to replace our grill halfway through which we appreciated. Get the free macaroon (I got the strawberry which was delicious)! We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Macaroon

pF7BInQirPbLWjAznsIL1g.text: My family went here during our visit to Las Vegas. This isn't AYCE KBBQ but is well worth it and basically the same price as AYCE. One thing I didn't like is that they don't have any rice paper.   The meat is well marinated and so yummy!! They're very generous with the portions and the quality of the meat is well worth.  I would definitely get the sweet corn cheese to eat with meats.   The banchan selection was alright but I might be biased since SD has so many kbbq places with different banchan selection.   The service was average. It wasn't that busy but we had to flag down the waiters if we wanted a refill on drinks or a grill change. We felt very rushed to order. The waiter basically wanted us to order 1 min after handing us the menu.   Check in on yelp and get a free macaroon ice cream! The strawberry one is the best. The matcha taste way too artificial.

4IbI9Ce8lOjnXq9Y53OYFQ.text: I highly recommend Gangnam Asian BBQ. You really get a lot of food!!! I'm greedy, so I was extremely happy. One of the things I enjoyed most was cooking the meat on the grill at the table. It was a lot of fun, especially with a group of friends.   I also enjoyed all of MANY side dishes that are served with dinner. They were delicious :)  Don't forget to order ice cream macaroon. OMG!!! It was soooooo good. I think I ordered three of them and ate every bit of it.   The prices are also very reasonable for all of the food they serve. Great service!!

3c98v7NSFabL4br_t8BT8A.text: We are regulars for a few years!! We love the staff, service, atmosphere, food, price EVERYTHING!!

9sev6Im5KIaV0Rof9EGtiw.text: So good. Order the Bullgogi!! One of the best dish's on the menu. Great value. We visited Vegas for 2 nights and came back 2 times. It was that good!!

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jPDFH1PPjcLlBTLGwYFv-w.text: This spot was recommended by some of my best friends, so we decided to have lunch here. This is definitely not the best in town in regards to meat quality for korean bbq. The meat platters are very small and the combos are not very good. The side dishes (banchan) lack quality and quantity, and most of what they offer are bland or lack much authentic korean flavors.   The prime beef kalbi was alright at best and the pork belly was super skinny in its cut. The pork belly was cut like the chadol, which to me was not worth getting. The pork toro (equivalent to jowl) was quite tough and seemed to be not too fresh. definitely cut different from other places we have been to and enjoyed. The food was not very good, but it was not terrible. But, for the price, I would definitely recommend going to 8oz korean bbq steakhouse, goong korean bbq, hobak korean bbq, or even magal korean bbq. I definitely prefer those spots for quality service and quality food (plus, they cook everything for you as a service courtesy). The service here does not encompass the servers cooking for the table. Overall, I think the experience was very lackluster.   From the start of the meal, we had some issues with the table, and the servers had to move us to another table because of oil and water dripping from the fan system above that contaminated my beer, garnishments, and rice. It kind of took my appetite away completely.   I will say though, the customer service here is quite good. Everyone is very attentive and the manager, Patrick, definitely seems to care about the consumer experience. Eric and Dylan were super attentive, friendly, and considerate. I appreciate your customer service recovery standards gangnam. The service was a 5 star experience for sure, but because yelp is a cumulative for me on the complete experience for dining, I have to be honest and give you guys 3 stars in totality.

bFS-Blr5l2DJTHfQdhn5CA.text: I had never tried Asian bbq up to this point in my life. I had researched the ones around town and settled in trying this one. First, I called to make a reservation. They only take reservations for parties over 8 people. So we hoped for the best as I heard it gets busy at night.   Saturday night we get in around 530 and it's already pretty packed but there was a table available. Unsure of what to expect, we took a gander at the menu and agreed upon the Las Vegas for 2 because it was a smaller option, it had chicken and it seemed like a lot of food still.   All the sides were brought out and arranged all over the table. Nothing was explained to us nor did they feel the need to at least tell us what we may eating. So before I asked, I began sampling. Some stuff I knew right off what it was, others I wasn't quite sure and I couldn't quite figure it out. I finally asked and found out I had eaten fish cake! I thought it was tofu or something, I don't typically like seafood and although I'd eat no more after knowing, I can't say it was bad. So then they brought out our miso soup and rice. I loved the soup! Next we got our meats and some veggies and wantons(I could have devoured a dozen of those).  I felt the whole situation was rather unsanitary but we tried to be as careful as possible and not cross contaminate....I'm happy to say, three days later that I did not get sick. The spicy chicken was my favorites of the meats, followed by the beef toro. I liked the dipping sauces, but again no explanation of what they were and they were in a black dish...kinda hard to tell what it is. Finally, we checked in on yelp and received the complimentary macaron ice cream sandwiches, yum! We got green tea and mango.   All in all, the food was good but I felt like we wasted so much. I would have probably given 5 stars but as I said, nothing was explained AT ALL. For those of us new to this kind of dining, it would have been nice.

YSMf9iqQsuZ-0vnZb7dnBw.text: Real great service, food was great, bulgogi and rice was just like back in korea. Everything from the kalbi beef to the Kobe short ribs. The best korean restaurant in las vegas

TWf8t8jXgufjTt2znYZWZg.text: I feel this place deserves five stars, I also preface my review with the fact that I have limited Korean barbecue dining to compare it to, while visiting Las Vegas some friends and I stopped in for a dinner. The location was convenient, and the food was worthy of a review.  This location could work on: better customer experience as far as employee friendliness goes. We felt that our waiter was A little on the curt side with us, and was not going out of his way to make sure we were having a nice experience at the restaurant. Granted, everyone is allowed to have a bad day now and then. We just felt that it would've made the experience that much better.   As far as price goes, the price point of most menu items were fair. We would have liked to see a greater variety of side dishes available, and we would have liked a more regular refill on them.  What this restaurant does well: Quality and taste the food is good, the atmosphere is rather charming, and the wait time was not too long. Parking is fairly easy and available, and the menu is big enough to give variety.

fmBDANPjdUnl935Uvz8Ulw.text: Amazing...the staff is superb, the food is fantastic,  I'm addicted!!!  If you come from 3pm-6pm ANYDAY their HAPPY HOUR will definitely make you happy...

ard7B-qi7Qllo90Yseunag.text: I wish I had the capacity to eat more than I did because even though I was waddling out of the restaurant I felt like I needed more food in hindsight.  Saying this place is good is an understatement when we dream of a KBBQ like this existing anywhere in Utah. If you can, bring friends or family to ensure more variety is shared among each other. Try all of the sides as well, especially the kimchi! Don't worry about portions, if you can finish everything by yourself then order more! You will only regret not indulging even further.

bKx1pijLSLmUkZj4ekGMWQ.text: Back again after a year and all is the same goodness it was a year ago.  Great setup, great food and the service is on point.   Coming from Boise, it was good to get an authentic korean bbq with the flavors I am used to!

z_Llw780-RjVc4sVXwkOLw.text: Wow this place was awesome! Found it on yelp and because it had so many reviews I just had to try it for myself. Didn't disappoint At All! We went during a weekday around 3 so it wasn't crowded, the server was very welcoming.   I think we ordered the whole menu lol we didn't want to miss out on anything. The calamari was great, the sweet corn, everything was great, too many things to mention. I wish we had a place like this in My hometown. Everything we tried was on point, my honey doesn't like the fact that we had to cook our things but I don't mind it all. He was so thankful that I found this place that he didn't mind the cooking at the end of lunch lol. Also, yelp perk! we got free ice cream macaroon . usk1FLXNme9RKO0Qz_X71w.text: Amazing food,  quite the selection.  My second time having Korean bbq, I will definitely return my next trip to Vegas.  Pork belly was the best!!

AZIg-JWG692jEk9kaUxlrQ.text: I loves me some KBBQ and since my family from Korea and I were in Sin City, I decided to try this place out. I typically like to do the AYCE for KBBQ but this place had such high ratings, I felt it was worth my while. The flavor of the meat was great and the side dishes were pretty darn good. We got ribs and pork belly and the usual meats. I have to say that it's a bit costly since each order is kinda small. Would I come back? I think I most certainly would.

BwTvDCBfouQNwCGZnE1HXQ.text: The food is not bad.  They give a large bowl of rice with the entrees.   I like that they let you grill your meats even with the lunch specials. I had Japanese noodles and some bulgogie bibimbab, and yoogaejang.

G3DwY3iDeEOccKmyWeb0Fw.text: Such a great end of my long work day.. Great service and bomb ass food! Decent price and free desserts if you rate then.. Hence why I am writing a review!

14Y7nQnnchocyGkY_weTVw.text: They have awesome food and Great service. The environment was quite lovely as well lovely. Highly recommend

CBBfstTpJO7O3w9gaMdnJA.text: I am always looking for authentic Korean BBQ places and this spot is my favorite by far! They have so many different options for sides (the steamed egg and ttekbokki are my favorites) as well as a delicious variety of meats. The happy hour is the best with 50% off drinks and discounted food options. Will continue to keep coming back!

IV78L018BLtbWvMPr_70tw.text: Coming in you're greeted by the delicious aromatic smell of Korean BBQ. We went in for a late lunch on a Saturday, so they weren't packed, by service was quick, very friendly, and helpful. Kristin was fantastic! We actually had two different servers ask for our drink orders within a minute of sitting down and they were both very patient while we perused their extensive menu.  They play a mix of pop hits from both the United States and Korea, and the music isn't too loud so you can still have a good conversation over the sizzling grill. They also have a TV over the bar for sports. Their tables come with the built-in grill with ample table space for dishes and elbows.   The food can be a little pricey if you want a lot, but the combos are easily enough for two meals. We got the Meat Lover combo for two and even after eating to our heart's (and stomach's) content, we still have plenty for dinner. It comes with many different meats (pork belly, spicy pork, bulgogi, garlic flank, filet, and brisket) along with other side dishes (rice, miso soup, seaweed salad, green salad, chili dumplings) and complimentary Korean starter dishes. For two meals for two people, it was not a bad price. Since you can grill it yourself to your liking, you can easily share even if your party has different preferences.  The bulgogi is to die for! It's extremely tender and bursting with flavor. The garlic flank was also very well marinated an flavorful. The spicy pork isn't too spicy, so even if you have a low tolerance for spiciness (I can barely stand medium salsa) you can still try it out. They also provide three different sauces for you to add to your food if you'd like but the food was so good as it was we didn't even touch the sauces. The pork belly and brisket doesn't come marinated so if you want it to have a little more flavor, I would suggest cooking a marinated meat (like bulgogi or garlic flank) then use the same area to cook the pork or brisket and you get a bit of the carryover.

gOT940hvtjyOetD8O0sbRw.text: So I'm so used to all you can eat kbbq so I wasn't sure if the food was actually gonna fill me up. Especially since it's a bit on the pricey side for two people. But, I have to say I'm a extremely satisfied! Everything was delicious! I especially liked the filet migon and beef toro.

LXVDEEBLxJSIIhf61A-SBg.text: Great food!! Had the Gangnam set, said it was for 2 people, but it fed all three of us without having to order anymore! It was deeeeelicious!! I can't believe this is only steps away from my overnight hotel.

M6PSWtWoyy06ypYmXIwIMg.text: This place is the korean version of Gyu Kaku. We got the meatlovers set and it was all pretty tasty! Their beef dishes were super tender which is a plus. Def try the beef toro and garlic flat iron if you were to order individually. Its better than gyu kaku because there's ban chan. The service was friendly and they were super attentive. Our waiter in particular was super sweet and funny. We'll be back Gangnam, Thanks!

duP-vnuqpHZjFUqcydMYcg.text: Pretty good food, generous serving sizes, good prices, and excellent service. Here are the foods I've tried:  Bulgogi: sweeter than authentic bulgogi Original Bibimbap: AWESOME! Comes in a flat hot stone plate. Huge serving with lots of meat. Soy bean paste stew: Yum! Tempura udon: Noodles and tempura were good but I didn't care for the soup. Shrimp Sukiyaki(?) Noodles: sweeter than expected.

IF_VP_qIafj1qFhxCivdYw.text: The food is great! Definitely one of the better Korean restaurants in town! The price is a bit more expensive but it's make up for in quality

e4h0-zgG2n_kiwumh9VrEg.text: Great service! Great food and the super clean restaurant. The staff was so attentive to our needs. The food was delicious ! I had had the bimbim bop and it was perfect.  The appetizers were small dishes with different types of kimchi. There was something for everyone's pallet .Will come back and revisit, when my husband and I come back to Vegas.

IwAFt4nhZGalZmKUJHa0gA.text: Inconspicuous little spot in a strip mall near the Las Vegas strip. The food was fantastic and the portion sizes were filling. Very reasonable priced entrees. The complimentary Kim chi sampler to start was a perfect way to begin the meal. The best part of this place is the service. The staff was attentive, courteous, and efficient. Overall one of my top 5 dining experiences in Vegas.

L8sW2oHeTAA-JDILg75AnQ.text: Great food, friendly service, great happy hour, fun environment. We especially liked the calamari and bulging for grilling. Highly recommend!

OtRGezjJxIAXTvZN_lrl_w.text: Food was great, but service lacked. They did not explain anything, and this was my first time to a Korean bbq. Still recommend.

MUlD6f1Z1wcK9bAfLooZrA.text: My sister and I checked this place out a few months ago based on Yelp reviews. We were pretty pleased with the food. Atmosphere was modern and fun as was the decor. Finding great Korean food is a challenge in and of itself but a place with good atmosphere, solid food, and pleasant service always makes for a great evening out. Happy to say that we will definitely be back. Thanks for helping these Korean girls get a little taste of home!

a7iLoyvh-aBc_2y6usGJ-A.text: Don't pay attention to the bad reviews. I suggest you go and take advantage of their happy hour/lunch specials; they have great quality meat. The interior is very clean, roomy, and low-lit (great place for a romantic meal). The tables are clean and it seems like they take real good care of the grills as well.  I have never heard of this restaurant since they opened and oh my god... I am so glad now that I have! First of all, as a student, I think the location is great! It is literally across the street from UNLV. On my first visit here (also my first time in an asian bbq style restaurant), I was quite confused with their menu, but my server, a lovely Filipino young lady, was very helpful. She took her time explaining the different combos that they offered. I ended up getting the Meat Lover combo, which came out looking very fresh. What I loved most is that it came with miso soup, a salad, a bowl of sticky rice, and 3 different sauces for my meat. On my second visit, I had the same Filipino server. It was also during their happy hour, so select dishes were up to 50% off. I had the Meat Lover again (I can't help it--I love my meat!).  If you are into asian bbq and are near the area, I would highly recommend trying out Gangnam.

t-7MsIOwdzpawSQXkqe1Qw.text: Cook-it-yourself concept. Japanese tapas. Generous free appetizers. Great menu. Top 3: bulgogi, kabocha squash tempura, and cream cheese wonton.

XazjdnDu0xuvYjhJaz2v1Q.text: Came here after a 5hr drive from Page,AZ and was definitely looking for somewhere to fill up our hunger. So being from LA, first thing to do was look for somewhere like KBBQ. And this place definitely filled that gap of hunger. True, it's not like LA's but it has good taste. Service was great and the food was satisfying. My recommendation would be to get the meat lover :D

IcFyq_YDE3O-T6Az3YmKfg.text: Good but not mind blowing. Satisfy the Korean bbq craving and price is really reasonable, but not worth going out of your way.   We got all the marinated beef, bulgogi, beef tongue, two marinated chicken, the pre-cooked mixed mushroom. You cook everything yourself. Marinated beef were the highlight; juicy and flavored well. The other things were unmemorable and the mushroom had no salt or flavor. Sides were average for a Korean bbq place. They had good looking but average tasting macaroon ice cream sandwiches (Read: macaroons are at least several days old) that they gave away for free if you check in on yelp.   Our server was friendly. However, no one came to change the grill even once during our meal which is a turnoff.

fR2XuAxknO9AcwugBudFUQ.text: If you're looking for good real korean bbq with great jjigae ... come here!  It's very reasonably priced and the service was great!   They also have macaron ice creams - a must have after a great meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6Y77UuVDUhKrUhe8jhLUIA.text: The BEST Asian/Korean BBQ!  Value and quality, with great service.  The Meat Lovers leaves you fully satisfied for $60. The sides that come with it are awesome!  Everything, including the dipping sauces were great.  I think we'll be back before this trip is over.

HvelKphlkENtQKjuAlqA8g.text: I have been here for a 5 days, and this is the restaurant with best service - even topping places where we spent $150pp. The food is amazing - great value and so yummy. I'm from NYC and really enjoyed cooking the food myself vs other places that do it for you. The grill was changed 3 times and everyone was very attentive. The drinks are on the low end - beers are $5-7 and mojotos and mixed drinks are $8. Gangnam special ($68 for 2 people) is one amazing deal - highlight being bulgogi! Next time we come back to LV, we will certainly check it out

dClMTYA73qVDaWozj2rTvA.text: The food was delicious, the service was prompt, efficient, and courteous. The price was quite good (under $40 all in for two people).   They have some interesting unique items on the menu (such as Korean chicken fondue). They also have a unique take on traditional favorites (such as kalbi).   Still all was delicious and nothing far enough from expectation to create issues.  Definitely a place I would go back to given the opportunity.

gCDYhdyoLBGRbp6zNdcEtA.text: This was my first Korean bbq experience and it was great! Loved it! Great location close to campus and great food!

XoqpXqL6qltf4ENTWfv26Q.text: This place was A1! When in Vegas finding a quality for a good price is next to impossible but Gangnam was just that. Gangnam is off the strip but located walking distance from the hard rock. Happy hour offerings were only ok, most deals only had a $0.50 discount.   Expect a wait, especially on weekends and at night. We showed up at 9:00 PM and were not seated till 10. There is essentially no room / area to wait so best of luck there.   However once being sat the food was really good! The kobe beef was amazing. The beef toro and pork belly were tremendous though. Personally, save the $23 on the kobe and just order a ton of $5 meats. The quality is amazing. Overall a really great, affordable, Korean bbq place in las Vegas!

3Pi8CqfzmD5A8ojgZAit9w.text: Awesome experience!  Tons of food, great value for the quantity and quality.  I will visit again next trip to Vegas.

qMcabGMhEZVkUnVqx747TQ.text: At first I didn't care for this place, but now I go all the time! I guess I didn't order the "right" things the first time. The best thing to order (if you like uni) is going to be the Kobe Saam and the Uni Bimbimbap. Yaaaaaas! And make sure the uni Bimbimbap's rice gets crispy! The BBQ is not bad either, I always order Beef Tongue and Duck Breast. The sides are pretty good, love the daikon and jalepeno, and Mac salad.  They are quick with service but very very attentive. I think the whole team here is amazing, everyone does their job really well even though it looks hectic or busy. I come here for the uni bimbimbap, soups (when I'm hungover), happy hour, and the impeccable services!

Yv_ixYMss3Bh1y5Cjoo17w.text: A KBBQ place with a happy hour menu! Very bang for buck and average service for a KBBQ place. It's not your 5 start Boucher restaurant but you get good service here. Wait time can be annoying but it is what it is.

m9vQ-Z94VjFqLpxgs7TWVQ.text: We got the prime meats for 2. Wasn't a big fan of the meat being plain. Would rather of had a marinade. Cool concept though.

SUL0Pt9eysbh2i-ynxhfbQ.text: Super delicious + filling meal with top notch service. We ordered the Gangnam meal for 6, which included so much food! Some highlights were the oyster, short ribs, and beef fried rice. After 10 pm they also have happy hour, so we got soju for half off. Overall a highlight of our Vegas trip and a spot I definitely would return to.

4ZvkW6S452wCbkui4Uw1Uw.text: Good meats. Good side dishes.   I've never had to wait very long here because I think they do a pretty good job turning over tables. Service is fine. I'm never expecting the best at BBQ places but this is pretty good.   It's just a really good value for your buck. Like, it's good food. It's made better by the fact that you aren't paying as much as you might at other places.

lBCElnWZ22puWdIyoOaZeA.text: The service is always SO great, they work as a team so you always have everything you need. Their HH is pretty legit and the quality and variety of food is better than most. Highly recommend as a local. They even changed out our grill so we could make the second round of bbq on a fresh surface.

DXh21tQhN5AHmlaPiuCEVA.text: Well you know, I had great things to say about this place but I find out today that they're dishonest! I just reviewed my credit card statement and see that they added more to the tip amount I gave them. Apparently they want more tips, so they just add to the charge slip - even though I clearly wrote in the tip amount and accurately added the tip to the total bill due.  So people, beware of this activity here. Keep your receipts and check your credit card statements. I do this diligently every month, so this is how I identify fraud. I have contacted American Express about this fraudulent charge.

sceBH18gc3fNVb4DYuKXPA.text: Outstanding, delicious Korean BBQ in Las Vegas!  Staff was friendly and accommodating to a group of 30 kids/adults, in town for a soccer tournament.  They were helpful, attentive and offered great suggestions for our food choices.  We loved the food...our favorites included:  filet mignon, marinated beef, side dishes and amazing dessert.  We enjoyed cooking at our own table and loved the entire experience!  Strongly recommend it for families, groups, etc.    5-star Koren BBQ...worth a visit!

aHYvYtrNtrs4csGWGIxoHQ.text: Came here on a Tuesday night with coworkers. We really enjoy this place. Probably our third time here and have really liked it all three times. Ordered a few different beef selections, along w / some shrimp. We had a group of nine and they handled us flawlessly, which was probably not easy as the group had probably had a few too many drinks! Will be back for sure!

Y_V9wn-oXpyDCOCkww9__w.text: My first time here. Everything awesome. Pork toro is my favorite. I'm sure I'll go back.

WOVGSYVQEgo5Siz4vT_rqg.text: I walked in by myself and without reservations and I got seated right away at the bar area. The welcome was courteous, so good start. The bar is not equipped to cook your own BBQ but the service is so fantastic that it make up for this small letdown. The quality of the appetizers was top, every dish was savory and I was served 7 small bowl of "starters" as well. Prices are decent unlike the Strip prizes. Again, the service was excellent as they work in teams, very efficient and therefore food was served hot.

ZAY5f0pPQXNZz9OZtE5fUw.text: awesome korean bbq spot off the strip. me and my husband were in a bit of a rush since it was our last day in town and the servers made sure to get everything out right away so we were able to finish our meal within an hour. we got the gangnam special for 2 people and everything was amazing!! the cuts of meat were very good quality and seasoned perfectly. it was my husbands first time trying korean bbq and he loved it after this experience. only wish we had had more time to slow down and really enjoy it more.  P.S. don't forget to check in on yelp for a free ice cream macaroon!

Ag9zefjqrjcYHzKb-U7JQQ.text: This place is the the best!  Would definitely come again!  Jin welcomed my family and I with excellent customer service.

3rmiclanaI6n85-wwGB_1w.text: Pretty good kbbq spot we discovered today due to my reservation at an Italian restaurant was cancelled last minute!  The selection is meats really makes this place stand out from traditional kbnq spots in Chinatown!  We ordered the Gangnam combo with included bulgogi bibimpab, 5 different meats, and side dishes (even oyster).  They also have happy hours from 3 to 6pm and then 10pm to CL.  Definitely a place to check out :)

This place was literally a block from our hotel.   We were greeted immediately and seated.   Everything we ordered was so good! We had the Marinated Beef Kolbi, Spicy Tofu Soup, Pork Belly and the Seafood Pancakes.  I love this place, not only because the food was AMAZING but also because it was very cheap!   KUDOS!!!

LlvrcnYLQ-0lxxHGOxearw.text: I have to say the food is not as good as the rating says. Spicy pork is not spicy at all and too sweet. Korean bean soup tastes like fermented beans? I really dislike its taste. And filet mignon is the most surprising. It's just so average and kinda weird, not marinated at all. After putting it on heat for a while, it came out dry and tasteless.   Side dishes are also terrible, this is absolutely the worst Korean bbq place I've been too.

sRUSSL9N8TQeiKddO7B1mA.text: We came here for lunch. This place has a modern Asian decor and the smell from the food on the grills as you walk in will make you hungry. We ordered the seafood pancake and the "Gangnam." The side dishes were tasty and authentic. The meats were fresh and marinated well. The staff worked as a team to provide fast and friendly service. Overall a great experience...

jObbJxqP2AkSCEI80LlPAA.text: Soft tofu chigae is pretty nice! I'd like to visit next time. I caught a cold and I feel better after eating this.

ma2P-lQp0_tyR9LV8Bnr1Q.text: Excellent food- it's hard to find in shopping center because the sign isn't bright ( next to insomnia cookies). Great bonchon and great service.  Pass on the calamari - it's not flavorful and unless u grill like a rock star, it will be over done. Steamed egg was delicious!

zsXD4stHEVRIxuUX7IO_pQ.text: Hello, meats!   - Menu was straight to the point and the bundled offers made it easy to make a decision. - Quick Uber from the strip!  - At the time (January 2017), their check-in offer via Yelp was for a free ice cream macaroon...oh.so.good.

LT3Y9P62ZdIM_RmGdUdrIA.text: The food is wonderful! Got the Kobe beef, bulgogi, Korean galbi w/ broccoli, corn, & bulgogi bibimbap. Comes w/ 6 banchan, all delicious! 7 minute Lyft ride off the strip, but well worth it! Free macaron ice cream if you check in through Yelp!

bLaDVlwmnfmBURkLY0PT0w.text: In A Nutshell:  -We had an urge for Korean food after watching Anthony Bourdain eat galbi jim on TV in the hotel the previous night and Yelped "korean" spots in Vegas (surprisingly there were A LOT of choices) -As you guessed it correctly Gangnam Asian BBQ was our pick. -We came at lunch and it was easy to find.  It's located in a shopping plaza next to a tattoo parlor. -They have a nice selection of combos and tapas.  We went w/ the Gangnam combo which in the end was too much food (and I hate wasting food, but didnt want to walk around with a backpack smelling of KBBQ).  I think the bill came out to around $75 including the tip.  Overall, its a nice restaurant with nice servers and you definitely will be full :)

PtiGNYfFoL970yM8RquHOw.text: Tasty fresh food, great atmosphere, and fun hip-hop videos on the back wall. Food quantity is insane. We gorged ourselves and still only got through 70% of the food. The Korean rice is amazing.

z4KJoZ710RyfF0e_HkimtQ.text: This place is pricey but amazing. I was blown away by the food and the service is fast. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting Vegas.

tzZWU71WI-lvWepNKyD9zQ.text: Got to Vegas late and decided to Uber there based on the high Yelp reviews.  Got there close to 10pm and the place is rather empty.  Overall is a okay meal.  Nothing seems to be memorable.  The kimchi  rice is NOT kimchi fried rice at all.  It tastes more like teriyake fried rice.  My kids love it.  It's nothing compared to K-Town bbq down in LA.  I would think Vegas would have better Korean BBQ than this.  If you are close-by, it's worth for a meal.  But if you need to Uber there, it's not worth the trip.  There are plenty other options on the Strip.

jNCOHSSbMHLSEacqphSN5w.text: Hidden gem in off the strip! Great place to come for a fun date night or a group celebration! Lots to choose from! The bulgogi and pork belly were my favorite! Definitely coming back!

InCZ6t3dQs3J3VdrEqhX0A.text: Pretty ok. Ordered the beef toro which is just a fancy way of saying cha dol. galbi and Kobe beef. All just ok. But really doing this review for the free macaron ice cream!!! The coffee macaron was so good.

468HC1jGbBjm6Q-2oszRTQ.text: Its a great korean BBQ restaurant,the meat and the oyster are really fresh. There are many different choices for 2 people or more, and the price is not high.

t7KZ9Mfv18SyA3-bK0vmMQ.text: I love this place. The food was fresh and high quality, the beef and pork were very soft and tasty, even the sides such as kimchi was so good. The price was acceptable, the service was professional since they were very organized and their movements was so quick in order to serve a large amount of customers who were waiting outside. My family came here twice, and we had to wait around 30-45 minutes, but it was worthy. I would recommend for everyone to come here at least once to try it.

gucCxR84SyYT9Olu29_AUA.text: They should be honest about the waiting time. We were told the waiting time is 20-25min when we came in, but in reality we have been seating here waiting for an hour, and there are still several groups in front of us. If they have told us we need to wait for more than 1 hr we would choose a different restaurant to eat.

246V_nCWdoFGUMEhmsqomw.text: We all liked that it closed late. We tried the corn, beef bulgogi, beef tongue, beef Korean prime rib, mushroom they were all very good. The calamari, fried chicken, and chicken fondue was ehh ok.  The servers were all very nice. The atmosphere was very inviting. Very clean and loved the music videos that was playing in the background.  It is off strip, but some of Vegas best foods are off strip. =)

8cqOQAVzHgLZbRdk_XMnAQ.text: The food is great and very well priced. My wife thought her filet was not the best quality but I thought it was fine. For the price you cant beat it. I would come back for sure.

hUVe7yUlteMcfDLNZwgyrQ.text: This was my first Korean style barbecue place where you grille the meet yourself. For $70 bucks they bring a lot of sides and great prime cuts of beef and marinated pork. Other than that, I will recommend this place.

We never had to call our waitress because they were always checking on us. I never had to ask for a refill. Once we were done, they gave us our check and we are out in a minute after that. ua6KD3uptA-RTHmtR_TbwQ.text: Went here tonight, and really enjoyed it. I loved how the wait staff explained everything to us. We've been to other Korean places where they don't explain a thing. However, in those places they end up cooking the food for you, whereas here you're left to do your own thing. The miso soup was by far the best miso soup either my husband or I had ever had. The meat selections were good, but we were left craving some other cuts we've had at other places. Not their fault, maybe ours for not knowing. Would recommend this place to others, but the one down side is that their exhaust fans aren't as strong, so you'll leave with the smell.

xSKFkPqHt7BH32qTxRi4Uw.text: All kind of the BBQ food are really yummy. I would say here is the best Korean BBQ restaurant in Vegas that I've known with the best prices.

K89SwWZn78VvrttMoJrmkw.text: Great food. Mod interior. Off the strip yumminess. All the Korean BBQ fixings. Fast service. Hot grill ( for newbies, you grill your own fixing at your table). MCpanqS1X2NliMSYcZX-1A.text: Cannot go to Vegas without going to this restaurant. As a matter of fact I went twice in 5 days on my last visit. The food is fantastic and it is a fun experience. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Make sure to try the ice cream macaroons before you leave!

GfZ0-Rixit77YRHOx3hQ5g.text: Customer service here is not so great, but the food is bomb!  The server didn't bring us out beer, he was rude, snatched the menus from us after ordering. We didn't tip him because he was a jerk! We however did tip another server personally for bringing us our beer and checking on us.   The 4 's is only for the food! Customer service is -4 .

Jhz_xzCYIli3IIvHIOTQEA.text: We tried Gangnam for the first time for a late lunch/early dinner, after we swam for 50-minutes at the UNLV SRWC's lap pool. Needless to say, my hubby and I were famished, since all we had the entire day were coffee & one Kind bar, lol!   We ordered the "Gangnam" BBQ package for two for $65.00, which came w/ five different cuts of marinated beef (i.e., filet mignon, Kobe, etc.) with the following accompaniment:    two bowls of white rice, one big bowl of spring-mixed salad w/ light vinaigrette dressing, four pieces of quartered sweet corn (raw; to be cooked on the Korean table-top grill), mushroom medley, fresh slivers of garlic, and jalapeno slices, SIX Korean side dishes (i.e., Kimchi, spicy pickled cucumber, macaroni salad, spicy pickled bean sprouts, etc.), and two bowls of miso soup.  All of the aforementioned accompaniment were flavorful, fresh, and DELICIOUS. :D   The price was stupendous for all of the foods that came with the package, not to the mention the 10% discount we received for showing my UNLV student ID (GO REBELS!). Albeit, the amount of food seemed superfluous, but there is always the to-go box for the next day.

GsjPDOehq-p5pUAfCnxdnA.text: Best food we have had in Las Vegas. Servers are very friendly. The spicy pork and marinated Korean Kalbi are delicious.

3NvHyy1SxaYclRCnT2bGig.text: This was one of the best Korean BBQ places I have ever enjoyed. Our server was very accommodating and funny. He also helped us understand the menu because it does look intimating and confusing. Our server was very helpful in helping us pick items off of the happy hour to cut costs and still get a good amount of food. My group of 5 came in at about 10pm and were seated in about 10 minutes just in time for happy hour! We were excited to eat after a whole few days of traveling on sandwiches and road trip food.. We came hungry! I can't exactly tell you what we ordered after enjoying several bottles of happy hour soju.. but our bill was very, very affordable for a group of 5. So, I highly suggest happy hour if you can. I also recommend the flavored soju. :)

W_7ceHHVNXt11fvztNwlVQ.text: **D-D-DON'T BELIEVE THE HYPE**  Umm, how on Earth did this place get 4.5 stars?!  Took a taxi here from the Strip.  PARKING ======= Packed strip mall.  AMBIANCE ========= Videos of hip hop and K-pop. Dark and limited booth seating. Staff was friendly enough.  FOOD ===== LUNCH FOR 2 - GANGNAM COMBO - $65 Yes, that's a lot of food and pricey for 2 people at lunch (in East LV, more or less).  MEATS Favorite was the prime kalbi - everything else was tough. RATING: 3/5  Favorite was their BEEF CARPACCIO.  RATING: 4/5  BANCHAN Not super fresh (I'm spoiled in LA) and underwhelming, except for the tofu and salad. RATING: 3/5  RICE AND MEATS Decent and delicious with fatty bits. RATING: 4/5  BEVERAGE ========= HOUSE SAKE (COLD) OK, at best. Not smooth. RATING: 3/5  SERVICE ======= Felt somewhat rushed at times. Never refilled any of our banchan. The guy kept coming back and forth after we told him  that we were hanging out for a bit and pacing ourselves. There was no line, no people waiting, I didn't understand the rush. RATING: 3/5  OVERALL ========= Does not hold a candle to LA's KBBQ joints. #sorrynotsorry CANNOT BELIEVE how many people gave this place 5 stars.   NOT RECOMMEND, if you're that drunk, eat pho instead. Cheaper and better.

nAvnJ7Fh6FlhNtTFp1OnJA.text: First timer here!!! We flew into Vegas this am and wanted a good dinner! Found this on top restaurants and boy oh boy they did not disappoint! My husband and I got one of their combos for 2 and it's was plenty!! We surely thought it would be waaay to much food, but it was too delicious to stop eating! Trust me when I say this place was amazing!!! The ambiance, efficiency and freshness were just a name of the few things this great place had to offer! Yum, fun and cool! Wish we had this back home in Florida! Try it!!!

FOAkYh4mYgJUC02FMHJDSA.text: We came here with a group of 9 and they were able to get us seated fairly quickly during Happy Hour. There's plenty of options for banchan (side dishes) as well as main BBQ meats and vegetables. They have my favorite tteokbokki and fishcakes. If you check in on Yelp, you receive a free macaroon ice cream sandwich which was nice. I didn't try it but everyone else in the group seem to enjoy theirs.   The place is clean but a little small, so if you decide to stop by with a large group... make sure to call ahead or you could end up waiting. It's located in a little strip plaza across the street from Hard Rock.

gMu9ziEdNyJpSWqIgDqjBA.text: Great Korean BBQ without the expensive price. Everything was great and the customer service was even better. If you are craving Korean BBQ and are in Vegas I definitely recommend this place. Also avoid the overpriced restaurants in the strip by driving a few miles away and enjoying this Korean BBQ experience.

ErNRuMpSB--I9jsAGXFVTg.text: This place is great. Several time to this places when im in vegas and it never disappoints. Staffs and servers are courteous and of course. The food is AMAZING!!!!

wfFjrymld9sRkPTZ3bL2_Q.text: Wow...like wow...  We were treated to dinner here by a colleague during a recent convention...and wow...  Before we had gotten there, they had already ordered...some type of premium platter that feeds ~6 people...it could have fed 6 villages...  I am not sure if this is all in the platter, but this is what we had...  Salads that were, despite us not wanting to waste any stomach space on salad, we're surprisingly light, well dressed and well balanced--a very nice starter.  8 different kinds of Pan Chan...sprouts, fish cake, delicious cabbage Kim chee, perfectly crunchy cucumber Kim chee, and more..  Hawaiian Poke style ahi tuna--this was good, but there was too much other great stuff  Half shell oysters...probably the only imperfect part of the meal...not much flavor from the oysters or the toppings..  Beer  Kobe beef Carpaccio was a great way to open the main portion of the meal and was probably one of my favorites of all great things we ate  Kobe Style Beef that melts in your mouth like butter...to die for...the best part of the meal  Kal Bi perfectly marinated and as tasty as any Korean BBQ I have had  Beer  Filet mignon cubes...so tender!  Flank steak thinly sliced and delicious..  Beer  Scallops and Shrimp freshly prepared  Ice cream macaroons for dessert...strawberry, coffee, green tea, mango, maybe a few more, but by then, I was so far into food coma heaven, it didn't really matter.  There may have been some other things, but at this point, you either get what I am saying or not...one or two more dishes isn't going to make a difference :-P  Even living in the Bay Area with all the great Korean food, I would be hard-pressed to find a place to top this one...  A resounding 5 stars and I can't wait to go back!  VERY Happy Eating!

Cf03cmd5XL2sJsVzZ5rPPg.text: The flavor is never less than amazing great job! Ask for Dillan when you come in great service!

jh051iF5YqyRB9v-Va0tRQ.text: We were here for a wedding celebration and service was great. The food was also delicious!

vtyYm1lizjHcqSxPm33WoQ.text: 1st time here. Nice little spot in a strip mall close to the strip across from Hard Rock Hotel. No waiting.  Excellent service. Traditional Korean BBQ at great price.  Must try macaroon ice cream in a variety of flavors. Nice assortment of deserts. I also ordered chocolate lava cake and banana tempura.  Will stop by next time in Vegas.

7rNR8KPUmOHGTkFq1q8fLg.text: Nice decor...loved the grills..not as smokey as the normal korean bbq places. The meats were good quality. Nice change of pace compared to the all you can korean bbq places. The waiters were very helpful and attentive. when I lived in the OC. I would have korean bbq once a week in Korea town. Gangnam reminds me of the good old days. The bulgogi was tasty. The fried calamari was perfect. The Kolbi is superb, but the filet mignon was orgasmic.

There was a variety of vegetables. They ran out of oysters but I had a choice to pick something else. I got the salmon.  Bruno Mars was playing on the big screen in the back. I'd def come back here again. Very good!

Never did I see my server  she literally cane to take my order and that's only cus I had to go get someone, I ended up ordering 2 waters that I never got I ended up having to ask a different server. XbdNnPfU0MYn6bbNQ7S6Qw.text: Went here based on the reviews on yelp. Very different and good. It's a pretty small restaurant across the street from Hard Rock. Customer service was on point. Lots of people there to serve you. Food is served to you raw and you cook on a gas grill in your table. They different items you can choose from Al la carte or as a group special. The specials are for parties of 2 or 4, we had a party of 3 and ordered the Premium and that was plenty of food for us. defiantly worth try.

KTlE5lMHmEK8nA3SMib3Ag.text: Great bulgogi! Came in for happy hour! Quick, courteous service...lots of side dishes and good food! Recommend coming in for the happy hour specials

runAfBZ1iuIk45s-ml8g8w.text: Service is terrible. Took forever to bring us water and took forever to come and take our order. We asked for a scissor before we start eating and it never came even after 2 times reminding them. The foods are fine. Mostly likely would not come again.

ySAZOM2wXxk9HB7qJZkuAA.text: Great food. Especially liked the spicy pork and kimchi. Great selection of drinks. Next time I am definitely coming for happy hour.

SQf9Xn9hstwEyvhf4Yfw1Q.text: Good stuff beef was pretty great . Seafood pancake was also unexpectedly impressive. Lots of food for a good price

FYmK0UaAotk-L5bCI8qJQA.text: Really cool experience. The staff was very friendly and made sure we were comfortable. It was also our first time coming to a Korean BBQ and they made sure we were knowledgeable on all the items and cooking the food properly.

Xx1NTuNde4xe7SZy5DO85A.text: This is a paradise for meat lovers!   So many choice of meat and seafood and veggie to BBQ!  Everything is so well marinated and flavorful.  The two of us opted out of the set menu and chose our own selection of meat.  The spicy chicken and pork have a good kick of spices but not over-the-top spicy.  I especially recommended the Korean style prime and bulgogi....well seasoned and incredibly tender.  All the side dishes are delectable.  Come early!  We came at 6pm on Wednesday and we waited 40 mins!

Finished the meal with an ice cream macaroon that hit the spot. Will come back when I'm in town. We need this place in Houston!

w0MFI2TI4ggTRZde-cUKsw.text: Great place! My boss set up our office yearly dinner there and it was delicious. They were very accommodating and friendly. The food was fantastic, steak, shrimp and the spicy tuna was delicious! I look forward to visiting again.

itPBAP7QONSVgDGNDI6l-A.text: No wait for lunch. Happy hour 50% off alchy.  Beef tongue, Kalbi, uni bimbimbap!!! Hella Bomb!  Free dessert with check in :)

kmUgnMlQzQKDAkfBc7bjXA.text: Pleasantly surprised by this little gem. Grabbed lunch to go while working in my hotel room nearby. It was within walking distance and had great yelp your views but I wasn't expecting much. When I went to pick up my food, which was ready in exactly 10 minutes, I was pleasantly surprised by the interior of this restaurant. It's really cute and clean inside you can't really tell driving by. I ordered the kabocha tempura and bulgogi bibimbap both were really tasty. The tempura was crispy and not greasy the sauce was flavorful. The bibimbap had a good amount of meat and a lot of flavor. I will dine in and try the barbecue next time I'm in town.

XjFKpDWpfGZfTb3JCwcBFg.text: Great Korean food in Las Vegas! I got the 2 person Gangnam meal with my teenage son, who was starving! Thus the food better be plentiful and spectacular. It came with an assortment of meats and appetizers. All the meats were tender, flavorful and the filet mignon was melt-in-your mouth good! The miso soup that came with the food package was too salty and the bulgulgi bib bim pap was too sweet for my palate. So I got the plain white rice.   The service was decent, but they were very rushed around because of the flood of people that came in. They could have used one or two more service people.   We'll be back!

TNU4K6fFTdkpL4xT0s7yjw.text: Most meat were over marinated, salty and loaded with MSG (except the pork toro and belly).  Meats are small portion and not of great quality as shown in the menu. At almost $7, they serve you 5 dead fucking shrimp that's not fresh at all.   $7 can get you a pound of good shrimp!!!!  "How the f they get 2280+ average 4 stars review then?"  they offer free desert if you write an review!

MfEjhn9DXbknrSMlDTAVOg.text: Slow service. This is around 2pm non rush hour  Ordered an Udon Tempura the comment is it's coming. It's coming. More like oops we forgot Edit: showed them this review to get free dessert (promo). I hope they didn't spit on it

wlKSlvvvi9vhIVE557mn4w.text: Phenomenal. We got the premium meat package and it's a bunch of food. I will be coming back again for sure. I think I'm going to watch some videos on how to cook each thing and which things go with what but even with no knowledge everything was easy and paired well together.

OUTAfocsCCx8PT-rTtBdKw.text: Ok....so I come to Vegas once or twice a year....mainly for my nieces basketball tournaments...we stay away from the strip, I don't gamble or drink - but I am a foodie.....  The last couple visits I've notice some Korean food spots open up...being an army brat and having an aunt who is from Seoul...(we're talking growing up seeing clay pots of veggies go underground to ferment) I have a pretty set idea of what Korean food should taste like. This place has it down! When I tried the bulgogi my eyes lit up! It's saltier than Kalbi as it should be (some places make it super sweet, albeit delicious - it's not the way I remember it)  Fish cake on point, Kalbi just sweet enough and all pieces of meat were very tender and high quality.

YYtg-5-LVFjOVxRKg_krEg.text: Such good food! Ive been craving it everyday since we ate here! And if you check in you get a free dessert! I wish we had this in Utah!

RFfIyeTzzNNLI8rnRnl5FA.text: We ordered Gangnam set. The chicken is really juicy and tender, but other items are actually too sweet that you hardly taste the meat and get sick of the sweetness really quickly. The soup and hot tea are not hot at all. Portion size is ample and can easily be for double the amount of guests they recomend. Among all the staff, only one of them is attentive and friendly. We ordered the honey toast which we waited for over 15 minutes and thought it would never be served. We also got the free deep fried banana for making this rate. I believe this is how they got all the reviews and good ratings because you have to show them the rate to get the free dessert! In conclusion, Gangnam is an up coming trendy restaurant with modern/urban feeling if that is what you are into, but as far as Korean food, I would rather spend my money at many other great selections around the city.

FrUBAlb1OyGCHKYUphWS_w.text: Love this place!  It's a great value and it doesnt compromise on taste.  I've never had something bad here.  You should definitely try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k0cfx_GMKl2SUXYBujjzGA.text: Place gave me way more food than I expected. A little pricey but it was definitely worth the visit.

Dlw7qlaCkeOsEytk_H4mfw.text: My bestfriend and I came to this BBQ place after we've gone to a Korean Spa. We thought it would be good bec. of how good the reviews seem to be... however, just like most Yelp Reviews... it was all hype. (I'm starting to think that the reviews are mostly fake).   First off, the host told us that we had about 35-45 min. of wait. So, my bestfriend and I decided we could wait for it. An hour passed, after checking in with the host, he now tells us that reservations come in first, before we get to sit. Since we've already waited for so long... my bestfriend didn't want to leave. So we waited another hour, for a total of TWO HOURS!   When we were finally sat on our table, we thought, Finally!!! Guess what? We had to wait an extra 30 min for a waiter/waitress to take our order and we weren't even in a hidden area!!! The person who were in line  five people after us even got their food first!!!   So I finally asked the host for help and he took our order and checked up on us. I don't know who our designated waiter/waitress was but there was this girl waitress who was giving us an attitude, slamming the lettuce order we've ordered on the table. We were just too hungry and to even bother paying attention to her.   The food was just like any other BBQ place. You cook your own food. As usual, they didn't marinate the shrimp and squid long enough for the flavor to cling when barbequed. The food wasn't worth the inconveniece.   I understand the long wait in line to be seated. I also would have understood if it would take a few minutes for food to get ready. However, it is absolutely not understandable when the waiter/waitress would ignore you completely; taking 30 minutes to take your order... when you were sat first. Then, needing to flag someone to take your order.  I actually felt bad for the host because he took our orders and was acting like our waiter... when that's really not his job to do. So we decided to give him the tip. (HOWEVER, upon giving him the tip he said he was actually the manager). Thus, I felt irritated all the way home.  As the manager it was his responsibility to ensure that guests are all attended to. I will never go back to this place again and I will advise other family members, group of friends, other government co-workers to completely skip this one. It's not worth the wait. Not worth the trouble. Food places are meant to be fun, relaxing, not troublesome.

b_G9Pr80WhsK1VnUQmTt0Q.text: Me and my husband came for date night and it was so delicious! We got the "las Vegas" options and we had tons of food. All the sides that came with it were amazing and we had no idea what some of them were. It was our first time at Korean BBQ and it was great. I also got the peach martini as well as the Apple cooler, both were so good and dangerous because you can't taste the alcohol. The one thing I wish the server would have done is explain the process a bit, as I said it was our first time so I wasn't sure how the meat needed to be cooked and etc. also didn't know what the sides were. I saw so many delicious looking things coming out of the kitchen to guests next to us and wish I would've gotten a bit deeper into the menu. However, the host told us when we come back he would order for us, which we are extremely excited about! We will be back.

gaQDN8fVgvUcZShDqCHiww.text: Great service. Great ambience. Clean. The meat is high quality and yummy. Prices are typical of most Korean BBQ's, which is a little pricey. The meats are separated in smaller quantities which give you the ability to order a nice variety of meats, without having to just stick to one or two or a packaged deal. It wasn't really crowded when I went, but I can see it getting crowded sometimes.

QIHxQh7K1P__8vPHJ3hH1Q.text: It was "ok". I wouldn't go back. The service wasn't anything above average and there is way too much competition to subject myself to mediocre servers...especially when they're located in the hood. It's gotta be worth it to get food in a sketchy neighborhood, and this isn't it.

ctOXbys5HDlE8NUsbz2rSA.text: Came here for lunch. Food was amazing and delicious. I would give this a 5 star because of the food but I have a hard time with my water glass sitting empty for awhile. Restaurant wasn't busy just don't like asking for refills. Definitely will come again!

0Gbmn_kT2i91W_pa6ZAh_A.text: We totally love this place. People care a lot about the food there making and it shows

ox-Gff8nBwxWCMm1LPHL0A.text: One of the best if not the best Korean bbq I've eaten at! The sides are really good, especially the sweet kimchi cucumber! I had the bulgogi bibimbap and it was phenomenal! You can check in for an ice cream macaron, which is also really good. I will definitely come back here.

0nTffMUNohePyHiYbv601g.text: Some people like their meat rare, some like it well done. Me? I like it Oppa Gangnam Style!  In all seriousness, this is the go-to Korean place of my Korean Vegas local friend so what more do you need?

TG83K3qlEwPq44LMQ7JThg.text: SO MUCH FOOD! All the little side dishes were really fun to try. The steak filet was my favorite. Our waiter was very helpful and even told us about getting the yelp app for a free ice cream mochi. A great hideaway amid hundreds of date spots in the city.

OLtbOkPmM1sYditRAnZHCA.text: Best tabletop grilling experience I've ever had! Quick service, polite staff, great meat selection and perfect wakame salad. Order the Premium and split with friends (up to six people) for best price and fare. Be sure to check in for free ice cream!

YBd3iU1e8xd8hA0-5Rxwhw.text: Food was great and so was the service!  Will definitely add it to the "when in Vegas" list :)

3vMpXPanLv-IVndHqEev5g.text: Food is outstanding but nothing compared to the customer service!! The varitey of meats, veggie, fried items and desserts is incredible. Service is easy quick but incredibly friendly. Definitely coming back anytime I'm in the Vegas area!

The quality of meat is high and the flavor is good but there is nothing that makes this place really stand out from other KBBQ places in the area.  We ended up spending about $40 each which is more $ than a good AYCE KBBQ for less food. We had a nice dining experience, but we won't be back.

I WANT TO GET OUT OF HERE. HELP ME. GOD DEMMIT LET ME FREE. FINALLY. SHE TOOK THE CHECK. I HAD TO GIVE IT TO HER. WTF.   This is not all you can eat though. So be prepared. The food was really good.

z4RG92fuvcWRG0DWNaPAmw.text: Great Korean food, fast service and friendly staff. Excellent value, but no reservations accepted.   The spicy tuna roll, tteokbokki and bugogi were my favorite.

Definitely coming back when visiting again.

A7H78rUpfL1PZ2mYpkPefA.text: I have been coming here since its opening.  The food has always been awesome.  I have only ever had the beef for two so I cant speak to the pork.  The tea is very tasty and the sides are very well assembled and displayed.  The service has always been wanting.  I think it is hard to find experienced help in this area.  The head on shrimp cooked at the end of the meal is a real finisher.  I will be back.

CLK4jCrGXE-BJ6CfkGxxsg.text: The goods 1. Set menus for BBQ give you a lot of variety, can try a lot of different options and comes with various side dishes  2. The beef toro usually tastes tough, I am mainly a kalbi guy 3. Shrimp was plump 4. Sauces are offered but not sure what is what, one is spicy two of them taste tangy 5. Macaron ice cream by brick, check in to get one on the house   Service 1. Adequate but could be better  2. You get help from all the staff 3. Happy hour from 3-6 and 10 to close last call 12ish (double check times) for reduced price select dishes and beer/sake  Ambiance 1. Clean and slightly dim 2. Ample parking 3. CC accepted  MoJo 1. The bibimbap bulgogi is yum, also does cream cheese wontons and toppeuki (delish)

EQYwZjzeLpZEZnS1Iz_5YA.text: This is probably the best restaurant we ate at on this trip. We came late one night and was able to order from the happy hour menu, which was great. Affordable and great portions. However, I'm docking a star because the servers didn't explain anything to us. I'm guessing they assumed we knew what to do? Other places I've tried like this would tell you how long to grill each meat for, what type of sauces were given and such but not here. Either way, we still enjoyed our meal. I'd definitely eat here again if we're in town.   Oh, maybe skip on the spicy pork.

i8bcT85Fq_VLiZTv6jLxnA.text: This place is delicious!  A must to come and dine!  Staff is friendly and speedy.  The family came to celebrate my son's birthday and my in-law's wedding anniversary.  Everyone enjoyed their food. Gangnam Asian rocks!

4EAU0113-HTBR44PVLaJuQ.text: In Vegas from Boston.  Came to this restaurant with my family and we loved it. Very good food and service is excellent. Cool atmosphere, family friendly. Will be returning when I come back to Vegas!

uu0FW9g0Wz4s04NpZS1dCQ.text: Great BBQ at a great price.   Oysters must not be missed.  Great location if you are at staying or stopping at the Hard Rock hotel.     The meats were great quality and the house combo selection was a good choice.   Cool atmosphere.

8m31BMUPjOx5psaHEcULbQ.text: check in on yelp for your free ice cream (while promotion lasts)  this place is NOT AYCE KBBQ, but the meat quality is so good you may just forgo that thought  I thought the tongue and kalbi chuck was amazing, definitely worth trying imo.   Ironically, my party and I were not supposed to come here but due to certain events that happened we ended up here.....wait time can be long, so make sure you don't come hungry

SG4y3NfXNxSsf-_ZIXzfkQ.text: Great place to go not too far off the strip, super flavorful food.  Really enjoyed the fatty and regular ribs, must haves if you visit here.

OchPv8h6fvnu7n7ESRTmUw.text: This is probably my favorite restaurant in all of Vegas. It's a hidden gem next to  CVS but damn don't judge a book by its cover (location) lol. The seating is great. I waited max 10 minutes without a reservation. The service is amazing. Any time I finished a plate 20 seconds later the plate was cleared from the table. The wait staff are extremely attentive yet not overbearing. NOW let's talk about the good. Everything and I mean everything was amazing. I 100% recommend the cream cheese wontons and the meat lovers meal. The pork belly is tender. The filet in unreal and practically melts in your mouth because of all the marbling. Plus the cost for value is unheard of in Vegas. I will be making this a must visit/ staple every time I come back to Las Vegas.

Wf9JKBHwR8gdcEzY7Rz1mQ.text: So glad we found this place off the strip but close to the airport!  We came for an early preflight dinner, just in time for happy hour. The deals here were much better than expected - besides beer being 50% off (pitchers included!), bbq items were also eligible including corn, broccoli, spicy garlic edemame, bulgogi, spicy pork, and maybe some others i'm forgetting.  The staff were attentive and refilled our waters, and they were very understanding when we got our bill but wanted to order more food. Overall it was a great value for the money we paid. We also used the check-in to get one free macaron ice cream sandwich which was delicious and refreshing! If i were from the area I would come here more often.

CRCHnq33AWJqT6J7udb_PA.text: It was so good and I wish that I could eat more Because that you can cook and do the rareness by yourswlf

VjPzbwql9W_OO7st-zx6Eg.text: One of the BEST in Las Vegas. Bring your "A" game when eating here !!! Lots and lots of BBQ for your enjoyment... Your stomach will love you long time !

y0yJfOUo_qQ_bOgRxWp3ag.text: Good all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ place. Much cleaner than a lot of the Korean barbecue places in Las Vegas. Service is a little slow.

19UaB3ypUlMmTWD_XkmMig.text: My fav Korean spot on the strip . Everything is soooo delicious . You can either cook the food yourself or have it cooked in the back. I usually opt for them cooking it and it never disappoints !!

hFICR5lkSgAmvANwmDKArw.text: You can't imagine the variety and value you get at this all-you-can eat sushi restaurant. Fresh, and delicious. I have brought many visitors here and all agree....the absolute best !!!!!

qj41jMv4bsecJURza5EjXQ.text: Holy moly.   I'm from LA and eaten at a lot of Korean restaurants. This place is sooooooo freaking good.   The quality of meat is so good. Nothing was chewy. Everything tastes fresh.   The sides were amazing. I like how they had set menus for people to share and the portions were amazing. 2 people could not finish all that food.   The service left much to be desired BUT I didn't really need anything so it wasn't a big deal.   I crave this place now I'm back in LA

I had some trouble finding it so I called to ask for directions.   Let me just say, I happened to arrive during happy hour and I couldn't be happier. The food was scrumptious. Everything was full of flavor and the dipping sauce served with the crispy chicken was to die for. Plus I got several free samplers. I paid about $11 for all the food that I got. Plus I got a free ice cream macaroon for checking in on Yelp. The macaroon was just ok but I'm not complaining, it was free

You get a choice of dessert after your meal.  The price is fair and the service was very good.  You won't want to miss out eating at this place.  One of the joints you need to try.

Cv6pl1NIwddpec7tDqTGKw.text: I love love love this place. Service is on point, food is flavorful and fresh. You must try Gangnam!

I could really see and taste the quality of the meats. Everything from the appetizers to the entrees we ordered was pleasant.  The waitress was very friendly and attentive.

It's a grill it yourself type of meal where you cgoose types of meats, veggies and sides and you cook it yourself at the table with a grill in the middle.   They also have some noodle plates and soups, so everyone can find something!  Affordable and fun!

PeMc-kmI2KvGUhXiKYj_Lg.text: Had a great time! With the size of our group,Staff was very helpful !! We sat at the private area in the back and it was great since we babies and kids in our party. Although this wasn't an ayce joint the amount of was plentiful! I

sFoBt8YS-r1RXK2Yz8rKEg.text: Awesome KBBQ restaurant.  My group ordered the Gangnam special and it was one of the best meals I've had in Vegas.  It came with a salad, miso soup, raw oysters, bibimibap, corn and a selection of protein.  I have a big appetite and I was satisfied with the amount of food we had.  The meats were good quality and it's up to you to ensure they're not burnt.  We basically threw on plate after plate of meat.  You finished what you had on your plate and there's more in the grill!    I called ahead since we had a group of 12.  They have a large room in the back and were very accommodating.  Service was good.  Definitely would come back to this restaurant.

EeP3OL_4Yx4ujoOySVg6iQ.text: The starters was tasty, but it was gone before we started.. Yum yummy  Enjoy Friend!!

vmOyAcE1d8WYrM5QX3NmMQ.text: Solid BBQ experience, but has some serious flaws which, if fixed, could make this resraraunt truly great. When we had the attention of a server, our service was excellent. However that attention was hard to come by and many staff appeared distracted by the Olympics. We ordered the premium for four, which was certainly enough food for five people. The beef carpacio was stand out, and some of the meats for the grill were excellent, but it seemed like the quality of some of the marinated meats was a bit low, and careful chewing was required. The flavor, overall, was excellent, and for what we got, the price was very reasonable. Would recommend.

8uycU2bsls6PnA_AD2ea-w.text: We saw the yelp reviews and decided to go there. The restaurant is run by Korean people they have a good selection on the menu, the food items were good, Service was good and friendly. Four star for Authenticity and since we are from Vancouver we have lots of Korean barbecue restaurants too, so this restaurant was not outstanding for us. But if you are in Vegas and want to try some good Korean barbecue this is the place.

rLE-N37ydu7KwIWgdHB_ng.text: We came here for late night happy hour and the BBQ meats and side veggies tasted great; spicy pork and bulgogi were my fave. Service was great and we got a free macaron ice cream for checking in. :)

Wze91_PnyC_hGE3Trz482Q.text: You will understand how amazing this place is the second you arrive. The smell, atmosphere and flavors are on point. Their happy hour value is exceptional.

8Ae5zsBNwSuQqtlXkxMAJg.text: Excellent food. We got the premium for two people and paid $89.95. Cuts of meat are fresh and everything pretty much excellent.  It's not AYCE and the servers don't cook the meats for you. But, I didn't mind cooking it. There's a bit of a wait if you come later.

crn_BpX0gfdYs47X28sXaw.text: I'm pretty sure that this is not the best Korean bbq place in town, but yelpers love it here! We came on a weekend and the restaurant didn't seem too busy on a Saturday night around 9p but we still had to wait for a table.   The three of us ordered bulgogi, kalbi, japche, and dynamite shrimp. The food wasn't bad and I enjoyed it but the service was non-existent and the vents over our heads was leaking water, which kind of turned me off. A drop of water even hit my head so I moved spots.   Our bill came to around $50 which is normal at a Korean restaurant. I'm not sure if I'll be back, but the food did hit the spot.
