VaE5il8aXh463aYXovwLDg.text: Awesome food with nice clean space.   Great place to enjoy some Asian BBQ!  Staff is very sweet and definitely on it.   Great cheesy corn!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eDx2uVlpQRr8Tz35qZvaXw.text: Okay, so when you see a 4.5 Star rating with over 3,000 reviews, you can be a bit skeptical.   But I am no longer that!  What a great place!  Great food, excellent service, and a really nice atmosphere.  Quality of the ingredients is very impressive and portions size are thoughtful.  We'll absolutely be back!

WKHU_2oIE1M2LZ-nRRxBDw.text: We came during happy hour which was a good idea. Everything is fairly cheap and quite delicious. We hd the Beef Toro, Bulgogi, and Korean Chicken Fondue. The dipping sauce is what gave the food so much flavor. Also comes with the sides to include cucumber kimchee, kimchee, macaroni salad and bamboo shoots. Also when you review the restaurant it comes with free dessert! Choices are banana tempura or a macaroon!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour! Chicken and bulgogi.

EB63USZDVnsBamY3asQ1Mw.text: Friendly staff. Great service. Pork belly was booomb!!! On the way out we saw that they had macaroon ice cream sandwiches so we went ahead and had to try all five flavors. They discounted us for checkin in on yelp and only charged us for three of the ice creams. Next day I realized I left my Michael Kors sunglasses there and was able to pick them up. Anyone could've easily said they didn't find anything so I appreciate their honesty as well. Definitely going back next time.

vvED1ec5hqlaJGMGmhJsGw.text: Open 24/7 perfect to eat whenever. Went in and got serviced right away.  Easy menu cause it's all you can eat. Most try if you're close.

HVx2l2WVJJ8Qh9CHRzEFXg.text: Stopped here for lunch with the family on the way back home from Zion National Park. Double check the address as it took us to a nonexistent location at first. We found the correct location in a strip mall next to a tattoo shop. The service was quick and attentive. Three or four servers regularly checking up on us and refilling drinks and ban chan dishes.  The decor is very modern (typical Vegas style) and comfortable. The food was fantastic! We ordered the Gang Nam set for 2. The meat selection and quality was very good. There was enough food for at least three people.  Value was fair. I thought the price point for the quality and quantity was a very good deal. To top things off, if you check in on Yelp, you get a free macaron. We were a party of five, two people checked in but they gave us five macarons, three on the house.  Would definitely recommend this place.

j0DOgygmnEH8Lqk32SbMGQ.text: I like this place a lot. sometimes it's a little slow getting seated and also somewhat slow service, but good food.

nThQwDUVt4unirueTRa2RQ.text: I tried this for the first time tonight. Food Is excellent and very nice staff. Prices are not bad and I had a great time eating here with my fiancee. Definitely try this place out if you love quality Korean bbq.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very delicious food.

ooiGw_5BsFEBYPno0u5QIg.text: Wow! This is such a great restaurant! The meats are very good quality and well prepared. Everything we had was delicious! To the people who complained that the meats were tough or made them sick, I have two tips - don't overcook beef and don't undercook pork.

srDgBHdWggOTQSUeQaorQg.text: This was a FIND!  Just off the beaten path (but not that far) and more food than we could eat, AND All of it was FABULOUS. GO!  And bring your appetite.

7UEjhX1WIPDfMqjczXa-MA.text: This is my favorite place to eat and I come here at least twice a month. The sides are the best out of any bbq place I've been to and the quality of the meat is exceptional for the price.  I would suggest coming here for their happy hour!

jg4d92pPT_knSjRlh--GEA.text: Super good! I would totally go back!! It was a little different then what I'm used too, but the sauces were really good to dip the meat in to. And the poke was

WYun_zdZSgIaEPXgrN2uqg.text: We were in Vegas for our annual family vacation and almost at the end of our stay so everyone is pretty much Buffeted-out.  We turn to Yelp for suggestions and Gangnam Asian Bbq came up. Now mind you.. I'm not much of a fan of having to cook my food when I go out to eat but I'm game. I like to just stuff my face with dinner I ordered and the only effort I want to put in is to slice and lift-to-mouth but again, I'll go with the flow.  The place is in a small strip mall so parking was good. We get there and there was already a line. Personally, it seems small.. I look at the "Maximum Occupancy" and it states 75. Remember, I'm still hung-over from the buffets where you see hundreds of people so I had to remind myself that 75 is a good size restaurant. There's a bar in the back of the restaurant where I saw a couple seat themselves because they didn't want to wait the 30mins for a table. While waiting, there's a constant stream of people coming in. This place must be good then.. but we have to wait for our table to see.  We get seated after about 30mins as stated and get a table where the grill looks totally brand new (or got one heck of a cleaning).  Around it are the condiments where we got 2 of each.. kimchi, pickled bean sprouts, baby cucumbers, radish, squid??, fish cake.. you have to pardon me but I don't know what they were called so I listed them as I saw them. We ordered pork belly (lots of it), Beef Toro, and Korean Prime Kalbi. The kids (they're actually adults now but they will always be my kids)  proceed to grill with earnest and the meats cooked fairly quick. Each one of us were given dipping sauces (3) to dip the meats and they turned out very tasty. Again, I'm not a fan of having to cook my food before eating it, but since I wasn't cooking.. it turned out well. Perhaps if my pockets were deeper, we would have swung for the Kobe beef also or more marinated meats, but what we quite full and satisfied from what we ordered.  Overall experience was great.. but why 4 stars and not 5? The service was good but not great. We had to ask to refill our waters and had to flag them down for other requests. It wasn't too much of an effort and the restaurant was very busy but the servers didn't come around often enough to check. The food was good but I had to cook it and season it myself so I can't say great.  The final bill came out and for a party of 6.. it was very good! A lot of food for the price and everyone seems very satisfied. And for the experience of non-buffet.. this was a win.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Check out the spread that greets you at your table!
Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Other side of menu..

njjo4NxMI1K93aGBGrJp-w.text: Out of all the KBBQ places I've tried along the west coast and New York, this place has got to be on my Top 3. The food, ambiance, and cleanliness are exceptional, and although they are sometimes slow with the first round of meat I order, there are a ton of banchan to eat while you wait. my absolute FAVORITE, the thing that makes this place so unique in my eyes, is the kobe beef carpaccio!! Honestly I think about it all the time, even at other KBBQ places, and when I go to Vegas I'll go here and get at least 2 orders hahah

LZobpjk6gXSi4KgXmTyE9A.text: On a $7 Uber drive from strip " 15 min " and the quality of the food and services goes way up and the price go way down . The meat lovers for two was so good and much more meat then we could finish , the macaron ice cream sandwich I will dream about

lxq8QQIw9yfWl9XjLxL0cg.text: Deliciously tasty food. We went with the meat lovers for 2 people and it was so much food! We left so happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WSYQRUOafbbEHJqJtfrhIQ.text: Sometimes a simple service can affect an overall dining experience...This is the case of this restaurant.  Came in for lunch, the restaurant was about 70% full. A male server seated us, not a hi, welcome or any greeting.  Plates, water, and utensils was sliding on the table. Needed the flag down the staff to order when they were pretty much..Staring blankly and standing around.    We finished the first round of the side dishes and flagged down a shxt face service for second round, he asked "which one" I said "all of them" he stood there for about 5 seconds silent then left without clearing out the empty plates then came back "sliding" the side dishes on our table...  Seriously, the food quality is just ok. You would expect it to be better when 6-8 thin slices of beef portion like appetizer that would cost $9+ per plate....

dPWBWQnFhwJ-HtAHhm-jAg.text: First time at a Korean BBQ and it was a great experience! I'm vegetarian and there were still plenty of options for me. It was a fun and enjoyable meal.

NcYd5fIl2c0qtOsnHFWsdA.text: Freaking amazing food and great prices !!!! Fast service, they don't make you wait incredibly long like other Korean BBQ places. I always come during happy hour and always satisfied. Two of us is no more than 25$  great places for dates or just hanging out   Happy hour is from 10 pm to closing everyday I believe and if you check in you can get a free macaroon

BVKn13NSTXj5xsnqAEkmIA.text: I dont like coming to Las Vegas but when I have to go for work, I always look forward to eating here!! Such amazing Korean bbq and sides!! They give A LOT of food, so I suggest you bring an appetite!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So MUCH FOOD!!

ImCW4-4m2l23N12IAVfKQw.text: This place is not on the strip. It's about a 6 minute drive and hidden in the corner next to the foot spa. I'm an out of towner from Dallas, Tx and we have our fair share of Korean barbecue places. But this place has a meat selection very different from the ones back home. They have Kobe meat (super soft and melts in your mouth), scallops, and even duck breast. The meat here is so much more succulent, flavorful, and different from the regular short ribs and brisket.    My boyfriend and I got the premium meats and it was really worth it! It comes with appetizers like the tuna poke, oysters, miso soup, and beef carpaccio. The oysters were good but left a weird aftertaste. The beef carpaccio was a little on the sour side and the tuna poke was super fresh. This deal also comes with the  best cut meats in the restaurant. The table will be full of your regular Korean BBQ sides like kimchi, bean sprouts, and fish cake. When they bring the meats, it may seem like a small portion but it's actually really filling for 2 people. I really appreciate that their presentation of the meats are sliced and placed carefully on decorated plates as opposed to the meats back home are slapped onto a dingy plate and cut in front of you with scissors.   The only thing I don't like is that they don't give you advice on how to cook the meats like the Kobe beef. Service here is quick and polite. We were seated within 2 minutes and food came out in 10 minutes.

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Z_xuVwa5WFrOtUDgYkwftQ.text: in vegas for a night found this place and had to go.  the marinated steak was delicious and we really enjoyed cooking right at the table. the service was great. we ordered too much food

Y97Bv7s9_ukbwAyJ3zfmqw.text: Good food. I'm been here few times but today, the service seems slow. Either way, I like it here!

pqRXt8S6fi8Y1eabxErMUQ.text: Good food . Good service . I love the beef tounge here. Its hard to find places with the tounge. Nice decor fast service

14fKWi06Ft7IXdP8GowpjQ.text: The side dishes arent exactly traditional korean but the meat is decent. They charge for lettuce wraps and korean sauces which all come with a meal at all Korean bbq places.

4oZ9BdSlbc4FY23he0aPVQ.text: Great bbq. The oysters left something to be desired. The korean waitresses do not cook the meat for you but they mix the bimbimbap.

HyI5Tvxb_p3tmhtwPkdIhg.text: Awesome service, amazing happy hour and great variety of healthy choices!  My favorites are the steak toro, broccoli, corn, mushrooms and free sides!

b8cCAxbvEcug27QMmQYMjQ.text: I loved it here....  I was staying across the street at Hardrock and wandered over....being a huge Yaki Niku fan I figured it was worth a try....I realized right away they were not Japanese but that's not important these days...the quality of the meat was good and the service was amazing...  I asked the waiter for atsukan....and he had no idea...so I told him it means hot sake...I was in one of those moods....I did send back a few pieces of the tongue they sent me, however the chef then replaced my tongue order and in addition made me another chefs special dish on the house....my friend and I left full of wagyu beef....happy...and maybe $60 lighter....which is a deal, given we were drinking...

xAy9zTCbW31T2D6_7Brx8A.text: Awesome place!  My son loves to cook his own steak. Celebrating my nieces birthday. Perfect portions and excellent service!!

HGtDL2mMpMBdN-w2VBjPbQ.text: One of the best spots for korean BBQ.  When we visit vegas this is the SPOT.  meats are premium and service is awesome.

BHHS00mVFR0Gpp6rsyeFLA.text: Was here with my friends post basketball. Didnt know it was happy hour and the offer was so good to refuse. We ordered the porkbelly and bulgogi. Also the original bibimbap. Was a lot of food and serve it on a sizzling plate. Was very satisfied. Def coming back.

3XM85IFbCKZRX0lFl6LC8A.text: Best korean bbq in Vegas! There's a reason this restaurant is highly rated. The price is decent. The food is perfectly seasoned! Great side dishes and menu selection. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu! It was a 30min walk from our hotel and it's off the strip but it's TOTALLY worth it!! I will definitely come here again when I visit Vegas again.

Omg7f-tr-_aRhwAG0oABaQ.text: Not many korean BBQ places in Vegas. This one is decent. Can get crowded though so the earlier you go the better. Or really late

s5exxFeAKuMUHlaYKKmEIw.text: I actually did not understand why it has so many 5 star ratings..It is just ok..Not that perfect. The food is delicious as well as the sources they provided. However, comparing to Japanese style BBQ, the meats were not that fresh.

OqR7_FR3cBvVj47GHKN9cQ.text: I for one was very excited to visit a Korean restaurant since my best friend and I love Korean BBQ. We were very sad to see limited Korean options in Houston. This is not the case here!! We were able to have a wide selection of BBQ meats and seafoods, wonderful Japanese inspired appetizers. For appetizers I had the tuna poki, seafood pancake, tuna bibimbap, and jalapeno poppers. For main dishes, I was able to order garlic shrimp, and my friend also ordered things like bulgogi and duck breast. I do wish rice came with the meal, looks to me you have to order it separately. The BBQ came with several side dishes including the most delicious Kim chi and fish cakes. Loved it.

CjnnAF711be9u8Zos883bg.text: 2nd time back to this place..  it did not disappoint again!  This time I came back with 5 friends and we had the 2-person portion of the meat lovers and the gang nam and it was perfect portioning for all of us. Highly recommend this place.  Atmosphere and food was great!

Q02wWIQVYKP8zHcdJidcPg.text: Stopped here after 4 hours trip from Utah. We ordered harami miso, korean kalbi, tongue, pork belly, and pork cheek. Pork cheek and harami miso are recommended. Probably the best korean bbq in town.

OMcDKYMiDGSMx-LpUp1Fdw.text: Needed BBQ fix while visting Las Vegas and did not disappoint. Hopefully we'll be back soon for more.

l7XDRwRbRubrGChXlbnXGg.text: Unique place.  Must visit when in Vegas! A little confusing at first but friendly staff is nearby to help out.

3aJsSgyrF2SOe7XLfD4XCg.text: Price is very reasonable. They give small side dishes if order 2 bbq items per person. Also, give out free dessert if you write a review. Worth to try.

LbB6fCcaeUB54zoyL1Z4Nw.text: Very good.  Didn't give it 5 stars because the kalbi was fatty and the bulgogi was very very sweet.  That said, this place was better than Hobak.  The kalbi and japchae were flavorful and very good. The side dishes/banchan could use more variety, but service was great. And you save a lot of money during happy hour.

v3mC9y_K5LeCOqt8_k5gXQ.text: The reason why this place has almost 4,000 reviews is because they offer you a free macaroon ice cream sandwich in exchange for a review. Mystery solved. Now on to my actual review. Place is decorated nicely and makes for a great atmosphere. Husband and I decided on the Gagnam Special for Two. We were originally looking for an all you can eat Korean BBQ restaurant; however all the sheer amount of reviews for this place caught our attention and it happens to be a few doors down from one of our favorite sneaker boutiques. The food was good, high quality of meat with pretty good sides (kimchi being my favorite) and you get a LOT of it for what you pay for. I'm taking away a star for service. Our server was quick to drop off our bill when we weren't even halfway through the meal (we hadn't asked for it yet) but not quick to check on us..didn't do so once the entire time. Felt incredibly rushed as it was starting to become busy and you could tell they just wanted as many people in and out as fast as possible. I would come back during a less busy time. Left so much food on the table.

UI95dqEcK3_eFZLg7WLyjA.text: Worst customer service I have ever had. The host does not how to work the waiting list. We were there for 2 hours when they told us it will be an hour waiting in line. There was like 10 people before us, left their name then went off somewhere while we were there for the entire time. They didn't even take out the name of whoever does not show up but keep waiting for that person to come. That is not how customer service work. You will lose more business it is how you decide to run it that way. The worst thing is to let customers who have been waited for a long time to see someone shows up, and claim that its their turn to be seated. It doesn't matter how good your food is, but if the customer has bad experience even before he or she can taste the food the business already fail.

3pykFgJF6JOPGGKjldydMg.text: Great customer service awesome meat ! Went here with a friend and we had a blast (: can't wait to come back with more people the server was super nice

kt3lsyVrXHtp5B5dJZl4NA.text: Awesome service as I went in! The waiters are funny with great recommendations. I mean free dessert at the end so why not? They didn't change the grill that often. We ordered some green tea and it seemed like they didn't want  to give us water. I guess it depends on the waiter. I got really after two dishes so order accordingly.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xBSjxOZzNoYLwD_026BNFQ.text: This Korean BBQ is an outstanding rendition.  This is my second time here.  Just as good as the first.  Outstanding meal.  Consistent.  Rich flavors.  High food quality.  Good service.  Plenty of food.

1ud6C1zNOVO8jXvhSX3utQ.text: Not even open a week, this restaurant has problems with kitchen efficiency and with service. It's almost like they all just showed up and started doing things without any prior conversation or coordination.  They haven't got a liquor license yet and still they won't allow patrons to bring their own wine!  Now that's just dumb. Virtually every other restaurant in town, and especially the ones with no liquor license will allow corkage.  I asked if they'll allow corkage once they DO get a license, and the answer was "we'll take it under advisement".   Well, I've got news for these guys: I'll take it under advisement as to whether I ever return.

Mf9afNGiQAEBrgXX9OlZnw.text: Tasty meats, good sides,  good service, large menu,  free dessert with review if you show the waiter.  A little pricier than Chinatown, but that's to be expected.  Surprisingly not saturated with obnoxious tourists even though it's right next to the strip.

brdWrnoKUfh6_Y_7OiZBWg.text: Omg. The food was delicious!  Our group was 4 people. We got the butterfly and firecracker shrimp. Bulgogi bimpap and bbq the following meats: grade a kalbi, kurobuta sausage and shrimp. Most delicious yall! Im coming again tomorrow night. Love how they stay open late and offer delicious food with awesome service. The apple sake was yum as well, just keep it nicely chilled. Going back tomorrow for the lychee sake (:

R1G26-POmyzlCoIILMzWEA.text: This place has one of the flamest happy hours in Vegas. Drinks and food are SUPER cheap with pretty decent quality. Great place to go before a night out.

GJxcluNVqOlQVqpLFfjKTA.text: The best korean bbq in town hands down. Me and my girlfriend came in got sat down and got fast and excellent service from the staff. The staff was friendly and efficient. The food was excellent and fresh I tell you better than the other places I've been to in vegas. We got the gangnam and the meat were prime cuts and we'll marinated. I tell you come to this place you will enjoy with your significant other or friends and family pretty cool place.

RO1CDSEapRb7An454NUGNQ.text: Came here for lunch on Thursday. It wasn't crowded at all and service was attentive. They also have a lunch special for their meats, 1 plate for 8.99 and 2 plates for 12.99. Overall, good Korean food in Vegas and would recommend if you're craving Korean food!

1UbAuJ_tDlhuIddF_5qzHA.text: Trying this restaurant for the first time! 7 ban chans offered. Lunch special is reasonable price for the amount you get.

6ce8dw3SKdqFEdVfcxqPjw.text: We came here immediately after landing at the airport. The food was phenomenal. I'd highly recommend the chicken karaage, seafood pancake, and chigae. All were so flavorful and delicious!

QwMt5buavwlKkP44OetWCA.text: awesome korean bbq. get the gangnam combo for 2. worth the money. so much food! the selection is great and the service is good! will definetly come back again when im in town

jwGb6R_DCqj1xpLGiz9NpQ.text: Awesome Korean food joint. Service was great, food was great, just be prepared to eat...alot! Jin was especially cool - those ice cream macaroons at the front door were delicious! Big fan, and will come again.

OXQZBotBZrc2dfpSG8JNuw.text: This place offers a good lunch special for Korean BBQ at a fair price for what you pay for (9.95 or 12.95). They come with the traditional side dishes and 3 dipping sauces. It is well ventilated, not as smokey as other places. It is located close to the UNLV campus next to Undefeated and a sushi place. The service was prompt, since no one was here at this place on a Tuesday around 1.

3A9BjYgQdbOWFpF7-eEpNA.text: Food was good and the location is good; many of students come to here. Servers respond quickly and service is pretty well above the average.

xL5JTpSPdFAR0Lk0uNwnYw.text: In the mood to try something different. We usually go to the ayce Korean places in Chinatown but come across this joint at yelp. Fast service and place not too busy, we got lucky, it's Happy Hour too. Half off drinks! Everything is delicious, great portion. Will definitely come back

RSP4leKApFco2jY09nu-5w.text: We got the premium for 6 ppl and it was sooo much food!! Great cuts of galbi! The seafood bibimbap was amazing!  Really wish I had more room to eat everything.  Asparagus was good too...oysters and poke were meh.

hI5rNuvggCRYL0Dftk8KQA.text: As someone who eats at gyu-kaku pretty often I can say this place is very very good. Only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because the happy hour isn't as strong as gyu-kaku , I wasn't offered a grill change and there is no loyalty program.

oPHyMPcM061Z-5OqFkKyOg.text: Went here the second time and service still great! Staff are super friendly! Answer questions! Would recommend this place for some Korean food in Vegas !!!

hAh1_x2ZUWrsMxQZn7gKPw.text: This place was great for the price. The prices are not too steep and the food is actually pretty good for the amount that you pay. The service was a little slow but it was very busy when we were here. It is a family friendly restaurant and I recommend this place for families with children

jZrbtZNka-ZUyEu8if-jsA.text: If you've been to LA and had real, LEGITIMATE Korean bbq, you might be a little disappointed but this place isn't bad considering you're in Vegas.  Firstly, kbbq is acceptable in 100 degree+ weather because it's kbbq and it's necessary. Secondly, come during happy hour! They have spicy pork, bulgogi, and pork belly for super cheap! I recommend all those three as well as the japchae. It's delicious. My dad had the bibimbap and loved it as well.  The service is great too, they were very friendly and attentive.   Like I said, it's not LA good but it isn't bad at all. Give it a try if you're in the mood for kbbq(which you always should be)

Pj4e5jzDACY0Jspa4OluxA.text: Who knew Korean BBQ on 4th of July would be the thing I did.  I was glad I did it nevertheless.  The food was pretty good and cost reasonable.  Portions were enough even for a food whore like myself.    Glad I came and will be going here again.  And the KPop playing on the big screen kept the kids (and wife pretty entertained).

AU6ctx9E7DNHKP0LDFj4gg.text: This place is awesome. Great food. Super attentive staff. Macaroon ice cream sandwiches!

g5a-9SVhfqfVGaDyauVJTw.text: Food was awesome- all the other positive yelp reviews were spot on. I wish we had another couple with us because the food for two  was about twice as much food as we could eat. We have decent appetites too!

DcqAd9PuZslSJlW6VTgOpA.text: For our kids, this was their first time eating Korean BBQ, and I don't think we could have picked a better place for it. It's well off the strip, and consequently lacks the pretension of many of the more central eateries, which was very welcome.  We picked from then menu rather than going for one of their set menus, but everything was delicious. The meats were all tasty, well-seasoned and mouthwatering. The cheese fondue was surprisingly good for its simplicity and worked better than we expected. The Bibimbap was also tasty, although the presence of my children meant I had to choose a less spicy option than I would normally.  The Korean side dishes were great, although the refills of Kimchi we asked for never materialised. In fact, the slightly chaotic and inattentive service was the only thing that prevents me giving the place the full five.

r-2yqJQPnwqQq90D02IaJw.text: Beautiful ambience and very fast service! Loved the chives and the Meat Lovers option. It is definitely enough to feed 3 people!

isfsbbuRpcVmWjnBdrdx5g.text: Definitely coming back to this KBBQ spot!   The food was amazing.  Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is cause the service was just OK...  We got the 'Meat Lovers' package and substituted the spicy pork for Kalbi instead.   So BOMB.

qdh_fjFhNfyfexKrLyu_TA.text: The kbbq is amazing! We made it on time for the happy hour and their deals are awesome ! The sides for the meal is super flavorful and delicious . Loved everything about my experience here :)

39S-AMmL4mswD2TVxJZOhQ.text: Ho-lee-crap.   Amazing food, service and ambiance. Great prices and amazing selection of food made this a fantastic choice for our large group.   We will be back.

slWuW1-GpZqiaKNjuvPuHg.text: After a hard night out on the Strip, Korean BBQ is the go to hangover cure for us. Gangnam is everything we could've asked for--- reasonable prices for a huge BBQ set, including short ribs, steak cubes, marinated beef, bi bim bap, steamed corn, buttery mushrooms, and a plethora of other small side dishes. Service was great, and the interior was modern and clean. Huge thumbs up from us.

1wA3Mv7YdVBwE9MaXjCeOQ.text: Excellent barbeque! Best in town, hands down. Ordered meat lover for 4 and that's enough for us six people! Bimbibum is also great!

9uF90EcV4we0OGwPd7ONOg.text: Really good Korean bbq at a reasonable price!! Came on a Saturday around 5 pm for happy hour /early dinner. I suggest getting the premium bbq combo for 2 (actually feeds 3 if you had one or two additional items). They have kobe beef!!

zPiIm5fL1n4d_n22aey_Mw.text: So much meat. So much deliciousness. Wear loose fitting clothes. Banchan is on point. Attentive service too!

rj5u24O6WjKYea5XpkKM3g.text: Donkey was our server. He was very attentive and friendly. The food is always awesome. Every time I'm here in Vegas I always stop in for KBBQ here. The bacon wrapped enoki is so simple but delicious. All the marinated meats are packed with flavor. Bonus points for the jams playing in the background. Don't miss out on this gem!

NjGB9CYY2IjhVkSuvFVtMA.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant.  It is tastefully done inside, the staff was very friendly and the food was very good.  I had a Tina Poki which was excellent, bulgogi and marinated Korean short ribs.  The tuna was excellent, the bulgogi was nearly as good and the short ribs were good.  I would definitely return.  It was about $25 plus tip per person.  Not bad!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An empty tuna poking bowl and the raw short ribs and bulgogi ready to cook

8A6bJrGU9d5BPKLRTJauxg.text: Would definitely come back.. Meat was marinated very well and meat was so juicy and melts in mouth

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mfuqJh8aDkyAWlbx9lv5BQ.text: First time trying this place. My friends loved it. It was an ok experience for me. The bulgogi was really amazing and well flavored. The other meat was ok. Overall if you love Korean BBQ with a bunch of different meats and vegetables this place is definitely for you.

8UjlppY-AnMV6U7-EUwl9Q.text: This was my 1st Korean bbq experience and I really enjoyed it! The jalapeno poppers were delish and loved the macaroon ice cream sandwich! Definitely want to come back and try some other menu items.

SofNmE8hZOEtI0kNmYR6pA.text: Macaron ice cream is good  Good food Poor customer service Food comes so late The grills are not clean They need to clean the grills thoroughly  The tongs are not clean left some food marks in the claw part of the tongs

0Zec1NvthTRs1Y3dHChRMg.text: We went with the $89 meat option and everything was absolutely amazing!!!!! The meat was good the starters were just delicious! We cannot wait to come back!

y5gHeg1fragmdds-O6yoeQ.text: Great lunch special that enabled us to taste several types of meat, appetizers and vegetables at a very reasonable price. Great flavor - - - especially the marinated beef. Very friendly and helpful staff.

x8F1RU0RmJhg4rDNMc8gzw.text: We had our best casual food in LA. Staff was very warm and attentive . Food was amazing. I am not sure that their predefined options are the best. We decided to go custom: all top1,2,3 and bulgogi and spicy chicken. Also we added fried rice and miso. This was a bit more than needed for 2 adults and 2 kids. Free side dishes were insanely tasty.

fx9Uz8QmPvvAvkv5E30UIQ.text: Great food, excellent service and beautiful staff! Won't be disappointed near the Strip.

Hbwego4Ptrhh4W1pdLijng.text: Me and a party of 8 came here to eat during happy hour. Everything was amazing! Definitely will be back. They also had macaroon ice creams with variety of flavors that I loved!

mZDBglJKwek3NXjgrA2PCw.text: Good S@!t...liked the meal a lot. A good experience for the taste buds. Macaroon ice cream for dessert is not to be missed.

Gr6lvsDxXqoPHZw09pFjZw.text: This place is more for western taste buds.  The spicy pork and bulgogi is super sweet.  The banchan isn't so good, and not too many choices.  For non AYCE KBBQ, I would recommend Honey Pig.  Good meat, lots of banchan, and they cooke a fried rice for you at the end.

i2lhlmN2n4l7I1sXcxW7Ww.text: This place is awesome. All the food was really good. The Kobe Ssam actually comes with real wasabi - first time I ever tried that. Be careful with it! Stuff is stronger than you would believe.

jwYCqKHfz_LD3qEtkSE-dw.text: Their lunch set is an absolute steal.  For about 10 bucks you get a whole bunch of side dishes and high quality food. They'll even grill the meat for you in the kitchen! Which is nice when I don't want to go back to work smelling like grilled fat (lovely though that smell is).  Unlike other set lunches, every dish has a lot of attention paid to it. Even the little salad they give you is well constructed and tasty. Super recommended.

M4vYYtILz3f38Kq0yzK1wA.text: Their service is great! So is the food!!! The side dishes are delicious too! Coming here again very soon! And our waiter Back was great!!! Very attentive and quick!!! Thanks Back! We'll be back... Get it? Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gangnam meal set for 2

qrXx39-FeDVWziWDcNd-Eg.text: Was in Vegas for work and did some research on where to get a dinner without spending a fortune. Food was really good. Service was greet. Would for sure come back when I'm in town.

0ybTekjD92jwXuV0PaKFPA.text: Absolutely love this place! Whenever I have friends in town we go here. You can cook the food yourself or they will.

2pnU4z_qfYevIaR_v6QPAw.text: What's great place to eat!!! The uni bibimbap was off the hook!!! The spicy tofu soup was great!!! I highly recommend this pace. A treasure off the strip!!!

XTSczGmRf2_BKKFR8v5PPA.text: Super delicious! Get the gangnam plate for 2 or more! Loved the mushrooms and delicious meats in this combo.

fobLeTGAijmB8iZS8dy4xQ.text: In town for a convention.  Went out with a co-worker we were looking for some variety, liked the name and reviews close to our hotel.  Split the Las Vegas for two perfect selection, soup salad and fun variety of meats to be cooked.  Two types of chicken, then sampling of Shrimp as well as a good sized  portion of sliced beef.  We were able to eat it all and left totally satisfied.  When looking for something different perfect option.  One wall has music videos we got in early with no wait it was filling up by the dinner hour.

U-1MEYgXUeRKELzbwS9_cQ.text: It's the best place in town!! This is my second time here and it's still incredibly delicious! I will definitely come back here again.

qEs2uKbkMvWrVzKkfxn0lQ.text: Came here on a Saturday night with a party of 6 without a reservation, and was seated within 30 minutes. The host at the front counter was really apologetic, but we were not bothered at all. We did walk  in after all. We went with the a la carte items as there were some items in the set menus that we weren't really interested in. Portions for the a la carte items were a bit small, but it wasn't a huge issue for us as it gave us a chance to try more of the different dishes.  Our favorite meats were the pork belly and beef toro. Actually ended up getting multiple orders of each. Spicy tofu soup was also good with a nice spicy kick.  As for the service, everyone was really friendly and our water was consistently filled. Food came out at a constant pace.  Overall, I would recommend this kbbq joint if you want a break from all the burger and steak joints on the Vegas strip.

WNW1Cqg0IJ8FduB6d0lLyA.text: This place is the place to go for Korean BBQ in Vegas! The marinated kalbi was high quality and tasty. The pork belly was equally satisfying. Both were absolutely fantastic paired with their house soju. The banchan, unlike other Korean restaurants, is plentiful and the server explains what each one is.   I'd recommend the dumplings in chili oil, the Japanese peppers and the mushrooms (dip them in the ponzu sauce).  The servers here all appear to be Korean-American which helps with communication. Don't get me wrong, I love an authentic kbbq but ahjummahs are not always known for their friendly customer service.  Even the rice is on point! They offer brown rice for the health conscious but order white rice because it's exceptional.  They have Brick macaron ice cream sandwiches at the front as well as if you needed any more reasons to come here.

RgSRgOg9a4g5iKXaddc7Bw.text: Got here very hungry. Loved seasoned Galbi and pork belly. Kimchi soup was awesome. The portion is a bit small but reasonable priced.  Actually I liked it because it allowed me to try different dishes. Great place and I will definitely come back while I stay in Las Vegas. Tip! Come before dinner time. The line gets really long.

OHoaMucwcemyi6fwNTioMA.text: Awesomeness. Prices were decent. Food was filling. Service was good. Next trip to vegas I will be back! My family and I came here with hurt tummies from all the rich vegas food. We came here because they had the veggies we wanted. We had a party of 5 so we had to wait (reservation for parties of 8 or over). Waited about 20 minutes. It was well worth it. The Korean prime rib- my favorite. Tender and juicy with flavor! Beef brisket- it was good, just a Lil fatty here and there. Brocoli- bomb.com K squash- not my favorite thing to grill, came out kinda hard I will definitely be back. Thanks guys!

Photo of Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grubbin

aaDzF-ZSdggi7cTpNZJD1Q.text: The quality of the meat is great and the service is fantastic. They were very accomodating for our big party. Will definitely be back!

SFSfugcz7uekkCY7OtNhrQ.text: Very nice place to go with family good portion of food!!!! Employees are very kind and helpful.

I6gSf7_H_v10Oq2TsQv_sg.text: Found out about this place on yelp. Glad me & my gf stopped by. We ordered the Las Vegas which was priced at $45.95 for 2, for the money you definitely get what you pay for, good portion sizes, tasteful dishes. We even had to take some of the food home!

YmxR1R81ehOjcFsW3hG6HQ.text: This place is soooo yummy !!! Oh my gosh truly fantastic and lights up your taste buds without lighting up your wallet. We HAD to come again before our trip ended. Our first night was beyond expectations with great service. Quick and without flaw. Our second day was "eh". Our drinks weren't refilled. She didn't come to our table for half an hour to even check on us. She brought us the wrong foods and overcharged our bills. Our waiter from the first day ended up having to pick up her slack. If it weren't for the good food and price or the staff trying to fix her mistakes and such great service our first night,I would have given it 3 stars for today's  crap service.

T9vza4-tH-KsUgZGa6GosQ.text: Great food, great atmosphere, superb service.  Highly recommend the beef toro, short ribs, steamed eggs, and pork belly.

tUmEw2F6u4YGHJXLjZmQzA.text: Came here on a sunday at 12:30.  The staff got our food out quickly.  All the cuts were very good  (especially both prime kalbi dishes) as well as the sides, which you get complimentary when ordering at least two bbq dishes per person.  The precooked dishes and veggies were tasty also.  I do recommend coming as early as possible, as the restaurant gets filled quickly and the staff gets very busy servicing everyone.  Would come again!

3acvfsEVYyZ12NQ6_Qfd_A.text: Everything was delicious! Major yum. We had a range of apps and all were great-- especially the fried calamari!! The dynamite shrimp was just that-- dynamite! And don't even get me started on the macaron ice cream-- mmmmmm!

5xeEcmeRslm4xyDzb6crvA.text: Walking distance from hotel. Kids had their fill. Mission accomplished. Happy hour was great. Xoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxo

-hrwR1hPBjrJIofOu1RtWA.text: Tasty Korean BBQ very close to the strip.  We went for lunch and they had a reasonably priced lunch special.  2 meats, soup, and an appetizer (cream cheese wontons for me) for $12.99.

v6Spjs78c6tVRTrCcCwUew.text: We came here for a late lunch on Saturday. We were pleasantly surprised by how quick and efficient the service was. The marinated kalbi was perfect and the portions were decently generous. The only issue was the side dishes, which I didn't think were great. Most of the pickled items seemed a little dry, and the overall selection/variety of the banchan was mediocre. I guess I'm used to Korea, where the side dishes are as important as part of the meal. I was also not impressed with the chicken karaage which they used chicken breast for (made it dry).

xPE7IhuCon0qHjDtNfYq2g.text: Loved it! Awesome flavors, best Korean bbq i've had outside of Koreand super friendly staff.

rFUWXNw-4-GqXoigqlBuIQ.text: They are still awesome as ever!!! Whenever my parents come to town they always request that we come here! It is so much fun cooking our food on the grill in front of us and they are also so knowledgeable about their food and are always willing to help those who are inexperienced with the cook times and their different sauces. They also have amazing appetizers! When I'm working I'll usually order a couple appetizers and make it a meal! Their Spicy Tuna Kimbap, Spicy Chili Dumplings, Cream Cheese Wontons, and Fried Carpaccio are only a few of my favorites!! Ohhh and don't let me forget the broccoli and cheese fondue!! Yes Please! I will forever be a loyal customer! They are great :)

rMPgVeDBDmyZFBAYsISF_g.text: We ordered Gangnam style for 2 and a Meat lovers special for 2, It was the perfect size for 5 people. The waiter seemed to be constantly forgetful after being called over for assistance multiple times. Food was good but the review loses a star for the hostess who was rude to our party checking in and had to have a waiter stop her from speaking with our table.

zjwkyexqIT3ocB8LYkoLig.text: Was a great brunch! Great food all around with soup, kalbi beef and seafoods. Go gangnam bbq!!!

iVbeTXAME5Ihg84qB9jMsQ.text: The food and service are great, but not a completely authentic Korean experience. Would have liked to see the Korean food names on the menu.

KBJMOlyxx8B6bCO7Lzh49g.text: Great dinner and service. The pork belly was awesome. Fun place to bring a group. If you like meat this is the place for you.

Q76U7t7e7kQoJsziSXrg0g.text: When I went there I had to wait for about 1.5 hours. We ordered the meat lover, the steamed egg, and seafood soup. The food took a while to come out even though the servers said it was coming out right now. The Kobe beef was good, but the rest was average. The servers weren't very nice, but they weren't particularly rude either. They did give us two miso soups on the house though, which was nice of them.

nvPdPS_bWi-WV2Seoo4Lfw.text: Portions VERY small and wait is long even during off hours.  Meat is okay, the same hot-water dough that becomes cream puffs and eclairs -- and the straight cylinders therefore have a lighter texture than their potato-based counterparts. These were classic iterations; lightly herbed, they had been gently browned on one side for a contrast to their pillowy interiors, and served with crunchy celery root, velvety sauteed black-trumpet mushrooms, soft and earthy goat cheese and a silken garlic cream for a very successful dish.

AifcIM0xjopoCD_dypPEvQ.text: I was wondering why this restaurant has over 3000+ reviews. Turns out they offer a free macaron ice cream sandwich if you write one. What a brilliant marketing scheme! Every restaurant should implement this Yelp hack. Food-wise their dishes were quite good and varied, independent of the free dessert offering. Came out very fast and efficiently. The uni bib bim bap was quite delicious, but be sure to specify that you do not want them to mix it. Unfortunately they mixed mine before I had a chance to protest but were nice enough to bring me extra uni on the side to compensate.

B0XjXUK3Q__XQ4QS9l7jNw.text: This place was amazing! Great service and the food was delicious! Ordered the prime kalbi and chicken cheese tender fondue! And topped it off with delicious ice macarons!
